reviewer_comment:
Came here for lunch the other day and I gotta say - amazing. Great place on Divisadero to stop by before and/or after an outing at Alamo Square Park. Wasn't busy so we got sat down immediately at the table that faces the front window (great table, by the way).

Haven't really tried my hand at any Deep Dish pizzas while living here in SF and I am sooo glad Little Star was my first introduction. Just fantastic. A 6-piece pie is more than enough to share for two. Our server also mentioned that they can split it half and half with two different styles, which is what we did. The garlic bread with marinara is also some of the BEST I've tried.

Great friendly service and atmosphere, and most importantly, great pizza. Can't wait to be back to try out all their other pies they have to offer. Hats off to you, Little Star.

This is such an overdue review.  We have been a regular client for this pizza place after moving to SF 3 years ago.  We usually order take-out.  Not only pizza is top quality, the staffs are always super friendly no matter how busy they are.  We are vegetarian so usually order vegetarian deep-dish pizza.  

In addition, their price is very reasonable - Little Star is one of the few restaurants at SF (if not the whole Bay Area) have not increased their price for past 2 years during the high inflation, and still give up point system for discount.  

As I am typing, getting ready to order a pizza for dinner tonight for sure.  I am drooling at this moment just thinking about their pizza......

Their corn meal deep dish dough is so good! I honestly can't believe how much food we got for the quality and price. I also like how you can do a half and half pizza and it's only $1 more.

Highly recommend their spicy wings (its not that spicy but still good). And their deep dish pizza: half Little Star and half Meteor.

And our server took really good care of us! Much appreciated! We WILL be back.

Came here on a Friday night! They won't sit you until your whole party arrives and they don't take reservations.

Our waiter was super nice and friendly. All the prices are reasonable and we enjoyed all the food. We shared the large salad, little star large thin crust and a custom topping large deep dish with pineapple and chicken. We also got a bottle of cava and 2 brownie sundaes. All for 4 people. We were stuffed and had left overs.

I loved the deep dish! I'm from New York and I would favor a classic nyc slice but no this place has turned me on to deep dish. The flavor of the sauce, the crispy dough, it was all so good. And the thin crust pizza we got was packed with vegetable toppings. All the cheese too was super gooey and delicious. The brownie with the mint gelato was amazing. Brownie was warm, rich and decadent. I wish I new the brand of gelato because that was some of the best I ever had. So creamy and chocolate chunks tasted super high quality.

The vibe is mellow, kind of chic and minimalist inside. Low light and very clean.

I had a great night here!

I came here for dinner on a wk day because Little Star pizza of SF is the best deep dish I've had myself. It's not easy to find parking in the neighborhood since it has a good number of other restaurants and businesses. But there is a parking garage near by less than 2 blocks called Alamo Square Park & Charge. This garage is Mon-Fri 9am-9pm and always free, yes I couldn't believe it either. It's neat because a machine takes your car and stores it after you park your car just right on the ramp, it has to be perfectly centered. There was no wait to be seated in the restaurant and luckily I came right when happy hr was still going.

From the happy hr menu I ordered the burrata caprese appetizer and omg was it so good. The small breads or crostinis were toasted just right and the basalm was good with the burrata cheese. You could taste how fresh all the ingredients were even the olive oil. Then I ordered a personal deep dish half margherita and half build your own with bacon, pesto, goat cheese, and sundried tomatoes. Their crust is so good like a cornmeal buttery flavor? The pizza was so flavorful, both sides were great. Their deep dish is filling and rich so I had leftovers. For 2 people I'd say maybe the small pizza I ordered is fine if you're sharing an appetizer. But if you're doing only pizza for 2 or more people I'd say go with the bigger size pizza. The service was good and the waitress was attentive.

Visited Frisco based on the reviews had to try this pizza spot. Based on our server's recommendation we tried the Little Star (deep dish). The pie was made to order and was warned it took half an hour.  I prefer fresh made-to-order food so the time was okay with me.

They immediately served us water and took our order. The pie was super filling and for the first time, we didn't add a meat topping. A deep dish pie is big for everyone but hit the spot for us. It was raining outside and quite cold inside especially sitting on their aluminum chairs. Casual Dining with metered street parking.

The pizza here is simply amazing. I cannot get enough of it. The cheese on the pizza here is always melted to perfection. The toppings on the pizza here are always fresh. It adds the perfect amount of flavor. You can taste the quality. The staff are friendly and attentive. They make the experience even better.

Lovely ambiance in this pizza place! The vibe right when you walk in is very retro and SF-like, I love it. The pizza is AMAZING! I love that you can get any thing on the menu deep dish or thin crust, that level of flexibility is everything to me.

The service is also good. I've been to two of their locations, dine in and take out, and all the servers have been friendly and super accommodating.

Try the little star pizza with thin crust! I highly recommend this place!

Came here last min with some friends for dinner after having read about how good the pizza was here and was not disappointed at all!!
The restaurant is smaller and has a cool vibe with quirky decor on the walls and shelves! Our server was really attentive and kind - he actually chased us down after we left cause we forgot our leftover box  10/10 service tyty

I haven't had a deep dish pizza in a while and so I didn't know what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised! The butternut and bacon was hands down one of my favorite flavor combinations I've had in a reallllly long time! The sweetness of the butternut and the creaminess of the goat cheese  cut through with the saltiness of the bacon and heat from the hot honey! Def new my fav pizza in sf!

If you're looking for a good deep dish pizza this is the spot! I will definitely be coming back!!

First the first time after 3 years we live close by, we tried this pizza restaurant. We picked up 2 small deep dish (the Margherita plus and the little star).
Portion are super big (2 small are enough for 3 people). I loved the crust and the ingredients (but the quantity of garlic was too much). I think I ate too many slices because it was heavy to digest.
Overall I liked the pizza even though was different from the one I ate in Chicago.

Friendly staff, the location has plenty of sitting space, the food is excellent, and drinks are unique.
We loved the appetizers, mushrooms pizza, and alcoholic/virgin beverages.
Nice addition to the neighborhood!

We were heading to SF for the day and by coincidence came across an article on top pizza restaurants to try in SF. Damn Fine was on the list and since we were in the area close to dinner time, we decided to get take out pizza from them. Ordered the pizzas in the restaurant and there was about 15-20 minute wait. While I was waiting, I noticed many people were rushing outside the restaurant. The lady behind the bar told me to go out as there is a Mister Softee that stopped in front and they encouraged you to get the soft serve and eat it in the restaurant!! So I had to go out in the freezing air and order one. It made the wait for pizza feel so much shorter!! Got to try my first Mister Softee ice cream sundae as well!!

Back to the pizza!! We got two 14" pizzas to go. Got home and dived in. We had the burrata and the special one with asparagus and the most colorful edible flowers. Loved loved the pizzas, tasty crispy thin crust with the most amazing fresh ingredients. Need to go back and try other entrees as well. But we are off to a great start with the two pizzas so far!!

Will definitely go back again when we are in SF and in the mood for some Italian food.

We got take out
: pizzas.  Crispy thin crust.   Very good. And for breakfast the next day too.  LoL
Street parking very limited .  I waited while my wife went in to get our order.  
Was disappointed in the Caesar salad dressing, not garlicky enough or hardly at all in my opinion, and thought it was a over priced for just lettuce and dressing.

We came in on a Thursday night without a reservation and sat at the shared middle table. It was pretty chilly as we sat directly across from the door. Our food got cold really fast because of this. There were empty tables but I'm assuming those were reserved. We got the sausage pizza, bucatini and a couple drinks. The pizza here was really good. The crust was light and fluffy and all the toppings worked really well together. The pasta on the other hand was extremely underwhelming. It was plain and the sauce was just salty but not flavorful. I would be back just for the pizza and drinks and will definitely make a reservation next time.

Could we please change the name from Damn Fine to: Damn Double Delicious??

I have had this bookmarked since inception - and it did NOT disappoint!

We started with the frito misto - which was essentially cauliflower and green bean tempura - and can I say there was exactly the right amount of salt on top?   Served with a (smoked paprika??) aioli. WOW, just delicious!

3 of us split 2 pizzas - the bbq beef one and the asparagus/veggie one.  The beefy one was super unique but still relatable, the veggie pizza was B-E-A-U-T-i-F-U-L  and loaded with veggies AND some edible flowers.  

I eat a LOT of pizza and I have never had anything close to the toppings on these pizzas. I will put this on my "must visit" list for out of town guests who enjoy a wood-fired pizza.

There is a really pretty patio in the back for dinner, but the open concept dining room is lovely. You can see the pizza oven and there is even a disco ball in the rafters. The parklet looked too windy for us.

Service was friendly, but not too pushy or intrusive.

Can't wait to go back and try the mushroom pie.

Damn Fine is DELICIOUS!  My bestie took me here for my first visit because it's her favorite pizza place.  The sourdough crust here is truly a game changer; I don't even like pizza crust and I eat it all!

My favorite pizza is seasonal right now, the clam pie!  The combination of the briny clams, garlic, acidic lemon, and creamy and slightly sweet ricotta dollops are to die for.  I've also had the mushroom dream and that one is so flavorful as well.  Their pastas are handmade and we all loved the clam linguine.  On a more recent visit, I tried their bunny hop cocktail with chamomile syrup and it was soo good.

Service is super friendly and their back patio is super spacious!  Make a reservation because it gets pretty crowded.  Can't wait to come back!!

Damn fine is my favorite pizza restaurant. I've gone to several other places and have tried a ton of other pizzas, but there is nothing that can compare to their Mushroom Dream.

Every time I come with my bf, I want to try something new, but can't get myself to stray away from this absolute DREAM of a pizza. I never imagined that my favorite pizza would be as simple as mushrooms and cheese, but my goodness, it is!!

Please run to this restaurant and try this ASAP!

Super nice place to grab a pizza in the Outer Sunset. They offer cocktails and wine and have a great ambiance and wonderful back patio. Service here is also top notch and super friendly. Neighborhood parking around this area of the city is fairly easy depending on the time of day.

Tried the clam pie ($24) and it was enough to split for two if you're not suuuper hungry. Hope to be back to try some of the other yummy sounding pies.

Had a great old fashioned here as well ($15) that was made to perfection. Kudos to Damnfine for being such a pleasant place to sit down and enjoy a meal.

I've heard great reviews about Damn Fine Pizza from friends and my sister.

Food: 4/5 the warm olives were great. The mushroom pizza was okay. Mushrooms itself were tasty however just lacking flavor. Definitely needs a bit more truffle it was pretty bland imo. The pig in the woods was okay, I liked the sausage and mushroom combo however it also lacked flavor. We also ordered a cocktail and a beer.
Service: 5/5 good
ambiance: 5/5 great

All in all I'd come back to try the rest of the menu.

The name says it, this place is damn fine!

Came by on a Friday night for dinner and the inside was packed, we didn't have a reservation but had the option to sit on the back patio or at the bar. It was pretty loud inside so we opted for outside under a heater.

We ordered two pizzas and a salad for our group of 3 to share. We went with the Mushroom dream and Margherita pizza and a Caesar salad. Both pizzas were good but the mushroom dream was the winner. The garlic butter with the mix of mushrooms gave it that perfect umami flavor. While I liked the Margherita, I have had better.

This was the first time I've ever had a Caesar salad with visible anchovies on it. Tried one and it wasn't my thing, easily pushed them to the side and enjoyed this great salad.

Received wonderful hospitality and recommendations from our server.

Parking nearby isn't the easiest, after trying a few different blocks we lucked out and got a spot about two blocks down on the same side of the street as the restaurant.

Fantastic pizza. It was perfect. Please don't raise the prices. The classic cheese slice? Fabulous, can't go wrong. We liked the pesto veggie slice, too. The crust was chewy but tender and very thick, in a good way.

You order from a window, which added to the experience for us. The employee who served us was super awesome.

We will definitely be back.

If you find yourself craving an unforgettable slice of pizza in San Francisco, look no further than Golden Boy Pizza. Nestled in the heart of North Beach, this iconic pizzeria is a local treasure that has stood the test of time.

From the moment you step into the unassuming establishment, the aroma of freshly baked pizza envelops you, instantly igniting your appetite. The no-frills, classic pizzeria atmosphere adds to the charm and authenticity of the experience. The staff members are friendly, efficient, and passionate about their craft, enhancing the overall dining experience.

The crust strikes the perfect balance between crispy and chewy, with just the right amount of thickness. Each bite delivers a harmonious blend of flavors that leave you craving more.

It's worth mentioning that Golden Boy Pizza's popularity means that it can get busy, especially during peak hours. The limited seating inside the establishment may require you to grab your slice to-go or find a spot in nearby Washington Square Park to enjoy your meal.

I truly do not understand how this place is supposed to be one of the best pizza spots in sf!

I got a slice of the garlic clam pizza today and was so disappointed. I genuinely was so excited to try it and I thought it was going to be amazing but the dough itself was pretty flavorless and the pizza didn't have much flavor besides garlic! Even the cheese wasn't that good and the sauce didn't have that tanginess that most tomato sauces do. I didn't even finish the crust on the pizza and found myself not wanting to eat much more.

The line was really long so I really thought it would live up to the hype but it really wasn't worth the wait.

The staff however were really friendly and quick with their service.

The one and only place that I know of that has clams on pizza. The crust is soft, and their clam pizza is fully topped with a blend of baby clams, garlic, and chopped parsley.
Usually it has more of a clam flavor, but recently it leans more on the garlicy side. Still good though, especially when you take a bite the moment you're handed the pizza box. Call ahead (415-982-9738) and place a to-go order otherwise it'll be a LONG line. I called around 7:50pm on a Saturday and it took 30mins.

I keep hearing people rave about this spot so it was only right for me to check it out when I was around the area. The line was only about 10 minutes when I arrived, so not too bad. The staff was very upbeat and friendly. It was a nice sunny day in the city, perfect for a pie on the go!

I ordered a pepperoni, sausage, and a pesto vegetarian.(All 10/10) they were all delicious, thin crust with the perfect amount of cheese, sauce, and toppings! The price does not break the bank either. I recommend anyone in the area to stop by!

Golden Boy gives awesome phone:

"I've been looking at Golden Boy on Yelp for awhile ...and tonight I think I'm ready to take the plunge and order.."

"Let's do this! What would you like?"

Golden Boy Pizza is pillowy, slightly chewy with a golden, crispy bottom crust and thickly layered with delicious toppings.

We ordered a half sheet (large, 8 big Detroit style slices) with half pesto clam and half combo (pepperoni, sausage, tomato, zucchini).

Despite three hungry people grabbing slices, we still have two leftover.

Someone will have for breakfast...

PS You'll scare vampires after eating the pesto clam but it's worth it.

I love Golden Boy. This North Beach pizza joint has been a must-stop for me every time I've visited the Bay Area. The last time I was here I ordered and ate inside, but the inside appears closed to the public. It wasn't a big deal ordering from the pickup window and standing/eating on the sidewalk outside. I went with a sausage slice to mix it up from my standard pepperoni order, and the sausage was a good choice. The thick, fluffy Sicilian style square is a lost art that not many pizza places do well anymore. The Golden Boy slice is very cheesy, herbaceous, and flavorful. It's a truly unique slice for a truly unique establishment. I can't wait to come back.

This line was sooooo long as I was walking to chubby noodle that when I left chubby noodle I had to stop for a slice. It literally was 23 ppl in line before me. I got a slice of cheese pizza and it was amazing price point  was only $3-$4 and they warm the slices up for you before they serve them. It was giving deep dish which I looooooove. She wrapped mine up to go which I thought was so sweet because I just finished eating. Even on the reheat at the house the crust was so buttery and sauce was seasoned. I loved it and I will def be back.

Also It's a walk up and order you can sit in the outside seating area but it gets really packed. I don't think they have indoor seating. If they do I didn't see any.

Simple pizza place that you just order at the outdoor counter. But man this was so delicious. Super fresh. We had ordered a clam and garlic pizza and one was almost finished cooking, so we waited for the hot slice. The cashier was super friendly.

- Clam and garlic (5/5): Loved this slice, soo garlic-y which I love. Clams were a perfect addition, not too chewy and great flavor.
- Combo slice (4.5/5): Also yummy, love the toppings but not too overpowering. Just a delicious, simple slice of pizza.

I probably won't say anything that hasn't already been said! From the long lines, to the authentic taste, a slice of pizza here isn't just a slice of pizza, but a bite of heaven!

This has the long line effect.. Standing in line simply increases the appetite and makes you want the pizza more! If you are looking to-go pizza you can order ahead and I recommend it. Call 415.982.9738 to order.

It's all deliciousness, the pricing is stuck pre-pandemic, which is amazing!!

If you are in the North Beach area, please, please, please, please, don't miss this spot.

Amazing food, amazing ambiance. This is one of my most common to-go spots in the Richmond district. I always go on weekends and around 7pm, and they manage to sit us very quickly. The wait usually is around 5 mins, so super quick.

Food: 5/5. I love thin pizzas and they do theirs really well. The margarita pizza is amazing and the arugula pizza has a tingy, spicy tomato taste, and it was delicious. The farm egg pizza was quite interesting! It's a liquidy egg with a white pizza base. They make the pizza in front of you too, which is cool!

Ambiance: 5/5. The interior is quite dim and definitely adds to the aesthetic of the place. Servers are all quite nice. They do appreciate if we order all of our pizzas in the beginning -- rather than adding onto our orders later on.

I just can't keep my mouth shut about my last visit to an Italian restaurant - it was one of the most amazing restaurant experiences I've ever had!

From the moment I walked in, I was surrounded by an atmosphere of Italian hospitality. The interior was cozy, with decor that brought notes of Italian charm and romance. I immediately felt as if I was in an Italian alley where I could enjoy a fine dining experience.

The menu was extensive and appealing. I decided to try the pizza, and my choice was just perfect. The dough was thin, crispy and flavorful, and the sauce and hopeful toppings were literally heavenly. Every bite of pizza just melted in your mouth, leaving you feeling completely satisfied.

But the most delightful part was the dessert menu. I ordered the tiramisu and it was a true masterpiece. The airy cream soaked in coffee and generously sprinkled with cocoa just dissolved in my mouth, leaving a sweet aftertaste and a desire to eat more.

The service at the restaurant was outstanding. The staff was friendly, attentive and willing to offer recommendations. They created the perfect balance of friendliness and professionalism, making my visit unforgettable.

I would highly recommend this Italian restaurant to anyone looking for an unparalleled Italian dining experience. It combines great quality food, excellent service and a charming atmosphere to create an unforgettable experience.

The wait was so worth! Found this place on TikTok and decided to give it a try with a few friends. We ordered every single pizza on the menu and there was not a single slice left  

We waited for about 45 minutes on a Saturday at 2pm. Luckily time last by with their super cute restaurant dog roaming around getting pets! By the time we sat, we knew what we wanted and the food came out in about 20 minutes.

But like I said... their pizza was worth the wait and I wouldn't mind waiting again for their delicious slices!

Nestled underneath a dreamy pepper tree, Pizzetta 211 is a neighborhood gem. Their pizza menu rotates weekly, but some of their original classics like the rosemary pine nuts pizza are available everyday. Forget New York, Sicilian, or Chicago pizzas, the California pizzas here are the best I've ever tasted. I'm speechless when I bite into that cracker thin crust that's perfumed with sprigs of rosemary and toasted pine nuts. It's simply sophisticated. They also have daily special starters which are always fun to try. The flavors and creativity rivals that of Michelin starred restaurants; but I've never been to a restaurant that's as satisfying as Pizzetta 211.

This is a really small space with a few outdoor tables squeezed in on the sidewalk, and relatively brusque service, so I wouldn't recommend it for larger groups.

I got the rotating seasonal farm egg pizza -- Farm Egg, English Peas, Pancetta, Mint, Parmigiano ($19). I thought the pepper was a little heavy handed, but I really enjoyed the eggs and breaking the yolk to distribute over the slice. The crust was also flavorful and crispy, and very thin -- the pizza as a whole feels pretty light, and sized for one per person.

I also got the field green salad ($6), which as stated in the description, is literally just some simple mixed greens with a balsamic dressing.

*** BEST PIZZA IN TOWN ***

This is a classic restaurant that has truly perfected the art of pizza.Hands down it's the best pizza I've had in Bay Area. I've been to this place at least 10 times and I've always left happier than before.

They have a small menu. There are 3-4 fixed pizza options which are your classic ones. Among those, the spicy San Marzano is my favorite. There are also usually 3 pizza options which are seasonal and they change that once a month (or something like that).

I usually go with one of the new options on the menu and I've never been disappointed. Their daily starters is also very seasonal and they change it quite often. The dessert options are also great and they have an okay selection of wine and beer. What else do you want? This place has everything you want from good vibe, to good food and great prices.

Just keep in mind that the place is busy and the host is not the nicest person out there. But don't let that negatively impact the experience as they are trying to optimize how best they can serve their costumers and they have clearly optimized it!

I went here with my friend a little while back. I really enjoyed the intimate vibes here. This place is tucked away in Richmond and it's definitely a keeper. There isn't a lot of seating but indoor and outdoor seating are available.

As for food, everything we got was great. I like their unique pizza toppings. The ham, egg, and cheese pizza was very good. The menu changes pretty often so keep that in mind. For two people, an appetizer and 2 pizzas was plenty. We had leftovers to take.

This place seems great for any occasion, like date night, weeknight dinners, and dinner with the parents. There's a good amount of parking nearby and I didn't have to wait long on a weeknight. I highly recommend this place!

Cute little spot, we were seated at a booth right next to the kitchen so we had the opportunity to watch them make all the food. Definitely on the list of some of our favorite pizzas in SF - the crust is incredibly thin. We ordered:

- Appetizer special of the day, forgot the name but it was a type of salad with an egg. Quite heavy on the dressing and came with some bacon pieces I believe, also on the saltier side. 3/5
- Finnochio salami pizza - crust held up well since there weren't a lot of sauce, salami was delicious. 5/5
- Spicy San Mariano pizza top with arugula - the overly saucy tomato sauce drenched the crust unfortunately so the center became soggy, however we really liked the slightly spice with the sauce and loved the mascarpone in it. 4/5

Even though the place itself was small, it seemed like they had an efficient system worked out. My wife and I are not big people and barely fit in the booth, can't imagine a taller/larger person sitting where we sat. Overall had a great experience and would come back to try other pies.

Small joint located next to a very popping restaurant, I almost missed this place. Pizzas are smaller than what I'm accustomed to seeing, but priced accordingly (~$18 per) and don't leave you overly full.

Everything here is homemade, no reservations. Pizza dough is good, but prefer it to be a bit chewier - this seemed more crispy.

// Would get again
- daily special minestrone: $12: hearty and rich
- spicy mascarpone pizza $18: melt in your mouth mascarpone tones down the perfectly spicy tomato
- toasted ricotta dessert $9: lightly sweet, crunchy ricotta cake and perfect berry compote

// Would pass
- salad $6: nothing special here
- margherita pizza $13: nothing to rave home about. Would've liked more basil

TLDR:
Overall, great small date spot - not good for groups. Fast service and very reasonable prices!

If you love a thin-crust pizza, Pizzetta 211 is definitely the place for you.

While the menu is limited -- a few staters, five or six pizzettas and a dessert or two -- what you will find are offerings that highlight the best fresh, seasonal, local ingredients that can be found. With fresh organic greens and a simple balsamic vinaigrette, the tasty field green salad ($6.00) was perfect for one person or for two not-too-hungry people to share. While a little messy to eat, the farm egg, bacon, corn, cherry tomato and chive pizzetta topped with chipotle-creme fraiche ($19.00) was redolent with the best flavors of late summer. The classic quattro formaggi pizzetta ($17.00) was enhanced by oven dried Early Girl tomatoes, garlic and herbs: absolutely delicious.

Pro Tip: The restaurant is first-come, first served -- no reservations -- so be prepared to wait unless you arrive at, or close to, opening time. Also, the restaurant is designed for smaller parties of two to four people; if you arrive with a group of six or eight, it will be harder to be seated together.

In the spirit of a brief menu, the wine and beer choices are limited as well. You should not expect your favorite wine by the glass or your go-to beer, but you can be sure to find something that you will like.

If you're looking for a tasty thin-crust pizza in the Richmond District, Pizzetta 211 is the place for you.

The best pizza in ocean!!
We ordered pesto cheese w/sausage
My kiddo were so happy
Service was great.
Really recommend.

Great wood fired oven pizzas!
One size, great for two people with an appetizer or a salad and drinks.

Your pizza is prepared and baked in rapid time in a high temperature wood fired oven.

If your time is money, you will save on the heating time for your pizza.

We will be back!

I recently visited this restaurant and was blown away by the delicious food and impeccable service. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with a warm welcome and seated promptly. The atmosphere was inviting, perfect for a good time with friends
The Garden pizza was amazing.

The staff was friendly and accommodating.  and I truly appreciate it.

My husband & I decided to do Saturday night date night at this charming place.  We used to patronize the place years ago when it was a coffee shop before it turned into a pizzeria.  

My husband indicated it was a special occasion when he called for a reservation.  We were so pleasantly surprised to see a little heart shaped table decoration on our table for romantic effect!  

The food was great & the prices reasonable.  They have a pizza oven imported from Naples that makes all the difference & was so reminiscent of the pizzas we had in Naples, Italy.  The owner Abed came by to chat with us & overall, we felt so welcome.  

Definitely recommend this pizzeria for any occasion or even just for a casual meal.  Wonderful family run restaurant. Please patronize.

I must say whoever did the decoration should receive a warm hug! The place is festive (and quite fancy). As soon as I walk into this restaurant, I feel as if I have gone to a beautiful restaurant under the bright light of Venice river at night. Cozy. Woody and royal.

The pizza is delicious. I see many reviewers mention the burned bottom. I'm glad mine ain't, though I wish it was a bit cook through. I can feel the dough texture ain't completely done. The cherry tomatoes, moz cheese blend so well together thus the bitterness from fresh argu leaves. Beautiful!  
Great price and a perfect size for one person. Will be back again xoxo

You know what...

Not bad!

My group and I enjoyed our pizzas from That's Amore. We ordered a regular sized meat lover's and caprese pizza as well as chicken tenders with fries for my friend's 4 year old.

The pizzas were light and airy, just how I like it.

Great wood fired pizza. Tastes amazingly like Tony's Pizza Napoletana. Quick service. Pizza came out quickly. Great price. Recommended if you're out in the sticks, but on the K Line so not to bad getting there.

Surprisingly good wood-fired pizza and salads, with some limited appetizers like calamari. Interior has plenty of seating (maybe 12 4-top tables) and waiting staff was reasonably attentive to our large party. Salads were nicely balanced with dressing and toppings, a little small for a full meal but much larger than a side salad.

Pizza is Neopolitan-style and restaurant has a traditional Neopolitan wood fire oven. Crust is light with a little bite while tomato sauce is a nice blend of acidity and sweetness. Cheese was missing a little flavor and fell off picking up slices, but overall quite good. Pies are big enough for 2 to split with a salad or one person could probably take down a pie on their own if hungry. Reasonably priced by Bay standards.

Great pizza and desert! Gabriel, our waiter, provided excellent service - My kids love it.

Oh, forgot to mention - very  reasonable price!

Definitely coming back!

Great foood, terrible service.
I went out to eat here with my family around a week ago, Me, my wife and my 2 children. The waiter named Joanna asked me to pre-pay, which I did. A customer with the same waiter, who was white overheard this and said "we didn't have to prepay." I find this discriminating as the server was white, and only asked for the African-American customer to pre-pay.

Finally writing a review for one of my favorite pizza places! It's tough to not find reasons to try every single one of their seasonal launches, but these are also not cheap pizzas so it helps that they have Big Box Monday deals and Doordash also sometimes runs promos.

Some personal favorites from their regular menu:
Ellen Supreme
How Mush-Room
special shout out for the excellent crispy cheddar crust and the Detroit-style thick but delicious pizza dough base

This time, I got to try one of their seasonal flavors - the Mush-o-Roni! Delicious as always, but this also made me realize I was not necessarily a fan of...hot honey. Blasphemy, I know!

Regardless - will be back to try more every chance I get. Run, don't walk, here!

+ Tasty Pizza
+ Crunchy Wings
+ Friendly Service
+ Comfortable Venue
+ Epic Zaza Pachulia Collab

- Expensive
- Inconvenient Location

Yeah Square Pie Guys is a great place to get pizza if you're near the Civic Center BART. It was my first time trying Detroit style pizza. I'll say I prefer Chicago deep dish, but it was still pretty good. The crust on Detroit style is not as buttery so not as good imo. Unfortunately the price is quite steep, imma say worth.

Deep dish pizzas are the best! The pepperoni is how I like it...a lot and crispy! What impressed me was their seasoned  crispy asparagus....my fave! Can't go wrong with the chicken wings.

Self serve restaurant.

I've heard about Square Pie Guys by word of mouth for months now. Since I was in the area I finally decided to make the trip over for a late lunch. The area though is in the middle of the SOMA district so I would advise anyone looking to visit this location to be wary of their surroundings. Nonetheless, the food was amazing!

We ordered the Green Goddess and the Szechuan Wings and both were immaculate. If you're looking to expand your food palette past the regular pepperoni pizza the Green Goddess is an exceptional option.

I don't care what shape the pizza comes in, it could be octagon for all I care, but it has to taste good.

What an epic fail. Burnt toppings, barely any sauce, puffy bread, amd hardly any great crisp or cheesiness to this pizza.

Wow, like I could only taste the burnt pepperoni and mushrooms and thick messed up bread on this nearly $30 pizza which has 4 small slices with the added on ranch.

I wanted a fluffy crispy pizza and I got this mess.

The ranch was horrible by the way. It had this old sour flavor like it wasn't fresh. I ended up throwing it away. I don't think Buttermilk or any milk should have a sour taste and smell to it.

Yup, this place was hard to get to, even harder to find parking, and for what? Lousy burnt pizza, that's what!

YUM YUM YUM YUM YUM!!! I've only gone twice, but it's rare to find a slice of puzza you'll never forget a bite of! We ordered two of the big vons and one cutom pizza. Between 3 people we expected the four slices to be the right amount per person, but we were wrong! Each of us got full after a 1.5 slices! So one pizza is definitely good for two people to share. The staff was super friendly and patient as we were very indecisive on what to order. The work gave us all his suggestions and poured us water as we were waiting for our food to come out. The dine-in area was quiet and had nice decor around, plenty of tables to sit at as modt people order take-out!

This place was unexpected, but in a good way. I loved how they had NPR Tiny Desk concerts as the music in the background. The vibe here is cool and relaxing. You can order from a kiosk or from a QR code on the table for dine-in.

The staff here is friendly. They give you glasses of water and a pitcher so they don't have to keep coming back. Feel free to ask for a refill. I definitely recommend the green goddess pizza. The sauce makes it delicious, but it is complemented with juicy chicken and ripe cherry tomatoes. The four slices may not seem like a lot, but it's filling. I would come back here again for this pizza.

As a Pizza lover I have to say this is the best pizza I've had so far! Thick, deliciously flavored made pizza. Ate it with my eyes & the first bite proved me right. The fries were good as well 7.5/10 but it was the pizza for me 10/10. Great customer service too.
Can't believe this is my first time trying this place, definitely looking forward to go back & will recommend to everyone!

Dined in for a late lunch with a small group of us including my toddler. They were extremely accommodating the moment we walked in.

I like the simplicity of their menu as well as the modern and casual ambiance this place provides.

Do order their pizzas or any of their wings. You cannot go wrong there. I also recommend any of their IPA's they have on tap (I believe). The beer went great with our entrees. And if you want something non-alcoholic but also tasty as if it's alcoholic, so try their soft drinks they have. I really liked their Hoptonic Earl Grey (not sweet at all but has that divine Earl Grey tea smell).

Also, they have some delicious dipping sauces to go with any of your appetizers or entrees.

Came here with low expectations and left thoroughly impressed! I thought it was just going to be another overhyped place in a touristy spot.

Pretty casual space with plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. Choose a seat and order on your phone via QR code and they'll bring everything out to you! As far as I know, they only do full pies and not by the slice.

We got The Big Von: white sauce, italian sausage, pepperoni, mike's hot honey. $23 for 4 slices isn't a steal but each slice is pretty hefty. It is everything great about Detroit style pizza - cheese is crunchy and crusty on the outside yet still ooey gooey on top. You'll definitely get a good cheese pull.

Will definitely be back for their other pizzas and sides!

Really good pizza and pastries. Cute parklet out front to enjoy all the deliciousness!

I also love that they only have one pizza flavor each day. It's fun to walk up and see what you're getting into.

I will definitely be back for more!

Great bake goods.  Focaccia is filling and totally worth it.  

Flavors change daily.  Kids love the Parmesan bread sticks.  The scones are stellar.  Pizzas change daily and are the cats meow.  

You can get a par baked pizza to take home and finish.  Coffee cakes are only available on the weekends and I always buy.  Employee owned.

In the Inner Sunset on 9th Ave/Irving Street. Parking is tough but the N-Judah runs right by. No lines queuing to get in at around 2PM! Picked up:
*  Classic Sourdough Round -  classic sourdough in a round shape with sesame, poppy and fennel seeds on the outside.
*  Vegan tomato, spinach, mushroom focaccia
*  Rustic English muffin
*  Plain croissant

Service was quick once your selections were made but you end up getting in everyone else's way and vice versa. And while you're doing this it's all intermingling with the payment line. A lot of juggling and moving around. Very small area to negotiate all this. Cashier was nice and payment was fast once you got there.  A few seats outside. Otherwise take your goodies home or to Golden Gate Park to eat or walk/eat on your way to the De Young Museum or California Science Academy.

My favorite of all was the Vegan tomato, spinach, mushroom focaccia! Biting into this, the smell and bite took me back to the tomato & scallion focaccia from Liguria Bakery in North Beach. Total Yuuummm! Their version is airy and loftier and very good. Five stars for the focaccia.

I was not enamored of the rustic English Muffin, plain croissant or classic round sourdough. The English muffin was okay though it tasted like it could have baked a tad longer but definitely nothing special. The plain croissant while it had nice crispy flaky layers biting in and that butter taste. Maybe not enough butter and not as airy as a croissant should be. The classic round sourdough was crusted with sesame, poppy & fennel seeds. Though it had a nice crust on the bottom, I could have done without the fennel seeds. Probably a good sourdough for most but not my thing.

Lots of other artisan baked goods to try - muffins, cookies, scones, breads, pizzas, focaccias even clotted cream! Will be back when I'm in the neighborhood.

Love their baked goods, it's popular for a  reason. A lady at the register was friendly, the place is so
tiny but packed with tons of goodies:-)

We originally planned to arrive here early in the morning since we heard the line is usually super long, but we overslept and ended up arriving at 11:30ish on a Saturday. There were plenty of street parking in the area and we got lucky with one right across the street. There was a short line, although it looked kinda long mostly because the store interior itself is small, but it moved very fast! It took total of 10 min for us to get in and out. There were no line by the time we finished eating one of the buns. Perhaps we just got really lucky with the parking + short line on the weekend.

This is a "grab the baked goods yourself" kind of place. They have paper bags in various sizes, which I thought was a very nice touch. Don't forget to use the tissue/wax paper provided to help grab your bread (they don't have tongs here). All the items were in still in stock by the time we arrived.

So what exactly did I get here? I honestly don't remember the specific names of each. The cashier had to help me look into the bag & identify my items. She did it pretty fast, but I only had 4 items (a jalapeño cheese stick ? + Some sort of easter special bun ? + jalapeño & tomato focaccia? + an almond croissant) in one bag + 1 cookie in another bag + 1 focaccia from the counter. Total was $24 ish.

TLDR:
I thought the focaccia from the counter would be warm, but it's room temperature too. I really really liked it though. My bf loveeed the jalapeños cheese breadstick thingy. The chocolate mint cookie was wayyyy too sweet for our personal preference, but if you love chocolate, go for it.

When I'm in the neighborhood my go to for lunch.

Usually order whatever the pizza special is and get half a pie ($14). There hasn't been a combination they've done on their pies I don't like.

Everyone is always professional and helpful. Line usually looks crazy long from a first timers perspective but it goes so fast. I've never had to wait over 5minutes for my order.

This location is really small, but most of the space is for the bakery as they make things fresh! Cashier, I don't remember name, recommended the Oakland location which is more my stomping grounds.

Can't wait to check out the Lakeshore, Oakland location, (it's bigger :)

Forgot to mention, correct me if I'm wrong, I think all Arizmendi bakery shops are coop owned which is a huge plus for me. I know the Sunset location is at least.

Well... diet on hold again!!
So grateful my friend insisted we stop here on our way to eyewear shon in SF. No wonder the line was out the door! Delicious breads of all sorts including gluten-free. Scones, muffins, ethnic breads, cookies, focaccia, rolls, pizza. I picked up a macaroon, blueberry scone, cowgirl cookie, and a pizza to take home. Super friendly staff. See photo of pizza. You gotta experience this place!

Came to Arizmendi around 10:30am for some late breakfast on a Sunday this time, and it was just as busy at is always is, with a quickly moving line out the door and down 9th Ave. Ordering takes place inside now, instead of at the window, and walking past the cabinets of pastries made me feel a lot more tempted to buy an extra pastry.

I paid for my scone and bialy, and my single slice pizza was ready at the window not long after.

-Scone of the Day ($4): today's scone was pear and blueberry. The scones always have a delightfully delicate crispy exterior and a soft, light but moist crumbly interior. It just the right amount of sweetness and you can taste the richness from the butter and I love bits of fresh fruit throughout the scone. I always get the scone of the day when I'm here.

-Bialy ($3): the bialy is another of my favorites here. It's topped with carmelized onion and toasted spices, making for the perfect savory and fragrant bread. It's a nice chewy sourdough I just can't get enough of.

-Single Slice Pizza ($3.50): I'm not going to lie, I never pay attention to our remember what the pizza of the day is, but it's always good. I believe this one had spinach, onion and artichooke, but the pizza always comes out wrapped in foil which makes it seem deceptively warm - don't fall for the trick it's scalding hot. The pizza dough is perfectly chewy, the vegetables give you the vague excuse of health while providing great flavor and texture, a generous amount of gooey cheese creates the perfect cheese pull and savory slice to enjoy sitting at the benches outside of the bakery. Always get a slice when you're here.

Arizmendi has and always be one of my favorite places for amazing bread, pastries and pizza and a great price.

Arizmendi has been on my bakery list for a while. Especially love how they're worker-owned. Was a bit overwhelmed with their scone and muffin selection since everything looked bomb so asked the cashier for a recommendation. He recommended the corn cherry scone, which is one of their mainstays. Gotta admit that I would have not picked it out if it wasn't suggested, but gave it a shot.

Thoughts? The first bite I took, I thought it was just alright. Very corny. Crisp. Lovely exterior texture. Almost like those big fat bakery cookies that are crisp on the outside with a burnt buttery crust at the bottom.

Even though I tried to stop, I found myself not being able to. Someone send help. Finished this big scone in one go.

The inside is very reminiscent of cornbread. Not the biggest fan of the dried cherries inside since I didn't think they really went with it- honestly would've preferred blueberries but that may be a fruit preference thing.

Overall, a unique scone offering and they have a good selection of bakes that you wouldn't find in other bakeries in the city. Defo want to go back and try their other stuff, especially the pizza! The staff was also very lovely and warm.

Ok Arizmendi Bakery. You're trying to make me cheat on Arsicault, aren't you?  With your strawberry pop tarts and tomato and cheese focaccia and pecan rolls. And then you have the cute Asian cashier who didn't even check my bag when I rattled off my purchase. I could've totally shorted her a muffin or two but I didn't because who does that to a neighborhood bakery?!  The line gets long but moves fast except when you're behind parents who painstakingly describe what a scone is to their  kid only to have him ignore them and then proceed to ask what a focaccia is. But so worth the wait, much more reasonably priced than the bakery down the street. Won't name names but it rhymes with Tartine. I'll be back for their pizza.

Gioia is a staple. I've come here numerous times because I LOVE LOVE LOVE the pizza. Favorite is the Julian (house-made calabrese sausage, lacinato kale, red onion, chili flakes, garlic, mozzarella, pecorino), the avocado & arugula salad,  and the cannoli! I could eat 2 cannoli in one sitting because they are made so incredibly well

Make sure to order a whole pie (b/c you will want more) and get some parmesan cheese and peppers

The store itself is very small and you can take the pizza a block away to the park area in Hayes Valley and enjoy it there while people watching

The takeout slice is amazing. That is a five star service. The reason I write this review is for the delivery service this last Friday.
The pizza arrived with the plastic sticker for food safety unstuck. Pizza was lukewarm. Pizza was uncut?? I asked for a double cut so we could have more slices.
Arrived 30 minutes later than ordered. The restaurant charges a %15 service charge for orders with them.
I love this pizza, but come on now. $51 without a tip for a barely warm pizza, no meat, unsliced, and over 30 minutes late. I ordered ahead too.
Disappointed.
I hope next time the food will live up to it's hype.

I always hear Gioia recommended as one of the best New York style pizzas in SF, but after trying it I'm not really sure why. It's definitely not the best NY style (I'd give that one to the Pizza Shop), and I don't even think it's really that close to NY style other than the fact that you can buy them by the slice.

I actually ordered a whole pie (the funghi) when trying this place, and figured it'd be hot and fresh that way (which I think it was to be fair). It was tasty enough, but at the end of the day it was a pretty standard pizza and not particularly impressive to me. I wasn't the biggest fan of the crust at the end (It was on the thicker side, and also not very light or chewy)

If I happened to be in the area and was craving pizza this would definitely satisfy my craving, but I don't think I would go out of my way to come here again.

I am always looking for new quality pizza places, so when one of my friends suggested that it was good, I wanted to give it a shot! It's situated on Hayes in Hayes Valley with many other restaurants, public outdoor seating, and good vibes.

We got one of their Julian pizzas to share, half without sausage and half with sausage. It has kale, onion, and a garlic cream sauce. I thought the flavors really worked and were interesting. I was really tempted to try the Margherita after so I ordered a slice of that too. The sauce was so rich and tasty, with the right amount of tartness. The cheese was good but since it was already cold and reheated, it was firm and just okay. However, I thought the crust itself was not that NYC quality and didn't taste like much. It was bland and bit too crispy to my liking and lacked any stretchiness you get from a New York slice. If the crust was something to look forward to, that would have definitely brought this place to a higher rating.

This place has so much potential with the flavors of the toppings and sauce, but if the crust was better it would be easier for me to recommend. But it's still a solid place to get a slice in Hayes!

Been here a few times but never got around to reviewing, so this is long overdue. In a nutshell the za here is awesome!

The place itself is small and has 2 small seating areas inside but all good. The service is great and they make the pies quick.

I've tried all the pies and all were great! It's kinda New Yorkish Za with the flavor and size.

Definitely worth trying, highly recommend!!

Gioia is one of my new favorite pizza places in the city!

Their flavor combos are so good, I always leave feeling satisfied and happy. I stumbled upon this spot while shopping in Hayes and was drawn in by the amazing aroma wafting out of the restaurant. Although there is no seating, the option to get it to go is always available and it's so worth it. I didn't feel heavy afterwards and found myself definitely wishing I had gotten two slices. I know I'll be back plenty of times to indulge in their delicious pizzas.

A must eat spot in SF, especially if you're craving pizza.

Great flavor! If it's your first time and don't know which one to get, try the Funghi pizza and you'll love it. I thought it was a white pizza but it's actually tomato sauce base. I tried the margherita too and it's good but I prefer the Funghi one.

Service is good. The place itself is a little cramped but you don't need it as you can take your pizza and eat it in the park, just like I did and you can watch people chilling and dogs playing under a sunny day.

Small pizza shop, big flavor. Walked in on a Sunday afternoon with no line. Ordered two 14" pizzas (Julian and Fungi) and garlic knots for 3 people. Pizzas came out hot and freshly made in about 15-20 minutes. The Fungi pizza was AMAZING. The sauce and crust were perfect. The cheese was chewy and stretchy. Didn't love the Julian as much (no red sauce), but can see why people like it. Garlic knots were a hit (comes with a side of marinara sauce).

There is virtually no seating inside so you can take the pizza over a block to the park. It looks like there is some outdoor seating (pandemic style booths) but it wasn't open on this particular Sunday.

I feel like this is sort of a sleeper spot. If my word carried any weight then it would for sure blow this spot up because I love it. Maybe I'm wrong but I bet it's a very popular spot if you live in Hayes Valley but I bet the hype doesn't spread much further than that. I'll tell you how that there needs to be murmurs and conversations about this place throughout the city. This pizza holds its own as some of the best pizza in SF. I've had the Margherita and Salsiccia (twice) and it's packing some serious flavor. The red sauce on both pies is Robust. Everything tastes fresh. It's a difficult proposition to try and get a pizza right after they make it since there isn't much of a sit down vibe here. But if you could do that it's going to maintain a great crisp and texture to boot. Let's go Gioia and good luck pronouncing it. It's a funny problem but maybe since most people don't know how to pronounce the name that's made word of mouth difficult for this spot. Anyways, It's a sleeper of a pizza place, so wake yourself up and go out and try it.
(4.7 Stars)

Great pizza! The garlic knots are excellent and have a lot of flavor. They are the best in the pizza.

I usually get takeout. The staff are quick and nice when I pick up!

I absolutely adore this place.

Not only do they have top notch bagels in the morning, but they do a meannnn dinner experience as well.

Really great overall design and vibe of the restaurant, complete with wine-to-go, merch, and other fun kitchen/pantry essentials that you can purchase. They also have an extensive Vinyl collection and play great live music to accompany dinner. Kudos for also providing great friendly service.

Bar top seating is first come first serve. They don't do reservations. Came on a Wednesday night to find the place actually pretty packed so we waited for the bar top seating. We had the meatball pizza, which was fantastic (see picture). Kale salad was crisp, light, delicious. On Wednesdays they're also doing smash burgers - which was one of the best I've had in a long time. They also got beers on tap and plenty of wine selections to choose from. They got something for everyone.

Can't wait to be back. This is THE neighborhood spot day and night. Long live The Laundromat!!!

Awesome place to get bagels !   Not only are they freshly baked, but they also taste amazing .  My favorites are salt, everything, and egg everything.  

They make flavored spreads,and my favorite is Calabrian Chili. They also have a special green garlic on occasion.

The owners are really friendly & helpful.  The staff is pleasant to deal with.  If you get there at 8am when they open, shouldn't be a long line.  If there's a line, it moves fast.

If you're not fond of bagels, then you've never had a bagel from here.  I recommend eating a bagel from here, and it'll change your perspective

The Laundromat is the place to be out in the avenues of San Francisco, and mirrors the charm & unique character of this hood.

We walked in on Friday evening at prime time and were seated in about 20 minutes. Luckily, we were able to sip on wine & beer while we waited -- I loved the Lambrusco!

We started with the Kale Salad, which was deliciously crunch with a tasty lemon tahini dressing. We devoured the Mushroom Combo pizza (with red sauce), and were surprised by how light and airy it was, given it's perceived Detroit style thickness.

The ambience was a delight: upbeat music, eclectic decor, TVs playing classic movies, and nostalgic superhero water glasses. If the pizza was any guide, we'll definitely be back again to try the bagels!

I'm glad to have found another great bagel spot in the Bay Area! I had The Laundromat bookmarked, and luckily for me, saw their booth at the Mountain View Farmer's Market the other week. They had a variety of different bagels for sale, as well as different schmears.

I'm definitely an everything bagel person, and liked that they had an Egg Everything Bagel ($3, yelp.com/user_local_phot…)! I really liked this bagel, since it had a good crust on the outside and was chewy on the inside. Also, the everything topping added nice flavor to the bagel. Although this was a great version, I though the bagel was slightly more dense than my preference, and it didn't quite have that lightness to the chew. I would still order this bagel again, and look forward to trying their other bagel flavors and schmears!

My search for the best bagels has finally ended with The Laundromat. My gf had saw this place on the gram, and of course we cross referenced with Yelp and the reviews/photos made this our first stop before playing golf around the block.

This isn't your typical bagel shop. You can't order a bagel with cream cheese. You have to order a bagel and a lil tub of cream cheese. Rip-n-Dip style with fresh/hot bagels, I'm all about it. We tried a bunch of the bagels, they were all good but my favorites were the salt and everything bagels. For the cream cheese we got the calabrian chili and the dill pickle ones. Both were really good and we honestly ate our half dozen bagels with ease. They were so good that we had to share them with the randoms we got paired up with at the golf course. They loved em too!

It's pricey but honestly, I really don't care. You can't put price on quality, and for bagels that are the closest thing to delicious as you can get outside NYC, I'll pay whatever it costs. The Laundromat ruined all other bagels for me, this is the only spot I'm going to for bagels now. They reset the bagel bar for me in the Bay Area. If you appreciate good bagels, this is the spot to check out.

The Laundromat of my new favorite places in the city: best bagels in SF, delicious pizza, nice selection of wine, great vibes, and cute merch (I bought a t-shirt and I love it) -- my only complaint is that it's too far from where I live!

I tried their bagels a few months back, and I'm actually quite picky with my bagels, but these were seriously impressive. I loved the egg everything bagel for something a little different, but tried everything from their pumpernickel to their everything bagel to their cinnamon raisin. Each and every single bagel was incredibly chewy and delicious like a good bagel should be.

They sell pints of cream cheese as well (which is plenty for about 6 bagels) and this place might have me converted to the rip and dip -- there was something quite enlightening about sitting on the curb ripping off hunks of bagels and scooping delicious cream cheese. I think they probably have knives if you want to spread it yourself but where's the fun in that?

More recently, I've returned for dinner because I saw they do pizza as well (and smash burgers on Wednesdays!) and it was so cool seeing how different the vibes were! The space is completely transformed with a really nice bar with a good selection of interesting wines.

The smash burger was really tasty (the sauce is pretty sweet but it goes well with the charred patty) but I think the pizza is definitely more stand out. We got the truffle honey as well which I think is a must -- it was really amazing with the crispy pepperoni and cheesy caramelized crust.

The staff is also incredibly fun and friendly and overall this place is such a local gem, I can already see myself being a regular here (it's worth the trek!)

First time. Ordered to go. Wait time was around 20ish minutes.
Pizza is the rectangle cut style and more of a focaccia/bread type than your traditional pizza. Lots of cheese, not dense, airy center, lots of mushrooms and filled w/ flavor.
The Gem Caesar Salad was a bit disappointing as it was more plain in taste and tossed with croutons and cheese crisps.
Overall, a good meal for the first time.

Make sure to get here early if you don't want to wait for a table. The interior is beautifully decorated, full of plants and records while the bar stacked with collection of wines. Would recommend a wine shot if you're curious about what to get. At $5 a shot you can taste test a sample at a relatively low cost.

The pizzas here come with that crispy edge and glorious crunch. Square pan pizza is definitely a heavier meal but the fresh toppings and honey drizzle make for a lighter flavor. Our table of 4 ordered 2 pizzas and a salad to share.

The kale salad was refreshing and a good break from all the carbs. However we would have loved to see the kale a bit more massaged and dressed. The mushroom combo pizza was the star of the night. Not often we opt for a white sauce pizza but the sauce complimented the mushrooms making for a rich flavor. We did note that the mushroom pizza did come with a heavy sprinkling of parsley so if you're not a fan magnet ask for it on the side.

Definitely opt for the honey as it adds a sweet kick to each bite! The meatball pizza came with a good amount of toppings and the fresh burrata made for a creamy bite. Each pizza comes with 6 pieces and piping hot out of the oven. Perfect for sharing and sampling different flavors.

Will be back for more crispy edges and wine!

I've been wanting to come here for a few months.  Finally came here around 10:30am on Good Friday.  Not too many bagels left this late in the morning but we still got pumpernickel everything, salt bagel, plain everything and a couple drip coffees.  We already had cream cheese at home so we didn't buy any of their
made-in-house flavored cream cheese.

First up, the bagels!  The bagels are great - nice crust with perfectly chewy interior.  I think the pumpernickel everything is my favorite here.  Great balance of rye flavor and some sweetness.  We had it with cream cheese - both plain and toasted.  Both were great.  Salt bagel was my second flavor because that's something I haven't had in a long time.

Second, the coffee.  It's self service, and there are packets of sugar and other sweeteners, small jugs of oatmeal, cake and half and half.  It was perfect!  I really appreciate that. They have reusable spoons to store your coffee. They have a glass for putting into used spoons.

There's no place to eat here for Bagels. You bring it home. That worked perfectly for us.

We were so intrigued by this place, that we came back later that day.  We ordered the kale salad, brussels sprouts, and Detroit style cheese pizza. We also had some drinks. Everything was so great! Such an asset to the neighborhood. I'll definitely be back!

A shout out to Jamie who helped us with the bagels in the morning. She was very helpful!

Wait was 30min+ for party of 2 but there is bar seating that you can snatch! Hostess that seated was super sweet though

Mushroom Pizza was so delish and perfectly crisp. The white sauce was great with the mushrooms & as someone who doesn't love too much umami the honey truffle dip was not for me.
Brussel sprouts were also quite addicting, def recommend getting.

It definitely is little loud with the music but overall it was vibey and fun spot with nice lights and retro decor.
Best Pizza! Great service! We come every time in SF we even drive 2 hours just to eat and head home!

From the Coccoli, Meatballs, Drinks, Pizza, and Dessert, the best experience we've had in a long time! Caesar was a great Server! Very comfortable and pleasing atmosphere! Will definitely be one of our new places to visit for our annual anniversary trip!

Looking for an amazing pizza and watering hole in SFO... well look no further Yelpers.

TPN has an amazing pie with a fully stacked bar to wash down the pie of your choice. Trust me when I say you can't go wrong with Tony's.

So let it be written.... So let it be EATEN!!

We came here early for a dinner on Friday, and it was already very crowded. I definitely recommend joining the Yelp waitlist ahead of time, since the wait can get quite long. They were very nice and willing to move us to a table inside after we were seated outside. However, once we were seated we had to wait around 20 minutes for a waitress to come by, after waiting an hour to be seated, and had to ask other waiters and the hostess if they knew who our waitress was for someone to come take our order.

We got the margherita pizza, tiramisu, and a few drinks. The pizza was really good. The tomatoes stood out in the sauce and it tasted very fresh. The strawberry lemonade was also one of the best I've had. The tiramisu was also quite good. It is on the more expensive side though, especially the pizza for the size that we received.

Overall, we will definitely be coming again for a date night or an occasion, and would love to try out the other pizzas.

I tried the famous Margarita Pizza from Tony's.
It was no where close to the hype, it was very very average.
It was served cold instead of right out of the oven.
I am shocked that they have won so many awards, it was really disappointing experience.

This place was definitely an interesting find for me in SF, food is great.
Service needs some work, I know its one of the busiest restaurants in North Shore or North Beach sorry I'm from LA, but I will say the waiter we had needed to work a little better to be present for our table!
But I would give it another try next time I am in town!
The pizza was amazing! New Yorker  was our favorite!

This is basically an institution in the city. It is always busy. And way more busy than any other Italian restaurant nearby. They have like 10 different pizza styles, many award winning. I ordered their 3 most popular pizzas. Ranked from favorite

1. Classic Italian style 12" - Cal Italia $30: good. Very unique combination of flavors. Sweet. Salty. Not my usual flavor combo but it worked well. Semi firm crust
2. Coal fired style 15-16" - New Yorker $35: decent. Basically an all meat pizza. This was the crispiest/firmest of all the crusts. Wish it had some veggies
3. Napoletana style 12" - Margherita $26: ok. What you'd expect. Very thin and limp crust

Overall, their all solid. Just depends on your preference for pizza style. You can taste the quality. The new Yorker was the bigger of the 3, other 2 were basically personal size. Their all thin crust so 1 pizza is definitely doable for males

Extensive wine menu of both California and European wines. Beer list is average, limited with some crafts.

Service was ok. Not bad, not great. Took 10 mins or so after being seated before the server came and water was brought out. Food didn't take too long to come out, but depends on the pizza style you order. Some take longer than others

They have indoor and outdoor seating. No reservations but they have a yelp wait list. Wait list for a time earlier than you plan to sit. It took an extra 45 mins past my scheduled sit down time to actually get seated. So in total, 1 hr 45 min wait for Sunday dinner time. Overall, it's good, but didn't blow my mind or make me want to go back soon. Good pizza is everywhere

This is best Margherita pizza I've ever had, and it's in San Francisco. And I just got back from Italy. Tony's Margherita pizza won the world pizza cup in Naples, Italy, AND was the first American and non Neapolitan to win this coveted award in Naples, the birthplace of modern pizza. The tomato sauce, mozzarella, and dough are all insanely flavorful, with a chewy texture but in the best way. We also tried the New Yorker - my boyfriend preferred the dough on this one due to the crisped edges. Pro tip: Top your pizza with the hot oil for an extra kick.

I normally don't like even like a floppy curst but I don't even care because the tomato sauce was insanely flavorful, the mozzarella was the perfect texture and the dough was super flavorful as well and chewy but in the best way.

If that's not your jam, Tony's has a long list of different pizzas, many which have won awards.

OMG- this pizza was to die for!!!!

My husband is gluten free and pizza is usually such a drag. The " usual" gf crusts are thin like crackers and have no flavor or are made from Cauliflower - which hubby can't eat anymore.

This menu was so amazing because you could have several different types of pizzas ( American, Detroit, etc.) w/ a gf crust. Our waiter recommended the Detroit crust- which by the way is one of our favorites from when hubby could eat wheat .
This Detroit gf crust was by far the BEST gf crust we have ever had. The crust resembled the traditional Detroit crust being thick,soft and slightly chewy on the inside and crispy on the bottom. We added fresh ricotta and sausage to the tomato sauce and mozzarella laden pizza.
It was smaller than normal but still was filling. We also experienced the Caesar salad with white anchovies and that was delicious too!

The wait for a table was on the longer side in the middle of the day Saturday but so well worth it. Can't wait to try the Tony's  slice house near us when it opens! ( unfortunately hubby will just have to watch me eat since they won't have this amazing crust anywhere but in North Beach location

Friends in SF really recommended Tony's so it was a must for dinner. We walked by Tony's during the day and it was super busy and packed. You can tell this place is a city favorite no matter what time of day it is.

We were a group of 5 and we were all pretty hungry. We waited about an hour or so and we're seated outside. We ordered the Spicy Grandma, New Yorker, and Honey Pie. We were actually recommended the Honey Pie by the server when we wanted a third pizza. My gosh, the pizzas here are amazing. They are cooked so well and have so much flavor!! It's so hard to pick a favorite out of the three. I'd say the only down side is the pizzas are pretty pricy. It's not a pizza you would have every single day. I will say it's something you should definitely try though if you're in the are!

Giorgio's pizza is one of my neighborhood favorites. We regularly get the amazing pizza and Chicken Parm.

The chicken parm tastes and looks authentic. A little bit steep tho ($18+).

The pizza is pretty good but also overpriced.

Overall for me, this deserves 4 stars.

Needed a quick and nearby bite after we left Golden Gate Park and everyone wanted pizza. Happy we found this spot. The parking is easy and we found a spot quickly but it is metered.

We were seated quickly and ordered the garlic bread in addition to pizza which was yummy. My daughter kept commenting on the mural on the wall which she really enjoyed. The ambiance was really nice here and the service was great too! It was kinda chilly inside and tried to eat quickly to get into the car with heat.

Overall I would definitely some back and be prepared with some layers if we decide to dine in again. Especially because my family visiting from
NY approved this pizza lol! They said it was yummy!

We've tried many and I think Giorgio's Pizzeria has the best pizza in the city.

Perfect crust with a slight amount of char and a good chew, a just-right amount of sauce and cheese and generous toppings.

All the pizzas are hand tossed and many items must be family recipes.

We've been coming to Giorgio's since my son was three and now that we're getting back in the swing of San Francisco life, dining out is at the top of the list.

My son absolutely raved about the meatball cheese ravioli with meat sauce. I had a bite and it was delicious, very savory.

The best endorsement comes from our picky neighbor who reads a menu like a Chekhov novel (and takes about as long to decide!)

We picked up an eggplant parmigiana sandwich as requested and she texted me high praise:

"That was phenomenal!  The eggplant was cut in perfectly thin slices...and the sandwich was not overloaded with sauce...I could taste the cheese and eggplant. Wow, now I'm hooked!"

Gluten free crusts, vegetarian items, pizzas laden with sausage and pepperoni for meat-lovers. They have many specialty toppings to suit every taste.

And, don't forget the specialty plates of manicotti, ravioli, lasagna, antipasti and more.

Note:
Giorgio's has a brisk takeaway business through the front window until 8pm with the dining room open 'til 7 (Fri/Sa until 3).

We've been to Giorgio's a few years back when the crust was thicker.  My bf worked here years ago and still remembers how the pizza used to be.  What happened?  It looks like round table pizza took over??  The crust doesn't look homemade or made fresh.  And the pizza is perfectly round!  Also the inside looks somewhat renovated or painted.  Nothing wrong with fixing the restaurant but if they're cutting corners due to the cost of repainting, they should have left it as is!  Service was average.  If you're bringing kids to this restaurant, I guess they wouldn't know the difference.  Adults who have had good and great pizza, this will pale in comparison.

If you are a True native San Franciscan or are new to San Francisco and raising a family in the San Francisco Inner Richmond or Presidio Heights, Giorgios is YOUR pizzeria.  Yes there are new-fangled pizzerias like Amici's, Tony's Slice House which I love but we are talking about Tommasso's , Gaspar's and Pasquales level neighborhood pizzerias.  

Although it became a takeout only pizza joint during Covid, they did a 50 year old remodel and although much is different as they just reopened their new dining room it just feels good to be back.

They have reopened their dining room hours til 7pm for their soft reopening.  Menu is the same but visually updated, entrance is now on Clement and  not on the corner.  Seating area has three fewer booths but appears to cater to more  big groups, although capacity seems lower.

The pizza crust seems slightly different, but if you are nostalgic for your childhood pizza, this place will bring back memories.  Came back to the restaurant with my kids who were home for the holidays and they did seem to still feel at home, so that is a good sign.

My girlfriend lives right around the corner and every time we are ENTICED by the smell of pizza coming from here. Didn't end up getting pizza this time around but we did manage to grab some of their garlic bread with pesto to eat with our pasta tonight and it really did outshine our whole dinner haha. I would suggest ordering online or calling in for pickup so you can save yourself some time waiting. WILL DEFINITELY be trying their pizza next time I visit!

It's 4:30 PM.  I went in to get a couple slices and they told me they "don't sell slices after 4 o'clock"  Are you kidding me ? You're a pizza restaurant and you don't sell slices ?? Give me a break;  will never be going back. I've been going there for 25 years. I'll just add this to another casualty of how horrible this city has gotten .. Truly sad.

Well done

Was in the city and started looking around to find the closest pizza spot from Golden Gate Park. We ordered a medium size half and half of  Giorgio's Special Pizza and Lasagnean with 6 pieces of wings, honestly thought it was way too overpriced but the expectations were high so I was okay with it.. The pizza crust was soggy afand the meat was undercooked just plain DISAPPOINTED. Should've gone to our local Mountain Mikes down in Oakland and bet the pizza crust would've been still fresh once we make it to the park. Sorry not sorry

After ordering from Georgio's for over 30 years it is really obnoxious to have to order on line only. Really? You can't pay someone to answer the phone anymore then I will find another pizza place that still has phone service.

I went to this place once in my life & will never again.  Imagine it's you & your struggling mother & you're hungry & you come across a pizzeria.  You've got just enough money to split a slice of cheese pizza.  The waitress is disgruntled, maybe assuming she will not get a small tip or none at all or maybe doesn't like who or what you are...Then she brings you the slice and sneezes it on it intentionally.  I'm sure that having a business located in SF will make it easy to smile & give good customer these days.  I just went through the pictures and think I saw her old, dusty ass still working here ‍ .  This is an experience I had here that I will remember for the rest of my life.  Do yourselves a favor & buy a frozen pizza or go around the corner to Geary, you'll find something better, including fast food.

One of if not the best Italian restaurant I have ever been to. The food is amazing from the pasta to the pizza just amazing. The service is wonderful. The waitress was very helpful and joyful. Overall ten out of ten.

Pizza pizza pizza! North beach has tons of options it can be a little overwhelming but make it easy just come to Il Casaro and get a pizza. They also have pasta and other small bites.

I am trying to work my way through the menu. Can confirm the Margherita, Calabrese, and Diavola are all great!

Try to get a reservation as the restaurant isn't huge and will get busy at peak times. Ambience is great for families, friends, maybe a casual date night.

Fast, efficient, service was perfect!
Wanted quality Italian food and this spot was a bullseye.
Pizza was fabulous. Crust was thin, toppings fit perfectly. We got the prosciutto pizza 19.75$ was cooked in a red pizza oven. And all dishes came out pretty quick and all together.
The lasagna Bianca was the least of our favorites. Was just too much cheese on top of a béchamel cheese sauce. Didn't have much flavor, just a piece of pasta layered in greasy cheese.
Bucatini was our fav, thick spaghetti noodles, great flavor, and cooked Al dente.
Had a fun experience here at Il Casaro, will definitely be back.

The food was really good, as was the house red wine, though the service was sometimes lacking.

(And I resent what too many restaurants call a "SF Mandate Fee" --- these restaurants are required to provide healthcare for their workers or pay a fee, just as there are other requirements for businesses, including rent, insurance, electricity, wages, etc., but they are not required to charge that fee to customers, as they seem to imply.)

One of the best pizza's I've ever had in my LIFE.
The margherita pizza (with extra basil) was so fresh and fluffy. They give you 3 types of chili to add on the side. Would highly recommend the chili oil. Out of this world. Will be back.

If you're looking for an authentic Italian dining experience that will transport you back to Naples, Il Casaro is a must-visit.

We started out with the Insalata Romana salad and the Asparagi - both excellent. The star of the show is their Nepalese-style pizza - we ordered the Bufilana ($19).  If you are craving Hawaiian, keep walking. For the record, I like Hawaiian pizza.
