We were lucky enough to get a seat right by the pizza oven where the pizzas are prepared right in front of you, adding an extra layer of entertainment to our dining experience. I must stay, the two guys preparing the pizzas were amazing. We saw only one pizza get trashed due to an extended stay in the oven the entire time we were there.

Their al dente pastas are perfectly cooked with fantastic flavor.  We ordered the Carbonara ($18) with I would totally recommend. And on the beverage front, they have an impressive selection of wines and some great beers on tap. When in Rome, order a Peroni ($6) - we did.

No big negatives other than the service is too fast. Yep, not my usual complaint but we were barely halfway done with our salad when the pizza and pasta arrived. We had to quickly drop our salad forks in order to enjoy the piping hot pizza and pasta. Also, on weekends, you may encounter a wait for a table as they don't take reservations. Once seated, be prepared for a lively atmosphere, as the restaurant tends to get a bit noisy. But that's all part of the charm - right?.

Il Casaro is a true taste of Naples in the middle of North Beach. The incredible Nepalese-style pizza, and fantastic al dente pastas make it a standout Italian restaurant.

I was really looking forward to this place after reading the reviews, but it didn't live up to my expectations. :(

Not sure if we happened to get a bad serving of carbonara, but it was lukewarm and barely any sauce or taste. It mostly felt like I was eating boiled pasta. On the other hand the prosciutto pizza was pretty good! But it wasn't anything spectacular either.

The service and ambiance were both average.

My favorite pizza in North Beach! Went at opening and immediately seated inside by the window. Inside feels casual and trendy. Here I love the pizza and the 3 spice options for you spicy lovers. You get your choice of Calabrian chili oil, whole peppers, and chili flakes. I basically use all of those on my pizza because it tastes so good together!

The usual for me is the mortadella pizza. Not a common one that you find elsewhere and it's paired deliciously with pistachio. Once I finish the pizza I like to kinda dip some of the leftover crust with the oil from the chili peppers. Tastes amazing! The lasagna bolognese reminds me of homemade pasta in Italy. Great spot if you are local or tourist!

Oh man, my boyfriend and I were visiting from LA and super excited to try Il Casaro after all of the amazing reviews we saw. To our surprise, we actually left really underwhelmed!

We ordered the Imported Burrata, Beet Salad, and Il Casaro pizza. Here are my thoughts on the food:

-The Imported Burrata was probably my favorite of the 3. The burrata was rich and had a nice touch of olive oil and salt/pepper. The pizza dough that came with it was yummy. The arugula was slightly over salted but tasted fine when paired with the cheese and bread.

-The beet salad was disappointing. We felt it lacked flavor, and the beets and walnuts completely carried the salad! In fact, I felt like I had to get some of either in each bite otherwise the greens sometimes tasted bitter. There wasn't enough goat cheese in our salad for that to be a substantial flavor (sucks bc I love goat cheese!!)

-The Il Casaro Pizza was honestly just very *okay*. Again, flavor was really lacking. The pizza crust tasted good, and I felt like there was potential in the dough, but then the pizza itself was soggy.

Some other notes and things to keep in mind:

-The hosts and waiters were really friendly and brought out our food really fast! But, it took a while to get our check even though the restaurant wasn't busy because workers clearing things as if closing (they don't close till 11 and it was around 9:30).

TLDR; all our food lacked flavor but this place seems to have a great reputation based on past reviews. I'm hoping we just had an off experience otherwise I question everyone's taste buds

My friend and I came in Friday 8pm and waited a little because the host had to seat a few bigger groups before us. They have a few outdoor seatings and plenty of seating indoor as well. We sat at the counter facing the kitchen where we can see the chefs assemble the pizza and put them into the oven. The place was relatively loud with the music in the background and all the other customers talking but I didn't mind it.

We shared the il Casaro pizza and the lasagna bolognese. Both were delicious! The pizza was airy and flavorful. They also gave us chili oil and chili peppers for the pizza but we didn't use it. The lasagna was pretty big portion and moist.

I ordered this for delivery, so I can not speak to the service or ambiance. However, I wanted to leave a review here for how much I enjoyed their pizza.

I want to preface this by saying I'm a bit of a pizza snob and have not had the best experience finding pizza shops since moving to the bay. With that being said, I really love both the sausage and peppers pizza, as well as the Margherita. The ratio of crust to sauce to cheese was perfect for an east-coaster like myself.

The sausage and peppers pizza really wowed me with exciting flavors that worked well on a classic pie. The Margherita wasn't as memorable, but I still enjoyed the slice.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this place and will certainly be checking out their shop in person!

One of the best pizzas I've had in San Francisco over the course of three decades. So much that I limit my carb cycles to this place amongst a few others that are inclusive of pinsa restaurants as well.

I probably only have pizza once a month and the two most recent times were at this place and I live on a street with two renown pizza places within walking distance. It's that good and worth it.

The thin crispy texture is consistent down to the crust. Great flavors combinations and traditional ones with fresh grated condiments which is a rare feature.

Awesome staff as well. Definitely worth a visit.

Outta Sight Pizza has the best NY style slices in the City. After Arniell Pizza closed, I've been looking all over for a good slice, and Outta Sight has the best. As others have said, the crust is outstanding - crisp and light, almost like a cracker, but still slightly moist in the center, and it folds nicely down the middle.

I had a sausage slice and a cheese slice and both were excellent, although I probably would have liked a little more sauce on them.

The service was very friendly, and they had 6 different pizzas to choose from. The shop is super clean and is a nice oasis compared to the surrounding area.  The neighborhood is rather rough, even by SF standards, so exercise caution if you walk there.

Visited on a Saturday around 12pm, slight line to order but wasn't too long of a wait. A selection of about 8 different pies that are ready to heat and eat, as well as a few specials like asparagus and crab topped pizza.

Food: Mushroom Pizza Slice - great crust, crisp bottom with a nice chewy texture, stretchy mozzarella cheese and thin slices of mushrooms topped the pizza along with fresh basil and parmesan cheese for garnish

Service was good, quick order at the counter and wait for your name to be called. Once I put my order in it took less than 5 min before it was ready.

Overall, great spot for a quick slice of thin crust pizza. It definitely reminded me of New York slice shops, happy to see this new addition to SF. Would definitely come back to try the other pizzas, the special in particular sounded really interesting.

loooove their happy hour!! $8 drink and the salty dog was yummy! love the salted rims :)

meatballs and pizza were delish. bfs go to is the hot salami and it's one of his faves in the city. tried the pizetta (mini) of the prosciutto di Parma and it was one a white sauce that i really enjoyed. subtle tasting but blends well with the rest of the ingredients!

If you're looking for authentic Italian cuisine, look no further than this restaurant. The pasta was cooked to perfection, the sauces were rich and flavorful, and the desserts were to die for. I can't recommend this place enough!

Regenerate response

This is THE pizza spot

These picks were great:
-Margarita pizza w 2 eggs
-prosciutto di parma pizza

Finally got to try this place for happy hour! They have pizzettas for $10 and other little spots. We came here coz whenever I come to sf I always have Italian! Last time dinner was so fabulous I made a point to come back to try out their happy hour. The Pizzetta was Perfect for one! Brought along my colleague  we each got one! However we noticed when we sat down the menu was different than what was posted outside! Told the bartender and he thanked us for letting him know, he relayed the information to one of the managers and the kind manager offered us a the funghi Pizzetta on the house!
Will definitely be back on the next biz trip!

yeah this is some GOOD pizza! I got a slice of pepperoni and it was nice and crispy and full of flavor. The Brussels sprouts were also amazing and had a slight curry flavor which was amazing, the peanuts were a nice touch too!
Overall it's a really cute restaurant in a slightly sketchy area, but definitely worth a try!

Best pizzas, variety, high-quality ingredients, and the staff are perfectionist. Yoder's take real pride, and the pies they make his south and haven't still that in the stuff as well. They always have the highest quality ingredients reasonable prices.  try the loaded " lunch lady"
And they have decent wines and beer as well

I don't say this lightly, and I am aware I am going to make a big statement here... but Outta Sight might be the best Pizza in San Francisco. Yes the neighborhood isn't great but maybe that will help mitigate some of the foot traffic that would lead to some crazy lines. This place is also relatively new so the hype is still building. They do mostly slices and have plenty of types. The way they prep the dough leads to a fluffy and light pizza that looks much heavier than it really is. This type of prep is not common amongst most pizza places. The fresh parm and the oil they put on after it comes out of the oven is just the accelerator to the flavor profile. The flavor profile that's coming fast and furious to smack you in the mouth. Find a better classic slice pizza joint. I dare you.
(4.9 Stars)

Saw this on Tiktok in celebration of AAPI month and had to try it immediately! We tried the mushroom pizza, pesto and the Madonna - all were so good but our favorites were the Madonna and pesto. We want to go back to try more. The crust was nice and crispy. It's very reminiscent of L'Industrie Pizza in Brooklyn NY! Servers were very friendly and kind. It's a nice relaxed little pizza shop. I will brave the Civic center area just to come back to this place!

A classic staple in the Marina. Solid happy hour, good food and friendly staff. While all of that is nice, what you really need to come for is the people watching, you never know who's going to stroll by lol. If you're out and about in the area, you'll definitely have to swing by for happy hour.

Really great vibes and ambience both inside and outside!

First time here after passing by it so many times and happy we chose this spot for lunch as they have a lot of options and serve paninis from 11am-3pm.

They have different types of spritzes and the server was very helpful in recommending what to get! I opted for the other spritz they had.

Very tasty meal and pasta (Fusilli with porcini, parmesan, pork) was definitely a "I would get this again!"

You really can't go wrong with the classics. Delarosa is definitely a San Francisco staple for a casual night owl or a casual date spot. The food is well done and it's served pretty quickly. The service is really great considering the fact that everyone dies in a communal style on Long bunches.

It creates a nice ambience because it feels like you're dining with a big community. I personally love getting the margarita pizza because it's just simple, not overly salty, and you get to really taste each of the individual ingredients. The pasta was also really good. It is a little bit on the salty your side, so it pairs nicely with a sweet cocktail.

They also have really great appetizers like the burrata toast, and flash fried cauliflower

Price: $
Overall: 9/10
Must get: any of the pizzas or pastas

This is a safe, casual choice for a date night or dinner with friends/family. Delarosa has a solid list of pizzas and pastas for everyone.

I prefer their outdoor seating to their indoor seating. They have a big parklet out front with a roof and heat lamps, and each table is partitioned off for privacy. I've eaten outside in the rain with friends, and we stayed warm and completely dry. The downside of their indoor seating is that most tables are communal. It can be tough to have a conversation across the table if you're seated next to a loud-ish group.

I like their rotating pizza menu, which is bolstered by a few great staples. I always get the spicy fennel sausage pizza, and when they offer the bartender pizza -- burrata and sausage -- I order that as well. One pizza is filling enough for one very hungry person or two mildly hungry people. Their appetizers are also great. I've tried the crispy cauliflower with capers and the fried brussel sprouts with lemon aioli, and both were very good.

Expect to wait a while for a table on Friday or Saturday night. To trim down the waiting period, get on the Yelp waitlist 10-15 minutes before you arrive.

Outta Sight Pizza was my favorite slice from a recent trip to San Fran. As an out-of-towner, I can't say I felt terribly comfortable walking through the surrounding neighborhood to get to this pizza spot. Nevertheless, I survived and got to try some fantastic pizza. This is a fairly nondescript pizza shop with a handful of tables and a small standing area. There were a lot of good-looking pies in the case, but I went with a classic pepperoni slice. When the slice came out, I knew it was much more than a basic pepperoni slice. It was thin and crispy with fresh basil and freshly grated cheese on top. The crust was cooked perfectly, and the flavors were divine. The ambience is a casual, no-frills pizza shop. They have a jug of water if you want to hydrate while dining in. My slice was fired up in less than 5 minutes, and I probably scarfed it down in half that time. This is incredible pizza, but I wouldn't personally walk here alone at night to grab a slice.

I'm not a pizza aficionado, but I love me a good slice of pizza/pie!  Pizzas are not overly salty and greasy as many joints can tend to be.  I thoroughly enjoyed the Orchard (Mmx of mushrooms, mushroom cream, mozz, honey and basil whole pie only) AND the party wings (garlic + lemon pepper) with their house made ranch.  Wing places often are super salty and fried to death, but not here.  Juicy tender wings that weren't overcooked and seasoned well. Will definitely keep coming back.

Service was good, serve yourself water, napkins, hot sauce, chili pepper, etc. Hip hop music, patrons are laid back and willing to open up their table for you. Love it.

Many people have mention the location and yeah it's not great. Welcome to downtown SF, in particular near the Civic Center/Tenderloin area!   As always, drive and park safe, be kind and respectful of others and enjoy the food!

Outstanding ,lovely homemade style food,great service friendly and helpful.
A must visit restaurant.
Great food but nothing exceptional. The portion of appetisers was very small to be worth the price.
We are there twice in four days- Spring Salad and the Big Von were family favs! Easy ordering online and super quick pickup!

This is my friend's favorite pizza place and it's easy to see why.

We went on a Thursday so it wasn't busy, we were seated immediately and the server was very courteous. I ordered the Ellen Supreme pizza which was vodka sauce, pepperoni, italian sausage, onion, pickled peppers, and mushroom medley.

I loved the taste of it. Everything went together so well. The ingredients tasted fresh. And the dough was a nice crispy outside with a warm soft inside.

Ambiance here is very casual. No need to dress up.. Just a great spot to take anyone for some great quality pizza!

My favorite go to spot in SF!
My favorite is the Cherry tomato Pesto
And Pepperoni Pizza
But quite frankly all Pies are great!

Great location with lots of indoor and outdoor seating. The space is well-lit with natural light and the decorations are minimalistic but welcoming! The staff are friendly and attentive even thought it was quite busy. Orders are placed at the table by scanning the QR code. After placing the order, the staff came by with plates and glasses for water. Loved the option to get either still or sparkling water!

We ordered:

The Big Von- the deep dish pizza had a crunchy crust while the center was soft and doughy, great combination of textures! They're pretty generous with the honey, so it was sweeter than I liked. Didn't find many pieces of pepperoni but it had lots of cheese. Portions are shareable among 2 ppl, but a bit pricey for pizza.

Hot Honey Wings- the wings were saucy but still crunchy! The sweet and savory flavors blended well and didn't feel like it was too sweet. The other flavors of wings sounded good too so def recommend getting a side of wings!

Overall, good place to try if you're in the area! Well-lit place with great music selection and friendly staff. Parking is metered, but a bit tricky to find. Would recommend trying this place if you want a unique pizza experience!

I've had this place bookmarked for awhile and was in the area so decided to try it / got takeout.

Szechuan Wings ($14.50) - very small wings! Loved the flavor but the chicken was so so dry.  I think they over fried the wings. I was super disappointed as the 6 wings were $14.50. I did love the green goddess dressing!

How Mush-Room ($22.75) - I love mushrooms so this got my attention. The white sauce didn't have enough flavor so the pizza was a little bland. The pizza dough was fluffy and soft while the edges were super crispy.

Ellen Supreme ($26.30) - super flavorful! The pepperonis and sausage added so much flavor and the vodka sauce helped bring some acidity to the oily meats. The pepperoni was good but a little burnt. Out of the two pizzas, this one had more flavor. I would get this again.

I recently had the pleasure of visiting Square Pie Guy, and let me tell you, it was an amazing experience from start to finish! This place has quickly become my go-to spot for deep dish pizza in town, and I can't recommend it enough.

First and foremost, let's talk about the star of the show--the deep dish pizza. Wow! It was absolutely delicious. The crust was perfectly crispy on the outside and wonderfully doughy on the inside, just the way a deep dish pizza should be. The combination of cheese, sauce, and toppings was simply heavenly. Each bite was bursting with flavor, and the generous portions left me feeling fully satisfied. Square Pie Guy definitely knows how to make a remarkable deep dish pizza!

Aside from the phenomenal pizza, Square Pie Guy also offers an array of awesome sides. I tried their buffalo wings and asparagus and they were a delightful addition to the meal. Warm, buttery, and infused with just the right amount of buffalo sauce, these wings were absolute perfection. The sides here are a great complement to the main event and elevate the overall dining experience.

One aspect that sets Square Pie Guy apart is the great music they play. The ambiance of the place was enhanced by the fantastic tunes playing in the background. The music selection was diverse, with a mix of genres that catered to various tastes. It created a lively and enjoyable atmosphere that added an extra layer of enjoyment to my meal.

Moreover, the service at Square Pie Guy was outstanding. The staff was friendly, attentive, and genuinely passionate about their food. They were happy to provide recommendations and make sure my dining experience was exceptional. The attention to detail and customer satisfaction truly stood out.

Overall, Square Pie Guy exceeded my expectations on all fronts. The deep dish pizza was phenomenal, the sides were delicious, and the music added a fantastic touch to the ambiance. I left with a happy heart and a full belly, eagerly looking forward to my next visit. If you're a pizza lover, this place is an absolute must-try!

Somebody from Texas was raving about the Mexican food in San Francisco. I've heard Texas has good Mexican food, being so close to Mexico. And I know San Francisco's Mission District is renowned for Mexican food. So I figured that I could trust his cuisinely opinions.

"What's the best food in all of San Francisco?" I quizzed.

He thought about it while licking his lips, his eyes darting about the sky.

"We had this pizza," he started slowly, "that was like pizza in it's purest form"

"What is the purest form of pizza?" I squawked, perplexed.

"Oh," he pondered, "You can have regular pizza, or New York Deep dish, or Chicago deep dish, or Boston style deep dish..."

My interest was piqued.

"But this is just like, just the right amount of toppings. The perfect crust. The perfect sauce. It was just right."

He didn't describe it too much besides that, but it was nearing lunch, so I drove 25 minutes to go halfway across San Francisco and try it out.

Two parking spots were available exactly across the street. The sun was shining. People were smiling. It was meant to be.

If you want a slice of pizza, go here.
If you want a good variety of choices, go here.
If you're really hungry, it's fast and it's cheap enough to get a few slices.
If you just want a snack, it's not weighed down by too many toppings.
If you want to sit and eat, there are several tables.
If you want to eat and walk, it comes on a paper plate.

Since we're talking perfection, I'd prefer the crust to be slightly less crunchy; I'd prefer there to be slightly less cheese, and slightly more toppings and sauce.

The bathroom is super clean.
Service is friendly and fast.

I wish my neighborhood in Richmond, CA had a pizza-by-the-slice place like this.

If you choose to give a thumbs-up  or not, I hope you found my review helpful!

This spot is a real gem. You can do a pie or by the slice. Slices start at $5.
I have literally bought a slice 3 days in a row and did not disappoint each time.
I stick to pepperoni or pepperoni and mushroom. My partner loves the meat option.
Each slice is thin, exceptional crunch. Not greasy. Every bite has the perfect amount of red sauce, toppings and cheese.
The whole pie (18") is reasonably price for less than $30.
Honestly, it's a great spot. I can't say how much I love it. They are also available on DoorDash which is convenient.

Great pizza! But they forgot my meatballs when I paid for it so one star off. Recommend the spinach pizza and asked for more garlic and wish the garlic chunks were bigger, but still was delicious. Friendly staff

I had the best SALAD here! If you're looking for something to eat that isn't pizza, then try their salads because their chilled bowl salad blew me away - highly recommend. I, on the other hand, do not really recommend their hot wings. We got the hot honey wings and they were poorly made. Wayyyy too much honey and it didn't quite stick to the wings for some reason. There was honey all over the plate. Pizza is here and there. I always enjoy how square pizzas have that cheesy, crispy edge. I love that they're open late compared to a lot of places in Ghirardelli square. They also serve drinks, so it's a nice place to chill for a bit, especially if you sit by the window!

I was today years old when I found out that Detroit style pizza is the best pizza. But Square Pie Guys doesn't just do delicious pizza, they also have amazing salads and wings.

Pros:
- 2 words: cupping pepperoni
- Satisfyingly thick, yet fluffy crust with a crispy, cheesy edge
- The chicken wings are flavorful and juicy
- The Chilled Bowl Salad is a top tier salad. Add chicken for $4 and you have a full meal
- Gluten free options galore. The gluten free crust is among the best I've ever had

Cons:
- I wish more customization was possible, I would love to order a half and half pizza
- It gets pricey to Create Your Own pizza. 1 meat + 1 veggie comes to $25.75
- The music at the Ghirardelli location is so loud you can't hear yourself think, but maybe I'm just an old lady

Overall, a great experience and I can't wait to go back.

Located at Ghirardelli square on the first floor.

I orders online and picked it up at the counter. The pizza took 15 mins and it was ready! Super quick!

There is indoor and outdoor seating. We sat outdoors with the dogs and enjoyed our pizza with a partial view of the ocean. The tables are next to the street but it wasn't too busy.

The pizza was amazing! I loved the  MUSH-O-RONI
(red sauce, mushroom medley, pepperoni, calabrian hot honey, grana cheese, parsley). This is a perfect sweet and savory pizza! The honey was surprisingly sooo good. The pizza was not too greasy abs the crust was crispy and pillowy.

I LOVE Detroit pizza. It's my favorite style because ya girl likes her crusts thick. Some people will say it's too doughy but I'd argue that Square Pie Guys has got their crust down, especially with their crispy bottoms!!

I've had the Ellen Supreme at a different location before, but wanted to try something new so got the Spicy Pep and The Big Von. Their pizzas are quite expensive for the portion they give, and my one qualm with them is that the pizzas on their menu lack creativity and variety, in my opinion. I feel like the majority of their pizzas feel and taste very similar to each other, and there's a lot of room for them to expand on their premade combinations. I still think I like the Ellen Supreme the best out of the ones I've tried -- it's probably their most well-rounded pizza.

This location is probably the best one in terms of aesthetics and for those who want to dine it. It's clean and has a lot of room both indoors and outdoors. I came by to dine in around lunch time on Saturday and there surprisingly weren't very many people there, so the wait was pretty short.

You never really know when they will be open. Justifiable boasting about quality of pizza. I like a crispy crust myself.

Unlike many by the slice places this one is clean and shiny. Pizza case sparkles and pies are clearly labelled. I went safe with pepperoni and mushroom but there many vegetarian temptations.

Special shout out: everything is compostable including cups and straws. Snaps for that.

Ordered the Garlic and Spinach Pizza and a half cheese half pepperoni pizza. First of all, love how much the food is for the price, good bang for the buck. Second, the garlic and spinach pizza had my whole group coming for seconds, truly possibly one of the most delicious slices i have ever had. The cheese/pepperoni was solid, but not anything life changing but still incredible. 2 pizzas was plenty for our group of 5, we had so much left over. We ordered takeout for this through DoorDash, but everything was properly received!

Pizza here is solid and about as close to NY style as you can get in SF. The have plenty of toppings to choose from... I love getting it with spinach, onions, cherry peppers and garlic.

Service is great too!

I ordered 6 pizzas from The Pizza Shop this past Thursday via Doordash for a post-soccer practice dinner for my 4 year old and her friends (and their families).  The pizzas were fresh and flavorful and arrived on time.  I appreciated the reasonable prices and the ability to customize on the Doordash app (I was successfully able to order a cheese-less pizza for my husband using the app, which was convenient).  It looks like they only sell extra large pizzas, which was unexpected - I appreciate how they're keeping things simple, but it would have been useful to have more sizes to choose from.
Great pizza, I had a kids birthday party and they were really accommodating and puntual. I picked up  and order the day before. Thanks The Pizza Shop!
Best NY style pizza in SF. Not even a contest.

Overall Experience: 5
Food: 5
Service: 4
Atmosphere: 5
Value: 4

Pros: This is one of my favorite pizza places in the city! I already did a review of the other location but this was my first time at the one in Ghirardelli square! The place is so cute with lots of tables outside looking at the water.

Cons: Its a pricey pizza with only four slices. My friend and I always share a pizza so two slices is enough for one person in my opinion. It also can get heavy since there's a lot of oil and cheese on the pizza.

Tips: check in on yelp to get $5 of your order!!!

We came here for the Wednesday Combo Meal and we loved it soo much!!!! The ambiance, service and place are rlly cute, and they also have some great music at the place!
Spicy vodka rigatoni - rate this a 9/10. The sauce was super creamy, rich and flavourful and we finished it very quickly!
For the app we got the burrata plate- 8/10. The burrata was very yummy and they served it with a lot of fruit
We got the number 12 pizza - pesto, ricotta- 8.5/10!
Basque cheesecake - 10/10- super light, flavourful and fresh! We kept wanting more
You also get a full bottle of wine in this combo - red white or rose

Overall, amazing experience, we will definitely be back for more!

A tried and true restaurant dinner staple in SF.

I've tried Pink Onion 3 times, twice for dine-in and once for take-out. The quality was consistent each time and I literally have to resist the urge to place an order whenever I'm craving Italian food.

Their $55 meal combo is unbeatable. Not only are the portions large, the food is so filling and I've enjoyed most of the dishes there. My personal favorites are the Bianco (mushroom) pizza, burrata salad, and the vodka rigatoni pasta. Some of the dishes are very burrata-heavy so I would skip on those if you're not a fan of burrata but otherwise, no complaints. Service is excellent as always, you get a very homey-comfort feeling and the staff is super friendly and relatable. The restaurant itself is small, but cute and overall, a great place to catch up with friends for dinner or a cute, casual date night.

One combo for two people is more than enough!
The food is beyond amazing!!!! Avocado salad (Spring mix, avocado, toasted almond, balsamic vinagrette) was so good, magic mushroom pizza (Olive oit base, mozzarella, tomato sauce crimini mushrooms, black pepper, truffle oil, prosciutto) was just perfect, the crust it's so tasty, staff was kind enough to accommodate for me and my friend who is vegetarian (prosciutto on a side), Il pesto di pistacchio spaghetti (Pistachio, basil, pecorino sardo, ricotta)
yuuum, tiramisu plus a bottle of wine!!?! Woooow.. Wednesday combo for $55, was just perfection.

The place is a little tiny but cozy, has great atmosphere, the staff is amazing, friendly and helpful. The music was a little loud and a little hard to have a conversation, but that is not a reason to not to go!
Parking was limited (street parking)

This is a hidden gem in the Mission district! $55 for an appetizer, pasta, pizza, and dessert is a STEAL. And on Wednesdays, you also get a free bottle of wine (it's OK wine, but wine nevertheless). I've come here with three other friends (all girls) and this was enough food for us.

The place itself is a bit small with only a few tables and bar seating, so make sure to make a reservation ahead of time! If you don't have a reservation, you may have to wait a bit and you'll have to wait outside since the restaurant itself doesn't have much space or a waiting area.

What I've ordered here before - all were solid and just depends on your mood:
- Steamed Mussels
- Pink Onion Salad
- Pink Alarm Fire Pizza
- Pesto Pasta
- Seafood Pasta

I'm usually too full for dessert, so I actually haven't tried the dessert.

Service is good and parking is pretty easy as well since it's further away from the busy main area of Mission.

Parking was quick to find, we arrived and were seated quickly. The place was smaller than I imagined definitely not for big crowds luckily it was just the two of us.
We ordered the $55 combo on their menu which includes a app or salad, any pasta, a pizza, and a dessert.
The Ceasar salad was good and reasonably sized, we ordered the mussel pasta I was surprised that it was a bit spicy as I didn't remember it mentioning that on the menu still good and larger mussel portion than I expected. The pizza had good flavor however I wish it was a bit crispier. We finished the night off with tiramisu and it was delicious. We did have leftovers so the price for all this was reasonable!
The staff was friendly and our food came out quickly

was super excited to try this place after hearing about it on tiktok and it did NOT disappoint! My bestie and I heard about the combo meal which was $55 where you get to choose a pizza, pasta, dessert and an app or salad.
Our options were:

The Pink Onion salad:
10/10
-the candied pecans are delish with the fruit
-love the blood orange vinagrette

Meatballs:  (we added this additionally)
8/10
- so moist
-the sauce was delish

The bolognese (not pictured) 5/10
- I didn't really like the taste
- wouldn't get again

Jimmy G pizza 10/10
- loved the hot honey with the ricotta
- the pepperoni was so good

Tiramisu:
10/10
- it was so moist & creamy
-would eat alot

The servers were super chill and the restaurant was pretty quiet, luckily we got there just in time because it got pretty lively and busy as we were leaving.

Would def come here again, this place is perfect for a date night or a catch up with a good friend! Love it here, you should def try it

Might be my new favorite Italian spot in the city?? My roommates and I came on Wednesday night for their combo deal (appetizer, pasta, pizza, dessert and bottle of wine for $55!! incredible deal!!), and we were blown away by every bite.

For our appetizer, we got the vegetarian burrata plate, and it was the best way to start the evening -- the strawberries were so fresh, and the combination of the glazed walnuts and the arugula gave the dish a nice mix of textures and a good combo of sweet and savory flavors. The burrata itself was sooo creamy, and we loved all the blueberries too.

We ordered two pastas (one as part of the deal, one on the side just to add on): the rigatoni vodka pasta, and the pesto. My mouth is still watering over the vodka pasta... it was actually spicy, and the pesto was so nutty and rich (I recommend ordering gnocchi instead of the original pasta shape!)

The pizza had a very thick crust and I added a lot of red pepper on top for some spice! I'm devouring the leftovers as we speak.

Everything went great w the bottle of rose, and by the time we ate the tiramisu (so fluffy. so creamy.) we were in the biggest food coma of our lives and fell asleep content!

Also --- they have the nicest and most patient servers!!! Perfect small restaurant ambiance for an intimate dinner or girls night!!

My friend and I came here on a Tuesday night for dinner and made a reservation at 7. Well when we got there, the waitress informed us that there was only bar seating available and we would have to wait 30 min if we wanted a table-- despite having made a reservation.

This initial interaction was slightly off putting but the waitress, Jennifer, said that she would be able to honor their Wednesday special for us (an app, pizza, pasta, dessert, and bottle of wine for $55) if we just took the bar seating.

It wasn't great that a reservation basically doesn't mean anything, but it was really kind of our waitress to compensate for overlooking the resy.

The food was absolutely great. I came with a friend and we split everything which was more than enough food and we were each able to take a container full of leftovers home.

We tried the burrata plate, pistachio pesto pasta, nayalita pizza, and tiramisu. Everything tasted absolutely fantastic with the standout being the burrata and pizza.

This place is great! I am obsessed with the $55 deal, where you get any appetizer, pasta, pizza, and dessert (and on Wednesdays a free bottle of wine)! This can feed 2-3 people comfortably. The restaurant is smaller than you would expect, however, the kitchen gets the food out quickly and the staff does a great job of being accommodating of seating.

My friend and I had a reservation on a Wednesday at 10pm. This was concerning because this is their closing time but we got there 30 minutes earlier and were able to put our order in before the kitchen closed.

The appetizer I shared was the Vegetarian Burrata Plate (not pictured). It was amazing and by far a great start to our night! It was a fresh and appatizing starter that was refreshing yet light. It was salad like and the unique flavors combined beautifully. The next thing we got was the NAYALITA pizza (with burrata cheese instead of gorgonzola cheese). I was very well made and exactly what I was expecting. The balsamic glaze was the perfect touch to this pizza. For pasta, we chose the PASTA TARTUFO, which was described as Seasonal truffle in a delicate parmesean truffle cream. Nothing gets better than that! We ended the night with the tiramisu, which came in a large container and was the cherry on top of this meal.

Overall, if you're thinking of trying this place out. DO IT. It really is a great restaurant and nothing can beat their amazing $55 deal! It is well worth it! I can't wait to come back to try more on the menu!

A solid spot to meet up with friends over a variety of pizzas, pastas, salads, and more! We made a reservation through Yelp which was super easy and convenient, and we were seated right on time.

We ordered:

- Avocado salad: super tasty and might have been my favorite part of the meal. All the ingredients were fresh but the dressing and almonds really made the dish for me.

- Mussel pasta: delicious, buttery, and simple, with plenty of mussels in our portion. However, I didn't think there was anything particularly special about it, especially for $20+

- Magic mushroom pizza: also really good, but very oily. Most of the toppings were in the center which also made the crust in the middle get soggy pretty quickly, but the flavors of the mushrooms, tomato sauce, and prosciutto worked together really nicely. It came with 6 slices, but I was honestly satisfied after 1 slice.

Overall, the portions are generous and 3 dishes for 3 people was a good amount with a bit left over, and came out to ~$23 per person. I would say it is definitely worth a try!

Pretty good pizza place, usually my go to when I'm in Haight-Ashbury area. 6$ slices kinda pricey, but that's SF prices tbh. Young people working inside, they always put the pizza in the oven to warm up for you, which is very much appreciated. There's a few tables, some counter space eating area with no seats, and they got hand sanitizer and paper towel napkins. I've never been to NYC so idk what NYC pizza is but it's good pizza, I come back like every month or so whenever I'm here in the area.

Came with a friend who was craving this place and I left a little satisfied but not impressed with the name and expectation of "New York Pizza". 3.5 stars for me.

Slices are big, definitely can get full off of 1.5. We got pepperoni, veggie and a ham and pineapple. Between the pepperoni and the pineapple and ham one, the pepperoni was far better but not like those of NY (cheesy, greasy, thin crust). Because they're reheated in the oven upon order, some parts were hot others were cold, my ham and pineapple one was just cold from the very first bite. For 4 slices of pizza and 2 small drinks + tip, I paid almost $40 when that's the price of ordering an entire pie from the comfort of your own home.

About 4 small tables offered for seating, one long standing bar offered too. Quite the foot traffic on a Sunday evening but the service is fast. I could see this being the place to stop at after a few drinks in the Haight-Ashbury area, but not sure I would say the same if you're looking to satisfy a full pizza craving.

This place, on Haight street in SF, is an institution. If you like pizza places with a lot of crazy crap on the walls, this is the place for you. A few tables to sit and eat inside are available as well as a standing side counter to stand and eat.

The service is fast. They offer some unique pizzas too. The you say potato is a unique option I like. Their mushroom pizza is also a go to for me.

I recommend getting slices. When we get a full pizza delivered they tend to be not as good. Often too thick of a crust, which is common here if the west coast. But when we ask for thin crust we hope it would be as thin as the slices at the shop. But not so much. Especially in a medium size pizza.

In short, I highly recommend grabbing a slice when you're in the hood.

We visited Escape From New York Pizza at around midnight on a Friday after seeing a band play nearby. The place was relatively busy but we were able to order at the counter right away. I chose a Mushroom Slice, and my friends got the Veggie, Hawaiian, Cheese, and Pepperoni (all slices). First off, most of us are from New York so we were skeptical from the start. The service was quick and the place looked pretty authentic - with a huge NYC subway map as decor and the overall vibe of an New York dollar slice store. However, the slices were far from a dollar - $5.50 to $6.50, which I found to be wild. And then of course, the POS system prompts you to add a tip.

The slices came out pretty fast and we ate them on the spot (there were a few tables inside). I had to request red pepper flakes and parmesan because they didn't have those out, and they came in little packets - definitely not very New York. But the crust of the slices was sufficiently thin and crispy, which I appreciated. There was a bit too much flour on the bottom, but the toppings were all pretty good. Overall, decent for New York pizza in SF!

This is the first pizza I've had in SF that just wasn't good. It looks like NY style but it just didn't taste good. The service was fine as was the place itself, it fit in well on Haight. But I've had real NYC pizza in NYC and then NYC style pizza in STL and the STL one is the closest to real NYC that's I've had. This place just looks like NYC style and that's all it is, looks.

I've never had sliced potato and whole garlic cloves on my pizza before. It was so good and I have never heard of this before. The pizza slices were huge and the crust was crustin! Wings are a must! They're so big and juicy wings!

Home dinner date and we decided to order from the Escape From New York Pizza.

I ordered the "You Say Potato" pizza and long story short, if you're in love with garlic and potato, please do yourself a favor and order this. No regrets, just lots of love from garlic.

My boyfriend enjoyed his pizza, as you can see he took a slice before I even had the opportunity to take a photo.

Best part? You'll have leftovers and they'll still taste good after 1 minute in the microwave.

Lunch with kids...
Pizza is NEVER a bad idea. I wanted the kids to eat something other than chain restaurants and this place was .8 miles away from where we were so this is what I chose. Too bad there wasn't any seats or parking, but the kids didn't mind it, as they were starving. One slice was enough for each child. They scarfed it down and said it was soooo good. I agree. I have had my fair share of NY pizza and I will say, this place is gooood. I would totally come back. One slice is enough for anyone to be honest. They are huge, just like they should be! Reasonably priced too. 10/10

I absolutely loved the potato pizza, and the garlic on top was so good. Two medium sizes are good for around 5 people, 2-3slices per person. Scheduled to be deliverer via ubereats and arrived on time.

Had to give my local late night pizza joint a try! Came in the wee hours of the night/morning on a weeknight & got a slice of the potato pizza & the staff kindly threw in a slice of pesto! The crust was light, airy, & crispy, but it didn't have much chew to it. It was a bit cracker esque, and wasn't the most flavorful slice. The staff was nice so I'll round up what I would call a 3.5 star quality pizza to a 4 star experience. Seems like a great spot for the drunchies, I'll have to come back in an altered state to test this theory

Loved our meal here! My bff brought me here and it was perfect. From the food, drinks, dessert, you really can't go wrong!

My favorite was the portofino but the truffle was also very delicious!

Thank you Carlos for such a great experience! Already looking forward to my next visit!

I loved my meal at Pinsa Rossa!  My bff and I visited last night and had no problem getting seated around 5pm.  We had their cappaletti spritz, which is super similar to an aperol spritz--perfect for a spring day!.  For food, we started with the hamachi crudo, which was divine with the orange slices.  We also had the burrata and prosciutto crostini--delicious!  I loved the bread they used.

For pinsas, we ordered the truffle cheeks and the portofino.  Both were really good.  I loved the truffle oil in the truffle cheeks, and the sweetness from the fig jam in the portofino.  The crust is so light and fluffy yet crisp, I feel like I can eat a whole pinsa myself!  They also have a lot of pinsa options, so there's something for everyone.

Carlos was our server and he was super friendly and accommodating.  Can't wait to come back and try more of their food!

Pinsa Rossa seemed like a new addition to Pacific Heights and while strolling around on a Sunday evening, we decided to give it a shot! Let me tell you, I'm so happy we did :-)

First, if you're like me and don't know the difference: Pinsa is a dough that is pressed by hand, expect something lighter and in this case tastier than your regular pizza.  We got the Heavenly Mushrooms and the Eggplant Parmigiana, both were quite good and enough for 3 people (while leaving room for a little dessert!). We got the Tiramisu, which was amazing! I don't remember the wine we got, but do remember it being good.

If you're looking for a new pizza place to try, definitely give this a shot. It might not have the fame of some of the more well-known spots in North Beach, but it is the best pizza I've had in SF so far!

I. LOVE. THIS. PIZZA!

This location is great, great ambiance. Nice lil patio and lots of room inside.

I forgive Joyride for our pizza not being very warm when we dined there there because the beer was great, and the one server/cashier/bartender was awesome despite the slow service.

We've ordered pizza to go from this location and it was INCREDIBLE!!!!

My partner said this is by far and away the best  gluten-free and dairy-free pizza he's *ever* had.

This branch of Joyride is inside Woods Lowside, in the Lower Haight. Same delicious pizza, which is saying a lot, in a city that has thin crispy crust, Chicago style, deep dish, NY slices- but here we have Detroit style.
The bonus of this location is an extensive drink menu @ a bar you'll want to hang out in, although I wouldn't last long without back support. A surprisingly large interior, with tables, chairs, & a shelf full of bottles. But wait, there's more. A secret outdoor patio surrounded by greenery. Nice. In fact, the entire place is beautifully remodeled, clean, inviting. Great place for a party, or just enjoy your food.

Convenient location in Fillmore next to shopping and other restaurants. Made a last. Minute reservation Sunday dinner and restaurant was not too busy.
Waiter was extremely great and very attentive.
Caesar salad was a bit too much dressing for my liking. Both pizzas we got were pretty good definitely larger than I expected. We ordered one salad and two pizzas among three people and it was more than enough. The carbonara pizza was a bit heavy but bread itself was lighter than standard pizza.

Loved this place! The ambiance is just the right balance of classy and casual. We came in with a reservation on a Sunday night and split the Truffle Cheeks pinsa between the two of us. The dough was airy yet still chewy, and the truffle flavor was pleasant and not overwhelming (and I say that as a mushroom hater.) For two people, one pinsa is enough if you're not too hungry, but two might be too much even if you're both hungry. Wish the table we were at was a bit farther away from the table next us and not smack dab in the middle of the busy restaurant. Definitely a nice addition to Fillmore street with yummy special pizzas!

Great food, really put off by the hostess awkwardly telling us that we had a 60-min time limit on our table.

I want to be extra clear, the food was great! I got the Carbonara pizza and the Prosciutto pizza to split with my friend. We loved them both - they really hit the right balance of a both crispy and chewy crust. So so good

What really put off both my friend and I was immediately after we were seated at our table (6pm reservation, sat around 605pm because we were 2mins late) another woman/hostess (not the same person that sat us) came by and whispered to us that they had another party coming right at 7 so we only had a 60-min time limit for our table. And when I say whispered, I mean whispered - I had to ask the woman to speak up because I couldn't hear what she was saying at first. It was really uncomfortable.

I'm all for transparency on table time limits, but this was not clear when I made the reservation. I also think 60-mins for a sit down dinner reservation is a bit quick.

Because it was such an awkward interaction with this woman, we ordered immediately when our waiter came back. We didn't receive our food until sometime around 6:35/6:40, so we felt really uncomfortable about making sure we were done with dinner, paid and out by 7pm.

I would highly recommend being a bit more transparent about your time limits, but I'd also recommend increasing table time limits to at least 75mins so people don't have to feel rushed.

This is our all time favorite restaurant these days. We come here so often and feel like we know the team/staff well:) they are all so sweet and so attentive. Best of all, the food is amazing.

I usually don't eat the crust of pizzas but here, I eat everything because the dough is so fluffy and delicious. Even the next day if you reheat the pizza, it tastes like it came straight out of the oven! Every pizza is delicious but our favorites are the carbonara pizza and the spicy Calabrian pizza.

Their Caesar salad was really flavorful too.

The indoor decor is lovely. Feel like the perfect combo of fancy and chill, romantic and fun, or even if you just want a bite and glass of wine by yourself this spot is great - the bar area is so fun.

Overall my favorite spot lately, must go. Once you go though, you'll be returning multiple times:)

First time here. Cute spot for sure. The caprese salad was great because of their amazing balsamic. The caesar salad was average. The pizza we had (pepperoni on sausage) was unexciting unfortunately. I am a pizza nut and this just didn't do it for me at all. Will try the spot next door next time.

Hadn't gone to the previous pizza place in this spot as ai heard mixed reviews, but when this one opened it looked really cute so was really excited to try it!

We walked in on a friday night a little before 6:30pm and was seated at the bar. Food came super quick!

We ordered the pork & beef meatballs ($13), truffle cheeks pizza ($21) and the beef & arugula salad ($14). The meatballs were ok, a little too salty in my opinion, but liked that it came with some bread! The arugula salad was beautifully plated and and lots of beets! l I liked that they were sliced thinly rather than in chunks. The pizza was the highlight! The crust was light and airy, yet slightly chewy- it was so so good. The truffle wasn't overpowering and not too salty from the pork, and perfect amount of cheese. Would get this again!

Overall, quick service and tasty pizza. One of the better restaurants on fillmore in my opinion!

Not too cheesy, unique delicious toppings, crisp fluffy crust. The taste profile of the pinsa here is very similar to that of wood oven pizza, so it did not have as much of the wow factor, but it definitely did taste lighter than your typical pizza.

-Positano (4.5/5): I was eyeing this one from the get go, and it was delicious! The ingredients were so simple yet complemented one another so well -- light touches of ricotta with mortadella and pistachio for a nice crunch.

-Portofino (3.5/5): This one was also really good -- loved the fig jam for a touch of sweetness. But I did feel like I was really just eating cheese and fig jam. The prosciutto shriveled up and there were barely any pieces. The cheese also got cold really quick and I think this one is best enjoyed warm. The sweet salty flavor was really nice though.

Overall, it's a great spot to go with a friend! I love that you're able to cut up the pinsa yourself. The main thing I wish is that there was some means of keeping the pinsa warm and heated throughout the dinner.

We LOVE BrewVino and come here at least twice a month for lunch or happy hour. We love sitting on the sunny patio and enjoying lunch or a nice cold IPA after work.

We often will get two pizzas and a salad to split amongst 3-4 of us. We have tried the Meat Pie, Sausage & Mushroom, Funky Funghi, Artichoke Lover and the BBQ Chicken. For the salad, we order the Sesaonal or House salad.

Last time we went, we went for Happy Hour and got the Chicken Wings. We ordered one order of the Buffalo and the other was Jalapeno (super spicy, but mouthwatering delicious). We have also ordered the fries for HH and brussel sprouts.

We love this place and love that it is a little getaway for a little lunch or happy hour. We find ourselves getting wrapped up in talking the afternoon away while munching on good food and drinks. Fun place with a great outdoor patio.

We loved the reviews on Yelp for this place. We are from Reno looking for some of the best pizza in SF!

We ordered pineapple and red onions on our pizza with half jalapeños on one side. Jalapeños were over the entire pizza.

We were also told there were 8 slices to this pizza and there were 6.

Overall excellent pizza!

Maybe my expectations are too high when I see 4.5 ratings.

The food I'm conflicted. The pictures of the pizzas look great but the cheese on the pizza that we got seemed almost hardened up a bit. The crust was so thin, but it although not crispy it felt strangely different from thin-panned pizza.

I personally got thr potatoes soup. The bread is amazing). It was good but felt like it was still missing the right amount.

The place itself is great. Nothing like one sees from the outside.

Don't overlook this perfect place for a cozy wine and pizza night. Great pies with creative flavours and delicious crust.  You can even split the flavours if you can't decide. The staff was SO friendly and really made us feel at home. Outdoor area is very cute and protected from the wind so it was quite comfortable even on a chilly night. Dogs are welcome on the patio too!

I've visited Brewvino a number of times and its become a staple. The wine list at Brevino is truly impressive, featuring a wide selection of local and international wines to suit every taste and budget. The knowledgeable staff is always on hand to offer recommendations and help you select the perfect bottle to pair with your meal.

The pizza was also SO good. From the crispy, golden crust to the gooey, melted cheese and the perfectly seasoned sauce, every bite is a delight. We tried the Margherita pizza and the artichoke one. So creamy and delicious. It was perfect to share with friends over wine and beer.

But what really sets Brevino apart is the service. The staff is attentive, friendly, and always willing to go the extra mile to ensure that you have a wonderful dining experience. From offering suggestions on menu items to ensuring that your glass is always full, they make you feel like a valued guest.

Nice beer and wine bar that serve  great pizzas, salads, and sandwiches in the Mission.
Great service, wonderful staff, and dogs friendly.
Always great food and service with a smile. Pizzas are definitely solid but don't overlook the other food on the menu! Burger...Mmmmmmm!!!

I've had this spit bookmarked for a while (years?) and finally checked it out for lunch today. The inside is super bright and playful, but I decided to sit out on the patio since the weather was nice.

Kenny B. was my server and he was great. I started off with a glass of bubbles and quickly decided on the smash burger and fries, which came out after not too long of a wait. They hit the spot exactly and I washed it down with a hef. I appreciate that Kenny offered me to try out each drink before committing (I tasted a cider and didn't like it) and he was very attentive. I definitely want to come back to try out their rotating drink menu and the other food items they have on the menu.

Lovely place with lovely servers and service!

Starter was a seasonal salad with mozzarella on the side. Flavour was good, nothing unexpected

Pizza was great, too. Crust wasnt too firm and no real burn on the base! Great taste.

If you want a solid meal that won't disappoint then come to BrewVino, nothing really stands out though to make this go 5 stars, I kinda feel bad not giving it though

Came here for date night on a Friday night around 7pm and there was only about a 10 minute wait! I was very excited to learn that they were dog friendly indoors, they even offered my pup a bowl of water while we were seated at dinner. Food is great though I would say the pizza's are on the smaller side for the price, only because realistically they are just large personal pizzas. The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating, I would come back just for the staff. They have a great selection of beer on tap as well as tall boys you can purchase, for their tall boys they have buy 5 get the 6th free!

May give it 5 soon but 4 because...Ok I had a long standing grudge from 32 years ago when I used my hard earned tip money to get a pizza delivered to impress a date. (Hey i was young and poor and so was she)
Pizza was burnt to a crisp! It wasn't well done, it was cremated to the point where I wondered if an ex was working the oven.  I landlined my complaint and the grouchy middle-aged manager said no dice. We ain't coming back. Bring it in if you want me to look at it.  No car and the taxi ride would have been more than the pizza.  I told him that I grab a slice there at least once a week but never again. He laughed and hung up. Never saw the date again,
I kept my word for over 3 decades !!!Slow-forward to last year when at a gathering in the Castro everyone wanted pizza and the Sausage Factory was closed.  
Let it go they all said, he's in his eighties if he's still alive.  (Not wishing anyone dead over a burnt pie but mathematically they were correct)
So we ordered and I insisted we pick-up the pies, no delivery.  And they were good.  We have ordered several more times and no more char pizzas.  Staff is nice, prices are good and pizza is ready when I get there.  Oh I'm never doing delivery again.  No need to tempt fate!  And that is my poorly punctuated tale of a grudge erased.

Childhood favorite, growing up this was my favorite spot for a mushroom slice.

Recently went back with a friend and was mildly disappointed, we ordered a medium mushroom pizza, the guy said "it'll take 30 minutes" and he seemed annoyed, they boxed it up and didn't notify us when it was ready so we waited even longer even though we were right there and they barely sliced the pizza at all so it fell apart really easily. Maybe we got the laziest dude that night, idk.

All that being said one mediocre experience won't destroy my memory of this place but I reccomend you just order what slices they have ready, don't order a whole pie.

Even though the pizza was good and the prices were average, I didn't like the way the cashier did his job. I think he didn't understand what I was saying and decided to pretend that I didn't ask for anything.
Also, they don't provide a glass of water for the customers, and they don't offer anything instead, even if you have to pay for it. Lazy work = customers will find substitutes because there are many places with better pizza and service.

Good place for a quick bite on a night out or after a screening at the castro theater :) The pizza slice was large and came out fast, but sadly my friend's was really delayed and came out burnt. Some limited seating inside too!

Some of the best simple pizza in the city!

The crust is substantial with slight chew but not too thick/dry and the price is right for the portions that you're getting. They do not skimp on the cheese here and the flavor profiles of the pizzas are on the basic side, which is honestly hard to find in Sf and done well. I took off one star because the overall flavor of the pizza could be slightly more seasoned, but if you're a simple food lover, this is absolutely the pizzeria for you.

I love coming here when it's later in the night since parking can be a pain. I also like the seating here, if you're a larger person, you may find it cramped but if you're an smaller introvert, the seating will be perfectly private.

Now for pizza crust comparisons... I would say the crust is like a fancier Costco crust (which I think is a compliment).  The crust is similar also to Long Bridge but the toppings here are less flavorful. The Marcellos crust is definitely more substantial than the slightly undercooked chewy crust of il casaro, way softer than the crunchy/dry little star pizza.

If you're looking for a simple, large slice of basic pizza late at night, this is the spot for you!

First off, the pizza smelled and looked amazing. The problem was that when the slice was picked up, it could not hold its own and drooped down. At that moment, I knew the crust wasn't right and the pizza was soggy from the center out. I had to put it in the air fryer to get the crust a little crisp.

Taste was okay, remind me of the Costco pizza when they had the combo but except this had a thinner crust.

Not sure if I'd buy a pizza again for dinner, but this place would work out great if you had a late night and are craving a pie.
The guy working there was very hostile and rude. The girl was icey and unfriendly. They must've had a bad night that night. He should work on his anger management and customer service.

What is it about SF and bland pizza? I mean wow this is #5 and it's just not good. I had the Detroit style and it appeared delicious but I was tricked as it was a flavorless mess. Also, I asked the guy for a coke and he said they only had Pepsi but when he went to the cooler, they had Mexican Coke! Why wasn't that an option when I asked for a Coke? I asked him this same question and his answer is we only have Pepsi in cans. But I never specifically asked for a can, I just asked for a Coke. I also didn't see these Cokes displayed with the other sodas either for some reason. The likelihood of me returning is 0, there's absolutely no reason to based on the bland pizza and sketchy service received.

Located in the Castro is this pizza shop that has room to sit or even just pick up. Some slices are ready to go, they have Sicilian (thicker square pizza), all variety of pizzas, chicken wings, and sandwiches. We stopped by on a Thursday night, they're open late and for some slices they heat up for you. 1-2 slices are good. I got the veggie, my friends got Sicilian pepperoni, and we ordered Buffalo wings that took about 15 minutes but we're super fresh. Perfect if you want to pick up something quick and they're open late in the Castro.

I've been stopping in whenever in town for a pizza slice 1985. Happy to say each visit is just as tasty today as then. Service tends to be quick and friendly, and the window seats are perfect people watching.

Thank you for making my friend's day on her birthday! Went here on Sunday for a friend's birthday and it was such a great time! Our waiter was wonderful and served our food efficiently. Our group was around ~12 people and we sat in the back patio in a tent which was really nice. At first the group and I thought we were going to be freezing outside but the heater from the top of the tent was so warm. There's an area across from the patio that is great for taking pictures! There isn't much seating in the inside but love the vibes inside also.

The food was delicious and we were served a salad, antipasta, multiple pies and Tiramisu for dessert. We also ordered bottles of wine and everything was delicious! We had some vegetarians and vegans in the group and they did not have any issues with ordering anything at the restaurant.

The price of the food is what I typically see in San Francisco for pies. Each person spent around $80 for food and drinks.

Loved this place and the service and I'll definitely be back when I'm in the area.

We were seated in their patio area and it felt like a little garden! Super cute and  felt very private. The service was friendly and great. They kept checking in on us even though we were seated outside.

They have a pretty simple menu and I ordered the:
- Garlic Bread Knots
- Hot Honey Pepperoni Pie

Would definitely recommend both! The garlic bread knots were so good, lots of garlic flavor, super crunchy on the outside but soft in the inside as well. The hot honey pepperoni pie was delicious as well. The honey worked so well with the pepperoni.

I made a reservation for patio at 7pm. I was scared that we would freeze so we layered up. The good news is that its heated! The bad news is we had a VERY loud party of 8 people next to us that took all the fun out of being on a calm patio. The entire night was horrible because we could not hear ourselves speak (we were three) so we basically just ate in silence. If i had to rate the experience it would be a 1 but its not the restaurants fault...

The food:

The arancini balls were meh ok.

The carrot  goat cheese pistachio chili oil app was yummy and different

The pizzas were meh ok. From the looks of the food online i thought the pizzas looked yummy but while they were ok, i would never return to try others. The crust was good and im not a crust person. The corn one was fun but not much taste.  The mushroom one was ok too, couldn't taste the truffle oil.

The dessert mouse was super good.

The nutella pizza was fun and well tasted like nutella but lets face it its a lot of dough.

The cappuchino cup was very cute but the cap was meh ok

The waiters were both super friendly. I spoke with one because we were ten minutes late and he was super friendly and nice loved him!

Our waitress was also very nice.

I honestly wouldnt return here except maybe for the servers and a salad that looked good.

I came here for a friend's birthday dinner -- it was pretty much the only Italian restaurant in SF that took reservations for a large group (11 people). The service was great, our server was really nice and funny and we had a few fun exchanges.  

I ordered the Like a Virgin drink and the Radiatore Alla Vodka Diavolo pasta, and I had a few slices of the Sweet Corn Pie and the Pea Tendril & Straciatella Pie. The drink was decent, nothing really notable there. I loved the pasta, the portions looked a little small from the photos so I shared some of the pizza as well and that was just the right amount of food. The sweet corn pie was really good, but I felt that pizza crusts were lacking (they were a little burnt). I tried a bit of the Guittard Chocolate Budino dessert and it was one of the best desserts I've ever had.

I would definitely came again to try more of the pastas and desserts, but would probably avoid getting the pizzas.

Overall solid Italian restaurant in Sunset district.

Salcicca pie
Margherita Pie - delicious! It got soft really quickly though. If you get this eat this first and fast. The crust was really good.

I got the sausage and wood roasted mushrooms on the side as addons. Would definitely recommend getting on the side as it made these toppings much more shareable.

Spring Pea Aranchi -- the sauce was tangy and yummy. Interesting but not my favorite. Was like a croquette but not.

Spring onion crostini was the best thing there -- so fresh tasting! The mint was really good and the snap peas made it light and really really fresh.

Cacio e Pepe pasta was really good if you're a fan! Super simple.

Would recommend this place if you can get a reservation -- we got a reservation and it was super packed! Walk ins looked like they took a long time.

I was contacted by fiorella and refunded appropriately.

Wish we lived closer--this would be a regular place for us. Great food, kid friendly and yummy cocktails.

Just a bit busy so make sure to make reservations.

It's a cute pizza place in Nopa. They have a variety of vegetarian pizzas on the menu and you can request them to make any pizza on the menu vegetarian. Their background patio is very cute and I would recommend getting a table there.

We also ordered their squash lasagna which was yummy, small in portion but very tasty. I liked it more than the pizzas.

We ordered the moto and the New York pizza - I am not a fan of mushroom so I liked the New York pizza more than the Moto. They call it pies, but they're actually normal crust pizzas.

The pie was too spicy and salty for us. The meatballs were cold. The burrata salad was the star, as you can see it's half eaten photo.

They have a small but decent wine collection and offer carafes which was a perfect amount for two people.

Service was great and we walked in without reservations at 6pm on a Sunday but when we left it was 1/2 packed.

So I was driving down Diversidero trying to find some decent food and I flew by this on my scooter. I decided to stop and get some pizza and I had ordered NY style. Now THIS was decent pizza and the 2 men working there were very attentive. The place was quaint, and that's not a bad thing at all. I'd definitely return here, it's 1 of very few good pizza places in SF.

Cons: soda is $3.50...and they're 12oz cans....

Made a reservation via Yelp that required a credit card on file, and they had options for outdoor seating or any available seating (but none for indoor seating.) I was originally seated outdoors, which is a cute patio at the back of the restaurant with a tent and a few heat lamps, but it was still cold so we moved inside.

We ordered the baby kale salad, the moto pizza, and the mushroom pizzas to share. For the price, I expected larger portions of each. The baby kale salad was good - it came with fresh radish, corn, and avocado. There were few toppings for both pizzas including cheese - the sauce was watery, so the cheese and toppings slid off. The bread itself was soggy and the crust was dry.

Came here for dinner on a Thursday night (around 6pm) without a reservation and got seated right away! The tables did start to fill out shortly after, so reservations would be ideal for more popular times or for larger parties.

We happened to dine shortly after they changed their menu, which was a lovely surprise! We ordered the Di Stefano Burrata with Persimmons, Butternut Squash Rigatoni, and  Brussels Sprouts Pizza. Everything was so fresh and delicious! The pasta was my favorite - so rich and creamy, especially on a cold SF night.

Service was very prompt and I didn't feel rushed at all, despite the dining room being completely full when we left. Great place to catch up with friends or have a little date night over some fresh and flavorful Italian food!

We went to Fiorella for brunch and enjoyed our experience overall. We ordered the meatballs and the pepperoni pie which were both good! The portions are pretty small for the pricing (the pie is pretty thin and only cut into 4 pieces) so be sure to keep that in mind when ordering. Would love to check out the rooftop next time!

Came here with a party of 2 on a Saturday morning for brunch and there wasn't really any wait. We sat indoors though cause there was a private event going on at the rooftop.

We ordered the kale mushroom scramble, salsiccia pizza, and the ricotta tartina and they all were really tasty! The pizza definitely stood out the most and I will say it might be one of my top favorites for pizza in SF. Loved the garlicky salsa topping it had.
The scramble in my opinion was a little too salty but the flavor was really good.
And the dessert definitely exceeded my expectations! It was jam on milk bread topped with ricotta cheese and strawberries and the whole thing was just the perfect amount of sweetness - not too sweet at all! Loved every bite of it hehe

Anyways  the food here seems solid, typical lunch/brunch prices, and if we got to experience the rooftop maybe the experience would've been even more memorable!

Went on Neighborhood Appreciation Day, where they had $10 pizzas and pastas, so this place was fully booked on a Monday.  

We sat at the bar and watched the busiest bartender, who made delicious drinks AND served people sitting at the bar.  She remain composed and was a true winner that night.  

Portions seem larger than before and you cant go wrong ordering their Italian fare.  

It's a warm bustling cool vibe kind of place with a real fireplace for cold Sunset district nights.  A real gem in the neighborhood!

The last Monday of the month is Neighborhood Appreciation Night with $10 pizza and drinks. There's also a couple of other reduced price nibbles. Arancini was crispy, gooey, and packed with flavor at only $7. I'm moving to this neighborhood! Did you hear me?

Yes, at these prices, I paid the toll and crossed the bridge. The food came out quickly but not rushed. Service was sweet and speedy. Who said Friday can be the only pizza night? I just broke the rules.

The rooftop is a nice touch but it's also cozy and tres romantic in the main dining area. There's also a not so secret bar next door but you didn't hear that from me ;)

I've been wanting to check out this Italian restaurant in my neighborhood for a while, and it didn't disappoint. Amazing, fresh ingredients. Loved the Moto pie, veggie lasagna and chocolate pot de crème. Fast, friendly service. Cute interior. Will definitely be back!

Service was great! Servers were incredibly friendly and they had a great sense of humor.

We sat outside in the back to celebrate a friends engagement. Very cute layout, felt cozy and private. Can comfortably fit 20 people in the back.

Food was delicious esp the salad! Sooo yum would definitely be back here.

First time trying this place out after walking past it multiple times. Decided to come during Restaurant Week!

Made a reservation for Sunday brunch and were seated really quickly. Was upstairs at the covered patio and it's such a nice space with the heat lamps (zero chill/wind). Ordering was fairly quick--ordered the OG Baby Lettuce Salad, Croque Madame, and Nogroni.

Nogroni -- best way I could describe it is an elevated orange soda. It's not bad but it's not the flavor profile I usually go for. I might try the other zero proof drinks on the menu next time.

OG Baby Lettuce Salad - it's a salad; light dressing with some texture and it's definitely a massaged salad so it was evenly dressed which I appreciate.

Croque Madame -- I'm used to Croque Madames usually on a harder bread like a sourdough so this was a first for me. Bread was warm and was the perfect vehicle to soak up all the sauce on the plate. Egg was nicely cooked and overall I just enjoyed how savory it was.

Bill was...to be expected. Restaurant week was $25 for one app + entree. After fees and tip (~18%) my overall was $50. A little high for brunch IMO but it was great to try this place out!

The burrata pizza would be better if it were a bit more firm and less expensive.

The wallpaper, though.

Flavors and textures excellent. Prices on par with everything else in the area - portions made us feel mostly satisfied.

The cauliflower arancini was a cheesy, crunchy ball of delicious.

The meatballs were soft, tender, seasoned nicely. So soft.

Kale crudite didn't look appetizing but was surprisingly tasty. The kale was cooked down to a pleasant texture, and it worked well with the sharpness of the cheese.

The potato, kale, pizza with pickled onions was a tasty interplay of flavors and texture - the accent added by the picked onions took it to the next level.

The lamb pasta was my first time trying mafaldine pasta - long, wavy ribbons that look like they were trimmed from lasagna noodles edges. Expertly cooked to al dente. Full of meaty flavor.

Thought that the Aperol spritz had a bit too much ice. The wine portions felt generous, I'll probably stick to wine next time.

Price: $$
Food: 5/5
Ambiance: 5/5
Customer service: 5/5
Parking: Street parking

Truth be told, I was drawn here by the news that they had Zanze's cheesecake but I just became a hardcore fan! They have a variety of other salads, pizza, take-home baked goods, cheeses, sauces, etc. we were enthralled by their charming little shop. It was clean, neat, and filled with options.

We tried the rotisserie chicken (with a quinoa salad), lasagna, clam chowder, and ofc Zanze's cheesecake! Omg it did not disappoint at all. I loved the lasagna-- I could easily say by far the best lasagna in the City. Simple, easy, and not too acidic. The rotisserie chicken paired so well with the lemon vinegarette quinoa kale salad.

It's a little drive into a charming neighborhood. I would say it's conveniently located on the corner so you can't miss this shop! Id definitely be back for more!

Cute little Italian spot where you can get fresh made pasta and sauces from the fridge in the back, fry pastas, jars of olives, pickles, bread, spices, chocolates, a bunch of interesting items for your home or as gifts for family and friends.

Daily pizza specials for less than 6 bucks!
I recently went in for a large order of 4 pizzas for a party later on that evening. I was smart to drop in during lunch time hour to order and pay to make it more convenient at the time of pick up.

The pizzas we got were all good. Perfect toppings to dough ratio and good amount of toppings.

Lucky me - remember how I said I was smart to come during lunch? I placed my future dinner order and grabbed a slice of their daily special lol. Peep their Hawaiian version ! So good!

Was craving some pizza on a Friday night and decided to call in my order. Before arriving I thought it was strictly a takeaway spot only to find out it's also a cute little shop selling premade Italian goods (think truffle salts, olive oils) and even Zanze's Cheesecake! There's also some seating outside the restaurant if you choose to eat here.

I received a text message notifying me my order was ready, but I wasn't sure where to go to pick up order. Luckily, a worker kindly helped and guided me to check out.

I ordered the 14" Italian Job pizza that included all the toppings I imagine I'd enjoy but it did not exactly meet expectation: although chili oil was one of the ingredients it did lack the spicy kick I was anticipating lol. Also the sweet italian sausage tasted like regular italian sausage, leaving me confused? But even so, every ingredient complemented each other well and I enjoyed my pizza regardless. I also ordered the garlic knots and may skip ordering it next time. I will definitely come back again for some Zanze's as well as try some of their other premade meals or pizzas!
