Ordered the Half Spicy Mike half Hawaiian Punch with high hopes! However I was quite disappointed.. pizza was at room temperature when I picked it up.

Spicy Mike was a bit salty with minimal pizza sauce. Though the flavors were there, it was a bit overwhelming.

Hawaiian Punch was the normal pineapple ham pizza with the twist of the pickled jalapeño.

I primarily go here to shop for specialty pantry items, pastas, and their frozen food selection. SoSo sometimes I forget that this location is a restaurant as well.

For easy weeknight meals, I really like their frozen eggplant Parmesan, the frozen meatballs, and selection of house made pasta sauces. Having said that, I've also purchased plenty of takeout as delivery. I particularly enjoy their garlic knots and mushroom pizza! It can be a little pricey, but the quality seems worth the price.

Un mercato affascinante bellisimo! It's like walking into a part of Italy, which I dearly miss. Perhaps it was the company as well.

But here in this space tucked away in a small section of this unique city is this charming market! It is very clean, very beautiful, and very popular!

The pizza was good, and I love the crust. It was unique and makes for an affordable lunch. I like the idea from another patron posted previously how they paired it with ice cream. Thus, we will have to come back for another Slice of the Day! Oh, the pizza bread was super soft too. It smelled good and fresh all the way back home.

My boyfriend and I decided to order a night time snack since I was craving for pizza.
We ordered the Ultimate Paradise Pizza & house made Ravioli and we both enjoyed every bite and pieces of it. I was so excited to bring the left over to work the next day. Im not a crust person but I really like the crust here.

Not worth the price.  

For me, the ravioli sauce tasted too much of tomato.  I love tomato based sauces and love tomatoes but I need more flavor in a sauce. The pasta tasted a little too doughy.

The Caesar was just okay.  I do loooooove that they actually give you enough dressing for the salad, tho.  It's kinda funny, the other Italian place which I regularly order from barely gives enough dressing for their salads, even if you request extra.  So, thinking that would be the case with Joe's, I ordered extra and then had too much.  Which also brings me to the point that I appreciate their paying attention to the request when ordered to-go. So that is a major plus.  

They don't give any bread with the meal, which was another disappointment compared to other Italian joints. But I prob wouldn't have minded as much if the pasta had been tastier.

I really don't understand the hype.

Super cute store. It looks like Christmas everyday. Decided to get some Liguria Bakery foccacia since I never get a chance thanks to my work schedule. Got the tomato sauce, jalapeno cheddar, and garlic rosemary foccacia. After a bit of retoasting they were pretty good. They were all very good and everyone in my family liked a different kind. The only complaint would be that the rosemary garlic one had this weird coating of coarse particles on one end. At first I thought it would be seasoning, but once it was in my mouth it crunched and tasted like sand. So that was very suspect. Anyone know what those particles could be? Other than the potentially contaminated bread,  this store is great! Can't wait for them to start selling Zanze's cheesecakes soon.
Fantastic food if a bit expensive. I've only gotten take out here but definitely some of the best pizza I've had in the City and especially in this neck of the woods. Highly recommended.

Overall good casual restaurant with consistent food fare, a small menu, and sometimes loud ambiance

Lots of friends or after work hangouts

Would recommend for a chill easy-going place where everyone will like something here :)

Food: decent! I had a salad that was far too large but hit the spot just fine.

Service: excellent, not too slow or too rushed.

Ambiance: a bit noisy and a weird family style set up, maybe not the best for business meetings or a date.

Ambiance: they're always packed and yet somehow I can always get a table so props to them. This is kind of like the go-to non-controversial place to bring your friends when they visit SF as something that feels fancy but isn't incredibly pricey. The service is fine and we were seated in the outdoor section which was a bit cold but there were heaters.

Food: ordered the margherita pizza and funghi pizza, which were both thin crust and pretty good. Standard for a place like this.

The restaurant was quite packed. I would suggest to reserve a spot for big party in advance. The service was okay. I like the mushroom pizza because I haven't tried it elsewhere. Otherwise everything was good, but not great.

I love Delarosa! I only really come here for happy hour although I've been here for dinner as well. The men working at the bar are very nice! Their meatballs are the happy hour menu are good as are their pizzas (duh). I also love their beet salad. Drinks are good!

I loved my time at Delarosa. It  was my first time in the city, so I wanted to try as many places as possible. Seeing the reviews I knew I wanted to come and try it out.

To start we had the burrata bruschetta. That was my first time having a bruschetta like that, and I think it was amazing. I am not always a fan of tomatoes, so it was a nice change. I wish the bread was thicker to be able to hold all of the toppings. Also, I think the selection of bread was not my favorite, but I would order it again. So my thoughts are merely suggestions and do not take away from the app.

I also tried one of the pasta dishes. I do not remember the name but it had pork in it. I thought is was good. I would not need to get it again, only because I would want to try something different.

Overall the service was good, the food came out quickly and the ambiance was pleasant.

Food was delicious and served quickly. We sat outside during a cold day, but it was not an issue with the overhead heating lamps. The Margherita Pizza was great, but the crust was very thin. It was so thin, the pizza could NOT hold its shape when picking up to take a bite. Pizza can be shared with two people or eaten alone. We had the Burrata Bruschetta appetizer and it was delicious! I had the chocolate flour-less cake dessert and it was amazing. It came with ice-cream and caramel drizzle. The cake had a brownie consistency and was still hot from the oven. It was fantastic. Will definitely come back!

A homey and tasty Italian food spot in FiDi. Perfect for after work happy hour.

My standout dishes were the beet salad and the pasta. The beets were so rich and juicy, they tasted almost meaty. The pizzas were alright.

For dessert, the tiramisu and chocolate cake with ice cream were the perfect melt-in-your-mouth consistency. Still thinking about that cake.

Service was kind and attentive. An amazing dinner.

I liked the simple ambience of the place, the food was decent , but the quantity could have been better! Appetizers were in very small portions. Since we were a party of 6, we realized that there were exactly 5 prawns in white Argentinian prawns appetizers, which definitely was not what we were expecting. The crispy bread that came with it tasted yum with the prawns sauce. Had a mixed feeling about the drinks. The cocktails were either tasty or strong but not both. Had a great time with frnz at the corner table. Food could have been better. I liked the crab arancini and bartender out of all.

Ambiance, great food, good service. This place has it all.

We ordered the fungi pizza, ziti chicken parmesan, and burrata bruschetta. The mushroom pizza was flavorful and crispy thin crust. The chicken parmesan was seasoned well and complemented the tomato sauce. The burrata bruschetta was wonderfully toasted and creamy, the hazelnut and honey are the perfect pair. They have crispy thin crust pizza and it's bomb. Can't recommend this place enough!

Everything, great food, adorable place, excellent wine, and a very hot wait staff (Italian accent anyone?).  We only got appetizers as the pinsa was gluten-aware and not Celiac gluten free. But oh what amazing appetizers they were! Also very nice decor in a neat building with some wonderful leftovers of old SF interspersed amongst the nouveau Soviet architecture that's going up everywhere.

Not being able to order the pinsa meant the cost was a little higher, so I couldn't afford it on the reg, but I will *definitely* be returning.

Ambiance is a 10/10 easily. Beautiful restaurant and greeted by a polite and kind host. We had a salad special, burrata with heirloom tomatoes-- it was delicious.

Menu has lots to offer. We had a margherita pizza. The bread here was so good, I would recommend purchasing some to take home.

I would definitely return here if I was in the area, everything was lovely but would love to explore more.

Overall Experience: 4.5
Food: 4
Service: 5
Atmosphere: 4
Value: 4

We walked here and the area is a bit sketchy which was a little bit of a downer. The waiter mixed up our food with the table next to us so both my boyfriend and I had the wrong pinsa. I brought up the issue with the waiter and he kindly made me a new one despite me saying that it was okay (this was before we realized my boyfriends order was wrong too). They very kindly gave us the pinsa for free despite correctly their mistake which was a nice gesture.

The food was a little bland in my opinion, but I also think it's how the dish is supposed to be rather than  the restaurant itself. I still enjoyed the meal despite this.

Overall, this place was a cute and affordable date night spot with great service (except the mishap).

I came here on a Saturday night with a reservation. I showed up 30 mins early at 6pm and we were able to be sat right away. Eventually it got pretty busy. The server was great, he made good suggestions and was very helpful with the menu when we had questions. The interior is beautiful, very rustic and romantic. The area of the restaurant is definitely sketchy so I would suggest getting dropped off and maybe not driving your car like I did. Luckily, I found a really good parking and the sun was still out but yeah...sketchy part of the city and it's in an alleyway.

We ordered the basket of bread, a bottle of Tufaliccino wine, Montesacro pizza and the L Torta del Ghetto dessert. The bread basket came with three different types of bread, olive oil, with salt and pepper. I thought all of the bread was really tasty, and I liked the different textures and consistencies of all of them. The wine may have been mine and my friend's favorite thing from the evening. I would definitely suggest a bottle of this wine. We also got the Montesacaro pizza which was suggested by our server. The pizza was OK, I don't think I would order it again, but I thought the lamb sausages were really good and the dough was amazing. I learned I'm not big on artichokes. The dessert was also good but unfortunately I wasn't amazed. It was a little dry, but still tasty. If I ever come back I would wanna try a different dessert.
Overall, I would still come back and try a few other things on the menu and maybe with more than just one other person so we can try more than just a couple of things.

Stopped by this place for some pizza before catching a show at the orpheum.  The location is a little sketch, but once inside you forget what you walked through to get there.  We started with the burrata and the polpette.  We were a little disappointed that the burrata didn't come with bread. We ended up getting a separate order of bread ($5) to eat with it, but it didn't really have much actual bread and instead supplemented with bread sticks and thinly sliced stale bread.  Apart from that the starters were great. As for the pinsas we ordered the maranella, montesacro and the tormarancio.  All three were great, but the tormarancio was everyone's favorite.  Was a great meal overall and the service was excellent.  Would definitely consider coming back.

Came here for an after party quick dinner and it was DELICIOUS!! Not sure if it was because of the alcohol (pretty sure it wasn't) but the food was sooo good. Their burrata, pesto, anchovy appetizer is a must get. The anchovy is quite salty but the burrata and bread helps balances it. The bread is an extra $5 but it was much needed. The crunchy thin bread was SO GOOD. I wish I could get free refills. Their pizza is also really really good. The dough was soft and chewy. The soppressata on the pizza was amazing. It is like a better, thinner, and tastier pepperoni. The prices are a bit steep with the pizzas costing at least $20 for one person's portion, and appetizers costing at least $15.

The area outside the restaurant was a little sketchy. It was like an alley way and we went when it was dark so it was a little scary but the food is worth it. The staff there are also really nice and helpful.

Really lovely ambiance. The restaurant was dimly lit with interesting decor and just felt like you were sitting in someone's home.
We arrived for a friend's birthday with a reservation and were seated seamlessly. The staff was so kind and gave the him a small dessert consisting of a biscuit of sorts with a lit candle. They sang happy birthday and honked a little horn at the end which was really fun.

I and two other friends shared two pizzas. Amongst the 3 of us girls, it was the perfect amount of food. We ordered the Montesacro and the Corviale. Both were good and I thought it was a cute touch that they give everyone a pizza cutter to cut it yourself. I liked the Corivale more as the oyster mushrooms provided a really nice texture. I thought the sausage was good on the Montesacro and wished there was more of it.

Personally, I felt like the pizzas in general needed a little something more flavor wise. They were just a touch bland. They gave us a spicy chili oil and red pepper flakes and I had to put a generous amount of both on. Our table all agreed that the pizzas could use a little more flavor.  
Other than that, a great experience in both service and food.

This cozy and authentic Italian restaurant is tucked away in an unsuspecting alleyway in SOMA and was such a wonderful experience! The indoor space had a lot of character and was a vintage, romantic Italian vibe. Definitely make a reservation beforehand as it was busy and a sought after place on the weekend.

I came with a group of 5 and we ordered:
- Polpette Al Sugo: Beef Meatballs, San Marzano Sugo, Basil
- Formaggi E Salumi: Chef's Selection of Salumi and Cheese (charcuterie board which we LOVED)
- We tried 4 of their pizzas and they were all delicious! Their Montesacro Pizza (Rosemary Potato, Artichokes, Lamb Sausage, Buffalo Mozzarella, Chili) was worth trying.
- Pannacotta Al Finocchietto: I have tried Manny panncotta's and this one was one of my favorites. The addition of the virgin olive oil was unique and something I wouldn't have thought of adding on top..

Great wine + pizza! Wow- their pizzas are AHHMAZING. With a wheat allergy, I shouldn't even eat pizzas, but will gladly suffer for theirs. Don't forget to drizzle the hot chili oil over your pizza for a yummy kick. Also, you MUST order their pistachio pastry dessert, just perfection.
Warm, cozy space with such interesting decor. The staff were attentive and efficient. Highly recommend!

Nestled in a charming alleyway off 6th and Market, Montesacro is an authentic Italian restaurant that enchants visitors with its tasteful decor. Step inside, and you'll marvel at the vintage typewriters to numerous accolades.  Whether you're indulging in a mouthwatering meal or simply taking in the surroundings, Montesacro is sure to leave a lasting impression.

Given its popularity, it's better to make a reservation before visiting. Montesacro offers various seating options, but my personal preference was the bar area. The attentive bartender provided exceptional service, not only with his expert recommendations but also with his hilarious jokes.

We ordered the pulpo, or grilled octopus. It came soaked in olive oil and was perfectly seasoned. The star of the show are the pinsas, or pizza made from soy, rice, and wheat flower. I ordered the Corviale and the mushroom coupled with balsamic was surprisingly addicting. I would love to come back and try all the other options. We were so stuffed so we didn't get dessert but the couple next to us said the gelato flight and espresso drink was a perfect finish to their meal.

This is a perfect place for date night or even a nice dinner with friends. If you find yourself in SOMA, this restaurant is an absolute must-visit.

Passing through San Francisco and said I think I want pizza. Google maps brought me all the way here from Castro area. I'll admit I was a little irritated. I passed other pizza spots along the way and thought what the heck.

Pizza was soooo good and I didn't get the pizza with pork. Not sure what kind they were but oh boy. I have a picture. A whole party in my mouth. Yummy to me tummy.

Food and service is amazing!!!!
The ambiance here is also pretty nice!!
Pizza is very tasty!!

There's a lot of places like The Good Life Pizza in San Francisco, where a business pre-makes pizza, leaves it out, and heats it up to order. And out of all of them, I think this place might be the best solely because they have many different flavors. This type of business model is already stacked against them because the quality can't compete with something made to order, but I do appreciate the variety here.

If you're looking to crush some slices before drinking in the Marina like we did, the Chicken Pesto and Aloha pizzas are pretty good. I'm still personally upset with Costco for discontinuing the Combo pizza, and Good Life offers a pretty good one in its stead. The experience here is nice, and a great place to snack at night or if you're waiting in line for Balboa Cafe.

Where I take primary issue is with the price- many by-the-slice shops, including Good Life, charge a lot for a slice, and for some it can be inconvenient to the point of being unaffordable. If you're drunk and need something greasy in your system, it's a wonderful option, but I'd also consider finding someone frying hot dogs on the sidewalk.

Alhamdulillah, one of the best halal pizza parlors in San Francisco, if not the entire Bay Area.
The pizzas are carefully prepared, the crust is light & cracker-like, the cheese isn't greasy, the sauce is really tasty and the halal meat toppings are delicious & of high quality.

I tried their cheese pizza tonight and it was pretty solid! The cheese was flavorful and the pizza dough wasn't too thin or thick. I also really like how aesthetic their pizza boxes are lol

I ordered through delivery so I can't speak to their ambiance and service but would definitely get pizza from here again!

Really trendy pizza joint hidden amongst the chaos of the Marina. We came here after the West Coast Craft fair for a quick bite and it's totally worth coming in and grabbing a slice!

The cashier was so friendly and made good recommendations for what slices to try.

The tables have not only parmesan and chili peppers but parsley which is so awesome!!! I thought I was the only one who put parsley on pizza, LOL!

They're open late and I assume they get the late night drunchies, but definitely don't bypass this for a great lunch / quick bite.

Cashiers were kinda rude, we asked how much each slice was and he just pointed us to the menu (which only listed the price for a whole pizza). We also asked which pizza in the case was which so we can decide on which whole pizza to get and he was just being really short with us. It wasn't even prime time yet, it was pretty empty so either they're always just rude or they weren't feeling it that day.

We ended up getting a large combo and turned out to be ~$50. I didn't think it was worth it, didn't have enough meat, crust wasn't particularly good, was too thick and not crispy, very standard and overpriced. 1 star for the aesthetic design of their logo.

It was Monday night (3/20) when we were looking for a place to eat after a brisk walk along the Embarcadero.  We passed by Good Life Pizza and noticed it was still open at 10 pm.  Found out it closed at midnight on weekdays.  

The place was a "hole in the wall".  It supported a few tables with the main display counter set a few feet back and in front of the kitchen.  It was a business made simple.  As it was late, each of us ordered just a slice.

I ordered a slice of their Chicken Pesto pizza and my friend ordered a slice of BBQ chicken pizza (not on the menu).  I have no idea what my friend paid for it as it was on him.  Although one slice was ordered, I'm sure if the whole pizza was ordered it would still be a five star rating.  It was the best pizza I've ever eaten.  Not too salty and the pesto was not overwhelming.  I'm not one for pesto, but I had a feeling this pesto pizza deserved to be tried.

Small but cute little place in the Marina. It's a  hidden gem you just have to walk into and try. I just so happened to be on the bus when I thought to myself that I wanted to try something new.

So I got off the bus and walked in to a warm greeting by the cashier. He was very friendly, nice, and attentive. He answered all of my questions and allowed me to take my time deciding what I wanted. He even defended me against a rude DoorDash driver by telling him I was first to order. Which I thought was really nice.

The pizza was good. I asked him not to heat it up because I knew it would be a while before I made it home. He even told me how to reheat the pizza in the oven when I got home.

The only downfall was I asked for a reciept but he did not give me one. Which is fine because the food was good but I would have like to see how much each slice was. I think I spent 15 dollars on two slice but not sure
Delicious, ready to eat pizza slices with kind service. They toast the slices, so even though they're prepaid, the cheese is hot/melted and the crust is crispy. Yum!

This pizza place is amazing food and good customer service.  Local business Inner Richmond district in San Francisco!  the owner is friendly!  We go there for lunch and dinner At least three times in a month!  Family members like the pizza. Must order to eat , you will fall in love with the good quality pizza!  Love it!  The owner name Amer is nice and hard working business man.  Family owns the business!  We should support local business!
Wendy (the honest customer)
Amazing pizza and amazing service. Super helpful and welcoming people. New favorite spot for pizza in the Richmond!
Excellent pizza, and even better customer service. The guys who own the place are incredibly friendly and make the best pizza in the area.

Would definitely return!

This place could get me into trouble! It smells heavenly inside.

Such kindness and generosity with the best pies to boot, ok, I will marry you :D

It pains me to have to write this review because the people behind the counter are super nice and friendly. But the pizza is really dry and it's like biting into a very thick cracker with some pizza flavor.

I thought maybe I just got a very old slice but in looking at other customers' photos from this place that just seems to be their recipe. As a matter of fact, I ended up going to another pizza place just to wash this memory out of my mouth.

There's tons of good pizza in this town and all kinds of different styles but I just can't recommend this place. I wish I could. Come here if you like incredibly dry, hard to chew pizza. If you like pizza where you can taste the sauce, there's a little bit of oil, and the dough is pillowy with a light crunch, look elsewhere.

I really really want to like this place, been meaning to try it out for a long time. Finally had some friends over to watch the warriors game, so why not give this a try.

First thought, price seems pretty expensive- I mean $29 for a XL cheese pizza? Granted everything nowadays is expensive and I figured ok, it's supporting local business, just go for it.

Ordering was simple enough, got our order in under 45 minutes, supposedly they made it fresh.....

Pizzas came - what a disappointment! Pizzas didn't look like it was freshly made, they looked like it's been sitting out for at least hours before it got to our place. It wasn't even warm - think cafeteria pizza sitting out for a day or so. It's edible if that's the only thing available but definitely not enjoyable. Caesar salad was eh as well, dressing was in a packet, nothing short of something you would get at an amusement park.

Overall, disappointing. I really want to like it, but definitely won't be ordering from them again

Just wanted to send an update - to my surprise, the owner promptly replied to my review and apologized and even refunded my order. I was pleasantly surprised by that gesture. I'll definitely give this place another try but will do pickup instead of a delivery app!

I was really excited about this place based on all the reviews, but my experience didn't meet those expectations.

First the good. Delivery was fast and the chicken pizza was really tasty. I also thought the wings were tasty, not too greasy and pretty meaty.

I judge a pizza spot by its cheese pizza and I was disappointed by theirs. It wasn't very cheesy, pretty doughy and kinda tasted like cafeteria pizza. I was also bummed that we didn't receive the red sauce that was supposed to come with the wings, and our requests for modifications, while willing to pay more, were not acknowledged.

I always root for new spots, especially family owned businesses, but I probably won't go out of my way to order from here again.

Picture is a thousand words, compare their Supremo from
1 year ago and the one I got a few days ago, you be the judge, don't sacrifice on quality, increase your prices, but don't skimp, once your consistency is gone, customers are gone.
Not bad, okay pizza. Will do in a pinch. My hubby likes to grab a slice from here occasionally. Service is ok. Not much ambiance as it's mostly to go.

ONE OF THE BEST CALZONES IN THE BAY AREA!

I have been looking all over for the perfect calzones and this place checks off all the boxes. I know each restaurant has their own way of making their calzones. A lot of the ones I saw were either too small, too much batter or looks too bulky. The calzones here are a work of art. I mean.. the picture says it all. They do not skip on any ingredients. It's the perfect amount of crust. The crescent shape is the definition of perfect. It tasted even better than it looks. We got the Meatlovers Calzone with pesto. $24 for a medium is win for me.

The service was 10/5. The staff is super nice and patient. We were torn between the Meatlovers Calzone and the Pesto Calzone. We asked if we could substitute the red sauce on the Meatlovers with pesto and they were more than happy to make that change. Places like this deserve all my respect and I will definitely be coming back without a doubt. :)

Little star has amazing deep dish pizza. The employees are really friendly and are available to help with any questions you may have. There are many dietary options, feel free to ask staff if you need assistance.

Parking in the area is a bit difficult. If you are doing takeout be prepared to send someone in for you or to double park. Take out is next to the bar.  If eating inside, be aware there is limited seating. They have a jukebox which is fun!

We ordered a few pies for takeout ahead of time and when we got home the pies were a bit cold (reason for docking a star). But we reheated them and they were still tasty just a bit soggy on the bottom.

We still recommend them and can't wait to eat their pizza again!

Little Star small deep dish pizza, Italian sub green peppers for roasted red peppers. Please and thanks!

This is our go-to order but their thing crust is also delicious. It's simple but good quality ingredients. We enjoyed their house salad as well, good dressing.

To-go orders are usually ready within 30 minutes.

My star rating:
5  - must go!!!
4 - liked it, give it a try!
3  - it was alright
2  - I probably won't go back
1  - turnaround and run

We walked by this pizza shop a couple of times and it always smelled lovely, so we finally decided to give it a try!

Surprisingly, we didn't have to wait at all and got seated right away. The interior has nice mood lighting, so definitely good for a date night!

We got the meteor thin crust, and it was certainly good! So many toppings; probably the most toppings I've ever seen on a pizza. This somewhat overwhelmed the cheese and tomato sauce, but definitely a preference thing! The crust was also super good. It had a nice crisp with some dusting of cornmeal, which gave it a really nice texture.

Overall, really enjoyed it! Will stop by to give the deep dish a go since thats what they're known for.

The pizza is incredible, some of the best I've had in the city. Service is impeccable. They were so efficient and kind. Since the deep dish takes awhile they let us order it while we were waiting for our table which worked out perfectly! The overall vibe of the place was just perfect for our girls night out. Can't wait to go back!

One of very few actually good pizza places in SF. At least the Chicago style deep dish was! It was almost as good as Giordanos which was completely unexpected. I would definitely order from here again, especially if you want good pizza bc that's so difficult to find here in SF
The deep dish pizza crust is light and delicious. Slight dusting of cornmeal. Crisp like a cracker, not chewy and heavy. It is worth the wait.

Was having date night with the boy and we decided we wanted to do take out with the boy - this place popped up and we are so glad it did because the food was awesome! We ended ordering the following online:

* little star dd (small) - this was the deep dish pizza with spinach ricotta amongst other things and was delicious! A dash of honey with some crushed red pepper really did the trick!

*chicken wings - this was delicious and came with a side of bleu cheese. Really enjoyed the marinade for these wings

Overall the food was great and the order was ready when we got there which was awesome, everything was fresh and delicious! Would recommend this spot!

Great dine in for family time. Or for a date night. Servers were very friendly.

I didn't get a chance to take a photo of the star dish (deep dish pizzas) but here is the roasted kale!

The roasted kale was really flavorful! I wasn't expecting for it come out and be served this way but now I know of a new way to cook kale!  Roasted kale is served with Parmesan cheese and lemon wedge.

We got take out from Little Star when I was craving deep dish. Don't let the size of the small fool you - it is filling and could probably feed ~ 3 people! The ingredients are super fresh and the sauce was delicious. The crust had cornmeal in it, so it was a bit crunchier than the traditional dough that I'm used to. Overall, we were pleased with our deep dish pizza!

I've heard about Little Star every time the discussion surrounding best pizza in sf comes up. And for good reason:) it was great and so delicious. You have so many different pizzas to choose from. You can create your own pizza if you don't know what to settle for. And you have the choice of deep dish vs thin crust.  I loved the vibe here, and how it wasn't too crowded despite being right in the middle of all the divis weekend fun

Gaspare's is exactly what I want from an italian restaurant. It's ambiance feels like the classic kitschy vibe that is perfect for eating cheesy goodness. There are checkered tablecloths, grapes hanging from the ceiling, and my favorite part - mini jukeboxes on every table where you can play three songs for a quarter. We didn't have quarters, but they made change for us!

The food is also great. This is probably the only place in SF I've been with homemade mozzarella sticks that slap this hard. We had the Bruce's special pizza as well - it was really cheesy with plenty of toppings in every bite. We also ordered the gnocchi bolognese - it was not what I expected from a bolognese, more like a tomato cream, but I absolutely loved it none the less!

I'll definitely be coming back here - it's my new favorite neighborhood italian spot.

I've known about this restaurant for a while, from the '80's when they were on El Camino Real in Belmont.  It took me several years to learn that they were so close to home now, being in the Richmond District.  With the many restaurant closures in their area, I was happy to see a Groupon promotion and promptly bought two.  Reason?  I wanted to try their pasta besides having the family try their pizza.

On a recent Friday late afternoon, I placed a takeout order for my brother and me to share.  We started with the calamari fritti (yelp.com/user_local_phot…); this came with several wedges of lemon and two sauce containers or marinara and tartar sauce.  We were only able to finish about half and saved the rest for a meal later that week.  I opted for the baked lasagna (yelp.com/user_local_phot…); the filling consisted of beef, pork sausage and 3 cheese.  I like that it was not heavily filled with ricotta, the way I like it.  I also ordered a side order of meatballs (yelp.com/user_local_phot…) which comes two per order; I finished my lasagna so I only had room for one meatball with this dinner.  It was your standard meatball and was in a pool of tangy marinara sauce.  I ate the 2nd meatball with a slice of their provided bread a couple days later as a part of dinner.  My brother tried the ravioli with pesto with meatballs (yelp.com/user_local_phot…).  There were three slices of fresh delicious bread for each pasta order; the portions were generous so it became two dinners for him.

I still have one coupon to use likely in the next couple of weeks to try their pizza.  My brother and I both enjoyed their pastas and the calamari and I will continue to eye those deals to make visits here a regular thing.  The dining room was about 1/3rd full at 5:30 pm on a Friday night, a decent but disappointing number of diners, given the quality of the food we tried.  Hope things pick up for them.

We hadn't been to Gaspare's in a good while, but recently had a little family birthday there. It is better than ever!
For 5 people, we had 2 large pizzas and a caesar salad to share. The salad was fine but the pizza was old school & spectacular! One was pesto (no red sauce) with mushrooms & sausage. The other was red sauced with feta, spinach & artichokes. They were both perfect!
Add to that, lovely service with little 25 cent juke boxes in the booths and you have a great experience in a charming  neighborhood pizzeria.

I feel terrible reducing the stars, but something is happening in the kitchen in the past month or two that has made me decide tonight was my last order. Recent orders have just not been good. One order there was grit and dirt in my salad. The last three or so times I've ordered my favorite chicken scallopini it's been terrible: unseasoned, watery, tasting unpleasantly of uncooked alcohol or something with an edge. Chicken bone dry. I may have the misfortune of just getting some off nights, but I couldn't even finish tonight's order it was so disappointing.

Wow, this place gives you the warm and comfy vibes! We didn't have any issues with street parking when we arrived and were seated right away. Service is excellent, with smiles all around, the tables and booths were clean, and the decorations were fun to look at. I can see why they are highly rated here. They have a variety of pizza options, which was nice. We got their Hawaiian pizza and enjoyed it. The crust was baked just right, cheese was pulling, pizza was fresh ham and pineapples were juicy. Yum!

An original in the city and have been coming here for 15+ years. Love the atmosphere and the customer service is excellent. But the best part of course would be the pizza! Bruno's special hands down the best pizza. And it's as thin as you can get while still being able to hold up the toppings that they put on it. Definitely will come back!

I love me some Gaspaaaare's!! Sometimes you just need an unpretentious down to earth delicious pasta and this family owned joint hits the spot. My friends and I have fond memories of eating here, we made our post-covid return and it was just as good as we remembered it. We love the family feel vibe, the decor, and most of all the food! The pesto is incredible, the garlic cheesy bread delish, and they have suitable wine selections. You'll leave stuffed and satisfied and possibly with some leftovers.

had some pizza here after my Cowboys were beaten yet again by the 49ers last weekend and I was pleasantly surprised to have a very nice meal. Pizza was on point. Reminded me of a nice New York style and crispy. I like the Kitschy Italian americana feel to it. Will definitely go back when the Cowboys beat them next time. lol

got a meatball sub and a fettuccine Alfredo with chicken and mushrooms at 7pm on a Sunday - not sure if I just went at a bad time, but boy was it bland and overpriced. The fettuccine was $21.50. I received a sauce that was completely separated, extremely oily, under seasoned, and the chicken had no flavor at all. For the price??? Really disappointed. I could've gotten something much more gourmet at fiorella's right down the street for the same price.

As for the meatball sub, the bread was probably made on Wednesday. I mean it was hard and chewy. But for $10, I guess that's what you pay for.
At least the meatballs were half decent. Edible, at the least.

Save your money and go elsewhere.

It's 1974 in here. Ok maybe not the prices, but it has the ivy & Chianti bottles hanging from the ceiling trellis, the checkered tablecloths, the jukeboxes on each table that play Funiculi Funicula or Dean Martin, and they have Spumoni! You get an amazing Italian-American style family meal and a time warp thrown in for free. I'm fact I'm going tonight for my birthday dinner because I know every single member of the family will be happy, from age 11-55. Abbondanza!

Yes yes yes! I highly recommend! I ate there for my birthday and had the best lasagna of my life!
This is a lovley family owns business.
I had a great time. Service was great and I loved the family style dining atmosphere !

This place is definitely a legacy restaurant (not sure if it officially is but it should be)- a historical destination. ***Come for the nostalgia and the pizza.

This time we didn't have any pizza and opted for the plates. Not the greatest decision on our part.
The ambiance is the fun part as it's still the original paintings from the 1930s.
Service seems like they are just there to do what they've always done and they don't like their jobs. It felt like diner service instead of quality restaurant service.
The plating and quality of the food could definitely be upped.
We had calamari, Veal Rollettini, and Chicken Parmesan. The sauce that was served with the calamari was the same sauce on the chicken parm and pasta. It needed help. The calamari was edible, but nothing exciting.
The Veal Rollettini was the favorite, although the plate looked sad. Three rolls on a large plate sitting atop just grease.
The chicken parm was edible, but I never want it again.
I was super disappointed in this meal as the restaurant seems as though it would have the greatest food, since it's been around for so long. I've been impressed by the pizza in the past.
The wine we had is a blend made only for Tommaso's and it was great.
Worth a visit to say you've come, but don't come with expectations- and order pizza to be safe.

There's so many things to love about North Beach, but the number 1 thing I love about this neighborhood is the amount of authentic Italian restaurants all in once place.

One of my coworkers recommended that we go to this place since none of us never been before and I'm glad that she recommended this place! They open around dinner time (5 pm to 10 pm) which I thought was weird but the place is phenomenal!! I loved how the inside felt like I was in Italy with the lighting, pizza oven and the long table down the middle of the restaurant. My coworkers and I got there as soon as they opened and there was not a wait time. Our server was great and our food came out pretty fast!

I got the pepperoni pizza with some bruschetta and they all tasted great! I only ate two slices of my pizza before I got full. The price is definitely reasonable compared to some of the other restaurants I've went to in North Beach! I recommend this place if you're looking for a small business with great Italian food!

In a foodie city flush with 4 and 5 star restaurants everywhere you turn, it's refreshing to find an old school restaurant that serves home cooked meals in a setting reminiscent of yesteryear. It's nondescript, the servers are patient when you can't decide what you want, and the food is plentiful.  
When you eat a "basic" chicken Caesar salad, it's usually just that, basic.  But the dressing made the salad, and it came with tender chunks of rotisserie chicken vs the usual grilled chicken.   The margarita pizza had the perfect crust, with good texture and the right amount of yeast.  
Chicken Parmesan was thin and crispy with a small side of penne in a thick marinara sauce.  While I wouldn't rate the food 5 star, it was close enough, because the atmosphere and good service makes for a 5 star Italian experience that leaves you wanting for more.
Excellent lasagna tonight! The Cesar salad was so good! Yummy cannoli with a touch of lemon, and a great cup of strong coffee!

Amazing family brunch authentic Italian place
Chianti while you wait wood fired oven for pizza

Absolutely shocked at how good this pasta is! Came here with my boyfriend for dinner and didn't expect much when we walked in (the decor and vibe is very old school/traditional), but their pasta is SO tasty.

I ordered the cheese ravioli with marina sauce and my boyfriend ordered the meat ravioli with pesto sauce and meatballs. I'm not a huge fan of marinara sauce but thought the cheese ravioli itself was killer. Also tried a bit of my boyfriend's pesto sauce and it blew my mind -- it was incredibly flavorful and creamy. He overall thought his meal was really good too. Would definitely recommend ordering their pesto ravioli! We also ordered a traditional cannoli and it was pretty good but the filling was definitely not the typical vanilla cream in most cannolis -- it had a strong lemon flavor.

Service was initially a bit weird (we just stood by the door waiting for a while) but once we sat down it was good. Definitely planning to come back to get their pesto ravioli!!

GREAT PIZZA!! EXCELLENT SERVICE AND LOVELY LOW KEY VIBE!
Definitely worth stopping by to check out if you're in the area and even if you're not in the area and enjoy pizza swing on by!
We got a large pizza which was enough for 3 people (two guys & myself)
We walked here from our hotel so I'm not sure about the parking situation but grab yourself an Uber and get your pizza fix!

Let me tell you a story about a girl who didn't really like pizza which made her life easier because she's lactose-intolerant...and then Tommaso's happened lol seriously though, I will double up on that lactade just so I can eat the amazing fresh spinach and shaved parmesan pizza! Everything about it is pure perfection! And for those garlic lovers, the fresh garlic hidden under the spinach just elevates this pizza even more. The crust is delicious too! They also have some amazing cold veggie apps and pepperoni pizza! AND the wine is amazing!!! Their Tommaso's red blend is made especially for them and can only be bought there! I may have taken home a bottle or two or five...and that's just the food! The service is absolutely amazing! Agostino, Anna, and Carmen are some of the most amazing, kind, and interesting people you will ever meet in your entire life! The parklets are always nice and cozy and have heaters. And inside is the cutest classic feeling Italian restaurant! I love the murals painted on the walls and the movie posters and pictures hanging everywhere. This place has been around since 1935 so there is so much history here! Absolutely everyone needs to try this place whether they are local or just in town for a visit!

When we lived in San Francisco, we dined at Tomasso at least twice a month, so it was very comforting to return after an absence of several years and find the place more or less exactly as it was in the late 90s - with the addition of the parklet outside.

We started with the broccoli in olive oil and lemon and carpaccio. The broccoli was incredibly tender, chilled to perfection and had just the right amount of acidity to balance the olive. As for the carpaccio, I think my wife finished it before I could get a fork near her plate.

For mains we had a pizza (half sausage&pepper, half margarita) and the lasagna and neither disappointed, in fact they were better than I remembered them. We brought home a LOT of leftovers (intentionally) and the lasagna was even better then next day. We finished with a cannoli, and as someone who grew up in Brooklyn eating in Little Italy in NYC on a regular basis I have to say that Tommaso is as good or better than any Italian eatery I've ever visited.

We were very pleased to see Carmen still working the tables - She is an absolute gem and it's a testament to her family that Tommaso has been a North Beach institution for over 85 years!

The service was amazing - considering we arrived at 6pm on a Saturday we were seated immediately and the food just kept coming until we were stuffed. Kudos to the Crottis, the staff, and the wonderful experience that Tommaso always is.  Although we're up in the North Bay now, we look forward to every visit here.

Came here recently for my 26th birthday and the vibes were 12/10. We ordered:
- 3 orders of the cacio e pepe (came highly recommended
- burrata pie
- chocolate budino
- almond Meyer lemon ricotta cake
- pepperoni pie (not pictured)
- creamsicle gelato (not pictured)
- pepperoni pie (not pictured)
- arugula & pea tendril salad (not pictured)
- radiatore alla vodka (not pictured)

Literally inhaled all the food. Healthy portions, decadent desserts, and great service. Our server was able to accommodate an extra guest for our reservation and checked in multiple times to ensure everything tasted good. Still thinking about that cacio e pepe tbh....

I had a pleasant dining experience in Fiorella -Clement. It's a cute and small Italian spot in the Richmond. Had a reservation on a Friday night for 6:30pm. Arrived there just in time, but with busy parking area, took us about 15-20 mins to find a spot. Called them and told them we were running late, and they were still able to accommodate us. It was a pretty busy night for them but the hostess was very friendly and was able to sit us down about 5 mins after checked in.

Food was satisfying and everything was good. Ordered the arancini, bruschetta, salciccia pie and rigatoni. Enjoyed all of them but my fave was the arancini (I'm partial tho hehe) and tha pizza.

omg... new placeholder text just dropped

the reviews are extremely confusing, specifically someone else giving this three stars when it was all good???? idk not to be throwing SHADE in the reviews.

I thought this place was pretty good! went here during restaurant week 2023 (which I should've ordered but oh whale) and got the winter pie and the spritz. both were really good!!! spritz feels extremely normal and i guess its italian so can't go wrong here

some friends I went got that and the arancini which looked really good. plates and decor have really good vibes, extremely cute, good date night spot. definitely recommend grabbing a reservation online if you want to come during a "popular" dinner hour

only location issue is that its out in the richmond district which is hard to get to if you're not close.

Came here on Wednesday night after my fitness class with my friend. Our plates of pasta looked very beautiful but were cold! My rigatoncini (my current favorite pasta dish to order) was too thick for My preference. I was hungry and finished the whole plate, but I was less enthusiastic when I noticed these things earlier in.

This is a solid spot for dining.

It's Italian cuisine.

They have indoor and outdoor searing to dine in.

Parking at times is relatively easy given it's in the less populated less congested part of Clement Street

I heard great things about this place from my friends and TikTok, but the food was pretty mid. Service was a bit slow, my pizza's crust was burnt and I couldn't enjoy it. My short rib lacked salt/flavor and the pasta was just alright. The best thing was the pizza, it was delicious, but the inedible crust made me sad. Maybe I caught them on a bad day, but I wouldn't recommend this place. I unfortunately don't see the hype. | IG: Smackinfood

This Italian spot is right around the corner from me and it has such a cute vibe, it has Bay Area themed wallpaper with faces like Mac Dre and elE-40 on it! But anyway, let's get to the important stuff! There's and outdoor patio if you have pets, but we sat inside because it was so cold. We got:
- OG baby lettuce salad: the dressing had a creamy texture to it which I liked because it coated the lettuce.
- clam pie pizza: this was my favorite thing by far, I loved the garlicky clam flavor, and liked that it also had an herby cheese flavor to compliment it! Also I'm a fan of thin crust pizza cause it doesn't make me feel so heavy afterward and that way I can eat more!
- chitara alla cacio e pepe: this was really cheesy, and don't come for me but it's a little too cheesy for me compared to most cacio e Pepe's I've had. It was a little overwhelming and I didn't taste the pepper as much!

Overall it's a nice restaurant to eat at and it's right in the heart of mid-Richmond district. Pro tip: use the chili oil on the table for EVERYTHING to add an extra kick!

Warm and friendly neighborhood restaurant with modern flair and carefully crafted dishes.

Very kid friendly with lots of pizza options and two large outdoor dining spaces. Our favorite is the covered back patio, which has plenty of ventilation without the chilly breeze from Clement Street.

Great selection of wines as well, with an emphasis on Italian selections that pair well with the pizzas and pastas.

We were very lucky this week and were allowed to be seated despite being a walk-in. So first tip, definitely make a reservation, because this place is extremely popular. You can also enjoy the cool wallpaper with some familiar faces such as E-40, Mac Dre, 2 $hort, Joe Montana, and others. They also show some iconic areas of SF such as Alcatraz, Golden Gate Bridge, etc. Regarding the food:

1) Nonna's Meatballs. Excellent appetizer that is savory, fragrant, with a nice touch of cilantro and cheese. The sauce is excellent (you may want to save some for the wings or pizza)

2) Herbed Chicken. You get drumsticks and wings. Although I am a drum-man, the wings impressed me! So tender with lots of flavor. They definitely put their heart into make these as delicious as possible

3) Sweet Corn Pie. It sounds weird, but the corn, red onion, and cheese are such an excellent, subtly done combination.

4) NYC Style Pie. This is a nice upgrade for the pep fans out there. Lots of small, tasty pepperoni over a strong layer of cheese. Well-done classic pep pie!

Takeaways. It wont hurt your wallet, and the food is delicious. Kids get an awesome picture with some local neighborhood buildings, and can color them with crayons. Pizza comes out of an old-school brick oven that seems to be well-maintained, hot-hot-hot. The older Italian gentleman is super cool (I think he is the owner) and takes the spirit of service into his own hands. He made our whole party feel taken care of at all times, despite being busy managing the logistics of to-go orders and bussing around trying to get everyone's dishes on the table piping hot. You have to admire his meticulousness (even the way one stacks to-go orders has to be in line with his principled spirit of service and organization). Also, there seems to be some seating in the back that is half indoors half outdoors. Try to get back there for some good vibes.

Some of my family from SF took me here for my last meal before I went back home. Best thing I ate my entire trip.

We got in just as they were opening, the place had a really nice vibe to it. I loved the wallpaper, it was interesting seeing all the Bay Area references (I had to have most of them explained to me). Generally just felt like a comfortable place to sit down, eat, and talk.

All the staff that I interacted with were incredibly friendly and gave some great recommendations. Since I'm allergic to peanuts and nuts, I always ask servers if there's anything I should worry about or that I should avoid. The server that we had (I can't remember her name) made me feel incredibly safe, and happily explained everything to me. I rarely feel that comfortable, it was something I really appreciated.

I'll definitely be back here if I'm ever in the city again

This is our third time coming here and everything was absolutely delicious as always. The pizzas are gorgeous and a lovely Chilli oil with pieces of Chilli peppers in it is served upon request.

As a gluten free person I can only have the pasta but it is so tasty that I never feel I miss out.

My picky toddler gobbled up the kids gnocchi with his choice of pesto sauce. A little thing but the sauce was so smooth that I think any toddler would approve!

He got milk as his drink and the discerning waitress gave him half a glass to start. Smart! They also greeted him with crayons and an Italy themed coloring page.

There is a screen inside showing places in Italy. Order an Aperol Spritz and pretend you're there. The food definitely supports the fantasy!

I would be happy to write a review for Napizza!

Napizza is an excellent choice for anyone looking for delicious, healthy and affordable Italian food. The first thing you will notice upon entering the restaurant is the inviting aroma of freshly baked pizza emanating from the kitchen. The decor is modern and cozy, with plenty of seating options available for both small and large groups.

In terms of the food, Napizza truly shines. Their pizzas are made with high-quality, locally sourced ingredients, and the crust is thin and crispy, just as it should be. The menu offers a variety of options for vegetarians, vegans, and meat-lovers alike, so there's something for everyone. In addition to pizza, they also offer salads, sandwiches, and pasta dishes.

The prices at Napizza are also very reasonable, especially considering the quality of the food. You can easily feed a family or a group of friends without breaking the bank.

Lastly, the service at Napizza is top-notch. The staff are friendly, knowledgeable, and always willing to make recommendations or answer any questions you may have. The restaurant is also very clean and well-maintained, which adds to the overall experience.

In summary, Napizza is a fantastic restaurant that offers delicious, healthy food at an affordable price, all served with excellent service. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for an authentic Italian dining experience.

I took my gf out to this place during our Valentines Weekend. She took me out to the sister restaurant, Bottega, and when we heard about this place, we always wanted to come down and try.

We had made a reservation but got there a little late. The place is really small and I recommend you to reserving a table on a warmer day because they do have seating. But I thank the waiter for taking us in even though we got there a couple minutes left. We sat at the bar and it was very packed. I would have liked to sit at a table because the speakers were right over us, but I guess it'll have to be the next time we go down. The service deserves a 3.5!

The food was really good. My gf had gotten the Sachetti and I had gotten the gnocchi. Her sachetti was very creamy and the sauce was very rich. The gnocchi was cooked perfectly, though I don't think the sauce was all that. The pizza though, was really good. It was a thin and crispy crust. The cold cheese caught me off guard but I still enjoyed it. Because we sat at the bar, we got to watch the workers make the pizza and cook it in the pizza oven. It was pretty cool to watch. The food deserves a 3!

I genuinely liked Bottega a little bit better than Napizza. I think this place was Graeme's more towards the pizza than the other food. I do still recommend this place to others!

Really reminds me of the Bottega in Mission. Might be under the same management? They have a lot of the same exact decor and dishes. The food is similar, and just as tasty. The restaurant itself is small, with a really massive chandelier. Our server was really nice, but our food took a while to come out. The pizza was pretty good, the salmon pasta we had was the highlight. Solid Italian spot!

The ambiance is nice and the food was great. The playlist during the time we want was phenomenal. Service was also amazing as they were very attentive and asked if we needed anything extra for the pizza.

The service was good, and we didn't have to wait long for the pizza. We ordered the Ortolana (mixed vegetables) pizza, and the Salsiccia (Italian sausage) pizza. Both pizzas were very good. The Neapolitan crust was light and crisp, and the toppings went well together and had great flavor.

We've visited twice and would visit more often if we didn't live in Oakland. The food is constantly good/excellent but what really makes this place truly special is the warm, friendly service we received from Ajara on both visits. Her food and wine recs are spot on so definitely ask her for recommendations. Thank you Ajara for always making our night!!

We ended up in the Marina, and while everyone else was being a Santa, we were eating pizza. I had Napizza bookmarked for a while.

So let's get to da pizza. We ordered the potato white pizza (Rosmarino). The potatoes were really yummy, and there were plenty of sprinkles of rosemary. The CRUST was super bubbly and chewy. Everyone knows I love a crust with excellent dough and chew to it. It was the thickest Neapolitan crust that I have experienced in years.

The decor was really aesthetically pleasing and such a cute spot. And our waitress was very personable. The menu of pizzas includes both red and white ones. I want to return to try the baked garlic pizza app. They also kindly said they could make any non-veg pizza into a veg one.

Overall, Napizza is a solid pizza!

My friends and I were able to get a table without reservations on a friday! We didn't wait long either so we got lucky cause the place was packed.

The food was very good, we shared a couple pizzas which was honestly enough for the four of us. The dough was really nice and doughy. The ingredients tasted fresh and service was attentive and friendly! This was also the first time where each staff we interacted with spoke Italian! That was pretty neat because it felt like being in Italy or should I say Eataly.

If you like neopolitan pizza, this place is good!

Really fun to eat more pizza in San Francisco

Pizza towns are best like Italy

Dad u gave me the best time

Calzone today sausage cheese spinach

Huge and tasty

Marina restaurant

My mother used to be here when she was a kid so we decided to go back. It was so delicious. They even have a copy of the original 1959 menu on the wall. This is a special place. There's a reason they have been open so many years, they are quality. It's a special place and the new owner who has been there for decades is doing an amazing job.

This is the best pizza in the Bay Area. I'm just going to say it. Get the "Sunset Special" with regular crust. Try the spaghetti and the garlic bread. It's all delicious. Eat there, lots of seating. Fun to people watch through the big windows.

The cashier and chefs are all really good at their jobs. The waiter who has been there for 25 years, (sorry I didn't catch his name) is really professional and kind. You can tell he is the best at his job. Joe the owner is really kind also and cares about customer satisfaction. I would give six stars if I could. Thumbs up and a high five! Check out Pasquale's.

Went less then a month ago three people.

My son and dad has the steak sandwiches they said it was too smoky flavored they didn't enjoy it at all.

I had what I always had the chicken and fettuccine plate with spinach plate they put the chicken on the grill it was horrible and the fettuccine sauce was drippy and dark and didn't taste good like it normally does.

I have found a new place in San Bruno that offers a pretty good fettuccine dish.  We don't do Pasquales anymore. I can't spend money on bad food why did they change their recipes.

fYI post :

They got new phones so their lines are a little wonky..  but they are open!

A friend and I stopped here after the inner sunset flea market on Sunday.  I'm pretty particular about my pizza, and I have to admit I wasn't expecting too much from this spot.  It was a bit run down looking and has mixed reviews on Yelp, but surprise surprise, the pizza was great!  We ordered the Sunset Special, well done, and it was delicious.  Sausage, pepperoni, peppers, onions and mushrooms.  It was cooked perfectly and had lots of flavor.  The table service was great too, even though the server had many tables to deal with.  I'll be back!

This is one of my favorite pizza places in the world! Almost every time we go to San Francisco we at least get a combo to bring back to Merced. We have been going to Pasquale's for years. Our favorites are the Sunset Special pizza, the meat ravioli with meat sauce, the cheese tortellini with marinara and antipasto salad. The food is delicious. Eat in or take it to go, either way you will leave happy.

Best pizza on the planet! I have been getting their pizza since I was in high school! So many years ago, ha, ha. They are still the same.... DELICIOUS! You just can't beat them. Love the Sunset Special too.
We did have that 1 bad experience that I wrote about a few years ago, but that must have been the cook back then. No other bad experiences, just perfect.

Pretty good. Pizza was more on the "thin slice" side. Coulda used more cheese. Fettuccine Alfredo was average and slightly heavy on the nutmeg. The "stuffed baked potato" a la carbonara was incredible. Never had anything like that in my life. Parking is a pain in the backside but what else is new in San Francisco. Definitely worth a try.

Pasquales has been a neighborhood favorite for as long as I can remember! Perfect for when you're looking for a reliable, no frills pizza parlor. We ordered 3 pizzas to go and they were hot with ample toppings. We ordered a house special, vegetarian, and a 3 topping with mushroom, sausage, and spinach. I usually opt for the house special, but it was quite salty this time and I couldn't eat more than one slice. My favorite was actually the vegetarian - all the flavors of the toppings came together nicely and I loved the garlic on top. I was afraid the crust would get soggy with all the veggies, but it held together nicely without it being too thick or doughy which I appreciated!

Most of my experiences at Pasquale's has been fantastic, but today the service was off.

I use a chosen name, and when the individual took my order I told them my chosen name, as that is what I go as. When I gave the individual my card they noticed it was a different name then what I told them. They proceeded to say "no you're name is __" scribbled it out then proceeded to write my deadname.

I write this not to call out this individual but request the establishment to be a bit more cautious regarding this as it could hurt someone in the future that is trans, non-binary, or simply goes by a different name.

It just was off.

The pizza was so good and has great quality. The cheese pizza and Meat earter pizza. The served good pizzas.  It has nice amount of toppings.
I dined there for pizza recently but a bit disappointed with the service, my food served late.

First time trying this pizza place and wow was I blown away! The line wrapping around the block was the first sign that this place was serving some unreal pizza.

The square pizza slices being served up here are perfect in everyway, not too cheesy, not too heavy, everything is just right. Me and my girlfriend got 4 slices to share, it was enough food for 3-4 people, and the prices are fantastic especially for the SF area. The environment outside the shop is great and its a cool part of town to top it off.

You get your slices very quickly after ordering so there isn't even a noticeable wait time, and they always come out piping hot. The clam and garlic was by far my favorite slice that we got, and is honestly one of the best slices of pizza I have ever had. 10/10 would recommend this place to any pizza lover!

Don't come here during the weekend, or especially when there are sport esque events going on because they will not be able to handle orders and there will be chaos. We only ordered one slice of the Clam & Garlic for $4.50, and it was okay-tasted like a normal Detroit style pizza slice! My only gripe was that the clam to garlic ratio was so off, maybe because they really finely sliced the clams and they skimped on the portion of this too. If I were in a pinch for pizza and in the North Beach neighborhood, I'd stop by, but would caution to others not to expect anything grandiose as their menu is pretty standard.

One of my favorite places for pizza in the city! My friends and I always go for a large pizza and split half half for the clam & garlic pizza and the combo. Came here right at opening and the staff there was so nice! They mentioned that if I wanted to order ahead, I could just call in and do a easy pickup (where we didn't have to find parking) and just have someone get dropped off to pick up the pizza.

This option is always great for picnics or to bring to a party. Not to mention, the large pizza comes with 8 LARGE slices.

Out of the two options of clam & garlic and the combo pizza, my favorite personally is the combo. The amount of vegetables and meat is perfect especially with crushed red pepper!

Golden boys also has another location in San Mateo that I have yet to go to, but can't wait to try since it's much closer to my house. They are also open late night at this location so perfect for a post club/bar night.

I just love this place! Love the thickness, taste, and smell of Golden Boy pizza. The service is always friendly. It's delicious fresh and delicious as left overs. My go to is the pepperoni and my husband loves the sausage pizza.

It was an unfortunate afternoon today. We ordered three pizzas, a salad, a cocktail, two desserts and three glasses of prosecco. One full glass spilled and a second partial glass spilled (since the kids were with us). They didn't try to comp us for the drinks at all. It's surprising because our bill was over $200 with a hefty tip. Clearly it was an accident, but they didn't pay any mind. We also did most of the cleanup. I won't be going back sadly. I just think folks in the service industry should know that accidents happen, and the nice thing to do in this situation is give your customers a new drink in a new glass. Pizza was decent but, I really wish the service was up to par. Definitely school your staff on the proper way to serve customers who frequent your restaurant or you will surely be out of business soon.

My wife and I enjoyed our experience at Damn Fine Pizza. We ended up there after walking on the beach. Our friends, another couple, recommended it. We have a routine of strolling on Ocean Beach, which is enjoyable despite the cold and the wind. We started when they had a dog, but they had to give it up because of aggressive behavior, and we now get together with only our pup. They have been sort of regulars at the sister business, a coffee shop with, they told us, the best cinnamon toast. So our quartet plus canine for five logged two and a quarter miles on a convivial Saturday afternoon. We then piled into one car to make it easier to find parking and headed to this place.

We split three pizzas. One had clams, another mushrooms, and the last sausage. We also had the fried vegetable starter, the "fritto" of cauliflower and green beans. Our pizzas were more on the limp of the spectrum than well done. Our friends remarked, however, that the first time they had dined at the establishment, their pies were much more crisper, on the verge of burnt. The claim here is "wood fired." I have no doubt. The ingredients had to have exceeded minimum standards. They had that taste that is achieved when you are hungry. The appetizer was lightly breaded and satisfyingly fresh and flavorful. There were no complaints about anything. We also had wine, the ladies; beer, my counterpart in the other couple; and a sour beer, me. They had a good list of beverages for a pizza joint.

Although we were there only a few minutes past five, by the time we left it was full up. They are popular. I'm surprised from time to time that the Outer Sunset neighborhood attracts such crowds, but that is my ignorance more than anything else. The only aspect of the evening that should be mentioned so it is not a surprise is that San Francisco is not a cheap city. This is normal by city standards.

Our friends are the sort of good friends whom I am glad to make later in life. As you age, you lose the wonderful ability that children have to meet a new acquaintance and just about immediately come to a mutual decision to be pals. In professional settings, people have mixed motives to be collegial. You have interactions that are not ideal. Yet we remain social animals, as Aristotle declared. We yearn for associations with others that are not transactional in nature. And we need those places we can meet. Damn Fine Pizza is such a space. It is easygoing, welcoming, and offers fine provisions.

The anchovy pizza was the surprise star here. We usually love a good mushroom pizza so ordered one of those too, but it just wasn't as flavorful as the anchovy pizza. Cute vibes and seems like a great spot for families, friends, and date nights alike. The bottom of the pizza is a little softer than I'd prefer, but the rest of the flavors were fantastic.
Delicious pizza. Friendly staff. We keep going back or ordering for delivery. Salads are excellent.
Delicious pizza, good prices, friendly service. They're now open for lunch too! The whole family enjoyed all the food (meatballs, pasta, pizza, lava cake).

Their pizza is the best I have had in many years. Delicious thin slices that fold just right. We had the garden pizza, fresh raw veggies topping the cooked pizza part. There was something unique about their mozzarella cheese; it had just the right consistency of gooey, not rubbery. I'm looking forward to going back.

Second review, I still come here and still love their mushroom with prosciutto pizza!

Today my girlfriend ordered my go to favorite and they accidentally made it with arugula which she absolutely dislikes. Won't even poke the greens with a stick lol.
I took it back in and they made a new one immediately without question.

I'm glad to see people dining in now. Hope they keep up their great pizzas and service.

Amazing- great pizza
Probably the best pizza in San Francisco, super friendly staff.
Great service, delicious pizza. My wife and I enjoyed a really cozy meal with big mugs of hot chocolate.

I had a wonderful experience here. This is another street-style restaurant with a small pick-up window. There is a line for single-slice pizzas and a line for whole pizzas. The workers are funny and have great character. Managing that many orders is hard work, and keeping a good attitude is impressive.

Order: I got the clam & garlic pizza along with the combo pizza, which were both to die for. The pizza was thick and fluffy without being overwhelming.

After getting lunch, clam and garlic pizza sounded too good to pass up so we stopped by. Between three people, we were already full, so we shared a slice into thirds. After trying a bite, we got back in line for our own slices  

The garlic makes this so aromatic and delicious, and the thin, crispy crust was just perfect.

Definitely a must try in Little Italy!

Finally made it to this place and so glad I did. Yelpers got it right! It's a must visit place!

I arrived on a Saturday lunchtime and I was expecting a long line but to my surprise, there were only about 10 people ahead of me.

I had made up my mind on a slice of combo but once I saw the clam and pizza, I decided on the latter. I was even considering to get both but I was planning to visit several places that day. I'm glad I stuck with my last minute decision cuz a slice was enough to fill me up.

Line went fast. Service was also fast. Cashier offered to warm up my pizza which I didn't even know was an option but certainly a toasted warm pizza made it better. I didn't bother to add any Parmesan nor pepper flakes. It's already as good as it gets.

Clam & garlic is a pizza topping combo I'd never had before but it's what you would imagine and more (lucky for me there's no such thing as too much garlic). The pepperoni holds its own as well! Love that the crust is thick and has a crisp, but overall fluffy and not overly oily/heavy. The pizza here is the perfect quick bite.

In the evenings the line gets crazy but at lunch you'll be on your way in a few minutes!

One of the best last night pizza I've had! The pizza slice is $4 and definitely worth the wait after a night out on the city! They make the pizza really fresh and it's really hot when they give it to you. Probably have to wait 5 min max after you order but highly recommend!

Damn Fine is damn good. One of my favorite pizza spots in SF - the pizza, good vibes and wonderful service are all reasons to keep coming back.

The cocktails are fabulous and if you sit at the bar, the bartenders are super personable and I had a wonderful experience with them.

Sausage and Sage Pizza - my favorite pizza is hands down. Add mushrooms and top with hot honey, Calabrian chili and dip in ranch. Trust me, this is the way to go!

Pepperoni Pizza - is also amazing. They use the cup pepperonis and we all know those are the best ones.

The atmosphere, decor, and service are all outstanding, and we loved everything we ordered. The pizzas have a thinnish, resilient crust that's slightly charred, so you have to fold a slice in half to eat it, but it's delicious and the toppings stay put. There's also an excellent drinks menu, with lots of appealing non-alcoholic options.

The delicata squash appetizer was so tasty, a perfect combination of flavors and textures. One of us generally dislikes squash, but had multiple servings of this and may rethink their opinion of squash.

We had the Pig in the Woods (pancetta, enoki, truffle, and more) and Potato Pesto with pancetta on just half of each, and the Cheese Please. Every slice was amazing.

Parking can be tricky, but it's worth taking transit, or parking a block away and walking. At 6:30 on a Tuesday, we had no wait for a table for 4, but it filled up fairly soon after we arrived.

What a local gem! My friend recommended this neighborhood pizzeria and it is only 10 minutes away from me. We ordered two pizzas and a meat ball appetizer for three people to share and that is plenty of food. They all taste so delicious. Thing chewy dough with delicious sauce and cheese. The server is super friendly. Love the decor and the ambiance as well. Modern, industrial and artistic all in one place. We will definitely come back. Highly recommend!

Created by former-interior designer Laura Seymour Damnfine opened in early-2021 to serve "all of my favorite things," and since that time the Outer Sunset space has been slinging a concise menu of Pizza, Coffee and Wine to a growing fanbase.

Not always a Restaurant, the open space now fitted with a full bar and custom-built oven, Damnfine is open early to late with good vibes and ten Pies daily including many with clever names like the "Grinch" or "Alotta Burrata."

Using 72-hour naturally fermented Dough, the fact that Seymour is entirely self-taught surprising, guests can expect an easily-digestible Crust with good rise and plenty of chew beneath heavily applied Toppings while Salads and Appetizers such as overworked Meatballs are less memorable.

Pizza as expected. High quality ingredients. Flavorful. Friendly pickup. I got the cheese pizza and the garden pizza. I especially appreciate that the pizza wasn't burned; some wood-fired pizza over-cooks their pizza resulting in very blackened crust.

Oh this wood fired pizza is sooo good!
I came here like on the first or second day after it opened, for takeout, and I was a little disappointed because I didn't think the crust was cooked enough and my 3 eating partners agreed. But, this place is in my neighborhood, the owner is super cool. I just had to give them another chance. So, I did. Fast forward; now I stop in every Friday for lunch and I am addicted to this amazing pizza! Every offering is delish! They have a decent beer on tap selection too. Pastas, clams and a super good Caesar salad. I mean this Caesar salad dressing is the best and I am a Caesar salad fanatic! Beer and pizza on a Friday afternoon or any day for that matter. Love this place and highly recommend it.

The servers are top notch! Very friendly and cheerful! They are always happy to see you! The Pizza and salads are pretty good too! They even use double zero flour grade for their crust!
Did you know you can customize your pizza toppings outside of the menu too?
This place is SOLID!!!

Amazing pizza!! Staff is also very friendly and professional. Definitely recommend for those that love pizza but also those that are in a hurry because they are so hungry. It only takes 90 seconds to cook this pizza!!!

Sat 10/8/22 got in line for Golden Boy Pizza I got there lot so the line was long.  Just a window to buy pizza, indoor dining is closed off.

I got 2 slices of clam & garlic $4.50 each, I paid $9 in Cash.  I think they take credit card now, not sure.  It's still my favorite.

I ate it across the street.

I had this place bookmarked for a long time and dog sitting nearby was a great excuse to try it out!

Pro pizza tip: Get here before 7 PM to avoid a really long line and wait. We arrived just after 6 PM and our wait was under 10 minutes. By 7:15 PM when we left, the line was at least 10 tables-worth long. (And I'm not sure that even included those already waiting.) They send you a text when your table is ready.

We came here for the pizza, however the tomato and ricotta salad was AMAZING. I'm talking like top 10 salads in my life. The tomato was so fresh, ricotta perfection, and amazing olive oil and balsamic.

The pizza was equally amazing. We ordered margherita. The crust was chewy and amazing. The tomato sauce tasted so fresh. It was near perfection. #crusty choice

The location is larger than it looks with an entire back patio area. However, I've never seen tables so close together in my life.

The tables inside (for two people) are so close together. I was almost afraid that if I ate too much I wouldn't be able to exit my seat. You have to slide with your front or back facing the table next to you. You will totally hear the exciting conversations of your next door table neighbors.
