I always hope I will sit next to someone on a first date. Now that's pizza entertainment. I only heard the tables next to us speaking about how amazing the pizza was - so true!

100% rate of return!!!

Easily the best pizza place in now!! Pizzetta 211 is in my neighborhood and it's excellent so it is tough to acknowledge Damn Fine as better than the neighborhood fave but it is. Make a reservation because the place is very popular despite its Outer Sunset location and unless you're going early (before 6pm) you could have a long wait even on a weekday.

First time around we tried the Margherita Pizza and The Acapulco. Second time we tried Pig In The Woods and Alotta Burrata. Every one we try seems better than the previous one to be honest!!

First, the pizza dough itself is unbelievably light, super thin and flavorful and even though the pizzas are all 14 inches you will definitely want to devour an entire pizza! My kid normally leaves the crust everywhere but the Damn Fine dough is so addictive and evenly good, he doesn't leave any of it uneaten.
The prices at on the higher side but all the ingredients (veggies, cheeses, meats) are super fresh and high grade which makes the pizzas here that much better.  

Verdict:
My overall favorite is "The Acapulco". I think it's the best pizza in SF. Don't be daunted by the mention of Habanero peppers in the ingredient list. The thin strings of habanero give the other ingredients (melt in your mouth prosciutto , fresh mozzarella, queso fresco, pineapple) a really nice kick.  (10/10)

A very close second is the Alotta Burrata which we ordered without the prosciutto. My new go to vegetarian pizza. (10/10)

The Margherita is the best in town in my opinion and that's a high bar for the litmus test at any place that serves pizza. But I'll give it a 9.5/10 because some of the other options at Damn Fine are even better.

Pig In The Woods is also a great meat option. Pancetta + Truffle cheese + Enoki mushrooms. And the basil and garlic addons with that combination.. wow! Definitely a 9.5/10 for me right behind the unbelievable Acapulco.

Also tried the lemonade and bartender's mock-tail choice du jour which was an awesome non alcoholic Rosé with lemonade (and I swear there was some hibiscus in there). (9/10)

The salads are solid and fine to start / share but that's not what I would make the trip to Damn Fine for. (8.5/10)

Other than that the service is great as is the ambience. Parking can be tricky so use ride share or public transportation!

There are dogs everywhere in the patio!  Including mine!  Great pizza. Super tasty. Super chewy dough. I love chewy dough. Reminds me of a place that I had in an alleyway in Japan. V v v good. We had a lot of drinks too. The stand out is the Best Friend drink. It tastes like szechuan spicy chili. Super interesting. Go take your dog.

Delicious pizza! Peach salad was underwhelming unfortunately. Tasty, but not enough grill on the peach to bring out the caramelization.
Burrata pizza and fungi pizza were fantastic!
Service was excellent too.

TLDR: Mid pizza at a pretty high price point. A very sad salad. Great ambiance and service tho

Ordered the Salsiccia pizza fully expecting it to surpass my usual go-to pizza spot and it was a lot smaller than we thought + the crust was very wet and droopy at the bottom which made it difficult to eat. The flavors were okay but nothing out of this world. I'm typically a huge fan of pizza crust but didn't love this one. Maybe I was just let down because of all the hype

The salad was okay but it was just equal parts of the 3 vegetables topped with a lot of cheese which was a little disappointing.

Overall it was just very okay. Stopped in for a spontaneous lunch while shopping in the area and was able to sit right away and the staff was really friendly but I wouldn't be eager to bring friends and family

Overall value: great value, good price for what you get!

Food: delicious, authentic Italian pizza

Service: quick, friendly, reliable

Vibe: casual, great for groups, or dates

Notes: make a Rez in advance

A great pizza! A pizza style that couldn't make up its mind between margarita and coal fire. It was quite crispy but also very chewy. Since it's not a huge pizza the toppings reign supreme and they don't short you on that. A great pizza without a doubt, but not in the conversation for best in the city.
(4.4 Stars)

Really nice staff and fun bar seating. I stopped in for a quick bite with friends and the food was awesome. The Parmesan on top was so yummy. The salad was especially refreshing. Note: there is not aperol spritz, but they have an awesome grapefruit spritz.

PIZZA: Try all of them! My favorite white pie is the Prosciutto and red pie is salsiccia. It's a tough choice every time as they are allll delicious.

OTHER DISHES: There's so many small dishes to choose from if you're not feeling pizza. There are new dishes seasonally and my most recent favorite dish is the delicata squash (perfect for fall!)

AMBIANCE: I love coming here for dinner. It's a super cute place with a bar top and table seating options. If you want a nice quieter dinner, come later in the evening.

SERVICE: Super kind employees. They are attentive even when  the restaurant is super busy.

PARKING: Street parking. There's a small parking lot down the block, but it tends to be full. Try your luck!

TIP: Save room for dessert! Their Tiramisu is made with 100% amazingness.

Super cute spot to come for brunch! Had a good amount of availability when we came so we got a good seat outside.

They provide free mini hard breadsticks. For drinks we had the Napa spritz and the white beach Bellini - both delicious.  

The grilled peach salad was really unique and delicious. The salsiccia pizza was amazing! Excellent crust.

Experience: I went here on a casual Saturday night. They just started doing reservations recently. Our waitress was very kind and helpful. She gave a good suggestions on appetizers and pizzas. One of my friends is lactose intolerant and she made sure the parmesan cheese was served on the side. Overall, I had a lovely experience and they did not rush us when they were nearing closing time.

Food: For appetizers, we got the meatballs which were delicious. It came with plenty of sauce to dip the bread into it. My friend got the vegan pizza, which came with your choice of three veggie toppers. They don't serve vegan cheese here, so keep that in mind! I got the prosciutto pizza. It came with a lot of prosciutto which I really liked. They did not skimp on the toppings!

PSA: They do reservations now. I reserved day of with no trouble.

Came in on a rainy Saturday a bit after the lunch rush, and was able to get seated for two right away, although I could see them getting busy at peak hours.

Loved the ambiance of the restaurant, and they made good use of their limited space to provide plenty of seating (also has outdoor seating out front on the sidewalk). On top, they had a fun soundtrack playing at a good level of volume: a lot of lesser known alternative pop/rock tracks.  

The service had a good balance of pizza shop busy and attentiveness, which added to the experience! We had a nice server who checked in with us just the right amount of times.

After not too long of a wait, our order of brussel sprouts and a salsiccia pie came out.
Loved the brussel sprouts, they were cooked to a near perfect texture and had a nice roast to them. Also wanted to mention that they were drenched in olive oil, which was still a bit heavy, but better than some other past sprouts I've had doused in too sugary sauces.
The pizza was a neopolitan style, with fresh toppings. Loved the taste of it, but had a tough time actually eating it. If I didn't hold a slice with two hands, the toppings, cheese and all, would all slide right off! Even after waiting a bit, still was getting the slide. Unfortunately, it seems like they need to work on the undercarriage a bit, it was too moist which couldn't hold the slice together. They do give a fork and knife with your meal though, which is worth using if you don't want to deal with the mess.

Overall, great service and a great place to grab a meal, but I think the wet crust needs a look-over.

What a fun experience! Friends and I were looking for a casual dinner before seeing a movie down the street at The Kabuki AMC. We had reservations for 5 and once our group arrived we were seated. Our servers were so funny and delightful, and helped us select our pizzas for the table! We got the Salsiccia, one with pepp, and also the Fungi. We also got the eggplant lasagna. The pizzas were so delicious, the crust was amazing and my favorite part. The eggplant lasagna was just ok, needs a bit more seasoning. We also had a bottle of red from Argentina and a Prosecco for the table. Both were delicious! Definitely bring your friends here when you're craving fun and pizzas!
Nice slice of artisan pizza.   Quality pizz on the go.   It's a take out.  You order through the window.

Ordered a Buche Du Noel for a holiday party. It was a hit! delicious. Not overly sweet but with rich chocolate ganache frosting.
My friends loved it!

3.5 stars. I had a slice of pizza, a muffin, and a scone. The pizza's not bad. I'd order a whole pizza and come back and try to get another type of pizza. The scone was very mediocre. I got the scone of the day, a blueberry/blackberry scone. It's too dense for me w/o a lot of flavor. The muffin was the best thing though, really not bad at all. Got a pumpkin muffin and it's good. Would order other muffins here.

I came on a semi-rainy day, Friday afternoon at around 1300. There was about a dozen people in front of me but the line moves fast.

Absolutely love this place. Try their dirty horchata! Also, anything you get from the bakery will likely satisfy. The only thing is that their granola needs some sort of sweetness added (like raisins or something).

You can never go wrong with Arizmendi. Everything they make looks and smells great.

I most often frequent Arizmendi for the elusive vegan muffin. I say elusive because, sadly, most bakeries and purveyors of baked goods in SF do not have this option. Arizmendi, on the other hand, usually has two options: banana walnut and lemon poppy. Banana walnut is definitely my favorite. Having one of these for breakfast absolutely hits the spot. However, the lemon poppy is good in its own right (and if that's generally a flavor you like you will be very happy.)

I will also pick up some of their rolls and breads on occasion, and similarly, these are well-made and extremely satisfying. While they are quite established, I hope they will expand their vegan options in the future so I can try even more.

Tip: order ahead! I cannot stress this enough, especially if you despise queues (as I do.) They are often very long, but with pickup, you go to a separate window and get your goods in no time at all.

Fine in a pinch. I like thin crust pizza but this sauce has minimal flavor--feels like recipe was designed to not offend rather than taste like anything specific. The slices i got also looked like they had sat around a while. Nice enough staff.

My new favorite pizzeria, loved the funghi & Formaggio. For the fact that its thin crust just makes me cry when I eat it.  
Will order again, same flavors but this time pepperoni my daughter's request!

Funghi pizza is good, garlic knots are amazing.

But unreliable delivery. They sometimes forget to include garlic knot orders!!
Still the best slice in the City in 2022 just as 2019. Make no mistake. Only spot that matters this much in the City aside from Tony's in North Beach.
Great pizza, fair price. Excellent customer service. Probably my favorite pizza in Haves Valley.

If you are in a mood for some good pizza, look no further. This is a great place to get pizza by the slice or a whole pie

They used to have an amazing pommodoro pizza which they discontinued but their other recipes are good too.

Not a place to sit down and eat but great to pick up and go

Pecan roll is absolutely delicious and you should definitely try it. Very rich, sweet, and flavorful.

The chocolate sourdough croissant was also very delicious. Flaky, buttery, and the chocolate paired well. Not too sweet or rich,

Chocolate brownie had perfect amount of sweetness

Great spot for thin crust pizza besides the famous Chese Board pizza in Berkeley. Different pizza menu daily gluten free & vegetarian friendly. All vegies based pizza. Super flavorful. Don't think only meats can give you a nice taste pizza but variety of seasonal vegies & cheeses can also create a yummy pizza. Scones are another my go to pastry here. Always get the currant scone whenever I'm in the neighborhood. So worth it.

I've only had their pizza and everyday it's a pizza of the day. The line can be long but goes fast. They have pastries and breads as well. Some bench seating outside. I would come after the botanical garden since it's down the street. It's definitely a popular place.

The Arizmendi Bakery is a little window shop bakery where you order outside at the window on the right and get your food in a bag to go on the left. They have built such a friendly atmosphere there as the employees were very kind and seemed happy to be there and even the customers waiting in line to order were friendly and recommending different baked goods and some were even regulars that came there often. I ordered the scone of the day which was a sourdough croissant and it was delicious

Arizmendi's is a bakery but I come for their pizza which is a 5/5, truly the best thing to get. Their sauce, toppings, and the flavor tastes sooo farm from table, authentic and fresh. Price is also so reasonable, under $4 for a slice! Each day is a different pizza. Go on their website to locate the pizza of the day! I've been a few times and  their pizza always tops the pastries I get. It is a must go!
A good place to buy pizza.Little pricey but good quality and nice staff.Will come again
Love this place. They have great staples on their menu and their special items usually hit the mark. I go here a few times a month for a quick bite.
Loved this pizza. highly recommend the funghi and pepperoni slices. $4.25 for a slice - what a deal.

I love the pepperoni pizza here! I've ordered here a lot and it's great every time, the cheese is tasty and pepperoni is crispy. It's $20-30 for a pizza which is pretty normal for SF and you can also get it by the slice

This is a bagel review. Believe the hype. I'm an East Coast raised bagel fanatic and these are my current favorite in SF. $3 in the morning, but I got a grab bag of 6 on a Sunday night for only $12! They taste great, toast great, freeze great. Friends don't let friends go to W*** S***.

My wife and I have been waiting for this place to open and we were not disappointed!  The menu is super simple, and everything is awesome. Really great pizza, salads, and a wide variety of wine and beer. We had a kale salad and the broccolini pizza, and there were no leftovers! The service is excellent as well. Highly recommend
Amazing bagels!  Just the right mix of chew  and crisp.  Beautiful interior with real wood bar and funky art.  Bagels in the morning and pizza at night!  Yum

Pizza was sooo yummy! We ordered the pepperoni and the mushroom. Both hit the spot.

Service was outstanding.

Olive oil cake for dessert was really good.

Haven't tried the bagels but at some point I definitely plan to!

If you like bagels, you know it's hard to find a good one in the city. This may be the best bagel in San Francisco. Crisp - not crunchy - on the outside, moist and doughy interior. They also have a nice selection of cream cheeses (including calabrian chili which is GREAT). Highly recommend!

Whenever I'm craving a pizza one word comes to mind....Tonys! Every time I've been to Tony's I'm reminded exactly why I keep coming back. Their service is fast and friendly. The quality meets expectations each time and you'll never leave hungry. Each time I come I make a point to get one of my usual favorites and try something new. They have such an extensive menu it can sometimes be hard to choose.

One of the pizzas that never disappoints is the classic New Yorker. The ricotta on top of the menu is outstanding! I recently also tried the Big Boise Boy, this one was probably not my favorite but I was trying something different! Needless to say I will always be a big fan of Tony's and continue to bring friends and family when they come to visit!

I usually gravitate towards Golden Boy pizza after a late night in SF, but didn't have cash on me, so Tony's is another top choice when in North Beach. Charcoal fired pizza!

There's a sit down restaurant on one half with both indoor / outdoor seating and then a separate to-go ordering entrance on the other half.

I ordered 3 slices - four cheese, pepperoni, and hawaiian (I swear the pineapple was not for me lol). $7 a slice, $25 with tip. Pretty steep but you can't be picky when it's 10pm in SF and the location is walking distance to a bunch of bars.  The pizza is always fresh, as slices go fast late night. Nice and thin, crispy crust with quality dough. My favorite was the four cheese, wonderful flavor!

Some of my squad grabbed beers next door, so we sat down in their outdoor parklets and shared some slices together. Apologies on the photo quality, I was a bit hangry! lol.
Great food & service! Will be back! Go warriors! Go warriors! Pizzas were ordered by other members of our group. I was in pizza heaven!
Everything was amazing!! The food was excellent and our service from Brandon was awesome. Highly recommend this pizza place
I don't need to say much. Simply the BEST bagel in SF at the moment in my humble opinion.

The food was excellent and service good.  They open at 5 and we got there at 5:20 pm and had to wait an hour for a table.  That was our choice, but would either come at 5 or much later.  We had a nice time once we were seated.

Great bagels! This place caught my eye after a visit to Butter Love. No wait on a weekday morning around 10am. Staff was friendly and there was a good selection of bagels and cream cheese. I've lived in SF for almost 20 years and have been disappointed by Bay Area bagels so so many times. And I say that as someone who grew up in Phoenix! I was hesitant to stop in, but so glad I did. I picked up a dozen bagels ($30 for a bakers dozen) and two tubs of cream cheese ($6 each). At home I toasted up a salt bagel and slathered it with Calabrian chili cream cheese and was in heaven. The bagel had great flavor, perfect density (not too bready or too light), and good chewiness. The cream cheese was excellent. My whole family enjoyed these and I will be back.
Soft, chewy, tasty bagel. So good. Come. You won't regret it! Cream cheese is amazing you just want to lick it from the knife.

Holy bagel, pizza, and burgers. Wednesday night delight potato salad on the side. Pizza has yet to be eaten but I am just biding my time. The bagels are the only ones worth eating in SF and they got dope merch, an amazing atmosphere and an insanely lovely staff

Quality - 10/10
Atmosphere - 20/10

Returned here recently after a year hiatus. We were seated at - what I think- is the best table in the house: at the counter in back room where the pizza masters themselves are making their doughy masterpieces! Highly recommend grabbing a seat there as the experience in watching the how's and the what's of the pizza making endeavor is spectacular!

The Napoletana was excellent - but what's even better is that the mani features not just this famous style of pizza- but about 8 additional types - from New York to grand ma to Chicago. The menu clearly indicates which pies have won awards too!

I really want to come back with a bigger group and order one of each types of pizzas. Their appis aren't bad either- albeit the fried squash blossoms were a little greasy: the stuffed Ricotta element was nice though!

Big tiramisu fan? Definitely try it as a polisher to your meal. Cheers

Cute spot for any occasion, especially a night out in North Beach. The Diavola pizza was delicious- the crust didn't feel too heavy or greasy and it had a spicy kick to it. Good size to share for 2 people. Same with the Caesar salad, it was fresh, lots of sauce, and I love how it's topped with the anchovies! Will come back and more items on the menu!

Also, yes they have outdoor seating with heaters.

We've passed by this place on multiple occasions but it was always too long of a wait. But we got lucky this evening and it was looking less crowded, still packed though. We put our name down and they said it would be a 30min wait. Luckily we stayed closeby because wait ended up only being 10min!

The menu is extensive (never seen this many pizza options) and at times overwhelming. Especially if you're not familiar with the types of pizza. I think it would be helpful if they redesigned the menu so that it had pictures. Or at least a page that had all of the pizza types with images or chalk drawings.

Highly recommend :
Porto pizza - The dough is very soft and chewy almost like a naan bread. Good balance of meat, cheese and greens. Depending on what else you order, this pizza is good enough for 2-4 people.

The wings and carbonara was good but they're definitely known for their pizza for a reason. It's a darn good pizza.

I've been wanting to try Tony's for ages and we decided to bust a mission on a Friday evening :) we got on the waitlist around 6:30pm and weren't seated until around 8pm (the wait estimate was inaccurate). The restaurant exterior was super crowded with people waiting for their turn to eat! I ordered the gin grape sour cocktail and it was absolutely delicious, and presented beautifully as well! My bf and I ordered the New Yorker pizza to share and while it took a super long time to come out, it exceeded our expectations and was just as yummy as it looks. The crust isn't as thin as I expected but it was still delicious nonetheless. The service was pretty mediocre but honestly the food and drink quality made it worth it! Cant wait to come back :)

We've had both take out and eat in here. For take out, we brought it to the park and it was a grand delicious time. We ate here on a Friday night which had an incredible line at 8pm. We were #31 in line so we first went for a walk to the candy store, then we got a small table in the bar at Original Joe's and had wine while we waited. We waited a good hour and 15 minutes for a table. We were sat outside on a side table and had a great server named Rose or maybe Sara Rose. She was personable, friendly, and attentive. My son liked the necklace she made of shells and pearls and they talked about it.

We had their Chopped Salad and didn't care for it. It had sweet dressing and very large cut pieces of lettuce so it wasn't quite chopped. However, we weren't there for the salad so we'll pretend we didn't have it. I was so excited to have their gluten free Garlic Bread as a starter. It was light and just enough to get my palate ready for pizza. I then had the gluten free Detroit style Motorhead pizza and my husband had the regular dough 1000 degree coal fired New Yorker. The pizzas were fantastic. The Detroit style was thick with crunchy sides. So yummy. They don't skimp on the toppings so every bite has something. The ricotta cheese on the Motorhead was beautifully placed and when you spread some of that around, it's delish. My husband and son loved their New Yorker because the dough, cheese, and sauce were fantastic and had a great char. It was cooked perfectly. My husband liked how you can choose the oven temperature of the cook.

We ended the night with some Spumoni ice cream which was also really good. We will be back soon for more pizza on another warm night when we're willing to wait.
I'd like to think I've tried a lot of pizza joints and if anyone asks what is the best pizza I've ever had... it is Tony's.

My favorite pizza in town.
Solid family spot and consistently good food.
The Giorgio special is a must...unless your a vegetarian, then don't.

Awesome classic neighborhood family-friend pizza joint. Eating at Giorgio's really makes me feel like a kid again, which in turn makes me so happy to be able to bring my kids there.

The pizza is probably the best in the neighborhood.

The pasta dishes are simple but satisfying and generously portioned. I like the sun-dried tomato and chicken as well as anything drenched in the pesto/alfredo sauce (though you've got to really commit for this one, it is R I C H ).

Bring the family; grab a booth.

Ambience was very good. The light from the ceiling make it an authentic Italian vibe. The waiter, Ian, was very responsive and knew when to approach us.

We both ordered pasta dishes. Unbelievable chicken mushroom sundried tomato fusilli.

The price was very reasonable, and the pasta tasted like it was from a very fancy restaurant.

House wine was only $5.50 for a glass, and very good. Highly recommend.

Three star pizza. Four star salads.

I was starving having fasted for about 18 hours for a medical procedure. I craved pizza. This was fairly close to where we were so thought it would be good to try it out.

Atmosphere was comfortable and not pretentious. It smelled good.

We sat in a cozy booth and ordered a lot of food. We both got the 2 serving salads. I got the blue cheese and it was pretty perfect - crunchy lettuce, lots of red onions, pieces of blue cheese, cherry tomatoes and a decent dressing. I polished off the whole thing. My wife took care of her Caesar too. I tasted it and I preferred mine.

We got two small pizzas. We took advantage of being able to order thin crust and crisp. It was thin but not particularly crisp. We both prefer more tomato sauce. The veg one was better because it had tomatoes. We only had once piece of the Sardinian and gave it away to one of the way too many homeless folks we passed on the way home.

Service was efficient and pleasant. I would return for that blue cheese salad but would try the pasta next time. Sadly I would skip their pizza.

I always order from Giorgios.  The pizza, calzone, bruschetta and salad are all quality.  I would give more stars except it was left on my porch WITHOUT ringing the doorbell so it was found 30 minutes later completely cold.  That is unfortunate.
Had heard a lot about it but had not tried until recently.  Really great old style pizza.  Im also in love w Clement street and the nice small stores around.

The pizza and the brochette were okay. Definitely not the best place for food. Just about average probably. However I did enjoy the beer, the aesthetics and the service.

Knocked off one more star as their menu does not have a symbol for vegetarian/vegan options and one has to go through the ingredients to see if the item is vegetarian.

That's just a free feature restaurants should have. It only shows how much they care for their customers with dietary restrictions.

My best friend and roommate has spent thousands here getting it delivered over the last nine years. I have been a beneficiary of this. He gets Hawaiian so he could get a million better options, but it is still great pizza. The combo is bomb, the vegi is bomb, and one of the special pizzas or something with mushrooms is super bomb. I am craving Giorgios while writing this now.

The pasta is delicious but heavy (it's pasta though). Calzones are crazy cheesy and super good. If I did not give a 5 stars I would be fraud.

If you guys are reading this at Girogio's, my best friend for sure deserves a shirt or free pizza or something. When I say he has spent thousands, I do not mean like 2k. I mean like he has paid a staff members salary. Hit me up :)

Mediocre, overpriced spaghetti that's no better than nearby Village Pizzeria on Clement.

However, Giorgio's is infinitely better than horrible Gaspare's on Geary. Anything is better than that dump with their pre-cooked pasta and bilgewater sauces.

Bottom line: Better spaghetti can easily be made at home in much larger portions with inexpensive Italian imports from Trader Joe's.

This was my favorite pizzeria as a child, and after years without, I'm pleased to say it's still amazing! The original crust leaves just enough around the edges and has the middle of the pizza pretty juicy. I order a large between two of us and it's just about right. This is one of those places you end up eating more than you think you will, just because it's fun to keep going. This last trip I ordered a small calzone and a large pizza between two people and all we took home was one slice!

I love that this is walking distance from my bus stop, so I can walk here, but I can't lie and say I haven't ordered delivery as well haha

They have great deep dish pizza. There should be parking you can pull up into on the street, right in front, if you leave quickly. I have always had luck picking up

They have a large trash can outside that homeless people will climb into

First time at square pie guys. The establishment is small but cozy. You order via QR code. Pizza was ok it had a bit too much hot honey in my opinion leaving the pizza tasting very sweet. We're also ordered ranch to go along with pizza and unfortunately it fell short. The ranch didn't taste like ranch as it had cilantro and lime in it.

If you like pan pizza then you will like this place! I would rank it a 4.5 out of 5 stars.

Their pizza is good. However, I was a tad bit disappointed that more pepperoni wasn't place on top of the pizza, but other than that I enjoyed it.

I have only tried their 6x8 pepperoni pizza a couple of times. Their pizza is enough for you to share with one other person (especially if you're on a budget).

I have also tried their fries as well-the fries are good but they are just regular fries.

Summary:
Decent, thicc pizza, but fairly pricy for what it is

Details:
* 3 stars for the food itself, but 2 stars overall since I'm unlikely to eat here without someone else treating, given the pricing
* Pizzas average around $23, are portioned into fourths, with each slice probably equivalent to ~1.5 standard pizza slices
* Ellen Supreme had good flavors, while the Mean Green Machine was blander and sweeter than expected, but both had a good crunchy, thin, bottom and side crusts
* Personally would prefer Little Star's deep dish or Neapolitan over this, though this style may be more appealing to crust-non-eaters

Delicious pizzas and appetizers for the table. The I'm Casaro was our favorite with mushrooms and prosciutto. The food comes out quickly and you're stuffed by the end of the night. The asparagus, beet salad, and burrata were also tasty.

Food was great.
Ambience was lovely
Service was immaculate.
comfortable & cute
worth the price.
Location is perfect
the neighborhood is lovely of course

Roamed around for some quarantine food and gladly stumped into this restaurant.

it was good and the service was great!

Randomly selected this place. It was a bit busy the restaurant is small on the inside and has seating outside but it was raining and cold. Service was a bit slow as well, I only saw one waiter doing everything. The food was amazing though, we were honestly so surprised as to how good it was. Definitely will be back just based off the food. We had cheese style sticks, pepperoni style pizza, calzone and the pesto pasta!! It was amazing

Il Casaro is a pretty solid North Beach pizza spot. The lively atmosphere and friendly staff make for a great dining experience. The pizza itself was pretty good, but not the best you can get in the area. In my opinion, the crust was a little soggier than I would have liked, but overall it was pretty good. We had the Diavola pizza, and the flavors were great. It had just the right amount of spice. We also had the burrata from the mozzarella bar to start, and it was incredible, will definitely order again.

We got this pizza to go, and I feel like I found my new pizza go to spot!!! it was definitely thick and full of toppings but super good. I usually gravitate towards dinner pizzas but this was really really good and well worth! The pizzas are a bit on the more expensive side but again, I would say they're definitely worth it for how much you get and how fresh and tasty they are!

Amaazing Detroit style pizza! I love the crust on the slices here and how they cut the slices so that each piece is a corner piece (4 per pizza)! We got a couple of pizzas: pepperoni, mushroom and truffle, and the green machine. All were delicious in their own way! Definitely worth the price and the wait. Would recommend!

However, would not recommend the wings. Way too salty and not crunchy- stick to the pizza!

detroit style is a good fad especially after slice of homage in SJ. thick filling pan style. the square pie feels a bit small for the price. (got the meaty one)
can be deliverable by SF2bay

So good it hurts I was only able to have it once.
Might be the best pizza I have had ever

Top Chef winner Melissa King and Square Pie Guys collab? Bark bark bark said my corgi friends. So I had to try it out.

This place is located balls deep in San Francisco and the crowd ordering from the store means that you should definitely order ahead of time. Even with a dozen staff making pizza pies nonstop, if you do a walk in order (from a touch screen at the counter, several bodies deep), it's going to take at least 30 minutes during its busiest hours. They know its going to be a wait since there's a water cooler in the corner, and even people picking up at the store are waiting up to 20 minutes! You can spend the time waiting by watching the pros work the assembly line while 10 finished orders are sitting on the shelves, yet none of them are for the actual crowd who's waiting. True to San Franciscans, don't make eye contact with anyone unless you're a cutieful corgi.

Some corgis also pull up curbside in their swanky EV SUVs but are stuck waiting as well. With this much business being slammed every afternoon, its worth the wait right?

Szechuan Chili Honey Fried Chicken Wings - 3 wings, 3 drumlets. Despite being covered in a sweet and spicy glaze that is well seasoned, mildly spicy, and very sweet, it remains crispy even after steaming in its box for about 10 minutes in the cold afternoon in San Francisco's Metrodome. At $14 its pricey as bark, but at least you know it's properly fried. The meat was juicy and you could hear the crisp texture crack when biting through.

Melissa King's "The King's Pie" - This is a pizza with a mushroom focus, pickled pepper, Szechuan chili honey, parsley, grana cheese. For a detroit square pizza, this is what she calls "simple", but it is packed with flavor. If you like pizzas on the sweet side with a splash of heat and crispy toppings and the cheese is comparable if not better than your typical high quality grande blends. At $25, you've got enough slices for four people and god damn eating more than one slice will mos def make you corgi levels of fat.

Personally, I am not a huge fan of sweet pizza (otherwise this would probably be a 5 star rating) and the price is high (even if it's SF), but there are plenty of other great options for corgis and pie lovers so don't let that deter you. Definitely worth a try if you're into pizzas (who ain't in California) or looking for one of the better Detroit pizza places around SF.
The quality of food and authenticity is something else! The Mozzarella is so heavenly and the pizzas and pastas are out of this world! You cannot go wrong with anything on the menu
Fabulous pizza! Close your eyes and be in Napoli! Great staff , super layout, and the cherry on the cake, they had a great playlist when we came in for lunch ! Viva Italia;)

This pizza monster prefers the pasta options here. Appreciate that they have several outside tables, which is what I look for these days. Also like that they offer good California wine options alongside Italian. Nice and helpful service. My disappointment is the restroom. It's in terrible shape and makes me think they don't care enough about their customers.

We went as a big group of 7 adults, a kid and two infants. We used the yelp wait-list feature and it took about ten minutes after we arrived since we had a slightly bigger party. Area was lovely and warm with plenty of light and heat even on a brisk fall evening. Lots of vegetarian options - lasagna Blanca and pesto were especially great. The mozzarella and eggplant ball appetizers were ok but not particularly noteworthy. The four cheese pizza was very strong because of the provolone, but the mushroom calzone (made without ham) was easily the best thing. Tiramisu was also great for dessert. The one downside was the cigarette/weed smell from a couple of unhoused people who were nearby but they didn't bother us directly.

I got their buratta, Il casaro pizza (not pictured), prosciutto pizza, and four cheese pizza to share with 3 friends. I highly recommend the burrata dish and prosciutto pizza - I've never seen any restaurant put that much parmesan cheese on the pizza other than here and I loved it. The four cheese pizza was also pretty good even though I was hesitant to order it because it had goat cheese and that's one and only type of cheese that I don't eat. But it blended well wither the flavors of other cheese that I was able to appreciate this pizza.

I would've given them 4 star but this spot deserves 5 because of their pizza dough. It was fluffy and really chewy which is the exact type of dough I look for when I'm eating this type of Italian oven pizza.

The ambiance is very casual but still good for any type of occasions (but maybe not the best spot if you're trying to have a very romantic date). I would come back here again if I'm craving solid Italian pizza!

I've been here four times now and the service is erratic. First the pizza is great--I'm sure plenty of reviews can go more deep into that. But the service... is sometime fine. But when it's bad, it's comically rude and opaque. For instance, I arrived with a party of five on a very cold afternoon and the restaurant was empty. The waitress refused to sit us indoors without giving any explanation.

A few more visits went perfectly fine, even with the same host and then I come with just my 8 year old and again we were refused an indoor table even though there was plenty of room. Again no explanation. Even when pressed, it's just "yeah, we can't seat you, but there's plenty of space outside" (it's drizzling btw).

I've no idea what's going on, we're not fussy, order lots of food and drink, and tip well. The service is just bipolar to the extreme.

fast service! thin-crust pizzettas are the perfect weeknight meal for me. Plenty of outdoor seating. Heaters kept me warm the whole time!

youtu.be/AXnW9hodxuk?t=90

5/5 stars for this place. Nothing to complain
Their thin-crust pizza is cripsy, tasty & yummy. I love the ambiance at the store where you can see people making pizza for you. Reminds me of little pizza shop in Rome.

Last but not least, the dessert - apple walnut cake with rosemary caramel & whipped cream is a bomb. Eating the leftover , enjoying every single piece of it while typing this review

Wow! We were starving and decided to just go to the first thing we saw and glad to say it did not disappoint, the place was beautiful and the service was not bad, the dog they have that roams around does make the experience better. The food was delicious, I am not the type to eat a lot of different cheeses but it has now opened me up to try new things. I enjoyed my meatball pizza and was the perfect size for 1 person, will definitely be coming back!

Overall, a good but not great experience.
1. We tried calling to order a pizza, but they were too busy so nobody picked up the phone. We had to go in and order, so just extra waiting time.
2. The service is good. Friendly people.
3.  Pizza is decent. My girlfriend's pizza was amazing, she got the one with an egg and ham. I was pretty jealous. My pizza was more akin to prison pizza. I got tomato basil mozzarella with pepperoni and sausage. It was pretty small and skimpy in cheese and meats. I would definitely skip this pizza and order the other one next time.

I've ordered delivery from square pie before but this was my first time dining in. So I already knew the pizza was going to be worth waiting for. The server checked up on us a couple of times and made sure we had everything we needed. Pizza itself came and was super yummy. Make sure you ask for their sauces too! I like to eat the sauce with a side of pizza. :p

The restaurant was a bit dirty or because the door was open, we had a bunch of pesky flys around.

It was difficult to eat and continue our conversations as we stopped often to swat away the flies.

Everything you need and want in a pizza place!  Me and my gf stumbled upon this place after our hike.  It is all by itself on a side street, almost hidden if you will, but I am so glad that we crossed paths.  It was pretty busy but we wanted to eat outside so we waited 30 minutes or so (wasn't so bad with all the cute dogs people had).

This place has a rotating menu which I found pretty neat.  We ordered the daily starter which was a kale salad with burrata and the fingerling potato pizzetta.  I never in a million years thought I would love a kale salad, but this proved me wrong.  The kale was massaged so well that it was super easy to chew, and the burrata and citrus slices were highlighted by the dressing.  I've never had a potato pizza before but this was a great introduction.  I had to practically fight with my gf over the last piece.

Super glad to have accidentally found this place, I highly recommend checking it out and I can't wait to come back.

Easily my favorite spot in SF. Came by for Pearl (also amazing), and was convinced to come back for Pizzetta. As a New Yorker, I was skeptical of California style pizza but I've been back three times since then! Every time I try something new (which isn't hard because the menu changes every two weeks) and every single thing has been delicious!! The pizza with the spicy tomatoes and mascarpone is unreal.

I've gone for dessert twice now and it's been amazing. Not too sweet and super fluffy and light. I am making a stereotypical Italian kiss with my fingers right now. Seriously amazing, definitely give this place a try!

I came here with a couple friends and the 4 of us shared 4 pizzas - the potato pizza, farm fresh pizza, spicy arugula, and plain margherita and they were all very good, with the spicy arugula being our favorite and farm fresh pizza our least. (The egg on pizza was an odd combination)

The crust on these pizzas were terrific, they were all thin and crispy, and the sauce was deliciously flavorful and just the right amount.  
The price is on the higher side at about $18 for  a pizza the size of a personal pie, but we were all full and satiated after our meal, and you really come here more for quality and creativity rather than quantity.

We came in a Thursday evening and there was a wait of about 15 minutes which was fine, and parking was street parallel parking on the side. The service was also good with the host delving into details on his favorite pizzas and our waitress was friendly and attentive.

Met up with friends on a Friday night for pizza and quality time - Pizzetta 211 turned out to be a great venue for it. Yes, they didn't take reservations so yes, our party of 5 had quite the wait ahead of us since we arrived at 7:15pm but the heated lamps and being able to pull up 5 chairs into a small circle definitely helped pass the time just a little quicker. Admittedly, we almost lost faith. At about 8pm, we still hadn't been sat and almost got up to leave but the guy that took our name quickly came over and talked us into staying pointing at the table that would be ours. Alright, sold.

We began our meal with the cheeseboard which comes with 5 crostini, olives, candied walnuts, plums, and two cheeses. Ours was a funky goat cheese and a smoky hard gouda. Yum. Both were so good and no, that wasn't just the hunger talking. We also opted for a bottle of Fiano di Avellino which was deliciously fruity and not too dry.

For pizzas, different people shared different pies. I shared the fresh farm egg pizza with a friend. ABSOLUTELY DELISH. Everything played so well together from the pesto to the sundried tomatoes, pepperoni, and creamy fresh egg. The crust is thin and crispy so it may not be everyone's favorite texture, but I still enjoyed it (even though my favorite style is pan crust).

To complete our meal we had to have dessert. We split both the flourless chocolate almond cake and the daily special which was a plum(?) galette. Both again we're great. The housemade whip was definitely also a fan favorite on both. If I had to choose though, I'd go for the galette again. It's play on sweet and sour was just so so GOOD. But if you're a purist looking for a sweet dessert, that rich chocolate cake would be right up your alley.

All in all, it was a great meal. Highly recommended experience!

The pizza is absolutely delicous. The crust was crisp and thin. The toppings were fresh. I love few pizza places (im picky) but this is definitely my top choice.
Would definitely recommend and go back
Fun place for drinks and dinner with friends! Burrata pizza and the marco polo cocktail are a perfect pair  Will be back soon!

I live in Los Angeles. I was up visiting family for the week,
we happened upon your restaurant and WOW! Best service, incredible food and your manager, Peter, what a lovely host! There were six of us plus a new baby. We all ordered something different and sampled almost everything on the menu from appetizers to entrees. Everything was cooked as requested and it was all delicious!
The manager was very attentive to everyone. He definitely made sure everyone was satisfied with their order. The bar was full and the restaurant was very busy. I never felt we waited very long for any of our food . Great experience. We will absolutely return! Thank you.

If I was rating just on the pizza it would be a 3 or 4, however just too many negatives.  
1. Ordered 3 pizzas, a salad and a drink online. Total was $124.  Tipped 17% for online, because COVID.  Yet the hostess basically looked at me expectantly and never said. "Can I help you?" Then brought food back, placed it on hostess stand in front of me.  No, " here you go", nothing.  She is the front of the house, and needs a way better service approach or at least speak to the customer
2.  We picked up the pizza right after getting text they were ready.  2 pizzas were warm and one actually was cold.  Too bad because it tasted good
3.  No utensils or napkins for a togo order that included a salad.  If the  new law says they can't ask if we want it, that should be posted somewhere.
Overall a big disappointment based on other reviews was expecting better

Serafina Was unbelievable and made our 10 year anniversary brunch a total success.  Be sure to sit at the bar and ask lots of questions about their amazing wines.  The current team at Dellarossa are stunning, knowledgable and just plain fun.

Food and service were both so good. We had a little bit of a burrata overload (both the burrata and honey app and the burrata pizza) but it was so good. Their cocktails were also good. We had their tequila with raspberry and pineapple drink and we weren't disappointed. The vibes were good and the service was spot on. Definitely recommend
I think it's just average. It's more of a vine than good food . I feel like this is Americanized Italian if that makes sense.

All the food was very good. Delicious apps and pizza.  The cocktail are very very sweet, but other than that we were all happy and satisfied.  The online wait list originally said 60-90m but ended up getting a spot in 10m.

Super disappointed. Read a bunch of reviews and wanted to impress my girl with a great Italian pick. We couldn't sit at the bar (or anywhere) because the bartender was on his lunch break and no one in the restaurant knew how to make a drink until that was actually incorrect and there was someone. Our waiter was unprofessional, clearly not into Italian food and corrected my pronunciation of caprese salad to "capreece"  Help me Jesus. Then asked what kind of meat we wanted with it... which was weird but I guess this is what faux Italian joints do.
When the Capreece  salad finally came out, the tomatoes were mealy and not sweet... they were old/frozen whatever foul tomato place this garbage comes from, the mozzarella was unseasoned (not enough salt) and finding anyone to get salt was an unfriendly experience. The drink I ordered was.... Drinkable but too sweet for a Negroni. The fried cauliflower was off the hook good though. No one came to check on us after our meal was served. So for $64, we got a mediocre lunch with poor service. I get that a lot of places are struggling with staffing but... this was pretty bad for an expensive dining experience.

It was an amazing late night dinner! Went there with my best friend for a late quick bite and I was amazed!
Even though it was a Saturday night we actually didn't have to wait a lot!
For appetizers we got the Burrata Bruschetta which tasted good!
Then we ordered the Margherita with Burrata Pizza which also was good!
The server was more than nice and helpful as she explained for us some of the dishes we were asking about!
It's a really beautiful place to have a meal there, the only thing that you should know is that they dont offer free refills for the soda.

Visited the place on a Friday evening for drinks and dinner with friends. This place was busy and lively. We got a couple cocktails and beers for drinks and pizzas for dinner. Both of which I highly  recommend. We also had the fried cauliflower and weren't impressed.

Overall a great place to grab drinks with friends.
Love the pizza shop!!! The cherry pesto pepper is bomb and the pepperoni mushroom is great too!

Probably the best cheese pizza in SF. Nothing beats getting a slice of this right from the oven in the shop, but delivery is still great too.

Great overall flavor, sauce, and a good, chewy but not too thick crust.

The cheese is always my favorite but every other kind of slice I've had there has been delicious as well.

The Pizza Shop is one of the better pizza places you'll find in the Mission. One thing I noticed straight away was that it's super clean by pizza place standards.

The slices are pretty delicious but there is no middle ground i.e. they are either vegetarian or pork based. I've been here on multiple occasions and have tried the pesto, the King Julian, cheese slices and the mushroom pizza and I think it would be fair to say that I've never left this place disappointed.

The guys behind the counter are pretty cool although I think one of them checks-in to the business every single day and is duke of the Pizza Shop! Give the others a chance man! ;)
Just popped in for a slice. Cherry pepper and pesto was delicious. Crust was thin and crispy, and only takes a few min to heat up and be on your way. Friendly & efficient staff too. Will return.
Cash only *** only con. The pizza is great, I've gotten pepperoni both times. Super quick and convenient service and they serve cherry coke which isn't THAT common in the area. Love it.

Classic NY style pizza. This review is for slices only and not whole pies. $3 for cheese slices, $4 for slices with toppings. It's cash only! These prices include tax, as it should, so you don't get left with spare coins.

I got two slices--the mushroom+ricotta and the meat slice. Both had a crispy crust that definitely held up, which is generally uncommon with some of the greasier toppings like pepperoni and sausage.

Most people want to hear a comparison between this and "real NY pizza". But just remember that there's probably 20 different "top" pizza shops out there. Everyone has their preferences, and every place makes their pizza different, some better than others though!

I like my pizza a little chewier and cheesier, but the crust was definitely perfectly crispy. I'm not sure what it was, but the pizza tasted a little bland though, it could have been the sauce, cheese, crust, or a combination of the three.

There are pizza shops, and there are Pizza Shops. The former is usually run by a guy named Vinnie who wears a wife-beater and talks like he's auditioning for the part of a pizza guy on "The Sopranos" and still couldn't get the part. I'm thinking of a place like 2 Bros Pizza in NYC where you see all walks of Lower Manhattan life get two big slices and a soda for $2.75. You eat it in the back with all the other goombahs who couldn't get a date that night (photo: bit.ly/1qZh2cb). But a Pizza Shop with capital letters must mean there's an unexpected designer element to the culinary creations coming out of the oven, right? Hmmm, not really. Jamie W. and I came here out of curiosity since a pizza spot is an unusual sight among the taquerias on 24th.

It's a modest operation with a large glass case with all their pizza pies on display, a large oven in the back and just four tables for sit-down eating. There were ten to choose from (photo: bit.ly/Qc1mHr) , and at $4 a slice, I felt entitled to two. Don't judge me. So I ordered the Pepperoni and Mushroom and the White Mushroom (photo: bit.ly/1kZPcPJ). Jamie must have been showing off because he ordered only one slice of the Deluxe, which featured sausage, pepperoni, mushroom, green pepper, onion and olive (photo: bit.ly/1hJQsEc). Our verdict? It was OK. The pizza has the cracker-style crust that isn't really my preference, and the ingredients, while fresh, were rather on the bland side as if seasonings were optional. The $2 refillable sodas were helpful to wash them down. Where are my goombahs?

FOOD - 3 stars...middling on the pizza scale, not bad but honestly a bit on the Costco side when it comes to execution
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...could use a bit more oomph to liven up the place
SERVICE - 3 stars...friendly enough
TOTAL - 3 stars...pizza seems more directed to the hipsters than the rest of us

Warning! Addictive! These pizzas are SO good - the best tomato sauce, medium-thin crisp crust, and high quality toppings. We are partial to the cherry pepper pesto - a little kick of spice and perfectly balanced. The team is super nice and pies are always ready when they say. Note: cash only and one size only (which is pretty large) but we never have trouble eating it over the course of a few days.

4.5 STARS

After flushing $150 down the toilet at Saru Sushi in Noe Valley, all I wanted to do was to drown my sorrows...

In cheap slice of carblicious pizza.

Me: "I'm still hungry, can we go grab a slice of pizza?"
Mr. NSS: "I'm not, I'll just keep you company."

Me: "You're going to just sit there and watch me eat...like a heffer?"
Mr. NSS: "Ummm yah, who cares what people think?"

*Arrives at The Pizza Shop*

Me: "Can I get a slice of the White Spinach please?"
Cashier: "Anything else?"

Mr. NSS: "I'll get a slice of the Mushroom and Cheese..."
Me: "I thought you weren't hungry?!?!"

Cashier: "Anything else?"
Me: "Also a bottle of...."
Mr. NSS *cuts me off*: "A slice of Pepperoni and Mushroom too!"

Me: *evil stare*
Mr. NSS: "What? It's for later...you know how I get hungry late at night."

*Pizza slices come out piping hot from the oven: bit.ly/1loMFxK*

Me: "Mmmm, so how is it?"
Mr. NSS *while mouth is full*: "Mmmmkaaay."

Me: "Uhh you have an accordion of cheese hanging from the corner of your mouth."
Mr. NSS *no response and moves on to his second slice*

Mr. NSS: "Just so you know, I'm only eating this second slice because it will be cold later."
Me: "Uh huh..."

Mr. NSS *licking his fingers*: "How come we didn't order a whole pizza?"
Me: "WTF!?!"

Men.

OTHER NOTES:
*Across from Philz Coffee.
*Friendly and upbeat staff.
*Excellent pre-made NY style pizzas.
*8 varieties: cheese, white spinach, pesto, pepperoni, mushroom, tomato-garlic, meat-o (pepperoni, sausage & meatball, and combo.
*$3/slice for cheese and $4/slice for all others (whole pizzas available).
*Super crunchy, thin-crust pizzas that are deliciously satisfying and not too salty or greasy.
*Didn't taste any garlic in the White Spinach (-.5 stars).
*Sodas only.
*Four 4-top tables.
*Cash only (prices include tax).

The pizza here is really good...however the person working the counter is not very friendly. I'm from the East Coast and I know what a pizza shop should be like. I asked for the garlic sprinkles and the guy behind the counter said "whatever is out there buddy" ... Like he has no idea whether or not they have Garlic sprinkles. Yes they do have them, but it was on one of the tables, this is why you need more than one shaker. And he should know whether or not they have it.
Great pizza. Crust is crispy and flavorful. They put a good amount of sauce on, which I like. It's pricey pizza but you know, that's how it goes in SF.

So I tried to order pizza from here yesterday and they gave me the biggest run around.

When I first called I wanted delivery but they told me that I was out of their market place, but when I looked at the map the closest store was 8 mins away from me!

They then redirected me to another location that was 20 mins away from me!

I think the person on the phone just didn't understand me which got me frustrated.

I then called back the Castro location and just told them I would pick it up!

Just a huge hassle going back and fourth. Pizza was great though!

Next time I will just pick up

After screwing up the order and taking double time to deliver, they showed up with cold, dry garbage. I would have been better off heating up Totinos Pizza Rolls with my armpit. It would have taken half the time and twice the flavor. Never again.
This pizza is about as close as you get to that east coast za I love! Thanks for being here all these years! I would never order a cheese slice anywhere but here! Friendly hot and fresh! Aye!!!!
Pizza was mediocre and expensive. It was dry and reminds me of frozen pizza. The two guys in the back were chilling on their phones. It seemed like the pizza was sitting out for a long time.

This past weekend I wasn't escaping New York.  I was escaping the crowds and masses at the parade.  Even though apparently I missed out according to my coworker who said there was a beautiful young lady who had a sign that said "free hugs", along with a whole lot of stories which included drunken brawls and other madness.  So I escaped any calamities and any possible dangers as well.  

But instead I headed over to the usually bustling neighborhood of the Haight.  On Sunday it was quiet and I was actually able to find a parking spot believe it or not.  I needed something quick to take to go.  So I stumbled on Escape from New York Pizza.  Right at the counter were a bunch of delicious looking pizzas by the slice.  Every kind you could think of, meat lovers, veggie pizza, pesto, Hawaiian, etc.  But I wanted a whole pie to go so I ordered a large pepperoni pizza.  

So how was the pizza?  Really good!  Maybe one of the best utility pizzas in San Francisco.  About medium thickness in crust.  A nice amount of tangy pizza sauce covered by a generous amount of cheese and pepperoni topping.  If I'm in the area again I wouldn't hesitate to go back.  

The eatery is an eat-and-go type spot like so many of the eateries in New York are, with the counters to eat your slice on a paper plate with a fountain soda.  Quick, clean, friendly pizza spot in the Haight.  

Any other weekend, I'd probably want to escape from Haight.  But this last weekend I'm glad I came and ate Escape from New York.

I was pretty skeptical of this place when we saw it, but my kids insisted on coming in when we were touring Haight-Ashbury.  I was very pleasantly surprised how good the pizza is.  I naively assumed that you could only get a decent 'za in Chicago or New York.... this place rivals any NY style I've had.

It's a small space so it's not somewhere you'd come for a dining experience.  It is, however, a great place to drop into for some unique pizza made in the NY style.  They have a lot of unique pies that you won't find anywhere else- potato, anyone?  You can also get the standard pepperoni or sausage if that suits you.

No alcohol, soda on tap.  We brought in Boba tea from the place across the street and nobody batted an eye.  I'd recommend.  Good for kids too- my kids really liked the heavy metal music in the background, which is reason enough to like this place.

Great people working and great pizza. I have stopped by multiple times before my shift. I walked in before my shift on one particular day, (I'm a nurse) during the COVID battle and practically gave me 50% off my order and said "thank you for what you do!" Pleasant gesture!

I have gone here multiple times because their pizza taste great. The crust is thin and crispy, just how I like it.

I have to write this because it's taken a long time and too much wasted $ to figure out where to find the best gluten-free crust. If you're tired of f*****g around, go here.

The search is over. This is my spot. Escape From NY on Haight is the best. Slight crunch while still chewy with quality toppings.

I ordered the Andy Warhol delivered and it was so good I questioned for a second whether they messed up my order and gave me regular crust.
Gone too quick for a pic. It was a beaut.

*if you're severely allergic, they note the GF pizzas are not strictly separated from regular while cooking, so heads up on that

It's all about  the "You Say Potato"  for us... I'm here for this and this only (and their veggie gourmet ;p) ... roasted potatoes sliced thinly w/ roasted soft garlic cloves over their pesto sauce... don't care if my breath is hummin for a couple hours since the hubs is eatin the same thing... hahaaa =D

Parkin is crazy here so he drops me off and drives around while I fall in line for the slices and we grub in the car.

Cash only, but they have an ATM machine by the door. (3 dolla charge, so come w/ CASH)

ohh and if you're not into the crust, don't throw it out, donate it to the hungry-hungry hippies chillin outside will w/ their dogs ... they'll  be more than happy to take it off ur hands or from the garbage...

Love this place for so many reasons. Pizza (both regular and Grandma's) is some of the best in the City when comparing margarita to margarita. Ceasar and pear salads are both excellent. Pastas were also all really good: I really liked the Bolognese and the Sugo. I have been there 3X and They have some amazing weekday specials, and a great but somewhat limited wine and beer menu that is reasonably priced. The place is small and not particularly fancy but don't let that stop you.
I've been eating there for the past few years and it's amazing! The pizza is delicious and fair price! My favorite is magic mushrooms! I recommend!
Amazing food for such a good price especially for food in the city. The combo had so much food! Full recommend.

You know what....

update:

I should have put it in the toaster oven for sure. Haha raising to one star. I'll try to come back soon to try and be certain though!

Ordered the Combo Dinner off of DoorDash because of the amazing offer. However, they forgot our dessert. This was our first time trying it and it disappoints me that they stapled the bag together without verifying the order.

Great little local spot right around the corner from us. We ordered to go and got their dinner for 2 combo. For $55, it comes with your choice of 1 appetizer, 1 pasta, 1 small pizza, 1 dessert, and (if you order on a Wednesday), you also get a free red wine. I need to keep that in mind as a pick me up for hump day. A nice value for all the quality and options you get. We ordered:

Parma e Burrata Plate -- I admit, not my favorite appetizer, but it could be my bias towards prosciutto (sorry, not the biggest fan). The candied pear with the arugula and balsamic dressing was really nice and refreshing though. The prosciutto did have a nice savory counterbalance to the dish.

Pasta al Tartufo -- Who doesn't love a good parmesan pasta? And with truffles?? I love my carbs, so I definitely loved this dish. The truffle cream sauce was one of my faves. Super comforting with a nice thick consistancy. The pasta was a bit on the oilier side, so eat this while it's hot and fresh...cuz...have y'all ever eaten oily pasta that's been sitting out for a sec and is lukewarm? Yea, that oil gets gross.

The Ham Pod Pizza -- Can't go wrong with a classic sausage, pepperoni and jalapeño combo. The crust and dough just melted in my mouth. I wouldn't consider this a spicy pizza, but the sausage did have a bit of heat. The small was actually quite large, and we had more than enough for left overs the next day.

Sicilian Cannoli al Pistacchio -- I'm not a huge sweets girl, but the cannolis were a nice way to end our meal. There was quite a bit of cream, but it didn't feel too heavy. The skin was also a bit on the softer side, but not hating it.

Pink Onion, I'll be back, and I'll work my way through your extensive (pizza) menu. Which should be quite easy if we keep sticking to your combo set up.

The best of the best! Wonderful, attentive service. &  the food. I fell in love again and again with the pistachio pesto pasta. Then there was the pizza- Orgasmic. & Yes we ate the leftovers for breakfast and it somewhere tasted even better than the night before! If you haven't been here, you are definitely missing out.

This place was LOVE at first bite for me for everything that I tried here from the Pizzas to the Pastas and the Tiramisu! I highly recommend them all - Margarita, Pesto, and Pepperoni Pizzas, and the Truffle and Pesto Pastas were honestly among the best I've had in the dreamy-creamy-ultra-rich kind of way!! The Pastas are sinful but sooo flavorful and totally worth the calories! The portion for the Tiramisu is huge and is totally worth $10 for the brilliant taste!
I honestly can't wait to go back here and also can't wait to dine in again as there's nothing better than having your meal fresh and hot!

Pink onion is one of my favorite San Francisco hidden gems! The food is always exquisite and the service super friendly. Throw in the artsy decor + music and you're in for a great time.

My personal favorite is the pasta tartufo (truffle pasta). Delicious perfectly cooked pasta in a cream sauce with an exquisite freshly shaved truffle on top. Mmmm! An absolute dream for any foodie. They are quite generous with the truffle too so in my opinion a fantastic value given how pricey truffles can be.

Last time I also had a burrata caprese. This is one of those dishes that reminds you that good food doesn't have to be complex. It's all so simple but the freshness of the ingredients and flavors come together so so well.

Then finally we had the tiramisu for dessert. It was fine but definitely not quite as mind blowing as the other dishes.

The only thing to watch out for is the restaurant itself is a bit small so when it fills up it does get quite loud.

Overall a no brainer 5/5.
Small place but serves big flavors of Southern Italian food. The combo meal is affordable and a great deal for 2. If u come on Wednesdays and get the combo u get a free wine!

Not the worst pizza I've ever had but that's the best I can say about it. The staff is friendly and they do work fast, and the counters and floors are clean, but I'm pretty sure some of the ingredients (like the sauce) are not made fresh.

To be fair I know this restaurant is not among the finest ones in the city, but to be honest I wasn't overwhelmed but my pizza.

I guess I might go back if I was in a hurry or for convenience but I don't see why I should have to pay for something that I can get better and cheaper a block away.

Carb-heaven!  Crowded place but there was only a short wait before we scored a couple seats at the counter.  Note: I love counter seats when you can see the kitchen in action.

House-made ricotta cavatelli to start and was probably my favorite dish.
Bianca pizza: onion crema, shaved garlic, preserved lemon, aged provolone & wild arugula.  It was very light and the ingredients definitely complimented each other.
Brussels Sprouts pizza: w/ caramelized onion, thyme, bacon & smoked mozzarella.  Added a farm egg on top per our server's recommendation and the yolk helped add some sauciness to the pizza.  

I'm a fan!
Fantastic pizza with a unique crust. Crisp yet chewy, stays crisp for a good long time. That's to say nothing of the inventive and delicious toppings. Overall a lovely experience at this place.

My experience here was nothing short of amazing.  i loved everything about it.

the salumi plate was delicious, although i could have used more meat.

the brussels sprouts was the lardons were really, really tasty.  the sprouts were nice and singed.  the fattiness of the lardons really worked for me here.

the pizza....omg, the pizza.  first of all, a pizza is only as good as its crust, and the crust at Ragazza is exceptional.  the Warren Pear w/ caramelized onions, gorgonzola, Prosciutto di Parma & arugula pizza was off the hook, unbelievably, slap your mom in the face, crazy good.  all of the flavors were distinct and were simply singing on top of that delicious crust.  

the atmosphere is unpretentious and is the type of place you feel at home.

our server was extremely knowledgeable and personable and most of all, she was REAL.  had some nice convos with her, as it turned out she had mutual friends with someone in our party.

i would recommend this place to anyone in a heartbeat and i, myself, cannot wait to go back.  this place is better than Zero Zero, and i have yet to try Flour + Water, so we will see how it ranks once i tackle that feat.

Don't sit at the bar unless you WANT your hair to smell like campfire smoke. Plus, you just look at the food coming out and being placed in front of you (going out to other tables) and its pure torture when you are hungry.

Now for the food. I'm pretty happy that I've discovered this place. Good pizza. Get any pizza with egg. You wont be sorry. The crust is crunchy so dont go here if you dont like that.

The baked butternut squash rigatoni was on the sweet side. I usually prefer my pasta savory, but still, it was a good dish.

Oh and get the affogato for dessert. An espresso shot with Bi-Rite almond ice cream. Delish!

Great restaurant overall. Usually with a wait-- so come early or late. NOT for big parties as the place is somewhat small. 4 stars and not 5 simply because my hair smells like smoke and needs a wash, but maybe if i sit not at the bar next time, I might review again and give it 5 stars.

My pizza didn't have cheese on it. This was very unnerving. It didn't list cheese on the menu, but I made the incorrect assumption so it WAS my fault, but a pizza without cheese is...odd.

I sampled a dining companions pasta with pork belly that was absolutely phenomenal, and their warmed olive appetizer and Salumi plate were also very tasty. not a big beer selection but this is more of a wine place anyway.

They have a nice patio out back to wait for a table which we found very pleasant,. but we were disappointed to be told a 30-minute wait and when we checked in again, were told our table had been given away to a VIP and we ended up waiting a full hour. Not very festive for a birthday dinner. :(

It was a little spendy but very good food so in my opinion worth it. Parking is ridic though, stick with MUNI.

Came here with the girl and two good friends. We shared 3 pies:

1. Margherita - tasty, huge basil leaves and light on the mozzarella but still excellent.
2. Mariquita Farms - this was very cheesy and heavier, but man that smoked bacon was really good. Hint of sweet and savory.
3. Miss Figgy - quite possibly the best one of the three here. Figs, onion and pork belly is such a good combo...sweet and savory again.

We also had a salad: Wild Arugula w/ Black Mission figs, fennel, goat cheese & pistachios  - excellent.

Bottom line this is one of those places where I am both excited and hesitant to try anything else because what I had was all so good and I want it again. On the other hand, everything else looked really good when I would see things going to other tables.

Will be back.

I've walked by this place at least 50 times, so when a friend suggested we check it out, I jumped at the chance. I've never seen it without a line out the door, so my friend said she'd try to make reservations. No dice. We planned our attack: We would meet around 7:00 and hope for the best. Worst case, if the wait was too long, we'd just stroll down Divis and find something else.

I arrived first and was slightly disheartened when I saw several people standing outside. Well, the wait-gods were on our side. We couldn't have had better timing - several tables were readying for departure and they could seat us in about 15 mins. Win! They have a system where the hostess enters your name and number in the computer, after which you receive up to 3 texts: (1) your estimated wait time, (2) 10 minute warning, and (3) get here - your table is ready! I only received the first, as we were seated almost immediately. We did wait briefly in the heated patio out back. The setting made us feel a jacuzzi in the corner was in order.

As for the food.. I began salivating upon being seated. Everything smelled fantastic. Since I was mid post-holiday cleanse and am generally g-free, my selection was limited. And yet, they had options. I had the chicken breast with polenta, cooked to perfection. My friend (who was just over a stomach bug) had the Amatriciana pie, and let me tell you - it looked beautiful. How I envy pizza eaters. Managed to enjoy every last bite of my meal while fighting off the urge to indulge further. Our service was good, food excellent. I will be back, once I can have me a glass of wine.

Everything about this place was just great.  Even though, the roast chicken dish we got was still raw in the middle, the problem was corrected without a bat of the eye.  The second round was amazing.  The Bianca pizza was awesome (although a wee bit salty...but still worthy of 5 stars)

Even though I had a hiccup of an experience, I still thought this place was great.  I'll be back!

Yep, good italian style pizza, great service, I'm a fan. The tables are a little small, the service is slow (not bad slow but there is one waiter it seemed for the room, in fact-sometimes I like slow)  

Rice balls were great, but a little pricey for 3. Pasta was good, but the star of the day was the pizza.  We had a sausage with the fried egg, and the Miss figgy.  MMMM, mmmmm.  

It was my birthday (well, truth be told, the day after) and we were taking my best buddy back to the airport for a 10pm flight.  We told our waiter and we got a pot du creme (complete with candle) for my b-day - always love that.

Food is delicious and the pizza is off the hook... the owners and staff are so gracious. Seems from the other reviews their biggest crime is being a great restaurant in an oasis of average. I am so happy they opened before the holidays and thrilled to have a new pizza place close by!

We had a great dinner last night - a flavorful rotisserie chicken with salsa verde and their chili crunch sauces, roasted potatoes, crispy brussels sprouts and the little gem ceasar salad.  All excellent, well seasoned.  What an easy Sunday night dinner. What I loved was that the chicken was not huge - just right for two or three with leftovers.  The veggies were also just right for two with leftovers.  We are so glad they are here in the West Portal.  Looking forward to trying some of the market offerings.
Super addition to the 'hood. What a great place. Beautiful layout and fabulous food. I am going there regularly for sure.

We have ordered from them four times now so I feel qualified to write a review.  Obviously, with the excitement of them opening up in the neighborhood, the early mania was annoying, but predictable (phone ringing off the hook, long time to get order and running out of roasted chicken).  But they seemed to have worked out the logistics and it's been smooth sailing lately.  In fact, on one occasion, they offered to call me when our order was almost ready even though they were super crowded.  This was much appreciated and the food was piping hot when we got it.  As for the food, the pasta rocks.  Really, really good.  We especially loved the spaghetti, but all were really good.  The roasted chicken was great on 3 out of 4 experiences.  We found it to be juicier when ordering two 1/2s rather than 1 whole.  On one occasion, it was too dry.  This was early on so chalking that up to opening mania.  Not sure why they feel they need to give "sauces" with the roasted chicken.  We were not impressed and would skip those.  The pizza was also hit/mis but more hit than miss.  The first time, not so great.  The second time, we ordered it "extra thin and crispy" and it was perfect.  Also, the place is adorable and has a lot of pastas to go (cook your own) as well as sauces to go (like Guerro's).  Overall, very exciting new addition to the neighborhood which I think will only get better.  Hoping they add tables when life gets back to normal.

I've had really good pizza here, and really bad pizza. (over cheesed over sauced no char soggy)

Again with the customer service, it has either been really good or really bad. Nothing in the middle.

The I dont give a f attitude along with the prices and inconsistency keep me from going here often. I still frequent a few times a year and I'm either surprised or reminded of why its disappointing.

The sicilians are consistent but I prefer the thin crust (when its good who knows?)

The best pizza spot in the neighborhood still :/

The meatballs are also consistently very good and cheap!.. Pick up some meatballs and a box of pasta from AG Ferrari's and you have awesome dinner

Wow...great reviews right?! We had the worst experience here. We came here because we saw good reviews through yelp. We bought a pizza, wings, and garlic cheese bread. My friend and I vomited after we ate their food once a few hours passed of eating part of the meal. We couldn't eat all of it because of how bad it was. Afterward, my friend in the middle of the night had extreme anxiety and threw up that whole night to where she felt very scared for her racing heart rate to the point we went to the ER. No joke. This was a week ago...and STILL she has felt anxiety and finally starting to feel better. I would stay away from this restaurant. As odd as this seems I wouldn't risk eating here. Too add to all of this we came 25 min after ordering to pick our food up (they told us to come 15-20 min to pick up, and hadn't even put our pizza in the oven..)

Bad vibes, bad food. Don't go here and get yourself sick!!!

They make a heck of a slice, you've got to give them that.  Both the Sicilian and regular slices are pretty solid.  Not quite New York-solid, and no contest to my all-time favorite, Umberto's in New Hyde Park, NY, but not bad by San Francisco standards.

Delivery can be a tad sketchy, though.  It's a little slow and cash-only (as is the place itself, but at least there there are ATMs nearby).  Never have them deliver a Sicilan pizza to you -- you'll end up with a doughy mass on the bottom of the box and all the cheese stuck to the top.  They just haven't quite figured that one out yet.

But go there for the slices.

Macello's Pizza is not only a great pizza place, but it's also a fantastic place to get a slice late at night or grabbing a quick slice while someone is holding your place in line while waiting for a movie at the Castro.
