Also the chicken wings were a bit dry but the redeeming factor was the caprese salad. That was probably my favorite dish of the night lol!

I want to give them another chance and I will come back!  I'm hoping it was just an off night and the second time will be spot on.

the service was excellent and staff were friendly.  my gf and i had the half and half meator and classic pizza with wings.  a bit greasy but good.  we both liked the classic.  also made it in time before happy hour!  nice date place.

Little Star... So hip. Chics with asymetrical haircuts and dudes with beards galore.

I don't really like this place. Need a reservation? Don't accept them, so hip for the city. You're gonna love the wait!

I tried 4 different pizzas. Two of them were deep dish, two of them were thin crust. The deep dish was sauce all the way with cornbread crust (i still don't understand the appeal of that). The thin crust pizzas were oily. This place is a hipster palace for sure.

You know what though? The wings were good, 1 extra little star!

One of my favorite Chicago-Style/Deep-dish Pizza places in SF.

The cornbread crust is an interesting and delicious modification.

Highly recommend.

Divine! My husband is kind of hard to please when it comes to any food, let alone pizza. He's way better at food choices and cooking than me. I suggested we eat here (I ate here a few years ago with friends without him)..."BEST PIZZA HE'S EVER HAD!" We had the Garlic bread with cheese, Margherita, New Yorker, and the Hot Tony,all delicious!

Although good service can save a bad meal not even an awesome pizza can save bad service.

We used the yelp waitlist and upon check-in, we were given the option of waiting an additional 30 mins to be seated inside or be seated right away outside. Things started to go downhill from there, we waited 15 mins before a waiter showed up to take our order. The pizzas came out after 45mins and our waiter said it was because "the runner fell asleep*". *fell asleep in the non literal sense for forgetting to take out our order from the kitchen.

Would recommend the food but caution anyone willing to sit outside as you may end up waiting longer for your food than for a seat inside with better service.

As you can probably tell from the pictures, we were too hungry to even remember where our phones were.

I don't discriminate when it comes to pizza.  Deep dish, NY style, cracker thin, coal oven, wood oven...I love pizza in general!!

Having just said that, I feel fortunate enough to live in the city where Tony's all started.  Award winning pizza and for good reasons too...they offer an array of different styles of pizza all cooked in different temperature ovens.  One of the only places in the city where you can get coal oven pizza, so awesome and tasty!  You can never go wrong with their New Yorker or Margarita, both pizzas are divine, with the right amount of tomatoes sauce to cheese ratio.  Just came with some coworkers that tried both pies for the first time and they were all blown away.

Yes, this place does get PACKED no matter what time of the day you go but it's worth it.  Unfortunately, they do not take reservations so expect a wait, but thankfully, they are right in the heart of North Beach so you can easily put your name down and walk around for a bit.  If you line up before they open for lunch, you can easily make the first wave.  :)  In a rush and cannot wait?  Walk next door to Slice House and grab a slice (or pie) from there instead or venture to their sister restaurant, Capo's for their deep dish goodness.  Capo's takes reservations too!

While Tony's is known for for their pizza, don't overlook their coccoli.  Those salted fried pillows are insanely delicious along w/ their housemade pasta + meatballs.  If you are a fan of pizza and/or Italian food in general, definitely give Tony's a try!
Delicious! Just the right amount of sweet and spicy. Also ordered the battered fried artichokes and ricotta stuffed squash blossoms, highly recommend.

Very charming little Italian place on a street in North Beach filled with strip clubs and adult video stores.  As others have said, expect a bit of a wait - we were told to expect a 45 minute wait for a party of 4 on a Saturday night around 6:15, but actually ended up getting seated a little before that.  The owner was incredibly friendly, and actually remembered us when we came back after going elsewhere to pass the time, and the booth we were seated in was very cozy and felt like we were secluded from the hustle and bustle of the restaurant.  The restaurant is small, and while it gets loud from all the talking, the booths were far enough removed to the sides that we didn't have to shout to talk to the other people at our table.  
Onto the food...I was ever-so-slightly disappointed, as I always seem to be after going to a place that has more than a 4 star average on yelp.    The menu is very basic, so definitely expect comfort food, and even pretty unoriginal comfort food at that.  I sampled the chicken parm, which was surprisingly good, despite not really being very breaded (the cheese on top was absolutely amazing) and the spinach ravioli in tomato cream sauce (a special), that was not amazing but had a nice llttle kick to it, which is unexpected with Italian food.   My boyfriend had spaghetti and meatballs, which he said was good.  I'd personally give the food three stars instead of four, but since my boyfriend, his mom and his sister, all loved the food, I'm giving it four.  I doubt I'd come back here, but that's mostly because I come into the city very rarely and I like to try new places.
A quaint family owned authentic italian place. Busy, but worth it. Delcious pizza, old-school feel and waiters that call you "Bella," what more can you ask for?

Absolutely heaven for pizza lovers. Tony's is always busy  just for heads up. I usually wait an hour to get in, but it's all worth it once you got seated. They have so many different types of pizzas and I absolutely love their truffle giant meatball as an appetizer. So delicious.
Amazing pizza and super friendly service.  Highly recommend!  Try the meatball gigante and Cal Italia pizza.

"From your grocer's freezer to North Beach"

The infamous Tony has arrived. You may remember him from such $1 pizzas as Tony's Original Pepperoni Pizza or Tony's Supreme Pizza.

I came here in search of pizza. Apparently not every restaurant in Little Italy sells pizza (go figure!). I noticed this place because of the long line outside. That usually means one of two things: either the food is good or the service is slow. It was a little bit of both.

This is a stand up, get a slice, and walk out kind of joint. There is a table or two but there's also nice park outside to enjoy the slice of heaven. There are two registers for above average efficiency. Red pepper packs to go. Oh and of course vegan food options.

Overall it's a pretty good place. Not bad, not fantastic, but it hit the spot. Stop by if you want a slice to go.

LIFE'S MYSTERIES: So yeah I get it, this probably isn't the Tony of frozen food aisle fame, but then why are the pepperoni's so reminiscent of my childhood. They're little circles prone to curling up. You know what I'm talking about!

Went here on a wednesday afternoon to try. They have outdoor seating and take out. We got a pizza for takeout, i think it was $31 or something, so in the pricier side, but not too bad. We ate at the park across the street. The slices are very big and the pizza is more of a thin crust than a bready crust. It was good! Very very very oily. Literally each peperoni had a little pool of oil in it, it was insane. It was a classic italian pizza, I like that the crust is crunchy and crisp, the sauce and sausage and stuff were great, but I wasn't a huge fan of the little balls of cheese they put on top. I think it's mozzerella ?? Idk what it was tbh, but it was weird. I love cheese but isn't mozzerella supposed to be like...stringy ? Like cheese pull type stuff ? Their cheese was like, almost crumbly, more of a ricotta. Really weird imo but maybe I just cant appreciate pizza or cheese. Other than that it was a great pizza!
A must go place when visiting SF. Tony's Pizza is so good! Delicious wood fired pizza. Kids pizza was perfect for our son. Go here!

AMAZING!! So good! They were so kind and made chicken alfredo for my husband and daughter and it was one of the best sauces he'd ever had! I had lasagna and it was delicious. The bread was a little on the hard side, but I don't need the extra carbs. And for being such a small restaurant we were still able to fit a party of 17 and there was another party of about 10.

Pizza.  The final frontier.  Seriously though, the best pizza I have had in the city, maybe the Bay Area.  Get the spinach and fresh parmesan.  If you don't want to deal with the lines to get in, call ahead and have one to go.

All I can say is skip the pasta, go for the pizza!  The pizza is thin-crust style (not as thin as NY but thin enough) and is cooked in a wood-fired oven giving it a slightly crispy, char taste to the crust. It's not as crispy as a potato chip, but it was crispy enough that I swear it actually made a "crisp" sound when I bit into it.  Crisp, not crunchy.  Hubby & I were once crazy enough to fly to NYC for a weekend just for the SOLE purpose of glutton-izing ourselves on pizza. We tried all of the top 8 Zagat rated pizzerias in just under 2 days so yeah, we like NY style pizza and by our standards, this one is pretty good (particularly #8 - the one with fresh spinach and parmesan). I do hate myself for always comparing restaurants to those found in other cities, but alas I can't help it. Tommaso's pizza is not as good as NYC (it's probably because SF tap water is too clean while the dirty NYC tap water helps to "flavor" the crust - yes, I know, gross but oh so tasty).  Still, Tommaso's is good enough that you'll end up craving to eat it again....

However, really do pass on the pasta though....nothing special and I think I made better spaghetti when I was in the 8th grade (and I'm not even Italian or White for that matter)...
Reeks of red wine - never a bad thing. Great lasagna here! The wait was about an hour on a weeknight.

Great ambiance for a nice dinner date.  No reservations so prepared to wait a lil, but they'll serve you wine in line so no worries. The food beamed with fresh ingredients and the cheeses were to die for.  I got the veal parmigiana which was delicious with just the right mixture of marinara sauce, crusted veal, and cheese.   The tiramisu is a great way to top off your meal.   It tasted just like the ones i had in italy!

Luckily, we saw this place on the Food Network while we were relaxing in our San Fran hotel and decided to stop by for dinner.

We sat at the bar, which had no wait. The bartender was really talented and put effort into all the drinks he made. He made my husband an awesome orange moscow mule.

We shared a meatball gigante with wild mushroom, pancetta, and cream sauce. This was AMAZING. The meatball itself was a perfect blend and the sauce was da bomb.

We also had the Margherita pizza which was good (but nothing special), but coming from NYC, it's easy to find a great pizza pie.

This is a nice clean mom and pop place that seems to be not lacking any business as they were packed as hell, that being said the food was ok but not impressive  also don't come here if you're driving since parking will be impossible.

This is really a good place to be! A small Italian restaurant located in a basement. It seems to be a popular place, it was packed all the time we were there. The service was good, quick and friendly. The atmosphere was intimate and casual and sitting on the long table in the middle you are sure to make some new friends. The food was good, I had the Calzone, and even though I think it would have tasted better without so much ricotta, it was absolutely a good pizza. Large portions. A good place to start our visit to San Francisco for sure.

Very good Italian food tucked away in....little Italy.  Big surprise, I know.  Above average pasta dishes.  I have heard good things about their pizza as well.  But the thing that made me most happy was the cannoli.  I ordered the chocolate version expecting basic ricotta with chocolate chips inside.  What I got was brown chocolate ricotta inside.  Damn, it was delicious.  Well done, guys

Came in for dinner last week.  The margarita pizza with burrata cheese was the best pizza I have every had!  The meatballs were also delicious and a perfect start my meal.  The wine list is unique and I loved the Salty Dog cocktail that I got.  Service was very friendly and hospitable as well.  Perfect spot for a group dinner or date-night.

Came to Delarosa for dinner with a friend, after searching around downtown SF during a Friday night for a place that had a short wait. Wood-fired is my favorite style of pizza, and along those lines, the crust texture and consistency of the pie we had here was quite good. I was disappointed by the flavor of the spicy marinara pizza we ordered, and the lack of toppings did not help. I was surprised to hear that the normal way of ordering the spicy marinara was cheese-less, which I cannot imagine would help. I am a fan of the atmosphere of this place and would return, most likely to try something different.

Every time we come to SF - we have to go here. Talk about the most amazing drinks, they feel like a fantastic chemistry experience. The food is delicious as well - my favorites are the meatballs in spicy marinara (I ate them all myself - sorry fiancee! So good) and the hot salami pizza. My mouth is watering just thinking of it. They are always busy especially on the weekends and they do not take reservations for small parties. We put our name in and went to a pub around the corner to have some drinks and wait our turn. WORTH the wait. Can't wait for our next visit to SF to go again.

My husband and I popped in for lunch on Black Friday and the place was packed, but thankfully we only needed to wait 15 minutes for a table for 2.  The host seemed to be doing double duty as both a host and a waiter, which made his service as a waiter suffer (he wound up being our server).  We sat at the high table directly behind the bar and I am not a fan of how you sit at the same table and practically on top of your fellow diners.  This is our first time to San Francisco, and maybe this is common, but it was a bit off putting.  We couldn't have a private conversation, and we know all about the birthday plans of the people on my right and the financial struggles of the people on my left.  BUT the food (spicy meatballs, burrata burschetta and arugula pizza) were absolutely delicious.  Prices were reasonable.  Would go back at a less crowded time and ask for a private table.
Awesome food. Good vibe. And the best 90s play list I've heard in a while.

When this place gets packed, be ready to sit elbow to elbow with a stranger. The food is ok. A lot of olive oil is put on everything thats why everything taste good. Servers didn't have patiance during my visit. Good beer thogh.

Oh holy crap! This is the best pizza ever. Yelp is why we went here- no offense to Tacomania or whatever that place down the street is called, but this place blows it away.

Seriously- the only pizza I've ever had that comes close to theirs was purchased by the gram in Roma. I recommend that place too.

Had a great dinner. Super cool place. Loved the pasta. Freshly homemade with a delicious meat sauce. The pizza was out of this world. And the grilled calamari was fantastic. Ordered lemonade and it was fresh squeezed. The atmosphere is fun and overall a great experience. The only minus is the limited space. The restaurant has communal tables and it's not a large space. Really loved the meal.

Ever since I heard the news that Fuzio was closing and being replaced by another pizza joint from the creators of Beretta, I couldn't wait to get in. Unfortuately I didn't make it until my family visited the Friday before Christmas, and it was AMAZING!!!

When I heard the reservations were for parties of six or more and I only had five, I was bummed. When I found out my brother's girlfriend would be joining us at the last minute, I quickly called and spoke with Mitchell who was so kind and accomodating. He took my name and phone number and put me on the wait list. I stopped by about 30 minutes before our arrival to check in and he thought it would be another 30. When we arrived, we still waited yet another 30, but we were happy at the bar. I knew my father would love their extensive beer list. I was right, he loved it.

As soon as we sat down our waitress was super helpful. She even brought us 3 complimentary appetizers and thanked us for waiting so long! Can you believe it? And they were phenomenal!

My father loved it so much, including the price, that he wanted to take us all back again the following Sunday. Again, we received excellent service and a complimentary pizza. Where did these people come from?

We all fell in love. My brother's girlfriend forgot her ID and when I went back to get it a few days later I told the manager how impressed we were. He said something like, "thanks for the great review on Yelp." At the time I hadn't written one. But now I have. Thank you, Delarosa!

Dela rossa is a warm, casual environment that encourages you to share with your neighbors with the 'family style' treatment of dishes and the long-benches to sit on.  I ducked in here for a mid-afternoon snack on a Sunday afternoon.

We had the fried brussel sprouts and the gnocci with rock shrimp and olives.  The fried brussel sprouts were AMAZING; I swear, even little kids will eat them like french fries!  The gnocci was only so-so (I'd rate it a 3-star).  The olive flavor was a bit too 'over the top' and the rock shrimp were mediocre.

Next time (because I will come back), I'm going for the donuts.  I saw 3 ladies sitting next to us eating these donuts, breaking them apart, and dipping it in different sauces.  That's what I'm doing next ~ going straight for the dessert menu.
Great pizza--price can really add up if up if you're not careful though.  Wait goes pretty quick unless the line is out the door.  You can get takeout too, which always seems to surprise some people.

We've been to both many times, but I think the reason we come to this location more is because seating and parking are slightly better here.  

If it's just my husband and I, we always get the Salsiccia pizza and one of the specials.  One of our fav special is the Baked Lumachine with Sunday Supper Sauce.  If the arancini are on the menu, those are a nice add on and if we are really hungry, the second on the pizza list is the Prosciutto Pie.

Service is friendly and prompt.  Always a safe go-to option if you have friends in town.
This place has the best pizza in Pac heights hands down!! maybe even in the entire city. thier antipasto is always amazing, the staff is very friendly and the pizza to die for......a must have !

I went to delfina about a year ago and I have to say I was expecting it to be way better than I found it to be.... since so many people had told me it was the coolest restauraunt in the city, celebs have been spotted at it blah blah blah!
I found the food alright  I mean I'm not a tough critic when it comes to food.. but the only thing the pizza had going for it was the cheese and the little bit of basil they gave me mixed together..... which didn't cut it that night cause I was starving from walking around for over an hour trying to find a restraunt for my friends birthday cause our favorite restauraunt (suppenkuche) was closed..  anyway for dessert I waited 45 minutes for them to bring me 3 little spoonfuls of chocolate gelato which I wasn't impressed with at all.  Oh and the wait time was an 1 and a half hours which just sent me over the edge when I learned they didn't even bother to give you bread but 5 little BREADSTICKS. So anyway to feed 3 economic
people= 66 dollars plus tip. NEVER COMING HERE AGAIN!
Ehhhhh,,,.. Not worth the price nor the wait. Nothing special at all. It was 4 of us and we spent nearly 200 bucks for 2 sodas 4 beers 2 apps and 4 personal pizzas...

Yum, yum and yum!  This place is so good and the staff is so friendly and wonderful.  My favorites are the tuna conserva salad and the sausage pizza.  You also can't go wrong with the meatballs.  There is almost always a wait but just write your name on the chalkboard and you'll be called in when a seat opens up.
Good pizza, but not as creative/tasty as Beretta, Starbelly etc.  Need more topping combos!  I want to try the actual Delfina restaurant because I hear it's much better.
Absolutely LOVE Pizzeria Delfina. Excellent margherita pizza and phenomenal service- the meatballs aren't bad either!

Great thin crust pizza!  My sister and I split the arugula & prosciutto pizza and a tricolore salad.  Great dressing on the salad.  The homemade lemon and limeades were delicious!  

Nice spot for lunch, especially on a sunny day when you can eat outside.  As a plus, there are some cute little shops on Filmore Street close by.

I love the mission delfina too but had a pretty amazing experience here a while ago with a couple of friends.  It seems the waitstaff was privy to my weaknesses and made me feel really good about ordering (more or less) one of everything - which everyone always laughs at. And it's delicious, all of it.

Wonderful fresh baked goods!!

I'm a big fan of Arizmendi! I had heard great things about it from friends before and was definitely very pleased when I finally got to stop by to sample some baked goodness myself!

Mushroom, Red Onion, Asiago, Garlic, Oil, Parsley & Parmesan Pizza - Very good thin crust vegetarian pizza. I would definitely return for this and any of their baked goods : )'

Kookie Brittle - Really crisp, crunchy cookie chock-full of yummy chocolate chips and almonds. I LOVED IT! But, I think I will love anything and everything from this bakery

Their breads and pastries also looked fantastic so I anticipate many future trips to Arizmendi for my baked good fix : )

I have lived in the sunset area all my life and did not discover this place until two months ago. how is that possible?!

Anywho, just to repeat what other yelpers have said, this place is really something. I love their pizza and how they change it daily so that you always have something to try. I believe the first one i tried had a ginger sesame sauce on it or something close to that. it was unbelievably delicious. I wish i had ordered a lite-baked one for myself to take home. I also had one of their bread sticks which i have been trying to recreate for two months now but i just can't seem to get it to taste the same. The crunchy cheesy greasy stick is just what I want when i need a pick me up. Unfortunately, they go fast, so get a lot, and get them early

I have also had the opportunity to try their cheese roll, blueberry corn muffin, and pecan roll.

Cheese roll: i feel like it would have tasted better if it was warmed up.
Blueberry corn muffin: delicious cold or hot. but doesn't taste very good the next morning.
Pecan roll: too sweet but i never really enjoyed sweet stuff anyways.

My go-to bakery for extremely fresh(most of the time still warm!) baked goods.

The blueberry corn muffin is my favorite breakfast. Cherry corn scone is also delicious. Just slightly sweet and I'm on love with the cornmeal crunch.

I also love their focaccia. My favorite so far was the carmelized onion and goat cheese. Soooo good. Today I had a warn tomato/mushroom-very good. They also had a ridiculously tempting dessert foccacia covered in blueberries, nectarines and strawberries-must go back for that.

They have good quality coffee and my fav orange San pellegrino as well.

Great place for baked goods in the Sunset.

The daily pizza is is constantly revolving.  The crust could be a bit lighter but it still is very good.  So when your favorite favor comes up, you can stuff half a pizza in the freezer for that lonely night.  Believe or not it's even better re-toasted in the oven.

Another thing not to miss out on, the chocolate tea bread...mmm!

Stumbled upon this place (Oakland one) while bumbling around. I made a vow, no matter what happens, you'll always have my heart Arizmendi.

EVERYTHING, I REPEAT, is well-prepared and seasoned.

P.S. Someone make a listing for Arizmendi Oakland?? I'm too lazy.

The pizza is wonderful and worth more than $2.50 per slice.  They only have one flavor per day and the  flavors are always inventive  - my two recent favorites included sweet potato with sage and goat cheese, pesto, mushroom!  I love how when they cut the slices they'll give you a mini slice on top of your slice.  

The breads I've tried have also been really yummy.

Mmmm! When you walk in you can smell the fresh baked pastries and homemade daily pizzas. It's in the perfect part of town and close to Golden Gate Park.
I'm in love.

We decided we wanted to do a daytrip up to Tomales Bay to get some fresh, delicious oysters with some friends - so we started the day early and drove up to the city to meet up with them.  We, of course, had to stop for some breakfast, and decided to try out this bakery they recommended near their house.  

I totally went overboard there, and bought TONS of stuff.  I literally chose the largest bag they had and grabbed almost everything that I could with those tongs.  My favorite thing there was the blueberry corn bread, but everything I had there was good.

Downside was that it's cash only - luckily, I BARELY had enough cash to cover all of the baked goods I put in my bag.  I snacked on all of them throughout the day, and they were delicious.

If you're a carb lover, this place is your nirvana.

Had to stop in as I was running by the place when I got a whiff of delicious, yummy, freshly-baked bread. I doubled back very quickly and was greeted with a smile by the friendly staff behind the counter. I browsed around for a bit before selecting two different kinds of focaccia bread and a carrot muffin to go.

The muffin was amazingly moist, hearty, and had some kind of fruit puree in the center aside from the generous chunks of grated carrot. It was enough to delude me into thinking I was eating something moderately healthy despite the fact that it was a muffin. Absolutely finger-licking good.

The foccaccia bread likewise did not disappoint. I had the mushroom and the asiago with Roma tomato. The cheese melted on the asiago focaccia was SO GOOD. Crispy cheesy goodness baked into chewy, doughy bread sprinkled generously with sea salt. I devoured that thing in a second and did not even feel a moment's remorse for completely blowing the calories I had just burned off from my run. Will definitely be back again soon!

Love. I keep coming back for more, There is nothing about this gem that has not already been said. Believe every word. There is not one thing that I have not liked, here, perhaps its all the love that goes into their dough.

You have a cheat day, spend it here, you will be glad you did.

Bravo!
Clam and garlic foccacia! The thicker crust needs that extra bake they do to ensure the crust on the bottom is crispy. If they don't bake it well or long enough, you can taste the difference.
No regrets, ever. They serve their pizza hot and fresh! Always the best after a night out.

Not sure if the pizza was great because I came after a fun night out, or if it's that good.  It doesn't matter because I remember it hit all the right spots at 2am.

The garlic and clam pizza is a must and THE reason why you come here.  It was worth waiting almost half an hour for the pizza.  The pizza are Sicilian slices, so they are in squares and a bit thicker compared to your normal triangle slices.  I think 2 slices is good enough to fill you up.  There seems to always be a line, so that means their pizza is probably always fresh.
Their pitzza is different and it's a place you should try once, but I personally like thinner crusts and less cheese. This place was a good try though.

Latina lady around 9 pm  1/7/19. Sir, owner of golden boy pizza. We walked in, 6 people inside. Asked the Latin lady what slices are available at the moment. Her response "it's all out there check for yourself(why are you even paying her)". I say "ok". She goes ahead and starts cleaning tables further down inside and shouts across "dude, why don't you just leave".  At this point we were flabbergasted. Celebrating fresh Clemson national championship win, we were  euphoric but this petty, degenerate behavior from a service industry worker just reminded me that she doesn't care about you and the establishment Golden boy is, and what it stands for. I love Golden boy and won't let this petty worker tarnish its name. Please take necessary action you feel one should but plz don't take steps that have led to the demise of so many loved establishments in the city of San francisco. Customer is not always right but sometimes they are, and we're just helping you before it's too late.

Personally I feel the lady doesn't belong in the service industry.

What can I say!! Yelp you are always dead on with the ratings!! This pizza is different than what I've ever had. It's a little on the thick side but packed with flavor. I had just the cheese and it did not disappoint. It has many herbs and what taste like garlic that add tons of flavor to it. I was in town for 4 days and I came twice already. Friday and Saturday night and there was a line each day. The only bad part is there is very limited seating which makes great for take out but hard if you want to eat in. Some of the best pizza we have had!

The line at lunch time told me a lot about this place. The pizza is great. I had a slice of vegi, and split a slice of pepperoni with a friend.  Couldn't eat it all. Love the crispy crust.

The seating is minimal inside, and the stools seem a little close to the counter but it worked, and I'm sure it discourages lingering. I'm sure we will be back.

Delicious pizza! We were on our way to an Italian restaurant and we passed by this small place.  The smell of fresh made pizzA made it hard to ignore.. CASH ONLY.. .the line was long but  moved quickly
We got veggie pesto pizza and a slice of the garlic clam  pizza.. totally worth it!!! Loved the garlic clam pizza..

I used to think this pizza was only good after I rolled out of Geno and Garlo after beer or ten, but they really do have good pizza. The Clam and Garlic is my personal favorite, but I do not recommend it for a first date.

The line moves quickly if you stay off of your cell phone, so please don't be that person.

Now, this is pizza! Who doesn't like their pizza with a side of punk rock? Well, if you don't, stop reading now. This place isn't for you.

Golden Boy serves up some amazing pizza. Probably the best pizza I've found in the Bay Area. They serve up the fattest, most delicious squares of French bread pizza, I think I've ever had.

Can we pause for one second? The ambience of this place is insane. They have killer tunes playing. Is that a B-side off Dookie I just heard? YEP! They have awesome wall tags and stickers all of the place. AND they have one of the coolest logos I've ever seen!

This place is legit. Bring your vegetarian friends also, because they have some serious veggie pies on the menu.

I'm going to keep it simple and tell you to order the sausage pizza with a pint of anchor to wash it down. I mean, c'mon? When in Rome!

Stay golden, Golden Boy!

Friendly service, clean place. However, Too loud in here, I couldn't hear the waiter and ended up mishearing a menu item causing me to get the wrong dish. Lasagna bianca is too greasy, like a cheese rock. Couldn't eat much of it. Should've tried the pizza instead. Would not recommend. In hindsight, should've left when we saw the menu. More hipster than anything else.

Our wait was long but I'm guessing it was because we were a party of 5. We waited about 45 minutes, however the food and the service by "Red" was fantastic! The food came out soon after we ordered and it was all delicious! The service by our server could not be better!

Waited 45 minutes for no food. Waitress rarely checked in on us and kept promising for food to be coming. Then it was the printer's fault on why the food wasn't showing up. Then it was the wrong order. Larger parties arrived later than us and got their food quicker. Somehow we drew the short straw with our clearly inattentive waitress. The food is fantastic, as I have eaten here previously.

I have been on a hunt for the perfect Margarita Pizza for years. And let me tell you this is one of them. Hands down the margarita pizza here is perfection. This is coming from someone who has been to Italy and ate pizza in Napoli where margarita pizza was invented and I can boldly state that it's just as yummy as in Italy! Must visit.
Great pizza place! Very authentic and not pretencious. Quality and well set with a good atmosphere. I come here regulary and always have a great time.
Pretty good late night bite. The pizza is amazing, especially the crust! The pasta (seafood linguini) was tasty but the portion was very small. More like a snack than a meal.
Food is really good. It is very loud in there. And seating is at giant farm style tables. It also gets pretty packed in there.

I am shocked that this place is not a complete 5 star spot. The sausage fennel pizza was one of the best I have had at an Italian resto. I have also had the burrata and can promise that it is amazing. My favourite item is still the margherita with burrata. But, if you are looking for something lighter then the margherita (add arugula) is an obvious classic! Worth the price :)

Nice place, but horrible service. How do you mess up pasta or pizza? Honestly the food was trash. The horrible alcohol selection will have you ordering ice tea or water instead. Save your time and go somewhere else.
The steak was delicious.  Seemed to be oriented towards family style dinning.  My group each ordered an entree,  and it worked out fine.

This review is for happy hour... The happy hour menu was small but good enough.  Especially when happy hour in Union square is almost non existence..  This place decor is hip and they bump good Edm music... The bar and restaurant is bright so it's great...
Very slow service and brought us soggy clod pizza!! Waitress came to our table saying you finished your pizza?? But we never got it and then brought us an old cold soggy pizza!

Best pizza place ever! I am a huge fan of Calzone pizza and they probably have the best in the city! I highly recommend this place. I found this place thanks to a food blogger in the city, and now I feel like everyone should know about this restaurant!! Their pizza taste like the one you can find in Europe, very authentic, very traditional! I recommend!

Pizza was good but the egg that we had ordered for our pizza was completely undercooked. The egg white was still all jelly and completely raw. It was unacceptable and not safe to eat - we had to send it back. They made a new pizza for us but seemed to struggle with cooking the egg (again!) the second time also! The pizza crust was getting a bit brown and burned, any more and it wouldn't have been enjoyable. They said that the egg was fine when they delivered the second pizza even though there were still some obvious clear whites so we just pulled that off and set it aside. Seems like they can benefit from learning when to put the pizza into the oven if they need to add an egg on top.
They do not offer the seafood pizza anymore. That was one of the reasons why we went there . The pizza was tasty but very soggy. The waitress was very nice. I won't recommend it.
Love this place! Prices r reasonable, they make the pizza fresh right in front of you! I had the margherita pizza and the lasagna and both were so delicious! Wanna come back and try more!
Not a fan of the cold to lukewarm burrata on my pizza. Made for a wet, sloppy slice of pizza. Solid service at the bar though.

I am a huge fan of Delarosa, I'd always been to the one in the Marina and the wait is kind of long and is really crowded. This one however, I went for a few weekday lunch meetings, there was no wait and the food was just as good. Looking forward to going back.
Busy restaurant and good food. Quick to get seated and service is efficient. Pizza was fresh and delicious and meatballs were big with lots of sauce. Highly recommend.

Seating was "social" style - a long table where you sit with other patrons. Very cramped and a bit awkward.
Food tasted good. The idea is to order a variety of plates to share. My family of 4 (2 adults, 2 teens) shared the honey burrata bruschetta (**/*****), margherita pizza (***), steak (**), mezzemani pasta with tomato sauce (****), and chicken meatballs (****).

I was able to place and order to go and I liked that they did not put the arugula on the pizza until I picked it up.  The crust was just the way I liked it, but it's getting 3 stars because the staff could have been more friendly.  Considering I was the only one in the restaurant at the time, I think they could have been more friendly.
Fantastic little hole-in-the-wall with the best thin-crust pizza.  But make sure to go early, as there are only 3 or 4 tables in the whole place.
Excellent crust & sauce but not worth the price and wait.  Everything is self serve.

Good simple freshly baked thin small pizzas with fresh ingredients, although plan to spend about $30-40 per person (or more if you're hungry) on just a small pizza ($10-15) and a salad (~$10) and wine ($7-12) since the portions can be small.  Excellent Belgian beer, wine by the glass, and freshly baked desserts, too.  Great neighborhood place for couples, not good for groups since it seats very few people inside with a few 2-person tables outside.  Nice place to sit outside on a warm evening with the dog and a glass of wine.

Good pizza is hard to find in the Bay Area, but this is one of the best ones.  I think Picco (in Larkspur) is still the best but Pizzetta is close behind.  There are only a few tables in this small establishment, so bring a coat while you wait outside.  It's worth the wait.

My wife and I used to love Pizzetta 211 but something has happened and it's fallen so much that it's sad.  This was not a bad day either, I've been here twice in a few months.  On both occasions the staff was just a notch above surly, but they don't make any effort to make you feel welcome or appreciated.   It's as if they're pissed that you're taking them from hanging out in the kitchen.  The service was also really slow on both occasions and the last time we waited 45 mintes for our pizza when there were only two other tables taken.  Lastly, the pizza is fine but the sauce is bland and the toppings nothing special.  With so many other good pizza places in the city there's no reason to go here.

We travel all the way across the city as often as we can to eat this pizza.  Its our favorite place in the bay area.  The ingredients are fresh, the dough is incredible, and the atmosphere is intimate and relaxing.  Its the perfect way to spend a Sunday afternoon.
Yum, yum, yum! Worth the drive to the sunset!!
Pizzetta is tiny, cozy, and fun. The pizzas are truly delicious, and the servers are very friendly. The wait can be a little painful, but it's worth it once you get inside. Highly recommended!

A friend living in the neighborhood told me about this small pizza place that has 4 tables an 4 bar stools. We tried it...and haven't stopped eating there for the past year. At least twice a month we go there. Jack is the cool waiter, laid back but responsive and welcoming. The pizzas are so tasty and crunchy and delicious that makes my month water just to think about it. They also make great salads and offer bottled root beer - all I need for a cool meal. I almost did not want to post a comment on yelp because I wanted to keep this hidden jewel for a selected group. But it is not fair. Everyone should have a chance to taste the best pizza - once at least!

Went here for my friend's 23rd birthday, and as a pizza enthusiast,  this is one of the best pizza joints I have ever been to.

Let me start off first by saying that I gave this place 4 stars instead of 5, only because of the wait. We got there around 6:30, and did not get seated until 7:45 or so. But if I had read the reviews, I should have seen that coming in haha. Plus, we had a party of 8.

We ordered the Classic Deep Dish Pizza, and the Pesto Based Thin Crust Pizza.

The Classic Deep Dish was super super good! I had one bite of the crust, and I was in heaven. The crust was probably the best pizza crust I had ever eaten. The toppings were plentiful, and fresh.

The Pesto Based pizza was pretty good, but if I ever come here again, I would definitely recommend sticking to the deep dish. Man... I'm craving pizza just thinking about the crust....

Oh yeah btw, the crust is amazing here.

P.S. Oh yeah, did I mention the crust?

3.5 stars for me.  I lived in Chicago for five years and became a deep dish pizza snob (thanks to lou mal's, pequods and gino's).  I think Little Star is the best deep dish in SF...which is kind of like being the tallest midget.  
When I need a deep dish fix, it is the place I go.

Dare I say this is the best pizza in SF? IMO.  Best Little Star location, too. Parking can be hard to find, but it's so worth it! I'll circle for a half an hour, just for a simple deep dish cheese! So flavorful and such a delight. A weekly splurge (for now!).

Went here on Friday with a group of friends. Its a pretty small place so the wait times can get long and you can't call ahead and put your name down. The food here was really good, especially the garlic bread. In fact, I could have just eaten that and been satisfied.  They have deep dish but they quoted is a 45 minute wait on then so we stuck to the thin crust.

The garlic bread was fantastic. It was basically a mini pizza but with cheese and minced garlic. Needless to say, there was none left over.

The Italian combo was a great pizza and had a good balance between meat and veggies. Usually when I get these types of pizzas the salami and bell peppers tend to overpower everything else for some odd reason but not on this one.

The pesto pizza was great as well. The chicken was well cooked and the pesto was flavorful. I would definitely get this again!

Great place to go with a group of friends.  We got 2 pies and it was amazing...but SO filling.  I couldn't go out after eating there...I tried, but I had to go home and crash.

The deep dish crust is amazing as well as the sauce.  I recommend the Little Star...soo good.

Tonight, it is raining. Raining might be an understatement. It is blowing water sideways. And Little Star doesn't deliver. But my order will be ready in 30 minutes. And why, you ask, am I writing my review now when I haven't gotten my order? I guess it was one of those things that I meant to do. And I keep using Yelp as my personal phone book, so when I looked it up tonight to call in a phone order, I decided to finally write a review.

I love this place. They are worth walking in the rain for to retrieve dinner. Perfect crust and yummy sauce. Even a simple cheese pizza tastes like heaven on a pan.

A tip: Want to be the cool kid who orders something by name that is not on the menu? Order a brass monkey. It's the little star specialty pizza plus sausage, and it's the most popular pizza they serve.

What could I possibly say about Little Star that hasn't already been said? This place has won Best of the Bay- Pizza for at least the last 3 straight years. I went for my first time recently and was beyond impressed by everything except the décor. The place opens at 5pm, but since there was a big party that day, they had their door open at 4:30pm. As the party was walking in, I walked in and was seated immediately. None of this, "We aren't officially open, so you'll have to wait," crap you'd get at pretty much any other restaurant. I was very impressed by this.

The rest of the lunch/dinner went great. Even though there were at least 20 people in the big party, another table with 2 people, and then my 2 top, we were treated just the same as we would be if we were the only people in the restaurant. I think they only had 2 servers at the time, so again, impressive. I got the Little Star pizza because it's good to order the dish named after the restaurant and I'm not big on meat (spinach, feta, ricotta, mushrooms, onions, garlic). It was amazing. The crust was great and the tomatoes on top were so unbelievably fresh. I've been to Uno's in Chicago and I like Little Star better. Yeah, I said it. One thing I read in the comments was that the crust was buttery- I disagree. I thought the pizza crust was going to be like eating a croissant, but it wasn't. Just the cornmealy goodness you would expect. By the way, the pizza heats up great, too.

The only MINOR issue with the place is that black curtains cover the windows and walls. The bar looks good, but maybe something else can be done. In the evening, the sun shines right into the windows, so maybe the curtains are really necessary. Who cares. They have the best deep dish anywhere.

Had a craving for deep dish pizza tonight and was looking for something as good as Viccolo. Went online and saw Little Star on 15th was nearby my friend's place so we went there. From the outside, it looked closed, like no one was there because the windows were darkly smoked. Luckily, we parked and went to the door as it was open. There was no wait and we got seated immediately.

We started with a mixed salad. This was probably one of the best mixed salads we'd ever eaten. I think we downed it in 5 minutes. The combination of dressing, feta cheese, and crushed nuts made it a really hearty salad.

We ordered a large Mediterranean Chicken Pizza which was actually too big for us to eat, but it was DELICIOUS! I luckily got to bring home the leftover pieces.

Total dinner: $35.26

Definitely will go back! Thanks Little Star!

I love love love little star pizza...unfortunately so does everyone else, therefor the wiat is usual an hour or so during peak dinner hours and especially on the weekends....although...I went there a couple of weeks ago on a friday and was the first ones seatted and beat the rush completely. So if ya wanna aboid the crowds... go at 5pm
reasonably priced, good service, GREAT music, nice art! Good Stuff!

CASH ONLY!

6:30PM on a Saturday eve, whew, just beat the rush!

Trendy ambiance: dim lighting to set the mood (the mood to eat foo!), interesting paintings to line the walls, and intimate table spacing.

Was seated in a min, noticing the hipster staff. Love being in the Bay for this reason: can express one's style while providing good service without being forced in a pretentious suite n' demeanor.

Grubbed on:
1. Mixed salad
    +I normally stay away from gorgonzola but it was soft and was
    balanced with the dressing
    +Fresh, fresh, fresh...especially the tomatoes!
2. Deep dish special (small): house-made meatballs, spinach, ricotta
    +Some sort of cornmeal formed the crust and dish: crispy good!
    +Meatballs retained unique flavor while mixed with the tomato sauce
    +Spinach provided a minor, bitter zing
    +Ricotta spotted on the top of each slice, provided some solids to
    the deep dish sauce

Final Call:
Place is awesome for dates or for groups. Come early though, otherwise you'll be waiting like the rest of the folks that came after 7:30PM. Can't wait to try another deep dish!
this place is one of my favorite pizza joints... i absolutely love their margherita pizza!!!  i've gone here several times and there's always a wait... but well worth the time =)
This place gets packed so be prepared to wait but it is so worth it.  Fresh amazing food.  My favorite is the Burratta but you cant go wrong with anything you order.

I heard great things about this pizza, but when the box came home, and the lid was opened, I was in shock.  CRUST EVERYWHERE.  The 2 or 3 bites you get of the good stuff per-slice are okay, but man o man, most of the slice--most of the pizza---was crust.  My girlfriend, a fan (but admitted to the over-abundance of the outer pizza regions)  likes the sauce they use on the pizza...and she likes the salady-concept they have come up for a pizza (she defends this pie, it should be known).  But I much prefer when she makes her version of it, because you actually get to bite into something--there is more topping and hers has much more taste (yes, I am a lucky man).  The Delfina MIGHTY crust, by the way, is very good as a dog treat.  Let it stand for about a day, and then it is better then a bone for your furry friend.  It is actually the best feature of an otherwise underwhelming experience.  For thin slice pizza, Gaspares or Georgios might not be as trendy...but are their pies ever better.  Trend versus pie...you make the call.

Three stars because I'm glad this place is in the 'hood, it's got a nice vibe, and I love Italian-style, thin-crust pizza. But because I love Italian-style, thin-crust pizza and have had it everywhere from Rio to Rome, I have to say I'm not particularly impressed with this version. The crust lacks quality control -- sometimes blobby and sometimes burnt. The tomato sauce is kind of bland. Though there are some good flavor combos, I'd much rather go to Pizzetta for its pure yumminess or to South Beach Cafe for a basic margherita.

I am on a quest to find the best pizza in San Francisco.  I have found Pizzeria Delfina to be close to the type of pizza that I enjoy.  Apparently, Little Star is fantastic for their deep dish pizza.  But here, at Delfina, I believe most of their pizzas are thin (or thinner) crust.  Pizzeria Delfina is popular for their Margherita pizza, but I usually like more toppings so I first tried their Salsiccia pizza (housemade fennel sausage, tomato, bell peppers, onions and mozzarella) - it was pretty good.  But on my second visit, I tried their Panna Pizza (tomato sauce, cream, basil, shaved parmigiano) with sausage.  The shaved parmigiano on this pizza makes a big difference - for cheese lovers, this is a great touch.  I recommend the Panna Pizza with your favorite topping(s).  I also tried their Grilled Asparagus (w/ lardo butter and breadcrumbs and bacon) and their Amarena Cherry Sundae (Vanilla gelato, chocolate sauce, pistachio, and whipped cream) - not a big sweets guy, but the cherry sundae was pretty awesome.  4 stars.

Went there last night - We tried four pizzas, the sausage, margherita and napoletana and the prosciutto one.  All were excellent, not too saucy or cheesy and the crust was really good.
There was a wait when we got there, but the hostess was really friendly and accurate about how long the wait would be.
Only downside was our waiter who had a chip on his shoulder.  When he took our order, he didn't provide any explanations when we clearly were confused about certain things....when we asked if he thought we had ordered enough for four, he just said "no" and didnt offer any suggestions and became impatient while we tried to figure out what else to order....there were a few more instances of his crappy attitude and rudeness that night, but I want to keep this review short.
Despite the waiter, the food was excellent, which is the most important thing....so Id definitely be back, although i'd probably ask for a different waiter if i got the same dude.

i'm a huge fan of the pizza here!  italian style with the most amazing tomato sauce.  the variety on the menu is not huge but, i think that's a good thing - i'd much rather have perfection of a few items than being par at many.  the biggest downfall is that it is a bit pricey for essentially bread, sauce and cheese (and not that much of it) - definitely not economically the best go to spot for a weekly nosh of pizza.  none-the-less, i would recommend it for the occasional visit - they most definitely do justice to the dish.

We had very high expectations for their pizza.  But were somewhat disappointed.  I think they tried to put too much vegetables on their pizza and it makes the crust soggy.  We had their cauliflower which was wonderful.  Overall, very expensive pizza and not worth it.

I have been a fan of Delfina in the Mission so when my friend sugggested we try Pizzeria Delfina at Califrornia and Fillmore I was very excited. After waiting for 45 minutes for our table ( write your name on a chalkboard and hope everyone leaves quickly ) we sat down and ordered a bottle of Aglianico. Someone brought the bottle already uncorked and put it in front of us without asking for a taste. It was unusual for an upscale place but it usually happens in Italy as waiters drop carafs of wine in front of  you and depart so I dismissed this fact in good spirit. When we poured the wine ourselves and tasted, it was iced cold. The very friendly waitress just came by an inquired about the wine. When I said it was too cold and offered her to feel the bottle, she dismissed me with a smile telling me that all wine is kept at perfect temperature in their cooler and if it s too cold it will warm up at our table.Nice...I did not bother to argue that you do not do it to a $40 bottle of wine and instead we ordered appetizersand pizza. Food came fairly quickly and Buratta was melting in my mouth; the Tuna salad was superb and the 4 cheeses pizza was delicious. We finished off our dinner with home made gelato ( get the chocolate) and espresso. By the end of the meal we forgot all about small  wine inidisgretions and agreed that we would be back in Delifna. Definitely!!!
Totally fun to sit at the bar and grab a salad, pizza, and dessert.  Long wait though.

This is a great family restaurant, great food and good prices. The only thing is they don't take reservations so if you go there on busy night, you might have to wait in line for an hour or two but it is worth it, since they have a great Italian food, Pizza and Pasta...

Don't bother with the baked clams.  It is small and dry and there is no taste to it.  The pizza is not bad.  It is standard thin crust.  There's not much sauce on the pizza, but it is tasty.  I can't taste too much of the wood though.

This place was good. Not that special in my opinion. We came at an odd time so there weren't that many people, which was GREAT because I heard it can get busy. The ambiance is really cutesy. The oil and vinegar are in these bottles by your table. We got the pizza and a caesar salad. The pizza and salad were pretty standard. Maybe it's just me but I don't know what's so special about this place. I've been to a couple of places in the East Bay that are better than this.
Great crust. Great oven. Cool old-school setting. I'm a fan. Traditional high quality pizza
Painfully overrated.  The service is ok.  Hour long plus wait.  It's good at fooling silly tourists, but there are much better italian joints in the area.  Also, quite pricey, for what it is!

I've been here twice over the last several years and I'm not usually a fan of american style Italian food but I feel this place is definitely worth a visit for a good Italian meal. Everything I have had here has been incredibly delicious honestly. There is a bit of a wait but it is worth it. The waiters are always really friendly and it's a nice casual place for an Italian meal. You will not be disappointed.

Growing up, I was partly raised by my Italian aunt who came straight from Sicily. I would go to school, and my every day my teachers would have to talk to my parents about how it seemed like the smell of garlic seemed to run from my pores. But hey. I was a happy camper because I was being fed my aunt's delicious pastas, hearty Sicilian breakfasts, and homemade marinara, broccoli and pesto sauces.

I never thought I could experience Italian food better than Aunt Vicki's until I came to Tommaso's. Well.. sort of. (I only say sort of because I feel like a traitor)... But seriously.

I came to Tommaso's because of all of the good things I heard about it from my boyfriend. He lives in the Bay Area, and this is one of his most favorite restaurants in all of San Francisco, and pretty much overall. So, I decided that I wanted to treat him to a night out in the city. Being avid Yelpers, we meandered the other Yelp pictures from Tommaso's to gain some insight on what to order. Here's what caught our eye: the fried calamari (a staple, obviously), pesto ravioli, and pepperoni/mushroom pizza.

But before I get on with the food, let's talk about the experience. First off, unless you plan on using public transportation to get here or you want to pay $15 for public parking, plan on arriving about 20 minutes early to find proper parking. I mean, it is San Francisco, so you're going to have to wait a decent amount of time to find a spot along the street withing a two-block radius of this place. We found a street spot, and had to walk a little distance before arriving there. During our walk, we were somewhat caught off-guard by the scantily-clad women standing outside the strip clubs they worked in. But honestly, it wasn't a big deterrent; step out of your comfort zone. But no. Seriously. Tommaso's is surrounded by San Francisco's infamous "happy ending" massage parlors, strip clubs, and adult entertainment retail shops. Tommaso's really is a little gem located in the midst of all of this.

We finally arrived. No windows or any clue to what lay on the inside. As we walked in, I was pleasantly surprise by the super-tiny dining area. Seating for about 20 parties of 4, max. It had the cutest little Italian vibe to it. Murals on the walls, white wooden framework on the booths.

The service is honestly some of the best I've had. The waitress (who I'm assuming had some sort of affiliation with the owner) was not pushy at all, yet so attentive and never kept us waiting. There are also a few other people who will come to the table (to deliver bread, take dirty plates, fill water, etc.) and they are all very attentive and polite as well.

Anyhow, we started out with the calamari as I mentioned. Tommaso's calamari was the best I had ever eaten. It is the perfect consistency. Not rubbery at all: you can bite a piece in half without trying to struggle. I also loved how they served it with some of their warm marinara sauce. It really was the perfect combination and start to our meal.

Just as a tip: If you order a drink (i.e. soda) they charge by the can, so make sure you're wise about your drinks, we ended up paying $10 for 2 sodas plus a refill for each cup!

Anyhow. My boyfriend and I then shared a pizza and pasta. First came the pasta. We ordered the cheese ravioli with pesto sauce. Seriously. This was the best thing I have ever eaten. In my entire life. The pasta was homemade, and cooked to perfection. The ricotta cheese on the inside was fluffy and billowy and perfect. The pesto wasn't too garlicy, oily, or basil-y. It was the perfect combination of all ingredients and was very light. Not to mention, the pasta that we shared came out on two plates. Each plate (1/2 of the order) was big enough to be my complete meal. By this time I was already stuffed, but the pizza was on it's way out.

The pizza came out and it was honestly tastebud tantalizing! It was half pepperoni and mushroom and half ricotta and meatball. Forcing to find room in my already-full tummy, I just had one piece (the pepperoni and mushroom). I know this has been over-used in my review, but the pizza was literally the best I've ever eaten. Warm, thin crust, with an abundance of toppings. My favorite part of the pizza, though, was the dough/crust. Never have I ever tasted pizza crust like that before. You can just tell that it is homemade and cooked to crispy perfection.

We initially planned on getting dessert, but at this point I was already popping the seams of my dress! I couldn't possibly fit anything else into my tummy. We got our check, sat for a bit, and then bid Tommaso's a farewell for the night.

Anyhow, to wrap up this novel, I do have to say that Tommaso's makes my list of top five places to eat, and number one Italian place.

Food Quality: 11/10
Service: 10/10
Ambiance: 10/10
Prices (a little pricey, but worth it!): 9/10

Will I go back? Uh.. YEAH.

Very traditional Italian American place. We had the coo coo clams and the veal parm, with a bottle of chianti, and creme brulee for dessert. Great experience. Very busy. We had to wait 30 minutes on a Friday evening. Once you are seated, service is prompt. There were a number of large loud parties.
really great Italian but a hell of a line to wait in on a sat night.
Crowed, loud and subpar service.  Food was ok but nothing to write home about.  Not worth a 40 minute wait.

Delicious dinner/lunch spot. Their pizzas are amazing. If I go there with one friend, we will get a bunch of different appetizers to share! My favorite is the burrata bruschetta, hazelnut and honey dish... I could have had a second dish of this! Great atmosphere too and right on charming Chestnut street.

Food is delicious. Service was mediocre, at best.

One item was forgotten completely, one pizza showed up without the ingredients we requested. She didn't ask if we wanted refills on anything. Our appetizer came about 10 min after we were done with entire meal. One of our meals also came about 10 minutes after our other 3 meals arrived.

This was mid week, late afternoon when it was not crowded.

Solid Italian restaurant in the Marina that is open late and has a hopping bar scene. Sister restaurant to Beretta in the Mission. Prices are very reasonable and won't break the bank. My favorites are the meatballs, pizza and pastas.

My boyfriend and I went here while visiting on a long weekend from San Diego after seeing it had high yelp reviews. While the food and cocktails were pretty fantastic, the atmosphere was the most repelling I think I have ever experienced.

It was a Sunday night with the Monday being a public holiday; it was packed so we put our name on the list and waited 20-30 mins for a table, which was no problem.  We were seated on a long bench style table (nowhere to put my bag, coat, shopping) with a party of four on one side and a few minutes later a pair of horrendous and loud women on the other who felt it necessary to shout at each others faces across the table.

It was extremely cramped and I was conscious of knocking elbows with the person next to me. I couldn't make conversation with my boyfriend because it was just so unbelievably noisy, so we pretty much just gave up and ate in silence.

On the subject of food- we both had pizzas (I had the Barrata and he had prosciutto), they were delicious, as were the cocktails. We would have stayed longer and had another cocktail or some dessert if the atmosphere wasn't so awful. The staff were very friendly and attentive.

The use of space is a real issue in there, everything is on top of each other and I was on my way to the toilet and a member of staff stepped backwards from the serving counter and knocked me into one of the little box seats- I hit my knee (so hard it made a hole in my tights and subsequently bruised)- when I got to the toilet there was nowhere to stand and servers kept having to get by with food, so me and another lady waiting had to dodge customers eating and servers while waiting.

Me and my boyfriend are both in our mid twenties and like a place with a buzzing atmosphere but it felt like everyone had to shout over the top of everyone else just to be able to talk. I'd recommend this maybe on a weeknight if it is quieter or lunchtime.
Best pizza! Love this place and go here often! During Covid you can buy whole pizzas only at the window to take out!
Only cause I can't give a zero. Very rude worker w/ horrible customer service (Latin woman tonight 1/7 at 9pm in case management cares that she sucks ;) so we walked out! Won't ever go back!
Best pizza ever! The cheese is amazing and we got our order very fast even though it was packed. I love the square slices and size.

Very good pizza slices and they are open really late. Great place to go to especially after a night out with friends. The line however is very long at night so expect a long wait. I had a regular pepperoni pizza and I really liked it. The slices are in a square fashion and the crust is on the medium level of thickness. The slices was filled with awesome toppings and you could really taste the fresh ingredients. Overall I am very satisfied with their pizza and their service
Great service. Not out of this world pizza, but good. Pizza was kind of dry and sauce was just okay. Prices are good.

Crispy crust and hits the spot. Tried the clam but didn't find it to be life changing. The special was amazing though and lots of options to try! There's a small countertop where you can sit and eat. The walls are covered in stickers and graffiti, making it feel more relaxed as the sounds of The Doors play while you enjoy your North Beach late night treat. A solid San Francisco spot.
Joey is the best in the biz. My man slangs drinks quicker thank Usain Bolt. Boy be on fleek with all them drinks. I want to have his children ‍‍‍

Tried this place for the first time yesterday afternoon, so glad we did! Really great food along with exceptional service from a gal named Jenn behind the bar! She makes a mean gimlet and was a great conversationalist! Definitely recommend this place for an awesome lunch and an even more awesome cocktail :)
Sampled some delicious apps, including the meatballs & another with eggplant.  And the beet salad is to die for.  Yummy cocktails as well!

I came here for the second time last sunday with my amazing pal Patty. Ive been trying to get out of my usual dining routines and decided to allow my friend to choose where we ate at. I must admit this second visit was great!
The first time I came to Delarosa was on a thursday night. The place was packed and I had to wait about 30 minutes standing by the bathroom before we got seated. This time around I walked in on a beautiful day and sat down immediately. No wait! Also the windows were open letting the fresh air breeze through the restaurant. A great touch.
Now on to the food. We started with the Calamari. It was great! It also came with a bunch of different veggies that were fried up in the crispy crumbs that covered the calamari. Some of the veggies, like the onion, were a tad strange but still worth the try.
For my main course I got the Pappardelle Napoletana. This is an amazing pasta dish consisting of a tomato based sauce, cheese and shredded pork. Even better is that the dishes here are not huge. Some places you go the portions are so big you end up over eating and feeling gross after. Not here. The portion size was great. For $10 you got about a fistful of a portion, perfect size especially after an appetizer. The Pappardelle Napoletana was great too! Definitely want to come back and have that again. My amazing friend got the black Olive Gnocchi with Rock Shrimp and she thoroughly enjoyed it. Sometimes myself and seafood dont get along so i didnt try hers but it defintly looked appetizing.
All in all this was a great experience!! I've been here twice already and looking forward to going again.

Came here with my friend during a break from work. Both of us work in the service industry so we were pleasantly surprised by how good we were treated. We were given enough attention without being overwhelmed.

The food was good, but not great. I had the pasta pomodoro and she had the italian sandwich. I tried both and felt that her order was better, but neither was amazing. I did like the seating arrangement, the layout of the restaurant, and the general decor.

Service - 5/5
Food -3/5
Atmosphere - 4/5
Not sure what the big appeal is. The pizza was soggy pretty quickly.  They only take cash. Not a particularly great value.

Hands down, the BEST pizza ever! If there is a line, its worth the wait. I had the cheese and pepperoni slices. Fresh, fresh, fresh. Its a thicker crust, its a nice crusty, crunchy crust...lol. So its very affordable and you can have a couple slices and a drink for about $10. CASH only! No worries, though because there's an ATM machine in the back. The seating area is small, so if you have a large group definitely just take out.
    But people, the pizza is so good. The girl working at the time had it together and was taking orders and getting them out within a couple minutes. Give them a try!

I came here at around 10 pm and there wasn't a line. Also, it's cash only!
I got the clam and garlic slice and it was BOMB. I'm still craving it, even a few days later. The crust is thicker than I prefer, but it was actually pretty light and crisp. I loooved how garlic-y it was and had so much packed on top. Even though they heated it up, I think mine could've been a bit hotter since the middle was partially cold. And there isn't much space inside so it's better to grab it to go. But this is great pizza, and I'd definitely come back here!
One of the best deep dish ever tried in California, pepperoni my favorite one, except for too much crowd, ideal choice

this place was packed on a tues night!  i really love the communal table dining, since you can pack a lot more people into the restaurant.  the drinks here are good, and they have a large beer selection.  i went w/ the salty dog, which is like a greyhound w/ a salt rim, and it was yummy.

we ordered a bunch of apps and a couple pizzas.  the fried brussel sprouts were good, and so was the broccolini bruschetta.  i wasn't too into the swiss chard w/ chickpea puree.  the warm chicories were good but greasy.  we got the margherita w/ burrata pizza and the broccolini and pancetta pizza.  we should have gotten it well-done, b/c the pizza is so thin, and too much topping makes it soggy.

the desserts were very good though.  we got some chocolate gelato thing and the donuts which came w/ choc, berry, and a cream dipping sauce.

service is pretty fast and friendly.  this place has a ton of potential, but the pizzas could be better.

I really like their gluten-free muffins. They're always moist and flavorful. This place is a good pit stop for those that are walking through the farmer's market on Sundays.

Note: cash only.
This review is based on what i got to try. When I went the only vegan option available was a lemon poopyseed muffin. It was awful and tasted strongly of oil and not much else. I could not eat it.

Arizmendi is the best people watching perch in the sunset. But that's not the only reason I've been going for years. The pizza is always amazing, I can always taste the olive oil and they often use goat cheese and fresh vegetables. They also happen to have some of the best gluten free bakery in the Bay. Arizmendi is worker owned and you can tell that the people behind the scenes care about what they do. I am in support of worker owned businesses and that's where I prefer to spend my money.
I once locked myself out of my car across the street from Arizmendi and they were super helpful letting my use the phone, ect...

Today I went over and ordered a quick slice of pizza togo during my break. The pizza was hot, tasteful, and delicious! The slice was rather small for $2.75 but hey it was rather tasteful and delicious. The only downside was that the pizza was really greasy.

Absolutely everything is good here!! I always grab a focaccia and the special coffee cake. I'm also a fan of their blueberry corn meal muffins.

It's great because they are so good, consistent and not like all the other pretentious bakeries with mediocre service and food. This place is all about high quality baked goods and I've always received great service!

Quality pizza at a great price. I ordered two slices of their pizza with the cherry tomatoes, spinach, Parmesan with garlic oil and it was amazing. It hits the spot especially if you want hearty pizza without feeling too heavy after. I also got the chocolate mint cookie and its tasted like Girl Scouts thin mints but even better because it was soft and had little chocolate chips in them. All for $8! Can't wait to go back!
Pizza of the day was killer! Didn't get a chance to try any of the other baked goods but everyone seemed to be enjoying them--line out of the door!
All baked ones are fantastic. Service is very fine. I do not forget to visit this place whenever I go to SF.

This place is truely amazing for a neighbourhood bakery.

Most of their muffins and baked goods are excellent- I looove the banana walnut muffin.
The scones however appear to be a hit-or-miss. My mom had a terrible cheese scone the other day and refused to eat anymore scones from the place.

The pizza is very popular but looks a bit on the greasy side to me.

I like how they list out ingredients for the baked goods.

My fav. day of the week is Thursday- try their corriander-wheat and spelt molass- they are so good that they can be eaten entirely by themselves, no spread or cheese but just as is. The pumpernickel varieties are excellent as well. yum yum.

I love the fact that they make roll-size breads for single people who shy away from the whole loaf just because of the shear volume.

The bakery really gets 4.5 stars (0.5 off for the weird scone experience my mom had, and for not making more whole-wheat stuff.... oh how I yearn for whole-wheat sourdough and baguette!!!)

Overall, good neighbourhood freshness and amazing atmosphere (energizing and friendly). Rays of sunshine for the Inner Sunset.

Good, wholesome and healthy. Three choice words that describe Arizmendi bakery in full. This place is veggie friendly, no meat at all but if you believe yourself to be a carnivore think again. I thought that too, I mean pizza without meat, but they did a wonderful job of creating a huge variety of different complimenting flavors.

They make everything themselves, hot and fresh straight out of the oven. There are a lot of reasons as to why I would not want to be a vegetarian, there lack of beef, chicken, pork and all that, but if I could replace it with the food from this bakery then I would be ok with it.

With the lack of service is sort of disappointing, but understandable. I have never seen more than two people working  there at one time, and the line is often out the door and being understaffed doesn't stop this place from being a great place to grab bite to eat on the way to work. I implore you to try it out you won't be disappointed.
True Pizza napoletana. We shared Norma, Bufalina, Prosciutto and Salsiccia and Broccoli and they were all delicious!

This place is the best!! We didn't have a reservation on a saturday night, and they were able to get us seated within 20 minutes (and we were able to grab a drink while we waited). The burratta and prosciutto is to die for, it's literally the best thing ever. We also got a pizza, the prosciutto one... in retrospect, we should have gotten something different because it was basically the same thing we got as an appetizer... but it was still yummy. We topped off with some pistachio and strawberry gelato.

Officially on my top 3 fave places in north beach now!

I love this place! The pizzas are just as good as I had them in Rome and Florence, maybe better. Since the opening I'm a regular guest and they have never disappointed me. I often order the burrata which I can definitely recommend. By now I tried three different pizza's and they were all delicious! If you are into American pizza with tons of ingredients, this might not be the place for you. This is a place where they know how to serve european food. Staff is always very friendly and very flexible with difficult orders.

Ordered two pizzas. The salami and marguerita pizza and both came out pretty fast.

Their frier was broken so couldn't order one of the appetizers. Which was disappointing.

The pizzas were nice and thin and the flavors weren't overwhelming. Crust was over cooked. I wasn't amazed by either of the pizzas so will probably pass on this place next time.

The entire time I was eating there was a huge fly next to the window. Whenever I see flies at any establishment I automatically knock down a star. Just so unsanitary and uncomfortable to eat in an environment that has flies.

Dangerously addictive. Tenderest lasagna with most flavourful bolognese meat sauce comes with naked pizza bread delicious for dipping. Perfect wood fired oven pizzas made at miraculous speed before your eyes. Heaps of fresh shaved cheese atop everything. Personable and attentive owner and staff. Pepper spray yourself with the hot peppers in oil, you'll be crying and laughing at the same time. Great open space and fresh decor, fun people watching and genuine non-touristy Italian food. Thank you Thank you Francesco, hard to cook dinner at home with a great neighbourhood pizza place like this.

Loved this little Italian restaurant in North Beach. Fantastic pizza and great meatballs. The crust was incredible. Also, very smooth Italian beer and attentive service. Even my finicky teenage daughters loved this place.
The burratta and the Diatola pizza were amazing. I plan on eating lunch at your restaurant every Tuesday.  See you tomorrow
Lively atmosphere -- good music, good food (: thank you for great service. My brunch was delicious.

SO. DELICIOUS.

I was visiting friends that live in North Beach and they took me out to dinner here, raving about what a great spot it is. Let me tell you friend, everything was excellent: food, wine, ambiance, service.

We had the burrata + calamari to start (both drenched in wonderful, nutty olive oil) and then ordered two pizzas: Buffalina and Norma. I was experiencing an awesome buzz from the yummy white wine I ordered by the time the pizza came out I was having a major hedonistic experience. The pizzas were flavorful, pillowy, crusty, warm, savory, a little sweet at times...I remember it like it was yesterday.

To make things even better than they already were, our waiter/host brought out a Prosciutto pizza on the house because he thought it had taken too long to bring us the other two pizzas. The prosciutto was amazing! And the fact that he was so considerate took it to another level. It's hard to find such attentive service.

Wish I lived in SF, I would come here all the time!
This place is delish! Had the burrata, prosciutto pizza, margherita pizza, and Norma pizza. The staff was wonderful and the food was great, can't ask for much more!

When a place is an institution like Tony's, it's sometimes hard for the restaurant to match this reputation.  Well Tony's superseded even our high expectations. The diablo pizza was fantastic. So good I want to order it tonight. The service is excellent and the parklets are festive and fun. I wish them the best for the closure and cannot wait to come back and bring friends.

Ok so let's just say this pizza spot is totally living up to all the hype.
Although I was was a bit skeptical, I mean I love a good pizza, but 1.5 hour wait for pizza is really pushing my limits on it.
I got a few drinks at the bar and I loved watching the bartenders do their thing. The Agave and passion was quite tasty and I would highly recommend it, especially if you love tequila like me.
Its sweet and tart and packs a good tequila punch!
Once we were sat, the service was quick!
We got the meatballs and the New Yorker!
The meatballs were amazing! The marinara sauce has so much flavor. We were using it as dipping sauce for our pizza crust! Make sure to try it!
