The New Yorker is apparently one of the most popular pizzas. I can now understand why. The crust is thin and the topping are a variety of sausages and pepperoni. So good!
My dinner here was so much better than I had expected and I would highly recommend Checking this spot out!

We really loved this place. Their pizza is on a whole another level. Game changer! The ambiance was very warm and inviting. We sat at the bar when we first got there because we were waiting on some friends. I ordered a glass of wine and my husband ordered beer. Then the waiter came and brought over some meatballs that we didn't order, he said they were complimentary from the bartender. They were really good. Lots of flavor when you bite into it.

For appetizers we got the calamari and our friends ordered the Mac and cheese. They were both delicious. But the Mac and cheese tho was amazingly delicious. It was cheesy and creamy.

As for our pizza we had something that was similar to a deep dish. I forgot the name of our pizza but my husband called it the "Frank Sanatra" lol. And the waiter knew exactly what he was talking about. It had pepperoni and sausages. The marinara sauce was really delicious, clearly it was homemade and cannot be imitated. Our friends had the New Yorker. Theirs was on a thin crust, with pepperoni, sausage, and dollops of ricotta cheese. Although we enjoyed ours very much, my husband and I liked their pizzas better.

Then for dessert we had cannolis and espresso martini. I enjoyed them very much but I was overly full. The expresso martini was really good it tasted like  tiramisu.

I would def come back here and try other stuff on their menu.

Very good pizza. Especially the New York style charcoaled one with pepperoni  Nice warm tables outside with always great service... no wonder they do good business for so many years. We love you Tony's Pizza Napoletana!!!

Daniel and I stopped at Tony's after a long walk around Fisherman's Wharf. We were headed back toward our hotel but needed food and a local recommended Tony's. We used our handy Yelp app to navigate us in the right direction and- BOOM- there was Tony's!

I love going places on vacations that the locals love. This had a very 'Mom and Pop" feel and most people around us at the bar were regulars. They had a stellar craft beer selection so we ordered a couple. Only $4! Woo-Hoo!

We ordered a thin crust pizza and I honestly can't even remember what toppings we had at this point but it was delicious and we ate every morsel. They had the college football Bowl game on TV so we hung out for a bit and chatted with some locals. Good times and would go back!

Terrible service! these guys don't care about customer service at all anymore. Wow. The old man working at the front desk was so rude.. wow this place needs an overhaul. In the past the owner was here and so wonderful, it's lost its magic now.. after many years of birthdays and celebrations here, I will NOT be returning. SHAME!!!
The New Yorker was delicious and the staff were so friendly! My first time here and I will definitely be returning. Thank you!

The service has gotten much better and now is almost as good as the pizza.....

Everyone needs to come here.

Its the best pizza in the world and has the awards to prove it.... not just my opinion.

Aint much else to say other than there is not pizza better no matter what you claim....lol

They have the best pizza around. When we visit San Francisco, we pick Tony's up a few times during our stay. Their gluten free crust is outstanding. We love Tony's. Wish they had a location in Southern California

Today, once again, I took Calzone pizza for our dinner. I often come here for two reasons: firstly, it is near my place and secondly, and this is the main reason, the pizza here is always incomparable! The thickness and texture of the dough, cheese and meat balls are everything that a proper pizza should have!

Modern and trendy Italian that's somehow still casual and very reasonably priced? It exists!

I went here with a couple teams from work and we pretty much ate the entire menu. I left so, so happy.

The eggplant caponatina with burrata ($9) and kale & romaine ceaser ($11) were the best of the antipasti and salad menus. Definitely get these to start. Their burrata is the best I've ever had.

Also, DO NOT overlook the "Fritti" AKA Fried goodness menu. What are crispy tagliolini dumplings ($10)?  FRIED CHEESY PASTA BALLS. I HAVE TO TYPE IT IN CAPS, IT'S EXCITING STUFF. The dungeness crab arancini with aioli ($10) was like if someone combined a mozzarella stick with a crab cake. Worth the calories, I promise.

For a main - get a pizza. The spicy fennel sausage is delicious. Their crust is thin and their sauce tastes house-made and fresh. There's not too much cheese and they even offer vegan cheese and vegan sausage. Whoa.

Finally, dessert! The tiramisu, gelato, and bombollini (Italian donuts) are awesome. They even do a soaked panettone topped with gelato and pomegranate seeds.

This is a really, really good spot to grab lunch with your coworkers. Staff are very friendly and it's a great atmosphere.
Delicious fresh pizza, fresh salads . My first time ever coming here after the SF auto show.  They have a decent selection of craft beers too yumm!

My meal at Delarosa was definitely a highlight of my trip to SF (staying around Union Square).  The service was friendly & attentive, and the food is simple, delicious, and reasonably priced.  We strongly considered dining there multiple times over the course of our short stay in SF.

The restaurant was loud, causing us to yell at each other to converse. Fortunately, the arugula/prosciutto pizza, scallops and risotto were delicious!  The food was fairly priced and overall, we enjoyed the experience. Solid pick!

5 stars - PIZZA (deep dish veggie)
5 stars - mixed green salad
5 stars - walking distance from my house
5 stars - totally inexpensive dinner for 2
5 stars - interesting beers on tap

this review gets 3 stars for the moronic service I received last night.... I don't think the bartender had ever tended a bar in her life and the hostess just plain sucked. 20 minutes does not mean an hour ... and when we asked how much longer it might be, we got a curt "soon". Come on cranky pants... she really sucked.

Great deep dish pizza. Might be slightly saltier than Zachary's. I don't know Chicago pizza enough to know what's authentic. Definitely a good place to be. The atmosphere is intimate yet vibrant and the waiters/waitresses are nice.

Out of town people, be aware that the parking situation in the area is one of the worst. They also don't like to seat you until the whole party is there.

Dat's some freakin' tasty pizza over der.

Granted: I'm not a Chicagoan. Regardless, in my estimation, Little Star makes the best deep dish in the city. It blows Patxi's away. The cornmeal thin crust is pretty damn satisfying, too.

Overall, they execute very well in the realm of American-style pizza. Their tomato sauce is especially tasty.

They make a mean salad as well.

They have a cool jukebox, too, and the servers are very nice.

There are some cons: There's almost always a wait, it's loud, and the beer selection isn't great... Blue Paddle is a nice option, though.

I had been here 4 or 5 times and always liked the deep dish (that's what everyone says is the best).  But I wasn't amazed like so many others.   Anyway, the deep dish is definitely good.  But my observations on the deep dish are a little too much sauce, not enough cheese and the crust could be crispier.  The point I'm trying to make is that there is better deep dish out there.  Lou Malnatti's in Chicago.  Now that's a good pie!  Just too far away.

What took me by complete surprise was the thin crust.  My friends and I ordered a small cheese thin crust as well as the deep dish and I couldn't keep my hands of it.  Man it was good!  Crust was crispy, perfect sauce/cheese ratio and the ingredients were were very high quality.  Probably the best thin crust pizza I've had in the bay area and there are only a handful that come in higher on the all-time best list.

I'm leaving one star off because I think there is some room for improvement on the deep dish.

I'm giving it a four because The food and the place was great and they great options for not vegan and vegan people but the menu was confusing I did not understand anything on the menu that I had to Google everything

Delish! Frequented the Chestnut one & only just discovered they are now in the city.

How exciting, love this spot. The pizzas are to-die-for! You simply can't go wrong here - perfect place for family style, sharing apps & the communal tables will leave you eyeing your neighbors order with food envy (so we ordered more!)

Great cocktails, fantastic food & awesome ambiance. Yes please : )

First I want to say the server was great, that being said. The pizza was just ok. I've had better pizza at Pizza Hut. I mean come on guys, season your crust. And it's a good thing the have a busy wall paper. It's good for hiding the flys. Again, Serbia was great and the price we not bad. I would over look the flys for a good pizza, even flys need to eat.

Dropped in for dinner and drinks while visiting San Francisco and I have to say I was not disappointed! The wait for a table was not long, only about 15 minutes despite the place being pretty crowded and we orders drinks at the bar while we waited. The restaurant has a warm, cozy and modern feel with long shared tables in the middle of the space and smaller two-to-four person tables along the floor-to-ceiling glass window walls. After being seated at a shared table we started eyeing what others' were ordering. We went for the burrata bruschetta with hazelnut & honey due to it's popularity. It usually only comes with two servings but the waiter offered to add a 3rd since their were 3 of us.The cheese was very fresh and it was a crowd pleaser. We also ordered the hot salami, coppa, marinara & diavolicchio pizza and the spicy marinara, pepperoncini, olives. All the food was delicious but the hot salami pizza stole the show. We also split a bottle of wine with dinner. Service was spot on, so much so that we were talking about it amongst our table! If and when I'm back in San Fran, I'll be making a trip back here.
Went in Friday night and it was packed. The waitress was friendly and we had the burrata pizza and a few cocktails. We'll be back.

From all of the rave reviews, I just had to try it.  Business is definitely good with the wait at over 40 minutes on a Wednesday night.  Sadly, the pizza and wings were just ok for me.  The crust is a bit unique but no wow factor in the filling.

There are actually several good pizzerias in town.  Little Star does not really rise above.

Little Star has pretty good deep dish (for California!) but when you've previously lived in Chicago for 4 years you get a little spoiled.  

It's also really dark inside - beyond ambient lighting.  I could barely read the menu.  

I like the way they serve their garlic bread, though, with a whole bulb of roasted garlic.

"When I'm sad, she comes to me
With a thousand smiles, she gives to me free
Its alright she says its alright
Take anything you want from me, anything
Anything...

Fly on Little"... Star Pizza,
Yeah yeah, yeah, Little Star Pizza

- Little Wing (kind of),  Jimi Hendrix

Okay, so these are not the actual lyrics, but had he eaten here this great song just may have been called "Little Star".

I just had the most euphoric pizza tonight, as though I was in the midst of hearing Jimi Hendrix's "Axis:Bold as Love" on vinyl as I devoured their thin crust Italian Combo.

What should I order for side two?

Transcendental pizza?  It's possible, folks, and you can find it right here.  My cousin and I split the Little Star deep dish last night, and I can tell you that eating that pie made the half-hour wait for a table and the additional half-hour wait for the pizza itself well worth it.  One bite and the world around you melts away.  The roar of the crowd dies down to a tolerable murmur and the intermittent wailing and flashing of cop cars on Divis are but mere twinkles in the ambience (you can hear a couple of violins too if you listen carefully).

Truly sublime.  Unlike anything I've tried before, and I live and breathe pizza (come on now, it's the perfect food).   I've been told that there's an ongoing battle for supremacy between Little Star and Zachary's, and until I make my way out to Berkeley, I'm rooting for the local hero.

This is one of the top pizza restaurants in the city. It's not one of my tops because I like thinner slices. But if you like deep dish, this is the place to be! I enjoyed it nonetheless.

They don't take reservations at this location, so it's best if you come early (before 7pm). They also won't seat you until everyone in your party is present, so tell your usual late friends to stop lagging! The place is not that big and the tables are a little small as well. It'll be hard to fit a really big party in my opinion. It's also a little dark.

We had the chicken wings for appetizer and sipped on the different array of beers they offered. For the pizzas, we had the classic deep dish and a pesto chicken thin crust. I guess I never had a real deep dish pizza before because the sauce was on top of the pizza...which was very interesting! It was all very good.

I had a good time and will be back again.

Excellent food!!!!!! Excellent service!
If in San Fran, this place is a MUST!
Delicious pasta and pizza!

As I sat on the waiting area couch in Little Star the other night waiting for my friend to arrive, I realized that if I wasn't careful I was going to start drooling as I was practically daydreaming about the thick cornmeal crust I was about to eat.

In other words, damn I love this pizza. I usually get the classic deep dish but don't mind the occasional foray into thin crust territory, especially for the pesto chicken. And if I split a large with my friend I usually end up with two days worth of leftovers. And this pizza makes for some mighty fine leftovers, let me tell you.

The staff is usually pretty friendly. Always smiling, as far as I've seen, but they don't seem to be faking it. They're cash only, which isn't really a problem. There's an ATM right inside that has a measly fee of 25 cents.

I can't give Little Star 5 stars because I wish they took reservations and would seat you even if your whole party wasn't quite there. I understand the reasoning but it's still annoying.

Hands down my favorite Neopolitan pizza joint in California, and believe me, I've been to them all because I LOVE pizza.  I limit it to California since NY is its own category and let's be honest, no one cares about the states in between.  Meatballs are second to the ones at Tony's, but still pretty spectacular, tricolore salad here is the best rendition I've had, and you can't go wrong with any of the pizzas.  My personal favorite is the one off-the-menu they call "magic pie."  Ask for it.  It's amazing.  The only annoying thing is that just like any other great restaurant in the city, wait is long and they take no reservations, but the wait time at this location is usually shorter than the mission location, parking's easier, and food's just as tasty.  If you live close by, you could get take-out, but I think these pies are best consumed fresh for the perfect balance of crispy crust and fluffy top.

i have been here twice in the last week. it is just a great, comfortable place near where i live. the staff are really friendly and helpful. the food is excellent. i think that it can get crowded, however i have found that if you time it right and go later, it is less crowded.
saffron risotto balls. like heaven for your mouth, trust me.

went there after the elections tuesday night.  they were out of a lot of items already.  the menu was weird. nothing called my name. i had the fried broccoli, essentially italian tempura. it was done well.  the margerita pizza was fine. the pepperoni pizza was strong and cheesy.  feel bad it's right around the corner from dinos but this is fancy creative italian and his is traditional so both should survive.

The wait for a table was worth it.  We sipped a glass of wine while we listened for our name to be called off the blackboard.  After about 20 minutes, we were seated and our waitress was there to welcome us.  We decided on a special veggie dish of the evening - a roasted cauliflower with capers, bread crumbs, and just a enough heat to spice up the blandness of cauliflower.  We also ordered a tricolor salad with raddichio, shaved cheese and greens topped with a light olive oil dressing.  The sausage pizza was plentiful with roasted red peppers, tomato sauce and spices plus the requisite cheese.  We didn't feel rushed even though the place was humming with business.   The selection of wines mostly were from Italy.  Our waitress recommended a great red and proseco.   The water bottle was refilled without asking.  The one challenge at Delfina's is the noise level can tax conversation and the house rock music that blasts out of a speaker over the entry grew annoying while we waited to be seated.  We asked the staff to dial it back a notch but to no avail.  Good eats, reasonable prices, and friendly, efficient, helpful staff.
love this place! their prosciutto pie is so damn good. love the stretched mozzarella.  can't wait to try this place again.  service is fantastic
Old school Italiano! great pizza and if you have to wait for a table you can pop into the peep show across the street!
I have been here a couple times and everyone I bring here loves the place, as so do I!!! The food is great, the place might be small but it's perfect! If you are in SF, you have to stop here!!!

I miss you guys!  I was a regular in the 90's and early 00's.  The lasagna is the best ever, pizza very close to that, Coo Coo clams are always essential.  Is Calamari Saute still on the menu?  It was a mainstay for me but looks like it might have moved on.  This place is the real deal.  Worth the wait when there's a line.  Give them your name and go around the corner for a drink at Tosca Cafe while you wait (yes not the same since Jeanette sold it but still a North Beach institution, right?)

Get the mussels! Get the mussels! Everything was great. I have a rule about restaurants and here it is. "You know its good when the firefighters eat there." The SF firefighters rolled up on their engine, ordered food, left on a call, and came back excited for their food. The neighborhood is not what I was expected, kind of shady to walk to at night but that adds to the feeling that you're off the tourist path.

Tried Tomasso's tonight for my birthday. The vibe was great and servers were friendly. They moved a little slow but we were OK with that! They also will bring drinks to you while you wait for a table which was very convenient! We ordered beef carpaccio, calamari, pizza, lasagna, and veal picate. I'd say the best items were the pizza and the carpaccio. I don't know if I'd go back but it was a good experience! Thanks Tomasso's!
Very solid "old school" Italian. Quite cozy and reasonable, and always delicious. Decent wine selection- again, reasonably priced. Try the lasagna!
The best wines on the list are around 32 bucks. Really can't say enough good things about this place. Might go back tomorrow night. Not kidding at all. Yes, it's that good.

I'm having trouble writing an honest review because the place is crowded enough.  I threw a bachelor party there - taking over the entire row of tables in the middle, and have celebrated the last four birthday dinners at Tomasso's, and that's not going to change.  What to order?  Fresh spinach and sausage pizza, and the chilled green beans.  On the wine list, spend the 40 bucks for the David Bruce Petite Syrah...it's strong enough to do a loving battle with that pizza, bite after bite.

Good old style italian food that will keep you going back for more. The place gets really packed, but then again most good restaurants always do. That said definitely worth another visit sometime soon.....

The best pizza I've ever had!! The atmostphere is great too, I loved the  murals on the wall. Try the spinach pizza, it will change your life. I don't think I'll ever be able to eat normal pizza ever again.

This bakery really doesn't need any more reviews after having 1099 already. That being said, I wanted to be the 1100th review for this place.

I'll admit to not being a good Yelper by posting a review sooner when I first became addicted to this place's baked goods (literally have never had a bad item, and that's after eating what seems like 1000 pounds of their daily pizzas, focaccias, cheese rolls, breadsticks, muffins, brioche knots, coffee cakes, provolone onion rolls, cakes, and cookies). The straw that broke my metaphorical camel's back to have me write this review is my discovery of their apple pie, a seasonal treat for holidays such as July 4th. I balked when the register rang up $28 for the whole pie but the moment I took a bite, after nuking it for 1 minute, I realized I could've paid $40 for it and still be satisfied. Every bit of the crust, which we all know is the best part of the pie, was buttery. The key to knowing this was a delicious pie was that I was also eating the apple stuffing, which in most pies I pick to the side because I only like the crust. The place has found a way to make the apple stuffing taste like the crust. I admit to devouring almost 1/3 of it within a 24 hour period. Do not let a holiday go without getting a pie from Arizmendi. And having typed all that, I can now go to eat the other 2/3 of the pie.

Get in my mouth, this place is delicious!

I love everything about this place; the pizza, pastries and cookies.  Everything is always delicious, and I'm very impressed how affordable this joint is.  The staff is always pleasant, and I've gotten a few free cookies which puts a bigger smile on this Yelper.

One of the biggest perks of this place though is grabbing a slice and cookie, and heading to Mucky Duck for beer and liar's dice.  Can't ask for a better after work activity.

Teensy problem, cash only. ATMs are close by though.

Im wasn't really impressed with arizmendi's bakery.  While there was a line out the door for this place, I thought it would be amazing.  The pizza that they were serving looked really good but we just had lunch.  So I picked up a brand muffin, chocolate chip cookie and a pecan roll.  The cookie wasn't very good.  Took two bites and made the decision that its not worth the calories.  My wife said the brand muffin was good but not great.  Maybe the pizza is good here cause everyone was eating it but as far as what I had, I was not impressed.

This place is great. I used to buy bread from here from time to time. Then, my friends started bringing pizza's from this place to our Mahjong parties and I fell in love. I am a serious meat eater but I love all of their pizzas. I would recommend this place to anyone.
When I die I will be buried clutching an Arizmendi Sweet Baguette.

Freakin' delicious pizza...  The crust is perfect-- doughy and has a sourdough tang to it.  The toppings are fresh and interesting and perfectly paired.  It's awesome.  They have one pizza selection a day, $20 for a pizza, call to reserve in advance so you can be sure to get your pie, and they come half baked, so you choose when to have your steaming hot, delicious pizza in the comfort of your home.  We live in San Mateo, but it's worth the trip to get an Arizmendi pizza or to pick one up whenever we are up in the city!  Just as a heads up, most of the pizzas are not made with tomato sauce, so don't be surprised.  However, this is the best news for a pregnant woman who is obsessed with pizza, but has terrible heartburn from tomatoes (me).  They post their daily pizzas online so you can see in advance what is on the menu (they post the entire month's menu if you are a planner :)).

This one of the all time great bakeries in the city. You can see that from the line out in front on the weekends. Scone of the day never fails. You swoon with the great smells as you walk through the door. Plus the staff are warm and always helpful. I love that this is a cooperative... They have pride in their work- as well they should!

If nothing would happen to my body, I would eat all the baked goods from Arizmendi bakery EVERY DAY!  Kookie Brittle and a cup of earl grey (totally hit the spot after walking around with a good friend).  I love the bread and baked goods schedule.  One would need it considering they sell out FAST!  I LOVE this place!

Came in this past weekend to get breakfast, and decided on an Oat Scone.  There were scones in other flavors, but the plain-ish one sounded best to me.  Best part for my vegetarian friends - no eggs!  So even my sister could eat one!  :-)  They were very moist and needed no condiments such as butter or honey or jam.  Definitely will come back here again!

my car got towed .. i called a cab to take me to SOMA to pick up my car ... the cab driver asked me "do you mind if we make a quick pit stop?"

i was thinking "is she fo' real??" .. here i am in a rush to pick up my car, having JUST realized that it was gone .. and the cab driver wants to make a pit stop???

she then explained "i just want to pick up some things from Arizmendi's" ...

i said "well hell yeah! what are you waiting for?" .... Arizmendi! who wouldn't want to make a pit stop there if you're in the neighborhood? on the clock or not.

Was in San Francisco for the area and told to check this spot. I ordered the clam and garlic pizza and a combo slice, along with a $3 PBR. Overall, the pizza was amazing and not too long of a wait. Plenty of seating

The pizza is bomb here! The crust is soft in the inside and crunchy on the outside. Amazing texture. Cheap prices!

Nice customer service and super busy.

Damn the pop up window and carrying cash while drunk in the area. This is quite some good pizza if you can grab and go. As for sitting down and spending loads of time here... I'd pass that option as the seating is limited and I'm not sure it's really worth that much of my time.

At the wee hours of the weekend nights with not much else in the area this might have to be the move. Good pizza if you make sure they bake it for long enough so it's a tad crispy.

Probably the best Sicilian style pizza you will find in SFB.

Good variety of toppings and fast service.

This spot is so delicious! My husband and I stopped here during our time in San Fran. We ordered the half sheet with half pepperoni and half clam and garlic. WOW. Both were absolutely delicious. We were especially impressed by the garlic and clam. So unique and delicious!! The half sheet was huge. 12 slices of delicious pizza!

Seriously delish pizza joint that is unassuming and always has lines to grab a slice.  As with any place, if there is a line, all the way out and can take up to 20-30 mins just to grab a slice, has to be the bomb for people to keep doing it over and over and over and over again!

Give this place a try as it is reasonable in price, generous toppings, huge slice, but most importantly, amazing in taste that is well worth the wait in line?

Enjoy!

Delicious deep dish square pizza!  Four types of pizza to choose from when we visited, all looked amazing, I had pesto veggie, yum!  Inexpensive and sold by the slice.  Small sitting area (pub stools along the wall) which works to eat but not a place to hang out.  Bathroom and atm in the back.  Cheap good eats and then be on your way!
Loved loved loved your pizza! The best I've had in a long time around bay area. The pepperoni was the best one. I didn't love the garlic clams one but It was fun to try!!

What do you do after a full night of celebrating with your good friend for landing a new kickass job? After last call? After the bar owner tells you (the first time) that he's locking up? After he says "you don't have to go home but you can't stay here"? After he tells you to get the f*k outta here? You go loiter somewhere else and annoy the owners, of course.....it's only natural.

At 2:15 am, there's still a line going out the door to order a slice or two or three of Golden Boy Pizza's little squares of heaven, however many slices that will help the kidneys absorb booze. Good thing Golden Boy starts their pizza with a thicker crust. It's crispy on the outside and fluffy and chewy on the inside. Next, top it off with awesome toppings and bind it all together with ooey gooey stringy cheese. The end result is a combination that anybody, drunk or sober, can appreciate.

My boyfriend and I both ordered the clam and garlic pizza ($4 each). I expected a different taste based on the reviews, but it wasn't bad. It was an interesting taste, but not something I would try again. I would probably try some other pizzas there. We asked for marinara so we could dip the pizza in it, and it was decent. I really liked the bread part of the pizza because even though it was thick, it wasn't heavy, but more light and airy.
This place seemed more of a rock vibe; somewhere good to come late at night.
Our server was sweet and attentive and the food was great.   The pizzas are delicious.   Mozzarella in carozza was awesome.  Beer was cold.  All good!

I wish this place would stop getting so popular. Easily one of the best restaurants in North Beach, if not all of San Francisco. The staff is so friendly and the pizza is SO delicious. The ingredients are fresh and the pizzas are made quickly after you order. Even when there is a wait, it is worth it. I never feel rushed to leave, everyone is pleasant working there. I really love this place. If you are visiting, make sure to find time to stop, you won't be disappointed!
Excellent! Casual atmosphere and amazing food. Burrata was so yummy and we loved the meatballs. Service was excellent and tables turned quickly and efficiently. Would definitely recommend.

seriously, the BEST pizza napoletana around!!!! and their mozzarella is fantastic too! we used to go to Tonys, but the pizza there is always soggy lately. after trying this, we are NEVER going to Tonys again, this is our new spot!!!! love love love it. :)

Can I just say how happy I am that Yelp! took over Eat24?! I love all the new food delivery options. Like this pizza place. The wood fired pizza was amazing quality and even more so to get that yummy taste delivered to our home. The reason I am giving this place 4 stars instead of 5 is just based on the delivery time. It easily could have been traffic since the Warriors game 1 was on but it was about an hour late and so the pizza was cold. But this won't detour me from ordering delivery from them again simply based on taste and quality of the food. We ordered 1 margarita and one diovolo for 2 people. We both had about 6 slices leftover and easily could have just ordered one but decided to order two. The pizza is thin so I guess it depends how hungry you are. Prices are definitely up there(about $36 with tip for delivery) but again, it was just nice to order an elevated authentic italian pizza :)

Not a bad place.....had a mushroom, sausage pizza. Good taste but somewhat soggy crust in the middle...could of been due to the toppings though. Girlfriend had the pasta carbonara which was really good. Service was so-so. There was no wait on a saturday night around 7 45 so that's always nice.

Stumbled on this place after the theatre. Great vibe restaurant.    Lively with music.   The food was amazing.  Pasta with the rib meat sauce was incredible.  Would go back in a minute.  Two things really stood out to me....  1.  Service was excellent.   I mean excellent.   2...  the place was full of Italians.     Cool spot.  You must go
EXCELLENT eggplant pizza and Buratta Italian Cheese!  Yes you have to a wait a little but the service was great, what an incredibly beautiful meal and wonderful evening!
Solid every single time. Not only good food and friendly service but one of the best bangs for your buck in the City.

This might just be the BEST pizzeria I've been to! We arrived very hungry, and hesitant to put our name down on what seemed like a lengthy list. We waited around, and tables didn't see to be turning. So we walked across the street to The Stinking Rose, were quoted a short wait. While waiting, I received a text on my phone from here that our table was ready. Without hesitation, we decided to hop back across the street. This was the best decision. Our server was really awesome, loved her personality and honesty when asked about her favorite pizza. We ended up getting the fresh buffalo mozzarella app which came with fresh baked bread, arugula drizzled with evoo and cherry tomatoes. It was beyond amazing, clearly very fresh cheese! It was everything and more. Loved the Calabrian chili oil at the table. We also ordered the four cheese pizza (Mozzarella, goat cheese, asiago, gorgonzola), and added mushrooms to it. It sounds basic--but holy moly was it delish! Regretful that we didn't have room for dessert. I highly recommend this place. Also, great music, and open windows at the front of the restaurant. I will definitely be back!!

The mussels are hit or miss...they have been great and they've been not so yummy. The burrata crostini is always a fav! Pizzas are great too! The brussels sprouts were super delish (though bad for you I'm sure of it!!)  I just wish the mussels were as good as the first couple times I had them..then it would be a 5 star review.

Best spot on chestnut.

Great food, best drinks in town, low attitude, fun and friendly place to meet people or have fun with a crew.

Loved all that Depeche Mode last night ;-)

I'm sure there are already a lot of reviews for this place, so I'll keep this short.  The food was real good and the communal tables were fun.  We got lucky and we were sitting at the end of a big table.  It could be a bit strange if you were stuck in the middle of a table.  But this place is fun... I'd definitely go back.

The food is really good and they have a pretty good wine list. I loved the portobello mushroom panini, it was amazing! It came with a side salad and some really yummy chips. The decor is really modern and it's pretty casual. Most of the tables are "communal" so if you prefer a private table, prepare to wait for one. I'm looking forward to going back and trying something else on the menu.

A welcome respite from most of the other fare that you typically find on Chestnut. We had decided we wanted to eat in the neighborhood, but had no real plans, so we just strolled around for a bit. After passing by once, we stopped in again and were pretty impressed with the mood (the huge row of beers on tap on the wall confirmed this for me) and the menu (neither of us really wanted to go to an expensive hole-in-the-wall).

We were seated pretty promptly and quickly ordered the beet carpaccio salad, malloreddus with lamb ragu, and the pizza with hot salami, coppa, tomatoes, and diavolicchio sauce. The salad was my favorite part of the night, with a nice balance between bitter greens and sweet beets (both golden and red) that was tempered by the earthiness of some truffle and ricotta shavings. The pasta was a notch above average, but the portion size was perfect for sharing. The pizza was a bit of a hit-or-miss, depending on which slice you had. One side was in that gray area between deliciously crispy and frustratingly burnt, but the overall texture of the dough was nice. They bill their pizzas a "Roman-style", which accounts for the thin pie you'll encounter here, but the toppings are a clear sign of a modern, San Franciscan culinary pedigree. All the cured meats did get a bit oily on my pizza, but sometimes you just want a nice meaty slice of pie, right?

There's little chance of this becoming my go-to pizza joint (Little Star still holds that distinction), but if I come back, I'm definitely making a bee-line for the bar. Access to a wall of beers on tap, absinthe, and a ton of great top-shelf liquor? No sitting next to a too-loud baby or having to ignore businessman blathering on trying to impress the girl on a date or accidentally getting shoved by the nice (but cramped) wait staff? That might earn them an extra star on my next visit.

We really enjoyed this modern Italian restaurant.  They were able to accommodate our group of 8 (with a stroller) easily.  The food was wonderful.  There are a lot of really cool appetizers.  Be sure not to miss the meatballs!!  The staff and service were great.  We can't wait to come back next time we're in town.

Everythong here is wonderful...from the huge beer and coctail selections to the incredible food.
The Meatballs and the crab arancini ...Heaven!

I never miss this place when in SF
The food is so delicious. I love, loveee the scallops. Affordable, too. Great for casual dinners :)

All around amazing! I'm obsessed with the prosciutto pizza and the Caesar kale salad. Drinks are always good too! They really have excellent service too! Staff are all very helpful and attentive. One of my sf go to places for sure!

Last minute spot after watching a movie with my girlfriend. Gotta say best idea ever. I had the hot salami pizza and the spicy sausage pizza with a Heffe. Can't remember what my girlfriend had, but anyways to the point. I'm giving this awesome little spot 5 stars simply because they covered every aspect of what a restaurant with great service should have. Although I will say that if you're not a fan of hip hop, which I definitely am, then don't bother. But I loved this place. Walked in and we were immediately seated by Katie. Great service, she checked in on us frequently, and even helped us make choices for our dinner. Food was very fast and delicious. Great selection of beer, wine, and mixed drinks. The vibe, amazing in a very mellow and chill out way. I'm not big with wording things out so I'll cut things short from here. Great place for dinner, drinks were great, food was phenomenal, and service was exceptional. I call this my to go spot for a beer and pizza night!

$30 dollah for a pizza pie? Whatsa matta you?
I keep coming in and ordering the same thing(brass monkey-spinach and sausage on thick crust pizza) because I cannot get past the thought of gooey cheese with spinach and tomatoes with chunks of sausage on a crispy, thick, cornbread crust!
FOOD COMA Time!  This makes me delirious!  
This is my ultimate comfort food that throws me back to the days when Marco Polo discovered spaghetti noodles in China!  Yep, like the Greek guy in My Big Fat Wedding, whenever I come across something that is great,  I attribute the origins to my ancient culture that must have invented everything at one point in time.
The Chinese people invented "ketchup, noodles and maybe even pizza" and other tomato dishes but it sure seems that Little star is really close to Perfecting the Perfect Pizza!
I am a fan of their pepperoni sausage deep dish :) I love how their crust tastes soo buttery just like pizza hut :) The Chicken Pesto was my very least favorite. But other than that, i'll be back !

Awesome.  This is truly a five star place.

Here's what makes Little Star better than the rest:
+ Cornmeal crust.  I was skeptical at first, because I thought the cornmeal crust was a gimmick.  But it's not.  It's a smart way to get a crispy, substantial crust without too much doughy globbiness or grease.  Little Star's crust wins out over Patxi's or Zachary's.
+ Sauce is just the right balance of tangy and sweet.  Little Star's sauce wins over Zachary's (too tangy) but draws with Patxi's.

Here's what put Little Star over the top:  
+ Caprese salad was also top-notch, with vine-ripened hothouse tomatoes that tasted just like summer and creamy buffalo mozzarella.
+ Service was honest, friendly, and no-nonsense.  I love that our waiter admitted to forgetting an additional side, and that the host legitimately tried to figure out how long our wait would be and took down our cell phone number (turned out to be about an hour...)  I also loved that we could preorder our pizza, so we didn't have to wait too long after getting seated to start chowing down.
+++  Bonus points go to Little Star for making me feel young, SF-y and hip.  (Hooray for other patrons' spontaneous clapping and boogying to the jukebox!)

I love this place.  Their crust is just great and I love the big chunks of meatball for their meatball pizzas.  I usually will start with some garlic bread.  It's a really simple dish, bread, some butter/oil spread and roasted garlic.  I'm pretty partial to their deep dish, and don't really even consider getting the thin crust.  I've found that the specials are usually pretty awesome.

Love: The Little Star Pizza with Sausage. Their chicken wings. The fact that they'll take your order while you're still waiting for a table. A highly encouragable BYOWine policy.

Hate: No option for reservations. The excruciatingly long wait for a table. Once, the hostess at the Mission branch got very snippy with one of the waiting parties (this has never happened as the Western Addition branch, however). I rarely get to stuff my face with Little Star these days unless I'm ordering a pie to go b/c I end up trying to gnaw my own arm off due to starvation.

Outstanding pizza. Is it the sweet tomato sauce? The corn meal crust? The combination of a Blue Star Wheat that seems to compliment it so nicely? Whatever it is....it works.  Take heed, Gino's East. ;-)

Don't know which pie to order?

Hands down, Little Star Deep Dish Pizza. - The crust is so ridiculously amazing. It would be a gazillion times better if Little Star could make a Deep Dish Pizza with a white/alfredo sauce too though. *hint hint *nudge nudge. :)

I'll be back, fasheezy.

P.S - The whole staff that works here seem super nice. From the Host to the Bartender. Awesome food, awesome service. Can't get any better than that.

This place was really good, but the place is as big as a closet and super packed. I went here for the first time on a friday with a couple of friends and I would say it was worth the wait. The hostess said it would've taken an hour and a half, but some people peaced out so we were stoked!

This gem is located on the busiest street ever and if I had known it would have taken me an hour to find parking or I'd have to truck it I would've worn comfortable shoes. If you live in the area I would take a taxi or get dropped off.

Service was okay, our waitress was a little spaced out. We had a couple of drinks at the bar so we didn't really notice until she couldn't find or remember where she put our tab.

We had the Mediterranean Chicken deep dish and it was amazing! SOOOOO GOOOOODDDDD! YUM! My friend recommended getting the garlic bread, but they were out :(. Well...if they were out then it must have been good. Lame on running out though!

Overall I'd go back.

Pizza...Nom nom nom!

Last week I was hanging out with some friends when they both mentioned they were starving. Originally, the plan was to go to Butter and drown our sorrows (well really mine- it had been an awful week) in fried food and cocktails. Instead, we cracked open a bottle of wine and ordered a pizza.

I'd never been here before, but they swore it was the best pizza ever. We ordered a deep dish with pepperoni, zucchini, and something else- I can't even remember. Although I had zero appetite, I definitely managed to shove a piece of deliciousness down my throat.

We waited about an hour and then picked our pizza up (8:00 p.m. or so).

Please note: This review gets three stars, rather than 4, because I'm not a huge fan of deep dish and never have been. BUT as far as deep dish goes, this is pretty dang good pie!

Pretty long wait, pretty high prices, pretty good pizza.

Parking's a bit tricky as expected with the area. Might take a few laps around the block until someone leaves and you can swoop in.

Came with my fiance for lunch. I had The Monarch cocktail and he had a Trumer Pils. We have similar taste in drinks and we couldn't decide which was better, because they were both really excellent. Easily among the best elderflower cocktail and pilsner either of us has had. Then we shared a margherita pizza with burrata and prosciutto. The pizza was perfect - just enough burnt crust without being too much. I usually don't like much sauce on a pizza and am disappointed when the cheese doesn't cover the sauce, which is usually the case with burrata pizza. But, this sauce was delicious, tasted fresh made, and balanced the cheese perfectly. The only things I would change about the experience are cutting up the prosciutto into bite sized pieces because it doesn't tear well, and turn down the music because it was hard to hear each other's voices over the noise.

Excellent food in a setting that has a sort of "modern neighborhood bar" feel. We ate here three times in as many days while I was at a conference at a nearby hotel. Our server recognized us in our second visit and remembered our preferences. Top-notch service! Highly recommend for lunch or a casual dinner. Great beer selection too.

Recommended by the concierge at the Hilton Union Sq, Delarosa did not disappoint. Good food, nice ambience and fast and very friendly service make Delarosa a must visit. We went twice in two days with the kids insisting we have all our lunches there everyday.

Came with our 3 kids on a Monday night and it was super busy. The pizza was really good and atmosphere was fun. A good place for kids because it's really, really loud. Communal tables keep it casual. Music was questionable and the wait staff was a little snobby and not very knowledgeable about the wines, but food and atmosphere were good.
We enjoyed the food. So yummy. The service was great and the Manager Shaun is a great guy.  We recommend this place to everyone.

You share large table with other guest.  Put too many at table to where you are bumping elbows with other patrons.  Pizza crust was cold and soggy. Maybe it was bad night for them but I will not go back or recommend to others.
They had me waiting for a hour for a order Pizzas some people who are after me they got their pizza in 20 minutes.

Terrible pizza, bad service.  Crust was burnt on the pizza, had very little toppings and no wait staff to be found anywhere. Tried to flag down a couple of waitresses to get water who completely ignored me. Avoid.
This place is a good mixture between fancy and hip. A place for kids and adults. Most of the options on the menu are small entrée's

Came here with my HITTAS and I must say the ambiance is fantastic and the pizza is amazing. The crust is very thin and the meats are fine. The workers are very nice and polite. The only thing that prevents it from being a 5 star is the cups and plates had a few tiny stains on them. Besides that the place is fabulous.
Yum. Warm and friendly atmosphere, super fresh toppings and mozzarella bar. Attentive  and well paced service. Superb pizza crust!!!

Best pizza outside of Rome! This is now my go-to pizzeria in the City. The uovo plus speck was insanely delicious. The crust was cooked to perfection. They have a Ferrara oven which makes this place super legit. In the world of wood-burning ovens, this would be the Ferrari of ovens. The tiramisu is also a must. I also highly recommend the burrata which is imported from Puglia. Just try it and sit at the bar and watch all the action. Customer service was outstanding. What's not to love? Buon Appetito!!!
The best pizza of North Beach. So welcoming host, we love the atmosphere each time we go there... Thank you and keep up the good vibes!

We were seated quickly, which was nice as we found that most quality restaurants in North Beach fill up fast. We placed our wine order, which came out in a timely fashion and was pretty good, but when we put in our pizza order, they forgot to make it....twice. After about 40 minutes or so, we asked the server (who was also the hostess) how much longer it would take. Since the kitchen is open air so everyone can see in, we witnessed a brief, yet terse argument between our server and the kitchen staff. She came back and said it should be only a few more minutes, but it was pretty obvious they forgot to make it. After about another 30 minutes or so, still no pizza. We flagged down our server and asked AGAIN how long it would be. She went back for fight-with-kitchen-staff #2, which was in plain view. She came back and said it would just be a few minutes, but they clearly forgot to make it....again. It finally came out about 5-10 minutes later and the dough was clearly undercooked. If you're going to take over an hour to make a damn pizza, at least make it right. This place could be a good pizza joint; the chef knew what he was doing with the dough and the pizzas certainly had potential, but there was a severe lack of communication between the serving staff and the kitchen staff that makes this place a real mess. To make matters even worse, the server didn't offer to comp anything. She didn't even apologize. There is no excuse for that.

Loved this place.  We had to wait for about 30 minutes for a table, but the hostess made sure we had vino to drink while waiting.  Service was excellent, the employees joked around with us and were a lot of fun.

Everything we had was good.  I especially enjoyed our salad and the lasagna.

I was having some serious cravings for NY style pizza. I miss the super thin pizzas with the cheeze sliding down the crust as you pick it up. (Seriously making myself hungry by thinking about this.) So, it wasn't NY pizza that I love. But it was still fantastic and delicious. We had a party of 8, and only 4 of us were there for about 30 minutes while we waited for the other people to show up. They sat us despite not having the entire party there. We ordered apptizers. Yum. I think I'll just have to go to NY for NY pizza, but anytime I want some good pizza, this place is it.
The food here is terrific. The pizza was very tasty, good service and the ambiance is very special.
Delicious, authentic Italian food! Cute, small place with nice staff. Try the tiramisu! Would definitely come back

As cliche as it sounds, walking into Tommaso's is a little like stepping into a time machine. I have been going to dinner there for about 15 years and I do not think much has changed since then. The good news is that little change means consistency and in the case of Tommaso's that means consistently solid, no frills old-school Italian food.
Although some tourists flock here because of it's history as the first pizza place on the West Coast, it is typically much less crowded than nearby Tony's and has pizza that is almost, if not just as good. Also, they usually give you a glass of wine while you wait, which is never not a good thing.
In terms of recommendations, the Spaghetti and Meatballs is always good, mostly because their meatballs are excellent. When you combine that with their pizza and its crisp, soft-on-the-inside crust, the resulting Meatball Pizza is fairly unreal. If you want pizza, just order it. It's good.
Lastly, no true dinner outing is complete unless you order dessert, so you have to go with the tiramisu. It comes in a bowl, which I thought was weird at first, but then I tried it and realized that all other tiramisus (tiramisai?) are weird for not coming in bowls. You won't be disappointed.
If you want consistent, authentic Italian food/pizza, go to Tommaso's. Even the policemen eat here, so that must mean something. Plus all the streetlights outside are neon and shaped like women, so there's that as well.

OK this place is the best in North Beach and knocks all the rest out of the ballpark. Even an Iron Chef could not smirk at this action.  Cafe Sport is great, (just up the hill on Green) but this is even better. It will make you feel like BizMarkee when he finally got an personal invitation to the Grammies.  So, we went there with three people, and wow was the food and service great. Truth be told, this is not a five star interior of a restaurant, but it is home-like, rustic, and very comfortable.  I think I have eaten at every north beach Italian eatery and this is bar far the best.  "Who am I to talk you may ask?" "Well, I'm not the one looking for advice on Yelp now am I!"  So listen grasshopper, here's the scene: one long table divides the middle of the dinning room, while happy conversations, scrumptious smells permeate the air.  Tommaso's specialty (since 1934) is the pizza, but we decided to go right for the appetizing salads, pasta, and tasty Tommaso Ristorante Italiano's Shiraz house wine.  We started with their fresh baked bread, and fresh tomato and soft mozzarella salad. My girlfriend, who had gone to the dentist the same day, was having a hard time chewing the amazing fresh bread that they served us, and after we told this to the server she quickly went back and grabbed us some delicious marinara sauce to accompany the bread.  Wow, was the sauce fine.  I'm talking like G love & special sauce good.  I had the pasta with shrimp, garlic, clams, tomatoes, for my main shin dig and it was served in a delectable spicy red sauce. It will rock your world, if you don't get to distracted and order the pizza, or start beat-boxing like DJ Mix Master sweet tart!
i burned the roof of my mouth trying the pizza, but it was totally worth it!!!  definitely best pizza in SF!

We walked in with no reservations on a Wednesday night after being approached by many other people outside Italian restaurants trying to "woo" us into their empty space. A little extra walk and later we all had glasses of wine in our hands and were waiting in line - maybe 20 minutes - then the dining experience began! We didn't mean to not order the pizza, since that's what they're famous for, we thought someone might order it in our group, however, no pizza in our group. We started with the Syrah wine and then some appetizers and salads. They should be more famous for the MARINARA sauce. It's TDF all the way baby. You can even buy jars of the marinara to go. I had the manicotti and others in the group had seafood and lasagne. It was truly fabulous! The dessert of gelato and the cheesecake with raspberry sauce made my jaws tingle for at least 15 seconds, and then repeatedly with each bite. YUM. Great service and attentiveness and a true Italian fare and atmosphere. This is not the typical touristy North Beach spot- it's perfect!

Such a gem.  Inside, you 100% forget about the neon naked ladies lighting up the night sky on the surrounding sleazy strip club facades.   Very into the salmon bruscetta with honey and lemon.  There's a reason this place has been around as long as it has.

I was introduced to Tommaso's by my wife 25 years ago when we were courting.  We were regulars on Sunday nights for years until we moved to the other side of town.  Without question it is the best Italian restaurant in town.  When they close for a few weeks over the Christmas holidays I realize that I am craving their pizza by the time it reopens.  Our son's favorite is the lasagna.  My favorites are the veal saltimbocca and the coo-coo clams.  Whenever fresh fish is on the menu as an entree my wife goes for it since she knows how good it will taste.  The service is always excellent and whatever the wait time, it is worth it.  Be smart, get there at an earlier hour if possible and avoid any wait.
Delicious :) Loved grabbing a slice in North Beach just as much as I love ordering delivery now. I usually get the margherita with burrata or diavola

Terrible customer service towards patrons and delivery couriers. I witnessed several Postmates drivers being harrassed by cashiers. The pizza is not NY at all. The bread is like play doh. The cheese tastes like cardboard.

If you're looking for NY style or Roman style fare, good luck finding it in San Francisco. It's a hit and miss. Best luck is to try everyone but you'll never get close to East Coast or Roman Style food. Tony's doesnt even have garlic powder, what a shame. Disgusted with their customer service and business etiquette. Unprofessional and rude. I would not come back here and spend a penny, even if they replaced the pizza, the doe is shit no matter what they do; I'd pay them just to take their pizza back.

Good luck on your endeavors, you're lying to consumers and critics.

I'm sure your reply will be generic, so tag, "you're it".

This place is absolute quality. Great variety of pizza and wines. We were disappointed that we couldn't get the white pie with onions but we had the other pizza which was amazing. Can't wait to go back and try some more pies. I highly recommend the place. Downside, it always has a long waiting list.

Tony's serves some of the best pizza, I have ever had and I have had pizzas in Chicago, NJ, NY and Italy.  Wow, this place is underrated if you are looking for the best food!!!

My wife and I were on a bus tour and had gone to St. Peter and Paul's church and were looking for a place for lunch.  We were in little Italy, and thought Italian was the best option, but we had lots of places to choose from. We narrowed it down to two 4 stars restaurants and saw that Tony's had a line out the door and the other was not very busy.  I was a little concerned about time but my wife said there has to be a good reason for that line and "OH" was there!  

There was a wait of 30 minutes and we decided to have dessert first and went to a close by gelato store.  We then found a place to hang out and I read the Yelp reviews on Tony's.  We narrowed down our order to a giant meatball and their special Marguerite  pizza (if either were available as they were limited to 25-75 per day)! We were seated outside and a very knowledgeable and friendly waiter reviewed the many types of pizza available.  We were tempted to try an exotic one, but I held firm on the seemingly simple pizza made with the best ingredients.  We also ordered their gigantic meatball and my wife added a cream mushroom sauce based on our servers recommendation.  I wasn't too sure as I am not normally a fan of cream sauces but I'd give it a try as my wife agreed to my Marguerite pizza suggestion.

We were relaxing in the sun when a close to softball size meatball covered with a delicious looking marinara sauce arrived.  The server then poured a thick white creamy Mushroom sauce over it turning the sauce to the color of a pink vodka sauce. The taste was amazing! The meatball was moist and packed with flavor especially with that sauce that we were now fighting over with our spoons!  

The Marguerite pizza then arrived.  The taste was extraordinary, packed with flavor that I needed to slow down to savor! The balance of sauce, cheese and crust was perfect and the crust alone made a great swab for the remaining sauce from the meatball. We were totally thrilled and we were planning to see if we could either come back that night or work it in before we left town.  Definitely will be back when we are in town!

Food - 6 stars- Yes! that good, I don't care as much for the others if the food is this good!
Service - 4 stars - Server was prompt, courteous and knowledgeable and kept up with us.
Atmosphere - 4-5 stars a We were outside over look a park on a lovely day.
Price - 5 stars - This is a place I look for.  Call it a diamond in the rough, and the food is worth the price.

It all started with our server, Epi Novak. My husband and I were in town for the 49ers vs Giants football game, which also happens to be the anniversary of our engagement 6 years ago. Veterans Day weekend and this particular football matchup is always extremely special. Epi didn't know any of that, but her service is beyond comparison at ANY establishment we've ever been to, here and abroad.

1) THE WINE: we are freshly minted red wine lovers and wanted a bottle to celebrate the occasion. We mentioned a red we tasted before and loved. She directed us to the Petit Syrah. IT WAS PERFECT!! We order almost finished the entire bottle.

2) THE FOOD: I'm vegan but will eat vegetarian on occasion. Again, her recommendations and substitutions were impeccable. We ordered appetizers and a main course. I can't recall the names, but i took pics. My husband is a carnivore and swooned over the meatballs and chicken Parm over pasta.

3) THE EXPERIENCE: we arrived about 10pm
on a Saturday night. It was still a little lively, but the cleanup/wind down effort was beginning (they close at 11pm or 11:30pm on Saturday). Nonetheless, we didn't feel rushed. We had a nice cozy table for 2 tucked away by the front window. Epi let us enjoy the wine and food obut was there every time we needed something.

We WILL BE BACK!! Don't short yourself. Check this place out if you're looking for Italian and good wine. THANKS SO MUCH for making our last night in town memorable. Tip: This is a small restaurant and seems to get really busy. We did notice locals walk in and know everyone's name. It's an authentic Italian feel. Keep that in mind and plan ahead for large groups & expect authentic Italian hospitality.

I used to not be a fan because I thought the sauce was too sweet. But yesterday all the pizzas we ordered were delicious and perfectly seasoned. We had the sicilian Regina, wow! If says if feeds 2 to 6, more like 8.  Crust was soft yet crispy, sauce was beautifully balanced. We had my aunt's pick the American style Jersey. That had the sweetest sauce but wasnt too sweet, also delicious crunchy yet pillowy crust.  My dad chose the white clam, he really liked it.  Chewy thin multigrain crust.  Of course my mom had to get the margherita, I didn't have it so she could enjoy it.  Great place to go around the world in pizza.

A friend told me that she still dreams about this pizza after visiting last year, and I thought she was exaggerating. When I visited San Francisco last week, I had to see for myself.
I can confirm, this is one of the top 5 best pizzas I've ever tasted (and I live in Chicago.) I ordered the 4 cheese, but there were lots of other tempting  options. It's thin crust, with just the right amount of grease (a little) and cheese (a lot). The staff is friendly, and the atmosphere is casual. It's a pretty small place though. I stopped in for lunch on a Friday, and it was pretty busy, but they also have a "Slice House" on the same block where you can grab a slice to go. Next time I'm in town, I'll definitely be back here!
It's so great. Worth the price and the wait. We get the New Yorker and some pizza by the slice. The ingredients are super quality.

OHH MY MEATBALL, HOLY CHEESUS....I've never had a meatball more delicious!!

OHH MY MEATBALL.... The pictures of the meatballs caught my eye, and I knew it was a must try, who doesn't love a good meatball!!  The fact that there is also pizza is a bad thing either. Having three kids, there is always one who is the picky eater and only wants to eat three things, Pizza, Mac N Cheese, and Chips.

OHH MY MEATBALL, HOLY CHEESUS....I've never had a meatball more delicious!! And the pizza was AMAZBALLS TOO; even the pickiest of the pickiest ate everything. We wanted thin crust with different meats, so it was suggested that we try the New Yorker...it was a good choice, who said New York has the best pizza. Hands down he best meal of our whole vacation.

First time here when I visited the Bay Area recently, and I enjoyed it there! My girlfriend and I ordered the marinara pizza, which is an extremely basic oven baked pizza with just marinara sauce and roasted garlic (no cheese), and you know what? It was delicious! And since it didn't contain cheese, it was helpful since I am lactose intolerant lol And the pizza was only $14! We also ordered a round of cocktails while enjoying the pizza and enjoyed the beautiful San Francisco weather while sitting out on their patio! :)

oh, Arizmendi, Arizmendi how you keep me sated
with such baked goods, can you be twitterpated?

your cherry scone, crumbling in my lap
i like you for breakfast or even a snack
that organic roasted coffee, dribbling down my chin
anything so good must surely be a sin

and those brioche knots, how you make me tingle
if you wanted to date, i would quickly make myself single
for you, or anyone of your brood
i like you so much, i've elevated you above just any old food

alas, i'm sure to become diabetic
and maybe even a bit eclectic
but better to digest than to never experience
i really mean that; i'm totally serious.

I can't take my mind off of Arizmendi Bakery.  Was walking home from work and was starving.  Walked in here for the first time after seeing it a million times and I kind of have bittersweet feelings about this place.  I effing love EVERYTHING I've ever bought from here, but my waist ain't havin' it.  :(  Cheese, butter, carbs.  Who could turn that down??? Siiiiigh.

Anyway, rosemary parmesan scone, pecan roll, and cheese roll are the things I've had so far and let me tell you... they make my eyes roll to the back of my head and run a few laps before they go back to normal again.  I wanted to try a scone to see if they were dry so I picked up the first one I saw.  To my surprise, it was moist, salty and cheesy from the parmesan, slightly herby from the rosemary, and perfectly flakey with a slight light crispiness around the surface.  The pecan roll was not too sweet with the perfect amount of toasted pecans and a slight taste of maple.  Have you ever bought cheesebread to be disappointed because you can't really taste the cheese?????  WELL, the cheese roll thing will make you happy!  It's cheesy, crusty, chewy, and satisfying!  BEST PART-During baking, the cheese oozes out and finds its way down to the bottom of the roll and hardens so a cheesy crust forms. YUMMMM  

Arrite, I need to go there in the morning.  Cookie bark is what I was eyebalin last time.  I hear pizza is good too.  If you're ever in the area, DO NOT forget to fulfill your carb intake of the......year.

Incredible fresh baked goods but I LOVE the pizza here, they post a menu on their website and everyday there's a new flavor, all with super fresh vegetables! When I come to the city, this is the place I go to!

This place makes wonderful goods and some things are very reasonably priced.   I would spend more money here, but I find, there is something so pretentious about people who run coop businesses, I can't get past it.   The snobby holier then thou, because I am part of a coop attitude,  leave me cold and my money goes to business who have a concept of good customer service.
One of the best bakeries in San Francisco! Fresh pizza daily with unique, tasty ingredients- but whole to share or by the slice. If you prefer sweet, try the brioche!

I guess I expected a little more out of this place. Maybe I should have gone for some scones instead of cookies. The only thing I really didn't like that I had was the green tea shortbread. It was a bit too rich. The place is really small so you feel really cramped when trying to pick out your pastries. I would have gotten pizza if I hadn't just eaten before going here because it smelled really yummy! Warning: cash only.
Those cherry corn scones are out of this world!

Baked goods, carbs, and the scent of fresh baked bread. This a great place for bread, scones, muffins, rolls, focaccia, etc. The chai tea there is also very good. I have not had a bad thing here. I had the corn and cherry scone, walnut cinnamon roll, olive provolone roll and cheese roll. My favorite is the cheese roll especially when it's warm.

Amazing blueberry gingerbread scone. Love the daily pizza selections, they are so dense and delicious, makes a full meal. But I shouldn't have given in to the seasonal Chinese new year cookies though, totally not worth $3.75, and they snapped before arrival at final destination. Fail.

Ok I really don't get the hype over their pizza. It's not the BEST pizza it's not even pizza! I think it's more of a flat bread. I'm not saying it's nasty, it was good but nothing to rave about at all. I do like their baked goods, breads are yummy and very hardy and chewy, kinda gave my jaw a workout. I also like the sweet pastries, the chocolate thing, yum! This place makes me fat because I love carbs and once I start can't stop!

Came here around noon on a Saturday needing to have my pizza inch scratched and it certainly was.  I like all types of thicknesses when it come to crust and this was definitely on the thicker side. It has a really nice soft texture inside and a little crispy on the bottom.  I had the pepperoni slice and my wife had the combo and the toppings were solid. The sausage on the combo had a really nice fennel flavor that I would come back for.

Is it the best pizza in town? I don't know about that. But it's definitely good and different than other pizzas I've had. They have a light airy kind of crust with square slices, and the garlic and clam is delicious. You gotta wait in line then you can take your pizza down to the park to enjoy if you are so inclined. The people there are usually pretty nice too.

Whenever we make it out to North Beach this is one of the potential spots where we will most likely end up. With many, many options in the area there is certainly plenty to experience in North Beach.

This is certainly one of the places you should check out if you are in the area. If you have a hankering for a great doughy, chewy, flavorful slice of garlic/clam, sausage, pepperoni, or vegetarian pizza give this place a shot. The slices are light on crust, big on flavor and they disappear down your gullet with a dangerous amount of ease. To optimize your pizza tasting, plan on ordering at least a slice of each flavor and split each slice into two, they are big enough to do so.

You are likely to encounter a line that goes out the door and down the block but don't be discouraged. Part of the reason for the long line is that the ordering counter is right next to the entrance, so unless you are next up to order you will be out the door already; they also crank those crack laced puppies out fairly fast, so the line moves at a pretty good pace.

I'm glad this place isn't in San Diego because I would eat here every day and weigh a million pounds. Consistent, delicious, perfect pizza. And open at all the times when you typically crave pizza. It's outstanding!

If you ain't a crust lover, but love the pie, this is the place to come. You probably won't get any "crust" in your slice but if you do, fear not... it's just a nice thin piece of crispy and cheesy foccacia.

I did not know about this place until I walked by to the next-door Ethiopian extravaganza, Massawa, for NYE dinner.

We saw the giant line of bright-eyed, eager customers forsaking whatever NYE plan they could have chosen to stand in the cold for Golden Boy Pizza instead. Talk about opportunity cost. Then, as we saw the combination slices and veggie-pesto slices looking all warm and gooey from their pizza pans, we literally did a double-take and made a mental note to come back for lunch the next day. Low and behold, we did.

The combination pizza was amazing. All my favorite veggies--zucchini? yes please!--plus the pepperoni and sausage on a hearty, substantive but not-too-doughy focaccia crust. The clam and garlic was definitely too garlicky for me and won't be getting it again (you NEED to have Altoids on hand), but I'm glad we tried their novelty.

My main takeaway? The combo pizza is like a glorified Round Table Gourmet Vegetarian (my childhood favorite!) but meat-ified and on steroids. I'm definitely coming back to satisfy my pizza cravings. Best part: GBP is on point for vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike.
Best pizza in SF. Also really friendly staff. Thanks for feeding SF during this crisis.
The interios are funky with walls plastered with random stickers. Ordered pepperoni pizza and it was delicious! Portion is sizeable but it's good for one if you're really hungry. The best!
Want a quick slice of pizza? This place is made for you. Amazing pizza, great flavors and charming setting.

My favorite pizza place in the city. No sit down tables just a few stools. They sell by the slice and always hot and crispy. My kids favorite is the clam and garlic, mine is the pesto veggie. They are open late on Friday and Saturdays.

Love this place! Delicious, affordable, and always friendly. Clam and garlic is the best! I just wish the line moves faster. My only advice is, if you can somehow get people in and out faster, it will be win win. I've seen so many people who wanted to grab a slice here, got intimated after seeing the long line, and ended up not eating.
Good pizza. Nice service and the atmosphere is pleasant. And they are open late, even on weekdays.
Wow. So delicious! And even when packed with people on a Sunday night, the staff was friendly and the service was quick. Highly recommended.
Crowded, with good service. The drinks are excellent, but the food isn't up to par with Delfina, and is similarly priced.
Nothing but good experiences at Delarosa.  Awesome atmosphere, lots of beer on tap, and delicious thin crust pizza.  Staff is friendly too.  One of the best dinner spots in the Marina.
Just dont order the carpaccio beet salad. it was AWFUL. cool ambiance besides that.
Everything we had was delicious!  We will definitely eat here again on our next trip to CA.

The food here was good, especially the appetizers and the pizzas. This place, though, caters to a more "adult" youth, with a large bar area and very loud music. The music was a source of major communication problems between me and my table mates, along with me and the waiting staff. Another large problem is the menu. It lacks descriptions of what food contains, and my group suffered when a member received a meal that he wasn't aware contained meat. When the meat was found we had to ask a waitress to identify the meat, which resulted in us needing a meal to be replaced due to dietary restrictions.

I really wanted to like this place. When we got there on a Monday evening, it was super crowded and very loud. The layout of the restaurant makes it so you are sitting at a table with other patrons. I ordered the chicken parm, but they were out. Their website said they had gnocchi, but again, not available. My SO ordered a pizza with no olives. Unfortunately, they still put olives on the pie. We ordered an appetizer that wasn't given to us until our meals had already been served. The appetizer was bread and evoo, which seriously left something to be desired. We did not receive additional water for our meal until after we paid the check. Our server disappeared, which is why none of these issues were able to be addressed. These are the reasons I can not rate the experience and the food better. And I love food. Luckily, Ghirardelli square is a few mins away. So we got ice cream to make it a better night.

From the start with the host Gaelle they were percise even though the place was jam packed!!!  The pizza was amazing yummy, the service was exceptionally outstanding. The musique was cool the crowd was hip, a go to place in the Marina YES SIR!!! Corey as well as my waitress Danielle were very heart felt compassionate people people make you feel like family oh and the bus boys and girls were very rapid don't forget the cooks are real experts in the back of the house. Thank you

This place has good food but shit service and they don't care if you're trying to have a nice lunch date with your girlfriend outside. They WILL sit two random people right next to you and ruin what would have otherwise been a slightly above par meal. Sitting inside may be the way to go to avoid the service and sitting problems, but I ain't goin back to find out.

I finally had the chance to taste what the hype was all about.  I must say their pizza is excellent!  I had the real deal in Chicago last year & this is very close.  You need to time your arrival since they don't take reservations & cash only too!  

P.S.
Parking is a bi*%# around this neighborhood.  Were you surprised?

My sister wanted to try this for her birthday, and as my family are adventurous when it comes to dining adventures- we decided to make a go out of this. We decided to go at 5 (opening) on a Thursday so we wouldn't have to contend with the parking issue associated with parking in the city.

The wait staff was friendly enough- although our waitress didn't tell us the specials. One of the staff came in with an infant and they were more interested in their own than chatting the new customers- even though we said it was a special occasion and that we had come from Hayward.  They only have cans of soda and this was a serious problem with me as I think if you can have beer on tap you can (SHOULD) have soda on tap, especially if you are going to serve people a large amount of spicy food.

The garlic bread is win if you love garlic (I do)...the garlic was roasted perfectly.

If you like Goldie then their jukebox is the bomb but God help you if you like another type of music or band.

The pizza: don't get me wrong it was good- but it wasn't the BEST PIZZA EVER. Their crust is an interesting mix of cornmeal and sourdough. I didn't like that the tomato sauce covers all of their pizza and makes them indistinguishable from one another (the pictures of the artistic spinach pizzas are LIES). I have left overs but I doubt I will make an effort to go back.

For 60.00 for 2 pizzas and 3 cans of soda...I just really wasn't that impressed.
****************************************************************************
4/9/2010- Just received a nice email from Brian (co-owner of little star) explaining that he brought his daughter in and it was the first time many of the employees met her. He said that it was probably too distracting in hindsight. That was a very nice and classy touch and it is appreciated.

Alright, I love pizza.  I really do.  And I never have had a Chicago Deep Dish pizza, and the food was surprisingly good.  After eating my dinner and boxing it up and taking home it was still good.  Put me into an early food coma which I cant complain about.  

But here is what I can complain about Little Star Pizza:

Driving from a museum the restaurant was sandwiched tightly between two businesses.  (I of course had directions).  After getting lost (on the street it was supposed to be on) I called them and asked where they were.  After being told it was on the same block down the street I continued to remain on the phone with them, but they however obviously got kinda impatient and hung up on me.  HUNG UP ON ME!  Without so much as a "Well ma'am your not talking anymore so I guess you are either dead or being quiet but I have a job to do and I hope you find your way to the establishment.  Goodbye"  What is the deal with that?  Usually there are tricks to getting a customer to hang up without seeming like a royal douche.

Then I found it!
