When I went in, I was first greeted by the beautiful and kinda artsy surrounding.  The hostess was very pleasant and showed us to our table.  My family and I ensued in very pleasant dinner conversation when low and behold I spotted a Juke Box!  Wow a Juke Box!  How long had it been since I have seen one of those!?  Eagerly I jumped out of my chair, rushed over to it, searched the deepest part of my pockets for some spare change, but right as i was about to slide my money into the juke box.  The worst tragedy I ever beheld seemed to have fallen on the poor Juke Box.  It was all music by Blondie or a bunch of musicians I have never heard of.  Now don't get me wrong I love Rock but seriously!?  I thought every Juke Box by law was supposed to have at least something good.   Hence the -one star so far.  Now lets continue onto why It doesn't have four stars.

When I got back to my table and sat down, the waitress came up and asked us what we wanted to drink.  I had spent all my day in the city and had worked up a thirst.  My throat was parched and I needed something a little extra besides water.  Looking up, I asked her, "Do you have refills on Coke?"
"No they come in a can"
"Do you have refills on iced tea?"
"No it comes in a glass"
Bewildered I looked and saw that they had a whole bar with tons of beer on tap.  Now here is where I tell you that I am not a fan of alcohol.  But i thought to myself, don't all pizzerias have some sort of refillable beverage on hand besides WATER?!  With a sigh, I said I would order a coke.

Alright so when I eat I love to have a calm atmosphere.  When I was eating, however, a man kept on walking by snapping his fingers as if he were thinking if he left his oven on at home.  Then when I said something to my family he quickly abandoned snapping, for the time being, and started whistling.  Honestly guy, its called decaf!

Now the pizza was extremely good.  I could only eat two slices and that was great.  We ordered the Little Star and the Classic Deep dish.  I loved the pizza and the surroundings but I don't think I will go back again.  But this is definitely a good place if your in the city and need some good Chicago style pizza!

I didn't think pizza could really be that much better than other places. Little Star proved me completely wrong. Their crust and dough was unbelievably good and I'm getting hungry again just thinking about it.

The price of a small pizza may seem a little steep but they are thick pies and are worth it.

Perhaps it was because of my high expectations, perhaps it was because the pizza wasn't as hot as i was used to, perhaps it was because it was really busy I am not entirely sure but it didn't meet my expectations.

What I do know is they have good pizza but it didn't receive the 5 stars I so badly wanted to award this place.

I had the deep dish with artichoke hearts, sausage, spinach, and feta. The sauce was awesome, the crust even better but the cheese wasn't as gooey and melty as I was used to.

4 Stars because it is close to another deep dish pizza place I enjoy (Patxi). Definitely a place to try out.

NOM NOM NOM!

Came Tuesday around 5:30 and was seated right away. My friends and I were afraid we wouldn't get seated and that we'd miss the special. But we made it, ordered a Caprese Salad, a White Pie thin crust pizza and a classic deep dish pizza.

The thin crust was AMAZING! There was so much cheese on it! I love it when you have to keep pulling at the cheese. The crust was the best part. It was crispy but it wasn't burnt! It was almost like a cracker. The pizza also wasn't super oily. Definitely the best thin crust pizza I've ever had.

The deep dish was also good but I feel like it's not that different than Zachary's in Oakland.

Customer service was great. Our jar of water was timely filled. The people who work there were all young and hip and really nice. Also, during happy hour (5-6 or 6:30) all alcoholic drinks are $1 off.

This little hipster haven was quite delicious.  Got the basic "classic" deep dish, so good!  Who knew that a corn meal crust could make me so happy?  
Plus the hostess was pleasant and our server had neat glasses.

Divisidero is a fun street to hangout on.  Lots of different venues and a whole lot of randomness.  

Stopped in for a quick bite after playing a round of golf.  The thin crust pizza is crunchy, sauce is well seasoned and the ingredients are fresh.

I'll have to try the chicken wings next time.

These people are serving delicious pizza.

I got to experience little star last night with a friend who was visiting the Bay Area for the first time. We were craving pizza, and who can say no to a place with 1000+ reviews and 4.5 stars?

Things went really well from the beginning. We were told we were going to have to wait 30-40 minutes, but were seated in less than 20.

We had a Large Classic Deep Dish pizza with pepperoni added. For an appetizer we had garlic bread.

I had never been served garlic bread like this and I was pretty impressed. They serve you sliced bread, a portion of butter and some perfectly roasted garlic. The bread and butter were great on their own, but that roasted garlic did not fuck around. I have a friend who is a garlic lover and puts hella garlic on everything. This roasted garlic brought me closer to understanding how she can be that way.

The pizza was pretty incredible. Unlike Zachary's, Little Star's deep dish has a slight crunch to it. it's perfect. And unlike Zachary's, we didn't wait an eternity for it.

Food wise, this place got 4 stars really. Little Star earned that extra star thanks to the waitress that served us. I've never had a more attentive and pleasant waitress or waiter in my life. She was like one of those moms that makes you feel terrible cause she's doing so much for you and you really don't want her to.

Although small, the beer selection is pretty good.

I can't believe we stumbled onto this place.  It was a good suprise when we were tired and hungry.  Good pizza, good beer, good wine, and good service.  

The atmosphere is dark and lit by candles.  The water is served from a decanter into cups that look like (or are?) the bottom of a wine glass.  

There caprese looked beautiful, so we got it.  Of course it was good.  

It's a small place and when we arrived there was already a small wait.  We were seated quickly though, because we were only 2 people.  

I can't wait to go there again...
Great place for pizza! Had the spinach/Parmesan cheese and it was pretty good. Also tried the lasagna and that was good, not great. I'd recommend this place for authentic italian food.
I love everything about this restaurant...except the wait to get in! Don't worry though, they often bring you water and even a glass of wine while you wait. And yes, it's worth it.
Very basic southern Italian menu, average food.

After walking up and down Columbus Avenue with my wife to dine at an Italian Restaurant, we decided to dine at Tommaso's which is located a couple of blocks away from the main street of restaurants.  We waited about 15 minutes for a table which was expected as it was peak hours in the evening.  The menu was surprisingly inexpensive compared to other Italian restaurants nearby.  I ordered the Lasagna while my wife ordered Linguine w/ Clams in Red or White Sauce.  The wait for our food was about 20 minutes but it was peak hours so it was expected.  My Lasagna was delicious.  The layers of pasta, cheese, meat, and sauce was blended perfectly.  I had a taste of my wife's dish, very delicious Linguine with clams.  We did get both of our dishes at the same time; however, we never saw our waitress again for 20 minutes.  I had to flag down a bus boy to get more beverages.  I would recommend this place for its delicious food but service needs to get much better.

Stopped in last night for our first dinner in San Francisco and at 9pm on a Wednesday night we still had a 20 minute or so wait. For some, this may have been an irritation, however to us, this signaled an excellent dinner choice! :) While we were waiting the hostess provided us with beer and wine, which definitely made the wait insignificant. Once seated, the nicest waitress ever, Cindy, came over to greet us and take our order. Given we were in the area to try new things, we asked her what her favorites were. She listed several items, however she made sure to highlight the lasagna as one of their best dishes. We took her recommendations and ordered the Italian pepperoni pizza with spinach and fresh shaved Parmesan on top as well as the lasagna. Wow. The pizza was crispy, cheesy and very flavorful. Though it was tasty, our favorite by far was the lasagna. Fresh made in house, the first bite will literally melt in your mouth!! There is some serious witchcraft in how tasty it was! I would HIGHLY recommend it for anyone stopping in! In addition to the recommendations, Cindy provided us with great service and even gave us some chocolate sausage with raspberry dipping sauce at the end- DELICIOUS! The entire meal was fantastic and I would definitely make this a go-to spot in the north beach area.

I love this place and when taking visitors to North Beach this is my first choice of restaurants.  Phenomenal pizzas and Chicken Marsala, not to mention their fabulous clams.  And truely lovely people there provide friendly efficent service.  My only complaint is that it is always a wait for a table and can be a bit noisy.

They have good pizza and tomato sauce. Tommaso's pizza gives Arinell's a run for its money. It tastes very NY. Tommaso's crust is chewier and slightly thicker than Arinell's, and the sauce is definitely tastier. I can't choose. I like them both. The pasta is ok. It's so crowded in there, you might as well be sitting on the next person's lap or vice versa unless you're lucky or patient enough to get a booth. I get my food to go.

Spinach pizza is a slice of heaven.  This pizza keeps me coming back again and again and again.  Carafe's of reasonably prized wine, family owned and operated, and the best pizza in the city.  What more could you possibly want.  Whenever I'm in North Beach I'm drawn to this place like a magnet.

Really like Tomasos for the food and atmosphere.  I have the chicken and articoke pizza which I liked, but next time I went I went simple with just pepporoni which i like better.  Salads and deserts and very good as well as the wine selection.

Came out here a couple days ago. Lasagna was not bad, imho, but my friends LOVED it. Personally, I found the pizza to be amazing. The pepperoni and italian sausage pizzas are like nothing I've ever had! Do note that this place is only open for dinner, though.

My mom and I are going to make a ritual out of walking to Arizmendi Bakery, buying breakfast pastries & juice/coffee, and sitting down in the Music Concourse in Golden Gate Park for breakfast. Deliciously fresh, generously sized baked goods (I eyed the pecan sticky bun rolls and got one, but got full after eating apple & blackberry coffee cake.) Will have to go back to try the pizzas of the day, too... perhaps on another trip to the deYoung?

When I first discovered this place it became an obsession. I can honestly say that I no longer have an obsession but it's still a really yummy treat every now and then. I highly recommend their gourmet-type pizzas.

Although they're especially known for their pizza and snazzy democratic agenda (we're a worker cooperative!), I love the breakfast items, ie: scones, muffins and the like. My favorites are the Chocolate Things and the traditional brioche, sweet enough without being overpowering and the right amount of butter for richness, not nastiness.
All because everyone else loves it doesn't mean you can't love it too.  So go get a slice of pizza, a scone, a cheese roll, a chocolate thingy, sit in the park, and have a nice day.  Thank you.

Two slices of pizza, piping hot from the oven. Marinated artichoke hearts, caramelized red onions, garlic oil, cheese and parsley. Sticky pecan roll. Shockingly good parking spot right outside. Midweek blues are history. Now all you need to do is control yourself on the way home, because this aroma can drive anyone to madness.

Amazing mushroom pizza with garlic oil that just makes your tastebuds dance. I love the sourdough pizza crust they use. Their baked goods are good as well. However, their scones are not the moist and buttery type that I prefer. They're the dry and crumbly type. I thought the brioche would be more of e dense, buttery bread, but it's more of a slightly sweet eggy bread. It's great to have this place in the Sunset though.

Note: Yes, sometimes the line is long. Yes, even if you're buying some prebaked pizza and only need $2 change, you still have to wait in line just like everyone else. Don't get all huffy about it. Everyone else has to wait too.

Freidnly service. Different special pizza on the day is great. On Good friday, I stopped in while running some errands & had a slice of pizza spinach with feta, olives spinach & sundried tomatoes-yum! Only thing is its a bit pricey-$2.75 a per slice. they had lots of other yummy looking scones, foccacia, pastries & even challah. I'll definitely stop in again!

ive been obsessed with this place ever since my first bite.
thinking about it frequently, even on the weirdest occasions. it's just that good.

the cheese rolls are SO good. its like a cinnamon roll but with cheese.
when its warm, its even better. i love how crispy and savory it is.

and the cheesy breadsticks are amazing. (my boyfriend got these from the arizimendi on valencia so im not sure if they have these at this location?)
i ate a million of these as dinner one night. i think about them at work, in the shower, everywhere!

their chocolate chip cookies are yummy too. soft and everything you'd expect and more.

i cant wait to try everything they've baked up. everything looks amazing here.

The chocolate chip bread thingies are dry, definitely skip those.  The apple/rasberry scones are moist and just the right kind of sweet.  But definitely the thing to watch out for is the brioche.  As I sat down at the N stop to break into the knot, I wondered, why is everyone so up on brioches?  Then I tore into it and thought, Oh! that's why.

a good friend of mine rides his bike six miles to arizmendi at four AM, five days a week, just to bring me arizmendi's pecan rolls, which are the only thing i've eaten for the last six months as i recover from a serious case of work stress.

simply put, arizmendi is transcendent.

A pizza joint bumpin' Mac Dre and Livin Legends...say what!?

This is great place to go to for a late night pizza fix!  My boyfriend and I met with some friends here on a weeknight, close to 11 pm.  Parking is usually hard to find around the North Beach district, but we seemed to get one easily around this time.  

While standing in line (which goes out the door) to order your pizza, you'll have plenty of time to decide what you want.  Check out the menu board - it's one to stare at as you wait; plenty of hidden messages!  You'll also have a great view of  their Sicilian style pizza (aka square cut pizza) since they're showcased along the window.

I ordered slice of the Clam & Garlic and the Veggie Pesto.  I ate half of each slice because it was just so huge.  I knew I wasn't going to finish 2 slices but I wanted to try em both.  They were pretty darn tasty - if you're really hungry...go for the clam&garlic; if you want something light but filling...go for the veggie pesto.

This pizza is absolute heaven on a piece of bread.  I remember hearing form this place during a uber ride and decided to check it out one time with my friend.

It's located in little Italy but surprisingly not hard to find at all!

The place has a grungy punk feel to it, but very nice staff and ambiance.  The pizza I kid you not it too die for! Even the cheese pizza is legendary if you have to satisfy you pizza cravings go here! Best and does not disappoint !! Prices are very fare too!
Childhood favorite. We used to live on the same block growing up and sometimes this would just be dinner. I usually order the combo or sausage slice center piece please!

I'm not a pizza purist.  I like my pizza crust thick, not thin, greasy and loaded with toppings, and yes, I don't mind that it's cut into square slices.  I love the clam and garlic and the combo slices.  

The decor is really divey with stool seatings against the bar counter and wall and a bunch of random bumper stickers against ribbed metal wall panels.  But do you really care when you're drunk after last call in North Beach?  Cash only and for the unpretentious.

These square slices are hefty, real bricks of things with good solid slatherings of cheese and at least a couple of palm's worth of herb sprinkles.

I got a clam garlic behemoth for $3.75, which was extremely tasty and more than worth it.  Plus, where else can you order clam and garlic on your ONE slice of pizza?  Most places that do pizza by-the-slice confine your slice choices to the usual suspects like cheese or pepperoni, and leave the fancy stuff for the whole pizzas.

Golden Boy Pizza serves a small variety of great pizza in a fun and grungy bar setting, with a gritty 90s rock playlist playing in the background (at least they did when I went). But is it worth the long line that stretches down the street? Maybe? I got a Stella Cidre, and a slice of the Garlic Clam Pizza for only $7, which is a pretty good deal given how unique and delicious the pizza was. I was lucky to find a seat at the bar, but not everyone could.

It's 9:30 in the morning and I vaguely remember waking up at 1 am to my brother sneaking around the house with Golden Boy Pizza in tow!  It was about 3 hours since my munchies died down, but the smell of garlic was emanating from the box and woke me from my dream state...

Brother thank you for introducing me to GBP!  I have been on a search for the PERFECT clam and garlic pizza for years... I've had a few that I've loved, but never CRAVED like this!

We were visiting the city and our Uber driver recommended this place. There was a line out the door when we got there, but we soon understood why. The pizza was beyond delicious and the employees were so friendly! This is definitely a go-to place.

I wanted to love this pizza, but I wasn't crazy about it. Maybe I just don't like pizza on focaccia bread much. I don't know... We tried pepperoni, plain, and the garlic/clam pizza because we were starving. The line was all the way down the block (around 10:30 at night). We waited and finally sat inside at a booth. The staff were great and our slices came quickly. The pepperoni and plain slices were good, but the clam was way too salty for me. I think I just like thin crust best.

"Without question, the greatest invention in the history of mankind is beer. Oh, I grant you that the wheel was also a fine invention, but the wheel does not go nearly as well as pizza." - Dave Berry

Golden Boy Pizza is the default go-to place for late-night-after-crazy-party-at-North-Beach pizza. I know anything would taste amazing at 3 in the morning after a crazy night, but the pizza here is really legit even without the beer goggles.

If you're inclined to sit-in for your slice, they serve it up with a knife and fork. That's how cool they are.
Great place and good value for pizzas. Loved the thin and crispy crust. I recommend the di buffala pizza (;

i ate there 2 nights ago for the first time, it was wonderful!

Good ambiance, nice decoration, and awesome food!

This is pretty pricey for what you get, the plates are pretty small but the food is excellent. Everything looks fresh and delicious.

As an appetizer, the Burrata bruschetta with honey and hazelnut seems pretty famous, and i know why!!

I liked it a lot and will definitely go back, especially as i love this street.

first off it does not deserve 4 stars
service is bad really bad,it gets busy,
loud fast music piped in,my guess to get you out quickly,
pasta comes out hard
no cream sauce
portions are really small,they are like starters,20% added to bill with 5 people
maybe its because bad service people dontt tip
at the price charged you will not be happy with meal
lots couples go there for first time,bad move
tables are very close together,
modern looking place
some food tastes good some bad,
you will leave hungry even after spending a lot
The food is simply fantastic- REALLY. The service was outstanding. ORDER THE PIZZA. Get some buratta - the best I have ever had.  I can't recommend this enough.

A friend and I went, hoping for great food and great atmosphere. Only half of our hopes were met. Food was good, but the experience was negatively impacted by the overcrowded, loud atmosphere of the seated customers. We found ourselves constantly repeating ourselves to be heard over the noise of the music and the many people who had to talk over it. However, the major drawback for me was the many tables stuffed into a small space. Most tables are communal and tight. You sit elbow-to-elbow with your neighbors on small square stools, leaving little to no room for your jacket, purse, etc. The space on the table for your food is equally as tight and your server will stand over you uncomfortably while taking your order. Service was slow, but not the worst I've experienced.

Overall, for the money, I had hoped for a more comfortable dining experience. If rating on the food alone, I would have given 4 stars, but sadly the crammed atmosphere seems to resemble more of a nicely decorated mess hall than a restaurant, which negatively affected the entire dining experience.

Let me start by saying that I NEVER yelp;0. I did not have dinner but no one greeted me at door. Went to bar sat down. No one acjoqledgers me at bar. Some Jared Leto looking bar tense finally said so you want something after 10 minutes. Everyone seems very into themselves and less into customers the bartender was making drinks for the other bartenders and they were tasting them and discussing. FYI. I never complain for real. I thought about having dinner because do many if my friends said its good, bu after I was so "univited" I decided to move down street. Get over your mania attitude ( and I do live in marina) and il be back.
Had my VINCE leather jacket stolen from the hooks under the bar tonight along w/my friend's cashmere sweater wrap.  Not a 5star experience.

What's green, white, pink, and tastes like heaven? The prosciutto, arugula and mozzarella pizza! Okay, that was cheesy and a poor attempt at humor. But, I have been looking for this type of pizza everywhere since my trip from Italy. This is the only place that does not skimp on the arugula and provides quality pizza at an affordable price. My friends ad I (3 people) ordered the pizza with 2 frittis (dungeness crab arancini, calabrese aioli). The crab is real and with the sauce, super delicious! Can't wait to come back. The meal for us was $45 (including tip)

I've been to this place a few times already and every time I've been I've had a more or less good experience, the food is good, appetizers, entrees the whole nine. The one critique I would have is that the soup of the day always seems to be extremely thick, but other than that, great place.
the pizzas + meatballs in spicy marinara was delish!!!  seriously the pizza was soooo good!!!  (even though we had to do take out because they were so busy and crowded!)

Dear Tony's,

Can you break up with San Francisco and move to Denver?

Thank you,
-Mike

This place is awesome.

Really cold on a cold evening if you sit on the table on Stockton. The heaters aren't that useful.

The New York pizza was good but it's just a little too cold!

Pro tip: all the pizza is good so choose one and you won't go wrong!

We visited from Arizona and we stopped at Tony's on our way out to the airport. Wow! Pizza is amazing. We had the pepperoni and sausage, so good!! We also had the wings and the lambedi fries, they have honey and garlic amazing!! Great customer service. Highly recommend this place!

Loooove this place! Hubby and I get to Tony's any chance we get. There's no beating their margherita pizza. Go ahead, try to.

Here's the thing... I don't like to wait to be seated for a meal and their wait times can get CRAZY. Stick to lunch time and mid-week if you can and you should be safe. If you need to go around dinner rush hour, get yourself on the waitlist and it'll minimize your wait time.

Hands down the best place in San Francisco.

My family and I were visiting San Fransisco and made the choice to eat here. We waited 2 hours to be seated, but it was worth it. I would wait 24 hours. We were so impressed with the food that we went back early Saturday before our flight back to Los Angeles just to have the spicy grandma and a giant meatball.....my family were so satisfied....we even had the chance to meet Tony and his supervisor....ask for Epi, she was helpful and took her time to explain dishes and variation of foods that are considered popular....thank you Tony, Epi & staff for the food experience.....yes, we will return......

Thank you.

Johnny V

Second best pizza I've ever had. #1 is my hometown pie, and that'll never change. That's be never seen a place where you could get any version, and my mistake was going solo. Might try their slice shop next door to get the variety. Absolutely fabulous.

After a very long time planning to come here we finally decided to go try the famous Tony's Pizza. Since Tony won in a competition in Napoli the award for best pizza (2007 I think?) it is mentioned as the best pizza Napolitana in the world? But is it?

We tried two pizzas: Margherita (Neapolitan pizza) and Sausage and Stout. Obviously the reason I came here was for their Margherita which they say they only make 75 a day because of ingredients brought from Italy.

I am a huge fan of Neapolitan pizza so I've been trying to find the best one in the Bay Area since I moved here and I would say that in my opinion though good this is not the best in the city. And not the cheapest either.

The pizza is pretty good but just not the best. Though my review might seem overly negative it's just because of how famous the place is, expectations are high!

Are you a tourist or wanna check it off of your list so you can brag about having eaten the best pizza in the world? Surely go and you'll have a nice meal.

Do you want to choose from a long list of pizzas? Sure you're in the right place.

Pro Tip: if you don't care about eating at a table, skip the line and go directly to the bar. It's first come first serve and you don't need to be in line.

Happy Eating!

Cheers

Nuno

This place food is good but pricey.  We got two large pizzas and a pasta bowl and it was $120.  The reason why not 5 stars is because of our server, she was rude and when we informed her that there was a hair in the cheese, she said she can't help the wind since we were eating outside.  We kindly told her, wind does not blow hairs into cheese from outside.  This would be coming from the kitchen.

So happy this place is still open! They have outdoor seating with heaters which is great during the colder months. The hospitality is truly great and food is amazing. The Margherita pizza is a MUST as well as the Pesto Genovese Pasta and Calamari. Every time I come to SF I have to stop by this place, truly a great spot.

Once again, Tony's ran us around. This is the fourth time I have been treated poorly and they don't seem to care. The first 3x, we have had our orders take hours to get because of supposed shift changes. This time, the man at the podium upon arrival was talking loudly at my brother who didn't know there is no reservations taken while we had a party of 15 people including children. There were several tables open outside, they were sitting people as they came in, so no wait, and when I tried to speak up over my brother the man started yelling "we don't work under this kind of pressure." WTH? Maybe the wrong person to work your front door but the right person to rid your restaurant of a large party of 15 people. However we stayed, waited an hour and the hostess was leaving and said she had indoor tables. We couldn't take the indoor tables due to Covid and so we got told the next shift could handle me. Seriously? Been there and done that on a single pizza order as stated 3x already. Crappy service, had to leave after over an hour of this nonsense, couldn't update us on our wait while sitting people as they come in. We drive very far to go to the east bay Slice House often and give them plenty of business there. Because people working there are normal. Tony's doesn't care because there will be 15 more people in the door to pay them so what do they care how they treat you. They don't care! And don't robotically answer to me hear to say your sorry about my experience which is all they ever do.
From the garlic bread to the pizza sauce, this place is delicious. Knocked off a star because their water cups were dirty, but besides that, loved it.
Pizza is good but no where near the best,  little bit overpriced as well.
Meh...The deep-dish pizza here made me appreciate the real stuff in Chicago even more (if that's possible).

we decided to go with a thick crust pizza.  the crust was perfectly executed.  it was thick enough to satisfy dough lovers but thin enough to have the perfect crunch and allow room in the stomach for more than one slice.  we're going to go back.
Some of the best damn Chicago-style deep-dish pizza I've ever had. Brass Monkey for the win!
Cool atmosphere, waiter was really nice...the pizza was just decent. I didn't care for the margarita pizza. We were seated quickly which was nice and got our in a good amount of time.

I must start by saying: WOW the deep dish is AMAZING!!!!! great service, delicious hot pizza. I'm vegetarian, and I ordered the deep dish with mushrooms, and it was great!!!! GREAT Crust, GREat sauce and general deliciousness.
Good deep dish, not the best, but if you're in the area well worth the visit.
This is the BEST pizza in the Bay Area. I love their staff at every location. Drinks, food and everything is always on point. You all do it right! Highly recommend the Divis location!

This is one of the top 3 pizza spots in San Francisco. Fantastic pie with fantastic service. Its a loaded deep dish that might have you done after a slice but definitley 2. The crust is made of cornmeal(cornbread). Its a full course meal all in the slice. 2 thumbs up.
this is one of me and the gf's fave italian place in the city. great mom and pop feel. the clam dish was so yummy...and then mopping up the sauce with the bread...mmm. can't wait to come back!

If you are looking for a fancy Italian restaurant - this is not the place. If you are looking for old school authentic Italian food served with love - this IS the place! It is very small and I went with a group who are regulars here. Since they know how busy it gets and we had 6 people, we went early on a Sunday evening. No wait but it filled up right after we sat down. We ordered about 8 dishes to share and 2 pizzas. The pasta was good, but the pizza here was fantastic! We had the special pizza with pancetta and leeks and since they are well known for the spinach pizza we made this one half and half and then ordered a straight up Italian pepperoni pizza. Delizioso! Make sure you save room for a couple very special desserts. I am not a tiramisu fan but the one here is incredible. It does not have any alcohol taste and it is more like a pudding - it is so velvety smoothe. They also brought us something called a chocolate sausage which is sliced and served with a delicious sauce which seemed to have some kind of effervescence. Nothing like I have ever tasted before. Great little place and the staff here love what they do!

this is not only the best pizza in San Francisco, it beats the majority of pizzerias in Italy. i live in Italy and have been to at least three dozen pizzerias all over that country. the standards are uniformly high there. i have never once had a bad or even medicore pizza, BUT, yet i also truly have never had one as good as Tommaso's. a main reason is that it is run by a family of Italian immigrants (not Italian-Americans who have bastardized the cuisine). their 75+ year history is hard to dispute. and Pizza Number 8 (spinich, garlic and shaved parmesan chees) is the top.

My wife and I first visited Tommaso's in 1991 when we were visiting San Francisco from the East Coast. We picked Tommaso's because we had just bought a restaurant review book at City Lights, and were reading it at Vesuvio's. We weren't disappointed. The pizza we ordered that rainy day was perfection. Years later we moved to San Francisco, and Tommaso's has become a regular hang out for us. We still get the wine of the month (Augustino knows wine!) and an anchovy pizza, just like we did that rainy day almost twenty years ago. It's heavenly. My wife and I spend a lot of time in Italy, and this is real Italian style pizza. The salads are huge, and splitting them for two is a good way to start. The antipasto is great, too, and my wife is partial to the calamari. For something different, try the lasagna--also fantastic. The staff have a tough time getting the crowd in and out, but they always find the time to stop by and ask about us and our travels. This is, for us, San Francisco's best restaurant. And we go to the expensive five star places, too! Just remember--it will be really good the first time, and fantastic the 500th time!

I think the food here is good. The few times I have been in here, everything has tasted fresh and decent (so my avoidance of this place has nothing to do with the quality of their products). However, I can't bring myself to go in here most days - especially on weekends. There are only so many shoves and pushes by oblivious people or baby strollers that I can take. I understand everyone is in a mad dash to get their food, but I just wish this place wasn't so tiny. For living a few blocks away, this is not a place I'd consider going for a quick snack or pickup. It ends up turning into a big production just getting in and out of this place.

wow, their breads are *amazingly* good.  i love going early on saturday morning when everything is hot and fresh out of the oven.  there's something incredibly charming standing in line with a half-dozen other san franciscans passionate about getting their weekend fresh bread fix!  the coffee is also quite good.

update 10/27:  i just had some of their pizza, and i daresay it's the best pizza i've had in sf (of the same caliber as cheeseboard in berkeley)!  today's flavor consisted of caramelized onions with ricotta cheese and pesto on sourdough crust.  mmmm, good stuff!
It's all about the muffins, brioche, currants, and the scones!  All soooo good.  I also heard that they serve a damn good coffee...

If I lived close to Arizmendi I'd be seriously gaining some weight. When I first came here upon the advice of a good friend, I felt like a kid in a candy store. So much good stuff and so little room in my tummy. The pastries are great and so is the pizza. I could use a slice right now! The staff is also very friendly. I'm tempted to give it 5 stars but haven't been there in a few months and need to refresh my memory...will update this review after I try it again.
What else can I say about this gem?  Simply the best bakery I've been to.  Ever.  I've moved away, but when I come back, I make a real effort to try and come back here.  I love it so much.

This is the ultimate San Francisco pizza, and one of my favorite slices in the entire city-- sourdough, thin crust, crisp bottom but slightly chewy overall with interesting toppings like shitake & garlic parsley, potato & dill... just the smell... drool!!

You just can't go wrong here.  You'd be even luckier if you lived near the Oakland (Lakeshore Avenue) coop, where the pizza and other daily goodies are even better.  Don't mean to start an inter-coop battle here, and I'm not dissing the good folks on 9th Avenue either.

Awesome baked goods, but my favorite is the pizza -- unless it has toppings that I don't particularly like, of course, and there's only one variety each day. I don't like potatoes on my pizza, for example. But the crust is great, medium thickness. When I worked nearby, I used to like to pick up half-baked pizzas, bring them home, and finish heating them in the oven. Yum. The bialys are also pretty good, and I used to love the decadent cookie brittle.

I love every pizza here but Portobello mushroom/balsamic vinaigrette is my favorite.  I think the one in Emeryville has better toppings though.  For example, I always pray and pray and PRAY that the SF one will make the Arugula/Gorgonzola/Red Onions/ Balsamic Vinaigrette/Toasted Walnuts one but they won't.  And then I have to venture over the bridge on the right day just to satisfy my taste buds.  I love Arizmendi's though..their pecan rolls are amazing.  I got all my friends hooked on this place.  And I don't even have to feel sinful when I eat this kind of pizza, haha.  Just don't come here on a Monday!  I've done this like 3 times forgetting that it's CLOSED ON MONDAYS!  There's Yumma's right around the corner which is my backup, hehe.

I'm really mad at myself for waiting more than 4 years to finally try something from Arizmendi.  I'd walk by all the time and say, "That smells soooo good!" or "The pizza today looks awesome!"  None of this was enough to convince my stupid ass to actually go in and EAT something from Arizmendi until recently.  As a non-vegan I really liked the vegan cookie I had.  And their pizza?  Every bit as good as it smelled all those years.  I will say I think their strength lies in the savory over sweet but both are well worth a trip.

First visit. High expectations.

Service 5/5
Clam & Garlic Pizza-3/5 not my cup of tea
Pepperoni Pizza - 5/5 absolutely delicious

Would return again.

This is my second time coming to Golden Boy. Honestly it is pretty good. My review is basically on customer service. Last week when I called they said they take to go orders before one. Today I called before 1 for a take out order and they wouldn't take it. They said it varies depending on how busy it is. That's ridiculous. They should have a set policy even if they are busy or not. The guy on the phone now said he can't take my order at 12:00 am unless it is a whole pizza. Honestly I think they change their take out policy on how busy they are. Yes the pizza is good, but I wish their take out policy was better for the non drunk people.

Somewhere between a Roman al taglio and a Sicilian/Brooklyn square.

This is probably the best slice of pizza I've had in California. This is coming from a Brooklyn born guy from an Italian family.

Ok so we were really hungry (tired of waiting for a table at the Italian place a few doors down) and cold - but this pizza really was good.

Cheap, square, hot and delicious -- add a cold beer to that and you have made me a happy girl!  

They have a variety of options, including yummy vegetarian choices. Between us, I think we tried them all and everyone was happy.

It was photo-worthy pizza and that pic is still making me drool! I am looking for an excuse to go back. Seriously, any excuse.
Good pizza, long lines though. Order over the phone and you can just walk past the line like a big shot
Fantastic all around!! Great food, great price, great people!!! Hidden gem in north beach!! Love it every time we get it.

The best pizza ever hands down! I've been going here since I was a little girl living in the Bay Area. Moved away to Fairfield years ago and still hop in my car and take the hr drive down to the city just for a couple of slices. The atmosphere is great and I know bring my 3 kiddos with me everytime. They love it and hate the drive but they suck it up for some Golden Boy Pizza.

This is my wife's favorite pizza place. More of a dive bar that serves thick sliced Sicilian style pizza. No tables not a restaurant in the traditional since but man the pizza in FIRE.  Expect a line and to not get a seat. Perfect place for a quick bite, depending on the line, and to hit the bars of little Italy. Closer enough to fisherman wharf to be a good option to get a bite away from the pier

I had this place bookmarked for a longgg time & finally had the chance to try it out when I attended the North Beach Festival. I ordered 2 slices: Combo & Garlic and Clams

I enjoy thin crust pizza, but GB's thick crust was really good! The pizza crust is a little dense, not too doughy thankfully, but it still had that nice crisp to it, esp on the edges. For the Garlic&Clam, it tasted kinda bland to me. I was really looking forward to it since I love both garlic & clams, but sadly, it did not live up to its hype. Maybe I should'be toasted it to enhance the flavors. The winner, however, was the Combo! Great flavors w/ the sausage, zuchinni, onions&tomatos; not too cheesy but jst enough; and good tomato sauce, not your Prego basic kind.

Overall, awesome pizza and will definitely come back to get their Combo & other kinds of pizza. Definitely check it out when in North Beach. The line is worth the wait,& it will not disappoint!
Delicious pizza, one of my favorite spots in the city. Cheap, tasty, fast service, and unique flavors along with the classics. Will definitely be back!

Little Star was a lot more fancy than I would expect for a pizza place.  I believe it is the swankiest pizza place I've ever been to.  The champagne cocktails were interesting and rather tasty and came in way larger glasses than I would have expected.

The pizza was quite good.  The crust was very crunchy, not soggy or oily at all, which was good because there was a lot of cheese in that pizza.  The sauce was really delicious as well.  Overall, pretty good pizza.  It's up there with some of the best deep dish I've had.  

The wait was quite long, but service was fine once we were seated.  Luckily the pizza was worth it and the salad we had was decent too.  Prices were a bit high.  You're paying for ambiance a lot more than quality, I'd say.  Still though.. good pizza.

I'll go back again and again. Their Deep Dish Pizza is surprising at first, but so delicious! Probably the best pizza I ever had.

It's most of the time crowded (average of 30min to 60min waiting time) but it's worth it. Oh, yeah, don't forget to bring cash, they are cash only :(

Just good pizza! If you're a fan of deep dish,  you  need to eat here.  Fill's up rather quickly,  so get here early.  Good beer on tap as well.

Service: funny and friendly staff
Decor: Dark but cosy
Price: just right
Location: Western Addition
My Favorite: Little star w/ sausage...delicious!

My daughter loves the thin crust pesto chicken. My wife and I love the deep dish little star - spinach blended with ricotta and feta, mushrooms, onions, garlic. Yumm, my mouth is watering as I am writing.

We order take out from Little Star about once a week.

Came here on a weeknight with a party of 5; they don't take reservations and essentially have community seating. We waited about 15 minutes to be seated. We were all vegetarians and ordered four pizzas to share -- 1) the spicy marinara w/ pepperoncini and olives, 2) margerita and burrata (added on the spicy marinara), 3) mushroom and fontina ("funghi"), and 4) artichoke, provolone, bellpepper (substituted egg for ham, no extra charge). My wife and I love beretta and Delarosa did not disappoint. We enjoyed all the pizzas, though the crust on the artichoke pizza was slightly over done and the egg was not centered (it was basically all on one slice). My wife enjoyed the funghi (assorted, chewy mushrooms bursting with intrinsic flavor) and the margerita w burrata pizza, though found the spicy marinara to carry just a tad too much heat for her liking. We would definitely come back and enjoyed the pizza quite a bit.

Eclectic modern Italian restaurant on Chestnut.  Exceptional eats.  Mushroom pizza and the gnocchi were both amazing, paired with a simple yet tasty arugula salad.  Food was appropriately priced for what you get.  Service was prompt and the overall feel was very relaxed.
You must try their burrata appetizer, sooo amazing!!! And their pizzas are sooo good, thin crust and really good sauce!
This place is great. The bartender Mike is awesome. Very chill and relaxing place. The drinks are fully loaded not watered down. Try this place you will enjoy it.

mea culpa.  margherita with burrata is THE best.  obviously we ordered incorrectly the first time.  and yes, the brussel sprouts...how do i describe the heavenly bites with a light dipping of aioli? we were to full to have dessert, but we will go back.

I SIGNED UP FOR YELP SO I COULD TELL YOU HOW GOOD THIS PIZZA IS.

Seriously.  That should be enough right there.  It's better than Zachary's, hands down.

The baked actual garlic to spread on the bread was a nice touch too.

The best deep dish SF has to offer.  The moist cornbread crust rules. The Mediterranean Chicken my fav.

Wishlist: more deepdish recipes/choices on the menu. Little Star's currently the best, but years ago it was Vicolo (behind the Hayes Valley Bar & Grill) that had no rival, offering an awesome veggie, four cheeses, pancetta, and an ever-changing variety of choices.

Hence Little Star, there's still room to surpass!

I love their SF spin on the classic Chicago deep dish pizza. I came home from a Vegas trip and was in desperate need of hearty food. Ordered the Classic, added roasted garlic...grabbed it to go and enjoyed it with a nice sangiovese. The pizza crust was outstanding, seemed to have a bit o cornmeal throughout - loved that! The tomato and filling was delic. Cheese was spot on, but I should have asked for even more...just to add to the gluttony of it all.
The staff were super friendly....and I need to go back for a happy hour session.
Cash only.

If you don't know bout Little Star, you should.  Best deep dish Pizza in the city.  Worth any wait, worth any bus, worth any burns you might sustain from eating too fast.  

They've got a cornmeal crust that beats out Zachary's in Berkeley any day.  I know, dem fightin' words, but have you tried Little Star?  Then shut up.

Also, hot tip for locals not in the know: $0.25 charge on ATM withdraws.  Finally an establishment that's not trying to scam you by accessing your own money.

Just looking at the pictures of Little Star's pizzas makes my mouth water.  I have to admit, when I went to the restuarant I wasn't all that hungry so round one was just mediocre, but the next day I had the leftovers and it was amazing!  The pizza is thick with toppings and has a pie like crust that is absolutely delicious.  

Go when you are hungry, have time to wait, and make sure you have cash.  Friday and Saturday are always going to be a long wait, so opt for a weekday.

I was going to SF with my mom, Fiancee and photographer (who was a family friend) to take engagement photos. I scoured yelp for hours...literally to find something that was good and close to where we were taking photos. I found Delarosa in another yelper's review when giving another restaurant a negative one.
We got there around 5:30ish and when I walked in I realized we were going to be eating in a closet. I've been to some small places before but the tables were like cafeteria style seating so you're rubbing elbows with strangers. Even with that inconvenient seating everyone was still squished and there were waitresses and waiters stepping all over everyone. My mom ordered the scallop skewers and when she got it there was a total of 6 scallops in sauce...for $17. I shared a margahrita pizza with my fiancee and we were still hungry after, it looks filling because it's a good size but it's practically made from tracing paper! My photographer got a panini with potato chips and he seems satisfied.
I don't mind having a trade off when going to a restaurant. I understand that every restaurant can't have everything. I would put up with the crowded atmosphere if the food was great or if it was good food with large portions but an overpriced closet of a restaurant isn't my thing.
I love this place for the energy, the chaos, the great food, amazing prices and overall great service. I would go back again and again and I am glad its only 2 mins from my house.

The proscuitto arugula pizza is my fav! Along with the pumpkin ravioli, but honestly everything is good here. The only downside is that its really busy and they don't take reservations. If you can get in early or are willing to wait you won't be disappointed.

This has got to be one of my all time favorite places to eat in SF. The pizzas, risotto and meatballs in spicy marinara sauce are a must and are worth the trek to the marina! Give it a try, you wont be disappointed.

i really enjoy the salads and appetizers, and the pizzas are consistent and really great.  

The staff was not good in the summer, but seems to have stabilized now.

Firstly, I believe NY and Chicago style pizzas to be two completely different foods and it is entirely impossible and illogical to compare them.

Secondly, Little Star is freakishly amazing!  "Do you want to go to Little Star" is actually a rhetorical question as far as I'm concerned.
I go to Little Star for the deep dish.  I've never had the thin.  I'm too obsessed with the deep.

This is the only place in the Bay area that can compare to Zachary's.  Honestly I could toss a coin between the two.

Great Ricciarelli - a delicious Italian almond base biscuit / cookie originated in Sienna (Tuscany).  These cookies are usually available during Christmas time in Italy but you can find it year-round at Arizmendi.  I always get 4-5 ($2.50/piece)  when I'm in the neighborhood.  My Italian BF loves eating it as breakfast food.

This little bakery is great! Fresh baked goods, the place smells amazing every time I walk by. I used to frequent Arizmendi at least 3 times a week (before I found out I have a gluten intolerance) and they always had something new. So much goodness in one little place, really friendly staff too! This place is a 5 star bakery, but I put 4 stars because I really wish they had gluten free and sugar alternative goods. That would make this place the PERFECT little bakery, in my opinion!

Whaaaat?  Why did I start going here more regularly the last 2 months of my 6-year SF stay?

I really like their pizza.  I'm a meat lover, but their vegetarian pizzas sure as heck beat the pizza place across the street.  Their pastries are really tasty, and the variety is awesome.  I used to go strictly for their breadsticks, but I decided to branch out to pizza too because of the awesome Yelp reviews.

They recently started taking CC for over $10 so more of an incentive to buy more pizza and pastries!

Btw, please use those tissues or tongs to get the pastries.  You don't need to stick your bare hands in there.  Come on now...

I love salted caramel pretty much anything, but one thing I can never find is a good salted caramel cake that doesn't taste overly artificially sweet that actually has a good caramel flavor. This place actually has it and it's worth coming in for!
Always on point. Fresh muffins, breads, pizza, scones, cookies, cake. You name it, a neighborhood resource worth supporting.
If I could I would eat a slice of pizza from this place daily.  Fresh and good.  Highly recommended.

Do you like dry, dense scones? Me neither! This place gets them right everytime! Also applies to their pumpkin muffin and lemon poppy one too. Such a great place to get a little treat after a long shift at the hospital. Thanks Arizmendi!

Good quality fresh bread/pastries/pizzas at affordable prices. When I don't want to make the trip to Acme Bread Company at the Embarcaderro I come here. Love to get Rye raisin wheat bread for a snack. I only wish there were more locations spread across SF, though I live 10 minutes from here so I can't complain.

Been coming to this bakery since it has opened..  I have never been disappointed!   My favorites are the Cherry Corn Scones and Pecan rolls..  Very yummy!  Just a side note..  if you ride your bicycle to the bakery..  there is an additional discount!

I have never liked scones at all until I tried them here. The cherry scones are unbelievable. The cheese cake is good as well. The pizza is interesting but the only reason for me to write a review is for the best scone that I have ever had in my life.

Visited Tony's for dinner during 4th of July week.  Place was crowded, long lines, and lots of customers waiting outside.  We put our names on the waitlist prior to us arriving (saved us about 30 minutes of wait time at the restaurant, so needed to wait about 20 minutes once we physically checked-in with the host).  So many different style pizzas on the menu - options for everyone.  We ordered 2 classic style pizzas along with spaghetti and meatballs.  The meatballs were Amazing!  Some of the best we've ever enjoyed.  The meat sauce is really good - nothing fancy, just old fashion Italian meat sauce!  The pizza were good as well - classic American pizzas with a variety of toppings.  Pizza sauce very tasty.  Our crust was medium thickness, wish we would've ordered the thin style crust.

Service was okay - mixed reviews.  The primary server was training a new server - our experience was better with person in training.  Primary server (trainer) was a bit impatient, didn't really explain much about the menu, and seemed a bit bothered - not a bad experience with him, just not a positive one.  
The good review was with the trainee (Juan).  He was so nice, polite, answered all our questions as best he could, and checked on us routinely, even though it was only his 2nd day.   This was a pleasant experience and would recommend asking for him when dining at Tony's.

Good price for the quality of food.  Overall - 4 Stars.  We will return when in the area again.

Get pizza. No, pasta. Don't forget a salad. Well, get a salad and pasta. No, no - I mean pizza. Save room for dessert.

Hell! Get it all and bring the leftovers home. Don't leave without tasting as much as you possibly can!

A friend took me here and I have to say the food is really good. I had chicken parmigiana with meatballs on the side and it was unique and agreed with my palette. Everyone got different dishes so that we could all try a little something and I did not run across anything I would not order.

The lack of the 5th star is due to parking, inside seating and the temperature outdoors. Nothing major but it did take us about 20 minutes to find parking and while sitting outside was not that bad for me, others in the group were very cold. In addition if you sit outside people are walking by and it can get strange. I had a incident with a drunk college kid who wanted to fist bump me and I had to ask him to walk away, no more then 5 minutes later another drunk person walks past and is screaming at the top of his lungs, I actually have to stand up and tell him to keep moving. Put a barrier up and have your staff keep a eye out because things can get ugly when alcohol is involved. I went in July and I have to say there is no way if I had to sit outside again I go again.

Excellent pizza great waiters, fun atmosphere, the only downfall to this wonderful restaurant is that they do not make anti-pasta salads with the ham, prosciutto, salami, all they have is a Caesar salad which was just OK out of scale of 1 to 10 I would give it a three they did have a Salas card I believe the little Italy that was just so so. If they stepped up their game with the salads I would've gave them five stars.

oh my gosh. this is easily one of my top 3 pizza places ever. for reference, the others are pizza antico in atlanta and star pizza in houston.

my lady and i are on the hunt for the best pizza place in the bay and this place definitely delivered. we don't go into the city that often, so we wanted to make this trip count. this place is the highest reviewed and one of the best rated pizza places in the city so we had to check it out.

the wait is kind of ridiculous. we got there around 6 and waited about 30-40 minutes. and while we were waiting we saw the wait go up to 90 minutes! get there early!

we ordered the new yorker which seemed to be the most popular.

dough - 5/5 you can taste the quality in the dough. it's as if the dough was made in italy and flown in by... what's an italian bird? you get it. it had a really great charcoal char on it, which i loved. the dough held up really well when folded.

crust - 4/5 they have a designated crust (crust with no toppings on it). and it had great flavor. btw, crust and dough both didn't really hold up well the next day. you know how sometimes pizza can be better the next day when you heat it up or eat it cold? this pizza was definitely a lot better the day of.

cheesiness - 4/5 great cheesiness! really beautiful cheese lines coming from each bite.

toppings/sauce - 5/5 the quality of ingredients was unparalleled! you can taste the snap of the casing of the pepperoni, the calabrese sausage had this really light flavor that i loved, the spices were proportioned perfectly, and i'm not even a fan of ricotta cheese, but i loved it on the pizza (again, i don't think the ricotta tasted as good the next day). such great flavor! the sauce tasted delicious. i personally like it when the sauce has the potential to drop on the plate, which this didn't, but i didn't care.

water - 4/5 they're really good at refilling water, they didn't give straws (which is good cause we're trying to use less straws to save the turtles), water tasted fine without adding lemon in it.

my gosh, this might have been one of the best pizzas i've ever had. and they have so many different kinds of pizzas, you just want to try them all!

i'm interested to see what a normal, choose your own toppings pizza tastes like here. i felt like i had to get one of their award winners at least the first time or two i come here.

my lady gave this place 5/5 also. she's a stickler for pizza, but she loved it!

oh yeah, they charged us for ranch!! seriously?

I've been searching for a pizza place that can shake my undying love for a local joint down in Westminster California. Everywhere I travel within the states I've sampled different mom and pop pizza places. Some very good and others making me regret I paid for a whole pie. Tony's finally did it for me, it's the darn crust!

This place is always busy and we had an hour wait for a table. We were so hungry we rushed to the two seats that were miraculously available at the bar. I believe we ordered some New York style pie and a starter salad to share.

The pie was delicious and I'll say it again it's the crust that got me. They know what they're doing with their dough. The only problem I had was the price, ouch. Would I visit again? Probably, it was that good.

Does this amazing hole in the wall even need more reviews?
I popped in with my housemate early on Friday night. The wait for two was 45 minutes-long but not unreasonable given the fame of this place. However a spot for two opened up at the bar, so we got cozy together in the corner. The bartender was kind and took care of us quickly, and gave great recommendations to us newbies.

We went with the classic Margherita and  Manhattan Calzone, and I couldn't feel better about the choice. I am not a pizza connoisseur, but this was the best pizza I've ever had. So not only did we skip the 45 minute wait, but our pizzas came out in record time! That's my kind of Friday treat

Was it worth the hype? Yes it was. Was it worth the one hour 15 minute wait? Yes it was.

What I got:
Coccoli with the spicy meat: 5 stars - this was my first time trying anything like this. Think of a beignet which you open to stuff meat which is grounded into almost a paste and then you shove arugula on top of it. Crispy and savory it was so good. You get enough for 4 people. I highly recommend if you've never tried coccoli.

The New Yorker pizza:  4.5 stars - what a great pie. I know I should've ordered the award winning neapolitana marguerita pizza but so many people were raving a bout this one. I wasn't disappointed! Meaty, cheeses and lots of garlic made my mouth happy.

While I don't mind waiting an hour plus, the service could be a bit more friendly.

There's SO many options for Italian places so it was hard to pick. But this one was great!! The spaghetti and meat balls we're freaking delicious!! Fresh homemade pasta with giant met balls and tasty zesty marinara sauce. I was impressed!!
The only bad things was the bread... It wasn't good at all which is a huge disappointment  but I'm gonna give them the benefit of the doubt and assume they were having a bad bread day.

Absolutly fucking disgusting. I ate here before covid and it was amazing. I recently went back with my family and couldn't have been let down anymore. we were seated outdoors in a nat infested booth. Our server let us switch seats before we ordered. But after we switched spots we were completely ignored from the server and they wouldn't take our order. After sitting there for over 20 minutes we ordered to go and left. we ordered the "famous" Margherita pizza and it was dog shit. The middle was raw, the crust was burnt, there was too much sauce so it was greasy as shit, and the cheese was like a rubbery ball sitting on the pizza (and it slid off). On top of that it was $30 for a small pitiful pizza. Overall it was an awful experience. Good luck if you go there.
Excellent pizza in the heart of San Francisco and well priced too! A cheese slice for only $3.25 is totally worth it. The restaurant/bar is pretty neat, but expect some heavy metal jams!

This pizza is the best pizza in the area, the pizza is quite juicy and not dry  and for people that do not like the crust this place is perfect because there is not any crust. The place looks like a hippie bar and there are stickers every where making it look like some kind of skate shop, but the pizza is good. Only downside is that the pizza is not that big and it is shaped in a square
My absolute favorite pizza in North Beach!  Busy at lunch time, but worth the wait. Two thumbs up!

Good pizza in SF is hard to come by. People may disagree, but I have eaten a lot of pizza in my life and I can say that the majority of pizza in SF is only ok. Golden Boy is good. It tastes good, they have beer, soda, maybe wine idk, and a really cool little restaurant to eat it in. If you're into stickers, like graffiti stickers and stuff, this place is a must see. It's a de facto museum. It's up in North Beach with a lot of neat shops to walk around nearby. CASH ONLY. ENJOY.

Love the North Beach area.  Has an edgy feel to it. Golden Boy Pizza continues this edge with bar seating (only) and Metallica playing just loud enough to restrict conversations to maybe three bar stools.
Ordered a slice of the Clam & Garlic and the Combo. Nice beer selection, but I went for the 'Fine Red Wine'. I thought the C&G would have had more clams and red sauce - I asked the staff if this was Pesto, but no. The Combo was decent. Wine is served in small water glasses (no snobs here).
Overall, I liked this place.  If I lived in SF, it might be one of my regulars.

My favorite cheapie pizza in the city.
It is what it is; greasy "gutterpunk" pan style.
We have planned entire day trips to North Beach  centered around a stop there.
The music, stickers, and impressive selection of draught beers make me happy.

The pizza is GREAT!!!

They've got 9 beers on tap including STELLA, & Heff.. more beers by the bottle!!!

Walls are covered by graff stickers (interesting to look@)... and the menu has some interesting slogans!!

Did I mention the pizza, and beer were GREAT?

btw... kinda AwEsOMe!!!!

I love pizza. And a few people told me about how awesome this place is. errrrrr not so much.

I have been enjoying the lovely happy hours at columbus cafe, maggies, and many other awesome North beach locations. A few of my friends and co workers like to stop by and grab some pizza after or even during bar hopping.

There even tends to be a line. Skip to the pizza! Ive tried the combo, sausage, cheese only and pepporoni!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

ITs super crispy and reminds of little ceasars when they use to have those big giant blocks. Kinda taste like it too. ITs not bad but A ok. Good location and cool for mingling. Place is ok, small and cozy and hard to get in or out when a line is present. Drink more beer and it will taste better. And no Credit cards i believe. BOOO its 2012

Unbelievable bad. I dont know how this place got these review, either people are starving for food or go by 5 star reviews. The pizza base is 3/4th the pizza, it was not the fresh slice we got. Clam, veggie and plain cheese is what we got .. unfortunately trashed most of it.
Good pizza, great customer service - not worth the 1hr+ long wait. I wasn't even hungry when I got in line, so I can imagine how people with normal appetites felt.
You must try this little Pizzaria! If you like Chicago style Pizza, this is your spot!

I was in SF on business and decided to try another highly rated Yelp restaurant. Once again it did not disappoint. The pizza was good and the atmosphere was lively.  The staff was very friendly and checked in frequently even though they were packed.

I've been raving about the crust on the deep dish pizza for days. They have a nice happy hour menu that includes a caprese salad and a kale "salad" (steamed kale baked with a cheesy layer- delicious!). This could be a tasty date spot or a great place to share a pizza with a group of friends!

I had a classic deep dish and have nothing but positive things to say about the pizza. Wouldn't get this that often since it cost around 20-25 for a small pie but would not hesitate to go here again if I'm craving deep dish pizza.

I'll be real - Chicagoans know this is not real deep dish pizza. The Bay has yet to figure out how to make actual deep dish like Lou Malnati's or Giordano's.

But putting the obvious aside, the pizza is good. Sauce was on point and ingredients seemed fresh. The crust is tasty and has that slight buttery(ish) taste traditional deep dish pizza crusts provide.

It's probably the best "deep dish style" pizza I have had in the Bay, but still makes me miss the traditional deep dish pizza back home. I'm not rushing to return, but I'll go back if I'm ever craving good pizza.

Always delicious.  Did the smart thing and go there early on Friday to avoid the dinner rush. Was sat immediately and order their special pizza. This one had their house made meatballs and it was outstanding.
Really great all around. Nice atmosphere and aesthetic, really friendly and accommodating staff. Food is really great to top it all off.

Great pizza in a great place, lovely jubbly. We shared a large Italian which was most definitely the best pizza, both my wife and I had ever had. Lived up to the reviews that drew is there in the first place.

Best pizza I have ever had. The crust stayed crispy the entire time. Great topping combinations. Easy parking on the street in front of the place. Not from here, but with definitely target this place on my next trip.

Holy crap, I love this place. Whenever I have guests in town I always take them here because we are guaranteed great service, its a really fun atmosphere, affordable and the wine list is awesome.

Oh, and of course the Pizza is great! Thin crust or deep dish, you can't go wrong.

Pretty consistent with the delicious pastries.

My two favorite pastries are:

- chocolate roll/bun
- raspberry/blueberry scone

They also give you a discount if you come one your bicycle (probably should bring your helmet in so they know you ride)

I don't know what's not to like. The pastries: bomb. The pizza: bomb even though neither my wife nor I like mushrooms but we just skip those days, The bread: bomb. Pricier than an average bakery but hey it's no average bakery. The shortbread is great and a versatile little item for desserts and brunches. The scone of the day, I mean, I don't know how they get the scones so damn moist but they do. It gets crowded at times but the line moves well, never had the coffee here, usually walk down to the beanery a few feet away for a coffee. The lite baked pizzas are great for entertaining, just pick up a couple for a group and finish baking at home.

Came here on a whim one afternoon with a friend to check this place off of our yelp-to-do list.  Had a tomato and cheese bread.  It was really good with a nice cheesy crunchy crust.  Then had to get the chocolate chip cookie, which was quite the delicious little dessert.

Decided that we should come more towards the morning next time for more fresh-baked bread.  Also noted that they have some amazing cheeses in their little refrigerator.  Noted!  Will be back to buy, unwrap and devour all the cheesy goodness soon enough!

I curse Mondays when I crave carbs and this place is closed...Boo!  I can always rely on a slice of whatever foccacia they have in stock.  Whether it's eggplant and feta or wild mushrooms or even just a variety cheeses...I cherish my savory breads when I get to partake in them!  Combine a slice of foccacia with a cheese roll, and possibly a slice of fresh daily special--oh my gosh..my hubby and I are in gut busting, carb coma.  I say lay on the oliver oil, spinach, savory herbs, and cheese...BRING IT!  I love you Arizmendi, you've made me smile today.

i was really skeptical at first about a only veggie pizza but i have to say IVE NEVER TRIED BETTER PIZZA BEFORE! i can't imagine im saying this but i prefer the pizza at arizhmendis to any other meaty piiza ive tried before. after ordering just one slice i ran back and ordered another one. the pizza is not greasy and the flavors just mix so well. i will definetly be coming back soon to try more.

The pizza was excellent despite having balsamic on it, which I only like it in small quantities. I also bought a half dozen english muffins made with an organic sourdough yeast that were amazing. The only downside is that there is limited seating if you want to eat there, and it's pretty popular so you might have wait to get a seat.
The cotton is high. Daddy's rich and your ma is good looking. Pastries here are like summertime. Good stuff.

Where do I even begin?! This place is absolutely amazing. The pizza and focaccia bread is just perfect, and their corn cherry scones are to die for. Trust me, I don't even like scones that much...but these ones are unreal! They use cornmeal and dried cherries, and it's kind of like cornbread on crack (in the best way imaginable). I would live off of them if I could!

4.5 stars, really!

their mushroom and spinach focaccia is amazing. very liberal with the olive oil, which i approve of, without it being oil-soaked or anything like that. so earthy, with juicy slices of mushrooms generously sprinkled all over. the bread is substantial and chewy, full-bodied and fresh fresh fresh! the aroma of this bad boy cannot be justifiably captured in words. good, simple ingredients, masterfully assembled; this right here is a piece of art.

ah, the pecan roll. sticky, sweet, straight up bliss. tear this apart and get your fingers all gooey. peace, love, and these layers of bliss in your mouth. this is a sugar & carbs combo done amazingly.

had one of their 'chocolate things' just to check out the simpler items on their menu, and wasn't too impressed. dunked it in hot coffee, and it tasted only slightly better. mine was sparsely studded with chocolate chips too, so that added to my disappointment. an overall 'meh' on this one.

have not had their gourmet pizzas as i've only been here before the pizzas are ready (11.30am, i was told), but their focaccia selections more than make up for it. will definitely try out their pizzas one of these days.

it's a very small establishment, with the display cases lined up against the wall where the entrance is. i felt like i had to hustle a little with my choices instead of really taking a look at the goodies before making my decision, as other people were looking over the goods on display and they were waiting to pick their selections out of the cases too. the line here can get pretty long, so be considerate and ponder only the appropriate amount of time on what to get. also, cash only. you've been informed!

I don't get it. I keep trying and I never had a great experience. I tried the mexican hot chocolate once and it was lumpy. The cookies were ok, but not chewy.  I don't think they have wifi, but that's probably because there isn't much room to sit around.
That being said, I love the idea of a co-op bakery!

Golden Boy showcases its square pizzas in the window, reminding me of displays in Florence.   We stumbled in while waiting for a table at a nearby restaurant.  Upon walking in, they take your order, and yes, they are CASH only.   The most intriguing pizza was the garlic and clam --- and it did not disappoint.  The slice was gently warmed in the oven and served.  The crust had the perfect crunch, but the rest of pizza was fluffy (yes, I said fluffy).  It's an amazing combination. The garlic was pungent but not overpowering, and there was a uniform distribution of clams.

The menu and decor are entertaining, to say the least.  How can you go wrong with a pizza clock ?

I am definitely coming back.
Really good pizza but terrible service, the cashier was very rude and incredibly unfriendly !

A great solid affordable place to get a great slice of pizza at a great price! The slices are all way below $ 5.00 for all the pizza slices most ranging about $ 3.00 to $ 4.00 per slice. My boss and I went for lunch time and I had never been so Golden Boy Pizza it was. Since I work in North Beach we frequent many of the restaurants and eateries in North Beach. Who doesn't love pizza right?

Since it was lunch time during the work week the vibe was calm and laid back. We went up and sat at the bar to watch all the wonderful pizzas come out. I knew I wanted to try the infamous Clams and Garlic pizza and I also selected the combination as well. The slices are quite large and packed with toppings the crust was flavorful and had a thicker crust. The combination came from straight out of the oven which was one of the reasons why I chose it.

You can rest assured the pizza doesn't "sit" as they sell pizza pretty rapidly so it is fresh,tasty, and hot. For me the infamous clam and garlic lived up to the hype! It was the right amount of garlic to clam ratio. It was quite good and filling. The combination was also delicious with plenty of toppings. I felt two pizza slices were plenty for me. They also have a good selection of beer to wash down that pizza with!  

The space inside was small but as I said we went for lunch during the week so it was busy but far from packed! With one beer and two slices of pizza my tab was under $ 10.00! Not bad at all for lunch! The service was quick and friendly too. The young lady and guy who was tending to my boss and I were efficient and fun. I would come back since I work in the area and after hours as well. After a long day at work or after a night out at the bars of North Beach I would come here and get some fantastic pizza!
Had Pesto veggie pizza with extra sauce and garlic and i was slurp slurp slurp!! . Ofcourse long lines and high wait time.
I always loved this place. The line can get long but it goes by quick. Get the combo! It's my favorite!

Favorite pizza spot in North Beach. If you're feeling adventurous you can try a slice of their signature clam and garlic pizza. Beware of the strong garlic taste left in your mouth afterwards. The square slices are each about $3.25 - $3.75 depending on the toppings. The pizza slices are very thick. The restaurant interior has a trendy hip vibe with loud music, sports games on TV, and stickers all over the wall. The seating situation is not great and often feels a little cramped. You get more satisfaction than what you pay for at Golden Boy.
Must try the combo & pepperoni. Crispy crust, fresh ingredients and perfect amount of cheese and sauce. Great prices and delicious food. Highly recommend!

Golden Boy is my North Beach bar snack pizza joint of choice!

It's a little hole-in-the wall pizza-by-the slice place on Green, with super friendly staff and excellent food. Cash only, in and out, perfect spices and toppings. The variety is pretty good too, ranging from pesto to clam. Who wouldn't swing in for a $4 snack after leaving Columbus Cafe or King of Thai Noodle?
The pizza is totally worth the wait. Pepperoni & combo pizza being my favorite. The clam & garlic is also great but a little too much garlic for my taste.

This used to be one of my fav pizza joints in the city. The garlic and clam pizza is hands down out of this world. I always recommend     Golden Boy to others. Came here after work to pick up a couple slices of the clam pizza. Shoutout to the male with the blonde hair wearing the Giants cap, you just made me night. Worst customer service I received at this establishment. I was going to order more pizza, but the lack of customer service not even a hello or a your welcome after I thanked him.

How could I say no to a pizza place that has not one, not two, but ELEVEN styles of pizza, all cooked at different temperatures in different ovens? Tony's gets a ridiculous amount of publicity, but when you are offering up that many options, it is almost guaranteed that the hype is deserved.

Knowing that the wait can get upwards of 1-2 hours on the weekends, we decided to head there a bit early on a wednesday night to avoid the crowds. It was a little alarming that they still quoted us a 40 minute wait, but it really turned out to be only around 10 minutes until we were seated.

Being completely overwhelmed by the plethora of options on the menu we decided to go overboard on our order and get an appetizer and three pizzas for the three of us. Knowing we would have leftovers to take home was comforting and put less pressure to choose the perfect pizza out of the countless choices available.

-

Meatball Gigante - As the name implies, this thing was huge. Made of veal, pork and beef the flavor was complex and had a slight kick to it from whatever it was seasoned with. We opted to top it with an egg because why not. The whole thing was tender and juicy with a light tomato sauce covering it all. This was great but I think it would be interesting to try some of the other toppings next time.

New Yorker - This was the first pizza to come out, and the only one we ordered with red sauce. Since it was coal fired in a 1000 degree oven, the char on the bottom was perfect and crunchy. The sausage was very good as well and you could even see the little fat capsules gleaming in the light. The best parts were where the ricotta chunks were melted on. For my tastes this pizza had a bit too much tomato sauce, but it was good nonetheless. Good as it was, I wouldn't get it again.

Stout and sausage - The second pizza to arrive, this was very unique. The menu says that only 23 of these are prepared each day so we were glad to hear that there were still some available. The taste on this was very buttery and sweet, with a light fluffy crust. The caramelized onions really shone through on this pizza and matched well with the mozzarella and fontina cheeses which were gooey throughout, but beautifully browned on top. I was expecting more out of the beer sausage, but the rest of the pizza was so amazing that the sausage filled its purpose in adding some amount of meat to offset the rest. A very good pizza, I would order it again.
