I will get the caprese salad next time. Okay, I'm hungry now.  @#$%^%^

I love Little Star. I've been there many times for many different occasions and until this most recent visit, I'd always ordered the signature pizza "The Little Star". It was simply perfection and why mess with it? This time, I actually broadened my horizons and ordered the Mediterranean Chicken pizza. It was still delicious. The Western Addition location is far superior to the Mission location even though it is smaller. The jukebox is fantastic and the waiters are actually very friendly for San Francisco waiters. Almost every time I'm in the city, I end up here. It's my old standby and I love it.

What I remember from Golden Boy Pizza:
There was a line
The line moved fast
The pizza was cheap
I ate a piece of cheese pizza
It tasted good and I don't even like pizza
They think there needs to be Less Gucci more Coochie in the world

Even though I can only speak for pepperoni, because that's always what I get here, it is sooo good. This is the kind of pizza that really hits the spot-thick deep dish style square slices.

Of course it's greasy, but hey it's pizza-it's supposed to be! Always a great place to come grab a beer and a slice. They don't have a huge selection of different toppings, but enough to satisfy.

One thing I love here, is their menu on the wall filled with funny little quotes and stuff-gives the place personality. The guys that work here are really nice too, definitely recommend it!

By far my favorite pizza in the city!  

It's especially good at 2am!
...& cold at 9am to help cure your hangover
....& fresh out of the oven when you're sitting at the bar w/ a beer

Golden Boy is the best sicilian on the West Coast

It's average pizza. Since it's in S.F. it's a good price per square. All the same, I've had equivalent quality from Papa John's or any fast food pizza. They also need to update the Yelp menu. It's misleading. Now it's pretty much 3.25$ per cheese slice(add 50 cents). The overworked looking employee himself said the Yelp menu prices sounded 4 years old.

Hands down the best pizza crust I've had. Crunch in every bite.

The clams & garlic was ok.. the garlic was definitely present in each bite. A bit too much for me. But the combo and pepperoni were both delicious!

Service is really good here! Friendly staff.

Square Pizza!

This isn't your typical looking pizza slice which makes Golden Boy Pizza quite unique. It's not unusual, but it's more like a concept maximizing surface space to eat. Late business hours makes this place the best hang out spot after a long night drinking or dancing.

Cheap prices, friendly customer service, and tasty selections always win repeat customers whether you dine-in or take-out. A group of us strolled up to Golden Boy Pizza after having a few drinks at La Trappe and the line was pretty short at 12:15am. By 12:30am, the line was 20 people deep but it flowed fast. At first, I didn't want any pizza, but by the time I stood in the doorway, I smelled the pizza fragrance blowing from the heavy duty fan above and couldn't resist. My friend ordered four slices of combo and he topped it off with oregano and chili. I grabbed the massive slice and was able to control it by positioning every fingertip on each of the four corners. Cheese was oozing off, toppings were huge, and flavor hit the spot.

POW! Off the hook!

This has got to be a marvel of the world. With each bite, more cheese oozed off, and I kept trying to balance the tomatoes and sausages from falling off the top. Generous topping of zucchini, pepperoni, mushrooms, and sausage were infused in the mozzarella. I had to pick out most onions, but ate some by accident. Advice: You really just can't use one napkin and you need a drink or soda to wash everything down.

I was definitely satisfied. If I didn't have as much beer and alcohol in my body as I did; I would've inhaled another piece. I bet these slices taste good even for breakfast the next morning too!  Overall, I think they priced these heavenly slices below what they're really worth. At $3.75 a slice of combo, this was a steal in San Francisco. I can't wait for the day I'll be able to stop by again and try something new!

I'm swimming against the tide on this one.

Although I live a block away from Golden Boy, I hadn't been there for almost a year until this evening. And today I recalled why.

Yes, it's a tasteful pizza, if you are into Sicilian style (aka squared, thick crust, cheese placed beneath the sauce). They have 6 options: cheese, pepperoni, clam, pesto vegetarian, vegetables and sausage. And it's cheap. Period.

After yoga and some grocery shopping this evening, the thought of cooking dinner was unbearable. I walk past Golden Boy and think "Why not? Cheap and easy". I walk in. The place, like many reviewers already mentioned, is a hole in the wall. I remember eating in just once, when I had just moved to SF, and never again feeling tempted to repeat it. I was reminded today the reason why - the service just sucks! That just kills it for me!

I order my pizza, the guy barely acknowledges me, as he is in a conversation with another customer about why his alter-ego is 'mayor Giuliani". He warms up my pizza, asks me if it's 'to go', then when he takes it out of the oven, he asks me if I want him to wrap it up. What I am supposed to say?!?!?! It's TO GO!!! OF COURSE!!! Argh!!!

I wrap it up, regretting stopping by to buy it, and having a total deja-vu - service ALWAYS sucked when I went there before and that's why I never came back!  But it gets worse - after taking a nice shower, putting some nice Billie Holliday on, and getting ready to eat my pizza with a nice glass of wine, I take the first bite, and realize that the crust was burned! No, seriously! He warmed it up too long! Way to go!

Maybe I need to party hard one night and go face the long lines late at night (and with the munchies)  to  be able to appreciate this place. Or maybe I just need to give in - it's not for me! :-(
Bomb pizza...need I say more? We got in right at opening and avoided people (it was starting to get packed when we left.) there is a pretty friendly vibe in the place as well.

Nirvana.  "Spot-hiiting."  Irresistible.

Yum, you are a square.
Yay, your line moves fast.
Yippee, you are open late.
Yagats, you make me swoon.

"If I could dream at all, it would be about you. And I'm not ashamed of it." - E.C.

If Golden Boy ever needs a Golden Girl - well he need not look to the 80's t.v. show.

I will come running.

This was the 4th stop of the night, having switched from my Ruby Slippers to REAL slippers, I was down for a run through the dirty ass city streets in my little black dress and Isotoners to this Golden Destination.

There is nothing more in life than the hot pizza on your drunken tounge. We chose our Golden selections. We waited as it baked and the aroma permeated our dulled senses. Even buzzed, this Golden pizza smelled of deliciousness.

We snuck it back in to the nearby bar and ate and ate our fat Golden squares of hot, crispy dough, chewy salty Golden cheese and toppings. Mine of veg and pesto, others of meat, glorious Golden meat.

There is nothing not Golden about a Golden Boy slice.
It practically glows.
Golden.

I had heard so much about Little Star Pizza, and now I know why!

A friend and I decided to have dinner here one night and it was fantastic. It's definitely little old school pizza place meets fun, trendy restaurant. What a great place. I really like the layout and the casual vibe.

They have a great menu with a lot of food and beverage choices. For an appetizer we had the garlic bread - sourdough, olive oil butter and a clove of roasted garlic. Needless to say it was incredible. For the pizza portion of the evening we opted for the special that evening. Delicious! I don't remember what it was called but it included goat cheese, apple turkey sausage and olive oil. I was impressed and ready to devour that thing. We polished that off with a reasonably priced bottle of wine and had more than enough leftovers for lunch the next day.

Little Star Pizza has just made the top of my pizza place list.

We got lucky! They normally have two hour waits, but we only had to wait about a half hour, granted we did come on a weekday. Pizza was delish :-) I'm a bigger fan of their regular pizzas than their deep dishes. We got the original deep dish (w/ sausage, red peppers, mushrooms, etc.) and the regular chicken pesto one. It's definitely worth a try, but go early!!
Suuuuch good pizza. I don't normally like deep dish, but this deep dish isn't too deep. It has a crispy yummy crust, never soggy, great sauce and the garlic bread is amazing!

Damn this was amazing pizza.  I love Zachary's in Berkeley/Albany/San Ramon and all other pizzas around can not even hold a candle to their pies.  Except Little Star.  We ordered a Sausage, Pepperoni and Mushroom deep dish pizza and it was pure heaven.  The cornmeal crust was crunchy and the dough was flavorful.  The pizza was this good and I brought it home, I can only imagine how good it is right out of the oven!

Little Star Pizza is in the upper crust of pizzerias in San Francisco.

The deep dish pizzas feature buttery and crisp yet flaky crusts and a rich amount of sauce that still withholds from overwhelming the other pie components.  Since the pizzas are brought to the table piping hot, copious amounts of Parmesan are well received and melt instantly into the sauce.  The smaller deep dish size can comfortably feed 3.

Little Star's thin crust pizzas stay more than deliciously competitive with their deep dish cousins.  The pesto chicken is consistently rich in flavor, and the crust likewise crisp and enjoyable.  

Little Star pizzas are conservative in its greasiness.  An ideal party size of 4 or 5 can enjoy variety by ordering a small deep dish and a small thin crust, while still minimizing wait time.

Despite having to squint to see the contents of your pizza due to the forced, dim mood lighting, Little Star provides a relaxed and stomach-satisfying experience.

Ok... Here is the skinny - The cornmeal crust is delicious...BUT the filling and toppings just o.k.; not bad, not good...just - ok! For the money, I'm still in love with Zachary's!!!!   Sorry little star:(
Not Zacharry's  but very good. Start with roasted chicken wings

We visited Little Star for the first time today, and it's was a solid OK but not great or excellent.  Starting out we had a salad which was nice and then went with the original/classic (sausage, mushrooms, onion, peppers) but it just didn't have the flavor we expected, so it was lacking in that area, but otherwise good.
I live down the street from this place, you cant go wrong with anything on the menu and they have beer on tap.  Great for carry out as well.  Will definitely be going back soon!
Update: The owner of Little Star addressed my concern in the most professional manner possible. Thanks Brian..

Needed a booze bite in the middle of happy hour at Magnet so I wandered over w/ my roomie to Golden Boy.  We took a seat and ordered a beer and pizza.  

It was served immediately and the punky server told us to enjoy and enjoy we did!!  That is some tasty ass pizza!!!  The best is that the guy behind the counter is super nice or super flirty.  He gave us a free refill of beer and told us to stick around.  

Cheesy salty herblicious pizza....oh!!  It's a square slice of pizza.  I don't know why but that makes it even more tastier.

Every time I go here I am convinced I am eating the best pizza ever.

I'm pretty sure I'd still think that about Golden Boy if I weren't intoxicated at each visit, but we'll have to see.  It's hard to get me to North Beach sober.

Until very recently, I had never had pizza from Golden Boy while sober. I never wrote a review despite eating there multiple times because I never felt qualified in my inebriated state. Yet two weeks ago I tried Golden Boy Pizza for the first time and now feel I can writer a review.

I've had multiple pizzas there: the pepperoni, the clam garlic, the pesto and the combo. I've tried all the rectangular sicilian style slices and I've come to the conclusion that most of the time, it's just okay.

The toppings are good and the crust can be crisp, but I have had slightly soggy crust before. It's a thicker crust (more like foccaccia) and the line is exceedingly long at various times of day. At $3.75, it seems a bit steep for a pizza slice that gets reheated when you order it, but they are large and filling. The clam garlic pizza is by far my favorite slice with such pungent flavors and aromas.

I'm still not sure if Golden Boy is worthwhile all the time, but I do know it's still completely worth it for me on late evenings. I will keep going back to Golden Boy, even if it's not the best.

I'm not a big fan of deep dish, but Golden Boy's is still legit! The crust is still extra crispy, especially if you order by the slice. It's always pretty packed in here with people coming and going, but it doesn't disappoint. It's also located on Green St. which is the Italian food jackpot of The City, so come hungry!

This place has a cool old school vibe with a diner-like theme. The employees are nice, laid back people. You can order by the slice or a whole sheet with 16 slices! We ordered a sheet of half pepperoni and half cheese and it came out to around $40. Kinda pricey but it filled all 10 of us perfectly. I love the use of the fork and knives cause it keeps everything nice and clean. I'm coming back soon for another slice f'sho!

The best!! Clam and garlic..the best!! We always stop here when we are in North Beach because...it's the best!!! It's fun and funky and not trying to be.  the gal that seems to run the place is friendly and always calm, no matter how long the line is.Plus she gets your order right and remembers what you wanted when you order that third slice from your seat.
Sit at the end of the coin yet and you get to watch pizza ballet ... Three guys making pizza in a very small space.. It's choreographed movement.
It's a great place and dinner for two with drinks is less than $20.00.

GBP takes pizza to whole different level. well at least deep dish. So my elite foodie friend from seattle ian m. and I went on our foodie extravaganza, and I will have to admit. The pizza in the display didn't look so good, but once I bit into their their pesto vegetarian pizza, it was freaking game over! I could have eaten two slices! and trust me, their slices are not little.

As for the their clam, and garlic pizza. It wasn't for me. I thought I liked garlic, but I don't like thattttttttttttt much garlic. But I am not saying the flavors weren't good. They just weren't for me.

best description: light fluffy goodness with sweet sauce, and airy heaven melting in your mouth! IF YOU LIKE PIZZA, MOSTLY DEEP DISH...... you'll love gbp!!!!! better than little star, better than any pizza I have had in sf.... not sure if it beats zachery's, but it definitely is up there!!!!!

note to self : get cheese pizza next time

Served hot (if you take it to go and you're not going to eat it within the next 5 minutes, you'll be wasting your time because it's not as good cold)

They serve the thicker bread (opposite of the thin crust)

Oddly, the peparoni is better than the combo (unless you really prefer vegetables on your pizza)

Wish it was open past midnight

Slight crowd and line to wait on most nights

I love Golden Boy!

The other weekend my friends and I decided to do an unofficial pizza crawl...buy 1 slice of pizza from a bunch of pizza places and split it between 5 people. Needless to say, we didn't get very far. Golden Boy was our second stop, and although I've had it before, the combination of the pizza staring at us through the window + the delightful smell was enough to just stop our 'pizza crawl' altogether and just order enough slices to fill everyone up.

The line is usually out the door, but it goes by pretty fast. The pizzas are always freshly baked, but once you make your order, they pop it back in the oven for a few minutes so that the top is soft, doughy and cheesy, and the bottom has the perfect crisp. Affordable and open late!!

Went here last night with high expectations after my friend ranted & raved about "the best pizza place in the city"...Golden Boy Pizza TOTALLY exceeded my expectations.

The Good:
GREAT, flavorful pizza with tons of toppings
90s Alternative music playing - I LOVED it, I would sit there just to listen to the music
BEER ON TAP!
Leftovers were amazing & smelled so good!
Ideal for take-out

The Bad:
The stools are annoyingly close to the bar table and you can't move them because they are stationary

I will definitely be going here again and again and again...

I've probably eaten here 2-4 times a week for the past few months.  It's worth to note that nothing has changed.

Best tasting crust, friendly servers, friendly price, friendly tap beers, excellent music on the iPod (never fails), and Christopher Walken.

If they only served CHAMPAAAAAG-NIA...
The pizza was phenomenal!. The best part of the visit though was the staff! What a fun place. They are friendly and overall make this an outstanding experience!

I love this place. I have been coming here for years and each time the experience and food has been amazing! They have a full bar with TV for those day games. The bar is open seating, first-come, first-served. The wait time is usually around 30-45 minutes for general seating, but is totally worth the wait. If you get there in time be sure to order their famous Napoletana style Margherita Pizza (they only make 73 a day). The location is great, but no or very limited parking.

Pizza is amazing here! We've had a plain pepperoni here that was spectacular. Tonight we had the giant meatball with the fried egg on top, a Margherita and The New Yorker; all were delicious and were devoured within minutes of being brought to the table. Definitely our favorite spot to eat in SF

Had the Calzone from the adjacent Slice House.  It was excellent with its large portion & side of marinara sauce.  This is a popular place w/ the pizza slices as the big seller.  Can't wait to try them, too.

March 2018 Update
Purchased the Stromboli from the Slice House next door.  Again, very good with a side of marinara. The service was quick and there is a reason why the line is long here--the food is consistently good.

November 2018 Update
Had another calzone and other types of pizza.  This place is an institution b/c of their excellent products.

We ordered a few pizzas from Tony's for a party. The pizzas had a lot of old school flavor. Some of the edges were a tad to singed for my taste, but the meats were packed full of flavor. The pizzas are a bit pricey and the sizes are on the small side.

Can't believe people wait in line for this. Super underwhelming, our margherita pizza obviously came out from under a heat lamp. Sauce was watery and the basil dead and dried out. The meatballs were overcooked and sitting in lukewarm sauce. Locals should avoid this spot at all costs and leave it to the sucker tourists!
The wait was well worth it. Good food good drinks, great service. Very friendly staff which helps explain the wait. Mist try when in SF.
Wonderful service great atmosphere! Crowded but call ahead for a table. Meatballs, Pizza - many many choices, pasta fresh. Great time!

After 2 years of living in SF, this is my favorite pizza in the city. The New Yorker is so good. Gosh it just tastes salty and good. There's not much more to say than this is super high quality pizza.

Let me start with my complaints! I put myself on the waitlist and was #76 when I reached 6, they closed the list and took me off. COULD YOU IMAGINE HAVING WAITED 2 HOURS for NOTHING?!! Not to mention, I'm not from SF, I was visiting. Ok although I waited for nothing, my bf went back and ordered take out. Here's my next complaint, it was expensive! $48 for a 16" n 2
Slices because dude in the front said one pizza wouldn't be enough, However, it was and the 2 slices were leftover. Now for the pizza.. we got the New Yorker.
It was good for the most part, I could've done without the sausage. The cheese pizza was salty. Overall I'd give the pizza a 3. Would I wait that long again? Hell nah!

PROTIP:

Since we all know SF people LOVE lines....lines for restaurants, bars, clubs, lounges, MUNI, BART... SF people love lines for Little Star too. Do yourself a favor - order once you put your name down. Deep dish takes 30 minutes anyway.

We split a large deep dish pizza between 4 people (2 boys, 2 girls) along with an appetizer (mozzarella cheese + tomatoes). it was quite delish. you will enjoy your time here.
Nastiest pizza I've ever had. Burnt, smushed, expired nasty pie of pizza. It was cold when served and tasted like plastic. Don't come here if you enjoy the food you eat.

I'm from the East Coast and I admit that I am a snob when it comes to pizza. I was a bit apprehensive about coming here because I usually don't enjoy Chicago style pizza and prefer a traditional New York slice over the standard SF thin crust. I had no idea what I was missing! Little Star is the best. I still go to Tony's sometimes when I get the craving for a slice but Little Star has become my favorite place for pizza in the city.
Thin crust sausage pizza, and Caprese salad. a weekly meal of mine. delicious!

WOW these guys know how to make a seriously good pie!
We came here for our company's Holiday Party and we were extremely happy as the food was amazing, service and staff very attentive and a great place for a night out . Everyone was well fed and very happy at the choice of venue. A must see in San Francisco for pizza and the chicken wings were to die for!
Fav place for deep dish and fav beer Boont while I wait. Peops are cool and love the jukebox!
We love Little Star pizza! Ingredients are fresh, the special thin crust with the pear and Gorgonzola rocks!
the deep dish pizza is as good as patxi's. coolest staff ever. very nice kids. no pressure, no pretention, totally laid back atmosphere. we had a great time.
Great pizza. Decent service. Quite a wait. Good for dinner. Like most deep dish places, the pie will take a while. It's worth it though.
It's not quite as good as some of the deep dish you can find in the midwest, but it's the best I've had on the west coast.  It's better than zachary's and the service is as good as the pizza.

I stopped in earlier and ordered the clam & garlic slice. Generous amounts of garlic and clams, as well the perfect amount of cheese. Not at all greasy and for $3.50, I'll come by the next time I'm in The City.

Best pizza ever man. 3-4$ for a nice fat slice, quality service, and never fails to hit the spot. One thing i can say though is that if you go after 8/9ish you can expect to have a nice 15-20min wait in line.

If you want a slice of Sicilian style pizza, you found the right place. The pesto vegetarian pizza is so good!

Service was friendly. There is limited seating inside.

Cash only.

Parking is on the street.

This spot was soo good. Their clam pizza was pretty good (and what my siblings) hyped up. For me, it was a little much after a few bites. However, their pepperoni pizza was sooo good. I'm not one to get just pepperoni pizza, however, this was totally worth it! Definitely a must try in the city. It's not great for group settings and rarely any seats available to sit and eat (during the times I went). Their bathroom was surprisingly clean, I will add. Go - to pizza spot for sure.

Stopped by on our recent trip to San Francisco and I am a fan. We tried the combination, pesto and pep....so yummy! Paired it with some beer on tap and this girl was happy. Wanted to try the clam but Im saving that for our next trip! Not like I need an excuse to come back, this place is everything. Super cool chicks working the place, thanks for the hospitality.

No sign outside that says cash only. So after waiting in line I try to pay by card. Employee tried my cards and they don't work. He says he's taken my order for pepperoni pizza and it will be ready in half an hour. Great, I tell him I'll go get some cash and be back. Takes me 30 minutes to walk to the bank and back to pay in cash. They give me an excuse saying they're out of pepperoni and essentially haven't put my order saying they tried to call me and tell me that. I went to the bank to get cash to pay you wtf? And it's a Sunday, don't lie and pretend like you don't have pepperoni. You are essentially saying you don't have the food ready after taking my cash. Fine, my friend is with me and they love the place another half hour won't kill me. 45 minutes later we go up to the window and they say they've lost our order. Are you serious? Offering me a $2 drink for free means nothing to me at this point when I have waited almost 2 hours for my food. I get that things are crazy but you messed up twice and wasted 2 hours of my time. The pizza should have honestly been free. I really wanted to be cool with this place but with this experience I will never go back here or recommend it to anyone.

Waiting in line at Golden Boy is like a passage into a ride at Disneyland for the first time. The anticipation builds. The smells, the sounds, and the sights are all heightened. And then - BAM. Only this pleasure ride lasts longer than a minute of screaming and a few minutes of nausea. This is satisfying, cheesy euphoria the likes of which, I dare say, you won't find ANYWHERE else. The crust is soooo buttery and delicious. The Golden Boy name is well earned, as you can imagine.

When you get in line, you'll be in single file probably out the door. If it's a late night and people have been drinking, you'll be waiting awhile. Have no fear. Totally worth it. The pleasant aroma of golden baked crust with smooth tomato sauce and fresh ingredients wafts from the open window...you know they do it on purpose. My favorite slice is the combo pizza, with a little bit of everything. The pepperoni is good too, as is the pesto. A slice will range from roughly $3-4...I'd advise buying two. A beer or a soda washes it down reeeeeally well!

I don't know how I avoided writing a review about this place for this long? This is the place where I brought a girl for dinner, and she was swooning by the end of her first bite, proclaiming it the best she's ever had. Yep.

THAT'S WHAT SHE SAID.

p.s. Cash only. Be johnny on the spot with it too, cause the line is long and merciless. And have your pizza heated up there. It only takes a minute or so.
p.p.s. Please do not waste time hitting on the semi cute female bartender/server. She does not want to hear your pathetic pre-pizza chatter. And I'm hungry now, dammit. So move, b*tch. Get out the way.

Its late. Drunk? Hungry? Can't talk?  Neurons firing at slo-mo speed? Just come here and point to some pizza and pay (cash, atm nearby).  The place is easy to find, just find and follow the line.  You'll be happy with any slice.

Was here with a friend late one weekend night. The line was HUGE but it was really really worth it! It's a totally different kind of pizza compared to others in the area. The spot is pretty small but it's really a slice shop so you're in-and-out. I wouldn't say we queued for more than 15 mins. One of the best pizzas in San Fran for sure!

CASH ONLY!

Could be one of my absolute favorite pizza spots in San Francisco.  We came here on our Wednesday pizza nights to help survive this tax season.  We arrived after a long day at work, and even at 9pm there's still a mini line out the door.  Their pizzas are SQUARE SHAPED and oh so DELICIOUS.  I'm not a fan of lines but this place is really worth waiting to grab a slice of heaven.

I crave their pesto tomato and when they don't have that available, my regular favorite is the COMBO!  The crust is crispy, the cheese is perfectly melted and i love the juiciness of all the veggies and meat.  Theyre smart in that they cook the pizza but if it sits out for even a few minutes before being purchased, they stick it in the oven to reheat so when you take a bite it's STEAMING HOT!  Slices range from $2.50-$4.  SO CHEAP!

They have bar stools along their long corridor but most people usually grab a slice to go and eat it on the curbside.  

they do serve alcohol so on the right day, an ice cold beer with a pizza can make a day complete.  I'm a fan!

The line was super long but for great reason - the pizza was great! The single slices are enough for 1 person as they are the equivalent of 3 "normal" slices that you would get from Pizza Hut or Dominos pizzas.

Hasn't Tony's become synonymous w Napoletana pizza?  Yes.  Know why?  Cuz he CRUSHES it.  I've eaten here at least a dozen times, & let me tell you...Tony can do no wrong.  He's like a national treasure for his pizza doughs.  Know why?  Cuz he CRUSHES it.  

What style of pizza are you in the mood for?  If not Napoletana, then maybe Roman, American, Californian, Sicilian, New York, or Detroit...?  Oh, yeah...he does them all!  My last visit I was really craving burrata, so, natch we ordered the friggin amazing margherita pizza w burrata.  Then, the man in my life wanted prosciutto, so we asked to add prosciutto.  And a side of their kick ass tomato sauce for dipping.  They graciously accommodated our requests.  

OMG.  Let me see if I can effectively explain how good this pizza was...
Suddenly, all was right w the world.  The answers you were previously searching for?  Never mind.  You're in a good mood.  You can't understand why everyone can't always be in a good mood.  You don't care though, because you're in too much of a good mood...
Yeah.  I'd say that pretty much sums it up.

Worth looking for parking.  Worth the wait.
5 stars.

The best gluten free pizza I have ever had...EVER! And if you look at my history of reviews...I eat a lot of gluten free pizza. I have Celiac Disease, so I made sure to ask about the preparation situation. They cook their gluten free pizzas in a separate oven!! Seriously, that's a major deal for those of you who may not be as versed in gluten free goodness as me.

I got the Americano. When I read that it had won awards, it was a no-brainer. I'm so glad I chose it...it was AMAZING! Definitely won an award in my book. A must must must try! The gluten free crust is perfect as I already mentioned. My non-gf husband even mentioned how much he liked it! Even cold pizza leftovers the next day were just as satisfying as the fresh one :)

Now a comment on the wait time etc. It's ridiculous. My family and I tried to go Saturday night around 7 ish...the wait was 2-2.5 hours!! We went elsewhere. However, determined to try this famed pizza, Sunday night we got smarter...we ordered ahead at Tony's pizza stand/order by the slice place next door! Same pizza, same Tony's, but a fraction of the wait! It took about 25 min until our pizza was ready for pick up. We then grabbed it and went to sit outside on the patio tables in front of the restaurant. Hello?! Same experience, don't have to go grey waiting to be seated.

We stopped here after walking thru the Chinatown part of Stockton Street.  We were seated right away and a server came over and explained the types of pizzas and how they were cooked.  We ordered a salad ( big enough to share) and the coal fired pizza with sausage, pepperoni and fresh mozzarella.  It was delicious and we really enjoyed our meal.

Over rated and over priced. Put in my name, told 40-45 minutes. 70+ minutes later seated. Ordered a "New Haven" style pie.

An insult to New Haven (I grew up 10 miles from there). Crust too thick and, for $30+ dolllars for a 16" pie, toppings too skimpy.

Live and learn.
Literally the best meal I have ever put into my gullet. The tiramisu was BY FAR the best I've ever had and I will be buried in it when I die

After a day spent in San Francisco shopping, I decided to round up my friends and head to Little Italy for pizza.

Our wait was maybe 20 minutes. We arrived around 6:30pm on a Thursday, so the wait was fine with me. We were quickly greeted, got my name on the list and waited. I received a text when my table was ready.

Our waitress was great! She took the time to explain the menu and make recommendations.  We ordered the New Yorker coal fired pizza. It was amazing! One pizza could serve 2-4 people easily as the slices are large. The crust was nice, not too thick or crispy. The toppings were also great. I really enjoyed the sausage and pepperoni! I'm not a huge fan of ricotta, but the cheese worked with this topping combo.

We sat outside and enjoyed hanging out in the neighborhood. It was a fun, city experience. Check this place out!

The perfect pizza! Very light, yet fulfilling. The thick pieces of mozzarella, sweet pizza sauce and thin crust was an amazing combination. I tried Tony's hot pepper olive oil on top of the pizza, and that was amazing as well. If you are looking for a thick hearty and filling pizza, this is not for you. But if you'd like a light authentic pizza, it's a must when in SF's Little Italy.

By Far the best place in SF! Their hidden gem the Bread service (a mere $3) with their garlic chips in Agave - That's what brings us back!! The service is always impeccable & whenever we come back into the City We enjoy everyone
The pizza is fine, but this place is not worth the hype. Overpriced even by SF standards.

5-star pizza with 3-star wine and 2-star logistics. Still, if you don't care about all the rest, this place makes excellent deep dish. Our veggie pizza was eye opening. We got the small and even got to take a piece home for breakie the next day. Will go again 4-sure.

Best pizza in SF by far! Not as perfect as Zachary's in Berkeley but sure is damn close. I ususally get the take out since it is so close to my place, (although double parking on Divis is always very frightening!) and its a cool sexy vibe inside if you want to wait a bit and mingle. Place is cash only...so come prepared. The Little Star varietal is my fave. Go there..you wont be disappointed!

deee-lish-shush!

I don't know if we were really hungry but we ordered all the appetizers. Except for the green salad.  I must say - that I was in heaven eating their Caprese salad.  It was a flavor explosion in my mouth!  The chicken wish - eh was just a wing. The garlic bread (their version is roasted garlic that you spread over a pieace of bread), the garlic wasn't roasted enough and was pretty solid and I couldn't spread it really but it was good.  Now the pizza - wow... that was yum-o!  I can't even remember what we had.  I know it was deep dish, we had chicken, veggies, oh i can't remember. I remember I could only eat one slice because I had sooo much of the appetizers already.  And the cheesecake. I'm not normally a fan of cheesecake.  But I could eat there's all day!  And becuase I liked the Caprese salad so much I went home and bought my own fresh mozzarella and tomatoes and even bought a live basil plant thinking I could re-create the magic that is the Caprese salad from Little Star.  Sadly I was mistaken... no magic recreated.  Oh well - I'll have to go back to Little Star sometime soon then!

I could have also rated this restaurant so high because I was with a good group of friends. I could be biased there.  Food tends to always taste better when you're around good friends so who knows.

TELL that hostess you can order while you wait!  And while your at it, start the training process over.  Yeah, it's great to watch set tables just sit there with groups of 2s, 3s, and 4s watching.  The server was fantastic, yet after hearing our hour plus no pizza order wait, no comp nada.  Shit comp the salad or a couple beers.  
So the pizza was finally decent.  I don't do the deep dish thing, so if you like crust and sauce this is for you.  i do like the cornmeal of the crust.  I do want to try the thin crust, heard it is really really good.  The salad had been tossed in the dressing bowl without dressing negative one star.  Useless hostess negtive 2 stars.
The deep dish pizza here is great. I think the thin crust is average. I usually get the pizza to go, it takes 30 min, a small definately feeds 2 people. The classic is my favorite.

It is really good pizza. Almost as good as Zachary's actually. The crust is a little dry but I definitely enjoyed the pizza I ate. The problem with this thick crust pizza is that I can only eat one slice. So this place is perfect for those who have huge appetites.

The pizzas here are so tasty that I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.  We were starving and had to wait over 30 minutes for a table, but it was well worth waiting for.  The deep dish and thin crust pizzas didn't disappoint.

Best deep dish pizza in the City! I like to get the pepperoni - no frills. The veggie one with spinach tastes a little bit too much like lasagna. The garlic bread is good if you are going to eat in, but they are pretty stingy with the bread which is annoying. My only consistent complaint is that they routinely mess up my orders. Granted, this ends up getting me free pizzas, so this ultimately I guess I end up benefitting from it.

yeah yeah, another 5 star review.  so what?  there's crack in everything here, and im talking about the good kind.

BRIAN (sp) at this location was a doll, and was able to accomodate my uber-last minute, party of 11 with no problem.

support your locally owned small businesses/crack dealers!

Amazing Deep dish pizzas at this joint.  We ordered one deep dish and one thin crust pie for 6 of us.  The deep dish was by far better and next time I would probably opt for only that.  Once you go deep dish you'll never go back.

It was good, but didn't quite live up to the raving reviews. Their clam and garlic pizza is certainly original and tasty, but not out-of-this-world great. It was just about average semi-deep dish pizza. Certainly better than some of the pizza joints nearby, but nothing to go out of your way for or that justifies the incredibly long line.

all their pizzas here are great and they have lines to prove it.. always gotten it to go

order of preference
-clam garlic: i know sounds like an odd pizza choice but so what.. i though indian pizza would be weird but i love it.. clam garlic is pretty darn yummy wo anything being too over powering

-pesto veggie: love a good veggie pizza

-combo

-pepperoni

dont be afraid of the clam garlic pizza.. try it for yourself!
Pizza slices were delicious.  The line was about 15 min on Saturday around 5pm.  If I am in the area, I will definitely try 3 other kinds.

I guess North Beach needs more by-the-slice pizza places, because the lengthy line here is totally misleading.

I thought the pizza was ok, but with a line like that I expect to be wowed. I'd been eyeing this place for years, just waiting for the perfect evening to get a slice ... and when I finally did, disappointment.

Even the famed clam & garlic pizza (which looks divine) was nothing but a big let down. Blandy McBland.

Maybe I built it up too much ...

Inconsistent.  Ordered slice to go after standing in line in the cold for 20 minutes.  It was undercooked. I had a great slice here during last north beach festival so they know how to do it right, just not every time.

Introduced by a friend, I am now a fan of Golden Boy Pizza. Sicilian style pan pizza..super delicious.
I've tried the combination and the pesto vegetarian. They have a good selection of beers, on tap or bottle.
Definitely a must try if you're even in North Beach/Telegraph Hill area or whenever you crave for pizza.

Delicious late night food stop!!! The pizzas are squares and the flavor is just explosive and divine. Don't be turned off by the line, it goes really quick. There is practically no wait for the pizza either, and they heat it up for you, etc.

Check out which ones they made fresh as something to do while you're waiting in line, and get that one! All the flavors are yummy yummy yummy.

Also, they only accept cash (late night at least).  They will guide you to an ATM if you do not have such bills on you.

LOVE THIS PLACE. It is seriously one of North Beach's highlights.

- Crust is essentially a deliciously tender yet firm Focaccia bread
- The variety of pizzas here are unique and worth exploring
- The sausage pizza with red pepper flakes is OFF THE CHARTS!
- Open into the wee hours of the night (until 2am) for drunken cravings, workaholics, post-dinner snacks, you name it.
- Yes, there is almost always a line but I'm always impressed by the efficiency and friendliness of the staff
- Giant square slices - you need only 1 on a normal day and maybe 2 on a gluttonous day

The reason I knocked off a star is because sometimes, when the pizza has been made an hour or so ago, the pizza slice is reheated for you. And it really doesn't taste as good as it does when it's freshly baked.

But nonetheless, give this place a try and I guarantee your taste buds will love you and your abs will hate you.

Phenomenal pizza. I like golden boy best for late night however. Partially because anything drunk just tasted better but also because it's just a short 3 blocks away from my apartment. It's creamy and tasty cheese on top of perfectly, crisp crust is so amazing. My favorite is definitely the combo pizza (mushroom, zucchini, tomato, onion, pepperoni, sausage) but I've also heard that the clams & garlic is delicious too (but your breath will smell like garlic for days). The combo piece is $3.50 while the clams & garlic is $4 and yes while more expensive than regular old pizza your paying for a premium pizza slice. Well worth it!!!!

CASH ONLY! Don't fret, they have an ATM machine inside.

Their pizza is square shaped! If you're just like me, ask for the corners. Yes, they will honor your wishes! I've tried all the flavors, but I love the classic pepperoni!

My fellow pizza lovers, the crust here is on point! It has crunch, but at the same time, it's not too hard and burnt. They have a bar that you can sit at with several tap beers to choose from.

It's next to HRD by the way! So that's bonus points for me!

You don't know what pizza is unless you tried Tony's. this isn't my first time here but  this place is never disappointing. It's always worth the hour and 45 min wait. Service is fast. Servers are always attentive even if their busy. Today we had the New Yorker, honey fries, quail egg pizza, n pepp for the kids.
I found this place about 3 years ago just watching the food network. Happy I did.

I have lived in the bay area for over ten years and this restaurant remains my favorite restaurant in San Francisco.  The pizza is amazing.  It's very fresh and everyone that I take here is shocked by just how great the food is.  My birthday is coming up and I plan on going there for lunch with the boyfriend.

Nowhere in the states have I been able to get the experience as I had ordering a slice and eating it outside the restaurant. I recommend a Pizza Romana with prosciutto add arugula and  balsamic reduction on it, WOW. I just didn't go once.
Additionally, if you get single slice pizza is huge, and soooooo good.
Super accommodating for our large party! Thank you. And YUMMY Pizza...loved the one with fig jam on it. Wow!!

TONY IS AWESOME! I sat at the pizza bar with a few friends and was mesmerized by watching him make pizzas. The pizza had a very fresh tomato based sauce and fresh basil. We ordered the Margherita and the Sausauge Pesto pizza and I loved both. The bite of the crust with Tony's spicy oil! At the end of our meal, Tony bought us cannolis and tiramisu on the house! Thank you so much! The staff was also very nice  My favorite meal for the holiday season! Come here early because the line starts earlier :)

It's good. The pizza is always delicious, but what really put it over the top for me were the meatballs. Meatballs are usually hit or miss and I am not a huge fan of Italian meatballs. I don't really like the flavor produced by the fennel seeds. However, you could tell these meatballs were made with quality ingredients, even the flavor imparted by the fennel was delicious. The seeds exhibited a freshness that is uncommon in most Italian Sausages or meatballs that you can buy.

Minus 1 star for the typically long waits.

In Little Italy for a day trip, and stopped here for some real italian pizza. This place has decent ratings and had tables outside.  We (4 adults) were seated and received menus. And waited. When finally the waitress came by, we ordered wine- with a backup- and 2 pizzas.  And we waited. Again. 15 minutes later the first pizza arrived, but still no wine. We asked about the other pizza, and were treated poorly- "this one only takes 90 seconds" and still no wine.  We were told they were looking for it! And the waiter had to climb over some boxes to try to find it. One in our group offered to help find it. No, we'll find it....
And we wait. Finally a different wine than the first and backup showed up- after we had finished the first pizza.
And we waited.  
After another 15 min we saw the manager talking to another table and asked to see him. He came over, we asked about the other pizza. He did not apologize at all!  He said that there were many orders and he couldn't remember them all (???? )  Then he walked away from the table, saying he would check.
And we waited.
Finally we decided to skip the second pizza which still had not appeared, pay and leave. The older gentleman in out party (grandpa) went to pay the bill. There was an argument saying that we had been rude w the manager. What? Asking about where our food was is rude??
The bill was paid )no comps here!) and we left.
It had been a fun outing up until this incident. The manager could have been at least a little apologetic. The pizzas should have been prepared to arrive together. And there should no be a wine book if 2 of the 4 pinot grigios are not available!

The Detroit style with red on top is so worth the wait. Look- it's a tourist spot, it's a classic. Whatever it is, it's f'in amazing. Like- I'm a New Englander Boston thin crust guy however there's something amazing about this Detroit thing. Chicago style isn't nearly as good. Get on a wait list and get waiting for the best pizza you've had in a long time. Also- the meatballs!!!

YUM! What a hot spot in SF.

First and foremost, thank you to Yelp for including the online reservation option. We were able to get in line for a table while we were still heading over to the restaurant, which makes all of the difference because this place is always sure to have a wait.

A serious complaint to the owners, the menu is extremely confusing! Strange enough, the organization is categorized by the oven temperature they are cooked at. Aside from the temperature, there is no description on the pizza. As a bandaid, our waitress had to verbally explain the different categories, for example which ones are doughy, which ones are thin, which are square, etc. It would have been really helpful to have these descriptions on the menu to aid our decisions.

In hopes of getting to try the most, my party of three ordered the Pizza Romana II. WOW! Higggghly recommended! This is a great option because it is three pizzas in one, long square frame (6 pieces each). We were able to try the classic that it seemed that everyone was ordering with pepperoni and sausage in addition to a pesto based pizza and a garlic ricotta pizza.

All three of us were extremely happy with our choice and were even happier that we had leftovers to take home and enjoy later!

Super famous already. But Tony's totally lives up to the hype. I look up reviews regularly before I visit a place. Tony's definitely lives up to the high expectations. Great place to pick up yummy pizza and enjoy in the nearby Washington square park on a Saturday. Local treasure!

I've never been a fan of pizza and when my bf's sister wanted to take the family out to dinner, I couldn't complain. We started off with a salad which was pretty good. We also ordered the chicken wings and those were super tasty! It had a hint of curry. We ordered 2 pizzas. A deep dish chicken pizza and a veggie pizza. Both were delish. The crust was probably the best part! I've never been a crust girl but seriously, you need to try it to understand what I'm talking about. Oh, the veggie pizza was soo hearty that I didn't even miss the fact that there was no meat in it. 4 stars for the pizza and chicken wangs! And 1 extra star for the fact that this is President Obamas favorite pizza joint whenever he comes over to this side of town!! Loves it!

i love chicago-style pizza!!! and i love little star's cornmeal crusts ***drool***

came here for an early dinner (~5:45p on a Sat) = no wait + happy hour drink specials ($1 off all alcoholic drinks)
got the meatball special (bits of meatball chunks + spinach + melty cheese and tomato sauce) = absolutely delicious

fyi: leftovers taste just as good when reheated. we got the large (8 fatty slices) for 2 people, ate half and took the rest for home :)
I think Little Star is the best pizza in the city..their deep and thin crust are epic and their thin crust is even better.. Best local pizza in the business!!
3 1/2 star.  Got thin crust pizza.  Didn't like their pizza selection.  I like the simple Italian toppings at Delfino.

I'm too full to write much. Very good pizza. Not the best Chicago style I've ever had, but far from the worst. I prefer the to-die-for flaky, buttery crust that is more commonplace in Chicago, but would definitely not turn down an invite to go here again. Okay, I need to go lie down now.

I was a bit tempted to give 2-stars but will keep it at 3 for now and give the joint another go ... For a Wednesday, the place was surprisingly busy so we decided to get 2 pizzas to go.  I don't eat red meat and the fellas I was out with are all good sports so we got 2 thin crust basil & olives.  The sauce was good and the toppings were fine but the crust was like eating a pizza on flatbread.  It might just be I'm used to a bit doughier crust but after all the talk, I was kind of underwhelmed.  The chicken wings we got as a starter were fine, cooked well but no zip to them (although that might have just been because my friend ordered them that way).  On a positive note, the guy at the front counter (checking diners in) was great as was the gal handling the money.  I'd be willing to give the place another shot ...
I always enjoy little star. One of my fav deep dish pizza in the city.
If you ever land a spot here, try the Italian sausage Pizza, thick crust , very good pizza, not a regular pizza you are use to eat.

Everything at this Little Star is solid gold. The garlic bread with the full bulb of roasted garlic is absolutely fantastic. Staff is friendly, wait is never too long even on the weekends and straight up they have some of the best deep dish I have ever had in my life.
Great Chicago style pizza. Best I've had in the city. But I think Zachery's in Oakland beats it on freshness of ingredients.

Seriously, I live for late night pizza.  Ok, pizza anytime.   I like the pizza here, seriously.   The only downside is that i got food poisoning here 2x.  My guess is that its from the pizza that sits in the WINDOW, with all the dirty north beach germs and other crap floating in.  
Please move the pizza away from the window so no one else gets puking ill.

Kept hearing about Golden Boy from a fellow PHXer. It was his kids' favorite pizza in the world and he always had to take them to Golden Boy when they visited SF.

Eventually we made it, and it was worth the trip. That was several years ago. Just went again a few weeks ago and finally remembered to YELP it. Lo and behold, one of those kids is all growed up and is just a few reviews down on this page. Hi, Soph B!!!

Anyway, GB is just really simple, good sheet pan pizza. Usually not my style, but something about the pans in the window, the punky bar counter and the hundreds of photos and stickers everywhere make it a fun and tasty stop for a slice or 3. The toppings are fairly sparse, so if I were ordering a whole pan, I'd double up, especially on sausage. Have yet to try the clam pizza, but that's next up.

Also, nearly impossible not to get a Stella when the tap is right in front of you.

my boy alex and his family own this place.  I came here one night and tried the pizza. it was like 2 am and there was still a fat line outside.... but i finally got my pizza.

wow thats some damn good pizza i would definately reccomend it.  i tried a combo and clam and garlic.  keepin it OG wit the square slices, but pretty good texture fresh ingredients...

i gotta actually eat there next time tho.  kinda by broadway too.. so u can hit up strip clubs, pizza n beer.. mmmmm ahaha

good job sodini's

Been going here for over 20 years, and it's still the bomb.  Don't decide what you want until you see what's been freshly pulled out of the oven when you get up there.  And don't fret -- the line moves fast.  

And make sure to bring cash!

Pros:
I found this place by accident, and they showed me a new permutation of pizza toppings I never thought possible: Garlic, clam, and parsley! You have to try it, weird as it may sound (assuming you don't have a shellfish allergy). I like having one slice of that and one slice of pepperoni to balance it out, but it really blew me away, and now I've been bakc several times to get it.

Cons:
There isn't really great inside seating; your best bet is to grab a slice and cruise around North Beach on foot eating it.

Fun:
At the North Beach Festival you can dodge the drunken hordes of people by going to the side and ordering in a much shorter line.

For sure you won't see Oscar De La Hoya in here - since they only serve WINNERS in this pizza joint.

Had a pepperoni slice and a fresh from-the-back oven hot combination slice.  All I have to say is that I didn't want to leave the place.  Nothing beats pipin' hot pizza.  

Their style is like Blondies down on Powell.  But about 1000 times better.  It's more of a pan pizza, but not deep dish.  The crust is awesome, so be sure to order a side or corner.  The crust is definitely buttery (not in a bad way) the middle is oh-so-fluffy-like-a-Southern-breakfast-biscuit.  The topping was semi-loaded - not too much - but definitely the right amounts - if not more generous.  I hate it when there's TOO much on top where at the end of the slice, half the pizza is on the plate.  The cheese was super cheesy and the tomato sauce was rich but not overly tangy.  Score.

The waitress was super cool, helping us decide what the signature pizzas out and then also just dishing out smiles the whole time.

They have a beer bar but what sucked was no happy hour specials.

The only have stool setting in the whole joint - no date tables.  But I kinda like the stool setting - it gives it a nice vibe.

Surrounding area is I would say heart or left ventricle of North Beach with bars, restaurants, and Washington Square just minutes away.

Two slices and a small soda = $8.25

I meant it when I answered the yelp "last meal on earth" question as Golden Boy Pizza. This place serves up perfection on the daily. I love the veggie and supreme (polar opposites, yes) the most. Fresh, garlic tinged veggies and the best round sausage balls. Crispy and chewy crust- on the thicker side. It should be mentioned they serve Sicilian style rectangular pizza, rather than the traditional round pies. Stepping inside, the overwhelming feeling of true SF pride comes over me. Sometimes I have to hold back tears- of joy and ecstasy!

Most always, there's a line congregating outside, but you'll notice it moves very quickly.  The staff here is amazing, nothing but the best of what SF has to offer. Order, they toss your slices in the piping hot oven, and then in mere moments- voila, heaven awaits. Love it!

Not too much standing or sitting room, BUT if you want to really bask in the glory that is North Beach/Little Italy- take a quick walk over to Washington Square Park in front of Sts. Peter and Paul Church and have yourself a glorious picnic or romantic moonlit dinner. Ta-DA!

Thank me later.

I watched my friend eat her slice that had fallen cheese down on the ground in front of the bar a couple doors away from Golden Boy. We could have just gotten back in line and gotten another slice, but she insisted that this was what the 10 second rule was created for.

The pizza is that good.

Yummy pizza but lines can be annoying at 1AM when everyone is drunk/obnoxious. Love the focaccia bread but it is a bit greasy. Thought the clam garlic was just OK.

Would come back if in the mood for less traditional crust/bread.

A Beach Bum's afternoon. Grab a slice, or two and wash it down with a brew, or two, at Gino & Carlos. When pleasantly lubricated and satisfied wander through the square and grab a coffee at the Trieste. Drop in at The Beat Museum and City Lights. End your adventure at Specs. If you've followed my directions you will probably need to get a cab home. Enjoy the trip.

Rolled in on a Sunday night and the place was packed - a half hour wait for the three of us. No bother, however, as the bartenders were exceptionally friendly and the jukebox was great. After sitting at the bar and having a drink, the three of us were offered the opportunity to eat at the bar by the hostess. We said we'd rather wait, but she didn't give up. She said it would be at least another half an hour - we looked at eachother, and she chimed in, "So, why don't you just eat at the bar" and then walked away. I thought this was a total breach of restaurant etiquette, but I guess that's what they can get away with when the food is that good. The bartenders were really friendly and awesome.
Probably the best pizza in SF...I was so excited that I actually ate chicken for the first time there!

Well, I definitely think Little Star is better than Zachary's...I hadnt eaten at Zachary's in about 6 years and was so excited about it.  I was trying to be open but I realized right away that Little Star's crust is crispier and and more flavorful.  The toppings at Zachary's were undetectable and the sauce was just big clumps of tomatoes.  Little star's sauce tastes and feels like it has been simmering for hours.  I'm not happy to report this as I was looking forward to eating at Zachary's the other night .   But it's OK, let the east bay have their Zachary's and I will get mine at Little Star...

Great pizza. The thin crust was crispy, the sauce was strong but not dominating, and the toppings were fresh. Good atmosphere as well. It was a bit dark in there but I can overlook that. In the end, I'll be honest, the fact that they have Racer 5 on tap guaranteed them 5 stars :-)

Large take-out Little Star pizza, a bottle of champagne, my couch, good friends = perfect evening. The buttery golden crust holds the mountain of toppings securely without turning into a soggy mess (like Zachary's can). Almost better as leftovers the next day, when that champagne hangover sets in...
Amazing deep dish pizza that is worth the sometimes long wait.  Great atmosphere, and you can wait at the bar and have a drink.  Parking is a little difficult in the neighborhood.

DE-LISH-OUS.  If you want Chicago style pizza and do not want a 4 hour plane ride then go to Little Star.  It is like bubble gum chewing cheese pizza.  YUM YUM! Calorie Free?  Who cares.  From the hostess who dressed like Cher to the very friendly wait staff, you cannot go wrong.  The pizza was hot, the toppings are diverse.  The beer is cold and the art work is interesting.  The interior is dimly lighted, yet oddly relaxing.  My water glass was always full.  Yes I will go back.  Want to join me?

Cheap beer on tap, pretty good.
Long wait for a table, hated it.
Weird clientele, ignore them.
Chicken wings and pizza, yum.

The bar for Chicago deep dish has been set sky high by this here establishment. That's right friends.....between my boy Ray Butler and I,.we have covered all the so called "classic" deep dish joints in Chicago such as Gino's and   Lou Malnati's. Know what? They cannot even compare to Little Star. Pass on the boring, lethargic flour crust and dive into this rendition made out of corn. Call it polenta....who freekin' cares?! The pie here, thin and deep-dish, is second to none. The sauce is pure heaven, as is everything else they put on the pie. Zachary's? What's that? Long live Little Star...........I applaud you. You've made San Francisco king of pizza.

Some of the BEST pizza ever!! I've been a huge fan of Zachery's pizza for a long time but recent had Little Star and their deep dish is (dare I say) better! Thin crust is also great. Eat in or take out - quality is the same.

Great fun sf restauRnt food pretty decent for city you will wait an hour or so but make your reservation through yelp and explore north beach . Please remember if they call you you have 5 minutes to get back there if it's going to be longer give them a buzz and let them know u are on way. They will get your table but then you will not hold up everyone else waiting.
Pizza is amazing pasta made in-house very Italian style little thick but still delicious

By far the best pizza I've ever had! Expect a wait time of over an hour unless you can find a seat at the bar but it is worth the wait! The staff is so helpful and accommodating. 100% worth the long wait time. I suggest grabbing a drink at the bar and enjoy yourself  the staff

Recommendations
Tartufo
Meatball gigante
The New Yorker (for 2)

Nothing will ever replace Cane Rosso in my heart, but the take out next door is a good substitute. The slices are expensive, $5-7, but they are pretty big slices. This place truly embraces the idea of take out--there's not really any seating, and the line for the pizza itself fills up the restaurant so you wouldn't have space to sit, anyway. But, there is outdoor seating and a park across the street, so there's plenty of spots to plunk down and enjoy the pizza.

Hands down BEST PIZZA EVER! The sauce and the meatballs were incredible!!! The servings were worth the pretty penny you'll have to shell out for this World Championship pizza place. That is a legit claim as they're known for winning awards everywhere. Worth the wait and then some! The New Yorker (2013 World Champion) pizza was amazing!!! A 20" pizza was plenty for a family of 4 and a piece for the road! Please try it!!!
Great pizza, great atmosphere! Would recommend coming here if you're in SF for a few days and want some good pizza. It can get busy so be sure to check in before you get there.
Food was excellent! We sat outside because it was a nice day! Service wasn't the greatest, but the food was worth going there for!
One of the best Margarita Pizza's I have ever had! Fresh, homemade ingredients made me wanting more.

Recommended by an Uber driver on our way from SFO to Grand Hyatt in Union Square.  The wait was over 1 hour long but well worth it!  The best ceasar salad with white anchovies.  The cheese garlic bread with whole clove of garlic was so addicting that we wanted to order another to go.  We also ordered the New Yorker and Pepperoni, we liked the pepperoni better.

I came here with my boyfriend after a comedy show and we were able to get seats pretty quickly. We ordered our favorite pizza (the sausage and stout pizza) and it took a while to cook. While we were waiting, we were comp'ed with meatballs and we had dessert on the house. We had a great experience and will be back. 5 stars for quality of the food/taste, service and overall experience.

I visited this place because ever since I have been to Naples, I am a big fan of Napoleon Pizza. A long waiting (1.5 hours) that too at non dining hours; I can understand its all for the hype.First impression of a place comes from its staff and service that they provide. So Tony Pizza failed at providing good service. Never-mind, you won't get good service in Naples too if you are visiting an authentic Napoleon pizzeria..:P

Prices of Pizzas are freaking high.. I mean a 50$ pizza at a casual restaurant. Anyways I ordered their award winning pizza range and burrata, breads etc. Breads were bad. Burrata was okays. Margherita pizza is actually very close to Napoleon Pizza. So, these 4 stars are only for Margherita Pizza. They have very bad range of desserts. Servers are rude and really bad service.

My Advice, don't have high expectations. Just eat your pizza :D Must try Margherita Pizza !!

OMG I know this place got a lot of five stars but the pizza I had last night was terrible. The crust was shitty, the cheese was blah, the toppings were wilted and crappy. I had the combination pizza. I had taken someone there and I was so embarassed that I talked him into abandoning the meal and heading elsewhere.

The beer was nice and cold through.

I have had pizza here before and I used to like it. Not last night though. Sorry Olden (sic) Boy!

I took advantage that I was in San Francisco for the Outside Lands festival and decided to check this place out. Parking sucks but it's SF so it was expected. The line was long but moved faster than I expected. We waited in line for about 25-30 minutes but it was totally worth it. The pizza was sooo good! It's a small place with great service and a great vibe.

Their clam & garlic pizza is my most favorite pizza in the whole wide world. It's absolutely covered with fresh garlic, parsley, and clams--my idea of comfort food heaven. The crust is thick and soft, almost like focaccia, but is nicely crispy around the edges.
I love the corrugated metal walls and sitting at the counter. I always feel like I'm on some weird train blaring classic rock that's manned by beer-loving boys.
It's cheap too--yay all around.

This place serves outstanding pizza, easily the best in town.

Additionally, they are open super late, which makes it a great place to stop after an evening out at the bars.  However, be warned that it is very popular, and you'll be waiting in line with everyone else who had such a great idea.

Despite the long wait at 2am, it's a worthwhile endeavor.

I thought the flavor of the garlic clam was definitely incredible, but the dough and crust underneath was certainly not... The dough and crust wasn't crispy in chewy way... It was more crispy in a dried up airy way... Kind of like biting into crouton.
Went here yesterday for a slice and had a good experience. The slices and prices are good. Check them out if you're in north beach.

Nice spot up here in North Beach, hipster vibe good for chilling at the bar when it's not under siege. I've been lucky with finding times when it's relatively quiet: Sunday night, random weekday afternoons... Sweet that you can hear some real punk rock on the speakers here, though I'm not sure how I feel about coming in and having Minor Threat's "Guilty of Being White" blasting. uhhhh

So anyway the pizza. I don't know, the crazy top reviews of their pizza are puzzling to me. It's alright Sicilian style but not amaaaazing and it definitely doesn't hold a candle to the Sicilian slice at Arinell's. My main complaints: it's a little dry (in terms of sauce to dough ratio) and a little greasy. It's got a lot of focaccia style going for it, but I want my slices more moist and tender and...fresh tasting. I'll continue eating this bizness, but as much for the atmosphere as for the food.
Despite the creepy name, this place has amazing food.  Some of the best drunk late night food you can scarf down in the city.

Mmmmm crispity...crunchity...peanut..oh wait that's butterfinger

K lemme start over

Mmmm crispity..crunchity..thick and chewity in all the right places.  The dough kiiiiiiiinda reminds me of Arizmendi pizza chewy..but not exactly.

Some may say the clam and garlic is a hit or miss, but I say bring on the garlic, I could take it.  I got some Wrigley's spearmint in my pocket, shoooot.  Their pepperoni and even the plain cheese are yumski nation as well.

Expect to wait in line, but if you're a pan pizza type of person, you'll be glad you did.  4.5 and roundin up!

I'm not a big pizza fan, so I wasn't enthusiastic about going to Golden Boy Pizza.

But boy, was I proven WRONG!

This pizza is probably the best I've ever had in my LIFE! I got a slice of the vegetarian and it words cannot describe how delicious this slice of pizza is.  The pizza's here are shaped in a square, and they're a thicker crust. I don't like NY style pizza, so I was happy when I bit into the pizza that it was doughy and soft.  One slice was huge and I had trouble finishing it.  The price isn't too bad either, not too cheap but not crazy expensive. It's a small shop that can get busy, so try to go on an off hour.  And remember that it's cash only.
My only regret is not coming here sooner.  Best pizza ever!  Little Star will change your life.
The classic deep dish is fantastic. The tomato sauce is tangy and really tasty. The cornbread crust is great. I really enjoyed my meal.

This is some seriously delicious pizza. I grew up eating Zachary's deep dish (over yonder in the E. Bay), but I would say that Little Star beats Zachary's on the deep dish pizza...maybe it has to do with the tasty corn meal crust or topping combos. I love the hip, vibe,  ambiance (relative to typical pizza joints) and the fact that they offer some good salads, as in, salads I actually want to eat- no flavorless iceberg with Italian dressing here.

I've been to this location a few times with friends, once on a date myself and have recommended it to friends as a good date spot. I will warn that the wait can be long for a chance to eat at my beloved little star so be prepared. And by prepared, I mean do not go to little star when you are starving to death, about to pass out. Go put your name on the list when you're starting to get hungry, then head either across the street to 821 (or to another nearby bar), grab a beer, relax and anticipate the yummy pizza in your near future.

expensive pizza for the yuppies of the western addition/nopa area.
came here one night with my friends cuz a guy at work said it was fabulous. it was full of people sitting in low couches drinking wine with the lights off.
why do yuppies love the trifecta of wine, dim lighting, and sitting low to the ground on uncomfortable seating? i just dont understand.
anyways, of course we left after the dude said 45-60min wait or something. came back next week and got a pizza to go.
got Mediterranean something. overrated pizza. not big enough of a place- but thats why the yuppies love it, it always looks full and you'll have time to drink that wine while you wait.

I would have to agree with some other reviews on here-- Little Star Pizza puts way too much tomato sauce on the Chicago Style Pizza to the point where the taste of the pizza is literally gone. This style of Pizza is supposed to have the sauce on top, but it's not supposed to be drenched in it, jesus! I had to scrap off half of the sauce and some of the tomato chunks as well to enjoy it.

If you are going to do Chicago Style, I would recommend Patxi's Chicago Pizza on Hayes and Octavia--it's much better and has a great selection of beers on tap if you decide to eat in.

This is the best Chicago-style pizza that I've tried in the Bay Area. If your standard is Zachary's, you've wasted a lot of time. The sooner you get over to LS, the sooner you'll get back on track. Seriously, if Little Star is a 4, Zachary's is a 2. I've tried the Classic, the Little Star, and the Mediterranean Chicken. The MC is my favorite, but the LS is pretty good too.

Smells great when you walk in. Intimate interior as well. Pizza was brilliant, deep dish style. Would give the crust a 7/10 tho for deep dish. Definitely would rank somewhere on my top 25 Greatest Pizzas of All Time List. If you dig pizza, you've gotta hit up this spot.
Really great deep dish pizza, but still not sure if it's worth the epic wait. Luckily, there's a bunch of cool art bars on Divis to distract you while you wait.
Yum! My favorite! This is exactly what good pizza should taste like. There is usually a wait, especially on weekend nights, but it's worth it.

Get in my belly!!!!! You delicious pizza. Thank you for being conveniently located next to my Casa cause I don't know what my stomach would do without you. Thin crust pizza that's actually crispy and just the perfect consistency and taste explosion in your mouth. I can't figure what could ever beat this beautiful creation that little star pizza has concocted. A slice of little star thin crust  and a black cherry soda and this will be one happy little lady.
I Wasn't Sure What To Expect . Small Cafe Off Columbus, Limited Street Parking , However They Have A Delicious Array Of Pizza By The Slice . A Great Place For A a Quick Lunch !

Most people say otherwise, but I actually enjoy the pizza. It's relatively thick, like you've dumped all your favorite toppings on a generous square of focaccia. It's like the comfort food of pizza for me.

(As I recall,) Squares start at $3.25 for cheese. And strangely enough, around 2am, a line forms outside. But, I've learned to be patient and ogle which Hangover Helper I'll be selecting.

In a city by the Bay...a long, long time ago...a young adventurer embarked on a journey to find the sacred spots offering up neverending pours of liquid libation.  Given the devotion that this quest commanded, there were many late nights and there were many times where copious quantities of bad brews were forced upon the adventurer.  Fortunately these battles were not fought alone.  There were faithful allies like Golden Boy.  Golden Boy served up savory, doughy slices of clam & garlic goodness that served as the perfect antidote to soak up the gut-disrupting effects of the ethanol overdoses that were encountered on particularly rough nights of adventure.

While the passage of time has caused the once young adventurer to gray with age and be forced into an indefinite hiatus...Golden Boy lives on to help other late night journeymen.
The pizza had olives, bacon, lots of mozzarella cheese. It was the perfect balance. absolutely blown away, we finally tried the pizza that everyone raves about and it was delicious!

Yeah, so I like this pizza... a lot.  There's been some disagreement with friends, but I'm not here to discuss other people's questionable pizza palates.  

The only thing square about this place is the slices - friendly people, good music and a great beer selection.  On weekend nights there's a line down the street (for takeout), but squeeze your way inside and you can usually grab a spot at the bar.

Perfect North Beach fuel.
Quick service, good music, nice people, and good pizza.
I had a slice of cheese and the sauce was superb!

Came in here on a Sunday around 4 after a hike to Coit tower.
Sat at the counter and enjoyed the original atmosphere.

At tourist destinations its always good to know where you can get a quick cheap bite. Noted.

BOTTOM LINE
Solid place for a late night craving of a sicilian slice and a brew in NoBe.
Best pizza in San Fran. There's often a line outside but it's worth it. I suggest the clam pizza

Probably unnecessary to be writing the 208th review for this place, but my opinion of Golden Boy's has escalated after moving to the 'hood.  I have a theory that  this pizza's "quadrilateralness" is its inherent strength.  Does it feel like you're getting more than a traditional "isosceles" piece?  This is a great slice of pizza in North Beach.  They often make a sheet of clam, garlic, and cilantro (?) .  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Keep in mind:  most pizza places are crowded, sub-par, and attempting to close up right around the time that you are drunkely stumbling around Green St. on a weekend night.  If you had a bad experience, give it another shot at an earlier hour.

Delicious. There's no such thing as not hungry for Golden Boy Pizza.

I'm not normally into the thick crust style, but Golden Boy just does it right. Some pizza places seem to operate like the crust is just there to hold up the toppings, but here it holds its own in a beautiful two part harmony. The slices are inexpensive yet wonderful. I know I might get things thrown at me for saying this, but their 'famous' clam garlic pesto really does nothing for me, which is odd because I like all the things separately...

There is some limited seating inside, which is nice in the afternoon for a slice and a pint, but by the evening the window opens up to outside and the line starts to form. Thankfully they stay open late, for when you have the epiphany that you just can't live without another slice before you stumble home.

always delicious, but expect to wait...even for takeout. We live nearby and have regular cravings for Tony's- our must haves are the Eddie Munster and New Yorker.  We've grown accustomed to the wait times for eating in, and love that you can put your name on the list once they open, even if you don't want to eat until later. The wait time for takeout has gotten frustrating though. 3 out of the last 4 times we've called in a takeout order (usually for the two pies mentioned above), they've quoted a wait time, usually about 45-60 minutes, and when we've shown up at their quoted time, only one pizza, if any, is ready. On a couple occasions it has been clear that when we showed up, the second pizza hasn't even been fired. The result is additional wait time (frustrating!) and a cold, slightly soggy pizza (disappointing!).

I understand how busy they are- and am happy to see it! So I expect the wait times for eat-in and takeout to be on the longer side. I just wish for takeout they would stick to the time they quoted you so you don't waste more time waiting around and don't end up with cold pizza
A must visit. Awesome pizza. Great environment. Put your name in then have s beer at the bar. Long wait but worth it.

We had two pizzas and cocktails at Tony's today. We sat at the bar and had a great experience. Jose at the took great care with us and made great mojitos.

We had the sausage and stout pizza. Crust was light and crunchy. A little on the thicker side, but not a thick pizza. My favorite of the day.

The 2nd pizza was a pepperoni sausage and mushroom pizza. It was call Frantazella or something like that. True Thick crust pizza yet the dough was light  

Both pizzas were outstanding. With all of the choice for pizza in North Beach, stop at Tonys for a great pie and cocktail.

It was...okay. This was not our first time visiting, during our previous experience we absolutely loved it which is why we came back a couple years later, but this time we were left disappointed.

First off, it's very pricey even for San Francisco. I mean $21 for a margherita pizza is a lot. In comparison, another place right by the wharf (also with a 4 star yelp review) charged $13. We also had a pasta carbonara which was alright, and the green beans which were delicious. We waited half an hour for a table at around 4:30pm on a weekday despite there being quite a few empty tables. It certainly wasn't a bad experience, I just do not think it is worth the hype and it's overpriced.
Great pizza, there's usually always a wait for the actual restaurant so we just go next door and buy by the slice. Each slice is huge and so so delicious!

Waited in line for 30 mins before they opened. We ordered a giant meatball with creamy mushroom sauce because they only make 25 a day. It was great! The pizza we ordered was good but not great. I'm a traditionalist and kept it simple with a sausage pizza but I feel this is the type of place you have to order an unorthodox pizza with figs and balsamic sauce. You know, fancy pizza. The sauce on the pizza was the best part though. Not enough cheese. Also tried some of the pasta carbonara which was delish.
