This is the best representation of Neapolitan pizza I have had outside of Naples, Italy. I even went on a Neapolitan pizza hunt in Manhattan and this beats anything I tried in NY for traditional pies.
They use high quality buffalo mozzarella, the tomato sauce is light and slightly sweet, and the crust is classic: with a nice light char and kinda soft in the middle of the pie. I think some people do not realize that original Neapolitan pizza has a crust that is soft in the middle and cannot be folded to eat as easily as other pizzas. In my opinion, this is the only kind of pizza that could ever be eaten with a fork because of that soft crust middle... not that I ever use anything but my hands. While some people dislike that soft center, that is what a traditional pizza looks like in Naples.
Wait time is kinda long, about 45 minutes, but pizzas come out super fast. We put our name on the list and walked over to Italian Homemade, tried some of their stuff, and by that time our spot was almost ready. It's a good strategy if you are from out of town and are trying to try a bunch of stuff.

The pizza was very good - we had prosciutto and pear with goat cheese and peppers. The flavor was so good and it all complemented each other so nicely.

Only gave 4 stars because the service was ok - didn't seem to match the atmosphere of a nice Italian restaurant. A little more casual than expected.

I came from Miami to San Francisco and I tried this pizza ,  absolutely one of the best pizzas I ever tried , and the tiramisu was delicious. If I came back to San Francisco definitely I will come back here . Service is great

The pizza gods parted the skies and descended down upon Tony's Pizza Napoletana. As originally hailing from New York and having some very, very high pizza expectations, this place not only delivered, it amazed.  We had wanted to try Tony's for a few weeks now, but every time we attempted to walk up (like rookies), there was a two plus hour wait and we decided to go another day when we planned it out better.  Finally, this weekend we put our names in and walked around little Italy waiting for our table, we were told an hour, but it ended up just being a little over 30 minutes. Not bad for a Sunday. We ordered the Tartufo pizza and ate it in pure bliss. This was a six slicer and the two of us downed it really easy. If you are hungry, order two and have a few slices for the next day.

Deep dish pizza is on point.  The thin crust is good too!  I thought I would be able to eat more than one slice of deep dish but it ended up just being 1.5 and 1 of the thin crust.  The Little Star deep dish pizza had so much flavor and fresh ingredients.  Loved it.  It is very loud in there so if you want to have conversation you'll either have to yell or sit right next to the person you want to talk to.  Fortunately, I was with my roommates and we were already together the whole day so all we wanted to do was eat not talk.

Delicious! There was no wait at 5:30pm, and the service was fast. Started with a mixed greens salad, had the Little Star Deep Dish and was stuffed after two slices. The atmosphere was relaxed - lighting is dim - though it is noisy. Quality beer selection.

Only beer and wine! Beware.
Good champagne cocktails and wine selection though.

Not a huge fan of deep dish pizza but nom nom this was bomb. Great balance between crust, sauce and cheese!

went again last night;
seems like some things never change;
perfect pie thick and thin.
Took my brother here from Texas. Great atmosphere, great vide. Awesome!!!!!food. They also have a great unique beer selection. Can't wait to go back.

Went here for the first time to meet a friend who was also there for the first time and loved this place!! He had gotten word that this place was awesome and it was. Very quaint and personal so it's a great place for a first date, and the service and especially the pizza (we got the Mediterranean) was phenomenal!! I have nothing but good vibes and memories of this place.

Awesome stuff.  A uniquely terrific pizza, and the atsmosphere has always been terrific - a great mix of hipsters old and  young, stylish san francisco families etc. Really just a great time for all.  It gets busy, but worth the wait and fun to hang out on old overstuffed furniture while drinking a giant pint of Boont.
Their deep dish pizza is delicious! There were a lot of people dining here when I went with my friend.

Good pizza - I can't say it beats Zachary's in a taste test, though. The atmosphere is ok, if a little cold, and I've had mixed experiences with the staff.  They ran out of pizza one night so they closed early, but the manager saw us standing outside and offered us his last thin-crust pizza, which was really cool of him. But, later the same night they tried to charge me for 2 glasses of wine when I only had 1 and when I asked them to change it, the waitress/bartender was very rude about it. I'd probably go back to give it another try, though.

This is it......Little Star knows what they are doing. It all stars with the Deep dish and it's bold thick sauce all the way to the crispy full of flavor crust, hands down the best pie in the entire Bay Area (including Zachary's). The chapagne Cocktails are popular with the ladies and the handfull of beers they have on tap are a good selection. The only downfall is their lack of Cabs in house. The lighting and ambiance make the small restaurant seem lively and grand.

Be prepared for a long line at times but once you try it your patience will be rewarded. Excellent pizza and a decent selection of toppings.

Seating inside is a bit cramped but you'll soon forget as you take your first bite. Staff is friendly and place itself is well maintained but definitely shows wear and tear from the sheer number of loyal patrons that frequent the place daily.

This is the best pizza place in town. While it is an extremely small and hard to find it is well worth it. The pizzas are all delicious no matter which one you choose. However the clam and garlic one stands out as a unique pizza you don't get many other places. The pizza is large so only plan on eating a slice or two.

Yelpers were pretty right with this place! I came in on a weekday afternoon on new year's eve and there were plenty of places to sit.

Atmosphere: Pretty limited seating here with all bar-type seating (probably ~20-25 overall?). Definitely a hipster/indy feel to with random stickers and writing all over the place (including the bathroom mirrors).

Food: It looked like you can only get what they have out, which isn't necessarily a bad thing since all the pizzas looked great! they're decent-sized square slices of thin crust pizza with awesome combinations of sauce/toppings (the kind I would normally have to special order). It was really solid pizza, but nothing extraordinary or unique in my opinion. They have a pretty good draught beer selection too! Lots of local stuff which is always a plus ($5 for a pint).

Service: The cashier/bartender was extremely nice and patient with us when we were deciding. Pizza only took less than 5 minutes.

Value: Eh, I would say it's slightly overpriced for what you get. I get that it's SF, but given their popularity I think they could afford to make it slightly cheaper per slice. Just my opinion though, definitely not crazy overpriced though so don't get me wrong!

Overall: This definitely hit the spot for my pizza craving and I dug the combinations of toppings. The service was great too! I try to save my 5-stars for places that are super unique and knock me down with awesomeness. But this place is pretty good and I would come back again (maybe closer to dinner time so I could try more than one beer).

Hands down, the best pizza in the world can be found right here!  Anytime I venture over to North Beach, I must finish up the night with a slice or two.  

A date once took me here after drinks and I was hooked (on the pizza).  The place feels like a dive-bar, well, because it is.  Grab a PBR and ask them to turn the Motley Crue up!

I really wanted to give this place 4 1/2 with a little bit of a reduction for no available seating and their cash only policy but since i cant, this will have to do.

I just tried this place over the weekend and it is very good.  I ordered their combination pizza and i have to say that it is very good! The thing i liked most about it is its reasonable prices in proportion to their size portions.  I felt like for the 3 bucks i spent on a slice of combo, i got a pretty big slice.    Every kind of pizza in this place looked amazing!  

The other thing i enjoyed about this place was that they re-heat your pizza when you order it.  I know this doesn't sound very appetizing, but if you think of the pizza places that actually make you a fresh slice of pizza when you order it...this is pretty remarkable.  It is not to not just get a pizza that was made in the morning and sat under a heat lamp all day.  Their pizza sits at the window to draw customers in i suppose,  and when you order a slice, they put it back in the oven to re-heat for you.  

Like i mentioned before this place does lose some points for their cash only policy and little to no seating.  A few places in North Beach are cash only also, so i guess this isn't too much of a new problem.  This place is also a bar which means good news for alcohol choice, but bad news for looking for a place to sit.  If you don't come early before the lunch rush or even after the lunch rush, don't expect to find a place to eat.  But hey, its pizza, you can eat it and walk :-)

If your in the area and are looking for very good pizza at a very reasonable price in a very short amount of time, then this place is for you!

Good Pizza + Reasonable Prices + Fast Service = YUM :-P

Sicilian Style Pan Pizza. WTF! Cheese, Combination, Vegetarian, Pesto Vegetarian, Pepperoni and 2 root beers...bombay combination.And yes, that can be in one sitting if you pack it all in right.

Dont wait for window service. Go through the door, smell what you're about to scarf, listen to some Mac Dre and straight real Bay Area hip hop and tip the people inside what's due. 'nuff said.

After reading all the great yelp review, I made Golden Boy my last stop for this SF visit. After going up and down slopes & circling around for a good 10 minutes, I  finally found parking & got to the restaurant by 10:30pm.

I wasn't really hungry, but wanted to give this place a shot and see if they were all that amazing. As I pedaled to the store, the front glass window had a very tempting display of all the Sicilian style pan pizza. To my surprise, I had this sudden  urge of hunger/cravings. I guess visual displays does work its own charm

I quickly placed my order on the garlic clam as I only saw 3 slices left. This was the highly reviewed/raved  topping and I would've been totally bummed if I wasn't able to give this a try. Although the garlic clam was the only one I had in mind, I couldn't resist ordering another slice of the combination. The friendly waitress scooped up the two slice and tossed it back to the oven for a quick bake for crispness.

The pizza came out perfect. IT was warm and the crust was very crispy. The cheese was nice and all toppings were bubbling with the fresh out of oven look. I immediately dug my fork/knife into the slice of heavenly goodness. First thought in mind was.."wow this is quite garlicky".  The greatest difference I felt about the Sicilian styled pizza vs typical american pizza chain store were that the crust is thick/crispy but not greasy at all. The tomato spread is rather light and does not carry that strong tomato paste taste. The layer of cheese was thin and isn't loaded with the typical chewy/stretchiness. Toppings were very generous as mine was just smothered with garlic/herbs and a hint of clam. I'm honestly a chicago style pizza fan and loves anything with thick buttery crust and loads of cheese. I would say that I still steer towards BJs' chicago style pizza and Pizza Huts Pan pizza. If not then I love the classic Italian at "Bollinis" over in LA.

However, this was overall a good slice of pizza that would definitely be satisfying when you crave that hot fresh pizza with a thick/crispy crust. Service was fast. Pizza would be ready in 5 minutes and an order of beer would be paired pefectly for a late hang out with friends. Place is very cramp but with a fair amount of seat. It was rather pricey for a small rectangular slice at $3.75 but would be well worth it when you're craving some good pizza on the go.

My new favorite lunch spot!  Since I moved to this city I have been on the hunt for good pizza. Not only had I not found any that was more than "okay", it was all obscenely expensive.

My friend and I strolled in here around 12:15 and there were abundant seats at the counter. We had our food within about 5 minutes of ordering. I got a soda and a slice of sausage, he got a pint and a slice of veggie. These are huuuuge slices, so don't order two like I almost did!

First, the pizza had great flavor, second this Sicilian style was spot on and had great texture with a crispy flakey crust. The sausage was also good. My friend's veg pizza was loaded with veggies, not just a few specks like some places.

My bill came to $4.50, the cheapest lunch I've had in the city that wasn't sketchy Chinese. The place started to fill up right as we were leaving so it's probably best to come before 12:40.

BEST PIZZA EVER!  MUST HAVE THEIR UNIQUE SQUARE PIZZAS!
No parking? Who cares! Walk there and GET SOME!  Oh god... I'm drooling... It's that good.

Is Golden Boy the best pizza I've ever had? Not exactly. Is it right around the corner from my apartment and pretty satisfying when I have it? Yup.

The cheese pizza is always a safe bet, the clam garlic yummy when you're in a reeeally seafoody mood. I think I've had the pesto veg before, but can't recall..hmm.. maybe I'll have that one next! But who wouldn't like pizza on foccacia bread? Yum.

The line is usually long at peak hours (around dinner and then the late night rush) but the staff is cool. If you're waiting in the late night line expect a fight or argument to break out at some point... the 2-3 times I've done the late night thing, there has always been some kind of push and shove.

So for a happy experience head over to Golden Boy, grab your slice and go...and try not to push anyone in the process.

Oh and seriously, stop pee-ing in Jasper Alley...people live there!

After hearing rave reviews from everyone, I had to finally try this spot.  The boy and I took a break from our Great North American Layabout weekend plans to venture outdoors for a little pizza acquisition adventure.  We called our order in and jumped on the bus for take-out.  We ordered a small deep-dish (sausage, pepperoni, mushrooms etc) and the caprese salad and both were intensely filling and delicious.  I was worried the small might not be enough for the 2 of us but when you get the box, you can feel how heavy and dense the pizza is - they are not kidding around!  I was in a bit of a food coma afterwards but it was totally worth it.  The restaurant itself was crowded with modern decor and had more hipsters loitering about than you could shake a stick at but maybe I'll give the sit-down a try sometime.

Just moved to SF from Chicago - so there is a clear bias when writing this review.  And I must say in the month and a half in being in SF and the quest for a good pizza, I have had some REALLY BAD pizza.  BUT!  Little Star quelled my frenzy.  The crust was a little too hard, but overall, this is the best deep dish pizza in SF.  Mad props to you, Little Star.
BY FAR the best deep dish pizza in California.  Zachary's is good, but Little Star is the best.

This pizza is in a league of it's own. It's closest relative is Gino's East in Chicago, but the corn meal crust makes this pizza totally unique. You say pizza, I say Little Star!! The only down sides are that parking is difficult, they only take cash, and it gets crowded so the wait can be a little long and that crowd comes with noise. Totally worth it all though!

The pizza here is good chicago-style pizza... but it's not as good as Paxti's on Hayes.  If you are a fan of cornbread crust then you may think otherwise - I just found it to be "a-ok" rather than "great".  They also only accept cash which can be a pain.  They do have a good soda selection and the ambiance is very nice.

the deep dish here is DELICIOUS.

try the secret "brass monkey" pizza (not on the menu) that is basically the "little star" w/added sausage.

love the cornmeal crust and the hearty portions.

Here visiting friends in San Francisco, they told me this place was the best pizza in town. We ordered a thin crust pesto chicken pizza and a deep dish vegetable pizza. Both of them were fantastic! The thin crust was crispy and light and had the perfect amont of cheese and toppings.  The deep dish was not greasy like some deep dishes, and the toppings were plentiful and delicious.  The crust was very tasty as well.  Four stars instead of five because the waiter was not very attentive. Also, after excitedly putting money in the jukebox and selecting 3 of my favorite songs, the music was so quiet I couldn't even hear it!!!!

This place has the best deep dish pizza in the bay!  Yes I've been to Zachary's in Berkeley.  Yes this is better.  The cornmeal crust just makes this culinary masterpiece!  I always go with the signature Little Star although I've tried almost everything on the menu here and would highly recommend you start there.  Added kicker of goodness is the quality beers they keep on tap at good prices.  Great place to take a date for cheap great food.

Wow just wow ' this place is amazing it totally is the best deep dish in the city ! Special BBQ chic pizza but sub the chikn for mushrooms totally awesome!!!!  Iyar warn you the red pepper has cayene pepper in it and it'll mess u up!
Good pizza, not great. A little too heavy for me, with a thick cornmeal crust.  Four stars for food, - 1 star for long lines and sometimes not answering phone for takeout orders.

I was blown away by their choices! Every kind of authentic pizza imaginable. It was so absolutely delicious. We had the Gigantic Meatball, Cocolli, Italian Salad, Gluten free bread sticks, pizza margherita, and another awesome pizza. I can't wait to go again.
Great food! Good for families too. Waitress was a little slow in remembering to bring our drinks and receipt otherwise great restaurant and atmosphere. Will definitely be back.

I must say we were really impressed with the authenticity and the care and thought that went into making their Pizza- Loved the Coal-fired "New Yorker" fully laden with meats and cheese, great sauce and a crust cooked perfectly. The Famous Margarita Pizza was as close to Pizza perfection as one can expect herein the US. Our Friends were in town from Trieste, and Connecticut and swore this Pizza was in the top ten they have ever tasted. Every aspect of the perfect pie is covered here. This place spoils you for everything else- I wish there was a Tony's Pizza Napolitano in Long Beach instead of North Beach. This place is the Bomb.com

Ok I had the best of time, I went in to get a bit before my 5pm work schedule, it was 4pm, I ordered the chorizo mussels and a cocktail called "That's how I roll" delish, it was all just wonderful, the mussels were out of this world I could not eat the whole order, the bartenders are just fantastic. Since I'm single I always sit at the bar. I found this little gen by picking up a rider who works at Tony's her name is Chantel, I'm so glad I met her

The New Yorker is a phenomenal pizza. My wife, a New Yorker, was skeptical when I told her how great Tony's is. To put Tony's to the test she ordered a calzone thinking, maybe, the calzone would be okay. She took one bite and told me it was the best she'd ever had.

Great pizza, calzones, the fried artichokes are great as is the tiramisu.
The margherita changed my life. There are no words for it. One of, if not, THE best pizzas I've ever had. 10/10

There's a reason this place has so many amazing reviews. If you're in the area, or even if it's a far drive, you MUST come to Tony's.

I came here for the first time last week and I seriously cannot stop telling people about their pizza. We got the New Yorker and it is without a doubt the best pizza I've had in my life. Better than the pizza I ate in Italy!!!

We ordered take out, so I'm not sure what service is like but their food is definitely worth five stars.
Eveything here is worth the hype!! The margaratia pizza is an absolute must and paired off with a good wine and your me a ls set for whatever time of day

We had a fabulous time here, and it was our first time.  My hubby had been wanting to eat here for the longest but every time we were in the area the wait was just too long to bear.  It was hubby's birthday, I just HAD to bring him here!  It's Thursday evening, 6:30pm...and it was going to be a 45 minute wait.  That's not bad considering I hear people wait much more longer than that.  Put your name on the list and venture out.  You'll get a text when your table's ready. You then have only 5 minutes to get back to Tony's.

What we had?  Phenomenal Margherita Pizza.  And ... Downright delicious meatballs and lasagna.  This was no night for salad, even though the salad dishes being carried out of their kitchen looked good, we knew that's not what we came for.

The best seats in the place?  Right where we were...at the counter where we watched pizza being made and feeling the warmness coming out of that wood burning oven.

Hubby's birthday dessert was the tiramisu, a wonderfully ball shaped piece of creamy goodness.  I opted for the cheesecake, but after two bites I was just too full.  Man.  The next time I really want to try their pannacotta.  Excellent service and really friendly server too.  Can't wait to go back.

I have been trying to go to Tony's for a few months now. Every time I tried, there was at least an hour wait. Yesterday being Valentine's Day, I thought that I just had to do it, no matter the wait time. Unluckily for me, everyone else had the same idea. I ended up waiting two hours for a table for two. During that time I did have the chance to discover a really great wine bar nearby (stay tuned).

Once we finally got the table, I enjoyed every minute of my Tony's experience! We were seated outside, we had a friendly server and the food was great. To drink, we ordered a bottle of California white wine (by the way, Tony's is famous for their extensive wine list). Make sure you ask them to keep the wine chilled for you, if that's what you prefer.

As a starter, we had the kale salad - amazing - with beets, walnuts, and feta cheese. As a main we had the Pauline P pizza, which we decided to share. The pizza was delicious, and more than enough for two people.

Once we were done, no one rushed us to leave. The staff took their time clearing the table and bringing the check, which I really appreciated. Being such a busy restaurant you would expect them to rush you out the door as soon as you're finished, but not at Tony's.

Overall, worth the wait, I would do it again in a heart beat!

CASH ONLY, but they do have a ATM inside. This is a tiny pizza joint in North Beach, which is easy pizza to grab and go. I love their clam & garlic, pepperoni, combination which are all thick crust pizza. Golden Boy is a bit on the pricier side, $2.75-$3.75 per slice but still well worth it. You simply order, and they throw it in to heat it up for you - it's pretty quick.

They also don't offer any ranch and you have to pay extra for a pizza box. Parking is horrendous in this area.

I decided it was finally time to review my beloved Golden Boy Pizza after hitting it up for a hot slice last night right before midnight. Normally, I do not get the late night munchies....but last night I somehow missed dinner and hit up three different bars in the area to visit friends and see a band. I was starving and my crew was not going to make it to the band without something on their stomaches...

As we made our way across Columbus heading up to Grant and Green's, I saw the iconic neon hand in the sky. "Let's get a quick slice at Golden Boy!!" Everyone followed me after my look of horror that they had never been there. How can you live in SF and not have experienced Golden Boy Pizza????

It's delicious, it's hot, its fresh and cheesy and saucy and all those wonderful pizza-esque adjectives you want in a late night snack. Plus they cut it in perfectly portable squares and it's fairly inexpensive. The staff are sarcastic and annoyed with the public....which i kind of like. They play loud punk and rock music and serve beer up until 10pm I think.

All my GBP love aside, I have to say Chad P's review was pretty entertaining to read. That's a pretty common scene in North Beach.

My favorite slice place in Bay Area. They get a ton of business, so your slice is always fresh, not reheated like pizza my heart. The Sicilian slices are good size. 2 slices for a guy and 1 for  girl. or if she's watching her weight 1.5 slices for the guy and .5 slice for your date. It may be a little boring, but i like the plain cheese, with a ton of garlic sprinkled on top. The place is also next to a lot of bars so you can get your grub on after you drink.

For fast, delicious, focaccia style pizza, this place is top notch. I crave the stuff. They have some unique types too. Some sort of garlic and broccoli makes my mouth water.  And, I love the veggie.

I like to grab a couple pieces, belly up to a cold beer and listen to the punkabilly radio mix they've got going.

Golden Boy! I'm going right now.

I had one slice of clam and garlic pizza and it was ono!  

The problem is, this morning I'm paying for all the garlic on the pie.  I must smell like Gilroy.   It's like eating garlic fries from Gordon Biersch.

You get free refills on soft drinks.  

Fresh out of the oven is the only way to go.  It's well worth waiting for.

I've got this great picture from the right out of college drunk days of me and a friend staring lovingly at a slice from Golden Boy. I don't think the slice lasted much longer afterwards. And then we probably had another.

Fast forward a few years and I'm in the hood for other reasons, decide to get a slice for fuel before what turned out to be an epic Roger Shah show. The scene was familiar. Two absolutely loaded girls (it's the afternoon, mind you) were slurring their words debating whether to have another slice. Yes they did. Inside a guy at the counter struggled to stay awake, occasionally perking his head up to nibble on his slice.

The scene made for an amusing way to pass time as I waited for my cheap, greasy, and A-OK slice. Nice to see some things never change.

After eating dinner at Vicoletto's next door.........which tasted great but was more like an appetizer in size and I paid $60.00........we where walking back to the car and the smell of amazing pizza hits me right in the face!!
saw the line out the door and decided to investigate....through the window you can see the wonderful display of 5 different freshly made giant pans of delicious pizza!

Decided I couldn't resist having pizza for desert. That was a good decision!
After waiting in line for a few minutes......(reminded me of the soup Nazi episode,but way more fun)

I ordered a combination and a cheese slice. While waiting there was a huge wiff of some pungent herb wafting through the air(not the kind they use on the pizza) some nice metal music playing and the atmosphere was electric.......got the pizza and headed out the door. You could eat inside where it was nice and warm.
The pizza was hot Delicious! and....$7.00!!! Wow.

I think I will go back for breakfast!

My second time having pizza here was WAY better than the first, and my first slice here was already quite delicious. The clam and garlic pizza might as well be called garlic and garlic, because that's mostly what it is. There were some pieces of clam on the slice, but the garlic flavor is dominant. When eaten fresh out of the oven, the crust is also perfectly crunchy, while everything above it is soft and flavorful. It all melts in your mouth in a sort of way. Lots of texture, lots of flavor.

The pizza is a definite must-try for garlic lovers.
The line is always long.  The pizza is thick, not thin and bitter like most pizza places.  I love coming here.  It's a great SF vibe!

I am not usually a fan of pizza made this way, but they do it right! I'm usually coming here after a night out drinking. The wait in line is usually pretty long, but well worth it. It's kind of thick pizza, but the cook it well done and it's usually coming straight out of the oven.

They also have a good selection of Beer.

MY GO-TO DISH: Pepperoni Pizza slice and a Beer, but I am sure the other pizzas are great too!
Love it. The pizza is some of the best I've had and the prices are right on. It can be a little loud though.

Had the Caprese salad and the Vegetarian Deep Dish.  Salad doesn't factor into my score because this is a pizza joint. The salad was good (the olives and tomatoes were good but the mozzarella was nothing special so I probably wouldn't order it again).

I can't understand how anyone could review this place after having just their thin crust.  It's pretty obvious that they specialize in deep dish and I am surprised by the people who review this place with utter conviction without talking about the deep dish. That being said, I'm more of a fan of Italian style pizza--no, not quite NY, I like it rustic, fresh, simple, and crisp.

If you like deep dish you will probably like the zza here. It's got a great crust--can't really describe it. It is cornmealy but it's not like cornbread. It's buttery but it's not like pie crust. It's the kind of crust that I wouldn't like for anything but deep-dish pizza.

The fillings are also good--fresh veggies and springy cheese topped with a hearty and acidic tomato sauce. So it's the best deep dish I've had and the price was reasonable.

The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because I still don't get deep-dish.

We visited the outlet in NOPA, which was packed on a Sunday night.  Despite the mob, the service was great and we ended up sitting at the bar.  We got the small standard deep dish.  It was good, but almost too much for us -- it's heavy.  I think I prefer the thin crust-style. That being said, I think it's a fun, cool place for SF pizza.
Take my Chicago card but I must say I'm digging Little Star's Brass Monkey pizza!  Thanks LSP for giving a Chicago transplant a go to place when I need my real pizza fix.
5 Stars. I'm a Chicagoan. 'Nuff said. (This is my fave Chicago Pizza in SF. Specifically, they got the crust right, the cheese is stringily delish, the sauce is perfecto)

Because I would give Zachary's in Oakland/San Ramon 5 stars based on their superiority to even native Chicago Deep Dish (I've done the analysis folks) it makes it so that I can give this a 4 star rating because I would come back...but it is maybe closer to a 3.5 but since I'm bullish on Zachary's...no reason to be stingy.  It's a cool spot but a little off the beaten path but I happened upon this place only once so far and hope to be back.

I entered pizza in Frisco on Yelp to and this was the first place to pop up. I'm glad I tried it.  Small restaurant with either dine in or take out.  They won't seat you until your whole party arrives so make sure everyone arrives promptly.  Had garlic bread and caprese salad for starters.  Then tried the 'classic' deep dish which was the payoff.  tasty pizza with a buttery corn meal type crust.  Never had Chicago deep dish but I'm hoping it tastes as good as Little Star!!!!!

So Little Star Pizza...hands down one of the BEST Deep Dish Pizza's in town. It is a busy place, but so worth the wait. Grab a beer, chill out and await awesomeness in pizza form. I have been to both the shop on Divis. and on Mission - Both are fantastic!!

Came to this place on a friday at around 6pm and we were lucky enough to get seated immediately, but once we sat it started to get crazy busy in there. It's a little dark in there but I kinda liked that. We started off with the garlic bread which was solid they give you a whole bulb of garlic and you spread it on the bread along with the butter, so if you're feeling lazy don't get it.  Before I talk about the pizza I will say I usually don't like deep dish pizza and when I went to Zachary's in berkeley I was not impressed.  We ordered the brass monkey pizza and it was pretty fantastic, the thing that sticks out in my mind is how wonderful the cornmeal crust is it didn't get soggy at anytime, the last bite was as crisp and light as the first bite. The only thing you have to worry about coming here is the parking.

PROS -
Excellent pizza flavor
Good beer and wine selection

CONS -
Pizza crust is more like Pizza Hut now - used to taste more like a buttery pie crust
Too much cheese - not sure this was possible, but there was so much mozzarella that the cheese was coagulating into hunks as we were eating it
Tiny tables with water carafe included
Pouring my own water - despite our server walking back and forth empty handed

Cheap late night pizza - not good. Greasy with low quality toppings. No idea how it has 4.5 stars. Completely dumbfounded. Tony's just around the corner and down the street is 100 times better - super special amazing pizza.
Good stuff.. typically  don't like thick Pizza but this was bomb.. Had the Clam and a sasuge.

Yummy square pizzas, reminds me of being in Roma!! Everything looked so good and piping hot.
We got the pesto vegetarian (it had tons of veggies and black olives) and the clams & garlic-  (it was green, what was that? green garlic? parsley??) who cares, it was so garlicky GOOD!

It was my itty bitty little Asian legs that prevented me from seeing in through the window of this place.  

Then it was my deep-seeded desire to die an early heart-disease event that kept me walking through the door and sat at the counter.  A whole baking tray worth of pizza.  Fluffy crust.  Melty cheese with caramelized bits like sun spots.  Very little exposed cheese-less crust.

The boy behind the counter was cute.  If I was more bold, drunk, or from out of town and hanging out in North Beach because I thought it was the snap, I would have hit on him.  But because it was cold, rainy, I wasn't wearing enough layers and b/c I have a BF, I didn't.  

The slices here are rectangular like in public school lunches.  Unlike public school lunch pizza, this was not raw in the middle.  The crust held up to the cheese and the sauce.  The bread was chewy and substantial yet not thick and gummy.  I ate it with a knife and fork.  I am a lady.

The only downside of this pizza was that too much sauce pooled in the center of the pan resulting in too much sauce at the edge of the pizza.  I liked the sauce.  It had nice flavor.  I just wish I had more pizza to go with it.

I think there are around 50 gazillion pizza places I need to try first before coming back here for seconds.

This is probably the best Margherita pizza I've ever eaten and the Tony's is definitely worth the wait and all the hype! We checked into the restaurant on yelp right before we started walking to the restaurant and our table was ready and waiting for us as soon as we got there and checked in. Javier was our server and he was everything you want a server to be: kind, helpful, fast and friendly! This is definitely a must if you're wanting a variety of authentic and delicious pizza!

I wish we had a place like this in Perth!!!
Best meatballs that I've ever had and the pizza was like no other!
Never really been much of a pizza fan but this has certainly changed that....  
I'm 1 very happy customer that's still currently enjoying left over pizza :)

The best pizza in SF! Good luck choosing a favorite. Margarita is traditional Italy style (yum). New Yorker style is a great meat lovers style. Fig jam with prosciutto, balsamic vinegar and cheese is SOOO good (it's like charcuterie meets pizza). If you love all types of pizza crusts, you're going to love Tony's.
The place is the most overrated. Just regular pizzas as in every other places. Prices are too high for what they offer. Will never come back. Wouldn't suggest even to enemies

I'm sure they have amazing food here from all of the great reviews I have read.. But when I dined here on a Wednesday evening in September, I could not wait to leave! We had a 40-minute wait and was finally sat in a booth by the restrooms.

It was SO incredibly, uncomfortably hot in the restaurant.. It must have been at least 90 degrees in there! A couple of glasses of syrah we ordered were served at room temperature, which was actually hot because of the 90-degree temperature in the restaurant. I was unable to enjoy the long-awaited Tartufo I had been dying to try. I'm so bummed that we were sweating and so miserable that we couldn't enjoy anything. Maybe we'll try carry out next time!

BEST whole in a wall pizza joint! I was there once and I have to go back! My friend Mike and I were waiting to watch a show and had an hour to kill and we were both really hungry, couldn't decide where to go because restaurants on a Saturday night in SF is super busy most of the time! So we walked by Golden Boy Pizza and the smell from there was AMAZING!!!!!! There is a window you can order from or walk in and sit on their long bar. It is not a fancy place at all, but you will  NOT be disappointed. Their pizza's are small but they hit the spot! They have many choices to choose from, so the size of the pizza is just perfect, this way you won't feel guilty for eating couple of 4 slices! hee hee

I aet a pepperoni with black olives, sausage and mushrooms and a combo! OMG, I wanted to eat MORE, but had to walk away...I enjoyed a Diet Pepsi but if you like beer, they have plenty of beer on tab and bottles.

The service was great, friendly people.

PLEASE if you are in San Francisco, check this place out!

Love the atmosphere and service.  Hip and cool.

Garlic clam pizza -- good for the first 2 bites.  after that, ugh.  Gotta wash it down with something.  Sooo much garlic....and I usually love garlic!

Greasy fast joint pizza.   Inexpensive.

Awesome Sicilian squares... Pepperoni and the Combo were all we had, but they were stellar.  The girl at the counter was amazing and was able to multi-task with a crowd that building by the second.  

It was refreshing to see that they gave the option to get a pitcher of soda for the family.

Golden Boy pizza is the definitive place to go for pizza in North Beach!  

I decided to try this place after reading all of the positive reviews and was NOT disappointed. Thank you Yelpers!  

There's something about that wonderfully golden foccacia crust that gets me every time. Thank goodness they don't post the calorie counts of their slices. My personal favorite is the hot-out-of-the-oven pepperoni but really, everything they have is delicious. Makes for a cheap tasty dinner after a long day at work.

Even though I'll be moving out of North Beach soon, I know I'll be coming back for my Golden Boy fix!

Are you drunk? Is it after midnight? Do you want square pizza?

Then golden boy pizza is for you!

Delicious and cheap!  What's the catch, you ask?  Well, you'll have to wait in line for a little while with a bunch of drunken retards, but it's a small price to pay!

Golden boy! Good enough to put up with the drunktards of North beach!

My kids and i went to SF to tour. One of my daughters luckily reserved a table 45 prior us getting there. By the time we got there, took us like 30 mi. To find parking. When we got there it was our turn to be seated. We waited for a while for our pizza. But, gotta say was really worth it. The pizza was super delicious! The server kept checking up on us after and the guys that fill up water, filled our twice after the first. The place gets super packed!!!!!!! If you plan to go, reserve online. And consider time to look for parking.
Best pizza I've ever had. We walked in a few hours after the normal lunch hour and it was open seating. The service was excellent and the food was out pretty quickly. I cant wait to come back!

i salivate over tony's napoletana margherita pizza.  it's honestly the best margherita pizza i've ever had!

be prepared to wait a long time if you arrive during peak dinner hours.  we arrived just minutes after tony's opened its doors for dinner and was quoted 1 hour and 15.  we got seated after 1 hour and 20, so it's pretty accurate in terms of promised wait time.

service was ok, the waitress didn't check up on us and ask how we were doing, maybe she thought we were too busy stuffing our faces with pizza that she didn't want to bother us.

for the 6 of us we got the following to share:  2 napoletana margherita, 1 fratellanza, 1 spaghetti & meatball.  it was plenty for us to share and we had some pizza leftover from the frantellanza.

after trying other items on the menu i would say skip everything and order napoletana pizza only!  the napoletana sets the bar super high that everything else on the menu just seems ok.

Good yet expensive.   Ordered Sweet Grandma and New York bacon potato 2 cokes = $90 with tip.  First pizza arrived room temp, could've been hotter.

Our server was quick and friendly.  

Would go again when less crowded and shorter wait.  

types of pizza:
sfchronicle.com/restaura…
Love it! Pasta and pizza both are amazing!! The restaurant has a long wait usually but worth the wait!

Who says you can't judge a restaurant by the line out it's door? We wanted to see what all the hype was about while walking through the neighborhood so we waited in line. Be prepared to wait for a good couple minutes as all the pizza comes straight out of the oven. These pizzas are not your typical round sliced pizzas, their square and they pack lots of dough, cheese and delicious toppings with the perfect amount of crisp!

Worth the wait? I'd say so.

Previously I was totally opposed to deep dish pizza. It was too cheesy and just...not good. Little Star has changed all that. The ratio of crust (amazing cornmealish crust) to cheese, chunky tomato sauce, and toppings is perfect. There is pretty much nothing else to say. Fabulous pizza.
One of my favorite pizza places ever! Although I don't go regularly, this is a big treat when I do go. My favorite is the Little Star special, wow!!! I so happy they are in my neighborhood!

I was a little disappointed -- the deep dish crust was pretty hard and difficult to bite into.  The toppings were good though.

The best thing was the Movie Star Champagne Cocktail.  Definitely worth a second try to get one of those!
Better than mediocre sex. Go early and avoid the wait.
Love the cornmeal crust - as a Chicago pizza girl...this is my favorite deep dish out there.

I liked this place. I came here after going to the Cal Academy of Sciences in Golden Gate Park.  Yes the parking is little funky and yes it's kinda a hole in the wall.  But the place is jammin with locals (of which I'm not, I came from the East Bay).

We had a cool server who refilled our water. The beer comes in bigger than normal pints. I think they are like 20oz.  And we got a great deal on the happy hour or early bird special.  

So onto the pizza.
Deep Dish.  This deep dish I can really only compare to Zacharys.  I like Little Stars tomato sauce. It's not as vinegary.  The dough is not as crunchy/crusty as Zachary's but I thought it was good. The amount of stuffing was okay. Not over generous, but not skimpy.  Fair, but I would have preferred more.

We also got a chicken/pesto thin crust pizza.  This was okay.  It's not super greasy like a  thin new york pizza which I liked, but the downer was that the chicken was extremely dry.  Add that to a drier crust and it was not something you want to come back and order again.  Had I known the crush was more on the dry end, I would have said order a more "oilier" topping like sausage or more veggies.

Anyways--- the pizza was decent-- I wouldn't call it my favorite but I wouldn't tell you to avoid this place.  But the atmosphere and the service and personnel were fun so give it a try and try different pizzas. I'm sure if I do, I'll find something I like.

We also got a salad. The dressing was perfectly ratioed to the greens.  But I would have preferred less onions.

Oh ! And this place is very decently priced for eating out!!!

I have a theory about this place. You see, the deep dish is so amazingly, mind-alteringly good (especially the crust!!), but I'm starting to wonder if it's just due to the fact that by the time I get seated and get my food, my blood sugar is so low that by that point anything remotely edible will taste good to me.  Worth investigating? Maybe... Either way, I'll still go back to Little Star. It's so worth the wait. Mmm, cheesy goodness...

Tasty quality Chicago- style deep dish pizza.  Even though I'm more of a NY pizza guy I enjoyed it very much.  The crust is very buttery though so I couldn't stomach it that much.  If ur a fat American you would like it, lawl.

Disclaimer: as far as deep dish pizza goes, I'm a die-hard Zachary's fan.

That being said, I have to grudgingly admit that the crust here is actually better than Zachary's.

Other than that, it's good, filling deep-dish pizza.  I'll leave it at that; I'd feel disloyal to my 10-year favorite if I were to rave about this place too much!

The garlic bread is fantastic.  They serve bread with a roasted head of garlic, rather than oily, vaguely garlic-flavored toast.  I'm a huge garlic fan, so I very much appreciate the ability to make the garlic bread as garlicky as I want.  Yum!

I think we ordered the wrong thing.  Thin-crust vegetarian pizza with sausage on half for take-out.  After going, I see a lot of people get the deep-dish.  The crust was not very good, the ingredients didn't seem crisp and fresh.  The area is seedy.  The clientèle was young 30's and somewhat hip.  Many people were getting take-out.  We ate ours in the car on the way back from the Bay and it was very disappointing.  Once again....the crust tastes different, I don't know if it is cornmeal or what, but it didn't have a great aftertaste.
The deep dish, Chicago-style pizza draws me here, the bar keeps me.  Order the classic to get a sense of the pie and get whatever IPA they have.  That's a Tuesday night in the can.

I am a big fan of their Chicago deep dish and their special of the day thin crust. They get creative with the special of the day. Once I had a special with runny eggs and ham and I forget what kind of cheese but it was so good!

Came here strictly based on Yelp reviews and were not disappointed. Sat at the bar, extremely friendly bartender served us immediately. The Caprese Salad was delicious, another couple of slices of toast would have made it even better. Though not big fans of deep dish, based on the bartender recommendations, we ordered the deep dish Little Star. The pizza is all about the crust. We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner. Cant wait to try their thin crusts next time.

very decent deep dish for SF

watch out for the hipsters, though

the juke box cannot be beat
seriously

so it's a toss up,
i would say get the pizza para llevar
but the juke box
makes you want to stay

it's also way too dark to have a normal conversation or
see what you're eating
Amazing spot. Great pizza (both deep dish and thin crust are outstanding), great beer, great atmosphere ... and affordable. Have a drink at the bar while you wait for a table.

little star does great deep dish.  i grew up in the chicagoland area, and i love me some deep dish pizza.   definitely in the company of gino's east, pizzerias uno & due, and giordano's.  
the mediterranean deep dish is really fantastic.
thank you, little star, for reminding me of my childhood.
Rocks!! Fantastic, only please make the place bigger ;-)

Duffman's favorite pizza in SF. The deep dish is delicious. A lame spot to dine in, but perfect to pick up if you are gonna spend  the night chilling in your humble abode. Take on a small deep dish and you will be glad you are on your couch. I guess it could be considered a touch pricey, but compared to the prices and quality of other pizza places Little Star is definitely worth it.   Tip: If you call in on a busy night, and they say your pizza will be ready in 40 minutes, it will really be ready in 50-55 minutes.

Great crust... its all about the deep dish at Little Star.

If Little Star is too crowded try sushi at Tsunami! If Tsunami is too expensive just go get a cheesesteak from Jays!

I've never been a huge fan of deep dish pizza.  Until tonight, I thought all deep dish pizza was soupy... Little Star changed my mind.  The crust was flaky and crisp, there was just the right amount of delicious toppings that actually stayed on each slice while I ate.  I was prepared with a fork and knife and was glad to put them away clean when I was done eating.  I got take-out but it seemed like a nice place, next time I'll probably eat there... if there's not a line halfway around the block...

I don't know if this place needs any more reviews than it has but here is my verdict....2 thumbs up!  Yes its over hyped, yes you will have to wait for a table but its all totally worth it.  Now that you can put your name on a yelp waiting list it makes this place much more doable.  I have been trying to get a table here for a long time only to be told it would be a 3 hours wait.  Now lets get to the pizza - I love the variety this place offers, the different crust options and they allow all pizzas to be modified.  I'm vegetarian and I chose the "Some Like It Hot" made vegetarian and added artichoke and a few other toppings and it was just perfect.  If you love pizza, even if you don't this is the place to eat!!

Came here the other night for an early dinner and was quoted 40 minutes to sit outside. We decided to have a drink at the bar while we waited, and the wait wound up being about 15 minutes, not bad at all considering what everyone else on Yelp was saying about ridiculous wait lines.

Their pizza was super good. My review is as follows:

Sausage and Stout: By far my favorite. Loved the sauce, loved the crust which just melts in your mouth. The sausage was good too, my only wish was that they added more! Or maybe ground it up and spread it evenly. We got about one slice of sausage per slice of pizza, and that one bite would be amazing, but then you went sausage-less for the rest of the slice. The caramelized onions and scallions were amazing on it too.

Meatball Gigante: Oh man I could eat about a dozen of these and be so happy. About the size of a small grapefruit, this baby was packed with flavor and gave you a little bit of a kick. Cooked to perfection, the marinara sauce was amazing. Order it with the egg, and it will be one of the best things you've ever eaten.

New Yorker: With sausage and huge chunks of creamy ricotta cheese, what can go wrong? This was an amazing pizza, and I don't even like thin crust pizza. Not as good as the sausage and stout, but still an amazing staple pizza.

Cal Italia: Three different cheeses, proscuitto, and some sort of balsamic reduction sauce, this pizza had no lacking of flavor. It was almost a bit too basalmic-y for my taste, and the prosciutto was a bit on the salty side for my liking, but it was still good.

Our server was also very friendly and patient with us as we figured out what we wanted, and she was very attentive as well.

I'd go as far as to say that the sausage and stout pizza is on my top three list of favorite pizzas of all time. And I've had a lot of pizza in my day.
Great food.. did not wait long for pizza and pasta to come out..  atmosphere was great.

Good pizza . One of the best I've had not in NY/NJ area. Highly recommend it.
$30 for one pizza is a bit steep when it only feeds 2 people.
Staff friendly and prompt. No issue getting a seat. I would definitely return.

I've been here twice and both times I've had an amazing experience!

If you haven't been here before the menu can be quite overwhelming as there are so many different styles and crusts to choose from but the waiters are very knowledgable and happy to explain all the options and help you pick a pizza you'll love.

I've had the Margherita, Artichoke Joe, Cal Italia and the New Haven Lou. All of them were amazing but The Margherita and Artichoke Joe are my favorites.

Because they don't take reservations, I would say it's best to come for lunch or else you could be stuck with an hour wait for dinner...but trust me it's worth it!
The service was awful.  The GM was very rude.  Will not be dinning there again.  Maybe the GM should maybe learn how to talk to his customers.
Great pizza. We had the thin crusted margarita and it was delicious. And their calamari was the best. There was a little wait in line to get in but that just shows you how good the place is.

The bottom line is Tonys has delicious food and terrible service.  I will break it down to be fair, but I recommend you come here expecting to enjoy your meal but exercise patience.

Service:
-We arrived and talked to the hostess who was likely the rudest hostess I have encountered.  She was very dismissive and when we asked for an approximate wait time, she said "I don't know. I'm busy"
-Server: He forgot our drinks, forgot part of our order and charged us for some items that he shouldn't have (which we corrected) - it was a lot like pulling teeth just to get what we wanted..

now for the positives.. THE FOOD:
-Giant meatball - best meatball I have ever eaten.  You HAVE to order this as an appetizer if you go.  Their tomato sauce is made out of angel tears.
-Honey Pizza - Very complex flavor profile, but I was absolutely obsessed with it.  If you want a little kick to it (which I recommend) get it with sausage.  You will not regret it.
-New Yorker: Delicious, spicy in a peppery way and definitely had more kick to it than the previous two items.  If you get the honey pizza AND this, eat the new yorker first.

I will definitely be back.
Best pizza ever! I definitely recommend coming here and getting the pepperoni slice. If you don't want to sit inside, they have a to go window which is just as great!

Oh my. Where has this place been my whole life?! I came here with 4 people who were from out of town and we ordered a Caesar salad- which was great, a meatball gigante with the burrata cheese- super yum, but basically just a massive slab of ground beef, a napoletana margherita pizza- slightly watery in the middle but so incredibly tasty, and the Detroit Motorhead pizza- so delicious. Basically, I'm a huge pizza fan and everything here was so good. I can't wait to come back.

Late night beverages may play a part in this is 5 star review ... but whatever the case Golden Boy Pizza rocks!!

Not being from the city, finding a late night pizza place wasn't easy (thank you Yelp! gods!). This place did not disappoint and the line outside was clear indication that I was in good (and happy company).

Think crusty Focaccia was the base of the pizza and it was savory delicious. I ate my "slice" so fast, I'm not even sure which one I ordered! Went for a traditional cheese and a traditional sausage both were piping hot and the crust was crispy on the bottom, but warm and moist on the inside. Love it!!! Worth the wait in line!

I always try to stop by this place when in SF and have been here about a dozen times.  This is my favorite favorite favorite pizza place in North Beach/Italy Town. They offer thick crusted, square slices of pepperoni, clam and garlic, pesto veggie/combo, and a red sauce combo. They also heat your slice up in the oven. Crispy yumminess!

Parking is sometimes hard but if you drive around or park far enough you'll eventually get a spot. You'll need quarters as most of the meters are still the old ones that don't accept credit cards.

This is a bar.  I've had a beer here before and it's fun with the TV's but I usually prefer to get my pizza to-go. I say get the pizza to-go, walk over to the park that's at the bottom of the street, sit on the benches or grass and enjoy your pizza.

This would be a 5 star review if the worker that took my order on my last visit had listened when I only wanted one slice, wasn't condescending about ordering 1 slice, and didn't automatically put my $1.25 change into her change tip jar. I ain't tipping you lady!

My (probably not needed but will say anyway) advice for Golden Boy:

1. Realize that you sell pizza by the slice and that it is okay to sell one slice at a time. "Rome wasn't built in a day," has never rang truer!

I stopped by Golden Boy to grab a slice after a day of touring SF's other culinary treasures because I truly love you.

Where's that great service I read about in another yelper's review saying they'll even cut your slices into smaller pieces so you can share?!

2. Don't steal your customers change, no matter how small or tempting it may be. Tips will be given when you give good service!

Perhaps this is one rotten worker in an otherwise awesome place. Here's to hoping for a nicer employee next time I come.

If u like pizza, try golden boy pizza. Small spot, sometime lines r way to long, but might be worth the wait. Go during week days if you don't want to wait in line. Better than the franchise. Highly must try!!!
Really good pizzas and reasonable price. There is always a line unfortunately which proves it's a good pizzas spot. My favorite was Combo. Cash only.

I'm fiercely loyal to thin crust pizza, but, bite by bite, Golden Boy's clam and garlic pizza inched its way into my heart. The thick crust -- crispy skin on the bottom, yeasty and fluffy on top -- is the perfect base for the thick layer of lemony parsley, pungent clams and smell-it-from-a-block away garlic on top. The perfect proportions of sauce and cheese allow the toppings to shine.

I also tried the combo, which was brimming with some excellent sausage and thickly cut pepperoni, but it just didn't have the same magic. It's all about the bright green, truly unique clam and garlic pizza that's the REAL San Francisco treat in my book!

Tried pepperoni, sausage, and the clam garlic.  Enjoyed them all.  Crust was crisp on the bottom and thick.  

Good tap beer selection for $5 pint
The line wasn't too bad, I think we waited like 30 minutes. We had pepperoni and sausage slices, none of which were that great. It was not bad, but I definitely would not wait in line for it again.

I found it on accident. We were trying to walk back to the muni metro from chinatown and went the wrong way like the noobs we were. We got hungry and proceeded to look for a place that was cheep. The place was so small that we almost missed.

This place though small is actually pretty delicious. I had pooped bricks. It was delcious and only a couple dollars.
will go back again soon.

The real best pizza in the city of San Francisco..

One time @ Northbeach, my friend and I are getting ready to party but we need to find a place to have quick dinner. We were driving around and saw this Golden Boy Pizza.. it looks hot and fresh. We ate inside our car. How good is the pizza? sooo good that when a little piece of my friends pizza fell on my car's dirty carpet he picked it up and still ate it disregarding the dirt and germs. Well there goes the 5 second rule.. Haha it's that GOOD...

Really good pizza, served quickly by cute waitresses. It's a different style than I'm used to, thick rectangle slices with plenty of sauce and cheese, and a menagerie of toppings. I definitely make the trek down to North Beach just for this pizza, you just can't beat the price or the quality.

I'm a big fan of the vegetarian, but the other's look really good too. Its nice to grab a slice and walk over to Washington Square and enjoy a sunny day with a great slice of pizza.

My first review on Yelp has to be about Little Star. I can't say enough about this place. If you like real Chicago-style deep dish pizza, this is the place to be! I've only had better in Chicago, and even that's debatable. It's casual yet funky; a great place to go if you want a night out without breaking the bank. Speaking of bank, make sure to stop at one before going in ... it's cash only, though they do have an ATM with a ridiculously low teller fee (only 25c). There's another location at 15th and Valencia, which is closer to me, but the vibe isn't quite there so I still make the trek here.

Great pizza and great atmosphere! My boyfriend wanted to get pizza, as usual, and I wanted to go to a sit down restaurant where we could order a decent bottle of wine.  Little Star is a total package! Get there early though because it is small and there may be a wait.

We order take out here since the place is so tiny and dark inside. The cornmeal deep dish crust is the best! They are pretty good with the timing if you call ahead and place your order; too bad they don't offer delivery....

Absolutely incredible pizza.  The Classic deep dish pizza is really good and so is just the plain old cheese thin crust (probably one of the more under-rated pies in the city).  I know that everyone fiercely debates pizza quality or lack thereof in SF but Little Star is just good food, plain or simple, no matter what the category.  Will always recommend going to share a pie with friends and listen to their solid jukebox.

More like 3.5 stars. The pizza was good, but nothing extra special.  We got a deep dish meatball, ricotta, red bell pepper, spinach, mushroom pizza (it was the special). Maybe we ordered too many toppings, but each bit only had one topping in it.  There was less cheese than I am used to deep dishes having (not necessarily a bad thing unless you like cheesy pizza). The sauce was good, with a nice fresh taste. Wasn't big on the crust. It was not a true cornmeal.

The atmosphere was...bar like.  It was dimly lit with a candle on the table, but was a open room with people having loud conversations. The menu was also half alcohol. I wasn't into the atmosphere.

Great deep dish pizza!

Went with the "classic" which has sausage, tomatoes, olives, and about a foot deep in cheese/sauce.   Very good, and the essential crust was light, flaky, and a perfect compliment to the pie.

For a deep dish lover in S.F., this is as good as it gets.  The salads are fantastic, atmosphere is enjoyable and unique, and the pizza is AMAZING.  Both the deep dish and the thin crust are the best I've had in the city.  This is a must have.
Best deep dish in the city! I've tried Zachary's deep dish in Berkeley and Patxi's in Hayes- Little Star has the best crust by far! Make sure to get the Classic pizza...yummm
Not bad at all.  Deep dish pizza was almost as good as real Chicago pizza.  They had a few beers on tap, the IPA was not so good though.  Doesn't open til 5 pm.

Excellent pizza. Usually I am not into deep dish pizzas, but the vegetarian was absolutely amazing. It was a little dark, but it was a nice ambience. The size of the pizza was good for the price and the house salad was good for two people! I also thought it was strange that it was cash only. WIERD.

I'm in the minority camp here and have to say I'm not impressed at all with Golden Boy Pizza.  Came here around the ever popular time of 11 p.m.  It is a typical spot for the north beach drunkards and homeless which is to be expected around these parts.  

The pizza itself was lifeless and there was nothing to it.  In fact after I had a slice I was disappointed and wanted to eat more ... just not here.  Sure the french bread crust was crispy and hot but  the sauce was lacking and honestly where was the cheese here?  

When I think of good late night pizza, this place will not come to mind.  A boring piece of pizza and a boring review; nothing golden about either.

Pizza. Oh, pizza.

While I love pizza and am convinced that there's no real way one could mess it up, there is a real way one could make it soooooo good. And Golden Boy Pizza does make it soooooo good (imagine me pumping my hips rhythmically while you read that).

There sizable squares of gooey cheese and crispy crust take me straight to heaven. Seriously, you have got to try Golden Boy Pizza if you want to meet me there!

Meh.

Thats how this place made me feel. Meh. It was pizza. Ingredients were there. It was edible. Someone told me i HAD to try this place when I was around. And I did, but I guess maybe I wasnt drunk enough truly enjoy it? I dunno. I guess I have my favorite pizza place and I make all comparisons to them.

Sorry guys. You were just...Meh.

Ok I just noticed theres actually a "Meh" rating. I dont feel it was 2 stars though, so Im not going there.

***Edit***

Ok so The pepperoni is really good. The time I was writing my review I had only had the combo. I guess here, less is more. Ask for the edge or corner pieces. The crispy cheese that builds up around the edges is super delicious.

Oh. And dont sit down until you order. Or you will get yelled at. The memo must have got lost in the mail and I wasnt aware.

Best pizza in San Francisco.

The slices are big, thick crust, and cheesy. I'm a huge fan. I generally get cheese but I've had the pesto vegetarian as well and it was just as satisfying. It's a little expensive - $3 for a slice of cheese - but worth it. Be warned: late at night this place is packed!

This pizza is amazing!! It is one of the best tasting pizza I have ever had. I go here every time I am on this side of the city.
Seriously the best pizza in SF for sure.

That being said, the lines are always long. It might take quite a while to get some.

On a recent tour of old San Francisco haunts we stopped here for lunch. As a  Portland resident I have to admit there is no Sicialian pizza available in Portland that compares with Golden Boy. The pizza is enjoyably olive oil moist with a crunchy crust. The tomato sauce is perfect. You either want to get a single slice and eat very very slowly to savor it or order way too much and stuff yourself. The selections available run the usual gamut - cheese, pepperoni, vegetarian, clam/garlic and a favorite of mine, pesto.

It's a great place to stop by and grab a slice, but if the line is out on the sidewalk like it was the day we visited, you'll need patience. The counter person was cheerful and efficient, but not in any hurry. "Hey, there's a huge line of people standing out on the sidewalk, let's get in line and see what the wait is for.".

3.5 stars maybe?

Came here on a Saturday afternoon around 5PM when there was no line (score!). I've always wanted to try this place, but never wanted to wait in line. So when I passed by and noticed no line, I decided to give this place a try. I ended up getting the Garlic, Clam, and Parsley pizza, and while it was good, I'm not sure if it's worth the hype. I couldn't really taste ANY of the clam, which was a bit disappointing. However, I can see this as an awesome place to go to for drunk munchies!
I felt like i was eating little Caesars! I didn't find taste to the cheese nor the tomato sauce. The crust was goo.
Slices are really big!! I recommend getting one per person and more if you're hungry later. It's pretty much a piece of dough with very little toppings.
GARLIC CLAM PIZZA= to die for! Lol however they don't have ranch haha but all around such fire pizza it's a must try if your in San Francisco but be careful, the line could me around the corner

Getting a pizza is easy. Pizza Hut, Dominos, or Papa Johns can provide you with that.
Getting a pizza in the City is easy. Just go to Portico, Escape from New York, or some other places nearby to satisfy your cravings.
But getting an award-winning Neapolitan pizza from a restaurant that is home to an 11-time world pizza champion? Come to Tony's.

I only came to this place with the intention of trying one pizza: The Margherita ($20). It is a relatively simple pizza, consisting of mozzarella cheese from cow's milk and basil leaves on sauce derived from San Marzano tomatoes (the sauce is a brighter red, and more tangy), all on hand-rolled caputo red flour dough. The crust is light and airy, and as there is more sauce than dough, it results in the bottom being soggy. This pizza is probably not for everyone, as people may prefer to have more variety on their pies, but for the time-held standards it meets (it did win a competition in Naples), it is really good!

I'm truly glad there is a place that serves world-standard pizza within the Bay Area.

This review is for the delivery operation... I've had much better experiences in the restaurant.

Called at 5:15pm, on hold for 10 minutes, told the pizza would be here in an hour (6:25pm) Still no pizza at 7:30 so I call back... on hold again for 10 minutes, only to be told that they had written my phone number down wrong (after they read it back to me) and had been by my place three times. So they threw the pizza back in the oven and delivered it at 8pm. Burnt beyond recognition.  

But hey, they gave it to me free.

We got the New Yorker and it was simply fantastic!!  The sauce simple but complex, the crust perfect, the sausage was soooooooooo good and the ricotta cheese was a little sweet and oh so smooth. I doubt I'll ever be able to not order this pizza everytime I come here!!

Ordered 3 pizzas and was waiting on them for 1 hour. This is unacceptable.
Pizza is good, but the wait and the customer service...
Friendly. Delicious. Open late. What else do you need to know? Did you know they have a school of pizza on site? Sign me up!

Come to Tony's Napoletana if you want to have a full service dining experience, next door they also own Tony's Slice House and serve pizza by the slice.
The BEST pizza in San Francisco!
So many unique pizza choices, it's crazy good!  The gluten free dough is indeed gf.  No issues for me as a Celiac.

As a pizza snob, and a food industry lifer and geek. I love Tony's. Consistently awesome pie. And the best crew you can have the pleasure of hosting you. Hats off Chef Tony. Grazie. And if you're lucky enough to snag a seat at the bar, you will be an instant regular. Seriously. This is now and ever will be a San Francisco institution.

The waiter was attentive and super friendly even though it was crazy busy. The jersey style tomato pie de Lorenzo was amazing, the sauce was perfect. Definitely try the meatballs, great seasoning. I will for sure be coming back.
Want a massive pizza? Order Tony's! Taste is great! Pricing is a little expensive if you're ordering through a delivery service.

There are a lot of pizza options in SF and this is one of the best. Forget just options in SF, this is one of the best pizza places I have been to anywhere. I live a few blocks away and eat Little Star at least a few times a month. Their deep dish is insane! The crust is buttery and delicious. Their thin crust is amazing as well. I prefer thin crust pizza in general but both thin and deep are awesome here. Def. go here on your next pizza outing.
Not many places do deep dish well especially on the west coast. Well congrats to Little Star as they really do a great job of it. Staff just gets it, great vibe. Will come back again and again.

Having just moved into the NoPa area, I had to get into Little Star as soon as possible. Needless to say, I was not disappointed. We ordered the Little Star deep-dish (added sausage) as well as the chicken wings. Both dishes we're very well prepared and delicious. The chicken wings are rather petite - which makes them a bit easier to eat. Anddddd the Little Star deep dish was incredible. I've had Chicago deep dish and NY deep dish, and this was right up there with them. The crust was infused with butter and garlic, toasted perfectly and melted in your mouth. The pizza did not come out scolding hot and was ready to eat right away. Then, to top it off since we couldnt finsish the deep dish, we wrapped it to go and brought it for lunch the next day... and it was just as good. I'll definitely be going back.

Of all the cities I've lived in, this is the absolute closest thing to Chicago pizza that I grew up with.  The food here is amazing but I also go here when I'm homesick and it really feels like Chicago! Thank you Little Star!

All time favorite pizza joints:

1. Little Star (SF)
2. Grimaldi's (NYC)
3. Gino's East (Chi town)

X-factor.......Little Star has world class deep dish and thin crust!

Sure, the wait was long and the service took a while, but that's pretty standard with any restaurant with 4+ stars on yelp.  A bonus was that they put the order in for our pizza while we waited, so our wait once seated wasn't nearly as long!

The food was really good - tasty deep-dish (and no extra charge for splitting toppings - half no meat!), delicious garlic bread (basically a mini pizza, and creative drinks.

Popped by in the afternoon with a group of 9, including kids.  We were seated quickly and attended to wonderfully.  The service was quick and our waitress was wonderful, checking in frequently but not too much.

We started with the garlic bread which one of our group called the best garlic bread she has ever eaten!  Our pizza order was all thin crust (ready in 15 minutes instead of the 30 minutes for the deep dish).  What a great texture.  My husband swore off thin crust years ago because of a poorly done pizza.  Little Star redeemed thin crust for him.

Little star's atmosphere is hip and a little artsy.  It was what we day tourists wanted as we showed off the city to our guests.  It was a good find!

We ordered the little star pizza.  It was delicious, I hadn't tried a Chicago style pizza with a cornmeal crust before but I did enjoy it.  The tomatoes and topping were fresh and the service was very good.  I wouldn't hesitate to come back.
REALLY good pizza.  Their vegetarian deep dish is absolutely delicious!  I'd probably go all the time if parking wasn't such a headache in that area, but maybe that's a good thing lol.
BEST DEEP DISH PIZZA I HAVE EVER HAD**We had the Mediterranean Chicken and I will be back for more!!! Great atmosphere and super friendly workers!!!

Soooo worth it!  

Make the trip to North Beach for this pizza or stumble in on a bar crawl.  If you're anywhere near it, the smells will lure you in.

It's a low-key pizza place with a pretty decent beer selection and plenty of wall graffiti to zone out at whilst devouring slice by slice.

HOLY SMACKS.

that garlic clam pizza is full of flavor especially when its out of the oven fresh and hot. and that combo? DEEEEMMMM SAUSAGES ARE BOMB.

i wish they had an extra TV in there though. oh and ranch. i guess i'll just being my own next time for my pizza. cant complain tho, such a cheap meal but so satisfying

Good stuff.

Square slices Sicilian-ish but soft dough.

Started with three cheeses but went back for a pepperoni that just came out of the oven. Three and a half would have been enough for me.

short and simple: COMBINATION PIZZA! YOU MUST TRY! For the fans of amazing, warm, hearty, generously topped pizza. For fans of food in general, this is top notch pizza. I love that the slices are square!! :D :D With other pizzas, I feel like some bites are subpar because of lack of toppings or uneven distribution of sauce/cheese, but this is not the case at Golden Boy!! Every bite is spectacular, no joke.
A visit to North Beath without consuming a slice from Golden Boy Pizza is just all kinds of injustice all around.

perfect flavors, amazing sauce, perfectly crunchy crust accompanies a delightfully fluffy pizza (not thin crust). Everything about the sum of these ingredients makes this pizza a huge win for any time of day, drunk or sober.
The line moves fast, if you are greeted with a line, do not be discouraged!!

Golden Boy Pizza is about the best that it gets for me.  This pizza has a nice fairly thin crust yet strong enough to hold up all the topping that are quite thick.  My fav is the Calm and Garlic.  It's just loaded with flavor and all ingredients are fresh and plentiful.  Great also, is their on tap beer selection as you enjoy this succulent pie.

This should be a once a week deal for me to visit but haven't been in a few weeks.  Looks like I need to plan a trip to North Beach soon.
Visiting from New York. The pizza is absolutely delicious. Crispy crust lots of flavor. Staff is extremely nice. I highly recommended this pizza shop!!!

GOLDEN BOY PIZZA, YOU ARE DELICIOUS!!!!!

Late nigh grub at this place. its not your average sit down fancy pizzeria. Its more like a bar that offers pizza. the pizza is nicely displayed in their front window and you just pick what you want. we tried their combination(my favorite), pepperoni, sausage and:
CLAM AND GARLIC-my take on this pizza is; its pretty good, its actually delicious, it sounds weird but it works so well. BUT your breath....well your breath will stink, maybe for days. so beware. at the end i think its worth it.

My favorite was the combination which pretty much has everything, the toppings are so generous. this pizza is not ur thin crust or your thick crust, its just perfect, two slices and you're full.
Cool place, good music. Grab a beer and late nite slice. Great idea but I thought the pizza is very ok. Not sure I'd return. Got the 3 stars for the atmosphere. I give the pizza a 2.

Squared slices of pizza? More like squared slices of heaven at a bargain. This place caught my attention a couple of summers ago (when I began exploring the different food options in the city), and I've never looked away. I love the pizza at this place. My favorite slice is the clam and garlic. They really go all out on both ingredients (you can barely see the cheese), and after finishing the slice, the taste from that slice lingers in your mouth, tempting you to order another slice. I love it!

The setting of this place is definitely a dive, open late into the night and the early morning next day. Attracting the different types of crowds all day long (from touristy/local crowd during the day, to the bar-crawling crowd after dark). The music is turned up pretty high (the only problem I have with this place), the servers are friendly, and Golden Boy is always busy with the line to order pizza going out the door. Overall, this place is perfect and worth the time and effort to travel to North Beach and wait in line for a slice.

While visiting a cousin in San Francisco, she pointed out Golden Boy Pizza, stating the she heard it's "the best" pizza in the North Beach area.  On the hunt for grub after a busy day of solo walking and sightseeing, I popped in to grab a slice.  It's a small place, and apparently often very busy, with a line stretching out the door.  However, my visit was on a Wednesday night around 6 pm, and there were only a few other patrons there at the time.  I sidled up to an empty bar stool, and it was on.

I did not have the famous clam pizza, so I can't attest to it's degree of deliciousness, but if the plain cheese was any indicator of overall quality, I assume it lives up to its reputation.  The bartender will serve up drinks and big, fat squares of Sicilian style pizza, crunchy and doughy at the same time (served with knife and fork, if you're so inclined).  If I ever get back to SF, I'm going to make a point to get back to Golden Boy.

I think its the best pizza in San Francisco -- and I've debated the point many times.   And I'm not usually a fan of the Chicago style pizzas.  Plus they have a great draft beer selection -- something sadly lacking in San Francisco overall.
