Great service.  We had a 30 min wait in a Saturday afternoon, the wait ended up being about 15 minutes.  The menu is extensive and the waitress was knowledgeable about the different pizzas.

Tony's is the best pizza and the best spaghetti and meatballs we have ever found in North America, bar none. Get there early, or stand in line for lunch. Or, go mid-afternoon to miss the crowds. It's worth it. The best there is.

This is the best pizza in San Francisco. If you have a night to wait for a reservation, do it. You can put your name in for a certain time, go around the corner to Columbus Cafe for a few drinks, and return for some baller pizza.  If you arrive hoping to be seated right away, you aren't going to be happy. This place is kickin, all the time. Arrive early.

I can't recommend just one pizza, we've tried different kinds every time and loved them all. Get the honey bacon fries, and if you're with more than just yourself, order 2.

Can't say enough about the staff either, every server I've had there has been very friendly and always willing to recommend something.

We have gone 5 times. It is vey busy. Four of the five times the pizza was outstanding. If you like good sauce get the New Jersey tomato pie. Pick your toppings but not too many or pizza will be soggy. So many choices it's hard to decide. I felt the salads needed a little red wine vinegar. Once you find your pie, you will always be happy!
Unique pizzas including excellent spicy or sweet and spicy pies.  Just right size for sharing with a friend.  Long wait times unless you get lucky and find a spot at the bar.
All the hype is true, the best pizza in SF.  The long line and waits are difficult but it is an experience well worth the wait.  Mangia!
So yummy! We had meatballs as an app (AMAZING! We also had cheesy garlic bread again awesome. Then had a New York coal fired pizza. AMAZING. All goodness here

My boyfriend and i love this place ! We used to come to the city much more often but we make sure to always stop by and enjoy some pizza! The service is amazing as well as the food. The only downside is the long wait but definitely worth it!

Great Pizza - I haven't had anything from tehre that wasn't.

Their Margarita is delicious-  just make sure its hot - we sat outside last time and I think the waiter got lost on when our pizza came out and it was not very warm - but I don't put that on the restaurant, I put it on one waiter having a bad day.

The meatballs for an appetizer made me want to try the pasta next time I go back!

Came here with a few friends on a late night snack on Saturday! If you want to eat some good pizza by the slice, go here! The pizza a good size square cuts. I has the clam and garlic which was so tasty! Also, and spicy sausage pepperoni combo.  You have to try it!!! This place is very busy late night and parking will be a challenge but well worth it. I say it has to be one of the best pizza I have ate so far.

medium grade dog food.

Low quality cheese. Decent dough.  Ok Sausage.

The vegetarian was fine.  Prices are OK for San Francisco but $3.00 for  a cheese?  Really!??

I was not impressed with the food or service. Where am I the haight?

Interesting, kitchy kind of feel to the place.  Willnot go out of my way to come back here.  

They are sicilian style, fine if you like it but considering they cut corners on key ingredients like cheese and then charge $3 for it is kind of insulting.

Ribs falling off the bone as to golden boy pizza melt-in-your-mouth.  The hubby has been raving about this place so we were in the area one weekday for lunch & wa-la, its by far the best pizza I've had.  The slices are square shaped & its just so good.  I tried the cheese & the combo & it just melts in your mouth.  The crust is cooked to perfection, not too soft nor crispy.  

Beware: the restaurant is high stool seating only.  Don't bring your kids here, no high chair or boosters.  
P.S.  They also have beers on tap.

Products: (5 stars) Their pizza is just freaking good. Always served piping hot. Served in square pieces bout the size of your hand.

Selection: (4 stars) kind of minimalistic but it works. No hadn't name signature pizzas, bout 5 varieties if I remember right.

Atmosphere: (5 stars) Classic hole in the wall pizza eatery decor. Good use of space to produce max seating.

Customer Service: (5 stars) Good quick service and hot food served on the fly. Ate there, but they also do to go orders.

Final Thoughts: (5 stars) If your looking for a late night pizza fix look no further. Just good hot pizza.

Located in the North Beach district of SF. This place is the real deal. A local favorite serving up four different kinds of pizza slices with a variety of toppings, see the photo gallery! Great beer on tap and a hip vibe, lots of neon, edgy music and a big screen TV, rounded up with sheets of corrogated metal on the ceiling! Super friendly staff!

Duck in and sit at the bar while you enjoy a few slices and wash it down with a fresh cold brew. Hey, I gotta go...I'm getting hungry for Golden Boy Pizza!
Great late night pizza!!! Get in line, order  slice, grab a seat and wash it down with a great beer selection. Perfect start or end to an evening in North Beach.

I was walking by and I seen the pizza in the window it look so fresh!!!
So I try it!!  It was so good. The pizza crust  was not too thick it was just right.. I will go back be for I go back to Vegas..

What's not to love? Fresh, delicious pizza. Cheap, and the line moves quickly. Very casual with stools and a metal counter to eat at, and plenty of pizza condiments available.

I love garlic and I love clams, so of course I had to try the garlic clam. Different and pretty tasty, but be sure to bring some breath mints for after. The taste lingers for a LONG time. Would also recommend the combo slice...yum!

The pizza is AWESOME!!! This is currently my favorite pizza spot in San Francisco.

I went on a Tuesday night - Valentine's Day to be exact - and was able to find myself a spot right at the counter. It was a rather busy night, but I stayed for about 2 hours. I had 2 slices of pepperoni and 1 slice of italian sausage. They were all delicious and piping hot right out of the oven.

Towards the later part of the evening, they turned the TV to Fuel which was showing some UFC fights. That made the night even better.

I plan to return to Golden Boy Pizza often.

MMMM Golden Boy.  I don't come here nearly as often as I used to, but every time i walk by I'm reminded how finger-licking good this place is.  

Tips
* Gotta get an edge piece - crunchy crust, gooey/chewy center
* Pepperoni, Sausage or Both - the best!
* Cash Only
* Loooong lines on the weekends - so beware!

I'm more of a thin-crust gal, but when i'm in the mood for something a bit more substantial, Golden Boy is where it's at!
They have a huge variety of pizza's and the price is moderate as well. I was very happy to finally find my favorite pizza spot.

Ordered 3 pizzas - Pesto Veggie, Pepperoni, and Cheese - for our colleague's going-away luncheon. We ordered it by phone at around 12 noon for pick-up at 12:30. Left the hotel at 12:15, took a taxi, and got to Golden Boy right at 12:30. There was a line but by the time we got to the cashier, our order was hot and ready! 3 pizzas came in 6 boxes and it was heavy! Tasted great and everyone loved it.. wish we were able to wash it down with beer since they have a lot of selections for such a small place. I mean, I've been to Golden Boy a few times before and each time it was consistent.
I think the pizza is outstanding. This is the best pizza I have had in a long time. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
Incredible pizza. It's served in thick squares, but still maintains a crisp and tasty crust.
This place is delicious!  I tried the clam pizza and was very impressed (coming from Chicago).  The staff was really friendly and the pizza came out quickly.  Great spot for late night eats!
Delicious pizza. Served perfectly hot. Great seasonings. Love the neighborhood.
Love their pizza exspecially garlic and clam. Their puzza is so tasty even when you eat it cold or hot.

The crust was super crispy!  There was so much cheese! I loved the veggie-sausage.  Pepperoni was good, service was quick, the slice was piping hot.  Although the pesto-clam was reputable, I didn't care for it.  I'm a fan of the classics!  I'm definitely coming back here.
Pizza is good but like it's crazy long. Mostly a tourist trap but I was in the area and hungry. It got the spot!

Best Sicilian slices in the city!

A little cramped, but I love the oldschool set-up. This place has been around forever, and it has always been great. My dad used to bring me here when I was little, and it hasn't changed much.

Definitely go for the pesto veggie slice..if it's too crowded get it to go, if not sit down and grab a beer and check out all the stuff hanging up and posted around.
Definitely a no-fuss get it and go pizza shop.

Also, usually has great music playing. Definitely an oldschool SF joint that is fantastic.
Great location in North Beach..so you can either hit the bars, or take a walk down to the park and the wharfs.

A couple times a year I make the drive from LA to SF just for Tony's... yes, it's that good! When you crave it nothing else will do! Got one of a limited number of Margherita pizzas made each day, a New Yorker, and some carbonara. Let that settle in and lay the foundation for a lost night in the Haight. If you're a San Francisco local you already know, if you're not, get your ass up here!!!

So Tony's doesn't need anymore reviews that's obvious!  These are my personal tips, I give  the out- of -towners who don't have 2 hours to wait. 1) call in your pizza order to go. (You can do this on your cell phone right outside the restaurant, this drops wait time down to 30 min) Pick up your pizza, grab a blanket, six pack of beer, wine or soda, and go across the street to Washington Square Park and have a picnic, relax and people watch. Don't want to do the whole picnic you can still order the pizza to go and sit at the tables outside of the slice house.  Also stick to the New Yorker it's what the place is famous for. We have tried a few other pizzas  and still the New Yorker is our favorite.
So,I'm here on Saturday night with a friend. We sit at 2 empty bar stools. We order a $30 pizza. Yes, shits expensive here. And there's a bitch of a bartender looking at me like I don't belong here

Excellent. Why go into more detail? Just excellent! The food, the service, everything - just perfect! It was the best pizza we ate while in San Francisco, hands down! We were lucky to have come in when the wait was not an issue! As we left, the line was starting to gather. Go!

Such a great time and delicious food! This place is always busy so we had to put our name in for a table. We decided to sit at the bar get a cocktail while we wait. Well we never left the bar we canceled our table and ordered our food there.Robvell is the most amazing bartender and so accommodating. He made me the most perfect Moscow mule I had two! Tony's Pizza is so delicious we also had the muscles and calamari And we can't forget the meatballs they are delicious! I can't wait to go back I just wish it was closer to where I live I would be there all the time!

I get that this is a tourist trap... but they have like even kind of pizza, and do a pretty good job of it. So if you can get a seat, enjoy! Especially the meatballs, and the Detroit pizza.... the best

Is the pizza good? Yup. Do they have a ton of options and pizza styles? Yes, tons!
Is it worth the 1hour plus wait they also seem to be running at or having to deal with their rude prima-Donna host....hell to the no! Specially when there are so many other great pizza options in North Beach.

If you do decide to wait it out for a table know this: the host will try to screw you if you don't stay vigilante with checking in on the wait list. He quoted us a hour and a half wait, we gave him our number at 7:15 and they sent a "welcome" test text at that time. When we checked back at 8:30 he said we only had been waiting a half hour, when I showed him the text from 7:15 he made up some lame excuse and said we'd have to eat outside or go back to the bottom of the list. Just not worth the hassle for pizza.

We had to try Tony's before we left the city. The wait to get in was just under an hour and well worth it. The Cesar salad was very good and large enough to share.  We chose the coal fired pizza cooked at 1000 degrees and added a view veggies to the cheese pie.  Soooo good! Service was also very good!
The food is ok.. the service sucks and the people are rude. Not worth the wait.. get a pizza from anywhere else, it will be as good..

Heard a lot of great things about Tony's and decided to give it a shot while we were in North Beach. Got there just after 12 and there was already a line of twenty people.

Went inside and the place had a nice casual, but classy feel.  Waitress was super friendly and fun. Now for the most important part... the food.  We ordered the giant meatball with wild mushrooms and cream sauce and their award winning Margherita pizza.  Meatball came first. That in itself could've been a meal. Super tasty. Half way through the meatball our pizza came. It lived up to all the reviews. Amazing crust. Flavor of the sauce was dead-on perfect and the big slices of mozzarella melted on top were a nice touch. Left thoroughly satisfied.
Yum. Solid good pizza. To bad is so far from me and parking sucks but if your out there is definitely a place to stop and get a slice.

The pizza here is great even though they have a few options. There is beer inside on tap and bar stools to sit in case it's cold outside. Friday and Saturday nights are packed with a long line especially after all the bars close.
So amazing, and so cheap! Will satiate drunkies roaming through North Beach just fine

The best, quickest, cheapest pizza you cab get in this side of the galaxy! A smuggler like myself resides in the cheap end. Those Nerf herders of Hutts don't pay well. Pull up a seat and grab a slice for a mere 3-4.50 credits ($)! Meaty slice , so good, so perfect :)

Ill say best square size pizza slices in the city down in old Columbus st best late night snack the only reason im giving it 4 stars is theres not many options around four to five different types of pizza hot and ready even though your probably not going to be picky when your a little tipsy i do wish the have Hawaiian pizza when i come because pineapple do belong on a pizza.
The pizza is always delicious! Although on a weekend night the line can be pretty long outside for a single slice.

So delicious!  I am addicted.  It is not your classic type of pizza.  It is even better on a slightly crunchy dough and great spices in the sauce.  I have a love/hate relationship living a block away.

Good slices with high turnover but not an auteur's effort. Prohibition beer on tap a +.  Bar-like ambience pretty cool although stools not that conducive to conversation.

Great place to sit and grab a slice if you're going solo.

We have been craving to try this place but there are always a huge line and parking in the area sucks! We finally get to try it on Saturday evening around 7:30-8:30 (go early to avoid long line and a chance to sit in and eat) we ordered garlic clams, sausage and pesto veggie omg it was soooo yummy, warm, soft and just the right portion! You order, paid, grab your food, try to find a seat... They have about no more than 30 bar stool seating. Also the bathroom looks like a hot mess BUT it's decently clean maybe because it's early before the drunks are out.. Anyway yes will return!

Pizza is UGH, so good here.  The crust has the perfect combination of outside crisp/crunch and the inside is like heaven.  Always expect a line at night on the weekend along with a staff that has very little patience.  I assume they get a lot of drunk people and don't want to have to repeat themselves 100 times a night.  5 stars if I got a smile from the staff every now and then...but that's rare.  Cash Only.

This is not Italian pizza at all!!
I went there with my roomie (we are both Italians) and we ordered to pizzas margherita.
When they arrived we thought: oh they look super nice! But then we tried them and they were all burned and super thin.
I think this restaurant is overpriced as well!

Wow what can I say other than I am so disappointed in the management for hiring such a careless employee. CHASE, the guy that worked up at the front was beyond rude to my wife in front of other patrons. He essentially tried to publicly humiliate us.

We walked in and we're told there was a 30 minute wait, which is very fair and normal. We grabbed a spot at the bar to buy ourselves some time and get a drink. Multiple tables then cleared up and Chase told us that we were not allowed to switch to a table from our bar seat because of company policy. We asked to speak to a manager and he said he got a manager but the manager never came, it is safe to assume Chase lied. He then proceeded to seat people that just walked in to both the tables we wanted while the manager was allegedly coming over, well he lied again and blamed it on company policy, saying "there's nothing I can do" and walking away.

When my wife and I decided to not order any more drinks, cancel our pizza order and leave for the pizza place next door because of how rude Chase was he said to our bartender (who was very polite) "hey these tourists want to cancel their pizza order".

Another party that he was friends with walked in and we heard him say "guys what took you so long I texted and called you trying to save the table but it got taken". That tells me Chase was holding the table out for his buddies while we tried to switch to it, then he gave it to a couple that walked in when all we wanted was to have a nice meal at a table 2 feet from us.

Literally instead of spending $85 at Tony's we went around the corner and spent $85 at Calzone's and $10 at Tony's on 2 drinks. Doesn't seem like a good trade off for Chase or for his employer. Why employers let a brat like that ruin the company's reputation is beyond me. I highly recommend going to Calzone's around the corner instead of Tony's. They care about their customers experience, and after dealing with the Chase nightmare I can only assume Tony's does not care about their customers experience.

** p.s. Where is the manager Chase? Still isn't coming huh?

The food is delicious and generous portions for the price. We have been here twice and there's always a wait time. Customer service is also excellent although it takes a bit longer for service when it's extremely busy.
I grew up in Brooklyn NY where I thought was the best pizza. Tony's pizza is by far the best pizza I've had to date and it beats NYC pizza for sure. Love this place

Pizza Margherita - a very good pizza - this uses simple ingredients to come up with very good flavors.  They only make 73 of these a day and I really enjoyed this pizza

Stomboloni - this was amazing - a rich dough filled with three different kinds of cheese and baked with a nice golden crust - I really enjoyed this, more than their famous Margherita pizza actually!  

This was a great spot for Italian food and I will definitely go back since I thought everything was great.  My advice is to get their earlier rather than later to avoid longer lines and possibly not having what you're looking for later in the day.  The service was friendly and attentive.

I went there with the Mrs last week and it was an awesome experience. We ordered too much but it was almost devoured anyway
We had the Traditional Calamari which was crispy and very tasty. Then came the wood oven pizza the "QUATTRO CARNI" which was scrumptious. It was fun and fascinating just watching the chef cook the pie from heaven, it and put it all together - as we had the ringside seat facing the oven, which was great since it was cold outside. These peppers which were part of the toppings, oh man,  when they popped in your mouth had an incredible sweetness to them, the meats were really tasty, okay the whole pizza was out of bounds yummy
Then came the Manhattan Calzone - good lord this was delicious. It was oozing with cheese and the meats with yummy
Thankfully there were no complaints of tummy aches as we were quite full, but nothing some green tea couldn't handle for digesting this meal.
The atmosphere was lively, the service was top notch
I will return again someday soon !!

Seven ovens at your disposal. One of the best GF gluten-free crusts I have ever had. Do check out the little Italian shop across the street. Get a cappuccino to go and delicious chocolates, plus you might catch Tony himself.

Good-sized menu with lots of delicious combinations. Might as well look through it while you wait cause it can be a tough decision. Can't go wrong with the artichoke and calamari for appetizers, then New Yorker and Margherita pizzas as the main course.

In a great foodie city like San Francisco. Whenever you park your car in the heart of North Beach. You place yourself in a location that has probably some of the best dining options in the city. If you like great food (most likely Italian), photo worthy upbeat ambiance, with outstanding service. You will find all these things. On this particular occasion I came in to Tony's pizza restaurant. A pizza school on Mondays and Tuesdays, a really cool restaurant Wednesdays thru Sundays.

My waitress Amy was really down to earth. My kinda peoples. The hostess Nadia was super cool and cute.

The hip and popular pizza these days is the gourmet style pizza, thin crust, quality toppings, and impeccable sauce. Tony's pizza is all of the above. Calamari is a must. I know a restaurant is good when every dish that passes by me, I think to myself, I want to be those people over there or next time I'm ordering that!

Is this thin crust, hip, gourmet pizza phenomenon the future of pizza? Well the Old classic Mr. Pizza man or Bravo's pizza will always have a place in my heart.  But Tony's is a welcomed addition to my list of restaurants for my ever expanding stomach and ever expanding places to have an enjoyable evening.

It's Tony's one of the most historic pizzerias n town. Ppl love it. It's fun and casual (cafe). It's nice and classy(restaurant). I think there is a restaurant, a cafe and a  bar. 3? Separate establishments right next to each other.
If casual pizza is ur thing, then try the cafe.
If fancier Italian is ur thing, then try the restaurant. I think there are many better Italian restaurants out there, so come for the pizza (cafe).

Great late night snack.
The clam and garlic was tasty, the pesto vegetarian a great runner up and the crust was thick, chewy and crunchy.

Scenario: I get hungry when I drink. Probably why I tend to yelp bars and pizza holes simultaneously.

Product: Square pan pizza.  But NOT that Little Caeser's cardboard BS!  It was fresh, well-proportioned, fair-priced and different. I had never had garlic clam pizza before but I'm craving it right now.  I should talk more about the pizza.  The pepperoni slices were thick and girthy (gets you all excited doesn't it?).  There were more than enough veggies like tomato, olive and green pepper.  The cheese is prolific.  I like cheese.

Service: Nothing to report other than a cute, friendly cashier.  A group of us tried to order a couple pizzas but they were too "busy." In other words, everyone else would've had to wait for fresh pizza to come out of the oven.  Got what we wanted individually without trouble.

Atmosphere: I don't know, I just got my pizza and went back to the bar.  Cash only is always annoying.

Uniquity: The pizza variety and price were the perfect prescription for my hunger. Unfortunately, there was no cow bell.  4 stars instead of 5 because of the cash and their unwillingness to bestow two whole pizzas on our group at once.

This pizza is fantastic.. I trek to North Beach on a weekly basis to get me a slice (or two)!  It is always worth it.

I love the staff here.. Super cool and chilled out.

Go here and try it!  You will not be disappointed.

Oh my guilty pleasures....

If this didn't make me gain massive amounts of weight in a short period of time, I would eat here everyday.  After almost 4 years in the neighborhood, I've realized that not everyone in the city knows of this place which is bit shocking to me.  Don't be fooled by the dark hole in the wall, the square vs your traditional triangle shape, or the fact that the pizza slices look like they've been out for awhile.  The turnover is high and the pizza is amazing.  

How I like it:  EXTRA crispy.  I would order it for here and eat it at the bar for the optimal amount of crispiness and melty cheesiness... yum!!

Ate here during a bar crawl two weeks ago.

Waited in line and walked out with an open pizza box with my friends' and my slices. Then, the unthinkable happened: My pepperoni slice slid down the top of the box, onto the concrete below, cheese side down.

I literally got down on my knees, crying to the heavens "NOOO!" before looking down and trying to pick it up quickly with my fingers. But alas it was no good. The cheese was so hot it burned my fingers and were melted onto the ground. I felt like crying.

Luckily, another friend was still ordering so I yelled at him to get me another slice. He could tell I wasn't fucking around and promptly brought me my new slice. And it was damn good. i think what it is is that the sauce is super garlicky and the cheese is super cheesy.

Would stop here whenever I'm in the neighborhood though I think it's a little pricey. I could eat like $20 worth of pizza as a snack probably.

Dear Golden Boy,

Why do you not have another location on the central or south end of town?  The clam and garlic is definitely worth the drive/cab ride, but I would certainly indulge in more than a late night, post-drinking nosh if you could see your way to creating a closer outlet...say the Mission?

Thanks for considering!

OK, so there are already 590 reviews, but I have to add my 5 stars!

I love Golden Boy with all my heart.  Wonderful, fantastic, tasty pizza.  Square slices are brilliant (you can attack it from any angle!).  Toppings are always fresh and flavorful.  Cheese is gooey goodness.  Crust has a perfect amount of crunch.

Anyone who gives Golden Boy less than 4 stars is completely nuts, or they don't accurately remember their visit because they were too drunk/high that night.

A great place to visit whether you are just in the neighborhood on a random afternoon, or have been enjoying adult beverages all night at a nearby saloon.

Don't ever pass up a chance at Golden Boy...

This is one of my favorite pizza places in the city. I grew up in Detroit, where the pizza is very similar to this. In fact, this is the only pizza in San Francisco that my Dad considers as good as what he can get in Detroit, and he's way picky. I've always wondered if there was a Detroit connection to GB, but whenever I've asked, the answer has been 'I doubt it'. Unless you're from Detroit, you probably couldn't care less about my fascination, but for fellow former-Detroiters, this is your Buddy's/Louis'/Cloverleaf/Jets' style, and it's very good. The dough is slightly lighter, but every bit as good.

It seems people's tastes in pizza has a lot to do with what they're used to. They had this challenge once on FoodTV between Chicago style and New York style - fire fighters from Chicago and police officers from NY both tasting both. As you might guess, the fire fighters picked Chicago style and the police officers picked NY. I have a hunch that people that don't like GB are used to thin crust California style pizza. I actually happen to love all four styles - Chicago (Little Star is best), New York (I don't know, is Tomasso's NY style? If so, it's my favorite), Detroit (GB), and California (Gialina's, Arizmendi's, Cheese Board, maybe Delfina's, or Flour & Water?, which I have yet to try). All best in class.

Another homerun for a great pizza spot! I walked around the north beach area not sure which of the plenty of pizza spots I should check out and I remembered golden boy being one of the suggestions I've heard from friends.

I went in, ordered one of the combo slices, got a speak easy prohibition and enjoyed my delicious dinner. So glad this place is a short walk from my apt. I will def be back for more.

I was actually surprised about how crowded it was on a Tuesday night there. There was a line about 10 people at one point waiting for a slice.

well I finally made it to golden boys pizza after reading all the reviews and I have to sat
y I've had better but it was good and a nice place to go to think I'll stick to ZA's pizza
Also they had no clam and garlic pizza the reason i went there bummer.
Really good clam and garlic pizza in Capitola Pizza my heart

I love Tony's. By far my favorite pizza spot in San Francisco. The food is excellent, there are so many options no matter what type of pizza you are into. Definitely recommend the meatball to start, big enough to share with a group and a favorite appetizer. YOU WILL have to wait. The staff is not the greatest and definitely not friendly or accommodating- but the food makes up for it. I recommend going at least an hour before you want to eat then checking out the bar next to it for a drink while you wait. My husband loves the Cal Italia but I prefer a more traditional pizza- The New Yorker is my favorite. I also tried the spaghetti and meatballs once and it was excellent if you are in the mood for something other than pizza.

So legit. Yum. Yum. Yum. Had a great salad and pizza. Long wait but well worth it. They had a lot of gluten free options that I literally couldn't tell were gluten free. Thought I was eating the real deal. That good.

A must-do while you're here. World-renowned (read up on this place!  They even took them to the mat in Italy). Be there early...when they run out they run out. The line starts early. Wonderful music and atmosphere. Authentically Italian. Thin crust tomatoey goodness. Wow.
Great food, great service, great atmosphere!! Use the check in feature on yelp! Worth the visit!! We will be back'

I just moved to the Bay Area from Louisiana a couple of months ago. I travel a lot and have enjoyed great pizza all over this great country, but Tony's is by far the best pizza I have ever had. Apparently everyone else in the Bay Area thinks so too! Place was packed! Well worth the wait. Be patient, it pays off big time. Service was great too. You would think with so many people you would have to wait forever for your food. I was shocked at how fast the best pizza on the planet was served up in such a busy place. I will be back!!!!

DINERS BEWARE!
I ordered a St. Anthony pizza through UberEats and received a Di Lucca instead. The receipt from Tony's identified Alexandra as the employee who processed the order for a caesar salad and a Di Lucca pizza. I had ordered a St. Anthony pizza, NOT a Di Lucca. Also, Di Lucca pizza was not listed on the UberEats menu and so there was no way that I could have made a mistake in ordering. What irks me is too is that Alexandra gave me a pizza that I did not order and I do not know if I overpaid for that pizza. The St. Anthony has sausage on it and the Di Lucca was like a cheese pizza with a can of tomato thrown on top, totally not what I expected. I ate one slice and put the pizza aside. I called the restaurant and spoke to Alexandra and was told that she will have the manager get back to me. And of course, nobody got back to me.

Our Uber driver recommended this place.  He said it was on a list of the top pizza places in the country, so we had to try it.  There was a line and you need to be prepared to wait a bit.  But let me tell you, it was well worth it!  We love pizza and this is one of the best we've ever had.  We ordered the Americano but next time we will try The New Yorker.  Perfect crust, perfect flavor and fresh ingredients.  Our kids LOVED it!  Then we topped it off with three orders of gelatto.  Vanilla, Chocolate, and the Expresso topped Vanilla.  Oh my gosh!  So delicious!  If we lived in SF we would be regulars, but this is definitely on our list of places to eat at when we are back in town.

Tony's is an SF institution for a reason!! Their Meatballs are to-die-for and the Sausage & Stout pizza was absolutely amazing!

I think the line is really luck of the draw, but well worth the wait! The ambiance is fun and lively with wonderful staff that are friendly and accommodating. The only thing I noticed was that with the busy nature of the restaurant, the food came out a bit slower than I would normally expect. So, I'd highly recommend an appetizer while your pie is cooking!

My family and I went to Tony's yesterday... WOW!! The best pizza I've ever had. I'm from the east coast and I've had some great pizzas. Love this place and we will be back. We had the New Yorker and also had the meatballs. All delicious.

Pizza was cold, very cold, seems like I got a pizza that's been sitting out all day thrown in a box and had it delivered, I ordered a 46.00 Tony's Napoleons pizza because you can't go wrong eating pizza made from Tony's but ate one piece and lost my appetite thus was so bad I might have just ordered from Pizza Hut and spend 20.00, I always love Tony's Pizza but this pizza that was delivered was just plain awful.

I used to really love this place but I'm starting to think it's over rated. Don't get me wrong, it's still really good pizza, open late, service is fast and the people are chill. But more and more I realize there's more hype here than there is amazing pizza. I.E. the quality-to-hype ratio is diminishing.
Awsome little place you need check it out !! Beer , Pizza is great,  the service is great too !!!
Just had a slice of delicious pepperoni pizza! Deep dish, fluffy, tasty crust! Love it! It's a must visit when in the city.  Worth the wait in line. The staff was nice and cute too! ;) Viva l'Italia!
Amazing pizza. Crispy and square. Friendly staff. $3 per slice. $1.25 sodas. Veggie is with pesto.
Best pizza EVER!! Absolutely delicious and flavorful .. only down side is that it's in a location that crowded and hardly has any street parking.
It has great reviews and I was expecting some amazing pizza. It was nothing to write home about. I had the pepperoni and pesto veggie pizza, it was greasy and just okay.
Small, but lots of seating. If it's crowded, it clears up fairly quickly.  Good Sicilian pizza.  Nice beer selection.  Good classic rock music.  Great place.

Maybe I'm biased because I was raised in Brooklyn, the greatest place on earth for pizza, but I fail to see what's so special about this place. It's just your average square slice. Oh, but they put clams and garlic on their pizza. Whatever.

The pizza is something of a religious experience. The clam and garlic pizza will change your life. The crust is great and the toppings galore. It is a hole in the wall with diner barstool seating with great pizza and music.
Small on space, big on taste.  Good ambiance for good pizza.  Brought the kids with us last time and even though it was a tight fit they loved the pizza.

It's good but definitely not the best.

And with its prices charging per price, I expected a bit more.
Little Italy seemed overall quite pricey and Tony's while it would be pretty good in the middle of Utah; SF?

Not so much

Pizetta 211 is better by my book (And I write books like JK Rowling fyi)

Million different choices for pizza type, great beers on tap, jumping area of SF's North Beach area. This is the place to go if you want good pizza. Nice little Washington square park across the street.

Pro tip: sit at the bar for quick service if you don't mind not sitting at a table and don't want to wait 1.5 hours to get said table.

Tourist trap. Barcelona pizza was soggy, the paprika was absolutely overpowering anything else in the pizza.
Clam bake pizza was an actual disaster, I wanted to send it back but fiancé likes it.
Disgrace for Napoli to have people calling this "Neapolitan pizza". Yeah right.
Good marketing though, they seen to be fooling everyone with their frozen dough pizza

Good experience if you don't count the wait! Came here for a party of 3 on a Saturday night and waited 2 hours. Thankfully the dubs were playing and kept us occupied at the bar. Got the famous margherita, New Yorker, and seafood linguine. Margherita is the one!! New Yorker was good but more on the heavy side. And the linguine was just ok. Next time, it'll be best just to order to-go.

The most amazing pizza I have ever ate.  

I am not from the San Francisco area, and was in the area on vacation.  I wanted to eat somewhere in Little Italy and the original plan was to go to "The Stinking Rose".  After looking at the menu and prices we decided to try Tony's pizza.  So glad we did!

We got the Coal-Fired New Yorker pizza. A-MAZING.  This pizza stated it served 2-4.  There was 2 of us eating and we had lots of leftovers, which was nice to eat in the hotel later :)

I HIGHLY recommend eating at this place while in San Fransisco you will not regret it.  If you do not have time to do a sit down dinner, they also serve pizza by the slice.  This was one of the highlights of my trip.

We found this place on Yelp, after walking around trying to find a non tourist trap kind of restaurant. We had no idea it was actually quite famous. We were so pleased. Sat outside and because were not very hungry, we asked about sharing the Seafood Pasta and the server assured us that it was quite a generous amount of pasta to share. When it came, in two different plates, perfectly balanced, we literally thought she made a mistake, but she did not! They had carefully divided one order in two and it was delicious!!!!! We actually counted the same exact amount of seafood for each person. We were not rushed at all. We have gone back for the pizza and it is also delicious! This place deserves the fame!

This place was an awesome find, I'm glad I used Yelp to help me find this pizza gem.  I wish I could give the place 6 stars.

It was a short walk from Fisherman's Wharf and it looks like one of those neighborhood places that attracts lots of locals.  I didn't have a single slice of pizza in San Fran other than here at Tony's and I can tell you it is probably the best tasting pizza you will find in San Fran.  The GF and I split an original tomato pie w/cheese ($19) cooked in the 1000 deg coal fired oven.  It came out perfect, the crust was cooked but still soft.  Its almost hard to describe how good it really was.  Check it out for yourself.

Oh and I think you can come in and make a reservation and they will call your cell when your table is ready so you can hang outside in the adjacent Washington Square park.  Not 100% sure though so check into it.

We went here around 2:30pm and got seat within 10 to 15 minutes. We ordered two pies - 1) Margherita ($19), and 2) Uncle Vito ($18). The Margherita was cool since there were only 73 made per day. The pizza had a thin crust but was made with high quality cheese. It's a lighter tasting pizza but nothing really stood out. Since we sat next the oven that made the pizza, we got our pizza five minutes after ordering.

The Uncle Vito was a classic pizza made with pesto, garlic, onions, pancetta, and sweet ricotta. This pizza was a lot heavier and saltier than the Margherita. I picked off the pancetta, but I liked the thicker crust. I didn't taste the pesto too much.

The complimentary bread with the three dipping sauce - garlic, pesto, and olive oil was good. I liked the pesto and garlic sauce.

The pizzas are good at Tony's, but think they are overhyped.
Yorker and margarita pizza  and mushroom meatballs awesome .......back again second day

The margarita pizza was amazing, and the cheese and spinach calzone was great! They were the perfect size to split between 4 people. This place has the best pizza in the world, would highly recommend it.

Very good, bready pizza. The crust is almost like focaccia, but with buttery, crispy edges. Great toppings. Fun, dive bar atmosphere with a counter facing the kitchen and beer taps. The clam pizza is special. Give it a try.

Stopped by last night for a couple of squares and it was great! Had the cheese and the pesto veggie. The crust of the pie base is crispy and a little "stiff" (ends up providing a good stable base) - provides a very nice texture element. And the "inside" of the base is nice and soft. The sauce and the cheese are great, doesn't feel greasy at all. Very tasty!

You feel like the ultimate cool kid coming into this place. Walking up to it, you notice all the people gathered around, smoking, talking on their phones, having wonderful conversations that include "I was invited to an upscale swingers party" and "vanilla vodka, happy vicki!" .... it definitely had a certain ambiance I enjoy. The building has a small interior which adds to the uniqueness of the building as well as requiring humans to be in close contact with one another - something one does not always experience. Pizza is delicious, I was told it's Sicilian which means it has two crusts and it's delicious. The pizza is just pizza and it's so good. It's completely different than the pizza I had (The pizza of my dreams, the love of my life in Cambria), it's just simple and delicious and the right amount of greasy with perfect golden crusts. You can write on the walls but I mostly just saw stickers everywhere like "I hella love Oakland teachers." good stuff. Led Zeppelin was blaring while we ate our pizza. Hella cool place. Cash only because of course, its cash only. A place this cool doesn't take credit cards.

Yummy pizza. Nice, hot, and toasted when you get it. Except mine was a little bit too toasted and the bottom of one of my slices was burnt. Thick crust, too. My favorite! Tried a bit of my friend's garlic and clam slice, which was okay, but only because I don't like clam that much. The slices range from $3-4. Cheese used to be $2.75 like it says on their site, but they upped their prices. Still worth it. I was pretty full after two slices. Happy my office is a walkable distance to Golden Boy. Awesome for a cheap and delicious lunch!

Yup, its good, check it out.
Clam garlic parsley is the hit.

A great place to grab a slice in North Beach.  They usually have four different choices ready, if they've cooled off a bit, they'll just pop your slices back in the oven for a few minutes, and there you go, pipin' hot pizza.  

I usually go with two slices of their combination - pepperoni, sausage, mushrooms, onions, zucchini, and tomatoes. Delicious!

Golden Boy = Clam & Garlic RULES!
It's an odd combo, only popular in SF--but once you try it, you'll be hooked!  Their other combos are decent; good mix of crust/sauce/cheese--but Clam+Garlic is the BEST!

I have a love affair with Golden Boy Pizza. It's absolutely delish. It's not like North Beach Pizza or Blondies. It's better! I can't ever order just one warm slice. I have to have two, with a soda. Speaking of ordering, it's CASH ONLY. You'll find that Golden Boy gets busy with people coming from other clubs and bars in the area. I hate that parking is so troublesome in North Beach. I guess I'd drive around for an hour for Golden Boy Pizza. He does mean that much to me.

It is a great place to meet up with a friend or two after work and grab a casual bite.  We sat at the bar and had a slice of delicious pizza and beer.  

The pizza is fresh and done right.  They use focaccia bread with the perfect amount of sauce and cheese.  Lets just say they do pizza right.

Its a comfortable place to have a meal in north beach without dealing with all of the tourists.  

I had the combo and it was perfect.

CASH ONLY

Very good pizza. I finally ate at Tony's and Tomasso's and can tell you where I find their food very traditional italian, Golden Boys is all American pizza. The sauce at GB is awesome, slightly sweet. The crust is ever so crunchy and delicious. Points for the fact they serve by the slice.

Perfect for a day off light food faire as you mozy around the city (e.g. nick's tacos, golden boy slice, naia for dessert). Make a food day out of it people... and make Golden Boy a stop on your journey.
Omg I grew up eating these pizza.. Jus lived up 2 blocks from there.. And used to be like $1.50 a slice..need to go back some day n piggy out..

This place is bananas good and the dudes who run it are sweet, courteous and make a good thick piece of pizza. I had the pesto veggie and my husband gobbled up a sausage...cash only some come prepared but well worth it as it's incredibly affordable for a huge slice.
All are bomb but the clam and pesto is alright. But the sausage and pepperoni well dammmnnn Gina it's bomb! Pizza is my life!

Best pizza in North Beach!  Cheapest too!  Pick out what you like in the window and eat inside at the bar or take it to go.  Wash it down with a good selection of bottled beers.  A simple business model that works well.  Enjoy!!
Worth the trip worth the wait. Just very good pizza for everyone's tastes. Vegetarian with the pesto sauce is awesome.

Stop by this after a giants game and to my surprise wow!!! The pizza was amazing!!! Some of the best pizza I've had in the bay area!!! I had to come nation and the pepperoni pizza squares and boy were they delicious!!! There is a little bit of a line any waiting time but is well worth it once you taste their pizza you'll be a believer after one bite!!!
Delicious! Go for the combination ! Music and ambiance is great. Service is quick and very welcoming .

Good pizza but make sure you don't complain when they make a mistake or you will get an attitude from the front counter. Called a phone order for a sheet & told her would be in at 1pm to pick up. Came at 1:15pm & the girl stated that they forgot to put it in so would be another 10 minutes. When I told her why wasn't ready, she told me to go elsewhere if I'm going to have an attitude. They made the mistake but didn't even care to apologize or care about my complaint. I understand that they make $$$ because they are so busy but that's no way to treat customers. With that kind of attitude, business will start to suffer.

This place was worth the hype.  I let my friend drag me here on a recent Friday, and was disappointed when there was a line as I was starving, but I'm glad we waited.  The clam and garlic was one of the best pizzas I've ever tasted - the crust, sauce, and toppings were just so delicious.  And the line moved relatively quickly, so the wait wasn't unreasonable for a Friday night.  Will definitely be back, and will be recommending it to others.
A must place to visit every time I visit San Fran!!! The pizza is great! The service is great! And the environment is energetic and great!!!

BOMB ASS PIZZA.

got there early enough to get seated within 30 min. had the $15 meatball which was amazing, but prob not worth 15 bucks. you must get the margherita pizza - it's def the best I've had. The truffle fries were also bomb. next time i must try the New Yorker pizza. Will be back!

Worth all the hype. My fiancee and I waited an hour and a half to get in the door, and were almost turned off at the idea of eating there, but I'm glad we stayed. We had the famous Margherita pizza, and it was every bit a culinary treasure it's made out to be. Had I known it was so good, I would have ordered two before they sold out.

I don't often think about my meals past my next one, but the taste of Tony's pizza lingered in my mind for days. I can't wait to go back next time I'm in town.
Tony's is the best pizza in SF.   Great atmosphere.   Fun to watch them cook your pizza in that big brick oven.

Now that is what pizza is supposed to be like!!! Rather cramped inside but the tables outside are perfect (just don't go in the winter :)). Service was perfect and a great wine selection without being 'insane' $$$

Their feature on Travel Channel's "Pizza Paradise 2" was all it took for me to take the mecca back.  The 2hr wait over 2 years later?  Depends on how pouty your group is.  Choose wisely or face mutiny.

Ordered:
1) garlic fries
2) 3 for $5 meatballs
3) meatball, sausage, pepperoni pizza

Garlic fries were enough to share amongst 4 without me being too greedy.  The meatballs were large, moist, had nice structural integrity and not mushy.  Pizza was just as I remembered.  Perfect.

Parking around 8pm Saturday was a nightmare.  I literally said a prayer (Protestant) and found a spot as their delivery guy was leaving.  

Their pies are the only evidence I need to affirm Heaven exists.

We ordered Margherita pizza, the most classic one. The service was good, but the quality of the pizza was horrible.
The bottom was burned literally black all over the bottom crust.
And too wet on the top that we even could not hold it with the hands.
I asked the server that the pizza is actually coming out like this, and he said yes.
I'm so disappointed and still don't understand why people are going there
damn good pizza. Perfect, crispy, crust.

What more can I really add to the already stellar reputation of Tony's not much really but I'll give it a shot! This place is beyond belief amazing! Best time to come here is when your fridge is empty because one meal at Tonys will keep you full for a long time! It's delicious and rich! Cancel all your exercises the next day because this place will fill you and keep you happy!

All I remember about the pizza was that we ordered the special which was some type of beer and brat pizza! Enough said. Just go here and enjoy. I haven't eaten a lot of pizza in the Bay Area and didn't realize pizza could be good here! (I'm an east coaster) but I was pleasantly surprised.
Normally love this place. Total attitude from the hostess today. Doesn't understand hospitality.  It's a shame to have to deal with this.   Clearly has told the server to ignore us.

Took a trip to Little Italy and was looking for a legit pizza place. This pizza was pretty great. The crust resembled breadstick dough, but slightly softer. Flavor was fantastic. The closest comparison I can make vs local spots would be Celestino's in Rocklin.
Garlic clam was delicious. After the first bite my eyebrows were burning from the garlic. Another time I tried their veggie which was also good. I would eat them all everyday. Dangerous place.
Good pizza I recommend the clam and garlic slice and there veggie thick Sicilian type slice or deep dish don't know what kind it is really but really good if your in north beach give them a try

Stumbled upon Golden Boy pizza while taking a friend on a tour of SF based off the recommendation of a sweet lady at the flower shop. Golden Boy pizza is pretty unremarkable on the outside, just a small red tent that says Golden Boy pizza. As you get closer, you know it's different from the rest, though. The pizza at the window is still fresh, the cheese still melting off it. Rock music blasts throughout the small bar-esque seating area, a myriad of stickers and signatures of patrons past adorn the walls, the oven's heat makes the environment warm but not to the point of being uncomfortable.

The process at the cashier is simple: order your pizza, either by the slice or by the sheet (it's square pizzas here, kids). Slices range from 3-5 per and sheets, if I remember correctly, were 48 per. Pricy, in my opinion, but the slices are worth it. I had a Clam and Garlic slice and a Combo slice. At first, I was worried since it seemed like the Clam and Garlic was pretty unpopular - the sheet was still completely full save for one slice. The Combo, on the other hand, was already ravaged through halfway. Oh yes, another note: this place is Cash Only, no cards. Not sure if there's an ATM around.

Anyways, seating is simple. Swiveling bar stools line the walls and you simply choose your seat. Kinda hard to mess up. Seating is definitely limited, so during rush hour I'd imagine it to be very difficult to get a seat inside. On to the pizza.

Clam and Garlic had what I think was the Garlic adorned all over it. It had this beautiful green look to it. The garlic taste was surprisingly rather subtle for a pizza with garlic as a star in the dish. Clams, as you can imagine, were equally subtle since no pizza store can afford to throw on tons of clams onto a pizza. So, I felt like I was kinda just eating a regular cheese pizza with little bits of clams and garlic. But, the real star of the whole slice was the dough. This goes for the Combo pizza as well. The dough has all the features of a thin pizza crust: light, airy, crisp, yet it's a thick crust. It was amazing. The magic of the dough might have something to do with the fact that it's made in house.
Combo pizza was great, it had onions, tomato, sausage and a few  other toppings I can't remember. The sausage had a great bite to it, definitely not your regular pizza hut sausage. Tomatoes and onions were nice and refreshing as well. I didn't add any red pepper or parmesan cheese since it just didn't seem appropriate to adulterate a pizza slice so good.

All in all, four out of five stars. The pizza is in a class of it's own here, skip all those other pizza by the slice places. Clams and garlic could've stood out a bit more, so minus the one star. Really more like half star though, but no option for that. Its grungy, yet entirely at ease atmosphere makes for easy conversation and the pizza is outstanding. It's a great second date place where the conversations can flow freely and the meal is still wholly satisfying. Or, maybe even a first date place if you really want to come out of left field and leave an impression.
The clam & garlic pizza is amazing. It's a hidden gem for sure. Everyone is nice and busy and fast and inexpensive. Quality pizza in the city. You can't go wrong. Two thumbs up!

Been to Golden Boy about a million times. Best pizza I've ever had, and I've eaten a lot of pizza. The place is like this: There are always two guys at the far end of the long and narrow restaurant who are making pizzas nonstop. The bring a tray out of the oven about every ten minutes and add it to trays of pizzas at the front of the restaurant in a display area. Each tray contains maybe a dozen pieces of pizza, sliced into squares. You select the pieces you want and if they're not hot, they are heated up in an oven. That takes a couple of minutes, during which time you pay up and order something to drink. They have a good selection of sofas, including a variety of Pelegrinos. Plus red or white wine in glasses filled to the rim for $5--a great deal. Beer too, of course. Plus the pizza is cheap--super-excellent and cheap, it doesn't get better than that. You eat at a counter on a bar stool. No tables. I drive all the way across San Francisco for Golden Boy pizza. I don't do that for any other pizza, and there are scores of good pizzerias in San Francisco. My only complaint about Golden Boy is there isn't one just down the block from me. That would be awesome!
Just had the best slice of pizza in my life! I had the veggie pesto. The crust was thick, but extremely light and crunchy. And all the vegetables had been roasted to perfection.
The reviews are correct. This place is the bomb. If you want some real MF pizza, get on it.
I looovw this place! Totally would go back! the pizza was soo good. Their pepperoni pizza was the best. I would come back here all the time. I love the pizza.
Delicious and well priced. Have loved all the kinds I've tried so far; always have done carry-out.

I love Golden Boy. I've tried Patxi's (gave it 3 stars) and next on my list is Little Star, but so far Golden Boy is my favorite. Golden boy only serves the napoleon style (box shaped) pizza, they do 4-5 different topping combinations and are cash only. You'll notice a long line coming out of their small restaurant but that's partly because they put their cash register at the front of the restaurant which automatically generates a long line outside. So don't let the long line deter you.

I love the casual/fun environment of the place, their service and of course their pizza. I've tried the supreme (I think they call it the combo pizza), cheese, pesto, vegentarian, and their garlic/clam. My favorite by far was the garlic/clam pizza. I'd recommend that to people even if they don't like seafood cause I didn't think it tasted too seafood-y. The service is great here too. The gal at the register is a machine. She asks very succinct questions when you reach the front so there's no dilly dallying which got us through the line quickly.

As I was finished my first round of pizza's, I was thinking to myself, I'd love 2 more slices but I don't want to get back on that line. The other gal working there must've telepathically heard me and asked me what I wanted! She saved me a couple minutes by not having to jump back on the line.

Okay so to recap: excellent pizza, great prices ($3-$4/slice), fun environment, and great service.

This review is for the Slice House next store.

Very small space, only one booth inside for sitting (the restaurant is next store for more indoor seating) When i come to Tonys for a slice, i usually sit outside. They have extended seating onto the street with around 10 tables including chairs. Great place to stop for a quick bit to eat, or to take over to Washington Square park.

If you're going around lunch and dinner times, be prepared to stand in line and wait for 10-15 mins.

The pizza is one of he best I've had. Thin sliced and big portions! Only problem I have is that a slice of just cheese is $5. I think thats pretty expensive for a slice. I honestly cant help it though, really good pizza.

Food was great but our server Tony was way slow and forgot our marinara we requested. I'd give it 5 stars but service was not even up to par. The guy catered to his phone more than us. Coulda been a jerk but still tipped 15%.

Came back for more, Dec 27th. got here at 1230 and it was a 45 minutes wait. This time we got the 20" New York pizza (with salami, pepperoni, mushrooms, sausage and garlic), it was delicious and 3 meatballs was very tasty. Same from last time: Calamari, Seafood Linguine and Spaghetti with Meat Balls. We shared the cheesecake, it was good, but no wow factor. Great service. Will be back for other dishes.

Woah!Limited to 23 a day, the Sausage and Stout pizza is a must. The dough is made with honey malted stout beer. Toppings include house-made mozzarella, beer sausage, caramelized onions, fontina cheese, scallions, crushed red pepper, beer salt, and sweet stout reduction. Baked to perfection in a brick oven - this is one of the best pies I've ever tasted.

Amazing!!!! Finally had to try it and did not disappoint. Definitely get there early, gets busy. But they were pretty quick told us about 35mins and we got in around 20 mins. Pizza comes out even quicker. The Margherita is to die for but people who need the meat The New Yorker.. OMG. Wish we would of ordered some more to take home. Next SF trip definitely eating there again..and again..and again

Tonight I had the best pizza I have had in SF - I can't wait to come back again.

My husband and I went on a Wednesday and were quoted an hour and a half wait - for a popular place like this, you have to expect that. We walked around for a while and explored the cool neighborhood and were texted for a table after only 40 minutes! How lucky. We raced back and were seated immediately.

Perusing the menu took some time as there are so many styles and flavors to choose from! We ordered calamari to start and got half spicy and half not. The spicy really had a kick to it! We also started with a Caesar salad which was so fresh and delicious.

Then the pizza. This was a hard decision to make. In the end we ordered the Margherita (not one of the "famous 73" they make a day but amazing still) and the Tartufo which features truffles, prosciutto, and goat cheese. Both were mind blowingly fantastic.

I can't wait to come back and bring my family here when they come to visit!

Total fan - I'm not sure if it was the pregaming drinks at Rogue or what, but damn was I so happy at this place.

No reservations and wait was about an hour, but on the plus side they take your cell phone number which allows you to grab a drink in the meantime.

Fried Calamari - great! lighted breaded and the pieces were large and delicious. Plenty to go around for 4 people.

Proscuitto di parma, stracciatella cheese, coccoli - this blew my mind! the bread was like a salty, flaky puff pasty of sorts. And once you stuff it with the cheese and meats you will think you have died and gone to heaven.
*full disclosure: if you tend to not enjoy salty things, maybe stay away from this one.

Pizza:
Sausage and Stout- excellent
Tartufo- my favorite

Coming from the CT/NY where great pizza is readily available at every corner, I am happy to say that I have found my go-to spot for pizza in San Fran.

In my opinion the pizza was unpretentious, the bread was delicious and very well-made, and the toppings were quality and quite unique. I also appreciated the fact that they do not market themselves as "NY style" or "Chicago deep dish" pizza - like I often see done at other pizza parlors. It's just "damn good pizza".

I highly recommend this place.

After much anticipation, I finally got to try Tony's. I was a little skeptical only because the reviews were so overwhelmingly good, but it lived up to all the reviews and more. Even at 3pm there was a 45 minute wait, so we decided to get slices at Tony's slice shop next door. Then we found a nice table outside.

The pizza is incredible! Just as good as New York pizza. The crust is just the perfect amount of doughiness, the sauce is flavorful, and the cheese is gooey and delicious! Their cheese pizza even won the award for best pizza in the country. I am salivating now just thinking about Tony's. Can't wait to go back!

Honestly not a fan of writing bad reviews. But simply put we were ignored by our waitress and the food made us sick..we ordered spaghetti and meatballs and the prosciutto pizza and a bottle of wine. We both got sick that night- like in the bathroom all night kinda sick-and we didn't even share the food. Spent over $100 and I didn't feel it was worth it. Had I know maybe we would have gotten burgers instead.

I guess I was expecting a lot more because of the amazing reviews this place has, but I was really let down.

My friend, my wife, and I came to try their St. Louis style pizza. Being from St. Louis myself, I wanted to see how they crafted their version of it. It was advertised as St. Louis style, so I was sufficiently intrigued.

Starting off, the service was courteous, but inattentive. We had to ask on multiple occasions to have our drinks refilled, one guy said they didn't have any ketchup when another server said they did and brought it out to us, and so on. Kind, but markedly inattentive.

Then came the pizza. I was surprised the maximum number of toppings on their St. Louis style was 3. Imo's in St. Louis, the premier St. Louis style pizza restaurant, lets you pile them on without a hitch. As a result, Tony's pizza looked nowhere near as rich as the pies I was accustomed to eating in St. Louis.

Second, their St. Louis pie had a rim crust around it. Again, not like they do it in St. Louis (the toppings go to the edge of the pie). Another disappointment.

And their sauce was definitely on the scant side. They really don't indulge their guests on tomato sauce.

The only authentic element I could detect was the cheese. Definitely tasted like provel, so I assumed it was the genuine article.

All in all, not a bad pie, but as a St. Louisan, definitely not the real deal. I was thinking of coming back and trying their Detroit style pie, but why when their St. Louis style pie isn't what we really eat in St. Louis?

Come on guys, don't false advertise. If you're not going to give the regional pies of this country the respect they deserve, don't advertise them as what they're not.

I heart Golden boy!! i would have to say some of the best pizza in the city. the crust is thick and delicious, the size of the slices is generous, and you can buy a few slices and take them into columbus cafe and drink a beer or 4 with them

Brick pizza 4 life!!

Little math lesson:
Long Lines ALWAYS = Good Food

The whole crust/cheese/toppings ration is balanced out perfectly into the perfect size slice.  This is so worth the waiting in line.  

Cash only but there's an ATM machine inside.

This place has awesome pizza! It's by far my favorite slice in town.

The slices are thick, square, and packed with flavor. The combos are the best, as they offer a good mixture of veggies and meat.

The atmosphere of the restaurant is a little dreary for me. It feels more like bar: dirty, dark, with loud and rocking music.

There is a high likelihood that the person taking the orders is a cutie, but that doesn't affect the pizza flavor.

Granted I wasn't in Sicily, but I didn't eat pizza that looked like this in Florence. It wasn't what I was expecting for classic, Italian North Beach but that's ok! It was really worthwhile. In fact, nothing about the place looks like Italy. "golden boy"? The decor inside? Nah.. But onto the food..

I was boring and got plain but it had great flavor and was the perfect size for a between meals boost. If I went around lunch or dinner and wasn't already a little full I may go for a more filling option like the popular pesto veggie or maybe just 2 slices of plain.

I'm so hooked. So desperately hooked!

Two slices and two beers $16. Awesomeness!!!

Spent the day wandering around San Francisco and decided to find a place for a quick lunch in North Beach.  I passed 20 different Italian cafes, restaurants, and pizza joints and decided on Golden Boy Pizza based on so many YELP reviews.  

So, a little bit off the main road sits this very small pizza place.  They only serve Sicilian style pizza, with the pizza already made and sitting on trays in the window.  Now, this way of presenting pizza has never really worked for me.  I prefer fresh, right out of the oven pizza. But, I said let's try it.  The young woman working there was great and very helpful.  I got a nice beer and one piece of pizza with everything on it.  After a few minutes of being heated in the pizza oven, I started to eat.  There is NOTHING wrong with this pizza, BUT, it is NOT the best pizza ever!  I have eaten lots of great pizza, and lots of bad pizza.  This pizza is good, but not great.

I appreciate the effort Golden Boy Pizza, but I will not be returning.  Thanks!

Good pizza place in North Beach.

I don't think it lives up to most reviews, but place is good for late night pizza slices and definitely hits the spot.

I give Golden Boy 3 out of 5 just because I can not understand the hype around this place. Some times you will find people standing in a long line waiting to grab their take out pizza slices.

I believe most of the people standing in this line are tourists that have been recommended to try this place out.

I would rather go to any other place around here, theres a lot of restaurants to choose from (see my other reviews).

If the line is short and you don't have to wait you'll find cheap beer and great slices to an affordable price. My recommendation is to go for the clam & garlic or the veggie. The Combo slice is subpar compared to the others.

Very very good Sicilian/Chicago style pizza.  Good atmosphere and plenty of choices.  More of a local backdoor feel to it than the tourist "get your slice right here" pizza joints all along NB.

The only thing that prevents me from giving them five stars was the difficult I had getting service and the fact that I was blown off by a server on a not so busy afternoon.  

Other than that it was a great experience and I recommend it to all that visit SF.

A+++++++
clam and garlic pizza mist have. combo is good too. great crust.

We waited in the line it wasn't so bad. We were seated and it wasn't long before we were knee deep in a pizza that didn't seem as special as the line made it seem. I have had better pies but also far worse! The prices were fair by Bay Area standards. A proper end to a late night of exploration

Tony's serves any kind of pizza you can imagine. If there's a variation you're looking for which deviates from the usual SF "hunk of bread with cheese on it," this will provide the reprieve you need. They serve so many varieties, all cooked at different temps with different types of crust.

I'm a sucker for Guinness anything, so my friend and I tried the Guinness crust, which uses the frothy beer to activate the yeast. The crust ends up being bubbly and delicious. I think there was prosciutto and cheese on it. Blew my mind.

We had a large group here and everyting was perfect!
People and the product are the keys to sucess and they
have both down pat.
I will be back regularly!

This is the best pizza in SF. Must give it a try . Make sure you don't go there too hungry because the wait is usually over an hour- they don't take reservations . Must order the meat balls yum . Favorite for sure . Street parking is hard to find you are better off taking public transportation or an uber .

Any one of their pizzas may not be "the best" pizza --- although all the ones I've tried have been excellent and I especially enjoy the Trenton style --- Tony's has a large and diverse selection of top-notch pizza and therefore may be the best overall pizza restaurant in the world.

Come on its Tony G - If you've read his book the Pizza Bible you know this guy is pizza royalty. I've also visited his place in Vegas. Tony G knows pizza and keeps his place running at 100. The neapolitan marg is EXACTLY the way they make it in the old country. I think with this review, less is more. Letting the pizza speak for itself on this one.
Delicious, great pizza, it was so cold and they sit us outside with out a heater, because they''were fully committed '' . But we just one it to try this places and it was good, good services.
Hands down, The New Yorker pizza is the BEST pizza I've ever had.  Perfect combination of pepperoni, spicy sausage and pockets of ricotta cheese! Buy it, you won't regret it!

We came back three times before finally got a table ( came 15 min after they opened and got the last table available). We tried their margarita pizza and it was officially the best pizza I have ever eaten. Definitely recommend even though the wait time can be up to  3 hours.
Hands down best pizza I've ever had. Wow this was good. Had the Prosciutto and arugula pizza. This is the way pizza should be.
I'm a pizza snob and usually like thin "ny style" pizza, but this Sicilian style pizza is incredible!

Pizza was tasty, crust was thick n' crispy. Didn't get to try the clam pizza, but maybe I'll come back.

Best part of my visit was watching these drunk, wealthy folks order 2 pizzas through the service window. Fifteen minutes after they order, they drunkenly start complaining about not having their pizzas. Their pizzas have to take at least 30-40 minutes to bake. After they were told the pizzas needed more time to cook, they start complaining even louder and insulting the dude working the counter. This dude tells the drunk people to be quiet or he will have to shut the window. This causes one of the girls in the group to start yelling louder and faster and she got the window was shut on her. One of the other people in the group comes inside and starts complaining about how their pizzas are taking too long and they should just give them the pizzas. The guy working the counter lets this girl rant and when she's done, like a total badass, tells her "Do you really want a half cooked pizza?" She says "YES." "REALLY?? YOU WANT.. A HALF COOKED PIZZA??" "YES." They got served half-cooked pizzas. Which they then proceeded to eat. What the fuck is wrong with some people??

'Tis my second time to the Bay area and only my second time to Golden Boy Pizza--how come? On my last trip--almost a year ago--I ended with pizza slices from Golden Boy, which left a great last memory. Now that I am back, and it is the start of my second trip, I begin with their pizza slices.

If you looking to grab a (very) late night bite or some dinner to go--they're open late!--Golden Boy Pizza is a great place to go if you are in the North Beach area, in my opinion. I do not think you can complain about the price and the quality of the pizza. I will however try to make it earlier next time so I can grab a beer.

The toppings--your meats, red sauce, cheese, veg etc.--are set atop a slightly thick, but light, soft, and moist crust. I must note that the veg has always looked and tasted very good.

A few notes and echoing as made by other Yelpers: it's cash only; don't be going in expecting a New York-style pizza; there can be a line--in other words, just be prepared. As a parting thought, I would suggest giving this place a try and see if you like it.

i'm not in North Beach often, but when I am, I almost always make it a point to stop by at Golden Boy for a quick slice or two of pizza. I live in the Haight so I frequent Escape From NY pretty often, which I also enjoy. But man.. if Golden Boy had a joint in the Upper Haight.. yeah. I'd probably make it my go-to quick grub spot.

There was a wait only one person taking orders and 3 employees watching her. Place was so small one could not even walk through the place without bumping onto other people. Seating was limited  and very tight facing wall. Pizza was bland lack of taste. It is located in a mostly Italian part of the city. My tip. Don't waist your time standing in line with so many other pizza joints in the area
Good, thick pizza. Stopped here late at night and there was a line of people waiting. I figured it must be a good place. I will be back.
Not very flavorful reminded me of elementary pizza back in early 90s. It wasn't horrible but wasnt as good as I expected its great for late night drunk munchies. Service is excellent
Quick stop in for slice, can be super crowded though. Cash only and limited menu but great pizza.
Fast service, humble front desk man, and amazing pizza! If you're looking for great pizza in SF, this is a must place to go!
Love the square pizza. Great flavor perfectly cooked. We try to get by every time we're in San Francisco!

Solid piping hot deep dish style pizza. Open fairly late. Cool dive-y atmosphere with a sprinkle of hipster. Great grab and go and sit down. Some of the staff have a little sf smug-atude but in their defense, they do have to deal with drunk people in north beach late night.

the BEST pizza but the service has went down.  my family would go to san Francisco all the way from Manteca  every weekend to get pizza here and now we barely come because the new pizza ladies don't heat the pizza correctly and aren't friendly.  When Laurie was there the pizza was always prepared correctly and the service was great. now if e go there we take our pizza all the way home which is about an hr away and we heat it up our selves.

This place by far has the best pizza EVER.
It's a great place to kick back and grab a beer, and pizza.
Definitely our favorite pizza spot in San Francisco!
A little bit on the pricey side $2.99-$3.99 but most definitely worth it.

I absolutely love this pizza joint. Their garlic & clam pizza is to die for. Only thing is that it's usually all gone by the late evening, but they have a veggie combo that's pretty tits too.

They have a good beer selection and it's relatively cheap for what you get (Note: ask the guys to warm up the pizza until it's a little bit crispier). Staff is kool and not that big of douches go there.
What I really love about this place is they all ways have sports playing which is perfect if you just got off work and you wanna catch a game, brew, and a slice!!

Fun and simple pizza.
Not a big menu, not a big price.
Your sitting in a pizza nook in San Francisco, you arnt going to forget that when you are here.  The smell is perfect, taste amazing.
Its fresh, its young, its hot.

One of the best places in north beach to get a quick cheap slice and drink a good draft beer.

Great ambiance when you sit at the bar.

I promise to keep this one plain and simple.
"GOLDEN BOY... I F#@king LOVE YOU!"

Amazing pizza!   A friend and I just happened to walk by this places and saw a long line and we stopped to look at the pizzas in the window.  We weren't even hungry but waited for half an hour to get a slice of heaven!

The dough is just right, not to heavy or packy.  Loved the combo pizza!

Fantastic pizza with the perfect crust. Nice and light, not doughy, and a bit crisp around the edges. Amongst our family we ate sausage, pepperoni and combo slices. It's a very cramped location, but we found seats along the wall (where you sit literally face and knees to the wall). But since we were hungry and enjoyed the pizza so much, the location didn't bother us. In fact, it gives it a bit of personality. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. Based on the line that formed behind us, it's obvious there are a lot of repeat customers. Wish there was one of these in San Diego.
Will spare you technical comments; just enjoyed the overall experience. Make more veggie pizza, Golden Boy!

This place has a long wait on the weekends and they don't take reservations. We had a 45 minute wait so we ran to go get coffee and when we came back to our table they wouldn't seat is until we had either finished our beverages or three them away which I thought was pretty bizarre...

The pizzas come out very fast and they are pretty good. Not the best I've ever had in my life but definitely good quality pizza. We got the margarita and one with spinach garlic and ricotta...which we didn't realize didn't have any sauce until it came out...oops.

The salad was honestly the best part of the meal. We got a Little Italy to share between three people and it was delicious and light.

I was a little disappointed with the place overall considering the crazy hype surrounding the place but overall it's a solid 4 out of 5.

This is a terrible place, I waited more than they told me to, also I was removed from the waiting list! People who came after us got a table before us!
The attendance is awful!
Great pizza!  Got the New Yorker with fried artichokes and green beans.  Delicious!!  Will come back bvb the next time in SF.
Best Pizza in SF!!! We ordered the New Yorker and the Americano and both are very delicious!!!

I would wait two hours for this, I would come back to SF just to eat here, etc etc it's that good.  The only thing I'm sad about is that there were only two of us so we only got to try one pizza.  Went for the fried dough app and the New Yorker pizza.  Worth every damn calorie!  They kindly take your phone number and text you when your table is ready so put your name in, grab a flight of tasters at Rogue and wait the damn two hours! You won't be disappointed.

YUMM!!!  Tony's is as good as it sounds.   We went on a slow day, got a seat at the bar and were waited on right away.  The bartender was very helpful and gave us suggestions on what to order. I can't remember his name but he was great. They all were actually. We will be back!!  We had pizza but the people next to use had a side of meatballs which looked amazing.
Small place but delicious food.  Worth the wait in line. We had a pizza, garlic bread and meatballs and all were delicious.
