An hour and forty five minute wait? Are you shitting me??  My friend assured me it was worth it. Skeptical as I was I agreed to wait.  We found a great little Irish Pub down the street had a coffee and just about an hour and thirty later I got the text that our table was ready.
We lucked out and scored a table outside and it was an absolutely gorgeous day!  
We ordered an obscene amount of food, which I feel is appropriate when you wait that long for a table.  We started with Meatballs, fried green beans, and fries. I cannot accurately convey how tasty the meatballs were. The closest I can get is to say - they are life changing.  Seriously, order them.  The fries were the unhealthiest-tastiest fry I think I've eaten.  There was fat, bacon, crispy potato goodness.  The green beans were good but got lost among the other apps. Oh Cheesus, we ordered calamari too. We did a half half order and damn glad we did!  The spicy calamari kicked my ass, if you like spice make sure to order them.  
So this is a pizza place right?  Next up was the reason everyone goes to Tony's - The Margherita.  We got 2 for the table which was plenty since we ordered our weight in apps but if you are just ordering pizza I would get 1 per person.  It was totally worth the wait.  The sauce, the crust, the cheese, all of it perfect!  I don't know how I managed to eat 2 pieces after everything else I consumed (and 2 cocktails) but that should tell you how good it is!

Color this girl impressed.  I can't wait to wait to go back!

This is probably one of the best pizza places I've ever eaten at.  In fact, I can't think of any other that comes close.  While there are pizza places which have one type of great pizza, Tony's has several different ovens (like 6 or 7) and thus many different types of pizza and crust.

We've eaten there at least 20 times and we've tried almost every type of crust they have - all phenomenal.  My family loves the New Yorker and of course their Margarita Pizza is great.  Recently, we've also come to love the new Sausage and Stout which is a non traditional pizza, but still incredibly tasty.

The service is great, they never rush you through and you can enjoy a nice dinner.

They don't take reservations, so you have to put your name on the list.  As long as you're a party of five or under (I think they only have two tables that can sit 6 or more), you don't usually have to wait more than 60-90 minutes.  So, just come early, put your name on the list and then go enjoy a drink nearby at Tony Nik's or one of the other nice bars in the area.  They text you when your table is ready so you don't have to stick around (but you do only have five minutes to get there after they text, so don't keep a tab running wherever you go or be prepared to close it ASAP).

Jules is the wine director there, and she does a great job - all of the wines go well with the pizza.  The cocktails are great and refreshing.  The food is consistent and incredible.  We love this place and honestly it's one of the best restaurants I've eaten at in SF - great food, large portions, reasonable prices, and great service.  

Cielo and Sarah are two of the hostesses there and always do a great job, despite all of the unpleasant people who get upset that they have to wait or that they have to wait an extra long time to seat a party of 10.  They're super friendly and it always feels great to be greeted by their smiling faces.

I first heard about this restaurant through the food channel, and I took note of it because I knew I would be coming to SF. Some of the reviews on this place are pretty discouraging, but I feel like that's just because of super high expectations for Tony's to have a perfect pizza.

My boyfriend and I got in line about 15 minutes before they opened, and we got the last table inside. There are also tables outside, but the cold won't matter because they have heaters. We ordered the Meatball Gigante with marinara sauce and the Margherita pizza. The meatball came out within 5 minutes of ordering. It is a must try! The meat was perfectly soft and the marinara sauce was absolutely amazing. It was probably the best marinara sauce I've ever had. They only make 25 of these a day so I definitely recommend heading there early and trying one of these. The world's best pizza, the Margherita, was also very delicious. The flavors that come from the tomato sauce, mozzarella, basil, and olive oil are combined extremely nicely with a very unique taste. It's definitely unlike any pizza I've ever had and I would definitely get it again. And they only make 75 of these a day. The only part I didn't like about the pizza was the crust, which was kind of burnt and I didn't like the taste on my tongue, but like I said, I wasn't expecting a perfect pizza, especially since I'm sure it wasn't Tony himself in the back making the pizzas.

If you're ever in SF, it is definitely worth a try. Get there about 20 minutes before they open and you can go right in when the doors open. It is a little bit on the pricey side, but nothing over the top. This meal was very satisfying!
The best pizza I had so far. We were there during the north beach festival. Even with the huge crowd the service was prompt and great! The pizza was fresh and tasty.
Pretty decent pizza. Long lines always.. worth it?  Ish. If there wasn't such a long wait isr say yes, but for the wait, I'd say no.  Pizza is good, not life altering.

My boyfriend and I smelled how good it was and made it definite must. The pizza was perfect with a thick crust and real Italian sausage. After getting one slice for dinner, and bar hopping a bit, we actually ended up going back for another piece! They have some great beers on tap too.
This place is awesome... Recommended by our driver Tony from the Big Red Fire Truck Tour Company.  Pizza is one of the best we have ever had!

Great pizza, very unique pan style with lots of flavor.
The staff is very friendly and kind! Way to go!
The only downside to this place is it's small and you might not get a seat. Other than that... good beer selection, great ambiance, and fantastic pizza. I especially like the clam and garlic.
Listen to Buzzcocks, The Ramones, and Fugazi while eating bomb pizza. Excellent.

Some of the best pizza I've ever had. Topped off with lovely staff, a great beer selection and dive bar decor. We went with a friend from Northern Italy who confirmed that the quality was top notch. If you are in San Fran and don't eat here, you are a stupid moron.

So good! $3.75 for a decent "square" Had the garlic clam pizza slice! Yummy! Highly recommend! Hubby had the pepperoni! Almost wanted to order another "square" but knew it would of been too much! The only down fault was they didn't have black ice-T.  Definitely worth searching for. Its on Green St cross St Jasper! Crust thick but crunchy! Cash only no credit cards!
Great Pizza! We ate there twice while we were in San Francisco because it was the gem we found while on vacation. The slices are HUGE and service is friendly.

From the bartender to the pasta this place can't be beat. Smaller place but the food is to die for. We jumped off the Grey line bus while sightseeing. The guide recommended it and we went in.
They know what they are doing. Freshly made pasta, homemade salad dressings. Ever just walked into a place and knew that you were going to get a great meal?  This is the place.
Service was great. Wife dropped her knife and before she could reach down there was a server with a new one.  
Go... You won't be disappointed.

This place is SO COOL.  

I like the layout - it's casual yet clean and well thought out. Being seated at the bar for dinner was a different experience, but in a good way.  There was just enough room for the dishes, and the bartender and servers were very pleasant. They have a large bell and baton hanging from the glass behind the bar; details like these make restaurants so much more interesting!

The Margherita pizza was simple and light, but also flavored just PERFECTLY.  The NY Sausage & Pepper pizza was a bit more bold and salty, but also good. Both were delicious, in very contrasting ways.  I love this place, and can't wait to go back to try more!

My italian co-worker invited us to go to this place for dinner to celebrate her birthday.  She's a big fan of pizza and heard good reviews about this place.

First, it's hard to find parking around the area.  But if you're a local you should know that ...knowing the place is a tourist area.

The host was really nice and even offered to call me since it will be a 40-min wait.  We ended up sitting at the bar for shots while we're waiting for our table.

We ordered the marghareta pizza and the SF sicilian pizza with the walnut/balsamic salad and wine.  The salad itself was really good.  The pizzas were good as well.  I love the foccacia, arugula and prosciutto combination in the sicilian pizza.
The customer service was good.
I'm not too familiar with pizza but I appreciate a good pizza.  This place pizzas were definitely good.
I was happy after leaving this place.  If I'm around the area (not driving) I may come back here and try their other dishes with my hubby.

4.5 stars (has to deduct 1 for the lack of crispy crust)
1 hour 40 min wait for a table on a Sat night= take out!
Margherita (award winner) dough was sold out so we got the 4 cheese.

Cheese=A++
Sauce=A+
Dough=C
Maybe the dough wasn't cooked long enough, but i like mine thin and crispy- NY style and the crust was def. lacking, not crispy, it was quiet unfortunate, although there are no words for how frekin DELICIOUS the CHEESE was- you could tell they really put 4 different cheeses in it and it was sooo flavorful, not bland like plan mozzerella..AND they put a tremendous amount of cheese- it was falling off the pizza when i picked up a slice.

Bottom line: I'll be back, probably earlier in the day so i can try the dough on their famous margherita. Take out, the ambiance is not worth the wait. The pie is small- think 2 people and you may want an appetizer.

Woohoo! First to Yelp! A word to the inevitable critics for my claiming the 1st to Review Title: I won a golden ticket for the soft opening, so I really did go and try the food, it isn't mere speculation.
So, what can I say? It's Tony's. What would you expect from Mr. Gemignani? Anything less than perfection? Of course not!
Tony will open this little gem next to his already famous Pizza Napoletana restaurant this Friday to the public. It's a walk in place for people on the go. As you walk in you will see the huge coal fired oven just in front of you and the other huge oven (he brought that one in from Texas I think) to the left. You can order a custom pie or a true Chicago beef sando (disclaimer: they were only alloting one item per golden ticket, the wife is a vegetarian, so I sadly could not try the beef sando. I spoke to someone who was enjoying one though who said it was "awesome"). We ordered a half cheese / half pepperoni thin crust from the coal-fired oven. It did not disappoint. It's all about the sauce here, folks. He slathers on a generous amount of potent, semi-spicy sauce that is just perfect. The crust couldn't be any better, and of course the cheese is cooked perfectly.
If you're in a hurry, go here. If you have more time, go next store to his sit down restaurant. In my opinion, it's the best pizza in SF, definitely this side of the Mississippi, and arguably in the country, although I know personal tastes vary and this will be a hotly debated topic for the forseeable future. In my camp though Tony reigns King, and I consider myself blessed that I am fortunate enough to live in SF and partake in his creations whenever I want. Oh, and one last thing - Respect the Craft!!

Our service could've been better (we ordered two pizzas for our party and they were delivered 15 minutes apart), but the food was amazing.  The deep-fried string beans are a great appetizer, and our two pizzas (Primavera Classic Italian and Margherita) were among the best pizzas ever. The crust is perfect, the toppings are fresh and the sauce explodes with flavor.  Worth the wait to get in!

We've been back several times, and while service is never superior, the food is consistently great.  The last time, we tried the Gorgonzola truffle fries, and it was like an orgasm for my taste buds.  So good!

The Margherita pizza is indeed the best (and thinnest) I've had. Better than Delfina, which was good but not memorable.

We also had the New Yorker, which was good, but I wasn't a huge fan of the globs of ricotta cheese on the pizza (it did grow on me as I was eating it).

The meatball appetizers were awesome, the calamari was good (but I'd order one of the salads next time), and the truffle fries were disappointing. It was my first time having truffle fries, so maybe it was just me.

Overall a good experience, but the wait was a little annoying (we waited for at least 45 minutes). No reservations accepted, but I heard that if you go in the same day and tell them when you'll be coming, they'll try to accommodate you.

Oh, and the bar seating is first come first serve.

I'm giving it 3 stars paritally b/c I think the hype is too much, AND I several gripes about this place unrelated to the food or ambiance.
1) WHY is there no separate yelp listing for the slice place next door?
2) Why is there no online menu for the slice/sandwich place next door?
3) The website is annoying with the musical intro, I bet NO ONE ever uses it and skips it, just a stupid idea, intros and music on website are just plain annoying, WHY does anyone approve such lame website design?

I went to the slice place next door. The slice was very good, but not better than Village or Arinel (though they do get a point for the small pepperoni they use - like Amici's pepperoni)

The prices for the slices are too high and I think the prices for the other things like sandwiches and calzones are too low (AGAIN this is at the slice place next door. My pepperoni slice was $4. The meatball, mushroom calzone is listed at $6, OR you can get baked ziti WITH a soda for $6.... it just seems like a pretty big disparity.

All in all I do want to come back for the chicken parm sammy that was rated super yummy by one of the food blogs I read. Maybe I'll give it another star then.

Really freaking awesome pizza. The Margherita pizza was up there with some of the pizza I've had in Italy. Cool little place in north beach, good service, and amazing pizza. I should try other menu items so I'll definitely be back.

Since I've written this review I've been back a couple times and gone to their take out window for a slice. The meat lovers and pepperoni - classics  - are so good. It's some of the best pizza in the city with out a doubt.

Perfect day in the City (after many rainy days), stopped and grabbed a slice then sat outside and soaked up some warm sunshine. Nice little tiled tables on the sidewalk on a wooden deck built over the sidewalk make for easy casual lunch. My cheese slice was nice and cheesy that I could fold in half with my paper plate just like when I'm in NYC....oh so happy! Didn't have to wait long on a Saturday afternoon (even though I do love the restaurant). Next time I want to try the Veggie pizza, but alas they were out. So had to suffice with cheese, which was equally fulfilling washed down with some sparking water. Happy to have a quick choice for pizza now, but will always "heart" the restaurant.....but if your on the go, this is the way to go!
Golden Boy pizza was delicious. Tasted fresh, service was prompt, and I love the open kitchen. The staff could have been friendlier but other than that, everything was great.
Great pizza and great beer selection. I had the garlic and clam, and the pepperoni. Looking forward to going back to try more.
Delicious! Yum! Favorite pizza in the city. I always bring friends here to show them great North Beach and SF pizza. The employees are always nice :-)

Clams..garlic...pizza...uhhh what??
it works, its easy to eat (finished it in 2 min -_-) and best after a night of drinking
Solid pizza for the line and price after a long night out.

This was on a whim finding this place, but I'm so glad we did!! I ordered a slice of pepperoni and a slice which I thought was pesto pizza. As I started eating the "pesto" slice it tasted really funny I figured the spinach was rotten lol it wasn't at all it had clams on it! For someone who loves seafood this is the slice for you, but since I am allergic to shell fish this wasn't a good choice. Nevertheless Max was amazing and switched out my slice for something else so sweet!!! Deffinatley coming back!!

Not your typical slice of pizza pie, it's a square crustless pizza slice. It's absolutely delicious though!! I tried the vegetarian pesto and pepperoni and they both tasted great. My meat loving husband even liked the pesto
Favorite pizza spot in the city! Clam and garlic is to die for. The perfect combination of flavor and crunch.

Best pizza in San Francisco.  Hands down.  

Stop whatever you are doing and go to here.  The garlic clam on sourdough is heaven on dough.  You cannot go wrong here and they serve beer too.  Cash only, so make sure you are prepared and do not disrupt the line, which chances are I may be in on any night.

You cannot go wrong here and can preview your meal in the windows.  This is not thin crust NYC style, but sour-dough thicker style pie and in my opinion superior.  Selections are limited somewhat but I have never had a problem finding something I like vegetarian or meat-based.  

Writing this review actually makes me want to hop on the 30 to North Beach...yum!

Big square of fresh pizza and a glass of decent wine for $7? Wonder why I come here often? It's quick, cheap and the service is great. I sometimes bring a book and have two glasses of wine, The music they play can be anything from heavy metal to '80s new wave. The only complaint I have, and it's a small one, is that their barstools are too close to the counter and they are bolted to the floor so you can't move them. I know it's designed that way because it's a small place and they want room for people to be able to walk behind but it's slightly uncomfortable, but doesn't stop me from going there at least once a week.
Delicious pizza, and easily the hottest pizza slangers and makers west of the Mississippi. I will be returning here until the day I die.

I LOVE GOLDEN BOY PIZZA! They serve San Francisco's best deep dish pizza. It is open late, they serve pitchers of beer, and there is usually an attractive pizza girl behind the counter.  It is close to many of my favorite North Beach bars and is perfect for the late night munchies!  Be sure to bring cash!

Had the combo and the pesto veggie slices and they were amazing!  I love that they're all the big square slices - always takes me back to elementary school and "pizza day" in the cafeteria.  Super friendly staff and the place has a great vibe, like an underground punk music club.  Probably because they're pumping out punk the whole time.  I'm definitely going back.

It was about this point that i got the idea they werent discussing Golden Boy anymore....

This is my favorite slice in SF.  Reminds me of the kind of pizza my momma use to make us.  Love the thick light crisp crust .. mmm!  I only eat here at lunch because will feel guilty for eating this in the evening.  Gotta keep slim, but if i didn't care, it would be on like donkey kong.  #bestpizzainsf #meltsinyourmouth #eatit

I am a pizza lover and I will travel just to try pizza. I was on yelp reviewing pizza spots in the city and I came across Golden Boy Pizza. I drove to the city to check it out and I loved it. There Garlic and Clam pizza is the Bomb! Also, their pesto pizza is the bomb as well! I recommend to anyone in the city to stop by and try it out. Every time I stop by there is a line out the door, but, trust me it's worth it. They are very fast and it's very affordable. Five stars all day!

The garlic/clam pizza was one of a kind.  The gooey cheese with a crunchy crust topped with garlic and clams was amazing.  A good place to get a late night bite or just a casual meal.  Absolutely love their pizza!

My boyfriend and I went to this spot after a night with some friends.  It had a line out the door on a Fri night I think it was 12am or 1am.  It was late and the line was long.  The pizza was worth the wait.  Loved the crunchy crust and the tasty toppings.  I had the chicken garlic and pepperoni.  We ended up going back a few days later but this time in the day time.  The pizza was still awesome as we remembered.  It's affordable but  when we sat in it was so hot that eating pizza was hard but I wanted the crunchy bread.  The seating is great on the bar but not so great near the restroom.  Seats where bolted on the floor so you are sitting too close to the wall and it's a good thing I'm petite I can sit on this but others had to lean on the stool sideways.  But hey we are here for the food.

Even though I am pretty exclusive with crispy thin crusts when it comes to pizza, I tried this popular, old North Beach favorite for a little Sicilian-style action. Sitting at the creepy counter is really fun, actually, as you get to watch them slinging slices for the diverse clientele who wander in, as well as read all of the cheeky comments slipped on the menu board. As for the pizza itself, it's not my thing. Maybe I'm just not "Eye-talian" enough, as it was too thick, too cheesy, and un-saucy for my taste, but their unique atmosphere alone is enough to garner three stars.

I've never been here while drunk or at night, strangely enough. So, take this useful tidbit from this stone-sober (at least when I was there) gal: this stuff is pretty good, and it's cheap.

These square little pieces of happy (you pretty much just need one, and it's about $4 a square) saved me most recently after a wedding ceremony at nearby Sts. Peter and Paul. You know how you sit there for a while toward the end of a ceremony, then realize you won't be eating for another three hours so the wedding party can take pictures before the reception? It's perhaps no surprise we made a beeline for GB as soon as he kissed the bride.

It's very punk-rock-industrial inside (stickers and corrugated wall decor abound), and will feel like your favorite, casual neighborhood bar, but with yums. A handful of beers on tap to go with your pizza, and plenty of seating if you're not there between 12 midnight and 2 a.m. on a Thursday-Saturday.

To sum up:

Golden Boy: Good even when you're sober.

Amazing pizzas. A friend recommended this place and it did not disappoint. They have two service times. The first day we arrived too late at night, we were told they were no longer seating tables. The second time we tried to eat here, they again had just stop seating tables for service change. Luckily we were still able to sit at the bar and order. All of the pizzas looked delicious. We ordered the New Yorker and loved it. Food came out fast. Definitely would come back here again.

I am visiting a friend in North Beach, and decided to call in a pizza. I spoke with a nice girl on the phone and she took my order. I was literally around the corner and she told me it would be ready in 15-20min. I waited about 10 minutes and then headed over. It was about 15 min before they closed and there was a line onto the sidewalk to try and grab the last of the slices. I squeezed my way inside and got the girl's attention. She acknowledged me but made it seem like my pizza wasn't ready.... come to find out there is no way to streamline take out orders! I waited in the entire line, just to find out that my pizza had been sitting there the whole time getting cold. When I asked her about it, she said that there's no way to skip the line for takeout. I paid $37 for a gluten free pizza that was cold and the cheese had already started to congeal. This is unacceptable, if you tell someone 15-20 min, but there's a line that you have to wait it for an additional 20min then she should have told me, why should I get cold pizza when I took the time to call in my order and showed up on time.

We tried to get in to Tonys pizza for 4 nights-each time they had over an hour wait. To day we skipped lunch and came at 5:00 and got right in. Within 15 minutes the place was packed! Started with the oven roasted green beans and garlic cheese bread. I could have made a meal of just the green beans!! Roasted whole green beans with olive oil, fresh minced garlic and sea salt- SO good!!! The garlic bread was good but the whole cloves of garlic were a bit much. Tried the New Yorker pizza- pepperoni, garlic sausage and a spicy link sausage, fresh crushed tomatoes, dollops of fresh ricotta and some mozzarella. Crust was thin and hot-oven blistered. Very good. I can see why they do such a good business. Service was very good.

I can't say enough amazing things about this place. The pizza, the meatballs, the service, the drinks. The New York pizza is very good. Thin, crispy and delicious. Every trip to San Fran we will make this delicious place a stop.

The best staff ever! Came in at 315 wanting their coal fire pizza,the New Yorker. We told them at we would wait until 4 that's when the Coal fire pizza start. Around 345 they came to the table and gave us complimentary meatballs for our wait. CAN'T WAIT TO COME BACK

Went on a cold rainy night.  Wait was an hour for a table for 2.  I found  a space at the bar so we were able to sit there.   Drinks were different this time than back in the spring when I went there.  Had a strawberry lemonade drink.  Very good.   Wanted our usual prosciutto and pears pizza but that was no longer on the list.   Ordered the Quattro pizza which is four different slices with a different meat on each slice.  Fresh cheese on top amp those fantastic sweety drip peppers.   Very tasty and would order it again.

Love it! Coal fire pizza is awesome!
Tip get there early as it is a long wait time for a table.

This place is so good! The bartender JP was amazing too. Ordered the garlic bread to start, it was good but a little too garlic-y for me. Don't order unless you really like garlic. Drinks were all fantastic, ordered pasta and a pizza because it all looked so good, and it was.

The famous pie that won the world championship in Italy is limited to 73 per day, so if that's what you want, get there by opening at 12pm. The New Yorker is their 2nd most popular pizza and it is DELICIOUS. If you want to save yourself the hassle of a wait, go between 3-530 in the afternoon. Anything you eat will be delicious. I recommend the Eddie Muenster which is covered in a mild cheese, bacon, peppers, and crunchy Kale. Buon Appetito!
I loved the pizza here truly recommend this place the staff is so nice by far the best pizza I ever had
all the way from stockton,ca. 50 dollars a box though :(

OMG!!! Outstanding pizza!!! Probably the best in Cali! Vegi is my fav. Great vibe. You'll likely have to wait a bit to get in as there is usually a line. Unusual beer and wine license, they stop serving alcohol around 11p; eliminates drama. But don't let that stop you! And don't forget to take some home. Killer the next day! Tip: If you do take some home, don't have them fire the slice(s) going home; makes em dry. Enjoy!

when I'm craving pizza there are three places i would go -

little star, if i want a sit down meal,
pizza orgasmica if a want a delivery meal  
AND
golden boy if i want a quick stand up meal

drunk or not, golden boy is delicious - the flavors are strong, salty, juicy, tangy and spongy as some have said.   be careful not to be too eager and burn your lips with the steamy cheese!  and always get the pizza that just came out of the oven, not the cold ones that need to be reheated.  

it really is so perfect.  just be prepared to drink a gallon of water afterwards.

are you there golden boy? it's me, kris....

i've been a loyal follower ever since that first religious experience after grant and green when an unexpectedly excellent local band inspired two hours of heavy drinking and heavier dancing, and salvation from complete inebriation was found at your door. i was brought up thin-crust, and not sicilian-style, but you have shown me the light, and i'm born again. and like any good disciple, i'm studying all of your important works: cheese, sausage, clam, and all the rest.

at around $3 a slice, you know i'll be there every sunday. promptly at 2am.

Pizza here was tasty before and after drinking. :P There was a line, but no wait time after order, so thats cool. They had 4-5 options to pick from including a few vegetarian options. 2 slices were enough to fill me.

This is certainly not the best pizza or the best late night slice in San Francisco. True, its owned by its classic next door neighbor Sodini's, but just because you cut a pizza into squares rather than triangles does not a best slice make.  Once you overcome the geometric illusion and regain your senses, you realize that this pizza is really just fair.
Sooooo yummy! Decently priced. Employees have always been great, personable, and friendly. Only giving it a 4 because it's tiny inside. But LOVE this place

This place was a small, but very friendly and open space. It was very crowded because it was lunch time. I really liked the stools, although instead of tables, there was a counter along the wall. Seemed like a bar space previously, but converted to a pizza place. The pizza came in thick squares, and it was hot and delicious. As a New Yorker, I would say the pizza was pretty good - even though I scoffed at the fork and knife. I would recommend this place as a in-and-out space, not for a long meal. Great lunch space. Would recommend if you're in the area.
It was ok at best, a lot if hype ok pizza  I would still try it but don't expect too much.

Line out the door which is always a good thing. Little hidden hole in the wall that has a really cool interior like an underground punk bar, and playing some good tunes. Seating is limited but people keep moving. Cash only but you can get away with spending under $20 no problem (2 slices and a lagunitas ipa was $16). Pizza made right in front of the whole place and cooked as ordered. Pizza on a foccacia crust which creates a different taste that wasn't expected but fantastic. Not a huge selection of topings and no customization, but they offer enough options that if you are planning to order a crazy style pizza with 80 different toppings you shouldnt be here. If you want a beer and a couple of lighter filling slices check this place out. Worth the trip even if your just touring the area or the warf.

The pizzas here are fantastic! I had the margherita, which was so good. I truly recommend it if you like a clean, simple flavor where you can really taste the tomato, the cheese, olive oil, and salt. It's also a good starter pizza to a more substantial. heavy pizza. In our case, it was prosciutto with a balsamic glaze. This was a good balance of salty and sweet, and definitely not your average everyday pizza.

We also had the fried calamari which was solid. The bread with the gariic is also outstanding too. The only negative is the wait time, so be prepared. We waited for a while until we just gave up and sat outside. Usually I have no problem with that, but of course, because of all the hills in SF, our table sat on a downward slope. We were also right next to the sidewalk and it was little awkward with various people passing by. Next time, I would definitely rather wait longer and sit inside.
Great food and service! I ordered the pasta carbonara and Italian salad. The food was fresh and pasta was homemade! The atmosphere was perfect for a cozy dinner and the cocktails were good too!

San Francisco's finest pizza. I've had this pizza plenty of times to know. Recently found out I had celiac. Well guess what Tony's has gluten free pizza! I had the gluten free New York. Unbelievable. I'm part Italian and life without good pizza is tough. It's good to know I can eat a gluten free pie worthy of its name that doesn't come frozen in a box.

Had the chance to meet Tony during his restaurant's fifth year anniversary event. He's incredibly talented and passionate about what he does-- something you can easily tell through the way these pizzas taste. I never liked pizza crusts until I went here. Must try!!

My favorite local stop when in San Francisco!  The Gigante Meatball with mushroom and pancetta cream sauce will levitate you to heaven!  The New Haven Lou, coal fired pie at 1,000 degrees was awesome!  Robvell at the bar is always entertaining, and hip, classy cat!

Thank god this place exists in SF, because this city overall is terrible at pizza and should be ashamed of itself.

I've had the Cal Italia a couple of times, the Tartufo, and another I can't remember the name of right now, and they've all been excellent. My mouth is watering thinking about them right now! The truffle sauce on the Tartufo...just wow. The fried green beans are delicious as well as the caprese salad which unfortunately seems to be a seasonal item. Also, the bread and dipping sauces they give every table are so good. The garlic sauce is like nothing I've tasted before...heavenly.

I like that they offer different crust types on the menu, Neapolitan, NY style, etc. I'll have to try the award winning margherita at some point although it's hard for me to order such a simple pizza at a nicer place like this.

Definitely worth the hour long wait, I've done it several times now. I'd recommend putting your name in before you're actually hungry, and enjoy a walk around North Beach or a drink at Park Place Tavern or Joe's while you wait. They'll text you when your table is ready.
Pretty good pizza! Loved their mac and cheese. I really liked it, only advice I can give anyone is make reservations, we had to wait 2 1/2 hours.

Outstanding stuff here at Tony's Joint!!.. In North Beach of course.. Meatballs to die for... Freshness is the name, baked in the 900 degree wood fired oven to boot.. Do yourself a flavor and check it out!!
Incredible food and service. They messed up and misdelivered our pizza and were so good about it!

-Free bread has the best balsamic vinegar dip and garlic agave dip. Ahhh I didn't even care about the pizza.
- I asked to get just the fried dough from the coccoli dishes. They allowed it.$5 for some really great dough. I recommend it.
- Most of the pizzas were out. It is honestly kind of annoying that they waited until after we had studied the whole menu before telling us what we can't get... it was at least 3 whole sections of the menu that we asked about. We got the New Yorker. No regrets. The riccota and pepperoni make it.
Great atmosphere and great pizza!! The servers were friendly and their menu was hilarious!! It's THE place to go!!! I highly recommend!!

The perfect spot to grab a great tasting slice of pizza and a beer before taking a nice stroll through North Beach.  It's got a cool dive bar appeal to it and the gal working the counter was super nice. Not ideal for large parties or parents with kids in tow.  Warning, they play explicit Gangsta Rap so be forewarned you may hear the B, F, and P word while dinning, one could be so fortunate ; )

Hands down, the best pizza in North Beach...  I've had a lot of pizza in the area, but my favorite is Golden Boy.  It's a total neighborhood icon.  Big red finger pointing down at it and they're open late.  Once the bars are near closing, this place is poppin' which means a line out the door!  People don't mind waiting while they're faded and chilly outside for it which means it is that good!  $2.75 for a rectangle slice of cheese, $3.25 for a rectangle slice of pepperoni or sausage, $3.75 for a rectangle slice of the clam, and there's more.  You visually get to see what slices are available.  Also, read their menu board, it's super funny.  One of the quotes is "If you don't see it, don't ask".  Meaning, if you don't see your slice of pizza available, then don't bother asking.  But once a tray is gone, they work right away to get another out there.  Wait for them to come out with it or order what's available.  They also have beer and wine there...  Such a local spot and the pizza is so good!  So good, that I am satisfied with a slice of cheese!  But if I have the funds, I'm always up for a slice of pepperoni or sausage.  Gotta have it!
I will give it up to Golden Boy.  The best pizza in SF.  I am always satisfied when I eat here and recommend it to everyone, even pizza snobs like myself.
Maybe it's the drunchies... But whatever it is... Very good and affordable pizza! Cons? Cash only and limited seating. Not a fan of the garlic clam pizza though.
I could go for a slice of Golden Boy clam and garlic pizza right about now.

Better than average, but I have to say I don't get the whole Golden-Boy-as-religious-experience vibe I've heard from so many people.  It's tasty, it's thick & rich, it's near a bunch of bars so it makes good pre / post drinking food, and the crispy focaccia crust is interesting and different.  On the other hand, it's kind of overpriced, there's always a line, and there isn't usually space to eat inside (especially on a weekend).  I think I still tend to go there because it is pretty tasty, it's open late, & I don't know North Beach that well so I tend to frequent the same spots over and over.  If you're going to take your out-of-town peeps to one pizza joint in SF, though, I'm not sure I see any real reason to make it this one.
The line was long, the slices in big squares.  All ten of of us waited in line and happily ate it.

Wow. Golden Boy Pizza has become a new staple in my life since moving to the city. The pizza is amazing, i find myself craving it whether I am extremely drunk or completely sober and i find myself there at least once a week it seems. Sometimes I find myself wanting to leave bars early just to go to Golden Boy, its kind of sad actually. Besides the food, the hours are great (2am or 3am r we kidding? perfect), and the plethora of drunk people outside at all hours proves to be a new hilarious place to hang out before going home. I recommend stealing a Parmesan shaker or two, they like that (whoops)
Veggie is excellent. Cheese is good but nothing extra special. Like the bar setup and atmosphere.

When it comes to pizza, it's pretty clear cut... either you're trying to get from point A to point B or you're looking for the perfect blend of ingredients that will send you off into euphoria land after that first bite.

With Golden Boy, the whole "am i getting a good deal" issue just totally vanishes because this place will make you forget all about it.

...and i guess it's one thing to hear it from a local yocal like Alex vs. hearing it from the mothership herself...

So here's the golden formula...personally tried and tested to work instantly...

1. Schedule a Happy Hour at a bar like Columbus cafe
2. Gather your friends/coworkers
3. Tell them to come straight from work
4. After a few drinks get everybody to try out the Golden boy

Golden Boy is like the Michael Fassbender of pizza places. Reliable, in demand, and almost too good to be true. For $5, you can get a fresh, hot, delicious pizza that's always satisfying. The dough is thick and crisp, there's never too much, and the tomato sauce has a light spice that really brings out its flavor. The only things that sweeten the deal are the fantastically cool cashiers, and the rock-n-roll background music; seriously, I can make an extensive playlist of all the music I bought after eating at that place. The place is pretty small, but for some reason, you can always find a seat (this is still a mystery to me). Golden Boy is definite must for quality pizza, just remember to BRING CASH!

First, I have to say I am a pizza traditionalist, and grew up in NY. I love Sicilian that has a hard crisp base with a soft top. I read reviews on Golden Boy and saw others raved about the pizza. I ordered a piece from a sheet that came right from the oven and it was soft, and only marginally good. If the sauce had been super flavorful - I would have bumped up my rating, but it was pretty mediocre.

narrow bar-stool seating..mostly a pizza by the slice joint.....averaging $3 a slice...pick your pie..vegetarian, pepperoni, sausage, cheese....sometimes fresh from the back...sometimes not...reheated in the front mini-oven....basket overlayed with wax paper and on goes your slice......thick...bready...rectangular sicilian pan pizza style slices.....wash it all down with a pitcher of brew...shy over $10 for a pitcher...

It is a mediocre pizza place. The Place is not so clean either.  It is a very casual joint that you can just get a slice.  They only accept cash so be sure to have enough before you head over. Ppl work there are very nice. Customer service is much better than Tony's.

My bf has been raving about this place since we started dating and I finally made it there this week.  I was sober, but I can see how much better the slice would be if I wasn't...slightly greasy, nice, thick crust, crispy and cheesy.  Yum.
Great pizza, long lines tho, if you want in and out as quick as possible ask them to not heat up your pizza.
I don't really get it. Golden Boy makes some square-shaped pizza that gets reheated upon ordering, and it only tastes okay. Am I missing something?

I sat in last night with a freinds band at the Grant & Green, and nothing could top off those tequila shots better than a thick slice of Golden Boy. Then off to shots of Jack at a friends... then into a cab, off to bed with the phone still ringing... Had a street cleaning ticket this morning becasue i left my parking open in case anyone came over... $50. Gotta love SF.
A square of sausage pizza and a can of San Pelligrino Aranciata and a park bench at Washington Square,  it's one of my favorite experiences.

We wanted to try their famed margherita pizza and were directed here because the main restaurant had a 1+ hour wait. This is right next door and you can get their whole pizzas or by the slice togo, and there wasn't a wait when we went.

Maybe I had too high of expectations seeing that they only made 73 of their award-winning margherita pizzas, but I didn't see what was so special about it. The pizza itself was really watery/liquidy, and it drooped as you picked it up by the slice. The thin crust wasn't able to handle all the toppings and was too charred in some places (bottom), giving it a burnt taste. The toppings tasted fresh though, but I don't think I'd come back.

Talk about thin crust pizzas in SF and Tony's is gonna be in the discussion of who's got the best. Of course there's a wait but 30min was alright by me. FYI Sat is the only day they take reservations.

Started off with the meatballs, 2 words YEAH BUDDY! Salad came next then the main attraction PIZZA! We ordered the New Yorker that had sausage, pepperoni, ricotta cheese, chopped garlic & oregano that came out of a 1000 degree coal fired brick oven. I love the crispy edges on the pepperoni that the oven produces and the sweet creamy ricotta cheese was crazy good. The pies are medium sized so ask your server how many you would need to feed you party. Next time clams and garlic or the margarita.

The challenge with being awarded the nation's best pizza place is living up to the super high expectations. Having lived on the East Coast and enjoyed New Haven pizza, we came to Tonys with high standards - thin-crust, crisp and chewy crust. Now New Haven is not perfect - the cheese could be fresher (not that bagged mozz they use on the East Coast), but the crust is always perfect.

So back to Tonys. We ordered two of the award winning margherita's - baked in the 900 degree oven. The crust was a disappointment, it was actually limp. The dough flavor was good, but it was under baked. The sauce was good as was the good quality mozz.  Since this was the signature pie, we were a bit disappointed.

We also had a proscuitto, fig, arugula pie - this was the best. I believe it was baked in an electric oven. The crust was far better and it was a great balance of toppings, fresh arugula on a crispy and chewy crust. The best pizza of the one we ordered.

The New Yorker pizza with ricotta, mozz, sausage and pepperoni was just too much. It was far too heavy for a pizza - it was overloaded with flavors that masked the sauce and crust. It was the biggest pizza (in terms of diameter).

So all in all - my guests (native New Haven-ians and New Yorkers) and I agree that Tonys is a good pizza place, but best in the nation? probably not.

Hands down best pizza in the Bay Area. The Margherita pizza is the best thing on the menu - simple, classic, and delicious. When the you have good quality ingredients you don't need to be extra fancy. We always sit at the bar instead of waiting - great service and the bartenders make a mean negroni! Honestly the wait isn't bad just plan on coming early, putting your name down and getting a drink nearby while you wait and they'll text you. Don't like waiting for quality food and good drinks... then you should probably stay home and pop a frozen pizza in the oven or order dominos because you have no taste or class.

I love the food and service at this place.  Great location and close to many good places to visit.  Easy access for the main streets and an easy walk in and out to other great places in San Francisco.   I have to mention the extraordinary service by the bartender.  He was very helpful and knowledgeable.  Best customer service, I felt like I was the only one in the place.  My family sat at the bar because there were no tables available.  Love our pizza and salad that we had.  Thank you for your hard work, Mr. Bartender.  Lovely lunch on a weekday !

Tony's has been on my list for quite some time now. Finally made a trip last weekend with my family to try it out. When we got there, there was a 1.5 hour wait for a party of 4 - already prepared for a wait time like this, we put out name down and hopped on over to Cafe Divine for some wine and cheese/salami.

Our table ended up being ready about an hour and 15 minutes in. The service here was mediocre - they are just so busy. There was always a long wait, so for these servers they must be non-stop from the start to end of their shifts.

As for the food - decently priced and good tasting. I like their wide variety of pizzas with all of the different styles. Between 4 of us, we ordered a Margherita pizza, the Cal-Italia, and their Spaghetti and Meatballs.

The Margherita pizza was good, except half of our pizza was cooked perfectly and the other half was undercooked (I didn't notice till I got to the undercooked half, so didn't think to send it back) The taste of their Margherita is good - I really liked that their was a nice little salty kick to the taste. As for the Cal-Italia pizza, I had been dying to try this pizza out since the first time I saw it on Yelp. The ingredients were all very tasty, however, when it came down to it, not really my style of pizza. I LOVE Figs/Fig spread and prosciutto but I guess on pizza I like my pizzas more of the purist type (ie. Margherita). However, it was awesome to finally try it out.

Their pasta on the other hand, DEE-LISH! Their Spaghetti and Meatballs dish was excellent - perfect al-dente pasta and I loved the rounder shaped fresh pasta they use. This is a pizza place but I feel like I enjoyed their pasta more.

I probably won't return to Tony's because the wait is so long and the pizza here was good, but definitely not the best I've had. However, it was great to check a place off my list - the vibe here is definitely very fun!

"The way pizza should taste"

Wifey Coffos

We got the New Yorker and I have to say it was the best pizza I've ever tasted. I am very easy to please when it comes to food, but this really went over the top. The tomato sauce was so good, just amazing. Perfect in every way. I understand why people talk this place up so much. If you're in San Fran and you like pizza you have to come here.
I'm from Chicago and I'm a deep dish pizza lover. I must say that this restaurant has the best pizza in town! New Yorker pizza is highly recommended.

Solid pizza execution.

My boyfriend and I went during a Monday afternoon, not too busy. The host quoted U.S. 15 minutes, (though he pages us 20 minutes after that time, no biggie). What kind of threw me off was that when he pages us he responded with "oh... Didn't expect you to come back so soon" umm... If the Wait was only supposed to be 15 minutes, obviously we weren't going to wander too far. He then proceeded to tell us it would be a few more minutes.and for us to go outside , even though he had already paged us! What the hell?... Kind of annoying (I was a hostess for three years) and know that you should never under quote and never page people until it's ready. We awkwardly waited for another 5 minutes before being told, AGAIN, that it was "almost ready, just now being set up".  

We were seated outside and although it was a beautiful day the wind was INSANE. Our salad pieces were blowing everywhere on to the table next to us. And this was partially my fault for saying first available, but maybe different plating would help prevent this on crazy weather days.

Our server made up for the entire experience though. He was kind, attentive, and our waters were never empty.  We obviously ordered the margarita pizza . It was delicious, but it fell apart Almsot too easily and I was eating tomato scraps after eating the bread by itself. Still yummy nonetheless.

Oh, and the table next to us got the complimentary bread but we didn't.... They saw we didn't have any so when they got theirs they said "oh we didn't order this" and the runner responded with "oh it's complimentary". I overheard that and immediately asked for the bread even though we had just received our food, because that seems really unfair to me!!

I'm thinking next time we will dine inside for sure , or even at the bar . The food definitely makes up for the few setbacks here and there.
Best margherita pizza I've ever had. Easy to say that this is the best pizzeria in all of the Bay Area.

This north beach is a gem and must for pizza lovers in the area.   I recently moved further away...but still make the trek back regularly to grab a corner slice of the veggie pesto.  Bar staff is great, rarely too long of a wait except circa 2am.  Only downside is cash only...but at their great prices, not enough of a hurdle to miss out.

Ate here again on the late end. Best pizza I've had in North Beach. I'm not usually a Sicilian style pizza eater but they know what the hell they are doing. Be prepared for a wait if you go on the later end. Everyone likes to hit up this spot after having drinks.

Ok so who knew square pizzas could taste as good as the round ones;-)  Im not too keen on thick style pizzas because they have a tendency to be too doughy and not bake well with the sauce- but here its well done-- not too airy and cooked through!!! I usually get the one with all the veggies or simply the mushroom-- deliciousssss!  Luv it...decor is bar style with hard rock music on the background- servers are kewl and chatty :-)

Hands down the place I want to go after a night of mingling, dancing, and listening to bands in North Beach.  After the first "whiff" of bubbling cheese, garlicky pesto, and bready, yeasty crust, you too will be dreaming about Golden Boy Pizza.
I've had too many pieces to admit, yet not enough to satisfy my cravings!  (what to do, what to do?) But seriously, if you're around Grant and Green and see the line form out the from under the red awning, you need to get into that line (it may be 20 deep, but worth it).  Prices are cheap compared to the power of the punch in just one slice.  They must put the money towards better products.  It's definitely not going to the establishment itself since I'm sure the majority of their business occurs once the doors close and only the window is where you can order.
*It has an inside which I have been in only once before (years ago so I won't review that).

This is my boyfriend's go-to place for pizza since he lives in North Beach. Boy do I envy him, cuz they sure know how to do pizza right at Golden Boy's! I think I've had every one of their slices and I have no complaints whatsoever! Great toppings on buttery, airy focaccia (such a genius combo)!

This little joint holds a special place in my heart, and is certainly a must destination whenever I visit S.F. The cravings start as soon as I spot the Transamerica Pyramid as the plane SLOWLY begins its descent. First the growling in the bottomless pit starts, then followed by small biological tremors as the withdrawals for this place continue to ensue.
  Golden Boy also provides me with beautiful little reminiscent vignettes of my time in this wonderful city. I guess the Sicilian pies in the window were a beacon to me and other young art students at the time. We would meet here to discuss concepts for new projects and pieces, while many pieces were consumed. Even though the place has its obvious deterrents at times, the long lines and nowhere to sit, the little squares of gastronomic heaven make up for it. Beyond the pizza itself you get an interesting mix people at this place ranging from tourists, art students, and the Beat Patriarchs of the neighborhood. This melange of personalities is here for one thing, and one thing only their craving for SAUCE and CHEESE.
  So until my next trek up from the South, I guess I can only savor the slices and the moments pleasure from my last visit to the Golden Boy and the Bay City.

I moved to northbeach a few months ago and my friend recommended Golden Boy pizza so i thought id give it a try.  The place is only a block away from my new place and when i got there... the smell was heaven!  Ive tried the meat combo, clam & garlic, and the pepperoni... but by far.. hands down the pesto vegetarian is just damn amazing!!!! i love my meat pizzas..... but the flavors in the pesto vegetarian is just devine!!! Best pizza in North Beach!

Best to get it fresh out of the oven. The wait is worth it. The portions are awesome. Large slice of pizza with great tasting ingredients. This is my favorite pizza shop in San Francisco. We almost always get the combo :) eating inside is not always an option, but it pretty cool. Stickers and ads and posters cover the majority of the walls. They have several beers on tap as well. Definitely one thing about the city that needs to be tried!

Delicious square pizza that just hit the spot after a night of North Beach bar hopping.  The focaccia crust just kills it.  Really friendly servers too.  Oh and decent beers in case you weren't hammered enough for your pizza.

I tried the Yelp favorites, the pesto vegetarian pizza and the clam and garlic pizza. Both was delicious, but the winner for me was the pesto vegetarian. All the slices/pies had a generous amount of toppings and packed with flavor. The line can get really long... Instead of ordering through the window its faster if you go inside and order there.

Delish food BUT the hostess, slow service & lack of attentiveness killed the Tony's experience I was looking fwd to. Hope management makes some adjustment as I think this place could deliver delight AND Dollars and create a win win experience.

This place is soooooo good!!  The closest to NY pizza we can find here in the Bay Area.  Plan a long waiting time, since it will usually take an hour to two hours to sit down.  The bread is good with the vinegar and oil, and marinara sauce.  The pizza like I said was great like NY pizza!  Their meatballs are the best we have ever had.  The staff is very helpful, and will advise you if you do not know how much pizza to order.

We planned a visit to SF to see friends but mostly to eat.  We heard good things about this from other foodies.  We ate our way through SF and Big Sur and this was amongst the top three places.  In fact, I'm salivating at the thought of their pizza.  

I recommend getting the giant meatballs, The Detroit, and The New Yorker.

Service was great. Very professional, helpful, attentive, and funny.

This was our second visit to Tony's Pizza Napoletana, with also a to-go order in between our visits. Each time, we order the Fratellanza Sicilian Pizza because my other half LOVES this pizza!!  Middle daughter was home from college, so we drove over for a late lunch today.

We ordered the meatballs with 2 glasses of Chianti, both were very good!  However, we were shocked when the pizza arrived.  Most notably, the pizza was approximately 1/2" high versus 2.5" as our other pizzas had been.  I asked the bartender about this and she offered to send it back.  None of us had eaten yet and it was after 2:30 PM.  Also, we waited 30 minutes for the pizza to arrive and didn't want to wait another 30 minutes.

My other half liked the pizza well enough, but he certainly didn't go on & on about it as he did in the past.  In fact, he said nothing about it.  He had a single slice and left the rest on the tray.  The 20 year old liked it fine, but again didn't rave about how good it was, even though this was her first time to Tony's.  To me, the pizza wasn't even close to being as good as it had been every time before.

Also, given the incredible touristy location of the restaurant plus the wait time required before you're seated, there's no reason to go back any longer.  Perhaps we were just lucky for a couple of years.  Our favorite pizza has gone down hill so much now.

If you order this pizza, the Fratellanza is now a flattened pizza about 1/2" high, whereas it used to be a tall, fluffy focaccia bread nearly 3" high with pepperoni, sausage, salami, oregano, & mushrooms on top.  And with a quick sprinkling of chili pepper flakes and grated Parmesan, it was like taking a bite of heaven.

Not any more, as this was our last time eating at Tony's. (sigh)
The food was good however we had to wait for 1 hour and 15 minutes... The service was average and one of our pizzas was served about 20 minutes after the other. Won't go there again!

Server was great, however I could not get an extra chair when my daughter showed up unexpectedly.  I spoke with the Manager and was told other customers are waiting and they have a business to run, meaning we can't hold up the table we were already sitting and eating at.  Thought I was a customer also and would have appreciated the flexibility to allow my daughter to join us. We were not looking to order more, just to have our daughter sit with us until we were down, which would have been about 15 minutes.  Zero flexibility and poor customer service straight from the Manager, who was not friendly or understanding at all.  We won't be back.  There was no mention of fire code issue and we were sitting outside on the sidewalk where hundreds of people walk by, so not sure how this was a fire code issue.  The Manager was not apologetic and this was all about getting us out, so the next customer could come, based on the Manager's comment, "I have a business to run."  We understand if this is policy, but we didn't need this unprofessional comment.  Instead some understanding and better customer service would have been appreciated.  We didn't feel that way at all, our business was unappreciated and ruined the experience!

We actually didn't wait that long (around 30m), I thought it's going to be worst than that. I like the pizza and the steak with bone marrow. Love it! Customer service is very good and price is not bad too.
Will definitely come back and try other pizza.

Came here for date night with the boyfriend and I really had high hopes for this place since Tony was on food network's pizza challenge.  We came in around 6pm for dinner after work and got seated at the bar almost immediately.  

The bar tender was pretty nice, but seems like one of those real old school bar tenders - mixes his drink then tries it then adds stuff then tries it again etc.  He tried the drink he was mixing like 10 times, no joke.  Once he was done, he came to serve us and he made me this drink that was sweet and tasted like one of those drinks from China town where you have to push the marble in to open it.  Yeah, I wanted something with alcohol in it not something that tasted like soda with a pinch of alcohol.  Boo on that.

The food was decent.  We ordered the meatballs, the Margherita pizza (only 73 made a day), and the Cal Italia pizza.  The meatballs were disappointing, didn't come out hot, wasn't super juicy, nothing that you could brag about to anyone.  The margherita pizza was pretty good, super super thin, wish it had more basil and tomatoes on there.  Definitely should eat the whole thing there and quickly too because when it gets cold, it does taste a bit soggy.  The Cal Italia - don't know how this won the gold medal at the food network challenge.  I like sweet and savory, but this fig jam on the pizza was a bit too overwhelming.  I only tasted sweet pizza and not much savoriness.  If I go here again, I wouldn't get the drink, I wouldn't get the meat balls and I wouldn't get the Cal Italia pizza for sure.  Only the margherita pizza wins my heart.  This one did get a medal and it was well deserved.  

I still love Little Star Pizza.  So far no pizza joint in the city has beaten out Little Star for a place in my heart.  Little Star FOREVER!!!

First time visit to Tony's on Sunday. We only waited 10 minutes for a table and the service afterwards was fast and friendly. Since we were first-timers our server went over the different types of pizza and offered some reccomendations.

We devoured the warm Foccia with the three dipping oils and five of us shared the Cesar Salad. the dressing was rich and creamy, the romaine crisp and the Parmesan had a wonderful bite to it.

I had the award winning Margherita Pizza and so did a friend. Our table also ordered the Americano, which was feast for the eyes as well as the stomach; the New Yorker and a Stromboli. Everything was delicious. The atmosphere was fun and lively and our server made sure we were doing ok without being intrusive.

Tony's desrve the reputation for being the best pizza place in San Francisco

Freaking incredible pizza. My wife and I were in town visiting a friend and had dinner there, outside, with our dogs in tow. The GM (I think) came out was was extremely accommodating to us and our dogs, even searching inside for dog treats to give them. We were so impressed with our Sicilian-style Burratina Di Margherita that we came back the following night, and received the same warm service. The second night we had the Pizza Campari and Pepe Bianco. Both nights we dined late, so service was great, with no wait for tables. I have always been impressed with the pizza offerings in North Beach, but Tony's sets the bar, high, for freshness and deliciousness.

* I almost forgot: my wife had a baked spinach and cheese calzone. Again, one of the best I've ever had. We both are vegetarians and had no difficulty with the menu.

I have to give this place a bad review based on my experience last night. We got here pretty late, but had a few friends from out of town visiting. We had taken a cab to get over here just in time before they closed, and were in line by 215am. After waiting for over 30 minutes and we were the last people in line, as soon as we came up to the window, they slammed everything on us and closed up. This is ridiculous, we were the LAST people in line, could have just served us. What's another 2 minutes? Food would have helped a lot with my hangover today. Never coming back here again, nor bringing people, a bad taste was left in my mouth, and it could have at least been from the pizza.

The Mighty Golden Boy oh how I loathe for you at times. Un-Healthy as you may be,  your Sicilian-style, square sliced deliciousness is worth the wait in line! There is absolutely nothing better to combine with the Alcohol flowing through my body at 2am on a Saturday night,  than a slice of Golden Za!

It was cheat day and my then friend (now boyfriend) and I made a deal.  He would introduce me to his favorite meal at the place he deems makes it the best and I would take him to my spot for dinner.  It was President's Day weekend and what better way to absorb the beautiful weather and long weekend than with good food, and a walk on the Golden Gate Bridge to burn it off.  

I had been hearing him talk about Golden Boy Pizza almost to the point where he was beginning to sound stubborn.  Hahaha.  No other pizza could match up, in his opinion.  I never heard anyone talk about pizza the way he did and even dismiss other beloved pizzas joints here in the Bay.  I thought, geez this pizza better take me over the moon and back.  So he is super excited as we're walking towards GBP and it's nice to see that someone other than myself can get so giddy over something like food.  

Upon entering the place is small and there are a handful of people in front of us.  The menu is pretty small as well with only several options:  Cheese, Pepperoni, Veggie, Combination, and Clam and Garlic.  No slice over $4.  Oh, and its all square slices which I never had before.  The pizzas were already made and waiting for you in the window.  You choose what you want and they reheat it for you and bring it to your seat.  If you're not too hungry, one slice will do ya.  But, if hungry, two slices would be perfect.  I chose (2) Clam and Garlic since I gave a few things up for Lent.  After Lent, I'll come back for the others.  

It took a while for me to get used to the seats and the counter space as it didn't leave much room to maneuver around.  Seats are not movable so I can only imagine someone much bigger than me trying to sit on there.  Anyways, that's beside the point.  Its a no frills place and you definitely aren't coming here for the ambiance.  Our slices made its way to us and yes, I had tasted pizza heaven.  They use focaccia bread and that makes a huge difference.  I was worried the clam and garlic (2x) would make me a vampire's nightmare, but not so.  I thought it would be overwhelming to eat, but it wasn't.  The crust was great, the garlic was diced up finely enough that you didn't feel as if you were swallowing whole pieces.  Every bite tasted great and I can see why a lot of people, especially my friend, loves it here.  The Clam and Garlic was a great choice and very delicious.  The crust helps to make the pizza and the ratio of crust to toppings are perfect.  I enjoyed so much I actually told my friend that we have to go back again soon.  I'm already looking up reasons why we need another cheat day.
Love Golden Boy pizza, the clam and garlic, the veggie, any combo....so good and not too thick!  So good if you drank some.  They do sell their focaccia at some high end grocery stores-YUM!

Great pizza!  Anytime I am in North Beach I stop into Golden Boy for a quick slice and a beer.  It is sicialian style pizza served by the slice and because so many people go here there are always fresh slices.  The beer selection is also awesome, always different brews on tap incluing some of my favorite micros.  All this said, be prepared for a line-especially when the weekend bar crowd is out.

Silly - hype has made this place successful and also it's great location and late opening hours - the pizza combinations are great but dang! The quality of the base is cheap cheap ... literally the only difference between frozen pizza's and this pizza is the trendy toppings and sexy drunk crowd lining outside ... Would Noor come again? Sorry!

This is a hard review to write because I have such mixed feelings. There are things I like a lot: The location, the atmosphere inside, the promptness of getting a slice. Conversely, I don't think the slice is great. It is quite greasy even if one gets a vegetarian slice. Also, the sauce hasn't much flavor. I feel like it needs to be doctored up a bit. I realize all of this is subjective, but I am just yelping.

I ran into Golden Boy Pizza between sets at Grant and Green.  I couldn't resist the square slices of cheesy goodness I spied from Golden Boy's window.  I selected a slice of cheese pizza for about two dollars and fifty cents (including tax, I guess!).  It didn't take long for the server to warm the pizza for me and hand it over.  This pizza tasted so much better than the pizza I have delivered from the chain stores in The East Bay.  I enjoyed every delicious bite.  It's a good thing I don't live in the city because I would certainly eat this regularly.
Anyone who has been drunk more than once in North Beach has been to Golden Boys.  It is the place to o to pick up a slice or 3 when you know you may wake-up hungover or drunk.
Love this place! Pizza is amazing and the employees are amazing.. Especially that cute little blond Mexican girl  she makes my day every time I go in there.
Yummy authentic Italian style pizza. My scilian friend Joey loves this joint (I'm Chinese so my pizza opinions are only worth so much). It's golden!

Bomb pizza, great craft beer selection, great price, chill spot... what more can you ask for?? Quit deciding which pizza shop to go to and come here before you regret not doing it! Sorry I ate my pizza before I decided to post this.

I love this pizza!  This is the best pizza in the neighborhood.  It is the perfect food for when you're night of drinking is nearing an end.  There is always a line out the door, but I wouldn't hesitate to wait. The pizza is that good and the line moves pretty quickly.  I don't go out in this neighborhood that often, but I try to make a point of grabbing a piece of this yummy square pizza when I do.

I went to Golden Boy for the first time Saturday night, but *NEVER AGAIN* after seeing how their employees treat their customers. We saw them assault one of the customers! Read on for the details...

We got to Golden Boy somewhat late (around 1:20 a.m.), so there was quite a line. My girlfriend assured me that the line would move quickly, so we decided to stay. After waiting for 15 - 20 minutes, we were almost at the front of the line when an employee suddenly shut the door and put cardboard over the window of the door. No explanation, nothing. I figured they might be switching over to window service, but I really wasn't sure. The guy behind us was a little confused, so he tried to pop his head in and ask as a customer was exiting. The employees yelled at him, and one of the female employees slammed the door shut *on his fingers*. When he tried to tell them what they had done, one of the other employees rudely pointed for him to leave. Talk about adding insult to injury!

I understand that they have to deal with a bunch of drunken idiots every night, but this guy was being respectful. We had been talking to him earlier in line, and he certainly was not one of the many obnoxious drunks we experienced while waiting. But regardless of the situation, it is NEVER ok to assault someone (yes, that is assault, my friends). I didn't get a chance to talk to him after that (he was so angry, he stormed off), so I have no idea if they broke one of his fingers or not. If they did, I hope he sues their asses.

When it was finally our turn in line, my girlfriend tried to talk to the employees to tell them that they had really injured the guy. They couldn't have cared less and started arguing with her. At that point, we simply left and vowed never to return. I cannot and will not support a business that treats people so poorly. So if the owner is reading this--you need to fire those employees.
I had the garlic clam pizza and it was amazing! My husband got cheese which was awesome too. Small little place, line out the door, but well worth the wait!

i hiked up to Golden Boy from Market and Montgomery.  totally worth it.  some of the best pizza i've had in the city.  when you enter, it's like you're in an airplane hanger where they're blasting Dead Kennedys.  got a pepperoni and the clam/garlic special.  they heat it up before they bring it over to you and it comes out just the way i like - melty, cheesy top with a chewy crust.

just an fyi... if you plan on getting the clam/garlic special, bring some industrial strenth gum with you.
Pizza is hot, crispy, cheap, and tasty. Decor is nothing fancy. There's often a line but it moves pretty fast. I've been here 3  times for lunch and will continue to go.

I don't know if I have told all of you, but pizaa is my thing. This place has been my thing for years! When I lived here in 2001, I was there three, maybe four times a week. I lived close by and I was a poor  college kid trying to eat and have enough for a beer too.  I'm sure many of you understand. Well, I moved back  to the city and I am still addicted to this place! Same crew working in the joint. Just a little older like me and a little funnier. I think it comes with age. Still rockin' the same beats and good cheap beer! I have a bit more cash now, so I like to get a piece to go. Incase I need a late night snack or don't want to make dinner the next night. Just stick it in the oven for 7 minutes and dinner is ready! The greatest people work there and the greatest pizza ever. God Bless GOLDEN BOY!
This is a 4 star pizza when you eat it fresh. Its a terrible pizza if you have leftovers. The foccacia becomes really hard as does the cheese and pepperoni.

Couldn't help but stumble upon this joint after ordering our burrito's from HRD Grill next door. They had a line out the door and these incredibly displayed square pizza's in the front window saying, "You want me! Yes you do!" It was at that moment, I regretted ordering a burrito from next door. I couldn't resist any longer, I ordered a slice and their pizza was off the HOOK!! The crust was perfect almost like a Focaccia bread and the cheese was just oozing with goodness. Pound for pound this pizza doesn't compare to the others. The taste is a true knock out! Highly recommend this place.

This pizza place is amazing, get ready for a wait though, make it a two hour event, don't come starving, but worth the wait! Pricey, but you get what you pay for, which is greatness. The best ricotta cheese I have ever had in my life.

I am rating Tony's 3 stars because I have tasted better Pizza. The hand crushed tomato sauce tastes the best but it doesn't come on all the pizzas. I had the classic Americano pepperoni and it was just okay... It was sooooo greasy and the flavor of the pepperoni over powered the pizza. My husband had the New Yorker which was good. I personally am not a fan of sausage or ricotta cheese which both were on the New Yorker... They did however have the best hand crushed tomato sauce on that Pizza.
The pepperoni would be better if it had the hand crushed tomato sauce and buffalo mozzarella instead of what it had on it.
The New Yorker, which they tell everyone it won awards would taste better with Buffalo mozzarella too.
Overall the service was excellent and it's located in a cute part of town.

Maybe it was an off night? Maybe I ordered the wrong thing? Maybe it's just not worth the hype?

Questions I will never answer. Ordered the pizza margherita and the crust was burnt, the sauce watery, and the cheese boring. I found it pretty inedible and chose to finish the spinach side which was quite good for sautéed spinach.

The table behind me was professing their love of the meatballs, so you should tried those! (They also ordered a margherita, but there was no love being professed about it...)

This place is def not worth the long wait!!
Had their popular New Yorker.
The sauce was really sweet. the sausage and pepperoni were good. I didn't care for the Ricotta cheese. The worst is the cardboardy crust.
oh well, i'll just wait to get back to NYC for some real pizza!!
Get take out if you really wanna try this place. Not worth the wait.

My very first visit at "TONY PIZZA NAPOLETANA" was also my LAST.  Sure they made have good pizza but their costumer services "HORRIBLE".  Before we were sited we had a very bad experience with the person greeting guests at the restaurant.

This person (Lady) was very nasty when referring to my ethnic group (Hispanic) to the point the she ask us to leave and she was not going to help us in getting a table. I call for the manager and this person took forever to arrive and when she finally shows she was also with the same attitude and this person's name is Nancy Puglisi which later I find out that she is also the Co-Owner to Tony's Pizzeria.

Well, I will not recommend Tony's Pizzeria if you are Hispanic, since The Owners of this restaurant and their Staff has a mayor problem serving my ethnic group (Hispanic) or what she calls us MEXICANS.

I know they have Hispanic worker in the back cooking and cleaning tables but Owners of Tony's Napoletana thinks that Hispanic people are only good for cleaning and cooking but not welcome to eat at their tables. Oh, I am from South America not Mexican but that's OK because I web a  beautiful Mexican girl.

So, Keep your Pizza Tony's, Since they are many Pizzeria Restaurant in beautiful San Francisco.

A Hispanic Person.
Great food and service, their menu has so many different choices. Highly recommend their margherita and New Yorker pizzas, both were fantastic.

This is THE best pizza I've had in my life. Got the new yorker, waited until 3:45 so they could fire up the oven. So worth it. The restaurant is small and tight and rushed feeling but it's all worth it, I promise.

OMG!!!!!!! Tony's Pizza Napoletana is a place that's been high on my husbands bucket list.  We've been trying to get here for the past 3 plus years, it's always packed with 2.5 hr wait times at times, especially weekends.  We came out today at lunch time and only had to wait about 15 minutes.  We were seated, our waitress made a few suggestions and we ordered.  We had the calamari which was very tender, the chorizo mussels and the New Yorker pizza.  I can't even explain how good the pizza was.  It had dollops of ricotta that tasted soooo fresh.  I could have taken it off and eaten it as is and I'm not even a ricotta fan.  As we ate one of the regulars stopped at our table to talk and informed us that Tony (the owner) was in the restaurant.  Wow, what were the chances of that.  So we got to meet Tony and he treated us to dessert, tiramisu...exceptional.   My husband chose this place because he saw it on Food Paradise and usually 8 out of 10 times we visit the restaurant we leave thinking it's overrated.  Not this joint.  It was everything and more than we expected.  The great experience started at the front door and great service continued throughout our visit.  We will definitely be back.

You can really enjoy Tony's pizza if you have NO idea what a pizza is supposed to taste like.
The place is highly overrated.
It is ridiculous that people wait in line for this....

I got there with the best intentions ( I was really looking forward to this) and I left leaving pizza behind.
(It is against my principles to create pizza leftovers)
Yes it was eat-able but after all this noise about this place I was so disappointed that I just wanted to leave.

Maybe in the past these guys made really good pizza or cared about making good pizza. Now they seem to be redeeming their reputation.

Pizza is quite good, for the napolitana, and the meatballs. The meatballs were almost better than the pizza. Be warned! No reservations and on a Saturday you could experience 2-3 hour wait times! Service was good despite being busy and everyone very friendly.
