Again, great place just be weary of the wait time and if you can't afford the wait there is a slice shop RIGHT next door before the florist that sells only one style of crust pizza by the slice, but from the same kitchen so check it out.

Square pizza slices are so much fun!  And especially at $3 for pure deliciousness in North Beach .. just across from the wine bar this place is perfecto. I dig it and will definitely be back to try the other pizzas.. only got cheese last week. step 1.

Got lost looking on my walk in search of Katanaya, a top rated Bay Area ramen house. Ended up all the way in North Beach and saw Golden Boy Pizza, a restaurant that I hadn't been to since I was 13. Damn good quality pizza with friendly customer service and nice size portions. From the 3 songs that I heard play within the time of enjoying my meal I do have to say they have some good taste with their music choice as well. Only downfall which happens to be a huge pet peeve of mine, especially when I only have debit on me. Cash only.

I normally prefer thin crust pizza but this place was great. While most restaurants were closing shop, we were happy to find a pizza place that was still open. We figured that the line out the door was a good sign and Golden Boy has a cool window display showing you the available pizza. I ordered 1 slice of the pepperoni. It had a great flavor and it hit the spot. If it wasn't so close to closing time, I might have ordered more. Well worth the stop.
Lisa always rocks and takes good good care of us.  Great hole in the wall!  See ya at the track this summer Lisa and Peter!

Maybe my expectations were a bit too high after reading all these 5 star reviews or it's because I'm not used to reheated pizza slices. Pizza was ok and cheap and staff was friendly but no 5 star pizza.

I give it five stars because when its 1:30am and you've been at the Grant & Green for the past 2 hours rockin out, anything greasy, cheesy and doughly is the best damn thing thats ever happened to you.

I swear this is the best Sicilian-style pizza in the Bay Area!! Seniore's and Pizza Chicago have nothing on this joint! The lines and the cash only may want you to leave but after grabbing a slice (or two) and a pint you'll feel right at home next to people from all over the city!

Awesome pizza. Reasonable price, large slice, good toppings and I enjoyed the garlic bread-like crust. I will definitely be back to get some beers and pizza late on a Friday or Saturday night. Open until 2:30? Yes please!

Okay, being from NYC I am a tough critic of pizza and considering that the thing in California seems to load bad pizza with tons of great toppings to make it taste good- this place is a diamond in the rough. Thank god I can walk there any time I want. It is worth the wait on line!
Great pizza and beer for under ten bucks.  Best time to go is around noon.  It's open late night but thats when the line tends to form, so i avoid all that.

I had the margherita pizza and wow is it good. Fresh, tasty sauce, beautifully chewy dough (the slight char on the bottom is irresistible). Wolfed it down in 5 minutes (I split the other half with a friend). Soooo good.

Delicious pizza and good service. My family and I really enjoyed our dining experience here and will definitely come back. I ordered the Cal Italia and it was amazing. Kids ordered pepperoni and it was delicious.

The food was amazing and the hostesses were so accommodating to us. My friend has her one year old so with her and he was a little fussy during the wait.  The hostesses took their time to engage with him and work diligently to find the best table for us to feel comfortable while avoiding seating us in an area that we might be too disruptive( with a one year old you never know what type of mood you might be getting). Our server was a sorta  put out this vibe that he did not wanted to be stuck with us. He had an attitude whenever we would ask for something so we opted out of asking him and just starting asking anyone that would walk by. I felt bad asking others to assist us but I felt even worst asking our server. Overall the experience and food was amazing!!!!!! I highly recommend this place. The food was amazing. The drinks were spectacular and everything came out in a timely manner. I definitely will be returning whenever I'm in the area.
I grew up in brooklyn and moved to the bay a few yrs ago. Tony's is where u go for a real slice

Best gigantic meatball Ina white mushroom sauce. Delicious pizzas on all 4 ordered amongst us. Margherita, traditional cheese, cal Italia and the pizza Campari. If you don't eat inside you are missing out, however grabbing a slice next door is just as good. This place leads the charge on pizza!

That margherita is the best I've ever had in my life. Order it 100% - you won't regret it.

Fried calamari is on point too. excellent stuff

We arrived for lunch,  sat inside which was very comfortable. The food was real good and we really enjoyed it. The service was horrible,  the waiter was in a real hurry,  didn't explain anything and kept leaving. W had to ask the bus boy, very polite,  but didn't speak English well. The overall experience was poor and I'm not sure we will be back. It's unfortunate.

Tonys is the best pizza place in the Bay Area! Hands Down the best. The New Yorker pizza is packed with flavor. You can tell love and care were put into the making of their pizzas. The service is good, and our pizza arrived lightning fast. If you haven't been to Tonys you need to go! You will not be disappointed.

Delicious pizza. The restaurant on a Saturday night always seem to have a line out the door, but thankfully there is the take-out side where there is still a line but much faster. There is still some seating outside and a bench inside. The crust is amazing, chewy, and smokey. The toppings are classic with cheese, sauce, and the typical toppings. The service was pretty quick too.

WOW!
Thanks Chris! You made our lunch even better than our high expectations about Tony's Pizza.
Also thanks to all the reviewers here at yelp its always nice to compare note and experiences.
My husband found out about Tony's Pizza from reading the news not long ago and we decided to give it a try by bringing two our kids and a couple of their friends to try it out. We left early in the morning from south bay so we will get a couple of the 75  world best Pizza and we did, we got seated on the first round seating at lunch time on Saturday and lunch time with their best seat in the house the round table by the window beside the trophies,.Chris was wonderful greeting us and make us feel welcome and Brittany was our server who did a wonderful job. Thanks Tony's crew you make us felt like home and we will be back again very soon bringing our two college kids to share the experience.
Our Pizza was wonderful in my opinion the "New Yorker" made the day to all of us,  make sure you try that one.
We order 3 of the world Best Pizza and one New york and another New York to go and it was still the same when we had it at dinner ( make sure to heat it on the oven not microwave if you take some home, also make sure you eat the world best pizza when it hot its make a huge different on that pizza since it is so thing it get cold very quickly.
I love the pizza, Services is great.
If services is very important to you try to get in for lunch so they will be fresh at noon, it was really great for us, I have nothing to complain at all.
My teenagers said that Tony's pizza brought some life changes for them and and it was shared right away from the restaurants right after lunch.

Thank you Tony we will be back very soon.

Golden Boy Pizza has some delicious pizza!  The crust is just buttery enough and the sauce has the perfect amount of tang.  I like their pizza with extra sauce and double meat (they are a little bit skimpy on the meat).
Thick tasty foccacia crust for this pizza. Toppings are fresh & well-proportioned. By the slice is their thing. There was a short line out the door when we got there, so it was bound to be good.

I didnt wanna like it because it reminds me of all the pizza joints on Washington in South Beach Miami, FL- but Golden Boy is so much better than those dives! I eat here every other night about 11pm and my ass is still tight.

The pizza reminded me of a frozen DiGiorno pizza that you get at the grocery store.  Didn't taste very good at all, very bland.  I had a slice of pepperoni and the garlic clam and they were both below average.  There's some small letters up on the menu that says "cash only", so on top of having bad pizza, I had to run down the street to the BofA ATM to get cash.  There's definitely better pizza in North Beach and SF such as Baretta, Zero Zero, or Tony's.  Very disappointing.
Nothing too much to add here...awesome pizza.  Square.  Focaccia.  Stickers.  Lines.  Thrash metal.  You get the picture.  My new favorite greasy pizza joint in SF.
This pizza was AMAZING!!!! One slice is plenty for one person, you can grab and go or sit inside. Definite worth waiting if they have a line.

We're a Golden Boy Pizza family.  It's a dive bar with excellent slices of sicilian style pizza.  It's crowded, sometimes loud, and a bit on the dark side.  The local rock&roll bar crowd is seated at the counter, drinking fresh beer and crunching on their slices.  We've been going for years... it's consistently delicious.  Go expecting an unpretentious atmosphere at this tiny little hole in the wall - and enjoy the tasty slices.

So good! It's pretty rare to find pizza this delicious in slice form. The crust is definitely the best part (and I'm usually a thin crust fan). I only wish there were more seating inside...and an east bay location!

Stopped by here for a late night snack...aka the munchies. I loved the combo pizza and my friend and I shared a slize of pesto vegetarian - both very good. Good place if you're out 'n' about in North Beach.

Best pizza place in north beach! I'm not talking that gourmet crap you get at the fancy Italian sit-down restaurants that can only feed a rabbit... this is the saucy, cheesy, crave-worthy pizza you really secretly could eat every day of your life. It's hot, oozing cheese&sauce is flavorful, and the toppings make it out of this world :) My favorite is the meat lovers and pesto slices! Oh yeah, and did I mention they serve beer?!

After a night in the city this starts to taste pretty good. Although, I'm less inclined to enjoy pizza cut into cafeteria style squares if it isn't at least an inch thick. Sorry. Also, its a little pricey for what you get, I feel.

I'm not sure if this is my favorite slice in the City (not that there's alot of competition for that honor... unfortunately the dearth of quality pizza is one of the few deficiencies in SF's food scene), but I will say that I never hesitate to stop in here if I happen to be going out in North Beach.  The square slices (particularly the combo, which is delicious) are just as easily enjoyed to go or by grabbing a stool at the bar.  The lines can be long after 1am as the bars start to empty out, but it's worth the extra wait.  By the way, if you order your pizza to go and they ask if you want it "wrapped up", I'd advise against it.  The cheese ends up sticking to the paper .

i purposely park on Kearby and Greene just so on the way back i can say "hey guys lets get some pizza real quick"

why? because the pizza is delicious, u can grab a corona inside as you wait for heaven to come out of the oven. and after that you can treck the 10% incline of a hill to the car unknowingly sculpting your buttocks and stuffing your face with cheesy goodness bought @ $3.00 a slice.

what a deal almost compares to nordstroms anniversary sale.

This is an absolute MUST if you come to SF!  They have the BEST clam pizza!  I love going here for a late night snack after a post bar/club hopping rendezvous!!  Now that I'm thinking about it...I wouldn't mind having some RIGHT NOW!
405 people have already weighed in... I just felt like saying something positive about pizza today.
Best pizza I've ever eaten in my life. Restaurant was very clean but a little cramped. The pizza made up for it!
Amazing pizza spot! The menu is full of so many pizza options that I already have a plan to return for more pizza! You should definitely give this place a shot.

If you love pizza, then Tony's is  the place to be. Previous reviewers have described in details about its specialty Margherita pizza. I ditto them. It's a must try. Their services are top notch.  This place is  crowded and simply reflects how popular they are. The only cons in my opinion-  The restaurant  doesn't take reservations over phone. Be ready to wait for  minimum  45 mins. but again its worth it. Since its located at  North Beach area in San Francisco, it gets cold during night. Don't forget your jackets. Regarding parking it's hard to find street side parking, however few parking garages are located in the area. The North Beach garage is a good option.
One of the best Pizza locations in California in my opinion....tastes very good and the service is great. I like the atmosphere too. If you are in SF area I would highly recommend trying this place!
The food was good, not great and the portions were huge. The 3 stars is the service was avg at best. Maybe it is better inside than outside.

I am not sorry I love this place to death and consider myself lucky that I work within walking distance. The crust whether crispy re-heated or fresh from the oven doughy is such a joy of cheesy goodness. This is such a fun place to be in as it's set up like a bar that serves pizza so you feel like you are up to no good when you go to lunch here from work. There is always a buzz and if it's cold outside it's warm in here. If it's warm outside get your slices to go and have them in the square. Become a local here if you can.
ummm HELL YES.  This is my very favorite pizza in SF.  And kudos to the dude behind the counter that has to deal with drunk douche bags at 2am in North Beach.  You rock my socks, dude.

I've been coming here on and off for years. If I had reviewed them a couple of years ago I would have given them 5 stars. This past Sunday my sister and I stopped by Golden boy to get a couple of slices.The line wasn't to long but it took forever because there was only one person working. I felt sorry for her working so hard to take care of everyone herself. You would think on a busy Sunday they would have more workers.
We shared a combo slice and a cheese slice.
Both were good just not anything special and needed more cheese.
The pizza just wasn't as great as in the past.We were going to eat there but we soon realized that the stools and counter are only for VERY VERY SKINNY PEOPLE.
I could only fit half my butt on the stool and I'm not that big just a little thick.
I guess baby's got back who knew.
I don't think it was worth the wait and next time I'd go to Tony's Slice House down the street. If you like thick focaccia bread style pizza and have a small butt or your drunk you will love Golden boy pizza.
While visiting family my uncle told me "If you want the best pizza you ever had go to golden boy pizza" and he wasn't wrong
If you want pizza.. this is it. Simple, solid pizza. Everything about this place is great. Service, atmosphere and food are just spot on.

Tony's is a very popular spot. I have never eaten at the establishment, but have been by it many times, always packed. I have eaten the pizza only many times, It is delivered via catering where I work,regularly. So I am not getting it hot. Yet Tony's pizza is always full of flavor. We get many different offerings: traditional sausage, pepperoni..chicken, pineapple... Everyone loves the pizza!  I stress the pizza has lots of flavor,the crust is also good. At times i wish the crust were a bit thinner, but then that's my taste and many like it as is. And I enjoy it every time it's brought in. I would like to try in house and add one more star.

Tried this place and totally agree with so many if my fellow yelpers.. Had the Caesar salad, meatball appetizer & New Yorker pizza.. Salad was good, meatballs were some of the best we've ever had and the pizza was fabulous..

If you're going plan on waiting, we got thee about an hour after it opened and the wait time was already 45 minutes.. The establishment is a bit crowed but the food certainly makes up for all that.
Hostes was very rude, she made it very difficult to ask any question, and would ignore you when you would he standing right in front of her attempting to get her attention. [did not try pizza].

The honey pie I believe ! Is sooooo delicious we devoured it before I could get a picture we also had the New Yorker the crust is soooo good and the oil is infused and spicy and brings so much flavor to the pizza  can't wait to go back

World famous margarita pizza tastes like California pizza kitchen margarita pizza which is half the price. Calamari tasted too fishy, almost like it had gone bad. Our waitress talked in a patronizing voice and seemed to think we were dumb for wanting the fans turned on even though everyone was burning up next to the pizza oven. We had to ask other waiters and busboys for help since she ignored us multiple times when we tried to call her over to or table. 100% not worth the price. Average food and below average servers.
Excellent for your late night pizza. Line outside says it all. Good quality, well topped and thin crispy slice for $3.50.

Wow is the pizza here good or what? I really love the walk up window and grab a slice and be gone in less than 2 minutes. Can you get better service? I've been coming here for ages and my parents used to buy sheets of this pizza for my birthday parties when I was a kid. As long as they don't change, I'll keep coming back whenever I'm close by.

I don't come here after the bars in North Beach. I come here on Monday nights after a long weekend, long day at work and I just need to not think. I used to do clam garlic, veggie slices etc. I think the straight cheese pizza is the best here though. It really just highlights all that is simple and good in this world.
Typical post-bar drunk food. Nothing special here. In fact, I'm pretty sure I've had better pizza down the street at any of the other NB establishments. Wait is long and pricey for what it is.

Easy, cheap (cash only by the way), and fun. The best part is when you're walking up to the restaurant and you get that amazing pizza/sausage/pepperoni/crust smell in the air, makes my mouth water. Lines for take-out get long so be prepared to wait a bit. Considering it's pretty small and crowded on the inside, the place seems pretty clean and very well organized. Staff is awesome- very helpful, humorous, and help keep the customers flowing in and out quickly. Great pizza by the slice! One of my favorites in the city for a quick and tasty pizza fix.

This place is far from fancy, I like to refer to it as a "pizza joint".
Seating is limited, no tables just bar stools.

CASH ONLY, as are most of the Northbeach neighborhood establishments. They do however have an ATM machine in the back before the bathrooms.

Square pizzas, good size, great flavors (Pepperoni, Pesto, Clam & Garlic, Combination, Sausage, Cheese), tasty dough.
*ask for yours to be toasted, it tastes even better.

Regarding the ambiance, well this is a chill, relaxed setting with a flatscreen playing sports and pints of beer going around. The walls are covered with stickers, ceiling to floor, so make your visit extra special by bringing your own sticker and add to the collection.

Lunchtime and weekends bring in the crowds so be aware of the wait.
Best pizza in North Beach!! Sry North Beach Pizza; Golden Boy wins! Love that you guys are open til 2 am too.

Was in town for the weekend and found this little gem through yelp. A must try pizza place! Slices look small (maybe because they are squared)  but they are very filling. I tried the combination, pepperoni and garlic clam. All were delicious!
Really liked this place. Love the clam and  garlic. Yummy. The place is hip, good size slice and cheap. Ive had to make a small line before but it goes by quick.

I rarely give 5 stars to pizza joints, but it was so tough not to with Golden Boy, it's my favorite pizza place in the city and I love the double toasted square slices. The cheese and the pesto-vegetarian slices are outstanding and the service is quick. I've never eaten inside, I always get it to go, and you can't beat the price point. It's also a great late night spot after a night out drinking. I've never had a bad slice and I've eaten here dozens of times. Great, great, great pizza spot!

Had the Napoletana Margherita.  It was very good.  It's baked at a very high temperature, so the crust is blackened exactly the way I like it.

Because this place is so popular and is located in one of the most visited tourist areas of San Francisco, waits are a little longer and prices higher than you'd expect for similar pizza in other parts of town.  The menu is a bit overwhelming -- they have at least eight or nine different styles of pizza, and then in each style family there are various topping options.  There's Detroit style, St. Louis style, New York style, American style, Napoletana style, Roman style, Sicilian style and classic Italian style.  I may have missed one.  I can't complain about the selection, but just know it may take you a while to figure it all out.  Luckily, you can download their menu and review prior to going to the restaurant.

Very good pizza overall in a great location.  But a bit pricey for regular patronage.

Best pizza I've ever had. So tasty and crust was spot on! LOVED the cannoli too, cream was perfectly creamy with a perfect shell! Wonderful waitress, went above and beyond for all her customers. Even kept her smile when another customer only tipped her $1.88 for their lunch.

3.5 stars. We waited about 2 hours for a table, so by the time it was our turn to be seated, we were really hoping for an amazing experience. We were seated at an outdoor table which had a small heat lamp, but we didn't feel any heat from it. As soon as the sun set, we were freezing, including my poor kid. (We said ok to outdoor seating, not realizing the heat lamps weren't helpful.) The server was very nice but did not write down our order, and there were some disappointing mistakes: My kid really wanted pepperoni and they forgot it; we ordered a salad, and they forgot to bring it. We did not ask them to fix the mistakes because we were so cold, we just wanted to eat and go home. Our pizzas were delicious, but our experience was tainted by the long wait, cold weather, and messed up order.

Tony's Pizza Napoletana is as good as pizza can get.  He has a huge selection of pizza styles and the skills and tools to make them.   My only regret is not having enough time in San Francisco to try more of the menu.  We tried the Margherita pizza (the gold standard) - his Margherita pizza perfection - hands down!  

We also sampled the Cal Italia pizza which the restaurant made with a thinner crust upon our request. The cheese blend and thin crust make this pizza awesome!

We also sampled the appetizer, wood fired baby asparagus prosciutto wrapped spears, quail eggs, and smoked scarmoza - another outstanding job!  

I plan on returning soon to sample more of Tony's menu.

Came to Tony's because of all the hype and because I freaking love pizza. Was 1.5 hour wait so we decided to eat at the bar.

Drinks were great and the staff was very friendly. The pizza is another story.  I am a native NYer so my standards are pretty high as I've sampled the top places there many times and have conducted my own pizza tours.

I went to Tony's really wanting to like it. We ordered the coal fired New Yorker with house made fennel sausage, Calabrian sausage, ricotta, fresh mozz, pepperoni, and garlic. The bartender said it was her favorite. First of all when the pizza came out I couldn't even pick up a slice. It flopped over because the toppings were too heavy. Ok fine. I hade a knife and fork. After taking a bite the first thing I noticed was the sauce is too sweet. Totally ruined the pizza. The toppings weren't bad and the crust was delicious - clearly that's where Tony G knows his business. But if you're going to decorate your menu with 10 different styles of pizza, put the types of ovens you use and the temp you cook your pizza at then I'm going to expect a lot. Not sure if quality control or a bad recipe were at fault but I wasn't impressed. 2 stars for the pizza and a extra star for the drinks.

The place is fun and the pizza is OK. Just not buying the best pizza in the world. I don't think Dom Demarco, Chris Bianco, or anyone from Roberta's were at any of those competitions. #SpumoniGardensforlife

Please stay away from this place so that we don't have to continue to wait 1 hour 45 minutes for a table!  :)

The wait is long but its definitely worth it.  The staff was very helpful in explaining the MANY types of pizza they make (master) and will definitely help you find your favorite version.

What we like best:  
Pizza

If Neapolitan pizza is a 10 in Naples, and the best I have ever had this side of the Atlantic is a 9.5, this place's is about a 9.3.  This is my highest rating for a restaurant that is not a member of the "Associazione Vera Pizza Napoletana", so its a big compliment.  Its so hard to get prime tomatoes in the USA.  The service is very sympathetic and thoughtful every time.  Great location, and lots of atmosphere.  Its popular and tends to be busy, but always well worth the wait.

We love Tonys they have the best pizza in the city and also have Valet parking which is a big win. Any pizza or salad we have ordered has been delicious and the service is always excellent. They also have a bar and make great drinks.

I asked my friends for a good place to eat and Tony's pizza was recommended. I didn't think a pizza place was a good place for a sit down dinner but boy was I wrong. I went with my friend who luckily showed up an hour early to reserve our table. By the time I got there an hour later we were already getting ready to be seated. However, we were disappointed to learn that even though we got the text that we were not yet ready to be seated. They did make an effort to sit us at the next available table which was nice but took longer than I hoped it would.

When we finally sat down we were greeted with a wide array of different pizzas. There were awards peppered all over the menu. As I come from New York I didn't want to touch anything from New York so my friends and I opted for the Margherita (limited to 73 apparently but luckily They still had it I guess?) and Barcelona. I also decided to order a root beer since I was very thirsty but didn't want water. I appreciated that they served the root beer with a glass of ice.

The Barcelona came and I was disgusted because I thought I accidentally ordered pineapple pizza. However it was just eggs playing tricks on my eyes which was a relief. There were 6 small slices and I was glad we decided to get 2 pies. We handily finished it and it's hands down the best meat pizza I have ever eaten in my life. We dropped some prosciutto on the pan and we scrapped it off with our forks because perfection can not be wasted.

The Margherita came next and it had big dabs of cheese all over it. Again it was delicious, it was balanced between the sweetness of the sauce and the saltiness of the cheese. We quickly finished the pie and we asked for our receipt. Props to Tony's for not rushing us and kicking us out even though there was an hour wait for the joint. It's kind of a double edged sword. You want to sit ASAP so you want them to kick everyone eating out. But when you're eating you don't want to be rushed and we were given our time.

If money's not a problem and you want to try pizza which in NY isn't normally seen as gourmet this is the place for you. Try not to come during rushes because you will wait a long time however if you do come then make sure you have something to do while you wait as they text you when your reservation is ready.

If you're some north American guy and think chicken vodka penne is authentic Italian food then this place is cool, award winning and a classic of San Francisco, no need to read further.

If you're from Europe or even better from Italy (which I am, btw), avoid this place. The bucatini tasted like frozen pasta you get at the supermarket ("4 salti in padella", if you know what I'm talking about), were super spicy and full of black pepper, and the sausage was sweet - i don't mean mild, i mean i could taste the sugar.

The New Haven Lou pizza was also bad. Full of garlic (one rarely finds garlic on Italian pizza), but mostly full of chili pepper. Inedible.

Tl;dr avoid this place if you know what real Italian food tastes like.

EDIT: my coworker convinced me to try it again. I got a slice of cheese pizza. The only difference between that and a frozen/1$ slice is the tomato sauce, Tony s is not acidic. Still 5$ for a slice of that pizza is offensive.

We are a family of 5 that were on vacation in the area June 2018.  We were trying to not spend an arm and a leg for meals yet enjoy something local.  We selected Golden Boy off of Yelp without reading too much and I am so glad we did it this way.  The decor was not something we would normally pick when we are with our kids (ages 10, 15 and 16) yet none of that mattered and we all enjoyed it.  Actually, the decor added to the entire experience.  The staff was friendly and helpful as soon as we walked in (order at counter as soon as you walk in).  We then spent a bit walking and waiting to find some seats as there are not a lot of seating areas and the place stayed packed and busy.  Since turnover of customers keeps moving, we were able to grab some seats in time for our pizza.  THIS WAS DELICIOUS!  Even my husband who is from Chicago and has lived in NY loved this pizza.  Do spend some time reading the menu posted on the wall behind the counter too, it is great!  We loved the pizza so much that we almost went back for a second meal even though we had limited days to enjoy various places.  Can't wait to return to Golden Boy Pizza!

Good late night pizza place after hanging out in North Beach.  The pizzas are thick Sicilian slices.  Pepperoni, meat, vegetables.  These slices really hit the spot when you are hungry.  I like the crispy crust and the raw doughy flavor.  I know that doesn't sound good, but it really is.  Try it and see.

Perfect place to get your hangover food. Probably the cheapest pizza joint in this area. Service is nice and quick (looking at how small and crowded the place is normally). They serve alcohol as well which really compliments the pizza they serve.

I had such high hopes for this place.  There is always a line.  But I'm guessing the line is for the bathroom, because the pizza ain't all that.

What a disappointment.

I agree with Brian W. serve me up some tube socks.

What do you do when it's 1 AM and your group has just finished drinking in the tenderloin and has a sudden serious need for pizza? Well certainly you high-tail it towards North Beach and get on your Yelp app stat! Golden Boy had great reviews and upon our arrival, a massive line so we jumped on in and did our time. The payoff was a new Foursquare friend formed while in line plus several large rectangles of doughy, cheesy goodness, perfect for balancing out our cocktail-fueled evening. We're talking heavy duty pizza here, not exactly what I'd chose to grab for a light lunch but absolutely perfect for late night needs and everyone in line already knows that.

i was wandering arounf north beach looking for an atm machine during last night's yelp gathering at the magnet.  i'd had a few drinks, when some one asked me for change.  i looke dup, and there was the golden boy.  i knew the place would be tasty with bums hanging out outside of it, and it was.

golden boy has pretty decent sicilian (square) pizza by the slice.  the sauce is tasty, the crust is good, and its cheap.  plus, they were playing ridiculous death metal.  

truly a hole in the wall experience i hope to enjoy again
By far the BEST Sicilian style pizzas in the city. Great spot to build a base before going out to drink. And a great spot to go after you've had enough and need something in your stomach.
Golden Boy Pizza is where it's at!  Sooooo good.  This is not a fancy place.  Don't go here looking for atmosphere.  Come for the pizza and leave very happy.

OMG! Visiting a friend here in SF and he tells me this place has the best pizza! Not only do they have the best pizza but great prices! The crust is light with a bit of crunch and that in itself makes it a four star! The goodies on top complete the last star!

Small joint with superb pizzas!!!  Their clam and garlic, cheese, and pepperoni pizzas are great.  I haven't tried the rest of the others yet, but I am sure they are absolutely great.  My girlfriend and I sat at the pizza shop to have a few slices and a drink...Tony, who served us our pizza, was warm and funny.  Almost felt like we've been going there for years.  Thanks for the peer cider and the snake bite, Tony!

Who would have thought that a square pizza pair with a orange soda could be so good..... Its not fancy just plain with bar stools that line up the narrow hallway. It's a gem and worth going in... I never experimented with the calm garlic pizza. But their veggie pizza or plain cheese is awesome. And yes, its open late very convenient for the after the club munchies. Warning you might have to wait in long line on the weekends.

Clam garlic pizza is money hands down! Only thing that sucks is that it's not big in size.. but it is huge on taste. The texture of their dough is what makes their sicillian style pizza so great. It's crispy and flaky on the edges and soft, doughy and fluffy on the inside. I always have to order at least two just to snack on.
It's a cool place with an interesting deco, but not for a long stay! Good for just to get a quick quality bite! The crust was really good and I really liked it! I think I'll go back again :)

I'm one of the owners at the Mercato (goo.gl/pP0eD) and always see the lines out the door here, so I decided to try it, and it instantly became my favorite pizza place in North Beach.  Others love the clam pizza, but I prefer the other flavors.

This place has been here for a long time and has stayed just as good. I love the pizza and it's fun to hang out here sometimes and have beer too. This place retains the spirit of how the neighborhood used to be before the tech take over. It's nice to go to places that remind me of the old San Francisco.
Best drunk slice in North Beach.

So we've always passed this place and most of the time, there's a line out the door. So after watching the giants game, we decided to go get some pizza. What better place to go to than go to Golden Boy Pizza. We got there around 12:30... I've never tried their pizzas but let me tell you...One of the best slices of pizzas I've ever had. Too bad there isn't another Golden Boy pizza location somewhere in the peninsula.
I love this pizza especially after long work week or a couple of cocktails with the co-workers. I can't eat it at lunch time or I fall into a blissful pizza coma!

Although the crust was a bit soggy and the pizza itself was nearly parsleyed to death, the delicious and generously sized clam and garlic slice totally hit the spot for late night munchies. Lots of garlic and clams, too.
Yum!  My alcohol infused body thanks you for bringing out a fresh sheet of pizza just as we were sitting down at the counter.
Some of the best pizza I've ever had. Huge menu, and you got a ton of food for a decent price.

Go here, you won't regret it! I got my favorite combo-margherita pizza (award winning) with sausage. Sauce- perfect acidity and sweetness. Dough-no too chewy or crusty. Perfectly thin. This place was recommended to me by a friend who has documented all the best pizza shops he's visited around the world. He raved about all pizzas but particularly recommended the Detroit pizza which is square and has a perfectly melted cheesy crust all around it. It's a little more filling so we ended up getting the traditional thin crust that I usually get which as described above was very good- on my top 3 list for sure. If you look at the yelp pics, you'll see a lot of people rave about the New Yorker as a must have so I initially was going to get that but again, the way it's served is a little bigger than what we were wanting to eat. A couple next to us was having it and we did ask them what they thought. Both said they'd definitely order it again and it's one of the better pizzas they've ever had but it did not blow them out of the park per yelp. I also noticed that the crust was a little harder and thicker than the thin pizza so it depends on what you like and what you are curious about trying. What's great is that they seem to have a big variety of pizzas you can try. When I go back, I definitely try the Detroit pizza. I'm curious about the cheesy crust. The bartender told me his favorite pizza was the Barcelona, so maybe you can try that too! Happy pizza dining!

HOW CAN YOU NOT GIVE THEM 5 STARS?!?!

They have incredible, fresh food & a very attentive & courteous staff.

We had the margherita pizza and the New Yorker pizza. It was perfection and my taste buds are going crazy just thinking about them.

The fresh mozzarella and homemade pizza sauce is the best I've had, like better than New York and Chicago good.

The wait is not ever bad because it's pizza, we're talking like 15-30 when it's packed. And it's always packed.

IT IS WORTH THE WAIT DONT LET THE CROWD DISCOURAGE YOU & take you away from this life changing experience. I will always recommend this place and love it forever(:

The crust to die for, I could tell the moment they put that baby on the pedestal it deserved. The added meatballs thinly sliced was perfect, plenty of sauce. I would add more fresh basil & my guy from Queens, NY, grew up eating little Italy pizza, said more cheese please. Seasonal beet salad was good, they prep it early. I wish all the salads would be prepared as ordered. I don't like super, just out of the fridge-chilled prepped salads, and another thing get some carafes of a descent red wine, this is an Italian pizza restaurant. FBWM has their own, buy it from them.
The wait was worth it. We will be back the next time we are in San Francisco. We had the Picante, had the right amount of heat. Can't wait to try something else off the menu.

Superb.  We had a margerita and a New Yorker and both were superb.  The margerita was light and flavorful and all the tastes were well balanced.  You could taste the quality of the ingredients.  The new Yorker was absolutely D-licious.  The ricotta added a creamy texture to some of the bites, and the sauce was robust and a little spicy, but excellent.  The toppings were all very good and overall, the experience was great.  We got there right as they opened and walked right in along with a few other people who were waiting.

If you read most of the recent 1 and 2 star reviews, they are all nonsensical crap  about "oh they yelled at me when I asked a question" or "waaaahh waaahh waaahh they didn't give me change for parking" or "there was lipstick on a glass" (can happen anywhere) or "the manager was rude to me."  Also, most of these reviews are from people with 1 or 2 reviews on Yelp, which in my book is an almost automatic move to the waste bin.  How about reviewing the food instead of sobbing like a bunch of babies for your one yelp review about stuff almost no one else experienced?  The service was great and friendly and quick for us.  Also, the bread with 3 different oils for dipping was EXCELLENT.  Overall, my only issue would be that it was a bit pricey, but honestly, not really much more than any other similar high grade pizza place.

Eddie Muenster. That's all I have to say. My husband and I drive to San Francisco from LA with the sole intention of having this pizza for dinner. We have been eating here for years and wish we could have It more often. This place is hands down the best pizza place ever. The flavors of the pizza's, but especially our favorite, the Eddie Muenster, are beyond perfect. Just had this place two nights ago and are still blown away. Love this place.
Wife had a slice I had a calzone, very good food, found it easy on our trek of SF, it seems they a place in Vegas
My pizza was delivered cold. I'd ordered a pasta but they failed to give me any utensils. While I was eating my garlic bread, I discovered 2 strands of hair. Never again.

The New Yorker pizza was delicious! My husband and I both ordered the Caesar salad and the server was kind enough to state it was a large portion that we could share. He wasn't kidding! We were recommended Tony's by one of our tour guides and we were not disappointed. The only reason I gave 4 stars and not 5 was due to being seated at a 2 top table next to the bar. We had people right up against our table waiting which was uncomfortable. Next time we are back in San Francisco, we most definitely will be going back to Tony's!
Best pizza in town. Minus one star because it's cash only. Who carries cash?

Awww man! This pizza joint is real good! A must in SF!! Reminded me of some spots in Chitown as my current city (PDX) fails to deliver on pizza.  Highly recommend this pizza joint. Small & friendly staff.
Clam and garlic. $3.75. I don't need to say more. It's perfect for those after North Beach drinking munchies. Staff here is always friendly and the quality is great.
Pizza and F#ckin' Hard Speed Rock.  I love this place!
I want to try the Sodini's place next door to this, but only this Pizza spin-off was listed in Yelp (at the time of this writing).

Best pizza i have ever had, i come here way to much now but its worth the travel across the city. i hear the clam garlic is great but i haven't had it yet but i can tell you the sausage, peperoni, and cheese are great every time. OH! and if you get a corner piece you are very lucky cause thats the best piece out of the sheet .

This has been my favorite, favorite, favorite pepperoni pizza since I was in high school.  This square sliced pizza, comes with a mystery sauce, with italian seasoning melted in cheese & pepperoni.  Two slices and now that I am legal, a Hefenweizen....I'm in sports heaven.  Yes the flat screen games, but very littel wiggle room and also a must for midnight munch if you should be in North Beach at that yay hour.

hello lover...

fluffy dough, perfect sauce, lots of toppings. and CHEAP! screw the touristy italian places around this neighborhood...go here

OMG. So freaking good! My husband and I were at a bar in North Beach with his co-workers and we were craving pizza. So of course I used Yelp on my iPhone to find pizza places nearby. We made sure to leave the bar by 11:00pm to get to Golden Boy Pizza before they closed at 11:30pm. We ordered 2 slices of cheese and 1 slice of spinach. Oh my goodness...deeeeelicious. Golden Boy Pizza is now the pizza standard for my husband and me. It's just too bad it's not close to a BART station.
great thick crust pizza! sauce tastes like they make it with wine or some other delicious secret ingredient. Great for dinner when out drinking in north beach!

Amazing pizza. Best I have had since Italy. They only do 73 margarita pizza's a day so if you want one I recommend lunch. Also make a reservation. With 4 award winning pizza chefs you can't really go wrong. One received best iternational pizza chef award and another chef won an award in Italy.
If you do not have more than two in your group you can sit at the pizza bar and watch them make the brick oven pizza. Warning though you will probably eat more than planned if you do that. That's what happened to us. We had to have a second pizza and one is more than enough. Had to climb some hills after.
Anyway it was a good experience for our occasional trip to sf.

Is it just me or does anyone else agree that it is over hyped? Luckily we beat the dinner crowd by 2 minutes. About an hour wait at 730pm on a Tuesday though. We ended up snagging a seat at the bar which saved us about 25 minutes. It was also hot that day and the fan wouldn't oscillate.

The seven sisters cocktail was pretty good and the Caesar salad was decent. Our pizzas were just OK. I expected more from a place so highly rated.

Lots of people were here to watch the Giants and Sharks game playing. I think I would eat elsewhere if I were in the area though.

My daughter and I dropped in here late on a Friday night starving after a long trip.  The waitress suggested the meatball appetizer as it would come out quickly - and it did. Within seconds were sharing 3 delicious meatballs (you should order the larger portion of 6 for only $3 more).  We moved on to the fried green beans, award winning margherita pizza and an order of pasta (with more meatballs). All were great.  Service was good.  Low key environment. Couldn't be more satisfied.
Sat outside on a wonderful Saturday afternoon and enjoyed the New Yorker pizza. Cold Peroni beer and fabulous pizza!!

As always, Tony's is supreme. We ordered the Detroit Motörhead, a favorite of ours, and it didn't disappoint. We tried the Great Grandma for the first time and it was fantastic! The sweetness of the port reduction, with the salty of the prosciutto and the spicy arugula was a real winner. The biggest problem with Tony's, no not the wait (it was an hour) but choosing which pizza to get. I definitely recommend Tony's!!!

Can't put in any other way..except...Delicious! This is me and my family's 2nd visit here are Tony's and it's just as good as the first time. I even brought a friend to  try the Margarita Pizza..so good. We also got a New York pepperoni. No words needed..we ate it all. Even gonna get a pizza to go. Must try if in San Francisco area..but hurry cause the Famous Margarita pizza is only sold till it's gone!!!

DETROIT PIZZA DETROIT PIZZA DETROIT PIZZA DETROIT PIZZA DETROIT PIZZA

DO IT!

I have been here four times. It was great every time but the past two times I have had my mind blown by Detroit pizza. This is the most perfect pizza. It is an umami bomb, it is so painfully savory it will make you weep.

The Margarita is great as well; but I think the one at Una is better. This time we also tried the Saint Louis pizza, which is pretty wacky. It's not my favorite, but it is really good too.

The caesar is really good. Also, they put delicious oil packed white anchovies on it.

People have to stop complaining about the wait times; that is what happens when you have a very popular restaurant that won't compromise on the quality of their food. Just put your name in, go take a walk, sit in the park, grab a beer at Rogue, etc and they will call you when your table is ready.

Great pizza, great crust, great toppings. No wonder he is 10 time world champion.
Great job Tony.
Absolutely perfect in every way for some classic Italian-american dinning. The best meatballs I've ever had and some top notch pizza. It gets VERY busy so plan accordingly, but DO NOT MISS!!
Nice ambience, music and food. Haven't had this kind of pizza before - for vegetarian folks ok with spice, order honey pie.

Ok, Ive only been living in the city for about 6 months but I live in Lower Nob Hill and there are tons of subpar pizza places in the Tenderloin and Union Square area. Today I got 2 nice slices of pizza and a coke from Golden Boy in North Beach and it was a little over 8 bucks. OMG THE CRUST was to die for!!! What you want is a slice from a pie right outta the oven. I will be making my trip to North Beach for pizza from now on, because I THINK I may have found my favorite slice in San Francisco! Good Job Golden Boy!!

I've been coming here my whole life.

The pizza is not bad. It's actually OK. And shaped like a square.

Come on, where else can you find a place like this?  Consistently great cheap pizza, nice cold beer selection, cool staff, galvanized siding and harsh loud music. I honestly don't know how they make money. I go to every time I'm in the city. Detractors need to shut up and go elsewhere. The line needs to be filled with fans only. I love this place.

This is awesome drunk pizza! Other than it, it really isn't anything special. The service was prompt and the slice was prepared quickly. The lady who helped me was really nice asking if I wanted to put any peppers or parm cheese on it and asking if I would like it wrapped.

I took it like it is with a root beer all for only 4.25. I wish I could have tried all the different slices so I could give a more accurate review, but I'll probably never be back so I have to go based off the cheese slice I ordered.

A great pizza has a good crust, a great sauce, and fresh ingredients. The crust nice, buttery, and thick the way I like it. Flavor wise tough, the crust wasn't special is any sense, just a plain pizza crust. The sauce had a good flavor to it, but I wish there was a little more of it since the crust was so hefty. The biggest disappointment was the cheese. When I order a plain cheese pizza I expect it to be cheesy. Unfortunately for me it wasn't. It had barely enough to cover the crust and sauce.

All in all if you are drunk and want an okay slice for a good price this is the place.

The sausage is bomb, yo. But get the combo.
The line is ALWAYS out the door. Well, you order at the door so if there's even one person in line, you're probably standing outside. We've gotten there about 15 mins. before they opened and had to wait in line. BUT IT IS SO WORTH IT. The Boyfriend is from the East Coast and he says this is the best pizza in California. We went for the first time at night and it was CRAZY PACKED like, there were no seats so we were worried we just wasted an hour trying to park and weren't going to be able to sit down and enjoy our pizza and beer. But, as if the gods were speaking to us, 2 seats cleared up just as we ordered, they had Prohibition on tap and the sausage was fresh out the oven. Every single time we go to SF, we go here and we're not stopping any time soon. Oh and I'm pumped I got a Golden Boy hoodie because nothing beats a sweatshirt with boxing gloves, wings and a cheesy slice of pizza on the back.
Holy cow that's good pizza. Perfect space for the business. It's thick pizza. Don't go if you want a thin wedge: that is Tony's. This is its own thing and it's amazing.
The garlic clam pizza is to die for!! There is never any spots to sit and eat, I would take my meal to go! Then, walk down the street to Stella's bakery for dessert:)

Okay, maybe it's just that it's always 2:00 in the morning when I'm eating here, and I tend to be starving, and I've usually had a few cocktails, but I still think this is the best pizza in the city.  Well, maybe it's a tie with Tomasso's.  Tomasso's is pretty tough to beat.
Goes together with a night at Gino & Carlo like...well...beer and pizza.

You're naughty Golden Boy finger sign, lit up in the fog, pointing me towards two things I absolutely need no more of:  Pizza and Beer.  But I love you anyway, in all your naughtiness.  Naysayers be damned, Golden Boy is a great place.  The pizza and the beer always hit the spot--and it is open late.  I don't live in the hood and I don't eat here very often, but when I do I'm always hoping to come back sooner than later.

Golden Boy came to the rescue one night out in NB. We were meeting up at Rosewood and I was starving. After walking up Columbus asking everyone where to go for a slice, the Italian waiter at Steps of Rome said oakaayya gooaa uppa tua blacks anda taka righta anda keepa tua youra lefta. I thought he was screwing with us, especially with phony accent. But low and behold we found it and the slices were incredible.
Ah the church of Golden Boy Pizza. You are amazed and wowed and can't wait to tell everyone about it afterwards.

Three stars because pizza was already made and sitting in the window.  More of a fast food atmosphere and not really suitable for families or groups of more than 2 people due to bar stool seating only.  Pizza was just ok and nothing over the top.
THREE WORDS GAR  LIC  CLAMs. the best. hole in the wall joint. cashier with attitude and sasyness. is that a word? ....neither is hella.

Totallah! My boyfriend eats here practically every week. The crust is perfect and crunchy.  the cheese and the sauce work together  to make my tongue and tummy happy. my mouth is watering as i type this.

Price: To get pizza as authentic as this and as good as this, I thought I'd be paying like $30 a pizza or something. For three people, our bill came out to ~$56, which was very reasonable to us. Getting 2-3 pizzas with 3 toppings each at a Domino's or something would run you just as much money. So I felt the pricing was very fair and reasonable.

Quality: My table ordered the New Yorker and the Margarita. Definitely enough food for 3 people, and it was some of the best pizza I've had in a while! The crust on the pizzas was delicious. It was slightly burnt (in a good over fired way), but crispy and and light. I'll definitely be back to sample the other menu items.

Service: Had to wait an hour at 9pm to get a table, but it was worth it! Our server was very friendly and attentive.

There might be a bit of a wait to get a table, but it's worth it if you're looking for some delicious Italian pies. If it's late in the year when you visit, I would definitely suggest dropping some extra $$$ for the shaved white truffles when they're in season (one of the best dishes my family has ever had). The staff is warm and welcoming, and there is a great selection of side dishes, beer and wine. Good for families, foodies and lunch/dinner with friends.

Hummmm, just
OK.  Did not like it much

Wouldn't know how the food is. Never got in. Signed in at the desk and was told it was a two hour wait. Went to check on status an hour later and was told they didn't have my reservation. They told me it was my fault that they didn't enter the information correctly and the George pulled a serious attitude telling me it's just too bad and deal with it. Got  the manager who said his staff doesn't make mistakes. His concession for his inept and rude staff?  Put us on the wait list and give us a 15 minute credit. No apologies, no, I'll take care of it. May be the best pizza in the world but also the worst customer service in the world.

Recently dug up a picture of me in a rocker under the bar here, and now I understand why I crave this place like the air I breathe.

I swear, everytime I go back it gets better (and that would be 25+ years of eating this stuff).

Shout out to Julien and the rest of the boys and girls working the counter and cookin up the magic- you guys rock

A really good place for a slice of pizza. The first thing that I noticed about it was that the pizza isn't in Pie form. The pizza is a long inch thick piece of pizza crust that has stuff on it. It's about what I'd expect pizza was like before it came to America, or at least how it returned to Italy.

The conistency of the crust reminded me of the deep dish pizza that domino's used to do (or still does). The edges had a nice little crispness to it. There really isn't a "end crust" like you get in a pie.

The downside to the pizza I had there was that the pepperoni pizza had like 5 pieces of pepperoni per slice. The combination slice, though, was chalk full of toppings. So if you're gonna go here take a look at the slices before you order and make sure you aren't going to get what is essentially a slice of cheese pizza. The pepperoni wasn't anything special.

I wouldn't make this a destination but might go out of my way while walking around North Beach to get a slice here. I'd definitely only get the combination slice from them.

Totally worth the visit, but not the end all slice either.
I've been eating Golden Boy's Pizza for years and it's still my most favorite pizza in the city. It hits the spot so good. Try the Clam Garlic or Combo...the best of the best!

The best pizza in NB!   Always great to squeeze up at the counter (slightly drunk), listen to the hungry sots around you while you wait for your slice to warm in the pizza ovens, look dreamily at the old boxing gloves hanging behind the counter while dreaming of dancing circles around your latest enemy, and then shake parmesan and hot pepper flakes on your steamy cheesy rectangular chunk of pizza as its tossed down on the counter in front of you, as the warm aroma wafts up over your face.  YUM, i think i'm drooling now.

It may be better because i've never had it sober, but it's damn tasty. Thick but still crispy on the bottom. Yum. Loses 1/2 a star because they only have deep dish- but gets that same 1/2 back because it's...you guessed it...walkable...which is particularly convenient when  I'm eating this pizza since, as I said, I have not ever had it sober-- has anyone?!?!

Always amazed when people who should know better fall for the Hype on the Margherita. Guess they get Hypnotised.

We ate here last month and had wanted to try it for a long time based on their reputation and Yelp reviews so we chose the Margherita pizza which is their Signature Pizza and only available in limited numbers of 72 per day so when its gone, its gone. We thought this would be the best way for our introduction to Tony's out of dozens of choices and there were but two of us and we didn't want to stuff ourselves with more than one pizza so we felt trying out the Signature pizza was the way to go. Well we were some what disappointed that the pizza was just average when we were expecting so much more. It was definitely a good pizza, nothing wrong with it but in world of gourmet pizza it was nothing to write home about. We were puzzled and disappointed that the Signature dish was so average. Maybe they could change the Signature pizza to something that didn't get so many complaints.

However we will be back to sample the other choices. Service was good and our waiter pleasant and knowledgeable so we had a great day. We also had an appetizer that was good but I can't remember what it was. I think it was the butter that had some outrageous North Beach honey mixed into it. I was very skeptical about the claim of NB honey but our waiter informed us that they had a beehive on the 3rd floor as well as a beekeeper to harvest the North Beach gold!

My friend Kelli who is very experienced in the food and wine industry really enjoyed the restaurant and also wants to try it again even though it was sort of a shock that the Signature pizza was just average!

Three stars for the pizza (so sad) and four stars for the dining experience.
The best pizza I've ever tasted. I'm still dreaming of the coccoli bread pouches. Definitely worth the wait for a table.

This is the place you have been searching for!! ( and by you I mean me)The Eddy Munster is one of our favorites but absolutely every single pizza is a masterpiece and the dough has a glorious stretch and chew with the perfect crunch. It is family friendly, the staff is so nice and even if there is a line for a table, it's absolutely worth the wait.

After returning from the Alcatraz evening tour all we wanted was a simple pizza in our hotel room. Several people recommended Tony's so we decided to give it a shot. It was a little hassle since they don't deliver and we had to go thru UberEATS and we waited almost an hour for the pizza. BUT it was 1000% worth the hassle and he wait. Soooo good!!! Perfect crispy crust, fresh tomatoes and cheese.  Scrumptious!
Really good pizza. the stout pizza was very good but spicy . Place is not cheap but worth because it all tasted so good. The vegan dish took forever so they comped it, nice.

With a chef who won the World Pizza Championship, it must be good, and Tony's certainly lives up to the hype.

Food was incredible, and whoever thought that dipping bread in honey with a chopped up garlic clove should be given a medal.

Ambiance was as incredible as the location, and they have a very cool bar with a solid beer selection. Pizza is also served on a hand painted Italian serving plate.

The menu was one of the coolest things, because it tells you what kind of oven and which temperature it was cooked. There were gas ovens, wood ovens and even a coal oven.

My one gripe was the price. Yes it is probably the best Italian style pizza I have ever had, and yes the attention to detail is mind boggling, but $20 for a pizza that barely feeds one? Come on.

That said, if I ever want to splurge on the best pizza around, I wouldn't go anywhere else.

I'm already craving it and I just had 2 savory slices last night! I had some before I went drinking so I could really enjoy it, but as many know, it's the only place to be for a slice after too many spirits! You may have to wait in line at the window but that's part of the fun. Once you get it, sit down on the sidewalk and consume pure square-cut pleasure while the rest just drool.

If you haven't had Golden Boy, go now! Hell, I would cab it across town just to get a slice.

1:30am, Friday night.
Wandering North Beach, drunk.

"Hey, I'm hungry. Let's find some pizza."
  "There's a place very there called 'Golden Boy'"

"Hey lady, how much for two slices?"
  "$6"

10 minutes later...

"I'm stuffed. Thank you, patron saint of late night pizza-by-the-slice"

Considering the deliciously satisfying-while-drunk pizza as well as the cute drunk chick who started feeling everyone up in line while yelling "Today's my birthday!" and "LET'S GO BRONC-OS," Golden Boy gets my seal of approval for making me not hungry, when I had been just a moment before I saw it's neon sign shining through the middle of the foggy night.
Yum.

the perfect portable meal: focaccia style pizza with a tangy-sweet layer of tomato sauce topped off with bed of juicy veggies + thick doughy crust burnt at the edges = lots of textures going on.

very few pizzas, sadly, have all these key elements to make it a success.

Hands down the best pizza I've ever had.  It's so good I try not to think about it when I'm not in San Francisco, because it makes me want to book a flight just for Golden Boy.  Hugely thick slices, and that's thick with cheese and toppings.  I've never been able to put down more than two, and I'm a big eater.  Take a chance and go for the clam and fresh parsley slice, if they have it.  It took me a few trips to get gutsy enough to try, but damn was it worth it.  Unless you order a whole pie, you have two pizzas in the window to choose from but I've never been even slightly displeased with any of their slices.  I'm also a big fan of meat and all-meat pizza, but I always go for at least one veggie pesto slice because the vegetables, especially the zucchini, always taste super fresh and delicious.

Cool staff too, skater type dudes generally.  You gotta love any place that has a picture of Christopher Walken placed prominently on the wall, and that plays skate DVDs as the entertainment.  Once I was there and the server noticed my jacket covered with punk rock patches, and started talking to me about punk.  I was drinking a Red Hook--as I'm almost done with the pint he grabs the glass and refills it.  Before you know it, I got 4 beers for the price of one.  I don't remember the guys name, but he was possibly the friendliest server I've ever had outside of a strip club.  Another time I was there before a show, and was tired and in an insanely bad mood, not even wanting to go to the show afterward.  The female server they had at the time (this is over ten years ago btw) was so nice that just talking to her put me in a good mood again.  Of course, that life-changing slice didn't hurt either.

It's a small place with two metal counters, so it can be crazy on Friday or Saturday nights.  I've never found that to be an issue either though, since everybody is so blissed-out on the pizza I've had nothing but good times there (I've gone at least 40-50 times).  I'm not sure why anyone wouldn't like this place, someone else pointed out the level of the reviewer's drunkenness may be a factor.  Maybe so, but drunk or sober, Golden Boy's slabs of loveliness do it for me every time.
If I am ever on death row, I might likely request to have a Golden Boy slice and a beer as my final meal.

I don't go to North Beach very often because...I fucking hate North Beach. I'm not trying to hate, it's just not my cup of tea, ya dig? So because of my feelings I so rarely get to eat Golden Boy. I occasionally act as auxillary-substitute-trivia-mistress at the Church Key, so when I do that I always duck in for a slice of the garlic clam pizza. This pizza sounds not good, but, it is very not NOT good! Maybe I'll head down for a slice tomorrow, if I think I can bear it!

I decided to tough the traffic and any parking issues to try Golden Boy Pizza because of the reviews and the photos. I ended up ordering a pepperoni, sausage, and combo. In all honesty, there's nothing too special about the pepperoni or sausage. The combo was good, but not worth the trip. Price is kinda pricey. Not cheesy enough for my taste.
Wow, all I can say is I can see why there is line going out of this place always.  I am already craving another piece.

Tried the garlic clam pizza here and I was not too impressed. Maybe there wasn't enough garlic or enough clams but it just didnt hit the spot and tasted like eating bland pizza. The other possible reason why I wasn't impressed is that I ate a $40 steak dinner about 3 hours prior. I might give this place another shot.
Possibly the seediest, dingiest, and best tasting pizza place in the entire city.
Delicious!! A friend took me here, and we finished two pizzas easily! Come early to get the Margherita pizza because they only make a limited amount per day. The Barcelona was my personal favorite.

My dad wanted to come here for lunch one day. He said we had to show up early because they make only a limited amount of margherita pizzas, and if you're gonna have pizza, that's what you want to get.  We got there an hour before they open which I thought was super early, obviously we were first in line. However, soon after, a line started forming behind us and before I knew it, the line looked almost 100 people long.  When we sat down we ordered the margherita, and also prosciutto e pomodorini. Both were amazing, I hate to say it but i think I liked the prosciutto pizza more. The only thing issue I had was the char on the bottom of the first pizza, I know that's what most people look for and like, but to me it had a sightly odd taste. Not that I hated it, just a little different.  That was there only thing keeping it from getting 5 stars. As a whole though, if you like pizza (and who doesn't) this place is a must try just to at least experience world famous pizza!

the best pizza ever!!! And I have had a lot of pizza .

I was searching on yelp for the best pizza around and decided on Tony's since I love a wood burning oven pizza. I was about to try the margarita which looked amazing and then Tony himself came out and made me a special pie. Wow was this pizza AMAZING!! I sat at the bar and enjoyed it. It had a delicious perfect tomato sauce, sweet tender sausage and pepperoni. It was awesome! Then the app I ordered was ridiculously good. It was called Coccoli - Italian the prosciutto do Parma was perfectly sliced and then the fried dough was not greasy but airy and had just the right amount of seasons. The cheese tasted similar to burrata. Very flavorful !! I would say if you some phenomenal pizza go to tonys! You won't want to miss this :)

Great service at the bar! I believe the bartender's name was Varnelle (s/p). He was so engaging and handled a packed bar very well. The margarita he made for me was one of the best I've had. He took great pride in his work and treated it like an art.

The pizza was also fantastic. I had a regular cheese pizza and it was yummy. I'm a picky pizza eater (Chicago pizza taste buds :)). Also had a salad that was very tasty. Would definitely go back if I visit SF again.

As if this place needs another review. Seriously, it's amazing, and you should go. The Cal Italia is EVERYTHING. Salty and sweet, unusual yet familiar. Perfect.

Waiting is no problem since they have text alerts. Just grab a Moscow Mule at the bar next door, and your table will be ready before you know it.
Great pizza but it's so hard to get a table and their waitlist system is bad as you end up hanging around outside the restaurant for a while. Very good pizza though.

This place is my number 1 choice of the best pizza I have ever eaten. The first time I came here, I ordered the margarita pizza and the New Yorker and my first slice of pizza was the margarita and I wasn't impressed at all on how the pizza look or taste. The margarita pizza was just sauce, cheese and tomatoes, and to my preference I felt like it was too plain to me.

But then, I took a slice of the New Yorker and it was absolutely delicious. I had my first bite and wanted some more after that. The combination of toppings was brilliant, pepperoni, Italian sausage, mozzarella and the most important ingredient of all, ricotta cheese. The ricotta cheese made the pizza so distinctive that I have never tasted on the pizza, and every time I got to the ricotta part, I was amazed on how good it to taste. Another way of saying it is "goodness in your mouth". I came here a second time and the taste was the same as before. I will recommend this place any day, but you have to get the New Yorker pizza instead, you will most likely not be disappointed.

Tony's is the best pizza I have eaten in my life, that is no exaggeration!  I can't wait to go back and try more food!  It was a very nice dining experience, the staff and atmosphere was very nice. The New Yorker pizza was the BOMB!  One of the best meals I have had in SF!!
Yes, the pizza is really that good. It is by far the best pie in SF. The main drawback is the wait.

We came here on a Friday night and had to wait about and hour and half.  However the wait wasn't too bad because they take your name and then text you when your table is ready, which was pretty convenient because we were able to walk around.  
The wait was well worth it.  The pizzas here are the absolute best.  We started off with the calamari, and 3 meatballs.  The calamari was good and had half regular and half spicy.  We all thought the spicy was really spicy so I if you can't handle the heat stick with the regular.  The meatballs was also very delicious with its accompanying marinara sauce.  We then ordered the New Yorker (a gold winner in Vegas) which was my favorite.  I loved the mozzarella, crushed tomatoes and all the pepperonis, sausage.  It was so tasty and the crushed tomatoes added so much flavor, and can easily say that this was the best pizzas I have ever had, besides the pizzas I have had in Italy.  We also tried Cali Italia which was another good one that won a gold medal on food network.  It comes with asiago, prosciutto, fig, and balsamic which is drizzled over the pizza.  Again and other great pizza and the balsamic reduction really stands out.  

Pros:
Probably the best pizza I have had in the states.  
Everything is delicious!!!
They will text you when your table is ready which is super convenient.
Fast service.

Cons:
Wait times are very long but well worth it.
They have limited items like the meatballs gigantic (25/day), and Margherita (73/day) and some other items but I forgot them.  
Parking can be hard to find.
Restaurant is kind of small considering how popular it is.

Overall:
I highly recommend coming here.  Definitely the best pizza that I have had so far in the States.  I am not sure if they take reservations, but if they do I highly suggests making reservations, or coming here very early to get your seats.

My favorite go-to place in San Francisco! I live a few blocks away and after a long day of work...all I want is a slice of pizza from this place. It's cheap, it's fast, all you need to bring is cash because they don't accept credit cards :)
Their cheese is pretty good, but hands down the veggie pesto pizza is 2 die 4...you have to check them out.
A slice of heaven located in North Beach. Great friendly service too. Any slice you order will taste awesome to the max!

Average at best. The girl serving the pizza was rude even after being tipped. The pizza was nothing really to write home about either, bland in flavour and nuclear hot. I'm not sure what all these other 5 star reviews are about?

The pizza is really good - but very limited choice.  The pizza is designed to go with the drinks so you can talk to people and enjoy.  This is a place you have got to try.  Be ready for a long wait but it is worth it!!

Spent the day in San Francisco with a friend.  We walked, we drank and we started to get hungry as only had a few appetizers.  We stopped for a couple of slices and I must say the clam and garlic pizza is my favorite!!!  I usually like my pizza super thin, but there is nothing wrong at all with Golden Boy Pizza!!!!!

The pizza is very good and chunky, so it will fill you up! I love how it comes in square shapes, pretty unique. Only bad part is the place has a limited amount of room :( But the pizza is fantastic :)
This square pizza is so dank. Good deal too as the pieces are massive. Lots of types to choose from. I'm headed there right now!
awesome atmosphere & Amazing pizza. square slices & super hot pizza guy named Max. Pizza & ber & HOT GUys what more can you ask for & only like 5 bucks a slice..sf has my heart with this one =)

Love this place. Order your slice(s) and go sit or get your slices to go. The quality is reflected in its popularity; the joint is always hoppin'. Don't be afraid to try the clam pizza if you don't mind garlic or the hemp ale if you love beer. ;) The bar stickers are always amusing too.

Cheap square pizza. Loved my cheese slice. The ambiance is really cool - so many random stickers and whatnots while you chow down on your slice of yumminess. I think it's the perfect beer + quick pizza-by-the-slice joint around!
I just want to go back there and eat there veggie squared pizza with pesto on it!

Garlic and clam pizza was pretty good. Deep-dish like crust (like Pizza Hut variety) in square slices, each slice is $3-4.  My only complaint was that there wasn't a whole lot of clam on my slice.  Tons of garlic though, which I love. Just be careful if you're having beers after, beer burps + garlic = complaining friends all night.

This is a really tight spot for thick crust.  There was a short line, but the pie was worth it.  I generally go for thin crust, and don't expect much out of west coast pie, but this spot is well worth a detour.  Great beer selection, & a very chill atmosphere.

Awesome. I didn't even want to write this review because I don't want people to know about Golden Boy. But, with 1500 reviews, my battle is futile. Really excellent pizza, nice crispy crust, hot cheese, fresh pepperoni. Stop reading this and GO!
I've heard it said that this is the best pizza in the city... The pizza is pretty damn good, but I guess I'm just a snob, cause I'll stick with the cheeseboard in berkeley any day.
Everyone already knows this is incredible pizza. But I am still dealing with the pizza burn. Eat with caution.

Wow!   I just happened to stumble upon this gem while wandering through the North Beach area.  With a hunger in my belly, I yearned for a nice pizza slice, except not at the fancy Italian places that lined Columbus.  Lo and behold, here is a place for your hunger pangs and pizza craves.

Golden Boy Pizza doesn't try to be something that it isn't.  The plain inside, stickers on the wall, simple beer choices (btw, Hemp Ale is one of the best microbrews I've tasted from the area), and no nonsense pizza.

The pizza is Roman-style, cut into giant rectangles, and toasted for ya in the oven.  I'll be sure to come back when I am in the area.  A+.

The "IT" spot for late night grub in North Beach. Just look for the window with a line half way down the block and you've discovered Golden Boy. If you go at the right times, they have garlic clam pizza which is just the best slice of pizza you'll ever have in your life. I'm happy with just a simple slice of pepperoni, but the garlic clam is borderline orgasmic. Every time I've been here, I've had to wait at least 20-30 minutes before getting to the window, and this is at 2 in the morning, mind you. Good luck trying to find a seat inside. Just take your food outside and mingle with all the other pizza lovers - it's the San Francisco way.

short and sweet.. open late. Get the supreme. Worth driving for after party munchies..the pizza is heavenly.  Great with a heineken on tap from next door.  5/5 hiyaaaaaaas (while buzzin of course not sure when sober ^,^)
My first experience here was excellent. What followed were several subpar dinners and a poor attempt to serve overpriced garbage as pizza.

Great staff, we came recommended from a Tour bus and the scoop was that Tony's had won an Internationa Pizza contest in Napoli Italy. We had to wait about 60 minutes for a chance to get in... It was worth the wait !!!

The Marguerita was to die for and the Regina was Outstanding. Staff was friendly and made up for the waiting time.

Tony's lived up to the hype. Definitely worth repeating on our next trip to Frisco !!

900+ degree ovens make the crust crispy and stretchy. Think about that.
best pizza in the city

So, I spent a day eating as much as I possibly could in SF.  I want to go back so badly and eat at more places but I cannot at this time. I am sad.

I came here with my parents and this was our first spot of the day for lunch.

PARKING:
It's SF, might need to park a little ways away.  Probably pay for parking.  We got lucky and parked at a meter that was out of order.  Apparently this means you can stay at the meter for 2 hours maximum and don't have to pay anything or at least that's what the sign said...

AMBIANCE:
It's a small cozy little place.  I like the feel of the restaurant, not super upscale but it's nice inside.  Modern looking and clean. Simple decor.

SERVICE:
Our server was good.  Not bad, got things done quickly.  But I just got this feeling that he wanted us to be quick about our meal?  Or maybe I just thought he'd be more engaging initially but he wasn't, oh well.  I can't expect these things.  Maybe just 'cause I was in SF...anyways...

FOOD:
Bread and the condiments were tasty.  We especially liked the garlic and honey, delicious with the bread.

We got the Margherita since a friend of mine suggested it. It was tasty.  No complaints.  We liked the thin crust, crispy exterior and chewy inside.  I appreciate the San Marzano tomatoes as the sauce.  Bright, clean, flavorful.  Wish there was a bit more basil on the pizza...

My dad wanted a sandwich for some reason.  I believe he got something called the All Star.  It was half corned beef and half pastrami.  Definitely seems like the make their own corned beef.  Loved how thinly sliced all the meat was.  We all felt the corned beef was a touch too salty.  Pastrami was flavorful.  Oh and this sandwich was HUGE! We barely finished it, but it was tasty.  We also liked the little purple potato chips with it.

Hahha, my parents definitely want to come back without me [they live in Norcal] so yeah, some good stuff!

We didn't love this place as much as expected.  The pizza was okay, but nothing I would ever go back to or recommend to a friend.
