Maybe it's because I love Olivellas in Dallas too much and it is way better than this place. Also, the service was extremely slow, and I didn't feel like our waiter did a good job in walking us through the different types of pizzas the menu had to offer.
Perfect! Also my boyfriend who needs gluten free pizza said it was the best he'd ever tasted! It took 20 minutes to get a table but we hang out in the bar, so it was not a problem. Very good service!
Tony's was delicious! The pizza was mouth watering. The only downfall to it was the wait but in the meantime good company equals worth the wait plus yummy pizza!

How can I explain how much I love Tony's pizza? Hmmmm...does going for dinner there Friday night and then going there for lunch that next day count?

Yup, I couldn't go 24 hours without having Tony's again. Let me tell you, this place is worth the hour wait. Now I've been here a few times, but I stick to the same things every time because they are so damn good. Even their bread and dipping sauce is amazing. Honey and garlic. OMG. Not going to lie, when I first saw it I was a little, eh, what are they thinking here. Boy was I wrong. I literally come to Tony's now just for the garlic and honey dip. It is so unique and to die for! It's so good, I dream about it. I want to try and recreate it at home, but know it's just not going to be as good.

But enough about the garlic and honey (did I mention YUM?!). I've had pretty much the same thing each time, and haven't tried new things just because what I've had is so good. For starters, the giant meatball. They only make 25 per day, so if they have any left when you're there, JUST GET IT! I always get it with burrata, because who doesn't love burrata?! But for real, the creaminess of the burrata just goes so perfectly with the meatball and marinara. It's so good that with two people, in a matter of minutes that bad boy is gone.

The newest thing I've tried is a one of a kind dish and it is FAB-U-LOUS! It's called coccoli and it's just heaven in pizza dough form. They fry the pizza dough so that it is so fluffy and sweet that it almost tastes like a donut, but then they salt and pepper it so it becomes the perfect blend of salty-sweet. So you have this fluffy pocket of heaven and you pop it open, steam going every where and that smell of deliciousness hits you in the face like a ton of bricks. But wait! That's not all of it! Then you fill that bad boy with stringy straciatella cheese and prosciutto and there you have it. The best tasting "hot pocket-esque" freshly made by you. IT IS SO GOOD! All the flavors just work together so perfectly. And the pizza dough comes out still so hot that the cheese is melting in there. Talk about delicious.

Now they have a ton of pizzas to choose from. Again, if they have any left when you go, just get the margherita napoletana. The crust is perfection, the sauce is so light and flavorful and then the mozzarella and with the fresh basil. It is just perfection. I have't tried any other pizzas yet because I've been lucky enough each time, that they still are serving this pizza. They only serve 73 per day!

I love Tony's. I only wish they delivered so I could have it all the time!

The most delicious pizza I've ever had was eaten here. Mind you I've had a lot of pizza in my life, and some foodie moments included. The reason that it was the best is probably because I would've never expected it and it caught me off guard when I tried it. The limited margherita was good, but paled in comparison to the Eddie muenster. Yup, muenster pizza did me in. Something about the flavor combinations (lemon, crispy kale, honey, spice and bacon alongside that muenster) made my taste buds do a happy dance. I've been wanting to try Tonys for awhile, and am so glad I did because I can't wait to go back and have some more.

Service very slow both waiting for a table and for food. A friend joined my table of three and the hostess immediately asked for him to leave because we "exceeded the guest limit" for a booth. After paying the bill, I was quickly ushered out of the restaurant to accommodate more patrons. And the Brooklyn calzone wasn't even tasty. If Yelp allowed 0/5 stars, Tony's would earn it.

So the huge line here drew us to the place, walking around little italy in SF.   We were a little wary when we realized that everyone in line was pretty wasted looking.  Looks like the perfect place to go to right after having a few rounds.  We read the reviews on Yelp and decided to go with the highly praised clam garlic slices.  It came out fresh right as we ordered it, tons of parsley, tons of garlic, and possibly some clam.  I think this is where the benefit of being drunk would help here - now, pay attention because I've NEVER said this before - there was way too much going on here.  I think if our tongues were doused in alcohol, it would have been perfect, but my sober tongue was bombarded by (and i can't believe I'm saying this) too much garlic and too much parsley.  If they would have cut that back by 50%, it would have been awesome - but as it was, i felt like I was chewing on grass a few times.  I could only taste the clam when I realized I was crunching on sand.  

Now that being said, the pizza dough was AWESOME, cheese was great, sauce was perfect.  I REALLY should have gone with something simpler to try, so that's on me.  I think this place is still great for where it is and what it's for.  I'd try it again, though the stars reflect my experience this time around.

Three words: Clam. Garlic. Pizza.

I was a bit surprised when we arrived Golden Boy, after my friend went on and on about how their pizza is very good.  This is a tiny hole in the wall, and the pizza that you are about to order and eat are just sitting in the window, facing the street, waiting to be consumed.  I was a bit skeptical.

Friend told me to get the clam garlic pizza, and I was thinking to myself, clam on a pizza?  The garlic better be very strong to cover the fishy smell... nonetheless, I still got it because I am a total pushover.

When I cut into the pizza, I was instantly amazed by how soft the top part was, yet the bottom of the pizza was crispy, and the amount of toppings they put on each square is plentiful!

I loved the aroma of the garlic, yet it did not completely cover up the taste of the clam.  No fishiness to this clam pizza as the little clams tasted fresh, sweet and juicy.  The garlic and parsley bits were also a little crispy, making a contrasting texture against the soft, fluffy dough.

This is a great place to grab a quick bite, and the prices are good, too!
The clam and garlic was definitely delicious, but overall, I'd prefer going to Marcello's for a slice of Sicilian if convenience/proximity were not an issue.
Cheese vs. Pesto- the vegetarian pizza battle. Thankfully, Golden Boy has perfected both so no need to fret, just come prepared to enjoy a little slice of heaven.

We wondered into Golden Boy after a night of imbibing, and it was the answer to our prayers. Late night quality eats are not too hard to find in the city, but Golden Boy is situated in a great spot, and doesn't lack the charm that some late night eateries can. It's a clean spot, offers a slice of cheesy, saucy heaven and even offers beer on tap.
Tried the garlic and clam. Even though it looks deep dish, it has a thin crust with a thick topping. It gas lots of garlic though, so beware if you have a meeting after:)
Sicilian pizza done right. Grab a beer, a bar stool and enjoy! Cheese is the best.
Perfect Sicilian-style pizza (focaccia crust), by the slice, and open LATE. Beer too.
Love the Golden Boy! I mean seriously... where else can you go and just jump on a bar stool, order a slice and a stella? I love this place.

I have a tendency to need pizza at 2AM, and Golden Boy is always my choice. I am awe of the girl who works there- its always the same person, she never gets snippy with the scores of drunk people who scream for pizza. I always make a drunken promise to bring her flowers.  I always feel less hungover when I have a slice so maybe it has restorative powers.

It's a nice restaurant in the Italian neighborhood.
We were lucky because we didn't wait for a long time .
The bread is rally good !

We had a very good pizza.
The price is correct a little bit expensive

Came here last night after joining the waitlist and we were finally seated near closing time. We ordered soft drinks and water.  Our soft drinks came but no water.  I flagged our waitress down when I realized she didnt bring the waters and she clearly made eye contact with me and she nodded her head and walked right pass me. So I'm thinking she clearly aknlowdged me and will most likely be right back when she gets a chance which I totally get.......nope she disappeared. After some time I had to get up out of my table to finally flag someone down to get our waters. Our waitress finally came back after some time but rarely checked on us. The pizza we ordered was great and ambiance was also awesome but I highly recommend getting there early because I feel the wait staff is more engaged during peakhours. Our waitress was clearly mentally checked out by the time we got there near closing time....But again....great pizza!

OMG! I absolutely adore this place. They have some of the best pizza I've ever had. There are so many options and so many different sizes. I love their New York style pizza, it's one of my favorites. The Caesar salad here is so good as well. Make sure you ask for a little less dressing because they can't put too much. Overall great atmosphere, great service, great pizza!

Pizza is a little expensive but is worth it! 5 for a giant cheese slice, 5.50 for a giant meat lovers/veggie combo.

My only complaint is I strongly dislike the fact small ranch cups cost $1. It seems outrageously greedy considering how many cups 1 pot of ranch would fill, and the average transaction total. If me and a date spend $20 on pizza/drinks it doesn't feel good to get essentially caught in trap and pay $1 for something the restaurant could easily afford to offer complimentary.
Super love! My favorite crispy style pizza has a Fig preserve on it. I will come here every time I fly in from Utah.

Great pizza !!! Don't get me wrong just the stupid worker in the red plaid shirt with blonde hair and glasses had the worse customer service ever ! So I was standing outside and I heard them say some number with a 3 and then I heard 569 so I assumed it was 563 I went back inside and asked her if they called my number she gave me attitude saying "you ordered a whole pie so of course it going to take a while" but I check the counter before I had asked her so I wouldn't be wasting her time since there was a long like and I saw a pizza on the counter she had told me no so I looked at my boyfriend and he told me that he sees it so we looked at it and I was like what the fuck ? So I asked her a second time and she said no then she was helping out a customer in line and went to the back to say something to the workers and I told her "I see 563 on the counter can you check for me?" And she said well I wouldn't know ? ... excuse me but if you had just looked you would have known and then she gave me my pizza I stood there taking in her attitude for no reason even the customer in line that she was helping looked at me and gave me a wtf look because she was rude worst customer service ever !!

Don't be scared away by the wait, because this pizza is amazeballs!

The wait for five people around five thirtyish was 45 minutes, but as soon an we got our table the service was QUICK. As the menu was a bit overwhelming we went with the waitress' recommendation, and our first pizza margherita was there within minutes. Just as we were finishing the first one, the next to pizzas came along, and we were in heaven. The best one we got was the award winning New Yorker, with sausage and other goodies - an absolute must.
This is the go to place in North Beach for pizza. It's like going to Naples without the craziness. I still suggest you go to Naples though, the birthplace of pizza.

Hands down one of the best pizza I've had! We had take out & on another occasion ate at the bar. Menu could be a little overwhelming but Joe the bartender knows his pizza (and his drinks). Going to make it a must stop whenever I'm in the area.

We planned to swing by Tony's Pizza Napoletana on our trip out west and ended up going twice.  It's that good.

Disappointed I was not able to get there in time to have the famous Margharita pie but we did enjoy the New Yorker twice and a Meatball Gigante once.  The food is just amazingly good and very very NYC.  

Amazing pizza.  Very Fresh!  Be prepared to wait though.  We had a 60 minute wait on a Sunday night and a 120 minute wait the following Saturday.  They wouldn't even put our name in as we left our hotel in route.  The hostess that worked 6/15 and 6/20 was rude on both occasions.  Odd for a place like that.

Gotta go though.  Food is phenomenal.

It ain't a New York slice, but it is the closest to a NY slice that I've had in San Francisco. I order the plain cheese square, eat it and order another. It's great. Daytime is best as there is rarely a line. At night fugetaboutit, the line can stretch out.
Serving up hot retro trailer park chic by-the-slice.

Average rectangle shaped pizza.  If it wasn't for the pepper that I put on it, then the "pepperoni" pizza would've been pretty bland.  But I gave them three stars because the service was great, and they had a pic of Christopher Walken on the wall...sweet....

You don't have to be drunk to enjoy their pizza....you can get drunk while you're there!  They have Sicilian style and its good...nothing like Zachary's but its warm and good, especially when you get in from walking in the cold breeze outside.  Lots of good beers on tap and a huge TV to watch the Warriors lose in OT :(  Bring a neck brace as the TV is mounted high on the left side of the bar.  Great for take out too...the girl working there was really efficient at wrapping the slices for takeout.

Big slices, cheap, and worth waiting in line for when it's late and you're hungry and have had a bit too much to drink in North Beach.  They have plenty of different toppings to chose from, but only have a certain selection at any given time.  If you come inside and sit, they also have cheap beer.  FYI - cash only!

For reheated pizza at $3.50/slice, it's certainly not a bad deal, and the server was really nice.  When I was in there, a couple of girls walk in and look at the beers on tap, and one says to the other, I don't know any of these!  Yeah, sorry honey, they've got Trumer Pils, not Miller Lite (well, they do have those in the bottle, I think).
AMAZING! Love the veggie pesto pizza! Totally worth spending 20 mins to find parking.

Yes, I have a weakness for square format. (Photography/gastronomy combo pun, stand back!) Golden Boy makes the best Sicilian I've ever had, and that's it. Also the only reason that readily springs to mind for being in North Beach.
Great late night option in north beach. Cheesy goodness.

This place is so delicious!!!! I was doing a bar crawl with a group of friends and we were getting closer to our end destination when we came upon this glorious pizza place. The line was a little long but I could see why after I was given my pizza square; it was warm, toasty and the toppings were perfect. I don't remember what I chose but I was very happy with it! One of my friends bought the clam pizza, wish I would have bought that one, it's super bomb!!! No really, if you like clams, you should get that one! He liked it so much he bought 2!!!  I can not wait for my next trip to Golden Boy PIzza, they are truly golden!
Amazing Pizza, we tried the margarita and mushroom pizza and they were both excellent. Outdoor seating is very nice and staff is nice as well. Highly recommended

Good pizza! If youve ever had Costco pizza well then this is the exact replica. It's a big slice and taste just like Costco pizza. The only thing I didn't like is that they didn't have a lot of options. If you're a person that likes a thick crust then stop through. Beautiful views on the way to the spot.

Ummm, why does everyone love this place? I had the worst pizza I've ever had in my life here (that's including frozen pizza). I don't see what all the hype is about. We got the "award winning" margherita pizza. The dough was paper thin and wet...imagine if you left a tortilla chip to marinate in pizza sauce, that's what it was like. And it was burned on the bottom. The sauce was watery and it barely had any cheese or basil on it, so unfortunately the burned taste was what came through the most. Maybe we just picked the wrong style and the thicker pizzas are better? If there is a next time I'll try something different. Overall though, very very disappointed with this pizza.  

The only reason this gets two stars is bc I liked my beer and the staff was really nice.

If you're looking for a great salad, Tony's has it! The beer is cold and perfectly paired with the balsamic on the Little Italian salad. The atmosphere is intimate/dark, so perfect for date night or a solo lunch.

Ever come here and there's along line... and there's just a few slices left... and you're panicking the meat heads / yuppie scum in front of you will snap up YOUR slices before you get your chance?!   I fuckin' hate that.

Great little place to grab a slice of pizza (or 3) alone, or after having drinks in North Beach (although they close before 2). I love, love, LOVE this pizza.  Anytime someone comes to S.F. to visit me I bring them here and they end up loving it as much as I do.  I'm all about the sauce, and this place does it right.  The cheese and the combo are my favorites! Also, I don't know what people mean about the rude service, I have NEVER once had rude service! Everyone who works there seems really nice and attentive.  But maybe it's because they've seen me in there one too many times!
This pizza is great because it is unique.  The crust is really really thick, and not to tough.  The sauce is a bit one dimentional, however the crust makes up for it! Plus is quick as hell and cheap!
They do a seriously good pesto slice ... seriously good.

I'd say Golden Boy Pizza is very unique.  Most places do not make their pizza in a Foccacia Style Crust so I will say they are a very "different" kind of pizza experience.  They do a very good job with it too.  I can't say it is my favorite and would drive down here just to get one but for sure if I am in the neighborhood. sure I'll grab a slice!
The most amazing pizza ever. Bad reviews are only referencing the wait times, not the food. Freshest ingredients, amazing diversity. My new fav spot!

I heard that Tony's is one of the best pizza places in SF so I went on Sunday for brunch, and it was AMAZING. The waitlins was petty long, we had to wait 40 min. But they send txts when your table is ready. Heard that Tony's raise their tomato on the rooftop of the restaurant, and the food was delicious! New Yorker Pizza and meatballs were amazing. Will def visit again!

Came here for the first time last week and the pizza was soo good. My boyfriend and I got here on a Friday night and the wait was an hour for 2 around 6, so make sure you come early or you'll have to wait. The bar seats are first come first serve, but there were a lot of people eyeing the bar seats. We got the New Yorker and the Quail, Egg, Potato & Guanciale, which was definitely more than enough for two people, but all the choices sounded so good. Tony's has now become my favorite pizza spot! If you don't want to wait, they do take out a few doors down!

Classic pizza joint to visit in North Beach. They're always super crowded but have a separate to-go ordering window so you can get your pizza quicker. I've loved every kind of pizza I've tried here, totally worth the visit.

We went here on a Saturday with a small group (4 people) and the approximate wait time at 7:00pm was 2 hours.  This is definitely a long time but well worth the wait, as we found out later.  What makes the wait bearable is that the hostess takes down a phone number and texts you when you're up next, meaning you don't have to stick around.  We spent 2 hours at a nearby cafe and had no problem waiting.

Food  * | * | * | * | *

First off, the pizza menu is separated by HOW your pizza is cooked!  Wood fired, electric, etc and you get to see the total temperature.  Now that's cool to know as a foodie.  We got the Spacca Napoli and the Quattro Carni.  My goodness.  Both pizzas were exceptionally delicious and the unanimous vote was that the win was in the crust.  The thin crust was crunchy but not a cracker, soft but not mushy, and all around amazing.  A definite win for the pizza.  We also ordered dessert, and can safely say, the Tiramisu is worth a try.

Service  * | * | * | * | *

As mentioned previously, the hostess took down my phone number to text when our table is ready.  Very nice, especially when compared to those vibrators other places give out which limits the range of meandering.  Our server was also very nice, and open to receiving questions about the menu and offering suggestions as well.

I don't normally like pizza but oh my god this pizza is SO GOOD. It's not like regular pizza or deep dish pizza, it's served on this focaccia like bread and it's AMAZING. The sauce is delectable and it oozes over the soft bread with crispy crust and the cheese is delicious and the pepperoni is delicious and it's just very DELICIOUS. Go now.

I'm not usually a fan of the thick slice, but Golden Boy is tasty! We tried the cheese and clam and garlic. Both were good, the clam and garlic really caters to garlic lovers. Convenient by the slice, eat in or take out. Very accomodating, heating cold slices, boxing them up nicely. Great for an afternoon snack or late night craving.

its my SHI**....man got two mondo-slices here. I had cheese and a meat combo. I should have not had 2...but I didn't find that out until I got home and they were looking up at me. WIth their broiled cheese eyes, and tomato sauce smiles saying...eat us Jess...eat us. So I did. And felt like a fat ass the rest of the night. And yet, it was undoubedly worth it!

The lines don't lie, all the drunk people at the end of the night knows what they crave, and they crave for THEEE BESTT pizza. I haven't gotten any further than the Cheese pizza.  I SHOULD try other stuff but, why fix what's not broken? The crust is unbelievable. It's crustilicious. And the cheese!! omg!! it's mind blowing!! damnit! I want some now... :(

Honestly, not my favorite pizza in the city.  The crust is excellent though.  Service at the bar is also an issue for me.  They kind of ignore you and I felt like they didn't want us to order food at the bar.  I have been here a few times and I can tell why people like it here, it's just not my fav.
Stopped in for a quick sample, a combo and a cheese. Both were good, but I took away a star because it had a little too much oregano. There is nothing like New Haven pizza!
Best drunk food ever! Garlic clam, soooo good. Their Veggie pesto is good as well.. It's all good. Best economy meal: grab slices to go and head to Columbus Caffe for happy hour 2 for 1 drinks.

Grabbed a few slices and a beer before the fireworks on the 4th. I am a pizza purist so I would not normally order any pizza but a classic Neapolitan pie. For what it is this is pretty good stuff especially after a Giants game and with a belly full of $10 beers. Two slices and two beers what was not much more then one of those $10 beers. A great value in North Beach.
Great pizza for pennies.  It's a must go...especially bringing it back to Columbus Cafe to eat.
Clam garlic pizza is really delish!!! Pesto was pretty good too.

I was looking for a good place when I went to San Francisco and found this on yelp so I decided to give it a shot. Little did I know that I was going to fall in love. The line was pretty long considering the fact that I went like at midnight so I decided to get a slice of each. Cheese, pepperoni and vegetarian. Soooo good and super affordable too! We paid like $10.00 for 4 slices that were pretty big in size and big in flavor. I wanna go back!!!!!!

No outting to North Beach for pub crawls is complete without a trip to Golden Boy pizza. Thick square slices that are piping hot and full of flavor. Seriously, if I'm ever in the city for casual times, then I will try to find my way there...I first tried it about 15 years ago and it hasn't changed a bit....great, now I want a slice...sigh.

i think you've gotten the hint by now that this place is good so i'll make this short. Tried the clam pizza and veggie, both solid. Waited for about 10 minutes and ate my tasty, greasy box shaped pizza slice and left with a smile on face. Brownie points for being open late and being able to order a beer while you wait. Bring cash and your appetite.

FANTASTIC pizza. I had the Vegetarian Pesto and Pepperoni (I wanted the Clam and Garlic, but they were out). The dough is SO soft and the slices are enormous. The perfect meal before drinking! Be warned, there is very limited seating so be prepared to stand outside and eat if it's busy.

Mediocre pizza.  I guess that thick crust, greasy pizza just isn't my scene.  I got a cheese slice, and it was rather bland.  There wasn't much personality or flavor, and the crust was REALLY thick.  The service was friendly, and it would be a chill place to grab a beer.  However, I wouldn't eat here again.  Bar seating only, by the slice only unless you're ordering a sheet, which is like 4 feet long.  It's really inexpensive, but for me it totally wasn't worth the calories.  Cash only.

Between the Yelp reviews and the stomach growling window display of square, cheesy slices of pizza I had such high expectations. We had the following slices; pesto, cheese and pepperoni. I thought the overall flavor was dull and the dough wasn't anything to write home about.. It's just ok pizza in my opinion.

I came here based on yelp reviews and I was disappointed.  It is way too much hype.  We can with family on Friday night.  Long wait. Had to sit outside in slanted table due to sidewalk.   The food was cold by the time it is here.  Not worth coming again.   Getting some slice pizzas next door... no waiting.

The meat ball Calzone was amazing for $13. But the $39 pizza 'grandmas butcher' was a little under whelming for the price we paid.  Our waiter was great and loved the service we received from him but we made a request with another waitress who said shed be back with an answer but she never came back which was a little annoying.  but overall the food was great :)
Best pizza in the Bay Area, just have to plan ahead and make an evening out of waiting for your table.  The biggest surprise is actually their other food, all excellent.

If it's a weekend put your name on the list and have a drink nearby; they'll call you when your table is ready. It's gonna be worth the long wait. If it's during the week it's still worth any amount of waiting. This is probably the best slice of pizza in town.

The wild robiola and the honey pie are absolutely scrumptious. Pancetta porcini and gigante are delicious. Can't go wrong with the margherita if they haven't hit the 73 a day limit. Been waiting forever and need antipasti stat? Deep fried green beans or the meatball gigante with burrata should do the trick.

This is a great place to go with a group. It's lively inside on the weekends and they have outdoor seating. Plus with more people you can get multiple types of pizza. Variety, especially here, is fantastico!

Can't decide? This is a great place to ask your server for suggestions. They actually know and will give you an honest opinion. Great service! Buon appetito!

We ordered the coal fire pizza, as recommended by our waiter. The pizza was so delicious!!!  Pizza was thin crust and perfectly crisp. You can taste the homemade sauce and ingredients were so fresh!!

Can't wait to go back!!! However, beware with the long wait!! There was a 2 hour wait when we arrived, but we found seats at the bar. Try checking the bar area first.

I thought I knew pizza.

I was wrong.

My mouth got to enjoy the very bestest pizza that I've ever tasted. From the toppings to the crust, every minute part was cooked and flavored to perfection. I can see why their margherita pizza is award-winning! I felt like an award winner after eating it, it was that good. My dining partners and I all pretty much looked at each other in disbelief as we tasted our first heavenly bites of the margherita pizza - I believe the first words from my lips were "holy cow, I had no idea pizza could be this good."

Pizza doesn't have to be cheesy, buttery, or overloaded with toppings. This place proves that quality matters, and, gosh darn it, now I'm spoiled. Now that I've visited and dined here, I have extremely high standards for pizza, so thanks Tony's!

I will make a point to come here again the next time I visit SF. Thanks for opening my eyes.

Now I know pizza.

Came here on a Saturday night for a birthday party. Party of 10... got there around 6:45 and our wait was about 2 hours. I didn't mind so much because of all the reviews. Near the 2 hour mark, I was just curious about where we were in line. I went inside to check and asked the hostess (this young Caucasian woman, I think she had a streak of red hair or something) and asked her how long does she think before we'll be seated. She said it's hard to say... okay... then I proceed to ask how many more people are in front of me? She then responds "Don't worry, we got you." THAT DOESN'T ANSWER ANY OF MY QUESTIONS.  She was pretty rude while she was responding, as if she couldn't be bothered with any questions. It wasn't like I was going to leave, I already invested close to 2 hours waiting. Anyway, 30 minutes later, we were finally seated.

The waiter was much better, but I forgot his name but he was pretty funny and nice. Constantly checked on our table, took out the dirty plates, and kept refilling our drinks. We ordered the calamari fritti, lillet blanc fries, garlic bread, New Yorker, Margherita, Cal Italia, and the Eddie Muenster pizza. I kind of wish I knew we got free bread... had I known, I wouldn't have ordered TWO orders of garlic bread. The free bread was pretty good, had 3 dipping sauces. Originally I thought that was the garlic bread... so I went crazy eating it. Then these 2 big platters of bread come out and I realized... THOSE WERE THE GARLIC BREAD. Oh how I wish I didn't eat so much bread... should have probably ran to the bathroom to throw up or something. The garlic bread was good too, nice and warm and had chopped garlic on top which was good. The calamari came and we got a mixture of the original and the spicy. Loved the calamari, nicely flavored. The spicy one wasn't immediately spicy, but as you eat it, you get the kick. The fries were good too with the bacon.. really sticky though because they put honey on it. The honey was something different for me... but everything was nicely balanced. Now to the pizzas.... I'm no pizza expert... but I didn't really care too much for the pizzas. The New Yorker was probably my favorite for the night... but it wasn't anything extraordinary about it. The margherita that everyone raves about... just tasted like a pizza. The sauce... was kind of light and bland for me. The only thing that I really liked about it was the fresh mozzerlla cheese on there. Other than that... I didn't see what everyone was raving about. The Eddie Muenster was a bit odd... since it was sweet and savory... which really wasn't my thing. The kale was too salty on top and the cheese had honey or whatever in it. Not a very good combo and the people in my table were basically forcing themselves to finish their slice. Finally the Cal Italia.... Our waiter told us he wanted that to come last since he said he was like a dessert... I was kind of confused until it finally came... and it all made sense. The entire pizza was like a dessert... which really turned me off. I'm not sure if putting honey on pizza is an authentic thing... cause if it is... I prefer the fake pizzas without the honey. The pizza was waaaaay too sweet for me. Overall, I didn't care too much for the pizzas... I think I liked the appetizers more than anything. I was kind of let down since most of the pizzas we ordered all won some type of an award... which really baffles me on what "award winning" pizza should taste like.

Overall, I was kind of let down by this place. Parking here is hell. Hostess... horrible and needs a new job.  Pizza... nothing spectacular... and some of them were kind of burned which left this weird coffee taste in our mouth (wasn't just me either). I feel like it's a bit overhyped here... if it's over anything, it's overly sweet. For $20 a pizza... I rather go somewhere else.
Hands down best Italian restaurant in San Francisco. Everything we ordered was delicious.
If you don't like this pizza your hopeless or hit a bad night. Hands down some of the best pizza I have ever had. It will be a regular stop when I'm in the city.

My absolute favorite place for Pizza in the US. It is as good as Grimaldi's in Brooklyn.

Get the New Yorker of course! But the mussels with chorizo is really wonderful with the delicious tomato base that the pizza is made with.

Try and get a spot at the bar otherwise the wait is long but it sure is delicious!

someone once told me "OMGOMG HAVEYOUHAD GOLDENBOYPIZZA ITS THE BEST PIZZA EVAR I SWER"

ok, so if they have the best pizza, where is it?

staff is super friendly though.

pizza isn't bad, it just doesn't stand out, especially at 4$ a slice when the line is down the street. and they're out of clam pizza.

Perfect little rectangles of delicious cheesy and tomato-y goodness. It hits the spot when there's nothing else. Its perfect late at night. Its satisfying when seriously hungry and can't fathom cooking! The pesto vegetable slice is the best.

the BF and I have been exploring as many pizza places in SF as we could after coming back from NY (and having mediocre pizza at Lombardi's).  I found this place and yelp and it was definitely not what i expected.  The place plays super loud music and is pretty narrow in the front.  We both ordered the clam and garlic pizza and i thought it was okay but the BF hated it.  I think he was more turned off by the atmosphere than the pizza.  Maybe next time (if there is a next time) we'll order to go?

Golden Boy! Square pizza with a focaccia crust: so quirky, and also quite yummy. I will admit to a teensy nostalgia bias in that it reminds of pizza that existed in the town where I went to college, which may be the reason for the fifth star. Nonetheless, the other Yelpers' reviews illustrate that GB is clearly an institution. That doesn't happen without some level of awesomeness... trust the masses, my friends, and go square.
Garlic and clam pizza, Delish!  Love the atmosphere

I have some friends that give this place a bad rap...  But I've always enjoyed it here.  Pizza is great and hot.  Service is fast and pleasant.  Seating is limited but it has a great vibe.  I regularly eat here.

WOWOWOWOWOWOWOWOW. Seriously SO GOOD! And I'm not even a fan of pizza! We first got 2 slices and then ended up order 2 more bc it was so good! We got the pepperoni, combination, pesto and garlic/clam pizza. My favorite was the garlic/clam pizza. It was so flavorful and just so amazing. It's cash only but they have an ATM inside. It's really small on the inside. It's all seating against the wall. I really enjoyed this place and definitely will be back!
How can you not like pizza by the slice? It's perfect after drinking in the bars, or just to take a slice home to heat up the next morning.
Pesto vegetarian pizza was so very good here. Good service very nice place one of San Franciscos finest

Took my hungry family here for lunch today after visiting the Exploratorium. I asked Siri for "nearby pizza" and we picked the highest-rated place within walking distance (btw - it was a long walk, straight uphill.)  

What a fantastic find!  Quick and delicious - loved how it's sold by the slice so everyone could get what they wanted.

I'm not one for writing reviews, but after lunch my entire family said "we have to write a Yelp review for this place!"  It's not fancy and seating is limited, and they only take cash, but the pizza is terrific.

nothing like a piping hot slice of golden boy pizza after the north beach bars. there are always interesting and friendly characters around too...yesterday, it was two old men sporting ascots. nice.

it's not the tastiest pizza-by-the-slice ever (i leave that to cheeseboard and arizmendi's)...but is cheeseboard's fancy ass open at 2 AM? no.

w/o a doubt GB is the best pizza in the city! for you east coasters who appreciate the thin crust....... even you will love it italian style on focaccia!
i am a sf native and have been making trips across the city my entire life to eat their grubbin' pizza. the decor or lack thereof is funky but, one doesnt necessarily go there to be wooed by the ambiance! you go for good down home pizza. get it to go and enojoy =)

a review of golden boy is 2 parts, sober and drunk
sober: the is thick bread with sauce and cheese and toppings. edible, but nothing golden about it
drunk: assuming i can deal with standing on line with everyone else, who doesn't love fresh hot pizza out of the oven!
and did i just waste an hour waiting for this... ugh
Golden Boy, you are the Chosen One for the drunk munchies. HOLLA!

Who doesn't like pizza??!? well, me actually. I must admit, i'm not a huge fan, at all. But, after one drunken night at northstar i stumbled upon Golden Boy and my friends wanted pizza. So I ate...and ate, and before I knew it i pretty much gobbled up the best pizza slice i'd ever had..ever.

One of my favorite pizza places in San Francisco. Hands down. Pizza is terrific, and root beer on tap is making me want to drive out there this very moment, despite after just eating lunch! The record store across the street is always a nice place to check out on a full stomach!

I had not been in a while and for the first time, got a slice straight from the oven and took over to Columbus Cafe and it was real good.  It holds it's own above and beyond simple drunk food and I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a good slice.  Nice sauce and a perfect size for a small snack with your 2 for 1 beer.

This place is really delicious.  It's cheesy, but not overwhelmingly so.  The crust is crunchy but soft.  The toppings are great too.  I think my only complaint is that the veggie has pesto sauce as opposed to normal red sauce.  I love veggie pizza but don't love pesto so much.  I forgot about the pesto sauce and ordered a slice of veggie and was pretty disappointed.  My boyfriend was kind enough to trade slices with me, yay!  Definitely a great spot to grab a slice!

You're out late in North Beach, and you really want some sidewalk grub.  Golden boy is your money spot.  

Sicilian square slices of all of your staples (cheese, pep, supreme..), and more.  It's sort of like eating a focaccia pizza. Spend your time in line ogling sheets through the glass.
Best atmosphere!  This cute little place has great pizza and nice staff.  Their menu is clean and simple-no need to worry about odds and ends.

We ordered the Calitalia, which was delicious, even though I'm not a blue cheese fan.  It was a very exotic pizza, and the balsamic vinegar (at least I think that's what it was) had a very nice touch.  The Calitalia won the Gold Award with the Food Network, and it is a very delicate, creative pizza that earned that award.  That said, most days I prefer a classic Neapolitan and I'll probably go with that next time.  The Calitalia is a bit on the sweeter side.  Unfortunately, my kids didn't appreciate this unique type of pizza, but I don't think there's any questioning that the quality of ingredients at Tony's is top notch.  I'll definitely be going again, but will probably order more conservatively for the kids.
My favorite pizza. Excellent quality, cooked to perfection. A must visit when in San Francisco. Parking sucks.

This place is positively sinful!

I never thought I could love a Pizza... Until now!

Tony's has made me a Margherita Pizza fan for life- this is the real deal as the wood-fired oven in which these pies are born were flown in from Naples. The meatballs are also an absolute must!

Yes, there's always a wait as everyone says but hey, "when in Rome..."

Had the gluten free breadsticks and gf pizza here. The toppings were great but the base lacked. That's just the nature of gluten free so pretty accepting of that. They have to buy pre-made so I get that. Really glad that the toppings rocked!

This review is strictly on the customer service we received on our visit: I have been here a few times and loved it! Food was great and the people were so nice , so I decided to share this place with some family. I had family visiting from another county and were in the city for the day , decided to go to Tony's our party consisted of 12 people; 10 adults and 2 children. One of the group members went to ask for a table and said the hostess had simply said "no" , confused I went inside and asked the hostess (a girl with short black hair and a septum nose ring) if we could put our name down for a party of 12, I wasn't even done asking when she replied "we don't do that " over and over in the rudest way possible . Shocked and I bit scared I left to inform my party , we then when back in and asked a different girl that was in the front who I assume was the assistant manager (tall blonde girl ) if we could spit into two different groups and once again I wasn't even done talking when she cut me of and said no we don't split groups and I went to explain how it would be two completely separate tables and separate checks and she still said no. At this point I was very bothered by her attitude so I simply said " you're telling me that if I want to eat with 4 other people at my own table you won't allow me ?" And she said "no because I already know what's going to happen" I said " no you don't you are assuming " and she brushed me of told me to speak to the hostess and walked away. Finally the hostess agreed to seat us, outside if I may add and said that we were going to be seated at two separate tables. I said that was okay yet she continued to lecture me about how she didn't want to see us going from one table to another and that we couldn't share food with another table. As I mentioned my family was from another country, as I was explaining the seating arrangements and "rules" she rudely pushed one of our guest and proceeded to throw the menus on the table. She then sat the second part of our part at the complete opposite side of their outdoor patio even though there was an open table of the exact same size just one table away from our other guests. I always try to look for the best in people and give them the benefit of the doubt but my family felt discriminated against due to their language and appearances. San Francisco is one of the most largest tourist places in the world it is a shame if they really do treat people different based on their appearances and language. Good was good but not worth the horrible service. * one of the guys cleaning tables and picking up dishes was the only genuine and nice person from our visit! He gave us extra plates and silverware when the hostess and server failed to do so thumbs up to him!) also when we sat down we saw on the menu that their party policy allows up to 12 people so I still don't understand what the problem was. ( we went on a Thursday afternoon at around 5:30 pm )
My brother and I just happened upon this place and WOW it was THE best pizza!  Excellent...  We'll be back

The waitor we had was helpful and nice. We waited a long time for a seat on a Sunday night (1 hour, 45 minutes), but that was expected so we went to a couple bars before.

The wine was great and so was the pizza. I look forward to my next visit!

Tony's was recommended by our driver Eliza @vantigosf.  So after our tour we hopped in an Uber and headed back.  We got right in.  We had a lovely waitress (sorry forgot her name).  Pizza was excellent.  Caesar salad was huge and very good.  Recommended Chianti was very good.  I do recommend.

I love the place, Tony is 11 Time World Pizza Champ, why wouldn't it be ?! Long waits but well worth it. Just check in and then take a walk around Little Italy.
 The restaurant provides for an intimate experience or a social one at the bar. Service is also great.   Everything on the menu that I've had is great. Must have : Margherita Pizza / Seafood Linguine
Personal Favs : Pasta Genovese
I do backflips over this place (:
OMG this place is amazing!  I recommend this place 100%  The food was so good and original.  It was pizza and appetizers but it was original combinations.  Not just another pizza shop. 2 thumbs up!

Once again im back with an exciting review! golden boy is it when it comes to deep dish pizza its cash only but they have an atm they have to best music inside and a great atmosphere if you want good pizza look no further than golden boy

Love this place! It's good after a night on the town in NB, and it's good when you are just hungry for pizza. Recently tried the vegetarian pesto and it knocked my socks off! The only issue with this place is that is it pretty small and always crowded, which can make things a little awkward. But not awkward enough to not grab a slice of the Golden Boy goodness.

This place is a must if you are visiting North Beach. They are generally open late and serve pizza out of a window. Who doesn't love that? Their veggie pizzas are great and they have beer which is a plus too. Tiny shoe box of a place to dine in, but then again.....how cool is it to order from the window and be on your way?
Love the vibe of this place and the cheap eats.  The clam and garlic is a little rough for the uninitiated so you may just want to stick to sausage.

Tasty pizza! I love that they give you a knife and fork. My advice is to take it to go and eat somewhere else though. It's not so much that it's small, it's that the setup doesn't really accommodate people in line ordering and people sitting at the bar at the same time. And with a park just one block away, why not eat outside?

Great pizza by the slice! After a 3mi hike on Telegraph Hill, a drink at the local bar "Grant and Green", a take out slice from Golden Boy was just what I needed.  The square sliced vegetarian (heated) was thick, cheesy, greasy in a good way and different than what I usually get when I order a pizza. We also tried the combo which was also good but the veggie was my favorite. One local recommended it and another said it wasn't his favorite but since I loved it I'm now on the hunt for the next local slice.

Went here last night with a slight beer buzz.  It was decent pizza but didn't sing.  Would I go back?  Yeah, if I was looking for a late night snack, but it's certainly not destination pizza for me.  I'd probably stick with Bowzers or Little Star.

Thick, squares of hot, cheesy heaven served up quick and easy.  I usually prefer a New York/thin crust style pie, but this place has made me rethink that preference.  Lots of beer on tap...you can't go wrong!  Did not rate it 5 stars due to it being Cash only and very small inside, so when it's busy you have to wait or get it to go.

The long night of vodka tonics probably influenced my high rating of this place but MAN that pepperoni pizza satisfied every pizza craving I have had over the past month!  It was square and easy to cut into devour-able pieces (to prevent burning the roof off of my mouth).  I wish I had more to write...but Golden Boy can be the last stop of my night any time.
Pretty damn good pizza and it is quick. 1 star for being cash only. Other than that its great. They sell those Pellegrino flavored waters which are delicious.

Tonys pizza was a bit of a let down for me.  I'd give them 3 stars for the margherita pizza. The sauce was very fresh tasting but the pizza itself was swimming in olive oil.  Timing was great.  We were seated for less than 30 minutes before our pizza was on our table.  (We arrived at 5pm). Meal was alright but our wait staff was bad.  Food was delivered and finished before our drinks (not water) arrived.  What's the point of a drink after dinner? I'd come back as long as i got a different waitress.

The wait time here was 2 hours! Patience made our dinner more worthwhile and boy(nostalgic sigh) ,i would do it again for the woodfire and coal pizza experience.Garlic bread made with their trademark world famous dough was soft and well done.What a great start.We were also served some complementary bread with amazing sweet chilli sauce.

We had Lou in coal pizza category which was little bland but the mozerella melted cheese cooked on coal was great.

The best was the woodfire pizza-margarita pizza and wild robiola with mushroom.Being vegerarians,options in woodfire were good but very few in coal.The serving size in coal was too big and i didnt quite understand why they serve it big as compared to wood fire.

Take a seat inside near the woodfire rather than near the bar.It will make your experience more memorable watching pizza getting made.They dont take reservations.Its first come first serve.Expect 1-2hr wait time.

Let me know if this helps.

Terrible and I will never come back! The waiter argued with me the entire time until I decided to get my family and walk out!!

I heard great things about this pizza place so I decided to give it a try on my vacation with my family. We were seated and 20 minutes later a rude lady comes to take our order. My son was the first to order, keep in mind he is 10 but he's a pretty big kid, as he's asking for his order off the kids menu, the waiter cuts him off and says "sorry, you're not a kid, you have to be 12 or under to order off the kids menu!" I was immediately confused and mad as I explained to her that he was only 10, she went back and forth telling me that my son was not a kid and she would not take a kids order. My wife and other son were disturbed as the waiter argued and talked back.

I finally said that's enough and walked out, we went to an amazing pizza parlor down the street and had no problem

Honestly, I can't put into detail how delicious this pizza was. From what I experienced, you're going to have to wait a little if you plan on dinning in. But, man. Once you're seated and the pizza comes out, be prepared to have your mouth jolted. The pies are quite large and you'll have plenty to take home for leftovers. Slice house next door is fantastic, as well.

Finally an authentic Italian pizza place in the west coast.  Have been here number of times and each time we get the Margherita pizza and some other new pizza to try.  So far all their pizzas are amazing.

Their Margherita pizza is their award winning pizza and is a must try.  It is the simple, fresh ingredients and that light dough that makes that pizza great.  One of these pizzas is perfect for one person. Remember to get there as early as possible, they run out of the special flour they fly from Naples in the first 2-3 hours of opening.

The other pizza I would recommend is one of their New Yorker pizzas, especially one with sausage, pepperoni and ricotta.  Oh and to start do try their cheese garlic bread and the calamari.  The spicy one is indeed spicy yet awesomely delicious.  Their calamari is perfectly cooked not chewy like most places and a great start to a meal.

They are also one of the few pizza places that offer different style of pizzas whether it is wood fired, coal fired, electric oven, gas oven etc.  Definitely a great place to try out.  Take the pizza next time and sit and eat at the Washington square park right next to this place for a perfect picnic in the California sun.
Good pizza, long wait.  We had the New Yorker and it was as advertised.  Garlic cheese bread was a little dark and crisp, but unique overall.
I don't know what it is about this pizza, but it's amazing. All the pizzas are made fresh and even cooked in different type of ovens. The workers are also very friendly. I would come back again!

The best pizza I have ever had! You must try! I was following them on Facebook and decided that we would add this place to eat on our list to try. Excellent service by staff. I couldn't ask for more. It made our trip (Oct 5-9, 2016) and experience to the City by the Bay even better. Thank you!

Good pizza and the wait staff does a great job. The only downside to eating here is the incredibly rude hostess.  Her nasty attitude is something to be marveled at as a simple question such as "would you please let me know how much longer it will be?" angers this woman like you just slapped her in the head and told her she looks fat in those pants...

There are way too many good pizza places in this city to be insulted before you eat. Management should fire that gargoyle or send her to the kitchen so she never has to deal with actual customers! Either way, we'll never go back because of that witch (management please note: she worked the evening of 3/16).
This place is amazing. I just wish that I lived closer so that I can eat here once or twice a week. Tony has created a working, breathing, piece of food art with this place.

Pizza is decent here, ONLY if you eat it right after they heat it up. If you take it home, it won't taste as good even if you reheat again.

Came here tonight to pick up some pizza to-go because my boyfriend was craving it and a weird guy who was sitting on the stools literally got off his seat and pushed me out the door. He pretended to look at the pizzas by the window and just pushed me hard, then laughed it off and said some stupid things. Hurted my back and neck.  Didn't know what his freaking problem was. The server girl just laughed it off like it was NORMAL, and said "Oh look, now you've scared her and she looks like she wants to run away."

Maybe Golden Boy Pizza needs to hire a security guard soon.  (plus its located next to a bar!)

Minus one star for the rude server and customer.

Minus one star for the price, and minus a last star for its pizza being nothing special.

I recently ate at Paxti's in Lafayette and they have the best pizza to date.. see my review for why. this place is still freakin' amazing but i tend to only give 5 stars to the best of the best, hence the update. this, by no means, however, reduces my want to go here, right. now.

Their cheese pizza is pretty standard, tastes a lot like Pizza Huts pan pizza.  Their pesto vegetarian, however, is the best pesto pizza I've ever had.  It's more like thin focaccia than pizza but it's delicious none the less.  A slice of pesto and a drink, for $5, makes a pretty awesome lunch.

The lady working the counter is also very quick and friendly.  The place itself is very laid back and casual with stools against the wall, light rock music and cool air flowing.

The cash only rule is the only reason it's not a 5 star place for me.

My mom loves pizza.  Picture a cute and sweet little old Chinese lady chomping down some pizza.  She doesn't get to eat it often because of her diet, but as a treat when I go visit her in Chinatown, I stop by here to get her a slice of the combination slice of pizza. She loves the thick crust and how soft it is.  And it's very tasty!  I've also tried the veggie pizza and it's very good.  I'm not a pizza fan, but sometimes I can't resist taking a bite of mom's pizza...LOL!

I went here for a late night bite and the combination pizza was good. I had a fresh piece, just right from the oven. I think the most enjoyable thing was the crust, it was flaky and just right. Other than that, the topping of the pizza and everything else was just ordinary.
We went again and I got the clam and garlic and it was definitely not as exciting as I wanted it to be.  I'll be going back to my veggie pesto choice next time around.

Let me tell you about Golden Boy Pizza
I came here with my Padre one cold winter afternoon for lunch. I've had pizza about twice already that week so at that point, I was kind of sick of pizza. Let me just say that this place was crackinnnnnnnnnn :D
Basically, no matter how tired of pizza I am, I will ALWAYS be down for this place!
First lets start of with the pizza. They don't do these basic circular pizzas that everywhere else has. They have SQUARE pizzas. Pizzas cut into SQUARES. Now if you're sexually attracted to Spongebob-shaped objects or if you have a fear of circles, THIS IS THE PLACE FOR YOU.
The pizza was DELICIOUS. I ordered two pepperoni slices and after finishing my first one, I was kinda already full to be honest because they aren't dinky little slices. But I really couldn't wait to get back home to eat the other slice! It was SO GOOD. The pepperoni was crispy and the crust on the bread was ON POINT. It was thick, crispy, fluffy, and saucy. OMG so good
The only complains I have is that the place is extremely small and cramped. So for my large fatass, I kind of had to get used to it. But my padre is quite petite vertically so he kind of just fit right in. There's limited seating so I suppose you have to make due. Also, when my padre ordered the pizza, it wasn't very saucy, as if it was lacking the sauce.
But aside from that, if you're ever drunk or are looking for some late night munchies after cheating on your wife at the strip club around the corner, COME HERE.

Learned about this place during a Bar Crawl and I have to say I love this place. Their clam and Garlic pizza is a must try. The flavors of everything will melt in your mouth to form a perfect combination of awesome! A must try!
Mmm, yum. To be honest, the pizza was good, and fun in it's square-like shape, but it's not the best pizza I've had. Maybe I should have tried a flavor other than pepperoni? Cash only.
Best Sicilian Pizza I've ever had.  Good slices on the cheap.  You'll find this place packed on weekend nights.
The pizza slice is just amazing....!! I tried pepperoni for the first time and just loved it.. !!!
RIDICULOUS and completely not worth the wait! Plenty of other better pizza parlors worth your time. Should not have to wait an insane amount of time for just pizza.
This is a good place to visit after an evening in North Beach.  A nice square of pizza goes down well with a draft beer.

Found this spot on yelp when we were in the city looking for a good pizza joint. Parking is a PITA but once you do find parking you are greeted with a long line. This is a result of having such great tasting pizza. After we went through the line we were able to eat our pizza. It was very delicious. It reminded me of my mom's home cooked pizza. The staff was great. There was one thing that kind of raised an eyebrow. I had asked for them to go but we ended up eating it there and the waiter questioned about eating it to go but was friendly thereafter.
Small place, cute, girl at the counter was super nice. Pizza was good, the crust is not thin but it's not thick either, chewy, crisp and a little buttery. Overall good pizza, great prices.

Their clam pizza never disappoints! Other pizzas are also delicious, but I always find myself ordering a clam slice or two. I love the crust, with its crispy bottom and fluffy middle, and the toppings are always fresh tasting. Can't wait to head back!
Best in the city.  Very tasty thick crust, unique combinations and a true original.  Love it when I'm craving a good slice of 'za and cold draft beer.

Oooh dependable Golden Boy. I so wanted to eat that third slice, but couldn't find the space. Maybe I should have declined on that second pint of Lagunitas IPA, but beer and pizza just taste so good together. It's nice to know this place is around, and the staff and people always make you feel welcome. Please don't ever leave.
The service might not be great, but you cannot find a better slice of pizza at 2:00am leaving the bars.  I have walked miles for Golden Boy pizza (figuratively) to complete my night.

oh, i love Golden Boy with all of my face.
~~
though i must say: good luck finding parking, dodging tourists and homeless ghosts.
~~
the BEST Sicilian-style slice of pizza awaits you.
~~~
notice West Coast bikers make this place a recurrent pitstop. That just about sums it up.

I cannot say enough good things. We are pizza lovers and especially love wood fire pizza. The one we got here was so good. We also loved the Cesar salad. The dressing was to die for.

Luckily we found some seats at the bar because the place was packed and the wait was over an hour. The service at the bar was really great. It was a insanely delicious meal. It was tough to find parking but that's just how it is downtown. I can't wait to go back!

As I entered Tony's, my heel went out from under me on the slick wooden floor.  None of the staff assisted me in getting up and as I approached the ladies room I was refused entrance by one of the wait staff because I was not a customer.  I hadn't had a chance to become a customer yet.  Unbelievable.  Where are these people from?  They must be New Yorkers!  Bring back La Felce and the lovely locals who cared about their customers.

I don't even care how fat I am about to sound right now I would eat everything in this place all day errryday including the plates and fuck it maybe some of the people. My brother was in town and wanted to go here because he saw it on tv or something, and so I decided to humor him and do something touristy because hey I'm not from here either.

Tony's has various styles of pizza, which I enjoy because I have various pizza needs, mostly dependent on my emotional state. My bro and I decided to get "Detroit style" because we are from Detroit (suburbs what what represent the D! I am horrifically white and I apologize for that). We didn't even know Detroit had a style of pizza so of course we had to try it. And of course I mentioned to the hot waiter that we were from Detroit, because this was my way of segueing into a conversation that would end in the hot waiter's pants. Unfortunately, that did not end up happening. I just get really horny around pizza, you guys.

Ok so the waiter was like "Detroit style, yeah like Shield's or Buddy's" and I'm like HOLY FUCKING WHAT how does this dude know about those places where I went as a kid and didn't think twice about? Detroit style is a square pizza with tons of cheese and tasted exactly like Shield's or Buddy's in a way that makes me feel like I actually had some good childhood memories and maybe I should rethink some of my daddy issues.

p.s. You'll probably have to wait like an hour to get seated which is the perfect amount of time to get a margarita (or 2) from 15 Romolo and then drunkenly sprint back to Tony's in the 5 minutes they allow you before they give up your table. So maybe wear a sports bra.
Pizza Marguerite was awesome meatballs were the best I've ever had, Jose was full of all sorts of knowledge about the Menu and the Area, we are from Vegas and we hope to come back soon.

If you could eat some of the best pizzas you've ever had but you were seated (literally) right next to a bathroom door, would you enjoy your dining experience? What if the bathroom door was fairly busy and you can hear the flushing and feel the annoying reverberations of the closing door against your seat after more than two dozen people used the bathroom (not to mention lined up next to your table) during your entire meal?

Tony's has two bathrooms towards the end of the bar. Only one door is marked; the other door is next to the last table. Unfortunately, that's where we were seated. When we were initially brought to our table, it was not ideal as it was near the marked bathroom door (we did not realize the table was immediately next to the other door that was unmarked) but the kids were hungry after the long wait so we sat down. We were ultimately disappointed that we were not warned when we were seated (I can understand Tony's logistical predicament but feel customers should at least be responsibly warned before being seated there. A cynic would not be blamed for wondering whether others have complained in the past so this would not be a revelation to the restaurant owners and wait staff and yet they continue to seat customers there perhaps hoping they would not notice until it was too late.)

It is unfortunate since the food is excellent--bread with three different olive oil dips, deep fried green beans, meatballs, Tartufo and New York pizza. I've lived in NYC, Boston and Los Angeles and this is among the best pizza I've had ever. Both kids loved the breads, green beans and their cheese pizzas.

So I guess as long as you remember my public service announcement and refuse to be seated next to the mystery door, you'll have a much better experience than we did. Of course, there's also takeout.

O.M.G this is truly one of the food highlights during our visit. They only make 25 meatballs a day but these aren't ordinary meatballs. They are the size of a babies head, seriously. The pizzas are amazing and the pasta was perfect. I would get so fat if I lived in the city because I would eat here a couple of times a week just to try everything on their menu.

The two stars are for the awesome food. I would love to give five stars except the ending service was unbelievable. After dining and paying a decent amount of money, were allowing our food to settle before we move on to the next place. This restaurant seems like it does pretty good business. It only has one restroom that is co-Ed. That's not the smartest business planning. At the end of dinner while one of my friends was in line waiting for the restroom, another friend joined us so we can take off for the show. About 3 seconds later the owner (a short man) came and said with a rude tone " we don't allow "joiners" to sit at the table. I've never ever heard such a thing and we have already paid and waiting to use the one restroom in the whole establishment. I really hope the owner addresses this

Anyone giving Tony's Pizza Napoletana less than five stars has obviously suffered severe taste bud damage and their judgement can no longer be trusted.

Yes, the wait is long. Get over it. Put your name in and then go walk around North Beach or go to the park across the street or go get a beer in a neighboring pub, for crying out loud!

Once seated you will be delighted by an attentive and knowledgeable staff (Scotty is a personal favorite) who can answer questions and make recommendations.

Get the meatballs for an appetizer. I love the Americano pizza. There is an organic garden atop the building where the herbs and tomatoes are grown. You read that correctly.

I'm not given to hyperbole, so I'll tone it down: Tony's Pizza Napolentana is the best pizza in all of SF, nay, the universe! And they have the trophies to prove it.
Best pizza in San Francisco!!!!!!!!!!!  You won't be desapointed !!!!!!!!!!!! ;) ps.: you have to be there early cause they have a lot of people waiting

This place was the perfect hangover fix. My wife and I both needed some good pizza to fix what we did in NYE.
The pizza was really good and reasonably priced.
We had the pepperoni and New York meat lovers. They hit the spot!

Golden Boy is THE perfect spot for refueling during your drunken stagger home from the bars and nightclubs in the area.  Nothing beats a greasy Sicilian slice when you're too hammered to make it home without sustenance.  Don't bother to park. Don't try to find it.  But when you stumble into it (literally?), definitely get a slice.

Certainly the best pizza of this style that I've had. The slices are cheap and tasty, the music is loud and the beer is cold. What more can you ask for in a "by-the-slice" joint of this type. I usually avoid places like this because they are dirty or the pizza generally sucks but this place nails it. The veggie and the combo are great choices; the sauce makes this pizza what it is. From time to time I've been known to say that this is the best pizza I've ever had and depending on my mood that's certainly true.

Awesome sicilian style pizza, which is good for the price.  The clam one is by far the best one available...Dive bar atmosphere with a pretty decent draught selection for a pizza place...Crowd varies but can be interesting and fun....A north beach staple for a reason...some of the best square slices on the west coast...but still not on the nyc level....regardless, it's a classic....

Great crust even if it's just on the bottom.  Crispy on the bottom while the top is soft and cheesy.  Had the Pesto Vegetarian...loved it!  Pesto, olives, onions, tomato...great deal, good pizza.  I had it with Limonata San Pelligrino...so Italian!

Came here for Sunday lunch today and had myself a slice of the pesto vegetarian. Mmmm mmmm.... sweet watery mouth goodness. The pizza (at least the one I ate) wasn't overly greasy, so I didn't finish lunch feeling like I needed to wash my face. Pretty big slice for $3.50. Service was good and speedy. Good place to swing by for a fast lunch if you're in the North Beach area.

If you ever find yourself stumbling home from the North Beach bars on a weekend night, stop by this place. Most of the stuff backing up this suggestion seems to have already been said, so I'll leave it at that. My favorite is usually the combo.

Solid slice of sicilian style pie. Cheap and fast with a pretty good beer selection. Being from boston i am still on the hunt for some real deal east coast pizza. Unfortunately to no avail yet, but golden boy will do till then.

Alright - it's a short review. I've found a surprising amount of SF locals that STILL have never been to Golden Boy. It's a North Beach staple. Ya gotta go. Oddly enough, my favorite is the clam and garlic pizza (yeah - you wanna make out after that?). You can get a BIG slice of quality pizza for less than $5 ($3.75 I believe). Great to take and walk. Or sit at the bar and have a slice with a pint of beer. Makes for a great night. There's normally a line if you show up after 10:00 - but it's worth the wait.

Extra large cookie sheets filled with square pizza sit right in their window, and an enticing aroma wafting out the door makes it difficult to pass by. Take it to go or grab a pint at the bar in this rustic little joint. The combo or the pesto rock my world.

Best pizza ever. I'm drooling right now remembering how delicious it is. I have only gotten my pizza to go, so I don't know how dine-in service is. From my quick glances it seems that seating is a little cramped.

The service is kind of shit, and the people are kind of trashy, but the pizza is spot-on. Unfortunately this place still hasn't accomplished packing flavor into their vegetarian slice by way of better or more sauce, perhaps more seasoning, it's still more fattening than anything. But this place satisfies when I'm drunk, sober, cold, or hot, and the delicious crunchy pepperoni atop these pillowy crusts make me happy.

I was just walking by for a quick snack on Sunday night. I saw Golden Boy Pizza and have always heard great reviews about their Pizza. BOY was everyone right. I had a slice of combination pizza and it was absolutely amazing. The crust was crispy and the toppings were juicy!  Must try! The staff there was also very nice people.

I live up the hill, and this place has been one of my usual staples for a place to get a cheap dinner when I don't feel like cooking.  In the past, this place has served pretty good "west coast pizza" (I'm from the east coast, so I have to modify my pizza expectations out here).  Lately however, the past few times I've ordered a few squares to bring home, the crust has been totally wet and salty.  I'm not sure what is going on there, but quality recently has taken a swan dive.  I'll curb my desire to give this place one star, based on past trips, and cross my fingers that they get their act together.

A friend of mine had a Total Recall party at her house in North Beach.  (yes the movie Total Recall). Every time they said the word Mars we would all have to drink....Damm they said Mars a lot.  Ok im off the subject but that night we ordered Pizza from Golden Boy, we ordered a peperoni pizza and a plain cheese pizza.  The pizza had pretty good flavor but it was to doughy.  Im a huge fan of NY style pizza, the thinner the crust the better.  So all in all i wouldn't order from here but I would eat it.
Did I hear square pizza! If you are in Northbeach you need to grab a slice of Golden Boy, it's been here ages that should speak for itself. So good.

I don't come to North Beach very often but after enjoying my 2 for 1 beers at the bar next door (or 2 down) I came here for a bite. I can see why there was such a crowd outside. Only drawback, it's cash only...boo. I can't wait to come back though...it WAS yummy...

I usually write five-star reviews b/c I write 'em when happy and sated.  I just got on the six-speed and rolled over to G-Boy for a quick light dinner (one slice) before the spring concert here at school.  Very satisfying and good North Beach flavor.  This place is no frills and always reliable.  I am not a big pizza guy but G-Boy is good.  Good stickers, good view of Green St, good.

I can't say I'm a fan. I can see the draw when your drunk and wanting something greasy. But this just doesn't scream pizza to me...but then again I'm partial to the huge floppy (snicker) slices ala NY pizza.

I find that the crust is too greasy...and they are kinda sparce on the toppings. I like my pizzas loaded.
Golden Boy comes through again.  Saturday night after a LOOOOOOOOONG night at O Malleys, the squares hit the spot.  My friends were in town and LOVED IT.
The best place to go after the bars in north beach!  The pesto vegetarian is my favorite, but I wish the line wasn't so long on weekend nights!

Place... Bad. Management VERY inconsiderate, rude, doesn't respect people's time and overall the worse place to be when visiting San Francisco! Save yourself the time and go somewhere else. ONE of the girls taking down the names ( you know who you are girl) was trying to go by the list but couldn't do anything and she also was upset. You deserve to be working at a better place. Over all DISRESPECTFUL.

I've rediscovered pizza and its name is Tony.

Nestled on a corner across from Washington Park and the St Peter and Paul Church, Tony's is situated on a somewhat more residential corner of North Beach. The large bar greets you as you enter.

For my first visit, I had to go with the award winners: the Margherita (2007 World Pizza Cup Winner) and the Cal Italia (Food Network Pizza Challenge Winner).

Margherita:
Cooked at 900 degrees for 90 seconds. The crust is still slightly doughy but there was a bit too much burnt crust for my taste. The pizza itself had a very thin crust. The flavor was light and simple, not overly complex. The creaminess of the mozzarella slices complemented the fresh basil leaves nicely. It was a good starter.

Cal-Italia:
So much dimension! Sweet, salty, savory, cheesy. The Cal Italia is a playground for the taste buds: paper thin proscuitto slices atop a cheesy bed of mozzarella, gorgonzola, asiago and parmesan cheeses and, of course, tomato sauce. Balsamic adds a bit of tanginess and the sweet fig preserve drizzled on top is literally (to use a cliche) the "icing on the cake". MY GOODNESS. I had to control my desire to devour each slice so that I could enjoy and appreciate all the flavorful layers. It must be tasted to be fully understood and appreciated.

I will return solely for Cal Italia, for I am convinced that eating at Tony's and not ordering it should be a crime.

Next time, I'll try the meatballs and the gorgonzola fries. My dining neighbors ordered them and I had food envy :)

Tony's only makes 73 of their World Pizza Cup winning Pizza Margheritas a day so you know when you're there for the first time and it's in stock, you gotta get it. This winning pie uses San Felice Flour (apparently that's special) and cooks for only 90 seconds in a 900 degree oven. 90 seconds!

So while waiting 90 seconds for our pie, they served us complimentary house bread with 3 dipping sauces. The first was olive oil with chopped raw garlic, the second was plain olive oil, and the third was olive oil with some pesto. The garlic one was the big winner. The house bread was fantastic and consisted of two types - a focaccia which had a nice flavor and big slices of something like pugliese.

I have to say the pizza looked beautiful with lots of bright red tomatoes, big splotches of fresh mozz, and basil leaves. The crust texture was perfect but was a little on the bitter side. (That crust bitterness reminded me of Lombardi's in New York.) Overall the pie was actually a little bland. I prefer shredded basil to get better basil coverage and thus more basil per bite. Oddly enough even though it was a little bland, there were some bites that were overly salty. These are minor criticisms because I thought the pie was very good on the whole. I just see ways for improvement. FYI: The Marg is $18 and on the small side for feeding two people. It only comes in one size.

The server was really friendly and knowledge about their pizzas. I didn't like that the busser refilled our glasses by lifting them up by the top where we put our mouths.

They obviously put a lot of care and respect into the pizzas and ingredients and I really would like to come back. There are THREE award winning pizzas on Tony's menu (the Marg, the Sicilian, and their Cal Italia), but next time I would definitely want to try their (non-award winning) New York or New Jersey style pizzas.

My Top 6 Pizzerias in the Bay Area:
1) Little Star, San Francisco
2) Pie in the Sky, Berkeley
3) Zachary's, Berkeley/Oakland/San Ramon
4) Patxi's, Palo Alto/San Francisco
5) Speederia, San Carlos
6) TONY'S PIZZERIA NAPOLETANA, SAN FRANCISCO

6th best! Pretty good!
Great menu...but the pizza was unimaginativve and way overpriced.  The 3 of us split a pizza..all agreed. The sangria was good.

This has been one of my neighborhood gems for over five years now. The food (shout out to the Detroit pizza and meatballs) is phenomenal, they make great negronis, and they have Peroni on tap. We always sit at the bar, and while there is usually a wait, the staff and patrons are polite as you hover. It's well worth it, and the bartenders are attentive and friendly, especially Jose.

I had high expectations walking in, but I was disappointed. First off, SO EXPENSIVE!  I went for lunch.  Two 12-inch pizzas, 1 meatball, and a side salad = $75 for 2 people for lunch.  No drinks, just water.  Add tip and easily $90.

Second, LONG WAIT.  When a line is over an hour long, you expect it to be heart swooning.  I think the line is all hype.....people see people streaming out the door....people see amazing yelp reviews, so they go.  Based on my experience, I would not go again.

Third, Tony's is famous for the Margherita pizza.  He's a World Pizza Champion and the backside of the menu has a little paragraph about the contest he won.  I was impressed.  But, by the time the pizza had arrived, the suuuuuper thin crust was soggy with oil and cheese grease.  It had only three globs of cheese per slice of pizza and a tiny amount of sauce on each slice.  I ate the whole 12-inch pizza by myself and was still hungry :(  Granted, the non-soggy part (the crust) was good.
