I will admit the salad was good.  Fresh lettuce, tomato, good balsamic dressing.  And, our waitress was very nice and friendly.

Seriously the best pizza around. Fantastic margarita pizza! This is the real deal.  Great wine selection!  

Taking 1 star away because they bussed our table as my husband was still eating. I can see removing dishes, glasses, but it was the dirty rag with stains really made him lose his appetite. I understand they were busy but bussing the table with a dirty, musty rag while people are still eating is a little over the top. It's not like he is a slow eater..if you know what I mean:)  we felt rushed even though we spent a decent amount of $$ on a good wine.  Anyway...we loved our meal so much, we'll be back.

Two stars for the food, no stars for the entire experience. We were a party of 7 that came in around 9:45. No tables were available so they sat us in the last table at the end of the row of tables outside. When our waitress arrived 10 minutes after we sat, she seemed to have some sort of attitude and didn't even ask what we wanted to drink, we had to tell her. Then I asked if we could get bread - it is $3 per bread basket and $7 for garlic bread! Wtf?! When do you pay for bread at an Italian restaurant ? One that I won't be going back to that's forsure! So then we ordered our food shortly. Someone in our party wanted ranch - an additional 75 cents?! STINGY! It took a little over 40 minutes for food to start arriving. Everyone was slowly getting there food one by one (a thing I ABSOLUTELY HATE, just bring the food all at once!) My dinner ended up taking the longest and I had to ask where it was. When the food finally arrived, it was piping hot and tasted good, it was just so late and I felt sick to my stomach after. Would not recommend to anyone traveling to Little Italy or any residents. Completely ruined our first night in town!

Tony's is definitely up there in my book along with Tomasso (thought I actually think the pizza at Tomasso's is better, and it's also not as touristy...).  It's a lovely place to take out of town guests for awesome, delicious, pizza, right in the heart of North Beach.  

Our party of 8 arrived right around 645 pm and was told the wait would be an hour to an hour and 1/2.  The friendly and cute hostess took down my number, stated she would call when it's ready and off to Rogue we went for some brews.

Just about 35 minutes and one beer later, the hostess calls us to tell us our table is ready and that we lucked out with a corner table right by the window!  We arrive and she profusely apologizes that there was a table of 10 that she needed to seat in the first table that was reserved for us. No big deal, but it was nice that she was so apologetic.  So we immediately get seated at a table right next to the original one.

Sadly, they were out of the world famous margherita pizza, but not a problem as that's never my pizza of choice--bring on the meat!  We split a lot of different items:

-Quattro Formaggio -- delicious pizza loaded with multiples types of cheese (probably my least fav pizza)
-Rotelli pasta -- which comes with Pesto Sauce, Sun Dried Tomatoes, Marinated Artichoke Hearts, Mozz, Parmigiano.  This was awesome, but definitely a heavier pasta dish.
-Penne -- Arrabiata  with a very Spicy Bolognese Sauce, Calabrese Peppers, Sliced Fennel Sausage.  Loved this pasta dish, but be careful if you're not into spicy food.
Scarola con Pancetta -- my favorite pizza that came served with crushed red pepper, mozz, pancetta, goat cheese, escarole, and sweet picante peppers. Sooooo SPICY! Be careful! :)
-Romano's original 1950s Stromboli -- this was also pretty awesome.  Super filling, it was filled with Ham, Sliced Italian Sausage, Pepperoni, Sweet Peppers, Mozzarella, American Cheese.

Serivce was great, prices are a bit steep, but the pizza is awesome and the atmosphere is great.  Good spot for large parties and the bar would be perfect for 2 ppl.

Meh. Hey waitress, stop telling me your pizza is cooked at 900 degrees. I don't care. I just want to eat good pizza.

Soggy crust is soggy crust. I eat pizza all the time and, especially in NY, I don't get an earful of crap about the temperature of ovens, they just serve a good slice and they serve it fast and inexpensive. My mouth likes it.

Tony, you charge me an arm and a leg, your pizza takes forever, and then your waitstaff insult me with their "You don't understand. We are told the oven is 900 degrees" nonsense. I'm listening and I don't care about your super fancy expensive oven alloy stone whatever. I'm not chewing on your oven. I'm chewing on soggy crust, bland and cold sauce. End of story.

update: some wise guy emailed me to say he's been here 50 times and never had soggy pizza. well, good for you mr salad lover. try a pizza sometime and you won't be back.

the guy also says he grew up in NY. la-de-da. if i have questions about overcooked chicken wings drenched in vinegar i'll be sure to let you know.

let me put it this way. if my hand is wet from the slimy bottom of a crust, and i tell the waitron, i see at least two options. they can touch/look at the problem and fix my experience *or* they can get on a high horse and lecture me about their consultants, stones and thermometers. the latter doesn't fix the problem. the earth is not flat no matter what you say. you can keep your false pride and customer-is-wrong attitude. i won't be back.

another update:

some lady emails me that i'm too negative. ok, let me be positive. if i were a fish, i would love this place because the pizza is so wet it's like it was made under water. she also says she wants to die for the balls here. go ahead. die for balls. why are you telling me this? and she offers me a hug. i don't care about your kinky pleasures. i said the pizza is bad. you like balls? good for you. but if you think you can bribe me with hugs to change how i feel about soggy pizza and bad service, think again.

i don't need no lectures, i don't need no bribes. make better pizza. kthxbye

Just what i needed after a heavy night of drinking.  My SF friend Spike took me to his favorite place for pizza in the city. And i was not disappointed. I'm used to thick east coast Sicialian slices but Golden Boy was a nice thinner change of pace. They will be a new staple of my San Francisco eating. I'll be thinking about my next slice for months.

I love love love love love this pizza.  First time I had it was ages ago with my cousin who lived up the street. We were on "the piss" and so were hungry from all the drink we'd had.  This place is truly golden in it's deliciousness.  I've hooked my boyfriend on this pizza and whenever we're hungry and in North Beach we head to this place.  I have to say I'm unbelievably excited to see there is one on the peninsula now.  The delicousness is closer!!!!

Great place to go after an evening of drinking or for a quick snack. The pizza is great and they usually have a lot of options to choose from. It's a bummer that it's cash only but definitely worth the wait if you are craving a good pizza by the slice. The crust is what sets them apart from the other by the slice places and the service is fun and nice. During the day it's mostly tourist but at night you have to fight the drunken crowd, which is great if you are in the mood to make new friends.
If you like greasy & crispy, Golden Boy Pizza is it.  My favorite pizza in the city even when I'm not drunk.

Best pizza in the city!!!!!!!!

I can't tell you how many times I have drunkenly found my way to this place.  It has saved me from numerous hangovers.

Deep dish deliciousness.
Hot damn!  Satisfied my craving for delicious pizza. I love smart phones for pointing me in the right direction. Keep up the great work!
Best pizza ever. That's all you need to know. Be prepared to wait in line because the pizza is that good and that worth it.

cheesus, their pizzas are so easy to eat.

i find it exceptionally hard to stop from continually biting into the focaccia goodness. filling and at the same time so light. coming in here with the munchies? holy.

had too many bites of slices of the cheese, sausage, combination, and clam pizzas. no regrets. sauce on the face and greasy fingers galore. terribly hard to share or stop at just one square slice.

eating in is just as fun as taking your slices to-go and having them in the park, by the water, or at vesuvio. wherever you choose to be, just eat the damn pizza and find happiness.

PS: follow up with dessert; traipse into chinatown and get them egg tarts at golden gate bakery. i think you've found your weekend daytime plan before hitting up the bars. ya welcome.
Another great spot for pizza besides Tony's Pizza. The only 2 places I recommend. This place is good for late nights and when you had a few drinks.

I've been here twice and liked the pizza both times.  It's a hip little spot and it is definitely a place to stop in when you're running around Little Italy.  Love the vibe and the pizza is pretty good too.  Be prepared for a line but it goes quickly.  Definitely check it out and I will stop in whenever I'm nearby to get another taste of the clam pizza, it's GOOD!!!

I've figured out why I haven't tried all the different restaurants that North Beach has to offer ... all I want to do when I'm in the area is go to Golden Boy for a couple slices.  You can't go wrong with whatever coming directly out of the oven, sit at the counter and enjoy a slice and a beer.
LOVE the Golden Boy. Fantastic Sicillian pizza and a nice selection of draft beers in a cool, clean little place tucked away in North Beach.

Not to many Sicilian pizza joints in SF, but this ones pretty damn good. Plus they've got all the extra stuff - grated cheese, red pepper, oregano - in shakers which makes a slice all the more better. A good selection of draft beer too. It's off the beaten path in North Beach, so it's not filled with a bunch of tourists - You've kind of gotta' now about it.

I LOVE this pizza after a long night of booze! Nothing will ever taste so good! And as I am walking away with ten pieces of pizza becuase they all looked so tempting in the window, I will feel content and nervous becuse I know I will also feel slightly ill in the morning.
Good pizza. I wouldn't go there after midnight though. You'll see nothing but drunk preppy guys looking to start a fight. I had to throw down 2x in 10 minutes.

A great place!  My boyfriend and I wanted to grab a quick bite before meeting some friends out at a bar.  We didn't really know where to go, but stumbled upon this place as it was right near Royale, where we were meeting friends.  This was the perfect spot to find.  They had lots of beers on tap (and for us East Coasters who can't get Fat Tire, we were happy to see it) and the pizza slices were perfect!  Just the right consistency, plenty of options, and served piping hot.  We sat at the bar, and the bartender/server was awesome.  We chatted with him a little while he served a steady stream of locals either eating at the bar or getting takeout.  The beer and food were cheap, and we almost didn't want to leave.  Even though I was full, I ordered a third slice because it was that good.  It was the perfect low-key place to eat.
Love the pepperoni pizza.  My favorite in the city - perfect crust/sauce/cheese ratio.  And you can carry a slice next door to Columbus Cafe!

If you like shi**y pizza that tastes frozen then Golden Boy Pizza is for you...  If you like to stand in long lines and wait for shi**y pizza then golden boy is for you.   Save your money and starve...

For a quick cheap slice, there's nothing better.  The crust is delightfully crisp yet doughy.  If I'm in North Beach and need something quick (and sometimes even when I don't), I hit Golden Boy and am never disappointed.

While I wouldn't say it's the best pizza in the world, I would have to say that there are times when I would believe that it is.  Like this past Saturday night around 12:30am.  I was drunk and it was my salvation.

If there is one thing I'm rapidly coming to terms with, it's my aging keester on a bar stool at dinner. Oh hey, it's not what you think.

The Birthday Boy wanted to stop by and check out the Margherita pizza, and I'm not one to stand in the way of a birthday wish, even with plenty of people lined up for tables in the middle of a Saturday afternoon. We were offered bar seating and without hesitation, St. Hubbins headed to the end of the bar to maximize his view of the room, among other things.

But wait. Maybe your assumptions were correct. From the moment we sat down, it was clear the bartenders knew what they were doing. So while the Birthday Boy wanted a draft Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, I just had to sample some of the offerings on the cocktail menu. First up, the Aviator. Before the pizza had even arrived, I was already planning our next visit on the merit of this drink alone. Fortunately, the pizza arrived before I could finish and order another. With palate cleansed, it was time to order another round. This time I tried the House Negroni. I truly appreciated the bartender's fair warning regarding one of the ingredients, Campari, as he considered it an acquired taste and offered to prepare another drink if I didn't like this one. Well, all I can say is: what's not to like?!

But this was supposed to be a review about the award-winning pizza. So ok, we really did like the pizza, the service was great and we expect to return from time to time to work our way through the restaurant offerings we didn't select today. And who knows, we might even sit at a table.

I think the Birthday Boy might be having afterthoughts about my increasing acceptance of the bar as dinner table. Because right now, he's online shopping for creme de violette, maraschino liqueur, and Campari. Hee, Happy Birthday to ME!

For a two hour wait I expected Pizza like I've never had before.  It was ok and there is better to be had around the City.  Servers and staff were good.  Pizza was okay despite all the fancy ingredients. If you are in North Beach, a local and don't want to bother for the wait...head to Golden Boy's or Don Pistos up the street.

This is the like the Mama's line but at night. If you are a local that will make sense to you.

I read the stellar reviews. I heard on the news it was rated by some reputable publication, "best pizza in the country." I went on a Saturday night at 5PM. It was a 2 hour wait. I went back on a Tuesday. It was closed. Needless to say, the hype was so built up about Tony's that I could barely contain my excitement about stuffing my face there.

My friend and I decided the ONLY way this was going to happen is if we went really early...like 4PM early. The wait was 30 minutes this time, much more manageable. We ordered their famous pizza margarita, a cesar salad and some meatballs with burrata. The cesar salad was one of the best I've had; very fresh and perfectly dressed. The meatballs were good but the burrata made it, otherwise it would have been like any other meatball I've had. What should have been the crowning glory - the pizza - was sadly lackluster. The dough was chewy, not crispy, and while it tasted good, we both were scratching our heads wondering what the fuss was about.

If you want an amazing pizza, Delarosa's burrata pizza is the best I've had in SF thus far.
Certainly the best pizza "experience" in our beautiful area. 'Nuf said.

As someone that lives in the area, I've eaten here several times but have gotten tired of their attitude and ambiance, which is the reason I won't be coming back.

First the positives: the pizza, especially margherita, is pretty good although not the best and it is a bit on the pricier side. For appetizer, the stir-fried string beans with garlic are great and worth it.

The negatives: as others have mentioned, the service can be pretty rude--especially the maitre d' on multiple occasions. Last time when my wife and I went, we asked how long would be and the maitre d' said "Wait" and disappeared for about 15 minutes. During that time, I went to the restroom, at which point the maitre d' returned and told my wife our table was ready. When my wife told him that I was in the restroom, the maitre d' immediately gave our spot to the next people in line.

In general, they have an unfriendly condescending attitude perhaps because they are popular and get a lot of business. At one point they were giving out pizza boxes with an Ed Hardy design. We told the waiter we didn't have any left overs and didn't need a box, at which point he insisted that we could still take it since it is free (never minding the wasted garbage).

Although the food is decent, the service and ambiance has convinced me to not come back.

I came here unwittingly to meet up with some friends, and was totally stunned.

Now, I realize that no expectations are sometimes even easier to meet than low expectations, but this place is just great!

Sat at the bar.  Bartender was super friendly, not just to me, but to everyone that came in-- a smile on her face and engaging in conversation, even when she was obviously busy.  Prompt service.  Perhaps the staff was so happy because the owner is also here a warm and friendly person!  Though I stuck to wine, I sampled my friends' drinks, and I must say this place has some tasty cocktails!

Shared the Quail Egg pizza and the Cal Italia.  Adored the fig and the cheeses on the Cal Italia & the texture of the quail egg pizza was oddly tantalizing.

...wait--I wasn't even hungry when I got here! ...I don't even remember how many slices I downed--it was that gooooooood.  Thank god this place is a brisk walk away from where I live.  Cal Italia might be my new fave!

After months of anticipation, we finally came here to celebrate a friend's birthday with a large party of 8.  We ordered the following:

Calimari Fritti (3/5): pretty standard fried calimari, which remained relatively crispy throughout the course of the meal.  Good but not amazing.

Meatballs (4/5): Deliciously moist, large meatballs with a savory, chunky tomato sauce.  The tomato sauce was garlicky and so tasty that we spooned it over our pizzas and focaccia.  Definitely order this!

Coal Fired New Yorker (3/5) ( mozzarella, hand crushed tomato sauce, natural casing pepperoni, sliced italian fennel sausage, ricotta, chopped garlic & oregano): Tasty but not outstanding.  It was flavorful, but the ricotta would probably have tasted better had it been on the sicilian style gigante we ordered, as it was a little bland on the thinner crust.

Coal Fired White Pie with Clam and Garlic (2/5): We were most disappointed with this pizza.  It wasn't briny/clammy enough, and the white pizza had a generous amount of some kind of mild cheese.  We unanimously favored Amici's clam pizza over Tony's.

Classic Italian Panchetta Porcini (4/5) (mozzarella, wild mushrooms, porcini, imported pancetta, truffle oil, smoked scamorza, fresh thyme):  How can you possibly go wrong with truffle oil, wild mushrooms and pancetta??  Delicious, and I'd order it again if we were going with a large enough party.

Classic Margherita (4.5/5): This is one of the pizzas Tony's is famous for, and it's no wonder.  The thin crust is chewy and pliable with a crisp, charred crust.  The tomato sauce was nicely balanced and the flavors meshed really well.  Winner!

Sicilian Style Gigante (4/5) (garlic, molinari salami, mushroom, bell peppers, red onion, pepperoni, linguica, sausage, green onion, black olives, cherry tomato): Some people didn't like this as much as some of the other pizzas, only because they like thin crust, but I really liked this one!  It was incredibly flavorful and I loved the airy, soft yet crispy focaccia.  With all the other slices though, I wasn't able to finish an entire slice, but I'd definitely have this one again, too.

Excellent service and great pizza is a fabulous location on Washington Square!

My family has been raving about Tony's Pizza for a while so I was glad to have had the opportunity to check it out this weekend. We got here early for dinner on a Saturday and managed to get a table before the crowds lined up.

We ordered the Cal Italia & Margherita pizzas along with the Spaghetti & Meatballs and Caesar Salad. The salad was decent but I would have liked more anchovies in my dressing. We didn't get there in time to get one of the coveted 73 Margherita pies of the day but the version we got was pretty damn good so I am intrigued to see how much better it would be with the San Felice flour dough. The Cal Italia is a Food Network Gold Medal winner but it was not a favorite among my group. The Croatian Fig Preserve just did not mesh well with the other ingredients in this pizza, in my humble opinion. I didn't care for the sweetness of this pie. The Spaghetti & Meatballs was my favorite dish. The pasta was thick and freshly made, the meatballs were juicy and the tomato sauce was just perfect.

The bill was $100 for the 4 of us, which is quite reasonable. I look forward to coming back and tasting the coveted Margherita pie in all its glory.

3.5  The style we tried is not my favorite.  Neapolitan style is thin and floppy.  I like semi thin with a crisp non floppy crust.  The toppings on the margarita were very  good.  I would go back and try on of the other styles.  The salads looked fantastic.  We sat at the bar . Lots of beer on tap.  The bartender, who was also our food server, was hilarious!

You know that mouth watering, dream about your meal later type of deliciousness. That was my meal hear.
If your visiting or live in San Francisco this is a must stop shop. It was a little wait for the table but they also have part of their shop that us strictly for to - go and phone orders. They also have a bar area that you can order a drink while you wait. We sat at a table outside. It was a nice night and they had heating lamps to warm you up. I got myself an old fashioned to drink, one of my staples. It did not disappoint.  We then ordered the chorizo muscles.  Now I have never had muscles before but I am a big fan of chorizo. This was such a great choice for an appetizer. The muscles and chorizo melted to gather very well and the whole this was on a bed of break so at the end you had bread that was soaked in the same flavor that we were just delighting in. When we ordered the pizza the waitress was very informative about the selection of style of pizza. At the end of it we decided to get the "New Yorker" a coal fire pizza will pepperoni, different types of sausages, home made tomato says, mozzarella, ricotta, basic, just packed with goodness. It was ever so gratifying. Each bite had a little, crunch, a little spice and the ricotta rounded out the flavors making for a smooth savory finish.  We were not able to finish the pizza as we had just devoted the chorizo muscle but we save it for the next day on the trip back home. Both my boyfriend and myself couldn't wait till we pulled over for lunch to finish the pizza.
If you do go here you meal will be not only satisfying but your mouth will water a little just thinking of it.
I love foccacia bread, so if the pizza is made on foccacia?! I am in serious munchie mode!
DEEEEELICIOUS! an awesome snack anytime of the day. ANd the service rocks

While I love this city mainly because you can get pizza by the slice no matter what neighborhood you are in!, Golden Boy Pizza is a place I usually walk right past. Surprisingly, the line is usually out the door, and since it sells so fast, the pizza always looks fresh (that's rare!) but the pizza is always lacking. Maybe because it's in that annoying square shape, they only accept cash, are pretty rude (the people that work there swear they are so cool) and never put enough toppings on the pizza to accomodate the massive amounts of dough they use in making them.

not a fan.
Really People?  I know food tastes better when you're wasted-high-etc, but how drunk WERE you when you tasted this pizza?  Really thick, doughy crust, mediocre toppings.  Meh.
The Clam and Garlic Pizza is the Bomb!  Nuff Said!
This place rocks, fast, fresh, cheap and some of the best pizza I have ever had!

I think I need to come back again in order to make it 5 stars as I was super drunk the first time I was here.  As far as I can remember, the pizza was YUMMY!  We lucked out and ordered the slices that were fresh from the oven.  We waited hald an hour for a crispy, foccacia crust with lots of toppings at 3AM in the morning...and it was all worth it.

Definitely best in class. There were times when the domestic thing didn't get organized, and Golden Boy kept the marriage intact by being there with the perfect slice of pizza and the nicely chilled glass of  small brew ale to make everything alright.

As I approached the location, the smell was amazing.  They only offer a few varieties (cheese, pepperoni, sausage, clam/garlic, vegetarian, and combination), which is a good thing because they do those few very well.  The texture and consistency were perfect, soft and chewy, but not soggy, with a bit of crsipness around the egdes (nothing near a teeth-breaking crunch).  It is a small place with limited seating, and I ended up eating my pizza out on the sidewalk out of a piece of wax paper and my hands smelled and felt like pizza until I got home.  I would have rather enjoyed the moment with my pizza while seated, with ample napkins and the chance to wash my hands afterward.  But other than inconvenience of the limited seating, it's worth stopping by if you're looking for a quick bite to eat and enjoy a wholesome pice of pizza.

Back in SF on vacation and walking around North Beach. Obviously had to get a slice and sit in the park with it. YUM. New York is currently experiencing a square pizza craze but this spot has been offering up the goodness for years.

This rivals the NYC pizza I was raised on. Bravo for good pizza in SF. We had the New Yorker and the margarita. Both were delicious. New Yorker was crispier, and the margarita was a bit doughy. Yum, highly recommend both!

Super small place. 2 hour wait! The front hostess was super rude. Saw me standing in from of her waiting to put my name down did not eve acknowledge me. She ended up walking away, then walking around for about 10 mins before she actually came to put my name down.

Good pizza -/ not NYC and not exactly Napolitano but good nonetheless!!  I like my crust just a little more cooked and if like to see more by the slice varieties too.

When in San Francisco I'd go back for sure!!  Great for families and kids too!

Wow.  I had a slice of pepperoni, my wife had a slice of cheese and we other thought it was probably the best NY style pizza we've had.  Usually with NY style pizza, I don't have problems leaving the crust behind, but even the crust was superb!  Great affordability and taste - I *will* return!

I've traveled all around Italy and spent a solid amount of time in New York, Chicago, LA - all the American pizza cities - and this is the pizza that I dream of at night. I have driven hours out of my way to get a slice - not an understatement. Phenomenal and shockingly worth the ridiculously long line to get a table.

GREAT PIZZA!!! Even on a Sunday night at 6pm, there was already 1.5 hour wait for 4 people. I suggest dropping your name really early, then peruse through stores nearby. They will call you.
Anyways, I highly recommend the new yorkers. I got the one with pepperoni and sausage and it was fantastic. The crust was still crispy and the sauce was so savory. Our entire table are from the east coast and we all approved of this pizza. I wasn't a big fan of the california one though. We had one with prosciutto and greens and mushrooms. The bread was chewy and the flavors were bland. Would love to come back for the new york pizza, but for take out!! We also got the asparagus and sauteed spinach to balance the meal a little more. We were also sitting outside, where it was windy, so we needed some warmth soon.

I always feel a tad guilty when I ascribe less than 4 stars to such a notorious and well-acclaimed neighborhood favorite such as Tony's.

However, I must remain true to my experience. I went in expecting to ravage allegedly one of the best pizzas in San Francisco. However, I came out quite neutral - I didn't LOVE the pizza. I liked it. And I certainly didn't think it was one of the best ones I've had in SF. In fact, I much prefer the nearby Golden Boy.

We ordered the New Yorker to satisfy our meat-tooth. And although there was nothing wrong with the pizza, it wasn't particularly great - the flavor was bland (I've had juicier and more flavorful meaty pizzas before - Adrienne's Pizza Bar in NYC has the best meat pizza hands down). The ricotta cheese was a nice touch but I wish it was more evenly spread out throughout the pizza.

Perhaps the New Yorker isn't their best pizza and I should have ordered the Margherita but I judge based on consistency and this wasn't 5 or 4 star worthy.

Tip: The line gets insanely long to dine in on weekends and they don't take reservations. I'd recommend this as a take-out spot instead.

Cozy.  Popular.  Satisfactory.

Acclaimed margherita pizza was soggy.  Mozzarella was plastic-y.  Pizza sauce decent.
American style Combo pizza was doughy.  Reminiscent of upgraded Extreme Pizza.

Truffle fries come out hot and delish.
Meatballs are large and in charge.

Wait is long (approx 40 min-1 hr)
Calling cell phone when table ready is good.
Head hostess be power trippin
Bar scene looks like a good time

Fun for big groups (6-8) if someone puts name down hour in advance.
Would rather go to L'Osteria for thin italian pizza in NB.

$$20-40 for pizza and apps

I'm pretty confident that everything here is absolutely delicious based off of ONE visit.

Friend and I came here after wondering where the HELL to eat in North Beach because it's like a limitless pit of choices. I had heard that this place was good, so we roughed the "45" minute wait (was actually 30 minutes -- and they call your cell phone when they are ready!) and was seated in a timely fashion. Waiter was super nice and attentive too.

FOOD: We ordered the tagliatalle pasta and the margarita pizza which they only make like 75 of per day. BOTH WERE SO DELICIOUS I couldn't get enough. Even the bread and the garlic and olive oil concoction was great. The crust of the pizza has some crack on it I think because it is soo addicting. The pasta was rich but also delicious. Hard to finish between two people but hey. even leftovers the next day did the trick.

COMING HERE AGAIN!

UGH I am breaking my self imposed gag-order on Yelp reviews to review Tony's.

"We" went here during Fleet Week and "we" ordered a margarita pizza. What we got was one of THE 70-whatever special $19 ones.
It was gross.
It was so burned and charred on the bottom it was like licking coal.
It wasn't that good. It was 3 stars good.

I appreciate that you used "the best flour" and "the best cheese" and "the best tomatoes and basil" from Italy, but FFS- why WHY would you then proceed to BURN THE EFF OUT OF IT???

And then the worst part! I went back and read other Yelper's reviews like, "Ohemgee this is THE best pizza ever, its like pizza sex," because I was like wtf am I missing something???

... NO. Half of the reviews say it's charred! (1) This pisses me off because if you write a review saying it's the best pizza ever, and then go, oh, but like... it was too charred STILL THE BEST LOLZ-- you are a BAD yelper. BAD YELPER!

(2) And this pisses me off because I waited something like 2 years for this pizza and it wasn't good! Now I'm wondering what else is over hyped in SF- do you know what that does to a person's psyche????? I AM ANGRY TYPING RIGHT NOW.

So no. This is not the best pizza in the world.

*And don't even try to get all up in here saying "I must not know quality." Quality doesn't taste like coal.

** I do highly recommend their pizza by the slice place, though. BECAUSE IT WASN'T BURNED. And when it's not burned, with a thick crust and oodles of cheese it is actually really good. (Yes, basically when its a COMPLETELY DIFFERENT pizza entirely.)

*** Oh and it's not even like they had an "off" day or something, they cook each pizza for 90 seconds! EACH pizza, that means any and all of the 64 pizzas they cook special each day are created the same.

**** And all of the staff and servers were great, so no one should get punished for this except whoever decided the pizza should be burned in the first place!
Good Beers on Tap. Pizzas unique and Tasty, butwatch out for the Hot Sauce. Made me cry.
It's a bummer that they don't deliver but making the journey there is totally worth it. They have a good beer selection and the pizza is awesome. And they have a matt cain poster.

This is the very best Sicilian style pizza I've ever had. I don't eat pizza often becuase I am a tough critic, but this place is my new favorite!  Too bad I live six hours away!  ..Except that I would probably get fat on Golden Boy if I lived in SF.  Enjoy!

cant go wrong. i cant even explain it. its sO frkn good.

my only complaint is that so man others know about it. so the wait is always tooo long! =(
Easily the best pizza I've had in SF.  I live nowhere near here, and make special trips out to North Beach for this pizza.

I live almost directly above this place so I am tempted to get a slice every day after work.  Be warned that this is not like the traditional napoletana pizza you will find throughout most of little italy.  This is made on thicker focaccia bread in a square baking pan and the slices are square as well.  I have tried most of their different slices and the clam and garlic is by far my favorite.  Grab a slice and cruise around North Beach, you won't be dissappointed.
Best pizza in the city.  Single slice with only a few choices but what amazing choices.  The place is always busy and for good reason. Have a beer and a slice and you won't regret it.

If you like pizza then you have got to stop and get a slice here- its amazing! The line can get a bit long but most of the crowds hit the road after they grab a slice to finding a seat inside is usually pretty easy. Next time I am in North Beach I will be having another slice (and probably every time after that!).

sooooo bomb!! Pizza by the slice - im a fan.

It was funny because my friends and I were kind of hungry, buzzed, and were walking around in SF for food....

Turned on Yelp on our iphone and found this place

BEST DECISION EVER!! LOL

Get the garlic clam pizza. u can't go wrong. Stop by!! you won't regret it

HANDS DOWN!!! BEST PIZZA PLACE EVER, i dont care what anyone else says! This place shits on other pizza joints in the bay. Just thinking of this place right now makes me hungry. I always order their vegetarian pizza and have tried the clams/garlic pizza. Both were extremely satisfying. On top of it, ITS DIRT CHEAP! I love how they dont look like regular sliced pizzas, but are in square pieces. And its hot when you get it too. MMMMMMmmmM. Dont even bother looking for parking, because chances are you're not going to find any!
This pizza was so scrumptious. Absolutely love it! The crispiness on the bottom surprises me every time. Golden Boy Pizza knows good pizza.
Possibly the best pizza I've had. Delicious, non-greasy and fast service. Try it - you might like it!
Hot, tasty big slices of pizza, what else do you need for $4 and under  without drink.

The pizza was awesome, but the service was terrible. The girl working the register was extremely rude, and refused to pour us a beer that we had paid for because she was confused on the number of beers we had ordered. Again, the pizza was very good. The garlic clam was something different and very good.

We spent 35 min walking up Columbus from Pier 39. We were directed to a small hole in the wall pizza joint in North Beach. It was the best pizza we have ever had. The ratio of crust to sauce to cheese was perfect. The price was very reasonable. This will definitely be a stop on my next trip to San Fran!
Only annoying thing was cash only. Great food for late night. Definite must try and worth the wait in line

A good slice of pizza! Wanted a place to eat before a concert at the Warfield. We trekked it over here from Montgomery Bart since my friends had a craving for the Clam Pizza. I decided to try it out as well since they always talk about it. I'd call it more of a garlic pizza since the clams are pretty hidden within the slice. But overall it taste pretty good! I'd say the crust is the star of the  pizza. You could probably put anything on that crust and it would be an awesome slice. (Although I don't know if I'd make the same walk for another slice) Next time I'll just drive or have my bike at least.

This place is open till late in the night, which is great as there are many times when you need food late. The pizza (pesto and cheese) was delicious, right out of the oven and extremely soft. The ambience is really funky, with posters all around. It seems that you are having a pizza party in a college dorm. I am definitely going back.
amazing amazing amazing. the pizza is great after some drinks... really is a great golden pizza place!

Homer Simpson would say '' Hmmmmmm Golden Boy Pizza .. ''  you can get hooked on the garlic & clam pizza here ...... really tasty pizza in North Beach... legendary , popular place ..... quick service- fair pricing ... disregard the naysayers -- this place has a strong,loyal following for good reason --- its very good pizza .

Had the meatballs in the marinara and a selection of pizzas. Can't go wrong with this place, but you definitely have to get a Margherita. Plenty of places to go have a drink while you wait for a table.

I'm here once a week

Awe, Tony, we had such high hopes.  Really, we did!  We were so looking forward to trying this much raved about Pizza.

We drove around for nearly hour trying to find parking.  North Beach is crazy on a Saturday night.  Just as we were about to leave and come another time, we found Rock Star parking right in the front.

It was about 7ish and there was a 45 minute wait, which wasn't too bad because we got to enjoy a nice glass of wine prior to sitting.

We were sat in the side room where the woodfire oven is.  It was great being able to watch Tony in action.  The server was extremely knowledgable, pleasant and very attentive.

We ordered their infamaous Margherita.  They only serve 73 of these a day.  So if you get there late, then they may run out.  We also ordered the Salsiccia.

Let's start with the Margherita.  :/  This pie, was the 2007 World Pizza Cup winner in Naples, Italy.  :(  I guess a lot can happen in two years, either that or they were having an off night maybe?  The sauce was ok, but the crust was really thick and doughy and the flavor was lacking.  Overall, average to me.  I prefer lighter texture, light and crisp dough.

The Salsiccia's crust was even thicker and doughier!  Not light and crisp, but thick and heavy.  :/  Not my style of pizza.  The flavor of the sausage was good though.

:(  I wish I could give them more for the food, but, I'd be lying.  So, honestly, I think my overall experience is a 3.  

Won't be rushing back.

The pizza here is sooo good. It was pretty crowded, and I was there on a Sunday night. It was definitely worth the wait.

I don't remember which pizzas we got, I think one of them was the Americana. I loved everything about the pizza, we also ordered a salad that was delicious, and some cheesy garlic bread. Yummmmmm..

I will most definitely be back!

Everyone knows about Tony's so not sure what more I can say. But I loved it for 3 years and then I tried someone new off the menu and like that even better now! Cocolli's and the St. Louis - that's my go to now.

Pros
- very good options for vegetarians, the Margarita pizza is incredibly good; a tad too oily for me though!
- good beer selections
- efficient, friendly service

Cons
- caution, it's prolly the most popular pizzeria in SF, so get ready to wait-:)
- $$$, but you get what you pay for!

seriously - every pizza here is astonishingly tasty...like DAMN. and they really know how to get me with their variety of sweet drizzlings that make for deeelicious sweet and savory pies!!!

there are 7 new pizzas on the menu...and they are every bit as amazing as the others! these are lighter pizzas - "california style" - they have the same type of crust as the margherita - thin and wet in the center, light, airy and charred around the perimeter.

tried the Wild Robiola (mozzarella, straciatella, robiola cheese, wild mushrooms, truffle oil, speck, piave, arugula) - thick shavings of full flavored and slightly sour robiola cheese, thin strips of smokey speck, and bitter arugula sitting on the surface make this pizza very bold-flavored. the tender mushrooms and truffle oil add even more aroma and savoriness. omg loved IT!

also got the Pizza Campari (mozzarella, pancetta, goat cheese, escarole, sweet piquante peppers, and campari blood orange reduction) - this one was basically a mini salad on top of a mozzarella and pancetta pizza. it had sweet red peppers, lettuce, and clumps of pungent goat cheese scattered atop the surface. the BEST part was the drizzle of blood orange reduction that added a zesty, tangy sweetness. i wanted to have this one JUST for the campari blood orange reduction. it was wonderFUL!

i'll be back to try the Fear and Loathing pizza - pulled pork in tamarind, habaneros, citrus, and tomato over mozzarella, fresh cactus & agave nectar salsa, and queso fresco - purely because it sounds so ridiculous. i wouldn't be surprised if it was absolutely yummers.

Best pizza ever! I was invited to eat here with a couple of friends a few days ago. I was not expecting much from a mere little pizza place in San Francisco. To me, pizza is pizza. Any pizza is good to me.

As soon as they brought out first  famous Margherita pizza, I was in awe. An explosion of taste and delicacy took place in my mouth. I could not believe this little pizza, simple yet quite fascinating, was being made in this  little pizza place. My group of fellow eaters kept ordering different pizzas. Slice after Slice, I kept eating. Each pizza pie brought different taste and textures. All I can say was my dining experience was awesome.

I am a huge advocate of fresh food. And let me tell you, everything here is super fresh. From the fresh tomato sauce to fresh mozzarella cheese, freshness just brings out the unique individuality of food. It makes the experience so much better. They use wood burning ovens which gives the pizza an extra special pizazz.  I believe Tony was after quality.

Now for my rating. The quality of the pizza alone deserves 4 stars. I would give it 5 but the place is not perfect. The size of the pizzas really got me. It could have been a bit bigger. I was basically paying for a medium thin crust pizza the same price as a large pizza from any where else. Also, parking is like finding gold. Tony's is right in the heart of North Beach. So if you come, please come early before prime time dinner, or you will be looking for parking for a while and then you have to wait to get seated at Tonys.

Other than those rants, This place is the best pizza place I been. You guys should definitely try this place out. Awesome pizza. Also, I believe Tony kicked ass in the World Pizza Cup. Shame on you Italy! SHAME ON YOU!!!

when SF cops stop to park their cars and get a couple slices on a sunday afternoon, you  know its been vetted..felt like i escaped to ny for a quick bite!

PRO tip: do not wait around to dine inside, you can grab a hot slice and sit out on a classic red and white table .. Amaaaaze~ best pizza slice in SF hands down. makes Pizza Orgasmica look like it is new agey ridiculousness.

got the pepperoni/pineapple combo.  would do that one again. mmmm peeezzza

This is hands down the best pizza I have ever had. You can tell the ingredients are fresh and top quality. The Margherita is an obviously good choice, so is the three cheese Stromboli, and my all time favorite, the Sausage and Stout!!

Seriously ?? The award winning pizza is a piece of ultra thin crap! The service is horrible and the waiters are a bunch of confused souls. Not sure what the "hype" is about ?? I've seen burrata cheese on the menu but are you kidding me when you are trying to pass the mozzarella as burrata? Never again !

The service is fast, the interior is fun and cool. I wouldn't exactly call it a "locals" place, but its definitely nice and small, not like some giant pizza restaurant. The pizza is relatively good here. Personally, I love it, and this tends to be one of our favorite pizza places in the Bay.
Good crisp crust pizza. Especially late at night. Worth the wait in line

Hands down I know this pizza is good because I burn my mouth every time I eat there just because of  the excitement that over takes my body and all the patience I used to have, fades away. I can't tell if it is because I always end up there after 2:00am or if the pizza is that good. But I have a strong suspicion that it would taste just as good at 2:00pm.You be the decider.

THIS IS THE BEST PIZZA

I would go with the Pesto.....especially after a long night of boozing.

YES!  Golden Boy Pizza was so good and worth the short wait for the fresh slices.  The girl behind the counter was really sweet and all the ingrediants were fresh and so delicious.  Where else can you get pizza this amazing for only $3!?  Not quite a five star, but better than a four... Try it!

Working down the street from this place hasn't done my belt line any good! If you're on the hunt for some of the best pizza around north beach stop by Golden Boy! Just thinking about their combination has me drooling! Y U M!
Not a big fan of Pizza but I really like Golden Boy's crust-super tasty.  I really like this place cuz it's cheap and hit's the spot and also good to grab a beer and hang for a while.

Delicious silician-style square pan style, perfectly crispy on the outside.  

Super-satisfying, good location (unless you need parking), fun to sit at the bar when it's not too crowded and have a beer with your slice(s).

Sicilian Pizza! I love it! I accidently came across this place and saw square shaped pizzas.  They were WONDERFUL.  WIth just the right amount of topping on each slice I must say was a nice way to start my day in Little Italy. I had the meat combo and the pesto, both were delicious! I cannot wait to come back and try the others.

Was stumbling around in north beach searching for food and happen to walk into golden boy for a bite. little did I know I was going to fall in love with this little spot. I tried the vegetarian pesto pizza.....then ordered another one 5 minutes later. amazing pizza.

When looking for Tony's pizza (around the corner) we found this place. Glad we did!  Great pie. Thick crust. Great sauce.

Not going to win awards for decor and definitely does not send the "families welcome" message but still a great pizza place.

With that said we did take the kiddos here.  But we were here before the assumed 20-30s crowd showed up.  Had to explain a few "odd" stickers on the walls to our kids.  But other than that service was friendly, and fast.  Pizza was great.  Soda was good.  

Counter seating only so don't expect to sit down across from friends and chat it up.

Large TV showing mostly sports was welcome.  

A little dark in there and bathroom was...well.....tired looking.

I'd put this place on my walk-by-hungry-for-a-great-slice list.

this by far has been the best pizza i have ate. The dough alone is amazing, buttery, with a crispy bottom and fluffy top layer with not so much cheese and sauce. Hits the spot and no u just cant eat one slice. awsome pizza.

as a huge fan and lover of pizza i have to say this is the best pizza ever! and i come from homemade authentic Italian pizza that my nono makes. the sauce is not to sweet and the atmosphere is awesome i love all the stickers. Im planning a trip back to SF just for this pizza.

Best sicilian pizza I've had in SF.  Really cool little pizza joint.  Beware going here late night you're bound to stand in long lines.  Going in the middle of the day isn't so bad.  The pizza is placed in the window for you to view before you order at the counter.  They re-heat the pizza pefectly.
AMAZING pizza! And really friendly and quick service. I just with they had had the clam garlic pizza so I could try it.
Good pizza with a very thick crust. I enjoyed the combo and clam slices.

Square pizza!  Yay, just like the beanery back in the school lunch days, when you could smell the curiously strong cheese smell wafting through the hallways...  Okay, luckily its not just like the school lunch pizza or else it would not be four stars.  This pizza is light and on foccacia like bread.  Yummy late night snack.

I dream of this place when I come to San Francisco.  As an out of towner, I always make a point of stopping by Golden Boy when I'm traveling to San Francisco.  They never disappoint.  The pizza is delicious, the staff are simple and straight-forward, and the atmosphere relaxing.  And I agree with all the other reviews. Its the crust!! Deep crunchy crust!
Fantastic, easy pizza. It always hits the spot, especially after a night of drinking or the morning after.

What can I say that hasn't already been said? Yes, all the rumors are true. This is the BEST pizza in SF. I know its a bold statement, but it is true. My litmus test for pizza is that it tastes as good during the day as it did the night before. Golden Boy is amazing for lunch as it is after a few pints in North Beach.

I love me some good pizza!  And boy does this place have some good pizza.  I came here for the Margherita pizza and it did not disappoint.  It was definitely a symphony of flavors in my mouth.  Tastes and looks like clean eating having such simple, yet complex flavors at the same time.

SO yummy.  
I have yet to have a pie I don't like here, and I've tried a lot of pies here.  
Not really sure what else to say that others haven't said already -- but go order a pizza as soon as you can!

The lines can be long and the store front is tiny so be prepared to wait, even if you call it in early it will still take them 5-10 extra minutes!

Sometimes when we come to San Francisco I ask my girlfriend who doesn't like pizza all that much, what do you feel like eating?  She says "didn't you want to get Tony's pizza?" The truth is she loves Tony's pizza, any others won't do.  Yesterday we ordered the Italian salad and some mixed drinks, it was all really good.  We also ordered the margherita pizza which is simple but amazing.  One thing is it cools very fast so I do try to eat it before it gets too cold because it's best when it's hot.  There are lots of other choices of pizza to get that fit your preference, so far all of them are good.  Even the side dishes are really good.  I think everyone should try this place once even if you're like my girlfriend aka Tony's pizza lover who says "pizza is ok".

Top meal and luckily we were very early so there was no problem getting a table. We had three different types of pizza and they were all excellent. Service was very friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend it for families but arrive early.

I can't believe that I'm saying I'm glad that Mama's had such a long line (I really did want to try their french toast sampler), but I feel lucky because without that being the case I would have never stumbled into Tony's and had the best pizza in all of the Bay.  It's expensive as heck - $18 for a Margherita pizza that was slightly larger than a personal pie - but it was worth every gooey penny.  The woodfired crust was perfectly crisp yet doughy and the fresh mozzarella jettied me back to my trip to Italy.  The wings had a wonderful BBQ sauce that supposedly had beer in it and somehow really did have an "Italian" taste (not that I ever saw chicken wings in any Italian cafe).  

One of my favorite lunches in the city, made even more pleasant since it was so unexpected. :)

Went here on a Friday night after hearing how amazing the pizza was.   Waited for a full hour for a table, since the place was so packed.  We ordered the Little Italy salad to start and had the Margherita pizza with Caputo flour (not the famous one Tony is known for, which uses San Felice flour, but a very similar one).  The salad was pretty yummy but on the small side.  The pizza was also good, but I thought on the smaller side for 2 people.  

To be honest, I was a little underwhelmed by the whole experience, and perhaps it's for a few reasons:
-Everyone had been raving about how amazing the food was, especially Yelpers
- I felt the price was not necessarily justified given the quantity of food.  While I was full after the salad and pizza, I felt I could have gotten a much tastier Italian dish or pasta at another Italian place in the city.
- I felt the crust was overly burnt and the cheese and sauce were not seasoned enough.

Yes, it was good pizza, and yes, it was authentic Neapolitan style, but was it the best Naples-style pizza I have ever had and worth the hour wait for it, to boot? Not really.

While the service was pretty good despite the wait and the food was of good quality, for me it didn't quite live up to its hype.  Perhaps I'll give it a second chance and try a different pizza on a different day...but, for now, they're a 3 for me, overall.

Pizza, not really a fan but boy oh boy...this place had me fall in love with it! It was sooo good that we had to go back and get some more.

Fresh dough, good toppings, best cheeses = Tony's Coal-Fired Pizza & Slice House.  

Love it love it love it!

This is easily the best pizza I've had thus far in SF. They have slices as well as whole pies. Tony's Pizza has definitely nailed the NY style crust and sauce. The toppings are on point, as are the variety of slices you can get at any given point.

If yr from NY or the Midwest, its worth the hike up to North Beach for this 'za. I promise.

Very glad I stumbled across this place. Had the Coccoli (pronounced co-co-lee) with prosciutto and it was fantastic. Also the Margherita pizza. Great, really loved the sauce. Perfect amount of food for two people. Definitely coming back. Got there about 5 minutes before they opened and got a table for two without waiting. If you have a larger party for lunch, I recommend arriving a bit earlier.
Pizza was good, garlic bread was different but delicious, service was nice, and if you meet Liam he was a very kind server, sat by a window booth great view

It's about 1:00am & I'm leaving one of those bar/lounges conveniently located around the corner from this place. Next to Blondies, its my second favorite SF pizza joint. Delicious square bundles of flavor. Perfect for the late-night munchies, or the quick grab lunch/dinner. ENJOY!

They're all business in here.  Get you in, get you out, often with a bit of attitude.  It's cash only.  And there's often a decently long line out the front door, particularly late at night.  But it's worth it -- the pizza is super cheap and super tasty, they have Mirror Pond Pale Ale on tap, and the TV is usually tuned to a Giants or Warriors game.  Best cheap and fast meal in North Beach.

Golden ticket: Golden Boy Pizza!  I'm always a fan of Dive places, and this one is the crowning glory of pizza joints... The line out front is a good indicator of what's to come. Step up to the cashier to order any one of their amazing choices(I prefer the clam). While u wait, enjoy a cold draft beer at th
Good Sicilian Pizza! Gets cowded but worth the wait!

Golden Boy Pizza is perfect for a late night fix after hitting the local bars. The pizza is delicious and not too expensive and the slices are fairly large. Even though there seems to always be a line ( 10-15  min wait) i would eat here again in a heartbeat!
The pizza was fine, but not worth the wait. There's a lot more pizzas in San Francisco that are way better

Awesome pizza by the slice. Just walk up and point out the slice you want.  They warm it in the oven and its just perfect.  Nice big square slices!  I tried the garlic/clam pizza and my friend had plain cheese - both were so good.  One of the best tasting pizzas I've ever had!

I don't usually like very cheezy pizza, but maybe I was just hungry, because the slice of cheese and slice of clam/garlic disappeared within 3 minutes.  

For $3.75, I thought the slice is just average in size, but I'll be back for the clam/garlic!
Clam Pizza??? Hell Yeah! This spot slays. My friend & I enjoyed a couple slices of the clam pizza, and 2 of the combos. After a long night of beers and general mayhem this hit the spot!
Delicious pizza! And the smell is just as good. Great for a late night meal or for a slice for dinner or whenever! I vote best pizza in SF
Great pizza, this place has saved me many times after a night out in the city.

Best pizza in SF - and that's saying something since I'm from the east coast.  Awesome that they're open so late w/ window service for the post-bar time.  Grab a combo slice, or 2, and you're all set.
Best pizza in San Francisco if you've been drinking. Get a corner slice. One cannot go out drinking in North beach and not go here.

I do not see where the big hype about Golden Boy comes from. Sure... it's a tradition for post-drinking in North Beach, but during regular, sober business hours... when there are other choices available???  It's OK, but not that great.

Easily the best pizza in San Francisco. Some people would argue Amicis. Not I. As good sicilian thick crust pizza that you will ever find. Super bonus point: Open really late, and even though I live in SOMA, always worth the detour.
We absolutely love Tony's and Capo's! The most amazing meatballs and pizza around, bartenders are awesome as well, shout out to Elmer and JP

Extremely disappointing service. Waited for over 40 minutes next to an unfriendly hostess and rude manager. Got rudely tossed around the place without a place to stand to wait for our table twice while we were drinking a beer. Save your time and sanity and walk across the street to Acquolina. They do know how to treat and serve their customers excellently.

I was excited to finally try this place while working in the area, but the place is closed on Mon and Tue nights.... sheesh..... so I still had a hankering for pizza, and decided to have a few slices from the slice house next door.  I'm a big fan of coal-fired pizza, but this place (at least the slice house) didn't stand close to those other coal-fired places I have had and loved.  The crust was okay done, but not as flavorful, and the pizza itself was overly greasy.... which poured down your hands (some like that... but I wasn't a big fan).  Perhaps the slice route wasn't the best experience as I normally like to try the entire pie to get the full flavor and ensure it is right out of the oven.  I wouldn't wait in line for this place though as there are plenty of other places in the surrounding area to enjoy.

This place is aptly rated as a 4 star restaurant based on the food alone.  However, the hour and a half wait brings it down to 3 stars.  Under normal circumstances anyone in their right mind would quickly pick another place for dinner.  However being on several top lists of pizza to try in San Francisco and given only 4 days in the city we had to give it a try.  We were able to hit several places while we waited for our table to be ready so that was helpful...including two other pizza places.  Golden boy around the corner although a totally different type of pizza was our favorite of the three and even with the long line was much faster service.  We also tried Baonecci a couple doors down from golden boy and that was pretty darn good with the thinnest cracker like crust we have ever had.  We had to sit outside because we didn't have reservations but that was fine with us because we were able to be served immediately.  So, all in all golden boy was the best although thick crust but melt in your mouth yummy, then Baonecci even though almost too thin of a crust and then Tony's.  That doesn't mean Tony's was a bad pizza and why I am giving them 4 stars but part of the 4 star rating is for some crazy yummy stuffed bread we had with prosciutto, burrata cheese and yummy pepper oil.  Anyway,  just trying to provide a helpful and honest review but I do feel like Tony's based on pizza quality combined with wait time was a bust for us.
The best Square slice Pizza in the city.  I have been eating here for at least the last 15 years.  I cant live without a slice at least once a week
I hadn't been here for a long time. It is still the same but I was sober and a few years older. Probably should have gone somewhere else. Oh, well.

I love their combo slices... you just need to wait for a hot and fresh tray to come out of the oven.... then pick your slice... if you like it harder/crustier... ask for a corner piece and for even crustier they'll stick it in the front warming oven for as long as you like.... it can be made to order.... so the "doughy" comment means you've got to try again.  As a former New Yorker... I did not expect to like this pizza... but instead I hate North Beach Pizza and Pizza Orgasmic because they can't touch NY pizza... but golden boy is uniquely San Francisco.... and it's the first deep dish (probably cause it's not that deep) I've liked... and in my book it's the best pizza in the city... certainly the best in North Beach which I've found incredibly disappointing for the "Little Italy" of the city.

If you are in the mood for a slice of pizza and a beer, Golden Boy is the perfect establishment.  The pizza is awesome, the service is friendly, and the atmosphere is fun.  Although a line can form on weekend nights, it moves quickly.  This place has the best Sicilian style pizza in the city and is by far the best place to get a slice in North Beach.

Cross your fingers and hope your favorite deep dish slice is still there when you order as lines are quite common at this local establishment.  But what can I say, one of the best slices you can get for $3.50.  Especially after a night out at one of the local clubs or bars in the area.  Hey that slice is very satisfying after a night of drinking and guess what, its cheaper than your beer.  I've been a fan of this place for more than 25 years and no matter what slice you order, your tummy would be happy :)

Think 3.5 stars.  But it reads 4 because I'm not an ass.

I heard rumors of the long lines and the disappointment for when items get sold out.  So, I ditched the line outside of a nearby breakfast joint, and I sat my happy ass down, when Tony's just opened.  

Maybe the timing is a factor, since I'm not skilled in the logistics of pizza ovens.  But my Margherita Napoletana was only tasty the first few slices.  After a short while, the crust was soggy.  I love my pizza piping-hot, and I didn't get that, during my visit.  But the flavors were very tasty, and that is commendable.

But what I really enjoyed was the Giant Meatball with Sea Salt Burrata.  Everyone should try this.  The meatball was tender and flavorful, which was powered-up (video game terminology) by the creamy burrata.  I understand it's already "giant".  But SIZE MATTERS, and this was so good that BIGGER will always be BETTER.

My girlfriend raved about how good their pizzas were based on the fact they had award winning pizza pies in North Beach so we decided to get a merienda snack (mid afternoon) since the six of us were in the area to show our friends from LA what's up.

Well, to our dismay - we ordered the Margherita and shared it with the group. It was meh for me - I personally prefer Pizzeria Delfina or Pizza Antica for their thin crust pizzas.

We had high hopes but fell short of our expectations.

Yay! We finally made it back here for a proper meal!

My husband had been wanting to come here for a long time, but due to the wait times,we weren't inclined to come on a weekend.

We came on a Wednesday at 8:15 and there was a 45 minute wait, no biggie. Especially since they'll take your number and call you when your table is ready. I LOVE restaurants that do this. I totally don't mind waiting if i can have a drink while doing so.

Our server was friendly and very patient while we made our decisions. I actually let my husband pick since he was so hyped to come come here.

We had the award winning Margherita pizza, and a NY style pizza,. The Margherita wasn't as awesome as we had hoped. There's definitely other places in the city I'd rather go for that kind of pizza. Although, the NY style was fantastic!  My preferred pizza is still Neapolitan style, but this was delicious.

I think we came home with more leftovers than we ate, but my husband was happy to have them all week:)

I wouldn't wait hours for a table on the weekend ,but the server told us Wednesday and Thursday nights have shortest wait times.

This strip of North Beach is getting better and better, and Tony's is a great reason to come here.

Their new york style pizzas are good! I loved the fig prosciutto the most for how deliciously savory and sweet it was. The other pizzas we got were good but the flavors didn't stand out as much. Overall Tony's is definitely worth the hype.

I recommend getting take out and enjoy the pizza in your living room with your favorite shows on instead of waiting in line for a table.

The food was terrific here but the dining experience would provide great torture for Guantanamo Bay prisoners!

They kept the temperature in this place like that of a pizza oven.

Moments after we were seated, my son spilled the beer I was drinking all over me and the table. My son is five so you can imagine that this has happened before.  Usually, restaurant staff clean up such things and bring you another on the house. Not here. Our server cleaned it up only after we hunted her down, then never asked me if I wanted another beer. I only got another after I asked for one and yes, they charged me another $3 for it.

We dined under a speaker that blared what my husband
called, "Liquid Metal" music onto our heads and when we asked if the music could be changed we were told no, because it was playing on an iPod shuffle. So we ate and tried to talk over the harsh drum banging and searing guitar for another 20 minutes until we actually saw someone scramble up a ladder then do what we were told wasn't possible, change the music! Then oh joy, we got to hear rap music for the rest of our visit. We were here during the North Beach Street Festival so several members of the staff let us know they'd gone deaf during the event. Obviously!

Our own server pretty much sleepwalked through our dining experience. She was more interested in watching the golf tournament on the TV over the bar than taking care of us. She offered nothing that made eating at Tony's more enjoyable. In fact, she didn't even offer any of the usual fun stuff that apparently comes with being a patron here. Another diner told us they'll bring pizza dough out for your kids to play with. Our kids got some after WE asked about it. We would have never known otherwise!

But like I said, the food was great. I recommend starting with the spinach salad (goat cheese, pine nuts, red onion, balsamic reduction, olive oil) and following it up with the Cholula pizza (mozzarella, marinated chicken breast in Cholula Hot Sauce, sliced Jalapeños, garlic, red onion, chorizo). Be warned though, this pizza is spicy!

I don't go around eating pizza much.  I'm easily satisfied with your typical Pizza Hut, Papa Johns or Dominos.   I read the reviews and had already tried Golden Boy Pizza.  I don't understand the hype behind Golden Boy.  I figured this place would be the best. Even the italian uber driver said tony's is the best.

I ordered just the pepperoni.  I'm simple like that.

First let me say the restaurant is very nice. We were seated immediately in a very nice cozy spot near the window.  Service was great too.  No complaints.

But this is about food right?   My pizza was fine.  Came out quick.  Liked the crust.  But nothing that I would come back to this restaurant again for. I'm just as content with Dominos.

My girlfriend ordered the popular Megheriti pizza.  She is pretty much a 5 start chef.  She did not like her pizza. The crust was burnt on the bottom but that might be how this is pizza is made.  The sauce had not taste according to her.  I didn't try it myself because I'm just your standard cheese or pepperoni guy.

Good people at this restaurant and good service.  Nothing impressed me about the pizza though.

pepperoni is $18.00 I think and the Megheritiz pizza is $21 If I recall correctly.

Having grown up in New York City, I have definitely had my fair share of good NY pizza so everywhere I go, I find myself comparing everything to good ol' NY.  Golden Boy is not on the same level as the best in NY, but its definitely one of the better slices I've had since I have lived in San Francisco.  The thick, tasty slices and the lively atmosphere make this place a great quick food stop on any North Beach excursion.

I was trying to think of a reason not to give this place a 5 and all I could come up with is: "I don't give 5 stars because nothing is that perfect." F that, this place deserves more than a 4. The pizza is the best I've had in the city, and the 2nd best I've had outside of NY (Pagliaccis in Seattle takes that honor). Atmosphere and decor are perfect for a slice joint, I wouldn't change a thing. Fantastic.

Took the boyf here for his b-day. He's pretty much obsessed with pizza and Little Star was closed for lunch so this was my #2 pick. It was pretty small inside but it wasn't busy, surprising for a Saturday afternoon. Most people just got slices to go but we dined in. I got a slice of cheese and it was very tasty. I probably could have eaten a second slice but thought I'd stick to one. When we left, I felt hungry again. It's was a decent sized slice but it felt really light - not heavy and oily like other places. I (not a huge pizza fan) was still raving about it 2 days later. I will be back - with or without the boyfriend. This place is good!

This place rules! I spent a day walking around the city with a buddy when he suggested getting the clam pizza, which, was f&*king amazing! i Don't usually like square pizza,i don't know why i understand it's weird maybe it's the shape who knows, and clam on a pizza? But the pizza was amazing. It's a odd little hole in the wall with limited space but the beer was great, the atmosphere was super chill. I would for sure suggest going to this place for whatever reason it may be, your sure to be satisfied.
Good square pizza slice, descent prices, quick and friendly.  Worth it if you are in the neighborhood.  Its open pretty late, serves beer.  Parking isn't easy.  And its cash only.
Depends on which misnomer slice you feel like ordering.  Good luck.  You'll definitely get it with a slice of attitude.

Awesome 'ZA....I usually come here for lunch but they are open late night for those with the beer munchies! It's square style pizza, and its all reasonably priced and yummy.

The combo is really really good, but so are the simpler slices as well. Great fast service, only downside is they are cash only.

Really like Golden Boy Pizza!  It's fresh and it's really good (and busy) late at night - especially on a friday/ saturday night.  I usually get the combo or pepperoni - price is a little on the higher side - but it's an "once in a while" treat.
For quick slices of delicious pizza, Golden Boy is the best around.

This is BY FAR the best pizza I ever had. Every combination from cheese to veggie is the best,  the price is perfect, its easy to get to, everyone that works there is really cool.  I have tried the one in San Mateo and its good although the crust taste a lil stiffer...doesnt seem to have that light fluffy crust like the city.....but you will have to judge for yourself

This place is ridiculous. I almost got scared off by the 4 page menu online with 10+ kinds of pizza to choose from. A recommendation from someone else in line led us to The New Yorker and it's hands down top 3 best pizzas I have ever had in my life. I've had pie in NY, Chicago, and Phoenix (before you laugh, recently named the best city for pizza by some reputable food review mag that temporarily escapes me) and this is one of the very best. Nuff said.

I've been a patron of Tony's Pizza more times than I can count, and have never had less than a perfect experience.

Yes, there will be a wait. But go ahead and get yourself on the list then go have a cocktail at one of North Beach's many, many bars. They'll call you when your table is ready.

Sit outside if the weather is decent, even if it's a bit chilly you'll be fine since there are ample heat lamps lining the wall.

We usually get the New Yorker pizza. It lives up to the hype and you won't regret it.

On our most recent visit, we tried the cheese cake for dessert and it was incredible. Hardly sweet, and luxuriously decedent - it made for the perfect end to our dinner.

Cannot say enough great things about both the food & the service (which is always fantastic).

This is my favorite pizza place in the whole Bay Area. Highly recommend this place for any St. Louis native dying to get a slice of cracker thin crust and provel cheese. It's no Imo's for sure, but it's pretty darn close!

I had a 2 types of pizza . It was super great . And they are champions !
Thank chiefs , and keep cooking guys !!

Only one disadvantage is waiting on the line , but it is advantage for owners !

So really enjoyed there and i think they are number #1 in the city. !!!

Great !!!!

Yeeowza! Their meatball sandwich started a party in my mouth!

This place is more than pizza. Their sandwiches are love-inducing, bundles of joy!

The friend that gave us the rec on this place is going to be on the top of Santa's list this year.  He really raved about their Turkey sandwich with cranberry sauce on cranberry bread.  I really wanted to try that, but as I was sharing with the old man, we settled on the Meatball Sub.

I just wanted to hug myself when that sandwich came out all glistening with olive oil or butter.  Other people actually ooh'd and ahh'd as they jealously watched me stake claim on that sandwich. One woman decided that's what she was going to order just by the looks of that Dagwood delight.

Sharing that meatball sandwich with the old man, made me fall in love with him again for selecting such a winner. But, next time he's got to get his own, because I'm going to need quality time with my own sandwich before I run off and marry it.

worldpizzachampions.com/…

Best Pizza in town from a world champion pizza acrobat, maker, and more?  

I guess there's room for more brag rights besides claiming to have the best pizza in SF.  But seriously, the wait is insane.  Yah sure you can grab a slice in the small kiosk like spot next door, but it doesn't seem to be the same especially when you can run down the menu and pick and choose which pizza you want in what way.  This is the cool thing about Tony's.  You've got your deep dishes, your flat, and the super thin Sicilian type pizzas too.

But because of the wait, we had filled ourselves up elsewhere and ended up just ordering the Cal Italia, a sweeter pizza due to the figs that happened to be cast between a a savory entree and dessert.  And on top of that, their meatball was also deliciously humungous.  

To go with the pizza, I had a beer which tasted like a double or triple IPA which is ridiculously strong, one of the strongest beers I've ever had.  

Hopefully I can visit again to explore more of the menu when its not so crowded.

Tony's Pizza was without doubt the best pizza I have ever had in my life and I have been to Italy!

Unknown to me it has built up a big reputation so the only way we managed to get a table was to head outside on a chilly San Francisco evening. Our table tried the Margherita and the Detroit style pizzas, of the two the Margherita was better as it has the perfect mix of cheese tomato and a decent crust.

A gorgeous Sunday afternoon in SF, and we were jonesin' for some authentic Neapolitan pizza.  Our quest began last fall when we returned from a trip to Italy, and our taste for pizza was spoiled forever by the pie we consumed in Naples.  It was life changing.  Truly.  We have tried to find a pizza like the heavenly one that we had on our trip, tasting pizzas that claim to rival their Italian counterparts, but have been disappointed.  Until now.  
We intentionally arrived a touch before the dinner rush, taking advice that there can be quite a wait.  We timed it just right, and were seated at a comfortable booth without waiting for more than five minutes.  Our waitress was quick to let us know that she would be right with us as she was delivering drinks and taking orders at other tables.  I couldn't wait to ask if we had arrived in time to order one of the 73 limited Margherita pizza's, and thankfully we were.   In total we ordered:

Salumi & Formaggio $11 ~ Served on a wooden cheese board, nice size for the price and tasty but would have been nice to have someone tell us what we were eating?

Deep Fried String Beans $7 ~  Really good - crunchy, not greasy and with just the right amount of fresh garlic.

Spinach Salad $10 ~ w/Goat Cheese, Pine Nuts, Red Onion, Balsamic Reduction, Olive Oil.  Really large salad, but overall nothing to write home about.  We had just a few bites and decided it wasn't worth ruining our appetites.

Margherita $18 ~ This was a truly amazing pizza, photo attached.  The crust was very thin, perhaps too charred in some spots but that was forgivable knowing that the inferno of an oven makes this crust amazing.  The sauce is to die for, it tasted exactly like the delectable tomato goodness in Naples.  Just the right amount of fresh basil leaves on top.  The cheese used is the only let down over the pie in Naples.  The Mozzarella Fior di Latte on the limited availability pie is made from cows milk, and the one that wowed us in Italy is mozzarella di bufala campana.  Next time I'll see if it is possible to order the STG Pizza Napoletana with the bufala instead.  I have a feeling that will make this the ultimate pizza.

I will definitely be back to Tony's to try the multitude of artisan pizzas on the menu as well as to try the STG with bufala.  I'll update if I've found my pizza nirvana, as another trip to Europe is not in the budget anytime soon.  

Tony and staff ~ Grazie molto!

The pizza is pretty good ($5 per slice), but the service is one of the rudest I have ever experienced. Take your money and visit a different North Beach pizza place, their food is equal if not better and you won't be treated like crap.

We were in a rush so we told the cashier to grab a slice of sausage with bell peppers and no need to warm it, in the middle of saying this she switched places with another worker without even saying "sorry i'm taking my break, person x will help you." The new girl didn't know what we ordered so I repeated it. Then I reminded her, just box it - we are in a big rush.

2 minutes go by and she had forgotten to grab it, then one of the chefs took it and put it in the heater when I told him not to. They didn't even give me a receipt or a #. I told him to please rush as I had to run and he purposely walked slow.

I won't give it a 1 star as the pizza in itself was tasty (though not worth $5 for a large slice). There's 5 other better pizza places in North Beach.

Skip this spot until they learn something called "customer service."
